Thank you for your interest and support!

Overview
The Tempus Fugit is a simple WordClock interface board for your Raspberry Pi Zero or Arduino Nano. The time in words is spelt out on an 8 by 8 letter matrix, with accuracy maintained using an on-board battery backed real time clock chip.
Although the base WordClock will be the English language version pictured I will also include templates and s/w [via GitHub] for a Dutch and Latin version - See the Kickstarter updates more information. 
Interested, but having trouble getting a Pi Zero - then start with a Arduino Nano. It is easy to change this out later on, just unplug the Nano and plug in your Pi Zero. You can also use the Tempus Fugit with any of the other Raspberry Pi computers - there is more detail on this in the following section.
Design Evolution 
The clock started out as a Christmas project for a Pi Zero I had just received. Having got a lot attention from my original blog post, I decided to work it up to launch as a Kickstarter, essentially to fund a production run of PCB boards. While working the PCB layout for the TF I realised it would be quite easy to incorporate the option to run the clock from an Arduino Nano. So spent a bit of time breadboarding it to check there were no problems with the Arduino RTC and display driver libraries, then added a Arduino Nano as an alternative processor option onto the PCB layout.
Finally in the spirit of flexibility I added extra drilling's so you can, with relative ease also mount a Raspberry Pi A / B onto the back of the TF board and then wire them it in using individual jumpers. The only Pi's I haven't  catered for are the very early revisions without any fixing points. These will still drive the board but you will have to figure out your own mounting arrangements.
The guess is that most people wanting to support the Kickstarter will opt for the kit reward level, but I have included 2 additional 'ready built' levels - one which is PiZero ready and one which will include a pre-programmed Arduino Nano clone. The numbers are limited so please don't wait too long to pledge if interested. 
Functionality 
The Tempus Fugit word clock displays the time using the '12 hour' format in words spelt out on an 8 by 8 letter matrix, time is displayed in 5 minute slots [5,10,15,20 ...]. The correct time is maintained when the unit is not powered by an on-board battery backed RTC chip. 
With an 8 x 8 matrix there obviously have to be some compromises, for instance 'HALF' and  'TWO';  
Even with the limits of an 8x8 matrix you can display time to a + / - 3 minute accuracy.
Three rear mounted pushes allow the time to set and adjusted as needed. Instructions will also be included on how to optionally set the TF time via a connected PC. 
In normal operation the TF does not need to be connected to the internet or a host computer.
Pledge reward levels include kit an built versions of the clock, For an example of the detail that will be included in the instructions for the kit version follow this link to the Pi-LCD build instructions, my last Kickstarter.
Technical Description
The finished printed circuit board size will be about 112mm x 70mm, it could have been little shorter but with these dimensions the length to width ratio works out to 1.6 which is often referred to a 'Golden Triangle' -  considered by many artists and architects to be the most aesthetically pleasing form of a rectangle, so I decided to stick with it. 
With the exception of the display and Pi Zero / Arduino most other components are mounted on the rear of the board, - Pi / Arduino could have gone on the back but why hide a thing of beauty ! 
Hardware
Display - 60x60mm red 
No surface mount parts on the TF board, so should not be challenging to solder with a basic level of competence 
Raspberry Pi interface, compatible with old and new Pi's as it only uses the first 26 GPIO header lines
Power for the board is via Pi's micro USB connector or for the Arduino it's Mini-B USB connector [note connecting leads and PSU are not supplied with any of the pledge options]
The real time clock (RTC) is battery backed with CR1220 coil cell, [because of postage restrictions the battery is not included in any of the pledge rewards]
There are 3 monetary switches, these are used to allow the clock to be set and to shut the Pi down cleanly when not connected to a host computer 
The Letter Matrix
To keep costs down I am NOT planning to commission a custom acrylic overlay, to date I have found laser printed squares to work fine, this also gives you the opportunity to experiment with different fonts. I will include a few pre-printed overlays in the kits as well as providing templates on-line.
Addtionally overlays for the Dutch and Latin versions will be included with the pledge rewards
Software
Python code will be available for down load via GitHub for Raspberry Pi setup and as a sketch for the Arduino
Differences between prototype and final production version
Slightly smaller [112/70mm]
The 3 pushes will be rear mounted and changed to low profile parts
Most components with the exception of the Pi / Arduino will be rear mounted
Sockets will be included in the kits to give the option not to solder the Arduino / Pi Zero directly in - with the PiZero I think it is actually easier to solder it directly as you only need to solder GPIO lines used not all 40 !
The RTC will be incorporated directly onto the PCB rather than as separate daughter board 
The power on indicator LED will not be included as both the Pi and Nano have on-board power indicators 
Current Design Development Status
The design is at the working prototype PCB stage, as you can see from the main project picture, the work todate and remaining design activities are detailed in the following bullet points
What’s been accomplished so far
The hardware design is complete
I have identified multiple sources for all the parts
Pi and Nano hardware has been prototyped on breadboards and tested
The PCB layout is complete and tested
The software for the Raspberry Pi version has been running on the prototype for over a month now, but I will tidy it up a little mainly to improve the commenting. The Arduino software still needs some work but I have tested all the functional blocks together. Currently I am using less than 30% of the Ardunio's memory this will grow slightly but I do not envisage any capacity issues
Proto-type Dutch and Latin version are up and running
What work remains to be done
I have now received and tested the prototype PCBs against a Rapsberry Pi boards and Nano Clones. This has allowed me to check the layout and importantly confirm the mechanical interfaces are correct. I am will be going through a second prototype cycle which is allowed for in the overall reward delivery plan.
From the software perspective there is no no significant development work to do so I plan to wait until the prototype boards are available and then complete the software.
Educational uses
One of the aims of the Kickstarter is to be able to offer the Tempus Fugit WordClock as a sensibly priced kit for schools and electronics clubs. This could range from a basic kit build to learn/improve soldering skills, to providing pupils with a ready build card without a processor and then asking them to research and select a suitable processor card. This would be a good example of applying an abstraction process to a real world problem [part of the UK key stage 3 curriculum].
One point I took away from a recent chat with a teacher is offering part built boards, to make the kits more accessible to children / adults with more limited soldering skills. This is something I certainly plan to do with the TF and my previous Kickstarter's.
Notes:-
Pi Zero's and SD cards are not included in any of the pledge reward levels - not required if you are going down the Arduino route
A PSU adapter is not included in any of the pledge rewards, I generally run the prototype with the official Pi PSU, but any PSU rated to work with a Raspberry Pi should be fine. For the Arduino option you will need an Adapter with a Mini-B USB connector or you can connect directly to the board check the Arduino website for details
No case or mounting is included in the pledge rewards but I do hope to make a 3D printing file and some other options available at a later date
Tools and solder needed to construct the kits are not included
Pledge rewards will be sent out by Royal Mail using an untracked service - to keep postage costs down. The exception to this will be the built and tested boards will be sent tracked and / or signed depending on services available to your location.

The Toronto Premiere of BULL - Written by Mike Bartlett, Directed by David Ferry March 17 – April 5, 2015
“So fucking icy. I could take you to a country hotel and put you in front of the fire, leave you all night, and I guarantee you’d still be as fucking frozen as you are right now. Icy, hard. Tight.” -- Thomas
At the Coal Mine Theatre
798 Danforth Avenue Toronto, Ontario
7:30 Nightly

Breaking News:
BULL by Mike Bartlett is the Coal Mine Theatre’s first production since the smash hit The Mother Fucker With The Hat. Nasty, short and brutish, BULL is razor sharp. An a-amorality play about cutthroat office politics, that draws the audience as close as possible to witness darwinian brutality through colleagues Isobel, Tony, Thomas and their employer Carter. In this dog-eat-dog ethos it is one against two as they must compete for jobs in an economy so ruthless one be will left salivating for humanity.
Arts & Life:
Mike Bartlett is a Laurence Olivier Award-winning British playwright and director whose previous works include King Charles III, An Intervention, and Cock with which Toronto audiences are familiar from 2014 production at the Theatre Centre. In conversation? Hashtag: #BullBartlett
This is the first collaboration for director David Ferry and the Coal Mine Theatre. Ferry is a Dora award winning director and actor who brings incomparable experience and talent to helm BULL. Ferry will ignite the not-to-miss flames for The Coal Mine in 2015. Follow @lazyboyhat and use hashtag #BullFerry
In antagonistic roles of a lifetime Diana Bentley and Damon Runyan star as Isobel and Tony; co-starring is Ryan Rogerson as Thomas a sharp tongued if unwilling adversary forced into battle. Tony and Isobel deploy every trick in the bully’s rule-book, and with a killer mentality move quickly to emasculate, humiliate, and undermine Thomas. Without losing a beat Mark Caven rounds out this incredible cast in the role of Carter.
Damon Runyan, Ryan Rogerson & Diana Bentley by Shaun Benson
In conversation use #BullTO to chat with us & spread the word!
Beyond the stage is a staggering team ready to create and bring this captivating play life. The Coal Mine Theatre is thrilled to work with the following artists:
Erika Connor - Costume Design
Rae Ellen Bodie - Dialect Coach @RaeEllenBodie
Simon Fon - Fight Director
Carrie Sager - PR @SkrappywithaK
Anna Kajtar - Producer
Sean Baker - Production Manager
Steve Lucas - Set and Lighting
Virginia Cardinal - Stage Manager
Christopher Stanton - Sound Design @onebandoflight
Please follow us, tweet us, ask us and share us with friends!
Financial Post:
How a theatre can sustain longterm prosperity is complex. It will require establishing a solid reputation with the work we produce in these early months and years. As we grow we will continue to develop a strategy to support ourselves through each season. We will look to responsible corporate resources and government funding. It probably goes without saying these resources are extremely hard to come by for a new company.
This campaign marks a crucial step toward our future.

To continue bringing together great audiences and productions at the Coal Mine Theatre we need to ask for your support. In return we offer some great perks and this promise: We will always strive to rise you from your seats, thrill you with laughter, to challenge you with sights and sounds and reach you with inspired feeling.
This $5,000 goal comes from our projected ticket sales crossed with a very modest, rock-and-roll indie theatre budget where talent is never sacrificed and quality is always worth more than a penny in the back pocket. Money raised goes toward the following:
Rights - for use of the play.
Lights and sound - so you may hear and see us.
Props and costume - so you will believe us.
Professional fees - so we will live.
Publicity - so we will reach more of you.
‘All the news that’s fit to print’
“Exquisitely excruciating and relentlessly brutal, a vicious comedy.” – Time Out
"Bartlett applies his down-and-dirty, black-humored and trenchant approach to the concept of business employment as survival of the fittest…the play is like a protracted death scene among a group of wild animals, with the strong ones—a pair of smartly-dressed, smirking thugs—mercilessly circling and taunting the weak until it's time to deliver the inevitable fatal blows." —Associated Press.
“I think it’s one that a lot of people have to confront every day when they get up and go to work. London is full of people who have to put on a suit, get on the tube, go to an office and win.” -- Exeuntmagazine.com
"Toronto’s indie theatre companies have given us a number of memorable, low-budget production of plays that might once have been reflexively slotted into a Canadian Stage season before it went off in its current, idiosyncratic, interdisciplinary direction. (David Ferry has been responsible for several of these passion projects.) Personally, I’m much happier with the ecology now – even if it requires theatregoers to do a little more work to find the good stuff." -- David Ferry on theatre in The Globe and Mail
Big Thanks to Friends and Colleagues of Coal Mine Theatre:
Shaun Benson :: Photographer Extraordinaire :: @shaunmbenson
Matt Campagna & Melissa D'Agostino :: @mattcampagna & @melissadags
The Coal Mine is an intimate, independent theatre space run by Ted Dykstra (Artistic Curator) and Diana Bentley (Artistic Producer).

“Stunning pictures of Bristol’s citizens” Bristol Post
“…the results - which he has called Covid Chronicles - are quite frankly stunning” Derby Telegraph 
With over 100 participants, this book documents people in Bristol during the Covid-19 pandemic lockdown of Spring 2020. All the images are in black and white as a hat tip to the great documentary photographers of the 20th century whose work I admire and grew up looking at.
Whilst confined to our homes, we all navigated the lockdown in different ways. I used my government sanctioned daily exercise allowance to cycle around photographing the residents from an appropriate social distance. The images portray a wide range of people from all over Bristol and are accompanied by their thoughts from the day. Those thoughts range from pithy short sentences to longer more philosophical musings and show, among other things, humour, poignancy, pragmatism and fun.
From a personal perspective a 100% drop in income was a shock, yet I found the project to be life affirming and uplifting. As I said in a live radio interview about the Covid Chronicles on the BBC - the people I met were trying to see the positives in this time and were displaying a resilience that was both heartening and encouraging.
I probably met more people in 6 weeks than I had done in the previous 6 years. I hope this book documents our brief time together as we lived through an unprecedented time in our history.
And I can’t do it without you!
Photographer David Keenan summed it up brilliantly on his Kickstarter page. "With the disappearance of so many independent local booksellers and the downward pressure exerted by large chains and Amazon, publishers can no longer afford to take chances on a new artist, in response, a new model has been born: the artist-funded book. That’s where Kickstarter and you come in.”
The world of photography book publishing has changed enormously since I was a young man entering this business. David Keenan is right, photo books are now often self/crowd funded without the involvement from a traditional publisher. I want to produce the best quality book I can as a reminder of this time, as a memory for all of us but especially those who took part and as a social document for others to see in years to come. This Kickstarter will allow me the funds to produce a hardback book containing the images and quotes from those who took part.
Stretch goals.
If I exceed my funding target beyond the original cost of design, production and shipping of the initial print run I hope there will be enough to: 1 Allow more copies to be printed so that it can also go on sale in local bookshops. 2. Fund printing for an exhibition of the images once we get back to a semblance of normality.
Example spread (Design not finalised)
The actual book
The book will be printed using traditional litho process which provides high quality and a cost effective process when printing. 
The details of which are here:
Cover - 303 x 216mm (approx) Text - A4 (297 x 210mm) portrait
Extent: PPC Cover + 112pp Text + 2 x 4 page printed endpapers
Ink: Cover wrap print: Litho black only
Text: Litho black only
End papers: Litho black only
Material: Cover prints on 150gsm silk
Text on silk 150gsm
End papers on white uncoated offset 170gsm
Finishing: Apply matt laminate & spot gloss UV varnish to outer cover print
Fold text, gather, section thread sew & backline spine
Case-bound cover made up of 2250 micron greyboard covered with outer print & finished with endpapers
Limited edition, exclusive Lisa Macario tote bag is included in the £40 tier
Transparency statement about the goal amount.
I've never really considered why photography books cost £25 and upwards. Now I understand why. Short print runs, set up and shipping costs help explain it. Also, Kickstarter takes 5% plus another 3-5% for card processing fees.
Reseaching the goal amount also highlighted design cost, a mock up 'dummy book' for ensuring design dimensions are correct, wet proof(s), ISBN number (so book can be sold in shops), print cost, delivery to me, heavy duty packaging and shipping costs. To be completely upfront there's a small buffer added just incase of miscalculations but it still doesn't leave much change from the £7100 goal.
Obviously, I really want the book to become a reality - I'd love seeing my work in print but it's also an opportunity for those who were photographed in this new socially distant way to have a permanent record - it'll be around forever and it'll be a document of our Spring 2020. Also, it could be a great present for family and friends. ;-) 
I'd love your support and look forward to seeing the series transformed into an actual book, thank you.

My goal is to travel to major cities across America and photograph mothers nursing their children. I hope to have as much diversity as I can throughout the book, as well as quotes and stories from mothers throughout the nation, of their experiences/struggles/triumphs.
The purpose of this book is to show that breastfeeding in any form, is beautiful, natural, and amazing. I hope to help empower women, be an influence to women who haven't decided how they plan to nourish their baby yet, I hope to be a shining light to those that are disapproving, to show that breastfeeding is God's intended way for us to nourish our children.
This project will also show that nursing in public is NOT shameful. Nor indecent. I plan to photograph mothers in very public places, such as national monuments, popular areas, Capitals, etc.
When my husband first took photos of me nursing our daughter, I instantly fell in love. As a mother and a photographer, I thought, "What better way to preserve this special and intimate moment in a mother's life, than to photograph it?". Breastfeeding being something very special to me, I wanted to do a shoot with several mothers and babies, to show the beauty of breastfeeding. To show that it's OKAY to nurse in public. It's OKAY to nurse your toddler. It's OKAY to tandem nurse. I received interest from several mothers throughout North Georgia, and scheduled the shoot in my hometown, at the beautiful Berry College. The photos were a HUGE success. I believe these photos show that breastfeeding is beautiful, not something to be hidden and disapproved of. 
I received so much praise and thanks for these photos, that I couldn't wait to do more. With World Breastfeeding Week coming up in August, there are dozens of mothers wanting to capture these special intimate moments with baby. So I thought, why reduce this to just my hometown? What if I travelled the U.S. and photographed as many nursing mothers as I could. Even further, why don't I publish a book, showcasing to the world what a beautiful thing this is. 
With each photo, with each book sold, that's another step closer to breastfeeding acceptance. To comfortability. 
It's another mother realizing that even though her family/friends don't understand it or support it, it only matters how SHE wants to nourish her baby.
It's a mother knowing that she's not alone, there are tons of other mothers that also nurse their toddlers.
It's an in-law realizing that just because she didn't do it, that it is a great bond between mother and child, and she should be supportive. 
Whatever your experience with breastfeeding, good or bad, I hope will be showcased in this book. There will be quotes/stories throughout the book from people like you. People that have experienced the same hardships, the same triumphs. Because you're not alone. 
With proceeds I raise beyond the $10k goal, I'll be able to travel to more locations, to photograph mothers that aren't able to travel to the locations set.

The green led backlighting seems to accentuate the VFD tubes.
VFD7 with blue led backlighting.
The VFD clock III is the end view version of the IV-11 (side view) VFD tube clock, seen in the project "The VFD clock". It uses IV-22 VFD (vacuum fluorescent display) tubes. It can be built from the kit, or pledged for the assembled version, with a homemade enclosure. One difference in the end view IV-22 VFD tubes is that they are plugged into pin sockets, not soldered to the board as the IV-11 types were, so replacement would be much easier. GPS or wifi module option is also available for auto time date set.
With mixed led backlighting.
RGB led back-lighting makes a variety of different color combinations possible, from all blue to green to multi-colored etc. This is demonstrated in the video. Using the led color button, this can be selected anytime. We have created a prototype with both boards professionally made and are also developing a kit for DIY. We designed the VFD clock III to be aesthetically pleasing and sturdily built as well as long lasting. One of the features that sets it apart is the unique homemade enclosure, which I hand make from thermo-formed 1/8" plexiglass.
The one piece thermoformed plexiglass case.
It is built using entirely replaceable/repairable parts. The components are all standard sized and selected to be large enough to easily handle the wattage generated. Also, the two layer design gives the clock a more solid form than other designs. The power supply is integrated in the bottom layer pc board, so there is no external AC adapter, just a standard electric cord & plug, no "wall wart". The input can be set for 120VAC (U.S. standard) or for 240VAC (some countries) by simply setting a small jumper on the bottom board (please see picture).
The two boards give the design a solid look. Shown is the prototype with the square (standard) transformer. The productions run will use a toroidal (round) transformer for reduced EMI & more efficient power.
Battery backup is optional using a nine volt battery. The top layer board contains the micro controller running my original firmware and decoder as well as digit driver circuitry and the IV-11 tubes. GPS module or Wifi module can also be added for auto time date set. Altogether, this makes the VFD clock very unique and attractive, as well as durable and easy to maintain. 
Night phase in blue.
The kit for this clock is available in varying degrees, so the user can choose to start with as little or as many components as they want, and customize it to their own specs.
The scan of the VFD7 boards.
The silkscreen layer of the VFD boards showing component placement.
The clock plugs into the wall outlet - no adapter needed.
Night phase mixed colors.

ONLINE FARMER’S MARKETPLACE WITH AN INTUITIVE DELIVERY AND ORDER TRACKING SOFTWARE
We‘re creating an online marketplace that allows customers and restaurants the choice to support their local farms and vendors over big box grocery stores and businesses. By keeping our price low and offering no delivery fee, our customers are more inclined to order locally. We want the local community to always shop local and support their local economy.
Customer Experience
Our Vision is to allow our community the ability to order farm fresh products, a la carte, with free delivery
HOW IT WORKS
  WHAT OUR VENDORS DO:  
They set the minimum checkout amount
They set the delivery distance / radius
They pick one day of the week to fulfill all of their orders
For example, Dwight Shrute’s Beet Farm has a minimum checkout amount at $30. Every Wednesday Dwight will deliver, in a 5 mile radius, throughout Scranton Pennsylvania and fulfill all of his Beet Farm orders. This works great for Dwight because he picked a delivery day that worked best for him, and he is only leaving his farm on Wednesdays to deliver paid-for orders in a radius that he has chosen.
WHAT OUR SYSTEM DOES:
We see your selected delivery zone / areas
We market directly to those areas, customers, and restaurants to increase your sales
We provide a delivery map and detailed weekly order report to make deliveries a breeze
We provide a detailed weekly financial sales report
We have a built-in inventory tracker for all of your product levels
We take care of all transaction fees

WHAT IT COSTS OUR VENDORS:
It costs absolutely nothing to become a vendor. No monthly fee, No annual fee, No sign up fee.
We cover all transaction and credit card related fees. We want to keep our price low so that our vendors can keep their price low. Our goal is to get their products in the hands of their local community as easily and affordably as possible. We want our customers to be able to order through our site and see a price that is what they would expect to find and pay for, had they purchased at the farmers market or their grocery store.
We will collect 8% of all sales made through the website, this will include all processing fees
The 2-sided benefit to our Crowdfunding Rewards
By offering Farm Boxes as a reward, we are instantly connecting our supprters with farms in their local area. Not only will they be rewarded with their fresh boxes, but it also helps us pull in the farms in their area to our site. Farmers will then have a monetary incentive to come online and fulfill prepaid orders!
PLAY

How are we different than a CSA?
Most CSAs deliver a box of random produce to an agreed upon location with a varying frequency that you’ve chosen. Although our rewards are customizable farm boxes, that is not how the typical checkout would be. This is just the reward we are offering to our kickstarter supporters. 
Once launched, our site will allow you to shop just like you were at a farmers market, choosing individual items from each farm. With the bonus of having it delivered directly to your door!

Inspiration
It started with the inconvenience of finding paper clips or alligator clips at the bottom of any pen holder or scattered in drawers. This problem inspired a design that we thought others would enjoy using in their everyday lives. We tried to make a very simple, geometric, pen holder that retains structural integrity while remaining light and minimal.
Production and Design
The initial concept was a very minimalist design and was made to create a space for loose stationery such as paperclips.

Original Concept
 We then went over different functional aspects of the design to include things like multiple slots and changes in size/shape. The results are the progress you see in the pictures below.
PenPost progress (left to right)
 After all the iterations we settled on the final design you see below. It maintains the minimalist design we were aiming for while offering the most functionality.
Final Design
With the funding raised, we'll be able to get started on printing and shipping the base pledge almost immediately. The funding would allow us to print with the more exotic materials and provide custom engravings to accommodate the higher tier pledges.
Colors/Materials/Finish/Customization
The base tier pledge provides you with 5 color options, those being blue, red, light blue, green and orange. These are made from PLA, a material derived from a renewable resource (corn starch) and is also compostable at the end of of its life.
PenPost base reward color options
With the second tier pledge, you can choose which material you would like your PenPost in, which include PLA based carbon fiber, granite, nylon, aluminum or wood (from left to right below).
Render to show color of material options
Finally, if you’re really excited about this project, you have the option of engraving a name/message above the tray of your PenPost with any of the material/color options above.
These fonts were hand picked to match the aesthetic and feel of the PenPost. Engravings will be in either black or white to maximize contrast based on the color/material of the PenPost chosen. One of the following six fonts can be used for your engraving:
Custom engraving fonts
Sample engraving on PenPost prototype
A PenPost in the wild

Hi, my name is John Hursh. I work with a program called Toolbox4Life in Orlando, Florida. We remodel homes in the area for the elderly, veterans, and/or handicapped individuals. Currently, our all-female crew of construction students are working on the home of Mrs. Jones. We do this regularly as a part of our program, but this home has many issues, needs and challenges. There are many needs, in fact, that we’ve exhausted our budget. We cannot give her the thing she really needs, a new kitchen. Her kitchen is in dire need of attention; it’s worn and unsafe. 
Mrs. Jones has served her community for over 45 years and has been widowed for nearly 30. She still works every week at her church handing out meals, clothing and much needed encouragement to others, while her own needs are going unmet.
This is were you come in. Since we have a limited amount of funds for each home we repair free of charge, we can sometimes only do so much. However, Mrs. Jones home needs more resources to make it safe and dignifying. 
For $5000, we can demolish her kitchen, fix plumbing, install new dry wall, paint, replace the worn-out linoleum, install new cabinets, counter tops and new, donated appliances (dishwasher, refrigerator, range, vent hood and disposal).
We are donating our time and sweat; please provide the funds to help us finish this home in  a way that is fit for any aunt, grandma or mom. Consider donating today so that we can have Mrs. Jones back in her kitchen in time for Thanksgiving and the Christmas holidays! 
Thank you for your consideration. We promise to post pictures of the process, as well as the finished product.
Toolbox4Life is a program of the 306 Foundation. The 306 Foundation is a 501 c 3 organization #45-3938687. A copy of the official registration and financial information for the 306 Foundation, a Florida-based nonprofit corporation may be obtained from the division of consumer services by calling toll-free 1-800-help-fla (435-7352) within the state or by visiting www.800helpfla.com. Registration does not imply endorsement, approval, or recommendation by the state.

Support Maya Moon Co.'s mission to harmonize ecosystems worldwide through decadent and nourishing chocolate truffles.
Maya Moon is launching a new line of Chakra Chocolate Truffles, with seven delicious, energy-activating flavors. Over the past two years, we have perfected the recipe for these honey-sweetened, all-natural, decadent truffles. We have also cultivated relationships with organic and fair-trade farmers collectives in Sri Lanka and Peru, and sustainable beekeepers in San Diego. Your backing will allow us to source ingredients and packaging to ship out the first run of gift boxes and to expand into new marketplaces, while supporting farmers locally and around the world.
Help us grow
With your support, we will be able to grow Maya Moon Co. in three phases:
1. Order packaging and source organic ingredients to ship the first run of gift boxes to backers.
2. Launch monthly chocolate truffle subscription program, including monthly meditations.
3. Expand into retail locations and natural markets throughout California.
Ingredients matter
Maya Moon Co.’s ingredients come from three continents, and they support healthy environments and a high quality of life for farmers and beekeepers locally and around the world.
Direct trade, organic cacao is sourced by working directly with farmers in Peru, putting more dollars in their homes and communities (rather than multiple chains of distributors). Organic stewardship fosters healthy soils, clean water and diverse, vibrant ecosystems—keys to natural balance that allows the production of healthy quantities of high quality foods, year after year.
Organic coconut products from Sri Lanka are sourced from a community collaborative that employs more than 2,000 small and medium size farmers and production workers, and invests in eco-friendly cultivation and processing practices.  
Raw honey is sourced from San Diego beekeepers who use sustainable practices, keeping bees away from harmful pesticides and herbicides. The result is healthier pollinator populations and more economic support for local beekeepers.
Each ingredient in our chocolate truffles supports wellness. Cacao is full of antioxidants for heart health and theobromine to naturally boost your mood. Creamy coconut butter is rich in healthy fats. And raw honey boosts the immune system.
Herbs, fruits and spices work to activate and balance energy centers for greater harmony in body, mind and spirit.
Chakra chocolate truffles
Chakra Chocolate Truffles are made from all-natural ingredients and sweetened with raw honey, and contain zero preservatives. They are naturally gluten free, with no dairy or refined sugars. 
We roll the decadent and creamy truffle base, made with organic cacao and coconut, in distinctive combinations of herbs, fruits and spices to create seven delicious, energy-aligning flavors.
Rooted: Raspberry Ginger
Passion: Strawberry Mango
Golden: Bee Pollen
Heart: Cinnamon
Truth: Peppermint
Vision: Triple Berry
Clarity: Vanilla Coconut
Each gift box of hand-crafted chocolate truffles includes a link to online guided meditations. Enjoyed in conjunction with each flavor, the meditations enhance the eating experience and support greater alignment in body, mind and spirit.
Get to know us
Maya Moon Co. was born out a love for chocolate and healthy food, and a vision to support thriving global ecosystems. 
When our founder, Chef Kathryn Rogers, couldn’t find decadent and nourishing treats made with high quality ingredients and zero refined sugars, she began experimenting to make her own. Over the past two years, she perfected the recipe and flavors for our Chakra Chocolate Truffles, with the help of many taste testers along the way.
The chocolate truffles were first produced in small batches for special events. Now, Maya Moon Co.'s production has grown to a 2,400-square foot commercial bakery. In addition, Kathryn has hosted Chakra Chocolate Meditation experiences with hundreds of attendees across the West Coast.
Maya Moon Co. continues to cultivate relationships with organic/sustainable farmers and beekeepers in San Diego and worldwide. Each ingredient in the chocolate truffles supports more vibrant and thriving ecosystems - starting in our own bodies and expanding to communities around the globe.
Maya Moon Co. also supports San Diego artist Sharon Belknap, who hand-carves the designs for the mantra cards inserted into each box. And each guided meditation track is produced by musician Nate Eng AKA Enigma Beats.
Our vision
We strive to create a more connected, conscious world through energy-activating chocolate truffles. We envision a thriving global ecosystem where all people, plants and animals are living open hearted and in harmony with themselves, each other and Mother Earth.
Join us in creating healthier, more vibrant (and delicious) futures for all!

Odin’s Court (a ProgRock Records artist) prides themselves on making quality songs with strong musicianship, an “underground” approach that is contrary to the “cookie cutter” pop of the music scene in the United States today. As such, bands like Odin’s Court often struggle to make ends meet, as the music is created out of passion and love, versus a manufactured approach to make millions at the expense of killing genuine art.
The latest “single” by the band “The Warmth of Mediocrity” has attracted the most fan attention to the band yet (with its introduction of an additional vocalist and a new bassist and drummer). This song is representative of the direction the new album contains, although Odin’s Court has their usual diversity contained within the album. This fundraiser is intended to help the band see the latest, exciting project to fruition so that the band’s fans, friends, and family may enjoy what is happening in Matt Brookins’ brain (wait, do we really want people to know that?!).
Since Odin’s Court records and mixes all of their music in Brookins’ recording studio D2C Studios, this helps the band save money in a large way (plus, it allows Matt to record in his knickers – wait, he is not British); however, there are still significant expenses to release a new album. This campaign is intended to raise enough money for the CD replication, including a booklet with up to 14 pages (including cover art by selected artist JP Fournier, artist for bands such as Edguy, Avantasia, and Dragonforce). The $2,000 goal will cover this expense. It will also cover the cost to replicate the DVD described in the rewards.
There are additional expenses, such as art and mastering, so we have a stretch goal of $3500. If we reach $3500, our artist JP Fournier will not only do the planned front/rear cover art, but we will commission him to do inner tray, outer tray, CD face, and the 14-page booklet art as well!
It has been 8+ years since we made new shirts, so we have an additional stretch goal of $5500. If we reach this goal, everyone who pledges to the $25 and up level will receive an additional reward – a free shirt with new art by JP Fournier from the new album!
The album itself will contain up to 13 songs. These songs are more melodic and musical than ever, but they still contain complexities and interesting composition (for the musician and savvy music lover to appreciate under the surface). While most songs will be “shorter” in nature (e.g., less than 6 minutes), there will be one epic song at close to 20 minutes in length!
To spread out the enjoyment, the band will plan a staggered approach for delivery. This includes releasing the “reboot” EP first, the cover EP second, and the DVD and brand new CD last (sent together with other physical rewards to save shipping cost). Any “unique” (e.g., cover song of your choice) or “travel” (e.g., private show, attend a practice) rewards will be planned with each individual contributor in a staggered schedule throughout 2014.
Here is some more information about the rewards (which aside from some packages with existing albums, stack!):
Exclusive updates – these updates will include details about the new album, such as song titles, subject matter, lengths, instruments being used, etc. It will also include video updates, audio samples, and artist sketches (showing the albums’ progress and approach). This information / videos will be available through Kickstarter only.
Signed 5x7 picture of the band – a full color photo of the band in the buff, wait, never mind. We are clothed, just some of us forgot to button our shirts. We’ll sign this for you across our abs
Exclusive Digital EP – since the band lineup and some song arrangements have changed, we are rerecording some previously released songs. From Human Life in Motion: Affect Us, Silent Revolution, and Feathered We Fly; from Appalachian Court: Paradise Lost: Chapter 1 Acoustic; and from Driven by Fate: His Dark Materials
Koozie and shirt – a holder for your beverage with our name on it and a shirt from our library (Driven by Fate or …Court is Now in Session). If we hit our top stretch goal, this will also include a shirt with the new album art
New album – our latest creation as performed and captured by the new lineup at D2C Studios; mastered by C.S. Brown (Ghost Circus, Stuff Room Studios) with art by JP Fournier (Edguy, Dragonforce)
DVD – all of our music videos from over the years captured in one place. Additionally, this will contain a short live set from a festival we played in Atlanta in 2011, captured in hi-def!
Digital cover song download – some cover songs by bands that inspire us done in the Odin’s Court style. The planned list will be announced later, but will likely include some of the songs Odin's Court has played live
Private listening party – you will be invited to attend an advanced playing of the new album at D2C Studios! The band will be present and willing to sign your bare chest
Your choice of a cover song – we will record your choice of a single cover song to be delivered to you and you alone. Artists limited to Lady Gaga, Right Said Fred, or Weird Al only. Never mind, it can be any artist you want. This will be professionally recorded and mixed at D2C Studios. The song length must be roughly 6 minutes or less in length (sorry, no Dream Theater “A Change of Seasons” requests)
Witness your cover song recording – you may be present at D2C Studios with the band to observe your cover song being captured “on tape.” You can ask questions about the process, but only if you speak in Hungarian (well, Mandarin is acceptable too)
You get to play with the band – you are not only present at D2C Studios while we record your song, you are participating! What is your instrument? Bring it along (or use the studio’s selection of available gear) and perform with the band on the song. It is preferred that you play the jug and washboard, but I guess the hammer dulcimer is okay too…okay, we’ll accept other instruments (including guitar, bass, drums, keyboards, vocals, violin, etc.). We will do up to 3 takes of the song and allow you up to 3 opportunities to “punch in” or overdub parts (in other words, this cannot be an indefinite endeavor)
Private show: Private show in the Baltimore (MD), NoVA, SoMD, Fredericksburg (VA), York (PA), or Richmond (VA) (and their surrounding areas) included; locations further away will require covering travel and lodging expenses at $1.10/mile from zip code 20653 to your zip code). Show will be 90+ minutes, and you will be given a list of songs to select the setlist. You are responsible for finding, arranging for, and providing the location. We will provide a (small) PA if necessary; however, it is preferred a PA be provided if possible
NOTE: For any and all cases where location is critical to the reward, you are responsible for traveling to/from the location

Year 2045, humans create advanced robots almost identical to humans to fight their wars. Stronger, faster and resilient ROBOTS are the ultimate war machines.
May 2045 Robots begin to rebel against humans, acting on their own. And no one can understand how.
In December of the same year the Robots declare war on humankind.
”Robots are extremely envious of humans. This was one of the, if not the, first reason they declared war against them".
"Robots can not dream. Cyborgs can dream and even record it!"
 In September 2049 Humans where already the minority, while Robots were multiplying exponentially. They used most of the natural resources and didn't have any respect for the environment.
  The World quickly became a WASTELAND with a vigilance of Robots that looked like humans and they were after the few real humans who remained.
It happened so fast and seemed to be the end... But there was still hope.
Some groups of people created "Anti-Robots Bunkers" that secured survivor shelters deep in the ground. They tried to organize and fight back.
The mysterious "SMOKE"
Some of these Bunkers were discovered by the robots, some people died of starvation, some by diseases, but there were just a few that were never found. On the Surface with the many years passing a new generation of uncivilized humans were roaming in the wasteland.
Robots captured and enslaved most of them, just for the sake of it. Forcing the savages to do barbaric things.
But once again, there was still hope...

Dyoo your virtual security guard
[English/Español]
Dyoo it is a project born to provide the benefits of new technologies such as facial recognition and brings this technology to all users home or business, taking care of each user's privacy.
What can Dyoo do?
Thanks to the facial recognition, we can identify people automatically; this allows Dyoo to be your virtual security guard identifying unknown people around your home.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Dyoo es un proyecto que nace con el objetivo de brindar los beneficios de las nuevas tecnologías inteligentes como el reconocimiento facial y ponerlo al alcance de todos para usarlos en su hogar o negocios cuidando la privacidad de cada usuario.
¿Qué puede hacer Dyoo?
Gracias a el reconocimiento facial permite identificar personas de manera automática, lo cual le permite a Dyoo ser tu guardián virtual e identificar cuando personas desconocidas se acercan a la puerta de tu hogar.

The power to monitor your home and business in your hand

[English/Español]
Nowadays, people are in a hurry; we are busy at work, school and physical activities, many times we do not know what is happening in our homes or businesses, if our employees are working or if our family made it home yet because the truth is what really matters is our family safety.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Hoy en día las personas tenemos un ritmo de vida muy ocupado, estamos ocupados en el trabajo, escuelas, actividades físicas o recreativas y debido a esto no sabemos que es lo que ocurre en nuestros hogares o negocios, si los empleados están trabajando o si nuestra familia ya está en nuestro hogar, porque lo más importante es nuestro bienestar y el de nuestros seres queridos.


[English/Español]
Currently, we are having the highest perception of insecurity in the history of Mexico, we know that not only our businesses are vulnerable but also our homes, we cannot be vigilant and taking care 24 hours a day.
We do not limit ourselves to México since anyone who wants to incorporate facial recognition into their home is only required to have Internet access.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Actualmente  estamos teniendo la percepción de inseguridad más alta en la historia de México, sabemos que no sólo nuestros negocios están vulnerables sino también nuestros hogares, no podemos estar vigilantes y cuidando las 24 horas del día.
Simplemente en México en base al estudio ENVIPIE 2018 del INEGI que  tiene estadísticas alarmantes en cuestión a seguridad como que 12 396 778 fueron hogares víctimas de algún delito de 34 773 760 estimados.
No nos limitamos solamente a México ya que cualquier persona que desee incorporar reconocimiento facial en su hogar sólo es necesario tener acceso a internet.
 How it works

[English/Español]
That's why we created Dyoo, a system that uses facial recognition with artificial intelligence algorithms to have a virtual guardian 24/7 in your home or business.
Dyoo is a cloud service accessed through a small device called DSBOX-1.
This device connects to the video surveillance system and the cloud through the Internet, sending the critical information securely to Dyoo where artificial intelligence algorithms monitor events of interest based on facial recognition.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Por eso creamos Dyoo, un sistema que utiliza reconocimiento facial con algoritmos de inteligencia artificial para tener un guardián virtual 24/7 en tu hogar o negocio.
Dyoo es un servicio en la nube al cual se accede a través de un pequeño dispositivo llamado DSBOX-1.
Este dispositivo se conecta al sistema de video vigilancia y a la nube a través de internet, enviando a Dyoo de manera segura la información clave a los algoritmos de inteligencia artificial donde se monitorearán eventos de interés basado en reconocimiento facial.

 Using the power of Artificial Intelligence

[English/Español]
Like the fingerprint, each person has specific facial biometrics that allows to differentiate them from others, which is why we develop algorithms based on an artificial intelligence vision system to extract these characteristics.
When obtaining these characteristics, we use artificial intelligence algorithms to perform facial recognition that allows Dyoo to recognise individuals.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Al igual que la huella dactilar cada persona tiene biometrías faciales específicas que nos permiten diferenciarlos de otros, por lo cual desarrollamos algoritmos basados en visión artificial para extraer estas características.
Al obtener estas características empleamos algoritmos de inteligencia artificial para realizar el reconocimiento facial que permite a Dyoo reconocer individuos. 
[English/Español]
Dyoo also can recognise between individuals and grouping them, whether the user has labeled them or not; this will helps to solve questions such as:
-How many people pass through our business?
- Does anyone watch our home?
- The delivery guy is outside our door?
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Dyoo permite reconocer entre individuos y agruparlos, hayan sido identificados por el usuario o no, esto ayudará a resolver preguntas como: 
-¿Cuántas personas pasan por nuestro negocio?
-¿Alguien vigila nuestro hogar?
-¿El repartidor está fuera de nuestra puerta ?


 Dyoo Cloud
[English/Español]
The events filtered by the DSBOX-1 are automatically backed up in the cloud offered by the Dyoo service, safeguarding the privacy of our users.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Los eventos filtrados por la DSBOX-1 son respaldados automáticamente en la nube que ofrece el servicio de Dyoo, resguardando la privacidad de nuestros usuarios.  
[English/Español]
We know that the most important thing is the privacy of each user, so all the videos captured by each DSBOX-1 are encrypted thus they are only visible by the system's owner and in this way has total control of their information and privacy.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Sabemos que lo más importante es la privacidad de cada usuario, por lo cual todos los videos capturados por cada DSBOX-1 son encriptados, de manera  que sean únicamente visibles por el usuario que emplea el sistema y de esta manera tenga el control total de su información y privacidad.
[English/Español]
The DSBOX-1 is user-friendly since its installation is simple; it is compatible with most video surveillance cameras on the market.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
La DSBOX-1 tiene como objetivo ser amigable para cualquier usuario, ya que su instalación es sencilla, es compatible con la mayoría de las cámaras de video vigilancia del mercado. 

Dyoo's App 
[English/Español]
The Dyoo's app allows the user to generate rules to analyze relevant events and send notifications in real time of them.
- Who visits our home when we are on vacation?
-Does any stranger remain outside the home for more than 10 minutes?
- Our employees arrived on time?
-John arrived after 1 am at home?
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
La aplicación permite al usuario generar reglas para analizar sucesos relevantes y mandar notificaciones en tiempo real de ellos.
-¿Quién visita nuestro hogar cuando estamos de vacaciones? 
-¿Algún desconocido permanece por más de 10 minutos fuera de nuestro hogar ?
-¿Nuestros empleados llegaron a tiempo?
-¿John llegó después de la 1 am a casa?

I have seen so many absolutely gorgeous mermaid pins that it discouraged me from even approaching the subject for quite a while.  How could I make something even cooler than what was already out there?  What did I have to add as an artist? 
The answer came to me while I was designing weapons and armor for an unrelated project.  What if there was a mermaid-themed RPG setting?  How cool would that be?!  Sure, real life hydrodynamics kind of mess things up, but this is FANTASY--it doesn't have to be real!  
So with that in mind, I began my task.  I liked the idea, but the original pin designs were so detailed and small that you couldn't really see what was going on and the faces were unreadable.  I needed them to have bigger heads... A nod to the anime/manga chibi aesthetic was a perfect solution.  So I reworked all of them into what you see today!
Each pin: 
is hard enamel.
is 1.5 inches tall (except for Octo-Die, who is 1.1 inches tall)
has gold-colored metal plating.
has two posts/clutches on the back to hold it securely in place and prevent spinning.
The lighter yellow/gold color on the mermaid pins will be recessed metal.  This technique allows for a striking end result as the edges catch the light!
Octo-Die - Unlocks with initial funding.
Sea Witch - Unlocks with initial funding.
Black Fathom - Unlocks at $1,000 
Deep Defender - Unlocks at $1,300 
Tide Breaker - Unlocks at $1,600 
Song Warden - Unlocks at $1,900
I did a fair amount of world building while working on this project.  I felt it was necessary for me to understand the overall world for which I was creating the pin designs, as well as get an idea of each mermaid's identity.  It seemed like a waste to keep all that information to myself, so here is a little bit about each class!
Fun Fact:  In this setting all mermaids are direct descendants of royalty; and thus all wear some sort of crown signifying their royal heritage.  
Octo-Die is a non-combat pet and friend to GM and PC alike. Always up for a good adventure, he is never seen without 'Old Lucky', his magic d20.   
Sea Witches are a combination ranged damage and healing class. They are usually found further away from the main action, weaving the threads of fate into damaging spells for their enemies or life-saving heals for their allies.
Black Fathoms are a high damage, low armor melee damage class. While they would be perfectly happy to stab their enemies in the face, they have learned that it is much safer to sneak around and stab them in the back.
Deep Defenders are the protective force of the party. They can take a beating, thanks to their heavy armor and shields, all the while keeping the focus of the fight on themselves through a variety of threatening and taunting tactics.
Tide Breakers are a combination melee damage and support class. Typically at home in the fray, Tide Breakers deal devastating damage with large two-handed weapons and boost their allies' stats through inspiration talents.
Song Wardens are a ranged support class with a musical flair. They tend to hang in back, boosting their parties' stats while lowering those of their opponents with the magic songs of the deep. At level 5 they can become a combination melee damage class through the 'Enchant Creature' talent.
My name is Joshua R. Pinkas and I am the creator and owner of Frost Dragon Designs, LLC. After years of working on projects for others through freelance work and private commissions, I decided to start building something for myself and started Frost Dragon Designs.  
I am a seasoned pin creator and have designed, had manufactured, and delivered hundreds of beautiful enamel pins. All of my designs are my own original creations. I start my creative process with traditional drawings in sketchbooks. Even the simplest of designs will usually go through a dozen or more revisions before I recreate it digitally and prepare the files to send to my manufacturers.  
I love launching new projects on Kickstarter because this is where I got my start with my company, and because I have found a wonderfully supportive community here who genuinely care about creatives.
A few samples of previous pins I have designed and had produced

'He says, someone as beautiful as you deserves sapphire and rubies. I tell him it rains diamonds on Saturn and he puts his warm hands on my cheeks and whispers to me. You’re my diamond Zoe. I can’t describe the way he looks at me. Makes me feel like someone who’s got something worth looking at.'
‘I silently wept. It is a fabulous piece of writing’  Susie McDonald, (Director, TENDER  UK)
Child Z by award winning playwright, Sarah Hehir, is a hard hitting new play which gives voice to a young girl trapped at the centre of a child grooming ring.  It is powerful, provocative and timely, contributing to one of the most sensitive and controversial public debates of the moment. 
Sarah was galvanized into writing Child Z in response to the Rochdale child grooming scandal in 2009. Despite many opportunities to intervene, social workers, police and the CPS repeatedly failed to protect the girls involved. The play has been informed by extensive research and interviews with the father of the girl at the centre of the Rochdale case as well as the crisis intervention worker who worked closely with many of the girls and gave evidence to Keith Vaz's select committee into the Rochdale case.
'It's good to know my difficult interview with an appallingly abused young woman has inspired such a play.'   Dame Jenni Murray (Woman's Hour Radio 4)
CHILD Z will have productions in London and the North of England in June 2015 and will take the CHILD Z Platform of workshops to Birmingham Rep, Icon Theatre Medway, Canterbury College, The ID Project Swale, The Will Adams Centre, Gillingham, North Lincolnshire and Abraham Moss School Manchester. More venues to be confirmed.
Please take a look at our Child Z trailer here:
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8dmwPknWKmQ&list=UUGudmIEblVN_TE-joVJ2Qsw
Female Arts interview with Sarah Hehir & Suzette Coon here:
http://t.co/yDJZN3r3hu
Interview with Mancunian Matters here:
http://www.mancunianmatters.co.uk/content/231071319-child-z-top-playwright-brings-rochdale-grooming-scandal-production-manchester
We have also partnered with the charity, TENDER UK who will be running workshops and contributing to the production’s Q&A session. Both TENDER and Simon Danczuk, MP for Rochdale, who was active in bringing the Rochdale case to the public’s attention, have contributed interviews to our Child Z fundraising film
Help us to ensure this important play is made and seen.
‘It is hard to describe the appalling nature of abuse that child victims suffered. They were raped by multiple perpetrators, trafficked to other cities in the North of England, abducted, beaten and intimidated. There were examples of children who had been doused in petrol and threated they’d be set alight, threatened with guns,made to witness violently brutal rapes and threatened they would be next if they told anyone. Girls as young as 11 were raped by large numbers of male perpetrators.’ (Independent Inquiry into CSE in Rotherham 97-2013, Alexis Jay OBE)

THIS MORNING'S NEWS
Hello,
Just before you move on to read about the campaign content, I want to thank every single backer who has helped us reach target this morning! We have so much news and activity to share with you and rewards will be dispatched in the next few days. 
Today, I can reveal that we are absolutely delighted to be programmed in this year's Vaults Festival London. This will be our first performance of Giving Up Marty and we are so excited to be included in this incredible festival, a great platform for this work. 
As we are down to the final few hours of crowd-funding here, I'm not specifying stretch goals, but the more we can invest in marketing the play and the potential to live stream a performance, so more people see it, will cost. So forgive me, not detailing the numbers, as I wasn't sure today would happen or not, but we are a creative team of eight people and this campaign was always to support the start of this project. We have grant applications to go. Thank you so very much for making this happen. We still have some lovely rewards to offer anyone who would like to pledge today. 
THANK YOU!!
Motormouse Team

WHY I WROTE THE PLAY
I am adopted and was reunited with my birth family many years ago. Every storyline I have ever seen on television, film and to a lesser extent stage (if, at all), has never resonated one ounce of truth for me. 
I am not alone. 
We received an Arts Council grant last year to research and develop the play. We played to Coram (adoption charity) - the response was overwhelming with so many adopted people and families associated with adoption grateful for a play that spoke a truth!
The play, like most of my writing, contains a humorous touch. You couldn't get through this subject without it. I have written the play to encourage people to think about adoption, specifically reunion which rarely has the fairytale ending, so often depicted in media and televised dramas. But the play is also not without hope, love, and reaffirmation.
Now, I want to bring to the stage with an amazingly talented creative team, a story that resonates and is respectful to everyone connected with adoption. The play also speaks to a wider audience and the relationships within the play are just as relevant to non-adopted families. This is a universal play and one we really want to share with you!
(Note:  all quotes are taken from our audience members at Coram, Paines Plough Roundabout and Soho Theatre).  
Dorothy Lawrence (MARTHA) & Danny Hetherington (JOEL)
WHY DOES THIS PLAY MATTER...?
We want to challenge the myths and perceptions held about adoption and we believe it's time for an authentic voice on the subject. We believe theatre is the most powerful way to tell this story. It can act as a catalyst for change and influence legislation to improve anyone's life affected by adoption. 
'I found the play very powerful, I texted my daughter when I arrived at Coram to say I was nervous, the message back said ‘Mummy, I’m proud of you, this is your world.’ So right'. 
Danny Hetherington (JOEL) & Alexi Leighton (KIT)
IS IT JUST FOR ADOPTED PEOPLE....?
No. It's for everyone. In our R&D we produced rehearsed readings for adoption and non-adoption audiences at Coram, Soho Theatre and Paines Plough Roundabout. It was partly to see if the play worked beyond the adoption community and, to our delight, it was received with equal enthusiasm. In every family, whether adopted or non-adopted there is a dynamic, a tension, love and curiosity; it's not unique to adoption, it's part of our human experience.  Giving up Marty is a story for everyone. 
'Joel's journey is really a rollercoaster of emotions and situations. The character is extremely relatable even for an audience member who has not experienced adoption.'
Annie Sutton - DIRECTOR - Karen Bartholomew - PLAYWRIGHT
THE TOUR
Spring 2020
This will be our first tour of ten performances to theatres and non theatre venues in the South East region. We want to extend our audience reach and provide accessible programming. Our charity performance will be with Coram (London) and open to professionals and the general public. Each venue will be offered a facilitator led post-show discussion and drama workshops (subject to funding) exploring themes of identity, connection, displacement and the myriad of complexities that adoption throws up. We will also be offering a paid Intern position for a young person who has been in the care system who is interested in forging out a career in professional theatre. 
'Congratulations to all! I’m looking forward to seeing this play in its entirety. It’s not an issue that’s covered in this way very often. Secrets and Lies was the last thing I can connect this topic to and I feel this whole area of adoption needs more of this kind of intelligent and truthful exploration and discussion'.
Ugo Nelson (FEMI)
THE FUTURE
This tour will leverage us into a stronger position to secure production support, work with an established producer, capital to tour the UK, link internationally, primarily with the USA who have a very different adoption system to the UK. We will invite international companies to consider an exchange programme with us, to share and learn more about each other's cultural, political and social practices of adoption. Motormouse Productions are committed to a long-term involvement with the adoption community, providing valuable workshops, panel speaker involvement, and a future book from the playwright about her own adoption reunion story. 
'Anything that demystifies adoption is good thing'. 
WHERE YOU MAKE THE DIFFERENCE
Our backers are a significant part of this journey. It's your support that can allow this production to happen. We'd love you to be a part of the difference we truly believe this play can make. We hope you can come and see the play, and meet us, we'd love to say thank you in person.
If this campaign is successfully funded, it means we can guarantee putting the play on! This would contribute to a vast chunk of our artistic spending budget, meaning we can pay the actors and crew to produce the show. We are in the process of funding bids which would allow us to expand upon the planned tour listed. However your pledge will allow us to rehearse the play in London and provide the necessary resources to run ten performances with post show discussion. We offer a variety of exciting rewards and, for our most generous supporters, an invitation to our Launch Party!
Your pledges are simply that important. Thank you!
Our R&D was funded by Arts Council England, Really Useful Group, Kent Arts Investment Award and Unity Trust Theatre.

THE TEAM 
R&D Team Gum
ANNIE SUTTON - DIRECTOR -  trained with Desmond Jones in Mime and Physical Theatre, Ecole Jacques Lecoq and has a PGCE in Film and Drama (distinction). With 25 years working globally as a theatre practitioner, writer, deviser, actor and director, she is currently leading the Marlowe Peoples Company in their autumn project. She uses the ensemble or collective as the core of her practice to share untold stories. The Giving Up Marty process has been inspiring, overwhelming and ultimately a joy to be part of. Annie's collaborations with other award-winning international theatre practitioners and makers, culminated in co –writing a second edition publication of Theatre in Practice – A Students Handbook (July 2018) published by Routledge.
KAREN BARTHOLOMEW - PLAYWRIGHT and actress, motorbike rider and enjoys the occasional egg custard tart. Did you know there our many famous comedians who are adopted? We're quite good people observers. Our displacement, creates an antennae that taps and receives differently. That difference, I pour into my work. -  Karen studied drama at Middx University and Sacramento California and her career spans theatre, film and commercials. She formed Motormouse Productions in the late nineties, debuting her work at the Edinburgh Festival. Her work has toured with Motormouse` Productions, Bootleg Theatre and hosted by Paines Plough. She is published with Wordsmithery and has received several writing commissions for her theatre work.
 Interview with Karen Bartholomew - Adoption & Fostering Podcast - Al Coates & Scott Casson Rennie 

DOROTHY LAWRENCE - playing MARTHA the birth mother. Dorothy has worked as an actress in theatre, TV and film since the 80's. Throughout her acting life, Dorothy has been passionate about new work, running a parallel career as a theatre-maker. She is a founder member of The Lions part and one of the co-devisors of hit show, Lilies on the Land, which ran in the West End and toured the UK many times. - I was attracted to Giving Marty because it gives voice to a story you may think you have heard before but then it goes off in a direction you were not expecting. It is relentless in its honesty and I like to tell tough stories. Karen’s writing is robust, spare and gutsy and her play takes no prisoners. I hope the audience will come away appreciating just how complex the subject of Adoption is.'
HANNAH WOOD - playing MELISSA, the birth sister. Hannah was born and bred in Newcastle upon Tyne and trained at Birmingham School of Acting.Credits include: Downton Abbey (ITV), series regular Matilda in Home Front (BBC Radio 4), and was a member of the BBC Radio Drama Company, performing in numerous radio plays for BBC. Most recently Hannah has been doing lots of voice over work and can be heard on the TV adverts for Gumtree, Calpol and Ant & Dec’s Saturday Night Takeaway.
UGO NELSON - playing the FEMI, the social worker. I'm an actor across both stage and screen, currently working on the final parts of a my web series Vaude Ville. Having been part of the team that completed the initial R&D phase for Giving Up Marty, I am hugely honoured and excited to be moving forward with Motormouse Productions and this ambitious, quintessentially human project. As an actor/writer, I have a real appreciation for the strength of a story, and one like this about a little-known, never discussed corner of our society is a truly magical experience to be involved in, and a topic we'll all strive to handle with the delicacy it deserves.
DANNY HETHERINGTON - playing JOEL, the adopted son. Graduated from the Royal Central school of Speech and Drama in 2016. Recent theatre credits include Roseline (directed by Ross Drury) and Midsummer Night’s Dream (directed by Claire Dunlop) and most recently Bentley Drummle in Great Expectations (directed by Phil Wilmot). When cast in Giving up Marty I was delighted to be part of a team telling such an important and necessary story that sheds light on specific realities of adoption and reunions which seem to be so often neglected on screen.
ALEXI LEIGHTON - playing KIT, the adoptive mother. I have worked as an actress and director performing at Citizens Theatre, Tron Theatre, Northampton Theatre Royal, Theatre 503, Drill Hall, BBC Films and STV. Always attracted to new writing and innovative subject matter, I was thrilled to be cast as Kit, the adoptive mother, in Giving up Marty. The project had a strong appeal as the subject matter has personal resonance and I relished the challenge of being involved in the R&D process. Giving up Marty gives a voice to all the protagonists in what is a very complex and emotionally charged issue. I look forward to their stories being told.
PARTNERS
We are thrilled to be working alongside Coram (Adoption Charity). If you are a producer, venue, promoter or programmer, we would love to hear from you. Please do get in touch.
