Hi! I'm Rosie. Most people who know me, know that I love talking about mental health. Working with mental health, I feel like I've picked up some neat lessons, and my favourite one is that self-care is incredibly important. The things that we deny ourselves, like time off, a good cry, a break, or the help that we need, can really mess things up.
These pins are cute reminders. Little mascots to remind you - it's okay to be sad! You deserve the help! And you're already good enough, so take a break. 
Pin no. 1
The first pin in the series is a cute pup - "You're Already Good Enough" - possibly my favourite message of the three. If we reach our minimum goal of £250, this pup will go to manufacture and be made.
Stretch Goals
Stretch Goal no. 1
This fluffy kitten will be made when we reach our first stretch goal of £500. "You Deserve the Help You Need" - I can't tell you how many people have insisted that other people deserve help and care more than them. This kitten knows better.
Stretch Goal no. 2
Because self care isn't all fun - sometimes it's letting yourself be sad. This pin will be made if we reach stretch goal no. 2 - £700.

The Project
In our ever-changing world, habitats are relentlessly disturbed and fragmented by humans. These habitat changes have major consequences for native species. In some cases, these changes can lead to the origin of biodiversity (speciation), but they can also lead to the collapse of species boundaries and, ultimately, to a loss of biodiversity. My graduate thesis work at the University of Denver addresses these critical questions using a small freshwater fish, the threespine stickleback.
Male threespine sticklebacks typically display a flashy, bright red throat area to attract females. However, in locations along the Pacific coast of North America, males from several rivers have lost this iconic mating signal and instead display a solid black body coloration during the breeding season.
I am investigating whether these two color types mate (Are they different species?) and the potential mechanisms that keep these two color types apart (How are there two color types maintained in the same streams?).
I suspect that changes in land use have altered water color in some Washington streams, causing a shift from red to black. For example, male sticklebacks with black coloration are more visible in tannin-rich water. Color is often involved in animal mate choice and helps females to decide which male(s) they will accept as mates. This means that environmental disturbances - especially human induced disturbances - could be problematic for threespine sticklebacks and other organisms that rely on color signals for reproduction. These changes can cause a species to split into two or destroy boundaries between them. Other common disturbances to freshwater habitats (like habitat degradation and climate change) might also affect the exchange of individuals between populations, directly impacting the genetic differences between them.
Human activity is the leading cause of global species extinction and endangerment. It is crucial to study these populations to better understand how human behavior affects biodiversity. My research will further our understanding of the barriers that maintain biodiversity and contribute to conservation efforts by revealing how human-induced threats impact reproductive interactions and boundaries. 
How You Can Help
My pilot trip to the Pacific Northwest proved that my paddleboarding approach is very effective for stickleback collection and helped me establish the methods I need to return to locations in Washington and Oregon that are crucial to my work. Forget white lab coats and fancy hotel rooms! We experience the wild side of science by trekking riverbanks in waders, paddleboarding through creeks, measuring fish on a fallen tree, and camping every night. Your support will help me pay for campsites, paddle board rentals, and a rental car to transport our fish in addition to contributing to my genetic analysis, behavioral measurements, and environmental work. 
I cannot thank you enough for your help! This would not be possible without you. You can visit my website for additional information about me and my research, to follow my progress, or to contact me if you have any questions!

So Crystal and I have done it.
We've developed a lovely plan for this chapter of our lives. As you all may or may not know. Crystal and I are both minimalists & naturalists. I'm a professional musician who has been offered recording contracts in the past, but really didn't want to be trapped in the city or so far from my family. So we've decided to start vlogging our progress on a wonderful idea that would allow us to be free to travel, bring communities together and introduce them to local farmers, which would help bridge the gap.
We would buy our flatnose school bus 🚌, convert it into a tiny home on wheels using as much re-purposed and free material as possible. Then we reach out and coordinate with communities for a farm to table pop up dinner (food provided by local farmers) accompanied by a mobile house concert (music provided by yours truly). This idea brings communities and farmers together while providing entertainment. We will be vlogging all of this, so stay in touch and like FrenchShip Bus for future posts on the matter!
  With that said. We know that this bus will take many steps to completion and potentially be costly, even though we intend on using free, re-purposed and donated items for the conversion. We know that this project will be just that. A project. We need your help, but we are not solely relying on donations, as we are also funding this endeavor with our good old fashioned paychecks. We will begin Vlogging on YouTube very soon and keep everyone up to date with purchases and building progress. We are going to continue to fine tune the details, but are really looking forward to seeing this become a reality! Frenchship is something we all need! ♥
  First we buy the bus as is, which will be in between $3000-$8000, then we start the conversion process! (Which will be a blast to watch on YouTube)
We predict it will take a year to convert and by 2020 we will be hosting these Frenchship Pop-up Dinner/Mobile House Concerts.
  We will be making a plack for the back of the bus honoring those who donated. The plack will have you name and a small message of love you'd like for those to see.
Add your name with a $500 donation! We can't wait to see this change peoples lives.  Join us on our journey!
French Family

Why am I creating this?  How did this idea come to me?  Recently, my food shopping order to Vons / Pavilions was canceled and the email informing me was sent to my spam filters.  Amazon Fresh only brought a 1/3 of my shopping order with no more delivery times in my area.  Whole Foods just down the street no longer has delivery.  
We have professional level drone flyers, piloting from the comfort of their home and quickly, accurately and best of all no human contact.  These drones pick up food shopping orders from grocery stores, food shopping stores, giant food warehouses, possibly Amazon, Amazon Fresh, since they no longer have delivery options and also from your favorite restaurants in order to help the stay open while also feeling like life is not lost with your favorite comfort food down the street.  
We are opening drone delivery stations and looking all food distribution partners across the United States, From Los Angeles, Ca to New York, NYC.
This is one way, we can get to those already in isolation, lockdown, or the city is completely under lock down.

The Documentary "Dreams That Never Die"
Zak Stevens, formerly of Savatage, started Circle II Circle in 2002. "ZAK IS BACK ON THE ATTACK!" CIIC has been running wild all over the globe since the release of their latest album "Seasons Will Fall" in January 2013.  This album is considered to be one of their strongest from both a musical and production standpoint.  That is until CIIC releases their next album which is tentatively scheduled for a spring 2015 release!
This documentary "Dreams That Never Die" will be following CIIC from recording their new album in the studio to the road on their world tour. During this journey we will be looking back, covering the stories from the Savatage years to our current/upcoming 2015 world tour. We will take you behind the scenes from the studio to the stage, from our hotels to our living rooms to capture the realities of a touring band in the music industry today.  Dreams that Never Die will capture the raw emotion, triumph, victory, pitfalls, and struggles of one of the hardest working bands across the globe, andwhat it takes to get our music out to you, the fans.
Update #2 100% funded! But this is not the end, Zak talks about our new goal for US Tour support
Update #2 Message from Zak
Update #1 US Tour
Being on the road is a great opportunity for interviews that we otherwise wouldn't be able to film. The funding will support bringing the film crew on tour with us and also send them to additional locations when opportunities arise. This is not just another tour footage documentary. We want to to tell you the stories directly from the storytellers themselves. We need to be able to provide flights and hotels so we can send our team out to gather these stories. Without your support we can not collect these stories and bring them to you.

Why $10,000?
This covers the bare minimum of the cost to have a dedicated crew to travel with the band through the up coming tours in Europe, Brazil, Dubai, and possible North American shows. We need to be able to provide airfare, hotels and to feed them on the road. 100% of the funding is going directly to the cost of filming. We need the ability to jump on opportunities and travel to the people you want to hear from. With this funding we have dedicated crew that will be working on this 24/7.
Our goal covers the bulk of the expenses. Other expenses, such as gear, time and effort, sweat, blood, and tears are being absorbed by the film maker and CIIC. As well as the huge effort to edit this into a documentary once the footage is complied. All of which is being absorbed by the film maker.
We can do this with our funding goal, because of the help we receive from our family, loved ones and friends who believe in what we are trying to do. No one is drawing a salary or profit from this campaign. This is why we can bring you the documentary "Dreams That Never Die" ... 'cause they don't! 
Successful Funding
Successful funding is not the end of the story! If we go beyond our goal, this means we can talk to you about greater ideas we have in mind for this project and for you fans in North America!

My name is Dani Maloney, founder and director of Dani Maloney Dance Company, also referred to as DMD.
             In the wake of COVID-19, the performing arts have been hard to access in a time where people need art. I am working on a project designed for eleven dancers that will outline the course of the pandemic through movement. I will be looking for dancers varying in gender from different cultural backgrounds. Most entertainers have been unemployed throughout this entire pandemic. It is my goal to give them meaningful work and pay them a fair wage, getting dancers back to their careers again.
         The piece will be forty minutes in length with an original score composed by Simon Greenberg. It will include athletic dancing, props, projection, and lighting design. I intend to use a plethora of saran wrap that will manipulate, support, trap and encase the dancers' bodies. The project will abide by the regulations put in place by the CDC. This will include social distancing, individuals only making contact if they are in the same pod, masks being worn, and taking a mandatory COVID-19 test before the project ensues. I am not only passionate about bringing performance opportunities back into our society, but bringing them back safely.
             I will film this work upon its completion, and plan to put it on a streaming service where the public can watch it for free. My mission is to make the arts accessible and to reach a wide variety of people. The projected dates for production rehearsals and filming are November 29th, 2020, through December 12th, 2020. 
        As my company is newly formed, I will need some additional funding to make this project possible. The money will be used to pay for rehearsal space, and pay the dancers, sound designer, and videographer for their work. I believe that this project will leave a lasting impression on viewers from all over and will be a powerful beginning to DMD's future. The arts are needed now more than ever, and I plan to bring this experience to your own living room. Thank you for taking the time to look this project over. Your time and your support are very appreciated and will not go unnoticed. 
Attached is a link to the company's website:  https://www.danimaloneydance.com/
Attached is a link to the company's playlist of live performance and dance for camera previews: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RUnr_JC-ww8&list=PLho03ezTaIlQA3fZrLURhqBYpkMaHdK45

Written by students, for students.
Available Now for Pre-Orders!
Long gone are the days where multiple residency positions are waiting for you at the end of medical school. It’s no secret that medical school enrollments are increasing while the number of residency positions remains relatively constant. Whether you will have your eye on a competitive specialty, a geographic location, or certain training program in your 4th year, getting your top choices will be paramount.
40,000 medical students have intelligence, work ethic, and social skills – that’s why they got in to medical school. Knowing how, where, and when to expend valuable time and energy throughout medical school and the residency match will help separate you from the herd.
Drawing on the experiences and honest hindsight of 12 medical students who recently matched, Medical School and The Residency Match details topics that brought strife, mistakes made, and successful choices that served students well. The goal is to provide student-driven insight to help you optimize your candidacy resulting in more control when residency applications roll around.
Get answers from students who matched at top programs in 2015:
How did an average student match into a top-tier surgical or medical program?
How can you maximize your potential without having to work like a robot for 10 hours a day?
How best to spend your time off?
How to navigate interview season?
Where should you schedule away rotations?
How to excel during your clerkship year?
A few words on Boards…
Help get this project off the ground by pre-ordering your copy today for $15.

"Frat Splat"
A Stabber-Comedy
When five members of DIK (Delta Ironic Kappa) go to Chad’s lakehouse for a weekend getaway, toxic masculinity isn’t the only thing lurking in the shadows, as the legendary Hyde and Seek Killer emerges and hunts down the boys one by one.

We are raising money to submit this short film to film festivals across the nation including South by West Film Festival, Tribeca Film Festival and many others. Our goal is to raise money to cover the film festival entry fees. The funds will also cover the cost of the composer for the film and miscellaneous post production costs. 

This past summer in the Fool's Pajamas Productions office we had an intern, Tyler Parrish, who came to us with this very ambitious idea called "Frat Splat". Our schedule was much less busy due to the coronavirus pandemic, so we took this opportunity to create this slasher comedy written and directed by Tyler. As we assembled our cast and crew, we knew this project was going to be something special. We worked long nights and even kept shooting through the night on a tight schedule.

We want to give a special thanks to our amazing cast and crew for all the hard work they have and continue to put into this passion project. We are creating this kickstarter project because we believe that this short film has the potential to be everything we want it to be.

The Beauty Clause is a book project and social media initiative dedicated to discovering, understanding, and celebrating authentic beauty in cultures around the world.
The Beauty Clause as seen on The Huffington Post
Our plan is to travel the world, seeking out women in each of the countries we visit who can help us better understand the standards of beauty unique to each of their cultures. We will be compiling their stories along with photographs of our travels into a coffee-table style book.
 Here's a glimpse of a few of our advocates here in the U.S. and the stories they've shared:
Our hope is that by bringing awareness and understanding to the different standards of beauty in cultures around the world our readers will be able to more easily recognize beauty in other people, as well as in themselves. By sharing these stories and photographs, we hope to build a community of compassionate individuals focused on promoting empathy amidst diversity and comradery upon similarities.
What people are saying about The Beauty Clause:
The Beauty Clause is dedicated to bridging the gap between cultures and people around the world. The ability to recognize and celebrate beauty in the unfamiliar is not only critical to the advancement of the human spirit, but imperative in stopping the personal detriment caused by being outcast by the world around you.
Q: What about men?
A: We absolutely, 100% believe that everyone is beautiful and is worthy of feeling included in and noticed by a world that can all-too-often be quick to judge and quick to outcast people who are different than them or different than what they know. With that, for our first book, we plan to focus on women. Being completely inclusive is something that we discussed, and is and will forever be important to us, but we strongly believe that different groups of people are weighted by issues and standards that are specific to their group. The arguments about beauty that surround men are oftentimes very different than those that women face on a daily basis and so we decided to choose one target demographic for this project and the first book. With that, we are dedicated to being as inclusive as possible within this demographic. As our project and efforts gain momentum, we hope to have the ability to give full focus to both women and men.

Clifton Film Fest is a homegrown film festival in Northern Virginia. I created this festival along with Eugene Abedejos 6 years ago to support young local filmmakers that didn't have access to larger festivals and wanted to show their work to the community. We provide these filmmakers with an opportunity to showcase their work and award prizes to help them grow professionally. We award expensive software, tutorial memberships, and free stock footage that most young artists cannot get their hands on. We also provide them with a red carpet experience being interviewed and treated like royalty with VIP passes, snacks, and a room to hangout in before the show.

Until I Gush Forth
My name is Manuel Esthaem, I'm a photographic artist based in Linz Austria. My work has been part of various group exhibitions around the world, as well as numerous online and print publications. Most recently my work has been shown in the If You Leave Showcase 2016 in London. 
Until I Gush Forth is my first ever print publication and will be printed in a limited edition of 100. Every copy will be signed and hand-numbered.
I've spent the past few months working on this new body of work that deals with the topic of the unknown. It is a meditation on living with the unknown as a constant companion. On the liberating but often times paralyzing and reality-altering feelings of what it means to wander along a vague path with no set destination. Staged photographs are set up against alienated snapshots and together create a visual poem that talks about a topic that's familiar to anyone. 
Most of the images were shot on black and white film which I personally hand-developed.

About Esthaem
Self Portrait with Odin, 2016
Esthaem (b. 1992) is a photographic artist based in Linz, Austria. He holds a BA in Graphic-Design and Photography from the University of Art and Design Linz and is currently studying Visual Communication.
Drawn to nature, life itself and the human body, he uses the latter and treats it as a sculptural object, allowing him to explore topics such as identity, intimacy, (de-)construction of sexuality, gender as well as the self through his photographic work.
He wanders along the narrow path of theory and its discourses, photography as art and his personal point of view, all while maintaining a distinct photographic vision which is often being referred to as „visual poetry“.
His images are a mirror of his own constructed reality, portraits of difficult to grasp subject matters that aim to translate his analysis of the world into aesthetically pleasing imagery full of fragile moments, sensuality and symbolism.

In June 2015, the first-ever crowdfunded forensic investigation of a state pension—the $8 billion Rhode Island system—was successfully completed and the report Double Trouble: Wall Street Secrecy Conceals Preventable Pension Losses in Rhode Island delivered to the public via multiple media sources. The investigation revealed that investment decisions that were obviously wrong from inception—reckless piloting of public retirement assets into secretive high-risk investments and leakage related to lavishing ever-greater investment fees on Wall Street—were the greatest factors undermining the solvency of the state pension. Mismanagement and “politicization” of pension investments were the chief culprits. Due to potential violations of the federal securities laws identified during the investigation, the report was filed with the United States Securities and Exchange Commission ("SEC").
Now the nation’s leading pension investigator—former SEC attorney and Forbes contributor Edward Siedle—will conduct a forensic investigation of the California Public Employees’ Retirement System (CalPERS), America’s largest public pension plan with over $300 billion in assets. Over the course of his career Siedle has conducted $1 trillion-plus in forensic investigations. He was recently named as one of the 40 most influential people in the U.S. pension debate by Institutional Investor for 2014.
This project will culminate in the release of an extensive forensic investigative report prepared by Siedle for publication via across media. In the event any actual or potential violations of the federal securities laws are identified, the report may be filed with the SEC.  
With 1.72 million members relying upon CalPERS for retirement benefits and a funded status of only 69.8 percent, prudent management of the state pension's investments is of grave concern to all stakeholders—including California's 11 million taxpayers. Given its huge size, CalPERS is closely watched by other public pensions in the United States and investors globally often follow its lead. Poor investment decisions at CalPERS can, and frequently do, result in harm to investors far outside the state of California.
CalPERS’ investments have been controversy-ridden since the early 2000s, including a “pay to play” scandal that implicated the CEO and some board members. In 2011, the fund paid $11 million to a Washington, D.C., law firm and its advisors to conduct an internal review which found support for allegations of corruption, bribery and influence peddling. CalPERS defended the substantial fees paid to the law firm, noting that it used the findings to negotiate $215 million in fee reductions from private equity managers. In September, 2014, the CalPERS announced it would shed its entire $4 billion investment in hedge funds as part of an effort to simplify its assets and reduce costs. While CalPERS stated that the decision wasn't based on the performance of the program, the hedge funds earned 7.1 percent during a fiscal year when all of the fund returned 18.4 percent. The annualized rate of return on its hedge fund investments over the last 10 years was 4.8 percent.
Recently CalPERS unveiled a plan to slash the numbers of outside money managers it uses, arguing that their performance couldn't justify the expenditure.  
In short, corruption, bribery, influence-peddling, excessive fees, lack of transparency and underperforming high-risk alternative investments have plagued America's largest public pension for at least the past decade. It's time the CalPERS Board and stakeholders got a much-needed expert "second opinion." 
Our mission is to provide CalPERS stakeholders with an independent, expert review which can be used to improve the structure, investments and performance of the plan.  
Today CalPERS stakeholders pay the cost of the experts it hires for advice regarding retirement plan matters, yet lack access to experts of their own choosing to review the decisions that are made. Without the information and specialized knowledge required to evaluate the retirement plan, stakeholders lack an effective voice in plan matters. A retirement planning paradigm which specifically excludes the very individuals whose money is at risk makes no sense. 
While few stakeholders can afford to hire a nationally-recognized investment expert on their own, through crowd-funding using our proprietary forensic protocol, participant or stakeholder dollars can be combined to fund a high-impact independent review at a far lower cost than even an employer would pay. We know it can be done because over the past 30 years we've reviewed over $1 trillion in assets.. Of course, you don’t have to be a worker or participant to contribute to this investigation. The identities of the crowdfunding donors are confidential.
To view our prior investigations: http://www.investigatemyretirementplan.com/our-investigations.html

Most people are unaware that there are currently 15,000 Americans in need of a bone marrow transplant, while only 2% of eligible Americans are registered donors.  To become a potential donor, all it takes is a simple swab of your cheek and you could give someone a second chance at life.  
While filming the recovery of my good friend and mentor, Joselyn Miller, a bone marrow recipient, I became increasingly intrigued with the need to increase potential donors and I myself joined the Be The Match registry.  Due to Joselyn's appreciation of her second chance at life, a friendly competition developed between Joselyn, her husband Todd, and I, to cross off items on our respective bucketlists. One item on my bucket list was to walk across America. During the walk, I will be documenting encounters with bone marrow recipients, donors, family members of recipients, doctors as well as the people I meet in towns along the cross country adventure.
The film will feature my personal challenge of walking 3,200 miles from Atlantic City, New Jersey, to San Francisco, California, and the experiences that unravel along the way.  I have been trained to personally swab and register potential donors, which you will see in the film.  My goal is to increase the number of registered donors by 600 by the end of my cross-country walk.  
Your donation will be split 50/50 to help me pay for the food, water and the occasional housing that I’ll need to complete the 7 month walk from coast to coast; the other half going toward the cost of post production of the documentary, which will include editing, music rights, animation, the production of DVD's and more. I have assumed responsibility for all upfront costs of equipment for the trek such as a tent, push cart, sleeping bag, proper clothing etc.  I have also assumed responsibility for the cost of all film, lighting, and sound equipment for the film.
I hope you will still consider contributing to my project even if the funding goal has been met.  All additional funds will help to enhance the quality of the film and expand awareness about the need for bone marrow donors and the ease with which one can become a potential donor.

You are reading this and I would like to thank you for doing so. This Kickstarter campaign is a fundraiser/pre-sale for my second CD Summer Sands & Sleeping Bears. It has been five years since the release of my first CD and I have been busy writing and recording original instrumental finger-style tunes. Yes, it takes me a bit longer because the music thing is a spare-time gig.  I am an educator by profession having taught in Northern Michigan for the past twenty years at the high school and college levels. When time allows I play guitar and write music because I can’t imagine not doing so. It is a release, a necessity (akin to breathing) and a joy to create music. 
As a non-touring musician the expense of producing a CD is a bit daunting. I managed to keep my head above water on the last CD with the support of all the people who were kind enough to purchase Borderline Normal and by placing a few tunes on the PBS Program RoadTrip Nation and satellite music providers in the US and Canada.  Summer Sands & Sleeping Bears is another homegrown project. 
 I keep the costs down by doing much of the recording in various rooms of our home. With this KickStarter campaign I am hoping to raise enough funds to cover production costs and the initial pressing of the CD. If we surpass the initial goal (be still my heart) funds will go towards a third CD and to compensate those who have contributed skill, time and help along the way.
 Summer Sands & Sleeping Bears is in the process of being mastered and should be ready for release in June. Sound Engineer and guitarist Steve Reinthal is hard at work mastering the CD in Brisbane Australia. Steve teaches Sound Design for film and TV at Griffith University, one of Australia's most innovative tertiary institutions. He is also an enormously talented and innovative guitarist. Steve was kind enough to add some fret work to "A Loon's Lament" on the CD.
Summer Sands and Sleeping Bears also features the musical talents of three other very special musicians:
Leslie Anne Harrison  the expressive flautist from the band New Time Ensemble and the folk duo Folk Ragoût.
Tim Lorsch, accomplished session and and recording artist, plays fiddle and octave violin
The incomparable multi-instrumentalist Zac Leger contributes whistle to a couple of tunes.
Several of the tunes on this CD were inspired by travel to places as far away as the United Kingdom  and Hawaii as well as places close to my Michigan home in Northwestern Lower Michigan where my wife and spend much of our summers beaching and cycling. One of the title tracks refers specifically to the Sleeping Bear Dunes National Lakeshore and both Leland Harbor and the Schooner Inland Seas(thanks to Tom Kramer and WIAA) make an auditory appearances in the tune “Foamfollower.”

Another Northwestern Lower Michigan connection is the artwork of acclaimed local artist Glenn Wolff. Glenn created an original pen & ink and watercolor drawing entitled Summer Sands & Sleeping Bears for the cover of this CD. His unmistakable artistry is instantly recognizable in this work.
I have put together some packages to kick the pre-sale of the CD into gear.  I hope you will find one that will encourage you to get on board and contribute. A big incentive is the chance to get an original and exclusive limited edition giclée print of the cover art for Summer Sands & Sleeping Bears by celebrated and critically acclaimed Northern Michigan artist Glenn Wolff.  
There is also the chance for one lucky person to claim the original pen & ink and watercolor drawing “Summer Sands & Sleeping Bears” matted and framed from Glenn Wolff himself...very cool!!!
There you have it. My primary goal is to raise $1,000 through this campaign and have the CD in your hands by the end of June. If we can go beyond that goal,  funds raised will go towards a fancier packaging for the CD and towards the recording of the next CD. All those who contribute to this campaign at the "Sand Between the Toes" Package level and above will have their name included in the next CD project.
Please know that your support for this project and the first CD are greatly appreciated.
With wishes for glad tidings, cheer and plenty of summer sands,
-James Filkins

Working on the devotional
Hi. I'm Jaden. I'm almost 12. I've been on Christmas break from school and have been reading the Bible every morning. Two mornings in a row I felt like I needed to write a book for kids my age and told my mom. She prayed with me and helped me get started. 
As I was working on devotionals, I asked my mom if I could do more than just one book. She told me that if God called me to it, she would help me do it. I'm almost done with the first devotional that has 30 days of verses from Proverbs with stories, questions, and prayers for kids to walk through and learn how to apply what the Bible says to their life. 
I want to give this book to all the kids in my youth group at church. There are about 35 people. My mom figured out the cost to order those books, which is about $150. That's what I need help with from you. My Aunt Denise and one of my mom's friends already helped by sending some money, so all I need now is $110. 
This is from the back cover of the book:
I Love God: A Devotional for Tweens and Teens is written by Jaden Laster, a tween following God's call in his life. The stories and lessons have contributions from Simon Gabriel, Jaden's younger brother and companion in all the things!
The Bible is the mainstay for knowledge, but understanding real world application is tough. This devotional helps bridge the gap between God's word and the world. Many adults in Jaden's life have helped him through guiding conversations that provide a deeper connection with God and a desire to lead his life by faith. After a series of mornings spent reading in Proverbs, Jaden felt called to share his experiences in this must-have devotional for all kids living in an age of anger, greed, and distraction.
I posted this on my mom's Facebook and her friends said I should really do a Kickstarter campaign.
Hi. My Mom is letting me write this message. 
I want to do something this year for all the kids my age. I need some help from you. I'm writing a devotional series based on what I see happening in the world. I want to give it away to all the kids in my youth group. There are about 35 people in that group. That's around $150. Will you help me cover the cost?
My Mom says I should also think bigger than just my youth group, so if you have kids that are between 10 and 14, they might want one too. Can I send them a copy?
Here's an example of what I have so far.
"Come and listen to my counsel. I'll share my heart with you and make you wise." Proverbs 1:23, NLT
I had a friend that wanted to throw knives at the snow. I had a bad feeling inside of me that told me "No! Do not do this!" The feeling inside of me was like a stomach pain. I was sort of queasy. I told my friend I didn't want to do it and he did it anyway. I didn't want anyone to get hurt so I ran home. He hasn't wanted to be my friend since, but I pray for him anyway.
Read Proverbs 1:20-23
Have you ever had this uneasy feeling?
Did you listen to it or not?
Do you think that feeling is the Holy Spirit?
God, please help me follow the Holy Spirit so I can make good choices. Amen.
My first devotional will have 30 devotions and space for kids to write their answers. My mom says that if anyone wants to help me, to send her a message and she will give you information on how. I'll have this finished next week and the first books will be ready for delivery at the end of the month.
Thank you. Jaden

Hello space-farers and desert dwellers! 
This is my first Kickstarter project and I'm excited to share some Dune-inspired art with you.  Dune is one of my favorite book series of all time, and even though years can go by without rereading it, I still feel the concepts and imagery flowing through my mind.  "Riders on the Worm" was a joke shared by the first roommates I ever had after moving out west, but the first sticker I made based on it wasn't very satisfying.  Time to make new art and a better print job! 
Sticker design!
There were quite a few  sketches before getting the design exactly as I pictured it in my mind.  I usually work with ink, but I wanted the lines to be especially clean, so I used Procreate on the iPad.  I didn't use Illustrator because I wanted it to maintain a slightly more organic look.

Hey there!
My name is Francisque, I'm a 27 years old Travel Photographer from France who's focused on wilderness scenes. 
This year, I told myself I would go beyond borders, into the unknown of the wild places I have yet to discover. I had a lot of countries on my mind for my next big adventure but after watching "The Ivory Game" on Netflix I quickly turned my eyes to an issue that totally shattered my heart, poaching. 
Elephants are constantly killed : 96 a day, 672 a week, 2,688 a month, and 32,256 a year.
We estimate the global population to be around 300.000 elephants today, compared to an average of 4-5 Million in the 30's - 40's There's only an estimated 30.000 individuals in Kenya, intensively tracked and brutally murdered for as few as 3 dollars US.. If things don't change we might only be able to see an elephant in a history book.
Orphans elephants at the David Sheldrick Trust for Wildlife in Nairobi, Kenya captured by Michael Nichols
 I am currently pitching a huge trip in Kenya that involves anti-poaching campaigns, learning about wilderness conservation on location as well as meeting the people involved in this fight against wildlife terrorism, taking part in the de-snaring walk , and most of all, I'll try my hardest to capture the most beautiful and wildest scenes Kenya has to offer, I'll be making portraits of local tribes and villagers and learn more about the people living there, the animals and how we can all help to protect them. I will document all the wildlife efforts and not only touching elephants!
This isn't a small project and this will require a lot of professional gear and a cinematic camera to make a short film about this adventure to transpire as clearly as possible how I've seen this country and the experiences I had. As well as a little book about this journey, with exclusive images and personal stories limited to a small amount of copies. Now why and how could this contribute to the protection of these wild animals or be beneficial in any way? The more advertising of Kenya and its issues, the more people will be aware of it, tourism is one of the largest income when it comes to wildlife protection there. Also, I will use my social medias (Instagram ,YouTube, Wordpress) to broadcast how beautiful of a place Kenya is and how the wild animals have the perfect resources to thrive there. I will also talk about the important issues and how people can contribute to this cause. 
What the fund will be used for:
Professional recording equipment, camera with high frame rate for cinematic video footage. (Sony A6500, only one that has in-body image stabilization which would be required in the bush) 
Used Nikon Full-Frame body (D750 or similar, weather sealing needed)
One fast telephoto-lens used 
Backup External Hard Drives to secure all files
High Speed Memory Cards
Realization and printing/Shipping costs of the books and prints
I will also make sure to give a little something to every local from little villages and farms I meet along the way in exchange of their time for a photo or two.
A percentage of the money will be used to foster orphans Elephants, Rhinos and Girafes via The David Sheldrick Wildlife Trust in Nairobi, Kenya for a period of at least one year.
My goal isn't about profit, as a quick number add up will show that I won't make any, also I've included the 8-10% fee of Kickstarter as well as took into account bank fees to wire the money and also convert it to the currency needed for me to use in Kenya, if you know me only a little through social media and the content I post, you probably know that I'm used to live a nomadic lifestyle with little to no money at all. I do this kind of photography because transporting people through images and stories is the only thing that matters to me. It's my first time doing this, I've been thinking about it for months, if this project isn't funded I will sadly have to put it aside for now. Meaning I will not witness the wild beasts crossing happening once in a year in late June among other things let alone let this wild dream to experience and share this wild journey with you through Instagram and such. However if this gets funded more than I expected it to be I will donate to Wildlife trusts around Kenya.
Alright I feel like I talked a lot but you still don't really know much about me, if you'd like to checkout My Instagram that would maybe give you an idea on what I do. I'll be posting updates here as well once the project is funded. It probably doesn't mean much to you but I will be eternally thankful to anyone who have given something to contribute to this great adventure.
THANK YOU!  
Francisque  
www.francisquesanchez.com
(A broke travelling folk with a lust for life.)
Please help spread the word!

Hi, I’m Dany Krom, photographer storyteller and visual artist, with over 12 years of experience covering stories about people, social conflict, cultural diversity and the environmental crisis in South America. In 2011 I began a story in the Uyuni Salt Flats of Bolivia, about the salt workers and their harsh working conditions, due to the nature of this mysterious land.
The Uyuni Salt Flats is the largest salt desert in the world, and most recently has become known as the location of the largest lithium reserve of the world. Lithium, a cleaner energy source, has the potential of shifting the rate at which we are currently contaminating our earth with fossil fuel, by offering an environmentally greener option. A lithium extraction and industrialization plant was launched in this Salt Desert, as a response to the effects of global warming.
THE BOOK
The pictures taken during this initial journey where published in National Geographic’s highly coveted website (Picture of the Day, Editors' Spotlight and Daily Dozen Dec 6 2013), obtaining several distinguished mentions, and attracting the interest and acknowledgment of hundreds of viewers. This inspired me to go back to Uyuni in early 2015 to continue the story. During this second phase of the journey I saw important progress within the lithium plant, and the effects this progress was having within the small communities that reside and work in this area.
Upon finishing this 2nd phase of the story, I had the privilege of showing the results to a great mentor and friend, the Magnum and National Geographic Photographer David Alan Harvey; who confirmed that the story could be of interest to National Geographic Magazine, but that I still had more work to do, and I needed to go back... this time for a longer period of time, to deepen the story, and really offer Nat Geo’s readers a window into the life of the people who live in this mysterious land, and the effect’s the Lithium expansion was having in their day to day lives.
Photo: DKTLP-003
So, here is where Kickstarter comes in. In order to finish the Lithium Planet story, and share the story of this cleaner energy source in the media giant that is National Geographic, I need to raise the necessary funds to complete the expedition.
As a gift to my backers, I will share the adventure with you, by: 
Creating a photo book of the expedition, containing interactive tips, maps, resources, logistic and travel advice as well as stories and photography anecdotes of the expedition. 
 Offer printed and signed photographs of the project in different sizes and print qualities 
Give you access to our interactive blog, where I will post videos and pictures so you can participate in the journey as it is happening.
For those of you interested in photography, stories, exploration and adventure, I have 2 highly coveted spots open for 2 backers to join the team on the journey during the first 2 weeks of this 2 month expedition. 
I am also offering a Meet and Greet the Photographer event in New York, to share about the experience, story and KickStarter campaign, for those interested in learning more about this type of photography projects. 
The details of all the perks, are described in the rewards section to the right. 
DKTLP-001
I am very close to reaching my dream of publishing in one of the most interesting and important magazines of the world. I invite you to support this project and become a part of this expedition. My hope is that through the photo book and interactive blog, you will enjoy the journey and be inspired to create your own Lithium Planet adventure.
The funds of the Kickstarter campaign will be used to: 
Fund the expedition from New York to Uyuni- Bolivia: Covering logistical and transportation expenses, including a driver, guide and lighting assistant for the duration of the journey. We will be staying within the small communities, in hotels when available, and outdoors when not. We will need camping equipment for extreme weather and well as supplies, food and cold weather gear. We will also need to purchase some special equipment in order to capture the unique places in the area, such as dark caves, ancient cemeteries (chullpas) within a cave, etc.
Editing and Printing the photo book, prints and postcards offered as rewards to our Backers: The pledges will go towards editing the photos, designing and printing expenses; as well as any additional expenses in fulfilling the rewards

Herpetological Exploration and Research Team (H.E.A.R.T.)
A male and a female golden toad, showing sexual dimorphic coloration.
 The Project: The Golden Toad, was a unique Costa Rican amphibian that was thoroughly studied from 1964 – 1988. In 1989 it’s population suddenly dropped, and by 1990 it was feared extinct. While it was never clear exactly what caused its obvious decline, the Golden Toad and it’s story became the poster child for Amphibian Declines world-wide and modern extinction in general. We feel that while the case of the Golden Toad has received a huge amount of attention, there was never a coordinated attempt to rediscover it within its original range, or to search for other localities nearby where it may have fared better than within its known range. Neotropical reptiles and amphibians can be notoriously difficult to locate, and when they inhabit montane habitats they tend to have disjunct and scattered ranges. Our goal with this project is to check the historical localities of this toad during its active breeding season, as well as look for it in new potential localities which we have already assessed via google earth. If we are able to rediscover this species, it will help to raise awareness about the demise of amphibians around the world, but also to call attention to the fact that for many species which would appear to be extinct, their remains a glimmer of hope. This is a search and recover mission, to check every possible Golden Toad habitat still intact in the Tilarán Mountains and to determine whether our suspicions are correct, and that the toad is still hopping around in the cloud forests in the spring. WE ARE NOT LOOKING TO COLLECT THIS TOAD, ONLY TO VERIFY ITS CONTINUED EXISTENCE AND PROVE IT WITH PHOTOGRAPHS AND OBSERVATION DATA. We will not be collecting any specimen on this expedition, only cataloging with photographs, video & audio.  
The infamous male Golden Toad, in all its splendor.
 The Toad: The Golden Toad, Incilius periglenes, is a small Costa Rican amphibian first discovered by scientists in 1964 in a stunted montane cloud forest huddling the continental divide. Immediately upon discovery, the scientists knew they had found something special. The one and half to two inch toad showed remarkable difference between males and females. While females possessed a blackish or greenish ground color with red and white spots, the males were unicolor bright traffic cone orange. The golden toad exhibited an explosive breeding behavior, which took place when the weather in Costa Rica changed from the winter "dry season" to the summer "rainy season". The toads would only breed right after the first couple thunderstorms had fallen, but before the forest became saturated. These breeding periods rarely lasted more than four or five days, & afterward the toads would disappear for the rest of the year.  The toad's unique appearance, coupled with its extremely unique breeding habits, made it a favorite study subject for scientists working with Costa Rican amphibians, yet very little is know about these toads outside of their brief appearance to bread.
When the Golden Toads were extent, they formed large breeding aggregations where many males would try to breed one female.
Golden Toad Habitat, Monteverde Reserve, Costa Rica.
 The Story: In 1987 researchers working with the Golden Toad, as well as different amphibian species around the world, started noticing a drop in populations. The drop of the toads in Monteverde was especially alarming, because the habitat was intact and appeared to have no negative human influences. However, the drop in these toad's population was one of the most extreme, to the degree that approximately 1500 were seen in 1987, however only 10 were seen in 1988, one in 1989 and from then on no others were verified. Since the early 1990s, undoubtedly no scientist has seen this frog in the wild. It was officially declared extinct in 2004, after more than 15 years of not having been seen anywhere. Due to its unique appearance, habits and rapid extinction, the Golden Toad quickly rose to be the poster child of amphibian declines worldwide, and also to raise awareness about extinction in general. 
Stunted Cloud Forest along the Continental Ridge with heavy epiphyte growth.
The Plan: With recent rediscoveries of various animals previously thought to be extinct, we have decided to organize a coordinated effort to rediscover the Golden Toad, in Costa Rica, in 2014. We plan on taking with us four neotropical herpetologists, from the USA and México, and sample at least five different sites during 5 weeks of the breeding period of the Golden Toad, which starts in late March and runs into early May. The sites to be sampled will include two of the historic Golden Toad localities, where they were common before their purported extinction, as well as over a half a dozen potential sites. The potential sites we have chosen share similar conditions as far as habitat, vegetation, elevation and rainfall go, which are the main indicators for where a species can or can not occur. Our goal is to check each site at least once every three days, in order to not miss even the shortest breeding episode should it occur during the time we are there. When there is rainfall & events necessary for breeding to occur, we will focus on the “historic sites”, afterwards we will scour the “potential sites” for eggs and tadpoles, which would be evidence of on-going breeding which we may have missed.
Map of Monteverde Reserve. Red stars are original toad localities, Orange triangles are localities we suspect will have toads, based on elevation, rainfall and habitat.
The Team: Our team has spent the last twelve years actively searching out new species or populations of species of tropical reptiles and amphibians throughout Mexico. We have also worked on rediscovering several populations or species which have thought to be extinct. Among these we have specifically worked with venomous snakes and explosive breeding amphibians. We have been lucky enough to rediscover the Manantlán Long-tailed Rattlesnake in 2008, which had been considered extinct since 1966. We also rediscovered populations of the Sheep Frog in Sonora in 2002, the Montane Burrowing Treefrog in Jalisco in 2007, and the Rowley's Palm Pitviper in the Selva Negra region of Chiapas in 2013. We have discovered approximately seven new species of frog of the genus Syrrhophus, scattered throughout Michoacán, Jalisco, Colima and Guerrero, as well as at least one new species of rattlesnake in the states of Guerrero, Morelos, Michoacán and México. Furthermore we have added more than 30 species to the known herpetofauna of Colima, and published another 50 or so new range extensions or state records for around México.

Where Your Donations Are Going: What we are planning to raise is the money needed for the airfare costs for our team to go to Costa Rica, as well as auto rental costs for a 4x4 truck and gas and transportation costs. Our equipment cost, food, stay and time we will cover ourselves, as we have done with other projects that we have funded. Our progress and preparation for the trip will be posted weekly on a Facebook Group for our participants and funders to follow along on. Our results and successes will be posted on our own Save the Golden Toad project website, to be launched before the trip and to be thoroughly updated throughout the trip. Of course if we are able to over fund this project we will be able to cover more expenses and have more field hands, which can increase the chances of success.

Hey everyone,
GunFight! is hard at work on the follow up to 2010's Frontier Land, AND IT'S GOING GREAT. We are working with the oh-so-talented producer and engineer Jeff Berner (galuminumfoil.com), AND we're hoping--for the first time ever--to press this new record to SMOOTH, DELICIOUS VINYL!
Oh... but, uh... we're outta money. (Oops.)
FEAR NOT, for we have a saying over here at Camp GunFight!: "When life sweeps the leg, counter with an illegal crane-kick to the face." It means, "ask your friends for money" (like the mysterious, handsy old man next-door told you to).
Real talk: if you've reached this Kickstarter page, it's likely because you have seen us live, heard our music online or own our first album. Maybe you've gotten sweaty with us at a loft show, or broken the "NO DANCING" rule at your regular watering hole. Maybe you witnessed Tony playing bass in his underwear or even hopped on stage to join us for a drunken encore. In any case, your good times are the greatest gift we could ever ask for. But we do need to ask one more favor of you to keep the good times rolling. We kindly ask that you support us with a donation toward our new record.
Not only will your generosity keep the GunFight! legend alive, but you'll also be rewarded with one (or more!) of the gifts listed on the right-hand side of this page. They range from a digital copy of the new album, to the vinyl version, to a fancy dinner with the band and mucho more. It's totally worth it, man!
Most importantly, we'd like to thank you for the years of love and support, both in spirit and in wallet. We treasure you. (We really, really do!)
--GunFight!

Death Bay is an Anthology film based on North Bay, Ontario Canada.  The film will be made of four (4) short films directed by different directors.  Each film will be based on different elements of North Bay.
The breakdown of the films, what they are based on and directed by who will be:
 The Shack - After years of going ice fishing on the last weekend of February, Hank sticks to his tradition, even if it kills him.  Directed by Darren D. MacDonald  (Director of  
 The Itch - After not heeding to the caution of others, Chad finds himself in water that gives him the itch... on the inside. Directed by Kiefer Friday  (Director of short film 
 The Shad-fly - Shad-flies have a life span of 2 days, these shad-flies, mutated by pollution, make every death count...This film does not yet have a director as of yet.  If we do not find a director interested in the production Darren, Kiefer and Renee (Directors of the other films) will collaboratively direct and create this short.
 The Monster at the End of Trout Lake - After hearing of the legend of the Trout Lake Monster, Flora brings her travelling Myths and Legends Vlog to North Bay.  Is this one myth she can't bust?  Directed by Renée Cleroux (Director of  
Why I Care About The Project
One of the main reasons why I started the project was because of the green message that is present in all of the short films.  The concept of these is at a surface level about elements of North Bay and the surrounding area, but it can’t just be that.  There needs to be a message and a core belief in the shorts.
With all of the nature present around  North Bay, it’s a message that makes sense with the surface idea.  This is the message of each film:
The Shack is a film about environmental climate change and how it can impact people, specifically Ice Fishers.
The Itch is about respecting the seasons and about respecting the environment.
The Shad-fly is a cautionary tale about pollution.
The Monster At The End Of Trout Lake is about respecting animals and the boundaries of nature.
How we Plan to Make it Happen
With your help and a group of like-minded artists, we will make this project possible. While I will be overseeing the whole operation, I will be giving the directors of the shorts the free range to make the film that they want to make, while making sure that it fits within the mood and the theme of the overall project.
We will do this by having regular contact between the directors of the project and myself.  To make sure that we don’t bite off more than we can chew we will be tackling one film at a time.  With the nature of the films taking on a different season each, it also makes sense to do this.
With one film being a lot of work on its own, this makes sure that there will never be too much going on at one time.  This will allow artists directing other films to help out on films that they aren’t directing, creating a community with a singular goal of completing the project.
The Impact
The project will solely be funded by crowdfunding, so the contribution that we gather will be vital for the production of the shorts.  It will be thanks to our contributors that will make everything we make in this project possible.  
Other Ways You Can Help
If you cannot contribute in a form of contributing, we are always open to collaborating!
Can you do Special Effects?
Do you live near us and want to help with the production?
Do you paint and want to make posters?
Do you know other languages (other than English) and can make other language subtitles?
And much more.
Then contact us at LightsInTheSkyProductions@gmail.com and let us know how you can help.  Even if you think whatever you have to offer is stupid, contact us, because it might just be the thing that we are looking for.
Thank you for your time, and I hope you consider helping out make The Death Bay a possibility.

After injuring myself in a hiking accident, I cannot skate nearly as much as I would like, nor how I'd like with enduring a serious amount of pain. I therefore decided to use my fine art skills on my own brand of skateboard decks, which I dubbed grafsk8. 
Spray paint has always been an important medium to my fine art gallery works, and I decided to apply it to a skateboard. When I was complete, I loved it. All I could think of was doing it again; creating another deck. I then started thinking about the cookie-cutter decks out there today, and especially the price people pay for them. 
After running numbers, with a start-up I can easily produce customized, hand-painted decks for cheaper than the larger companies. My overhead is in blank decks and paint--I am confident that in a first order of twenty blank decks, and the paint--my cost would be roughly $12 a deck. 
In the market at $25 a deck, I can undercut competitors with hand painted originals, rather than assembly line graphics, by quite a bit, and still retain a decent profit margin.
The business model remains sound, unless the demand outstrips the supply--in which case, there is already a plan in motion. There are two other artists I have on standby to help me create new decks and deck concepts--no two will ever be the same. 
The money now is specifically to place an order for blank skateboard decks, stencil paper, paint, and polyurethane to create a stock based on the template board I have gotten such great feedback about.

I am filming a documentary about P.J. Jacobs High School, and I want you to be the first to see it! 
I’m Terry Kawles, and I’ve been a professional musician both in Stevens Point and New York before becoming an entertainment attorney.
I’m also a graduate of P.J. Jacobs High School, and I’m excited to tell you about the story behind it; it’s history; how it came to be; the people behind it; and the students and teachers who were there.
Even though I’ve been part of over 200 video productions and know how to produce video content economically, it still costs money to travel to tell these stories, and the rights fees for historical footage of the WPA and the Great Depression can get “pricey.”  
So if you want to help me make this documentary, all I’m asking you for is $5; about the price of a large breakfast coffee.
Backer Reward Levels
For as little as $5, all backers will be able to see a preview the finished documentary online before its official premiere. Plus, all backers get their names in the credits! 
$5 Reward
If you want to help at an even higher level, there are even cooler rewards! 
For $10, you'll get exclusive live or online access to a Q&A following the documentary’s premiere. 
$10 Reward
For $20, you’ll also get a 12”x17” copy of the movie poster**, or a 12”x17” copy of this lovely 1930s rendered drawing of the architect’s design; *** either one. Both are suitable for framing, and I'll autograph it too! 
(**This documentary does not yet have the actual title. "PJ Jacobs Working Title" is NOT what the documentary will be called. It's just that-a working title; a placeholder to show where the final title will be.) 
Movie Poster
 OR
Architect's Sketch
For $30, you can receive the documentary on BluRay disk, which will also contain special BONUS FEATURES, such as behind the scenes and extra footage, and extra documents and photos. 
Blu-Ray with Bonus Features
I also have several limited offers, including: 
Associate Producer credits ($85)—you get to see a rough cut and provide feedback, and get your name on the movie poster; and 
Associate Producer Credit
Executive Producer credits ($150)—you get to see a rough and provide feedback via an EXCLUSIVE 45-minute videoconference, and your name listed prominently on the movie poster! 
Executive Producer Credit
Finally, I’d like to let you know that every backer will receive project updates by email. 
***Don't worry: I'll send out an email once the Kickstarter campaign concludes so you can indicate your choice of poster or drawing. 
Thank you so much! 
I'm really excited to tell this story, and it's been incredible to know how many of you are already shown your excitement for it on both the “You Know You’re From Stevens Point If . . .” and “P.J.Jacobs HS Documentary” Facebook pages. Thank you so much for your support! 
If You Have a Story, Photo, or Video
And if you have a great P.J.Jacobs story, or have a photo or even a video that you think should be in the film, e-mail me at PJJacobsMovie@gmail.com

Twenty-eight years after its founding during the height of the AIDS crisis, MIX continues to galvanize, promote and distribute the work of queer culture-makers, with a goal of providing high-quality queer programming that is not only immersive, innovative and experiential, but that also builds a sustainable queer community that is reflective and participatory. MIX fosters a highly-engaged, politicized, and enthusiastic audience that is hungry for imagery and programming that directly speaks to, highlights, addresses, challenges and inspires the community to see and think in new ways about issues such as AIDS, censorship and representation, safe sex, drugs, dating, coming out, violence, homophobia, racism, family, and non/assimilation. 
COMMITMENT TO MAKERS
When given the chance, MIX provides audiences with access to emerging and established artists whose work focuses on radical and alternative notions of gender and sexuality, while also uprooting traditional categories of form and content. As an organization, MIX is a laboratory and incubator created to explore work that has never been seen before, or that has been rarely presented. MIX has also provided considerable support for emerging makers. Jonathan Caouette submitted his unfinished film Tarnation to MIX in 2003. Then co-director Stephen Winter identified the film's potential, and shepherded it to completion, bringing on Gus Van Sant as an executive producer, and another editor. The film premiered at MIX and then went on to Cannes and the New York Film Festival and subsequently worldwide distribution. 
COMMUNITY SUPPORT

MIX would not exist without the support of our community, through volunteering their time and energy and attending the festival in record breaking numbers every year. The past two (almost three) decades prove that there is a need for a platform for work that represents and resonates with our audiences.
Given the challenging nature of the work presented at MIX and the strong integrity behind its curatorial process, the corporate sponsorships that fund most film festivals are not readily available to us, so we are asking for your individual support. While we have an amazingly dedicated team of volunteers and staff, it costs a good deal of money to put on the festival and your financial gift will allow us to deliver the 28th installment of the MIX NYC - NY Queer Experimental Film Festival (#MIXNYC2015).
(estimates)
Every dollar pledged will make a difference as we will lose it all if even a dollar short of our goal. The MIX NYC team have worked hard to curate a selection of fantastic rewards from committed artists and individuals in the MIX NYC community.
HANDSOME REWARDS
Pledgers will receive many handsome rewards in return for their support. We have sourced unique memorabilia, archives of the festival's programming, tools to create and inspire, and an impressive array of offerings from legends such as John Cameron Mitchell and Barbara Hammer to thrilling new designs from fresh young designers such as the bold and revolutionary king of showmanship, BCalla, and our very own creative visionary Diego Montoya.

$1000 - MIX Influencer
Become a year-round MIX INFLUENCER: don a custom onesie and join a group of like-minded leadership donors that help strengthen MIX NYC and support our year-round efforts by getting involved in steering the festival. Twice a year you’ll be invited to special brainstorming get-togethers with drinks and food, as well as preview screenings, festival press, networking events, and other core activity. Your donation will not only make a huge contribution to the success of this year’s festival, but allow you a front row seat to the future of MIX NYC.
SOCIAL MEDIA AND LIFE BEYOND THE KICKSTARTER
How you can help if you are flat broke and/or spend too much time in the techno-world:
As much as we'd love you to, you don't need to dig into your bank account to support MIX NYC.
Here are 3 Totally Free Ways to Help MIX NYC in lieu of or in addition to making a financial gift:
1. Help the campaign to reach more people by declaring yourself a MIX LOVER and sharing this page on Facebook, Twitter, YouTube, Instagram, or any platform of your choice (#MIXNYC2015). 
Include your favorite MIX PIC from the MIX HIVE last year for maximum engagement: Patrick Arias: Full Album and Tinker Coalescing:  Part One, Part Two, Full Collection.
2. The MIX team are building RIGHT NOW. If you have any free time between now and end of November, then please consider signing up for a VOLUNTEER shift using this form: http://bit.ly/volunteerformix This is also one of the best ways to get to know the rest of the awesome MIX NYC community and meet new friends and lovers.
3. Be BOLD about your love for MIX NYC in all corners of your life. Tell your Tinder date, your parents, your grandmother, and your boss. (We love company matches!) 
We look forward to seeing you at the festival in November.

He, for some uncanny reason, is able to communicate with us telepathically. This bodes well, as we don't speak, much less type. Typical HCTM sounds include grunts, howls, and the occasional dusty fart (whooosh).
HCTM is now putting the polishing touches on CRYPTIC  our sixth studio album. It's all happening at the Crypt™, our kick-ass secret lair/ studio. It is coming out seriously badass (like those dusty farts) and the *new songs are some of our most infectious to date.
Here's the rub, y'all: (Dr. Dumblucke, you better translate your lab-coat-covered ass off here!) The cost associated with producing and promoting CRYPTIC with an eye towards getting radio play is simply mind-bottling. Even for this very successful, efficient, independent band, a large-scale, coordinated marketing blitz, including hiring a reputable PR firm, has been out of reach. 
So, we hope you accept this sexy-ass mission: Take HCTM to the next tier (trail of tiers?). Push CRYPTIC off the jaunty edge… of the lip… of the fringe… of the precipice into the wild blue. Just ask our rabid fans, HCTM is poised to take off! We will reward you handsomely for your efforts, baby. RRRRrrrrrgh!
Smooches,

He came to the stage in a time when women in Kabul wore mini-skirts, foreigners flocked to Afghanistan on the “hippie trail,” and progressive change swept the country. Ahmad Zahir rocketed to stardom in the 60s and 70s, his voice capturing the soul of an entire generation. No other icon in Afghan history can allow us to more deeply explore a country that could have been, and unravel what such a progressive legacy means for the world today.
Despite being a household name for tens of millions of Afghans across the globe, and an inspiration to many others, to this day, there has never been a film about Ahmad Zahir... until now. 
This Kickstarter campaign is to support the production of the first-ever film about Ahmad Zahir. Executive produced by his daughter Shabnam, and directed by Oscar-nominated Sam French, the film will explore this icon of Afghan culture in an intimate yet universal way.
Join us and become an essential part of making the first film about Ahmad Zahir!
او درزمانی به صحنه آمد که زنان در کابل دامن کوتاه میپوشید و خارجی های زیادی که از دسته هیپی به افغانستان سفر داشتن به که این اتفاقات کشور افغانستان را به سوی ترقی و تغییر سوق میداد
احمد ظاهر در دهه ۶۰ و ۷۰ آغاز به خواندن نمود و با صدایش گیرایش روح تمام هم نسلانش را تسخیر میکرد
با اینکه در هر خانواده افغان حداقل یکی از فرزند ها به افتخار به نام او نامگذاری میشود با همین حال تا بحال هیچ فلیمی درباره اش ساخته نشده
به همین دلیل ما کمپاین کیکستارتر را برای حمایت از تولید اولین فلیم درباره احمد ظاهر براه انداخته ای ایده تولید این فیلم توسط دختر اش شبنم طرح شده وقرار است با کارگردانی سم فرانسوی تولید شده تا به شیوه ای ماهرانه و جهانی به تصویر شود.پش باما بپوندید و بخش اساسی در ساختن اولین فیلم در مورد این استوره باشید
WHO IS AHMAD ZAHIR? 
احمد ظاهر کیست؟
Ahmad Zahir is born into privilege, the son of Afghanistan's Prime Minister under King Zahir Shah. This makes it highly unlikely and controversial that he would pursue a musical career. But from an early age, he is obsessed with music, and starts collecting records from all over the world.
Ahmad Zahir goes on to study under famous Afghan folk musicians, and he also travels widely, becoming exposed to the burgeoning musical revolution of the 60s in America, Europe and India. These varied musical influences, along with his love of Afghanistan's most notable poet, Rumi as well as ancient Persian poetry, lead him to forge an entirely new musical style, synthesizing Western rock with traditional Afghan music.
Sporting Elvis-like sideburns, his flamboyant, loud style and poetic lyrics create an atmosphere of intense enthusiasm during his live shows. No one had ever seen anything like Ahmad Zahir before. In the late 60s, recordings of his shows are being passed around on tapes from person to person, played in living rooms across the country. Ahmad Zahir takes the country by storm.
احمد ظاهر در خانواده نخست وزیر سلطنت ظاهر شاه به دنیا آمد که به همین دلیل علاقه اوبه موسیقی یک امر خیلی نامطلوب و بحث برانگیز بوداما با وجود این او از همان اوایل به موسیقی علاقه مندبود و به جمع آوری نوار های ضبط شده موسیقی از سراسر جهان آغاز نمود
احمد ظاهر به تحصیل رشته موسیقی اصیل افغانی پرداخته و بعدا به طور گسترده به سفرکردن به دور جهان روی میاورد مه این سفر ها در دوره رشد موسیقی ۶۰ ساله در آمریکا، اروپا و هند بوده مه تاثیران موسیقی متنوع همراه با عشق اش به شاعران برجسته افغانستان ، رومی و اشعار باستانی زبان فارسی باعث شد که او به ایجاد یک سبک موسیقی کاملا جدید موسیقی غربی و سنتی افغانستان دست بزند
حرکات زیبا، سبک بلند و اشعار زیبا در جریان اجرای زنده فضای با شور و شوقی ره ایجاد میکرد طوریکه تا آن زمان اجرایی به اون زیبایی نادر بود. دراواخر دهه ۶۰ نوار های ضبط شده از اجرای زنده او از شخصی به شخصی منتقل شده و در هر خانه به نمایش گذاشته میشد و طوفان به پا می کرد
By the early 70s, he has become a household name, singing live shows on the radio and recording his first studio album “Dilak Am” in 1973. But the world is changing, and events are about to thrust Afghanistan into political upheaval, forever altering the course of its future.
In 1973, mere months after Ahmad Zahir’s father resigns as Prime Minister, Daoud Khan overthrows the current government and installs himself as President of the newly formed Democratic Republic of Afghanistan. Ahmad Zahir initially supports this new government, which attempts to lessen the country’s reliance on the Soviet Union and build up Afghanistan’s military forces. But as he begins to see promises unfulfilled, he starts to speak out through his lyrics, agitating for social reform. In his song “Ajab Sabri Khoda Darad” (1976) Zahir sings:
If I were God… when seeing one shivering and naked and another clothed in a hundred colors, I would tear up the earth and sky.
All the while, Communist sympathies are on the rise, and in 1978, Daoud Khan is overthrown in a bloody coup backed by the Soviets, who install a puppet government. Ahmad Zahir refuses to recognize the government’s legitimacy, and his lyrics become even more political. In one of the last songs he recorded, “Man Nagoyam,” he sings of a bird trapped inside a cage: 
Liberate me, liberate me, liberate me. Oh, how the thought of homelessness haunts me. Please save my home.
His voice captures the spirit of the resistance. As a result, the Soviets blacklist his music. Then, on June 14, 1979, he is suddenly killed in a car crash near the Salang Pass. His only daughter Shabnam was also born this day. While a car accident is the “official” line, most Afghans believe he was shot in the head, murdered by the communist regime. 
What really happened in that remote mountain pass remains a mystery to this day.
Upon learning of his death, schools across the country close, and men and women in the thousands pour onto the streets to follow his coffin. An era has ended. 
در اوایل دهه ۷۰ بخش زنده از طریق امواج رادیو نشر میکرد و همچنان اولین آلبوم اش به نام دلکم را ضبط کرد
در همین جریان جهان درحال تغییر وحوادثی در حال رخ دادن بودکه باعث تحولات شدید سیاسی در اففانستان درحال رخ دادن بود. در سال ۱۹۷۳ تنها چند ماه پس از آنکه پدر احمد ظاهر از سمت اش به عنوان نخست وزیر استعفا داد، داوود خان دولت فعلی آن زمان را سرنگون کرده و خود را به عنوان رئیس جمهور جدید دولت جمهوری دمکرات افغانستان اعلان کرد
احمد ظاهر در اوایل از دولت جدید حمایت میکرد و به این عقیده بود که دولت جدید در تلاش است تا وابستگی افغانستان را به اتحاد جماهیر شوروی را کاهش بدهد و درکنار آن میکوشد تا نیروی نظامی افغانستان را تقویت کند اما با گذشت زمان ناکاری این دولت آشکار شد طوری که بشتر شعار ها فقط به عنوان شعار باقی میماندند و عملی نمی شدند این اوضاع باعث شد تا احمد ظاهر بر علیه دولت وقت سخن میگفت و از هنر بر علیه این دولت استفاده مکرد. او آهنگی به نام عجب صبری خدا دارد را به رابطه اوضاع دولت آن زمان سرود ۱۹۷۶
اگر من جاي او بودم
كه ميديدم يكي عريان و لرزان، ديگري پوشيده از صد جامه رنگين
زمين و آسمان را
واژگون ، مستانه ميكردم
در عین حال در سال 1978، داوود خان در یک کودتای خونین تحت حمایت اتحادیه جماهیر شوروی ، سرنگون شد. احمد ظاهر از پذیرش مشروعیت حکومت خودداری می کرد و اشعار وی سیاسی ترقبل می شد
او در یکی از آخرین آهنگ های که ضبط کرده است (من نگویم)، درباره یک پرنده‌ای که درون قفس را به دام افتاده است میخواند
من نگویم که مرا از قفس آزاد کنید
  قفسم برده به باغی و دلم شاد کنید
در صدای او روح مقاومت موج میزد که در نتیجه شوروی سابق موسیقی او را در لیست سیاه قرار داد.و سپس، در 14 جون ۱۹۷۹، او به طور ناگهانی در یک تصادف موتر در نزدیکی کوتل سالنگکشته شد
تنها دختر اش شبنم نیزدر این روز به دنیا آمد
این حادثه فقط به عنوان "کاغذ اداره رسمی" ثبت است، در صورتی که اکثر افغان ها معتقدند که او توسط رژیم کمونیست به قتل رسیده است
آنچه واقعا در این کوتل کوهستانی دور افتاده اتفاق افتاده است، تا امروز مثل یک راز ناگشوده است
پس از باخبر شدن ازمرگ او مکاتب در سراسر کشور تعطیل شده و هزازان زن و مرد برای مراسم خاکسپاری او به خیابان ها ریختن
Ahmad Zahir’s death presages events to come. As the Soviets cement their hold on the country, the US-backed Mujahedeen forces take up arms and mount an insurgency. Afghanistan becomes a hot front in an otherwise Cold War. The Soviet government is overthrown in the mid-80s, sparking a civil war which is eventually won by the Taliban, who install a severely conservative religious government. 
The Taliban outlaw music and free expression. As a symbol of the new rules under their regime, they publicly burn Ahmad Zahir’s tapes and desecrate his grave. 
In 2001, after the events of 9/11, a US-backed coalition overthrows the Taliban, plunging the country into ever more conflict, which continues to this day. 
But through it all, Ahmad Zahir’s voice lives on in the hearts and minds of the Afghan people. His music is still played throughout the country, and is the one common thread that connects all Afghans in the diaspora all across the world who have fled their home over the decades. And he has inspires a new generation of musicians and activists to dream of a better future. His legacy truly lives on. 
Ahmad Zahir’s voice will lead the way...

.پس از مرگ احمد ظاهر نیروهای مجاهدین تحت حمایت ایالات متحده آمریکا موفق تلاش میکرد تا قوای شوروی سابق را از افغانستان بیرون کنند که این اتفاق اوضاع این کشور را بدتر نمود وافغانستان به یک جنگ سرد دیگربین قدرت‌های آن زمان تبدیل شد. حکومت شوروی در اواسط دهه 80 سرنگون شد و جنگ داخلی دراین کشور بین مجاهدین و طالبان آغاز شد و درنتیجه کشور به دست طالبان در آمد وطالبان که حکومتی بسیارتند رو و مذهبی بود موسیقی را در کشور ممنوع اعلان نموده و نوارهای ضبط شده از آواز احمد ظاهر را در ملا عام به آتش کشیدن و قبر اش را تخریب کردند
در سال ۲۰۰۱، پس از حادثه ۱۱ سپتامبر، یک ائتلاف تحت حمایت ایالات متحده برای از بین بردن حکومت طالبان تشکیل شده تا این حکومت را سرنگون کند، اما این تلاش تا به امروز ادامه دارد و این کشور هنوز با مشکل حضور طالبان به شدت درگی است اما با این حال ، صدای احمد ظاهر در قلب و ذهن مردم افغانستان زنده است. موسیقی او هنوز در سراسر کشور پخش می شده و یکی از موضوعات مشترک بین تمام افغان های که در سراسر جهان از دهه های گذشته مهاجر اند، متصل می کند. و او الهام بخش نسل جدیدی از نوازندگان و فعالان که در رویای آینده ای بهتر است میباشد. میراث او واقعا زنده است.
