  WHY MAKE A FILM ?
چرااین فیلم را می سازید؟
AHMAD ZAHIR is a film that tells the story of an Afghan musical legend whose life symbolizes an Afghanistan that no longer exists but remains present in the hearts of its people. 
AHMAD ZAHIR is not strictly a music documentary. We approach Ahmad Zahir’s life as a way into this turbulent period of Afghanistan’s history. Our film paints a picture of a country that could have been, and the timeless power of one man’s legacy to unite an entire people. We explore the 60s and 70s through his eyes, and through the eyes of the people he inspired with his music. 
احمد ظاهر یک فیلم است که داستان افسانه ای خواننده افغان را به تصویر می کشد که زندگی اش نماد یک افغانستان است بااینکه او دیگر بین ما نیست اما همیشه در قلب مردم حضور خواهد داشت
فیلم احمد ظاهر فقط یک مستند در باره یک خواننده نیست. بلکه ما از زندگی احمدظاهر به عنوان راهی برای این دوره آشفته تاریخ افغانستان استفاده میکنیم. فیلم ما تصویری از یک کشور است و قدرت بی انتهای میراث یک مرد برای متحد کردن تمام مردم را به نمایش می کشد. ما میخواهیم دهه ۶۰ و ۷۰ را از طریق چشمان اوکه از طریق موسیقی اش مردم را الهام میبخشید، کشف کنیم 
By using a wealth of archival footage – much of which has never been seen before – we paint a vivid picture of Afghanistan in the 1970s: a time of prosperity, freedom and hope that lives on in the dreams of those who experienced it, both the Afghans who grew up during that time and the foreigners who visited on the hippie trail.
با استفاده از مجموعه ای از فیلم های بایگانی - که بیشتر آنها هرگز قبل ازاین دیده نشده است - ما یک تصویر واضح از افغانستان در دهه ۱۹۷۰ را زسامی می کنیم: زمان رونق، آزادی و امید که در رویاهایی آنانی که این حس زیبا را تجربه کرده اند،هردو چه افغانهایی که در آن زمان بزرگ شده بودند و خارجیانی که به شکل هیپی به افغانستان سفر داشتند.
Ahmad Zahir’s story allows us to unravel and explore a new version of Afghanistan’s history, one rarely, if ever, explored outside of the Afghan context. Yet it is relevant to all of us, and shares unnerving similarities with the current political landscape in the United States. How does one musician’s legacy continue, and what does it say about the present and future of this nation, but also of the world we live in?
Despite his popularity and influence across the globe, there has never before been a feature documentary film made about Ahmad Zahir. 
Millions of Afghans are waiting for this. Today, there are entire radio stations in Kabul devoted to playing only Ahmad Zahir’s music, and his songs are not just played in Afghanistan, but by all Afghans living around the world. Ahmad Zahir is loved by all tribes and classes of Afghans and Tajiks. During a time when Uzbeks and Hazaras dealt with constant racism, Ahmad Zahir broke barriers by connecting with those audiences without prejudice. He is the thread that has tied the country together throughout the past 40 years of war, and is one of the only surviving symbols of an Afghanistan that once was.
With that thread, we weave the story of a unique time in Afghanistan’s history, and of a people still striving to chart their own destiny. Ahmad Zahir, in essence, is a unique beacon of hope for not only Afghanistan, but for all of us trying to survive in a troubled world.
داستان احمد ظاهر به ما این اجازه را می دهد تا نسخه جدیدی از تاریخ افغانستان را کشف کنیم، چیزی که به ندرت، تا کنون، خارجی درمورد افغانستان مورد میدانند درست وضعیتی که به شدت شباهت وضعیت فعلی سیاست‌های آمریکا است
.هم چنان علی رغم محبوبیت و نفوذش در سراسر جهان، هیچوقت فیلم مستند دیگری درباره احمد ظاهر ساخته نشده است
درحال حاضرمیلیون ها افغان در انتظار آن هستند . امروزه کل استشن های رادیویی در کابل وجود دارد که تنها به پخش موسیقی احمد ظاهر اختصاص دارد و آهنگ های او فقط در افغانستان پخش نمی شود، بلکه توسط تمام افغان هایی که در سراسر جهان زندگی می‌کنند شنیده میشود. احمد ظاهر از همه قبایل و طبقات افغانها علاقه مندانی دارد و تنها مربوط به یک قشر یا قوم نمیشود .احمد ظاهر در زمانی که ازبک ها و هزاره ها با تعصبات بین اقوام مواجه بودند، با آنها توسط موسیقی‌اش ارتباط برقرار میکرد و تعصب و موانع دراین بخش را از بین برد. موسیقی وی یکی ازموضوعاتی است که در طول 40 سال جنگ مردم را با کشوریکه از آن دور هستند به ارتباط بسازد و یکی از نمادهای ماندگاری است که افغانستان آن را در خود به یک بار دیده است
WHERE YOUR DONATION GOES
کمک های مال شما کجا میرود؟

احمد ظاهر فیلمی است که میخواهیم بسازیم اما هنوز قادر به انجام آن نیستیم. و ما به شما اطمینان میدهیم که تمام کمک های مالی از طرف شما توسط کمپاین کیکستارتر دریافت میکنم صد در صدمستقیما برای تولید این فیلم به مصرف میرسد

ما تنها 30 روز برای رسیدن به هدف و جمع آوری ۱۵۰۰۰۰ دالری خود داریم! اگر ما در این زمان به این مقدار کمک نقدی دست نیابیم، تمام کمک های نقدی به این فیلم به افرادی که در این کمپین اشتراک کرده‌اند دوباره پرداخت خواهد شد و ما هیچ پولی را دریافت نخواهیم کرد
به یک توضیح مختصردیگر !

برای کسانی که میخواهند کمک های نقدر بیشتر از ۵۰۰۰ دالرداشته باشند ما به آنها این امکان را میدهیم که به عنوان یکی از تهیه کننده گان فیلم با ما همکاری کنند و همچنان میتوانند بدون پرداخت مالیه به همکاری ادامه دهند و میتوانند به ایمیل آدرس ذیل بتماس شوند.
SOME COMMON QUESTIONS ... 
! سوالات عمومی ...
We restarted our Kickstarter campaign on Sept 8. Since then, we have had some questions about why and how this works, and we wanted to be transparent with our backers about the whole process. So, here are answers to some common questions we have received: 
ما کمپین کیکستارتر را به تاریخ ۸ سپتامبر آغاز کردیم و از همان آغاز سوالاتی وجود داشت که چرا و چگونه میخواهیم این کار را انجام دهیم. و اینجا میخواهیم به این سوالات جواب بدهیم تا این پروسه برای افرادی که از ما حمایت میکنند واضح و شفاف باشد. سوال های معمولا مطرح میشوند به صورت ذیل میباشد.
"You asked for $150,000 and now you are OK with $50,000?  Why 50,000?" 
Our overall budget hasn't changed.  Based on our following and the passion we were seeing for this film, we believed we could get $150,000 from Kickstarter.  Perhaps we still could, but if we don't reach our goal, we would get nothing and this film would not get made.  We don't want to risk that, so instead we are cutting the budget to assure a successful campaign.  We still hope to raise $150,000, but $50,000 is the bare minimum to get us started. 
"اولین بار شما مقدار ۱۵۰۰۰۰ کمک نقدی را درخواست کرده بودید حالا چرا آن مقدار به ۵۰۰۰۰ رسیده؟"
بودجه ساخت فیلم تغییری نکرده و ما هنوز امید داریم که موفق به جمع آوری مقدار ۱۵۰۰۰۰ شویم اما با این ها ما ۵۰۰۰۰ دالر را برای کمترین مبلغ برای ساخت این فیلم در نظر گرفته ایم زیرا ما میخواهیم که به هرصورت ممکن به ساخت این فیلم بپردازیم
"Documentaries are cheap to make, you just need a camera.  Why are you asking for so much?"
People don't realize that documentaries, especially if done well, are actually extremely expensive! For this film, we estimate that just the archive video footage will cost more than $100,000.  Our total expenses will exceed $500,000.  Every penny of the donations from Kickstarter are going to pay for the initial development of the film and will allow us to keep creative control of the film.  If we were to sell the rights of Ahmad Zahir to a big film company right now, they will have their own ideas for the film and we would not get to make the beautiful vision we have in mind. So, we are trying to keep as independent as we can as we make this movie. Your donations help us do that.
 "ساخت فیلم های مستند مصرف زیادی نیازی ندارند چرا شما به این مقدار پول نیاز دارید؟"
معمولا درک فیلم های مستند ساده برای همه آسان نیست ولی اگر فیلمی به صورت حرفه ای که عوام فهم باشد ساخته شود هزینه ای زیادی نیاز دارد ما تنها برای دستیابی به فیلم های آرشیف به مقدار ۱۰۰۰۰ دالر نیاز داریم. هزینه کل این فیلم مبلغی بیشتر از ۵۰۰۰۰ دالر میباشد و ما به شما اطمینان میدهیم که هر پنی از کمک های مالی شما در ساخت این فیلم مصرف خواهد شد و واضح است که مقدار بیشتر کمک مالی به ما این امکان را میدهد تا با خلاقیت بیشتر و بصورت خیلی حرفه ای این فیلم را بسازیم. درعین حال اگر ما برای ساخت این فیلم از شرکت های بزرگ فیلم سازی کمک بخواهیم واضح است که آنها تغییراتی در جزئیات این فیلم خواهند آورد که ما به هیچ وجه خواهان آن نیستیم.به همین دلیل ما میخواهیم این فیلم را به طور مستقل بسازیم و برای این کار ما به کمک های نقدی شما نیاز داریم
"Why would we donate money to a film when there are so many worthy causes in Afghanistan that need our money?"
This is a worthy cause! This film will be a positive message about our country, our people, and our history.  This is a film about standing up for what you believe in.  In a time when everything we see and hear about Afghanistan is negative, a positive and beautiful film like this can inspire and change people through storytelling and art. It is hard to put a value on that but we hope you agree that this film is a worthwhile endeavor.
"چرا شما میخواهید برای ساخت یک فیلم این مقدار پول را هزینه کنید درصورتیکه خیلی موضوعات مهم دیگر در افغانستان هست که به این پول نیاز دارند؟"
ساختن این فیلم یک دلیل ارزشمند دارد! این فیلم پیامی مثبت در مورد کشور ما، مردم ما و تاریخ ما خواهد داشت. این یک فیلم درباره ایستادن برای چیزی است که شما به آن اعتقاد دارید. در زمانی که همه چیزهایی که ما درباره افغانستان می بینیم و می شنویم منفی است، یک فیلم مثبت و زیبا مانند این می تواند مردم را از طریق بیان داستان و هنر الهام بخشیده و نظر شان را تغییر دهد. ارزش‌گذاری بالای این فیلم دشوار است، اما ما امیدواریم شمابا باارزش بودن این فیلم موافقت کنید
"Your film team involves non-Afghans - how do I know they have the best interest of Afghans in mind?"
This film is being produced by Afghan refugees and first generation Afghans.  We have an American director (Sam French) and an American producer (Mo Scarpelli) involved, not because they are controlling the project, but because they are really talented at what they do AND they have compassion for Afghanistan and Ahmad Zahir's legacy. 
Ahmad Zahir's daughter Shabnam is the film's executive producer and Baktash Ahadi is one of our producers. Both fled Afghanistan when they were young just like so many of us.  
Our Kickstarter

column1: video was made in English to help us reach the widest audience possible. We are working on Farsi/Dari subtitles for the video
id: and we are in the process of translating the English text on this page to Farsi/Dari as well. You can rest assured that the film itself will be comprised of mostly Afghan voices and shot mainly in Afghanistan or areas where Afghan diaspora will be interviewed. We have already done dozens of interviews with Afghans in Afghanistan and plan to do more. Many Afghan journalists based in Afghanistan have relayed their appreciation to make this film and believe it's a project that needs to be made.

column1: تیم فیلم سازی شما شامل غیر افغان ها است - چگونه می‌توانیم بداینم که آنها به موضوع که مربوط افغان ها میباشد علاقه دارند؟""
این فیلم توسط پناهندگان افغان و نسل اول افغان ها تولید می شود. ما یک کارگردان آمریکایی (سام فرانسوی) و یک تولید کننده آمریکایی (مون اسکارپلی)
داشتیم نه به این خاطر که آنها پروژه را کنترل می کردند، بلکه به این دلیل که واقعا در مورد آنچه که انجام می دهند، با استعداد و همسو با افغانستان و میراث احمد ظاهر هستند
دختر شهید احمد ظاهر، تهیه کننده اجرایی این فیلم میباشد و بگتاش احدی یکی از تولید کنندگان ما است. هر دو مانند خلی ازما وقتی جوان بودند مجبور به ترک افغانستان شدند
** Have any other burning questions ? Email zahirthefilm@gmail.com and we are happy to answer them !
اگر سؤالاتی دارید با ایمیل زیر با ما به تماس شوید zahirthefilm@gmail.com

story:
We are four artists excited to collaborate on an original artwork for High Desert Test Sites 2013! HDTS is a weeklong series of interdisciplinary projects to be presented between Joshua Tree, California and Albuquerque, New Mexico, from October 12th-19th, 2013. Our goal for this internationally regarded event is to create an artwork that allows HDTS audiences to join in a collaborative exchange about experiences in the landscape.
We plan to create a limited edition publication, which we describe as a mapbook. It’s a hybrid inspired by maps, atlases, reference texts and the form of the volvelle, a charting tool with rotating parts. Our project’s title, Collaboratively Determined Telluric Sites, is based on the concept of telluric currents, which are electric currents that run through much of the earth's surface.
Background: On the Road
In preparation for the HDTS event, we went scouting for telluric currents over more than 700 miles of high desert between Joshua Tree and Albuquerque. We met in Los Angeles, where three of us live, with the fourth flying in from Minnesota. We visited several significant sites, including Amboy Crater and Meteor Crater, and were surprised when our travels and conversation led us to unexpected destinations.
Some of the ways we each took readings of telluric currents
The Mapbook
Our mapbook, which will be printed in an edition of 1,000 and distributed for free to participants at this fall’s HDTS event, will document our experience and how we question various “currents” encountered at sites along our collective path.
The mapbook will also provide readers with an opportunity to map and share their own journeys. We intend to use these individual maps to create an ever-more collaborative map of a broader telluric universe. We hope you will be a part of this expanding network! Your funds will allow us to create a lushly printed mapbook that suggests a non-linear view of the landscape and an alternate means of engaging with visual and tactile information. 
The first part of the mapbook will describe the framework of our project in text and images and give examples of telluric currents we encountered during our scouting expedition.
Map of the road
The second part, a 16” x 16” foldout map, will show the connection between our path and a constellation of meanings. 
Our fold-out map in progress
The third section is a 12” x 8” volvelle template in which participants may map and write about their own telluric currents and mail back to us to us. We’ll make it easy and even cover the return postage. 
A detail of the template readers may alter
Where are you on the map?
We hope you join in our collaborative “current” through your contribution. Thank you!
The closest we got to Petrified National Park--a rock stump at Ortega's Trading Post in Sanders, AZ--because we were so caught up talking about Collaboratively Determined Telluric Sites we drove right by the park and didn't realize until nearly an hour la

When a secluded and forgotten mansion becomes open to the public, two friends are the first to enter it in thirty years. Thomas, an adventure video blogger, faces his most anticipated location yet, 'The Levisson Mansion' and invites his estranged childhood friend, Leo, as an attempt to rekindle their once-strong friendship. The unexpected occurs when they discover a decrepit, yet functioning, elevator in the basement that doesn't go to floors above, but down, deep into the unknown. The two let their childhood curiosity take over and flip the switch for 'down'.
Concept/Storyboard Art - 'The Entrance'
Concept/Storyboard Art - 'The Shaft'
There will be another 8 original pieces done for the film, and all 10 will be sent to backers (see rewards section 'Original Storyboard Art' and 'Storyboard Art Prints').
Thomas' adventure will take place at the Levisson Estate in the middle of winter at the base of Mt Ruapehu in the central North Island of New Zealand. The landscape is striking in beauty, covered in pine trees and tussock, but also isolated, exposed to freezing winds, and blanketed in snow.
Thomas
Thomas has a new lease on life and struggles with the mundane. He's making up for a far less spontaneous and exciting childhood, these days opting to go after the things that stir his curiosity and imagination. His desire for challenging adventure, physical activity and sharing his stories via video blogging only increases with each upload. Thomas is furiously chasing the ultimate adventure.
Leo
Leo's gloomy outlook on life gives people the impression of 'damaged goods', often allowing him to say things that are shocking or out of line. People keep Leo at a distance, not expecting much of him, and most of the time, they'd be justified in doing so. Unlike Thomas, Leo is only along because he's curious as to why Thomas invited him after their relation suffered a severe falling out many years before. 
All the locals know the name, none have seen the man in decades. Thomas asked around but all he came up with was a kind of 'Levisson Folklore'... just stories of the man, based on rumors. Every avenue came up empty; he even traced their family origins to Iceland, but couldn't find an official connection. Soon enough, Thomas set his eyes on the mansion itself, hoping the answers would be found inside. The missing millionaire was the sole owner the family mining company, which was handed down from his grandfather, the first family immigrant who built the Levisson Mansion in 1921. Police have assured that the search for Mr. Levisson is still ongoing. 
Mikey
With two young boys at home, playtime can get a little immature at best. This outlet has proved to be great for Mikey getting mature about his dream to make memorable movies. He has directed five short films, tutored Film Practice at Massey University, Auckland, and has nearly completed his second fiction novel. Mikey plans to write and make movies for the rest of his life.
Nicholas
Nick has an uncanny ability to binge watch movies or TV without fatigue, though his wife of three years has finally tamed his wild appetites. The most experienced in the team, Nick has been editing and producing TV for 20 years. His wealth of knowledge always comes in handy at the right time and has some great tricks up his sleeves. 
Tim
In between cleaning up vomit from his kids and making up voices for pet dinosaurs, Tim is the co-founder of a game studio in Kingsland, Auckland. He is the creator of Aethasia, the fictional world of their first game and is co-authoring a series of books to go along with it. Tim has a wild imagination has made great contributions to the story thus far.
 "The found footage style is popular these days, in fact, they're a dime a dozen, some producing good results, some not. In many cases, I tend to shy away from them when choosing a movie because too often, the style is distracting to me more than immersing. That's the problem, when it's token instead of an intentional decision to target a specific feeling or effect. In the video I said the goal of this movie is to make the most claustrophobic movie ever made. The decision to shoot found footage stemmed out of this goal, as did the writing of the characters, the choice of cameras and camera positioning, the location of the mansion, the sets, prop design, and script. In this film, the choice to go 'found footage' is as far from token as you can get, and I assure you, it will be unforgettable."
We'd like to thank you for backing us by giving you a reward. They work incrementally, meaning in most cases, you get the reward for the value you decide to pay, as well as the rewards offered below that decided value. See the right-hand column for out list of rewards, some are one-offs, so get in there quick!

It was March in Chicago, and the snow lingered in the streets like a bad cough. Hipsters and teamsters huddled around steaming cups of coffee, fighting off the cold leaking in around their windows.
Meanwhile, on the West Side, things were getting hot at the rehearsal space of the Private Instigators. As usual, the Privates’ guitarist, Dominick, started the conversation.
“Guys, we sound tighter than ever! I’m really happy with how we’re playing! We should record this!” 
“Yeah, we’re really cookin’, man,” Keith, the singer and bassist, chimed in. “Where should we record?”
“Chris Steinmetz from Stonecutter Studios wants to produce us," Dominck replied. "He's worked with so many great artists, like Paul Simon, Miles Davis, B.B. King, Alice In Chains, Smashing Pumpkins, Suicidal Tendencies, Rod Stewart, Mavis Staples, Jay-Z, Rihanna, Madonna, Usher, and even KISS!.”
“Dominick, that’s great! But where would we get the money?” Keith reached into his pocket to illustrate. “I’ve got $5, a cough drop, and a pick. Recording in a different city is going to cost an arm and a leg. Right, Jeff?”
Jeff, the drummer, shrugged. It’s just like him. You put him behind a drumset, and he’s the loudest person for miles. But ask him a question, and you’re lucky to get a word out of the taciturn timekeeper.
Dominick thought for a minute. You could practically see the gears turning, and the light go on behind his eyes.
“Kickstarter! We could raise our budget through Kickstarter!”
Keith nodded. “That sounds like a darn fine idea. Let’s see,” he said, punching numbers into his phone, “First, we’ll need travel expenses including renting a trailer for our gear (which should cost about $15 a day for 12 days, plus insurance), gas to Nashville for recording and Atlanta for mixing and then back home (which is around 1,600 miles!), and hotels and food for all three of us. Add that to studio time for recording, mixing and mastering ($800 a day), artwork, duplication, copyrights, and, since this is Kickstarter, we’ll need to make and send all of our supporters’ rewards. Hmmm.... I’d say that, when you add it to the money we’ve made at our shows so far, we probably need about five gees to make an EP.”
Dominick smiled. “Five grand? Sounds reasonable. But if we get more than that, we can record a full album instead of an EP*. Right, Jeff?”
Jeff shrugged.
At the same moment, in a burnt-down warehouse in Rogers Park, Ronette Penniman spoke to her friends, Crystal and Chiffon Morton. The two sisters listened raptly as Ronette purred out each syllable, soft and low like bare feet on a Persian rug. 
“Gals, we’ve got a lead.” 
Crystal stood up from the pile of ashes she was sifting through.”It’s about time,” she said, dropping the poker she was using to search for clues. She looked at her sister, Chiffon, who was already over by Ronette. 
Ronette was holding a piece of red paper. It was a flyer for something called The Private Instigators. 
“This must have fallen out of their pocket when they burned the warehouse down!” Chiffon guessed. Ronette had her phone out and was already searching these Private Instigators. 
“Well, look at that. They’re going to be only a couple blocks away tonight,” Ronette cooed. 
“It seems there’s three of them.” 
 “Just like us!” Chiffon added. Crystal shot her sister a dirty look. 
 “Can we get to them any earlier than tonight?” 
“It doesn’t seem likely,” Ronette said. “But tonight gives us time to plan. Let’s see... Ooh, the one with the mohawk is pretty cute. Let’s grab him. Crystal, you still have those handcuffs, right?” 
Crystal smiled. 
Later that night, the Privates blasted through their set like a grenade in a water balloon, leaving everyone present excited and soaking wet. The audience shouted, shook, shimmied, and shivered through crowd-pleasers like “You’re A Creep!”, “Don’t You Know My Love Is Free?”, “My Baby”, and “Too Pretty For Prison.” 
After the show, as they were loading the gear back into their van, Ronette approached the Private Instigators. 
“Hi,” she said. 
Keith stepped toward her. She was just his type. She was curvy, pretty, and there was danger behind her smile. 
“Well, hello yourself, sister.” He grinned at her, and they locked eyes. 
“Would you mind coming to meet my friends? I think you’ll like them. They’re sisters.” 
 Keith didn’t look away as he called to Dominick and Jeff. “Guys, I’ll be back in a minute or three.” 
As he turned the corner to see Chiffon and Crystal, his heart sank. Keith could recognize a trap when he saw one. As he turned to walk away, he felt a pinch in his arm. His vision blurred, and he stayed conscious just long enough to realize he’d been drugged. 
When Keith didn’t return from flirting with that fan, Dominick turned to Jeff. 
“Anything to get out of having to load the van,” he laughed. 
Jeff shrugged. 
“I’m going to go get him, okay?” 
Jeff shrugged. 
Dominick walked over to where Ronette had lead Keith, and found no one. A quick look found some of Keith’s picks on the ground and some footprints in the snow. 
 Dominick ran back to Jeff. 
 “Jeff, Keith’s been taken! Shanghaied! Kidnapped! Keithnapped!” 
Jeff rolled his eyes. Leave it to Keith to go chasing after some dame and get grabbed. The irony of that innuendo didn’t escape Jeff, but he didn’t say anything. He simply strolled over to where Keith had disappeared and took a closer look at the scene. 
Nothing escaped him. No detail, however small. He walked back to the van, and got into the driver’s seat. Dominick was already in the passenger’s seat, strapped in, and ready to go. 
“Come on, Jeff! Let’s go rescue Keith from that woman!” 
Jeff shrugged and shifted the van into gear, and they tore off like a band-aid, in search of their stolen singer.
*Stretch goal: If we hit 10 grand, we'll make a 10 song album instead of a 5 song EP!

FREDRIC BROWN'S MARTIANS, GO HOME
 ABOUT SEQUENTIAL PULP COMICS, LLC:
My name is Michael Hudson, owner of the boutique graphic novel publishing company, Sequential Pulp Comics, LLC. You may know of our books through Dark Horse Comics. We produced the critically acclaimed and commercially successful The Halloween Legion: The Great Goblin Invasion that was on the short list for Stan Lee's Excelsior Awards. We also produced a wonderfully atmospheric The Hound of the Baskervilles and Steve Bryant's Athena Voltaire Compendium that was up for an award in the 2015 Harvey's. However, our biggest successes have been with our licensed Edgar Rice Burroughs' properties, Jungle Tales of Tarzan and At The Earth's Core.
WHERE WE'VE BEEN & WHERE WE'RE GOING
We've recently broken our relationship with Dark Horse Comics in a mutually amicable way to begin the journey of publishing our own books under the Sequential Pulp Comics imprint. Fredric Brown's Martians, Go Home scripted by Martin Powell, illustrated by Lowell Isaac, and lettered by David Hopkins will be the first solo graphic novel. If we are successful in this venture, we have many more projects in the works that we want to bring to you. 
ABOUT THE PROJECT:
Fredric Brown's Martians,Go Home is a 112 page full color graphic novel that has been licensed by the Fredric Brown Estate. It contain an Introduction by legendary science fiction artist, Vincent Di Fate and an Afterword by the equally famous author, Barry N. Malzberg. It also contains a twelve page art gallery by our illustrator, Lowell Isaac.

The book is complete and ready to go to press. It will be solicited in the June edition of Diamond's PREVIEWS catalog. 

THE  DETAILS: 
 At 6.62 x 10.18 inches, the books  will be exactly like the Dark Horse Comics/Sequential Pulp books, printed by the same press used by Marvel and DC, featuring a gloss-lay flat laminated cover with interior pages on 70 lb. coated gloss  paper sewn perfect bound.
SHORT SYNOPSIS:
Martians have invaded Earth! That’s right, real Martians. Seriously. Suddenly, without warning, one billion Little Green Men are everywhere. The Martians are on your street, and in your house, all of them knowing your deepest and darkest secrets. Untouchable as ghosts and obnoxious as hell, their sinister agenda remains a mystery. Perhaps, their plan is simply to drive the entire human race insane, for that is exactly what they’re doing.
From flop house to the White House, no one is above, or below, the torment of the alien invaders. All is lost. Or, is it?
Only our unlikely hero Luke Devereaux, a burnt-out science fiction writer with nothing left to lose, knows how to defeat the Martians…but he has already lost his mind!
You won’t think of alien contact in the same way, ever again.

KATRINA JI AND CULTURE SHAKTI PRESENTS THE RAJASTHANI GYPSY CARAVAN TOUR 2014!
The Rajasthani Gypsy Caravan is a star studded performance tour including Suva Devi, Ustad Arba Music Group, Katrina Ji and local guests! The tour will include a grand performance & workshops of live music and dance. Enjoy the music & dance of Rajasthan along with Bollywood & Belly Dance performances. This unique tour will start in the USA in October 2014. 
"It takes a community! With your support, we can make this tour possible!"  -Rajasthani Gypsy Caravan
The Rajasthani Gypsy Caravan aims to promote and preserve the Manganiyar, Langa, Kalbelia, Bhopa (story tellers), Kamad (devotional singers) and Bhat (Puppeters ) communities and their traditions. This is an enormous and ongoing project. The US tour this fall will help them advance these ambitious goals. We are seeking cultural exchange between Rajasthan and USA.
In the creation of this group, the organization has selected prominent and talented folk musicians, instrumentalists and professional Kalbelia (Gypsies) Bhawai, Ghoomar, Teratali and Chari (fire) dancers.The Traditional singing and dancing includes different repertories such as : devotional songs of bordic heros Ramdeo Peer (Saint), Pabuji, Tejaji, Rani Bhatiyani Sarup, Sati Goma, Sati Gunsar (folk Godesses) Kabir, Meera, Sufiyana Muslims (Mystical) songs : Bulle Shah, Shah Latif, Kanwar Bhagat, Moomal-Mahendra, Dhola-Maru, Lailah Majanu, Shasi-Panu (Love Songs).
"(Suva Devi) has been an inspiration for me in my dance for over a decade." -Katrina Ji
Katrina first met Imamddin Khan online, then two years later finally met him in person during her travels in India. He brought the top Rajasthani musicians to come perform for her, including Suva Devi who is famous for her barrel turns in the film LATCHO DROM. Katrina Ji's love of Rajasthan, and Imam's mission to preserve and share Rajasthani Culture, has resulted in the Rajasthani Gypsy Caravan Tour.
The Tour dates and cities have been selected and final arrangements are being made! But the upfront costs are dear, such as $3,000 alone in travel visa fees. Your contribution will go a long way and make a huge difference to the tour, the members of the caravan, and their family and friends back home. Our goal of $10,000 will directly support the tour in the following ways:
Buys one round trip airline ticket India to USA: $1,400
Buys a week of tour van rental: $1,000
Buys home cooked meals for the whole tour: $500
Buys one Visa for entry to USA: $190
Buys 1 day tour van rental: $150
Buys home cooked meals for 5 days of the tour: $100
Buys one tank of gas for tour van: $50
Buys one meal for 1 performer per day: $10
Culture Shakti is a professional international dance company specializing in Bollywood Dance, & American Tribal Style Belly Dance with a splash of Bhangra. Classes and event performance information can be found at http://www.cultureshaktidance.com.
Katrina Ji, is the Artistic Director of Culture Shakti as well as a certified ATS® Belly Dance Instructor by Carolena Nericcio of FCBD®.
Katrina has been teaching ATS® Belly Dance since 2001. In 2007, she was amongst the first group of Teachers to become certified Sister Studio ATS® Belly Dance Instructors by Carolena Nericcio of FatChanceBellyDance® . Katrina is committed to providing consistent, quality instruction of ATS® Belly Dance as originated by FCBD and has been nominated as the Best in Western Washington by King 5 / Evening Magazine.

Après plusieurs voyages à Montevideo en République Orientale d'Uruguay pour découvrir mes racines maternelles, j'ai la chance de rencontrer des Indiens Charruas, des afro-descendants et des exilés européens. 
Tras varios viajes a Montevideo en República Oriental del Uruguay para descubrir mis raíces maternas, tengo la oportunidad de conocer Indios Charrúas, afrodescendientes y exiliados europeos.
Ces échanges me font prendre conscience de la diversité sociale et culturelle de ce pays situé entre le Brésil et l'Argentine. 
Esos intercambios me hacen tomar conciencia de la diversidad social y cultural de ese país situado entre Brasil y Argentina.  
Chaque année en Février en Uruguay est organisé le plus long Carnaval au monde, tous les quartiers de Montevideo sont en effervescence à partir de la Saint Balthazar ( 6 Janvier, Fête des rois ), C'est là que je découvre le Candombe, classé "patrimoine immatériel de la culture uruguayenne" par l'UNESCO en 2009.
En Uruguay, cada febrero, se organiza el carnaval más largo del mundo. Todos los barrios de Montevideo están en plena efervescencia a partir de la San Baltasar (6 de enero, día de Reyes Magos). Asi descubro el Candombe, reconocido en 2009 por UNESCO como Patrimonio Cultural Inmaterial de la Humanidad. 
L'idée de ce projet est donc née le plus naturellement du monde, nourrie par ces exceptionnelles rencontres humaines au coeur des quartiers historiques de la tradition du Candombe et des défilés du Carnaval.      
Esa idea de proyecto nace naturalmente, enriquecida por esos encuentros excepcionales en el corazón de los barrios históricos de la tradición del Candombe y de los desfiles de carnaval.                                                                                                                                                                                            
Parmi celles ci, une des plus significatives avec le grand percussionniste, luthier & fabricant de tambours Fernando " El Lobo" Nunez dans son célèbre atelier "El Power" à Barrio Sur. Il est le fondateur du groupe mythique et emblématique La Calenda en 1992. 
Entre todos aquellos encuentros, uno de los mas significativos fue con el gran percusionista, lutero y fabricante de tambores Fernando “El Lobo” Núñez, en su famoso taller “El Power” en el barrio sur. Es el fundador del legendario e icónico grupo La Calenda en 1992.
En 2003, ses deux enfants avec leurs amis reprirent ce groupe en y ajoutant leurs propres influences et renommèrent celui-ci: La Calenda Beat. Voici leur premier clip.  
En 2003, sus dos hijos y amigos suyos recuperaron el grupo, añadiendo sus propias influencias y renombrandolo La Calenda Beat. Aquí esta su primer vídeoclip.
Ainsi, à travers les vies de personnes proches des tambours, le documentaire met en lumière l'essentiel de cette culture :  La joie d'être ensemble. 
Así, a través la vida de personas y de sus tambores, el documental pone de relieve lo fundamental de esa cultura : la alegría de estar juntos.
EQUIPE DU TOURNAGE / EQUIPO DE RODAJE
Fabio BOUQUET :  De père français et de mère uruguayenne, je suis le directeur du Festival itinérant " Fleurs de vie, Fleurs de jazz" dans le Sud de la France et également attaché de production au Festival Radio France de Montpellier et Occitanie depuis 2010. D'autre part, pour accompagner au mieux les artistes  je réalise des clips vidéos, teasers & courts métrages depuis 2009. C'est d'ailleurs au début de cette aventure que je rencontre mon actuel chef opérateur Esus Glaser pour un projet " Le duo fraternel" avec les virtuoses syriens Haki Kilic & Delchad Ahmad. 
Fabio BOUQUET : de padre francés y madre uruguaya, soy el director del Festival itinerante “Fleurs de vie, Fleurs de jazz” el Sur de Francia y también attaché de production en el Festival Radio France de Montpellier et Occitanie desde 2010. Por otro lado, para acompañar a los artistas, dirijo videoclips, teasers y cortometrajes desde 2009.
ESUS GLASER :  Je suis vidéaste dans le sud de la France. Professionnel de l'image, je traduis en image les moments vécus dans cette aventure au sol comme dans les airs. Equipé d'un drone et de ce qui se fait de mieux en matière de caméra et équipements, je suis ainsi au plus prés de ce qui se passe et en même temps je peux garder une vision d'ensemble. Grâceaux équipements d'aujourd'hui, nous pouvons réaliser un film qui techniquement aurait été impossible à produire encore quelques années en arrière. La culture uruguayenne, les rencontres et toutes ces expériences sont uniques. Je travaille pour que l'expérience du spectateur regardant ce film soit tout aussi unique cinématographiquement.
ESUS GLASER: Soy videógrafo en el sur de Francia. Profesional de la imagen, ilustro los momentos vividos en esta aventura, en el suelo como en el aire. Equipado con un dron y los mejores materiales, puedo retranscribir de cerca de lo que está sucediendo y al mismo tiempo mantener una visión general. Gracias al equipo de hoy, podemos hacer una película que técnicamente habría sido imposible de rodar algunos años atrás. La cultura uruguaya, los encuentros y todas estas experiencias son únicas. Trabajo para que el sentimiento del espectador viendo esta película también sea única cinematográficamente.
Pour finaliser notre objectif, il nous faut bien plus que le montant demandé.. Si nous parvenons à un minimum de 10 000€, nous pouvons déjà continuer et terminer le tournage.                                                   L'unique moyen d'y parvenir, c'est vous !                                           Votre résistance, votre soutien et votre solidarité sont indispensables lors de cette courte campagne.
Para finalizar nuestro objetivo, necesitamos más allá de la cantidad solicitada. Si alcanzamos un mínimo de 10000€, ya podremos continuar y terminar el rodaje.
La única forma de hacerlo es usted! Su resistencia, su apoyo y su solidaridad son esenciales durante esta corta campaña.

Haiti: as it dances, not as it stumbles 
 What is Puertos príncipes: temblemos todos? 
Puertos príncipes: temblemos todos is an account of post-quake Haiti that both denounces systemic violence and celebrates its cultural heritage. That is why the book oscillates between investigations on abuse and documenting the nation’s cultural assets. I believe that zeroing in only on the trauma further hurts the subjects we are trying to help, therefore I also focus on the reconstruction, hope and what happens after. 
Part of this journey was achieved thanks to contemporary dance company Ayikodans. Thank you, Ayikodans and director Jeanguy Saintus, for allowing me to travel with you through sound, music and across generations. 
 Why Haiti? 
Haiti has been erased from the map. After the 2010 earthquake, Haiti received an outpour of sympathy and donations. World countries pledged billions. Humanitarian institutions lent a hand. Six years after and over $14 billions later, Haiti still struggles, and the world has forgotten about it. The statistics speak loudly: 7,515 new homes have been built in a country of 10 million people (NYTimes, 2014). Parts of the donations are unaccounted for (The Guardian, 2013). Some dominicans of Haitian descent face deportation (The Guardian, 2013). 
What happens next? 
Puertos príncipes was first published by La secta de los perros in Puerto Rico. I have been fortunate to take it to many universities, even CNN, which is great. What is even better is the messages in Facebook or emails by people touched by Haiti’s stories of courage. As an example, a Venezuelan dancer said he was moved by the Ayikodans dancers who have continued to represent their country worldwide in spite of the nation's difficulties. That is the best I could have hope for when I sat down to write the book five years ago: To show Haiti as it dances, not as it stumbles. 
La Cifra, a prominent publisher in Mexico City, will print the Second edition of the book. It will print 1,000 copies of Puertos príncipes in January of 2017 and has committed to place the book in bookstores and book fairs across Mexico and other Latin American countries, as well as developing a strategic communication campaign to reach different media and a wider audience, furthering the goal to expose Haiti in a different light.

SYNOPSIS DU FILM: 
Des Acadiens et Acadiennes passionnés de Belle-Ile-en-Mer en France visitent l’Acadie des Provinces maritimes. Nous sommes témoins de leurs expériences alors qu'ils explorent les lieux d’origine ou leurs ancêtres ont véçus, échangeant avec des Acadiens vivant aux Provinces Maritimes, et suivant leur participation au Congrès mondial acadien. Ce grand évènement attire des milliers d’Acadiens de par le monde et démontre notre diversité et notre vitalité.
Comment seront-ils reçus par leurs «cousins» en Acadie? Quels sentiments éprouveront les Bellilois lorsqu’ils verront les lieux en Acadie ou leurs ancêtres ont vécus pendant 150 ans? De quelle façon leur identité acadienne sera renforcée par leur retour en Acadie?
ENGLISH SYNOPSIS: 
Acadian descendants from the island of Belle-Ile-en-Mer in France come to visit Acadie in the Canadian Maritimes Provinces. We witness their experiences of seeing the places where their ancestors lived before being deported, the French Acadians exchanging with Maritime Acadians, and their participation at the World Acadian Congress. This grand event atracts thousands of Acadians of their world diaspora and celebrates the diversity and vitality of the Acadians. 
How will they be received by their Acadian «cousins»? What feelings will they have on visiting their «homeland» and seeing their old lands where their ancestors lived for 150 years before being deported? Finally, will their cultural identity be further strengthened by   coming «home»? 
Un peu d’histoire acadienne
Les français ont fondé l’Acadie en 1604 et pendant 150 ans ils ont acquis une identité unique. Grâce à leur travail sur leurs riches terres agricoles, leur niveau de vie est devenu très elevé. Ils sont fermiers, pêcheurs et marchants. Les Britanniques occupants demandent que les Acadiens signent un Serment d’Allégeance à la monarchie britannique, ce qu’ils refusent, et ils déportent les Acadiens dès 1755 vers les colonies anglo-américaines, en Angleterre et en France. Suite au Traité de Paris de 1763, les Acadiens libérés vont migrer à nombreuses endroits en Acadie et du monde pendant 50 ans pour trouver un endroit paisible où vivre ou dans l’espoir de trouver et réunir leurs familles.
La diaspora mondiale des Acadiens est née. Aujourd'hui, les Acadiens et leurs descendances vivent aux provinces maritimes, mais aussi au Québec, ailleurs au Canada, aux îles Saint-Pierre-et-Miquelon, aux États-Unis (en Louisiane, au Texas et au Maine), aux Antilles (en Martinique et à Haïti), en Amérique du Sud (en Guyane française et aux îles Malouines) et en France (dans le Poitou et en Bretagne surtout).
Belle-Ile-en-Mer, située au sud de la Bretagne, est à 5 000 km de distance de l’Acadie. Leurs ancêtres acadiens ont été déportés en Virginie en 1755, refusés, et ensuite envoyés comme prisonniers en Angleterre pendant 8 ans avant d'être libérés et plusieurs s’installent sur cette belle île en France. Malgré les années et la grande distance entre Belle-Île-en-Mer et l’Acadie, c’est une magnifique communauté qui est très fière de son héritage acadien.
Ce film est la suite logique au premier film que j'ai tourné : BELLE-ILE-EN-MER, ÎLE BRETONNE ET ACADIENNE. Ce film a connu un succès mondial et s’est mérité 31 prix aux festivals de films sur cinq continents et est diffusé sur TV5 Monde dans 151 pays. Film non financé par les institutions, j’ai eu une liberté de création pour y permettre un “point de vue acadien” ce qui est sans doute une des raisons de sa réussite. Je souhaite réaliser ce nouveau film en totale liberté créative avec votre aide par ce sociofinancement (crowdfunding) de Kickstarter. - Ensemble, c'est possible! Merci!
Je souhaite faire ce nouveau film pour témoigner des expériences vécues en Acadie lors de la visite des Acadiens et Acadiennes de Belle-Île-en-Mer pour aider à mieux faire connaître l'Acadie et notre diaspora acadienne.  - Le film sera tournée en août prochain pendant le Congrès mondial acadien.
Le monde est devenu un village globale. Et voir des gens d’un même héritage se réunir en revenant à leur « terre promise » sera sans doute une célébration de notre dynamisme mondiale qui va produire un rassemblement chaleureux. Le cinéma permet au public de vivre une expérience de rapprochement entre les gens.

Le réalisateur
Je m'appelle Phil Comeau et je suis un réalisateur et scénariste acadien d'une centaine de productions. Mes films ont rapportés 90 prix aux festivals à travers le monde et ont aidés à faire connaître l'Acadie. 
Amoureux des Acadiens et de notre diaspora, j’ai visité toutes les communautés acadiennes du globe. Du point de vue humanitaire, je suis convaincu que les personnes déplacées, les réfugiés et les immigrants ont besoin d'un lien directe avec leur passé pour continuer de chérir leur patrimoine et demeurés forts comme peuple. 
De toute évidence, je suis toujours troublé par cet acte injustifié de la déportation en 1755 de 75% de mon peuple, provoquant la mort de milliers d'hommes, de femmes et d'enfants. Mais cet acte cruel n'a pas réussi à détruire notre identité et notre culture. Aujourd’hui, dans les Provinces Maritimes, nous sommes trois cents milles Acadiens qui vivent dans notre «patrie» d'origine et nous avons des millions de «cousins» acadiens partout dans le monde. 
J’ai toujours été impressionné par la fierté des Acadiens et Acadiennes de Belle-Ile-en-Mer. Ils ont un quelque chose d'unique et d'inspirant. On ne peut rencontrer un(e) Bellilois(e) sans être touché par leur dignité. Pour certains d'entre eux, ce sera la première fois qu’ils mettent le pied en Acadie. Ce sera des moments touchants.
Ce film est un appel à la célébration de l'esprit de la résilience humaine.
Ce film suivra l’expérience que vont vivre les voyageurs acadiens et acadiennes de Belle-Ile-en-Mer, jeunes et moins jeunes, en échangeant avec les Acadiens qu'ils vont rencontrés en Acadie, dont certains sont devenus des amis lors de voyages précédents. - Voici quelques-uns des beaux personnages du film que j’ai tourné à Belle-Ile il y a deux ans, et que nous reverrons dans ce nouveau film tourné en Acadie :
 Claude Boudreau
Claude habite Dieppe au Nouveau-Brunswick.  Il est le fondateur des “Voyages DiasporAcadie” à Memramcook qui organise des voyages à travers la diaspora acadienne mondiale. Animateur passionné et plein d'humour, il organise ce voyage du “retour” des Acadiens de la France en Acadie. Il adore faire découvrir la diaspora et faire vivre des expériences avec la “grande famille” acadienne. L’ampleur de la diaspora le fascine, les échanges entre les Acadiens de l'Amérique du nord avec la France le passionne, et les débats sur l’identité acadienne l’excite… 
 Maryvonne Le Gac
Maryvonne est présidente de l'association acadienne «Belle-Ile Acadie» depuis plus de 20 ans. Une personne très active dans sa communauté insulaire, elle chérit son patrimoine acadien. Très connaissante de l’histoire acadienne, elle a visitée l’Acadie à quelques reprises et a parcourue la diaspora. Elle possède une perception éclairée de ce que c'est la résilience humaine. Acadienne par sa mère, elle est une personne très passionnée et engagée.
 Baptiste Matel
Baptiste, 35 ans, a récemment découvert son héritage acadien par sa généalogie des familles LeBlanc et Richard. Conseiller municipal de la commune de Sauzon, il est informaticien et magasinier pour la compagnie de transport de marchandises. Avide de recherches sur l’histoire acadienne, il est impliqué dont l’association «Youna» qui collectionne, conserve et fait la promotion des traditions belliloises. Très curieux et sensible, il visitera l’Acadie pour la première fois!
 Hélène Jugeau
Hélène est artiste en dessin et en sculpture. Mère de trois enfants, elle est agente de communications à la Compagnie maritime avec son mari. Elle est d’origine acadienne par ses deux parents, dont sa mère est un Granger. Acadienne au tempérament joyeuse, elle va visiter l’Acadie pour la première fois!
 Marie-Claire Granger
Marie-Claire, 57 ans, est mère de trois enfants. Ancienne directrice du Collège Sainte-Anne à Belle-Île-en-Mer, elle offre des cours sur l’histoire acadienne aux jeunes étudiants. Comme son mari, elle a des origines acadiennes par ses deux parents. Marie-Claire a déjà participé à deux Congrès mondial acadien, et voyagera cette fois avec son mari Michel et ses deux jeunes neveux.

Autres personnages 
Dans le film on verra aussi plusieurs Acadiens et Acadiennes de l'Acadie que nos personnages vont rencontrer lors de leur séjour, et bien sur, des milliers de personnes au Congrès mondial acadien.

"From Now on, you can live the way you always wanted to." -Haji
I want to pay homage to both my first anime I truly fell in love with as a teen, Blood+ and my love for enamel pins. I would stay up past midnight on Saturday's to catch it on Toonami and I loved all aspects of the series, the characters, the plot and the overall message that you can live the way you always wanted to despite who you were born as and since I was a kid I wanted to be an artist.
Blood+ (Blood Plus) is a manga/ anime series based off Blood, the last vampire where Saya Otonashi awakens from her amnesia after fighting a monster called chiropterans, giant bat like creatures that live of the blood of humans. Later she learns she is destined to be the only one that can kill them. Saya embarks on a journey with her family, allies, and her chevalier Haji, to rid the world of the Chiropteran threat, her twin sister and recover her identity. The course of the journey reveals the background history of the Chiropterans and Saya's past, which extends into the mid-19th century. Over the course of the series, Saya travels across the world from Japan, Vietnam, Russia, France and Finally The United States. The series had four seasons and aired from October 2005 to September 2006.

So What's It About?:
The Blue flame is 4 years in the making, and the final comic from indie label 'Damn Dirty Comics' a 120+ page graphic novel that is set to be our magnum-opus as well as our swansong.
This is the autobiography of Rees Finlay, he makes comics......or at least he used to, following a tragic accident his leg barely works, everyone he ever loved has gone and his passion is lost. He is broken. In his darkest hour a mysterious figure appears before him. She is the blue flame, and she is here to lead Rees on a journey though his memories to show him the painful truths that put him where he is now.
Motivations are questioned and loyalty is tested as she forces him to uncover repressed memories, take responsibility for his actions, and make desiscions that'll change his life forever.
Somewhere between 'Fight Club' and 'Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind', The Blue Flame explores love, loss, guilt and what it means to battle your demons. 
Why Kickstarter? Why now?
Well, following an unfortunate accident i have been away from the comics scene for just over a year, alot has happened (but if i told you that'd spoil the book) and as a coping mechanism i started drawing sequentials of these events, this grew and grew into what is the 120+ page account of the last 4 years. 
Just like the Rees in the book, it's been an emotional roller-coaster making this book, its not pleasant re-living the past, the good times especially. We're as good as finished making it, now we just need you're help for the book to see release. All my life I've wanted to do something that matters, and with your help it can happen.
Whats in it for you?
Well, apart from your newly discovered enormous sense of joy from knowing how much your support means to me, we also have both digital and print copies of the book up for grabs. We also have original art up for grabs ,aswell as rare books from our back catalogue and t-shirts if your into that sort of gear.
So where does the money go?
The bulk of it will be going into printing the book, a full colour, 120+ page walloper of a book isn't cheap to produce, but it'll be worth it. We also have the t-shirts to produce and postage costs.
We also have 6 guest artists doing pieces throughout the campaign we'll be posting here and printing inside the book, artists include Karl Jones, Tim Conroy, Shunaid Swayers, and Danny Avison. They'll all be paid as well as our wonderfully talented cover artist, Paulette Arochena and our 3 editors. 
 Thank you for reading. And weather you chose to back us or not, have a good one. have the best one.

Please come along with us on the adventure of creating TWO brand new art book projects! The result will be two beautiful coloring books that can be enjoyed, shared or gifted for adults and children alike! Sketchbook Flowers has 72 pages, 35 images, a full color cover, each page is printed one one side only for better coloring. Sketchbook Trees has 58 pages, 28 images, a full color cover, and is also printed one one side only for better coloring. All coloring books and prints will be signed by Herb and can be personalized to that special someone if you like.
By pledging, you will be directly supporting an independent artist and small business. 
Our two new coloring books
These images are from Herb's personal sketchbooks, this is what he does for fun when not working on one of his many illustrations. They are filled with beautiful flowers and trees with few surprises! Herb has always been a great admirer of the natural world and likes to sit quietly sketching when he is out in nature.
These beautiful, highly detailed drawings are for adults and kids to color. We are planning to create an inventory of 250 of each of the coloring books but if we exceed our goal we will be able to give our backers some surprise additional rewards. This is a great way for our supporters and friends to get some special extra rewards for pre-ordering the new coloring books and helping us to produce this wonderful project!

Four of our other coloring books are drawn in the Art Nouveau style with elaborate twisting borders, depictions of flowers, birds, animals and insects...and of course creatures from the worlds of fantasy and myth. Depending on how much you would like to pledge to the project, you can receive two or all of the other coloring books.

Social media continues to be the growing resource centre for professional and social outlets. Connect Ed is a way of joining schools and colleges with community and charity partners.
By forming direct connections these groups will be able to share resources, experiences, professional advice, opinions but above all else they will be able to connect together using a global resource bank to enable them to enrich the opportunities offered either educationally or through raising awareness of causes.
It can also be used a tool for recruiting high quality personnel as well as sharing outstanding governance and Administrative roles.
Once the site is up and running it will develop further through income generation opportunities through advertising revenue.

Hello! I am excited to announce my second multi-pin Kickstarter, featuring the happiest meal of all - eight adorable hard enamel pins!
What started as one cute little burger has now turned into a full snack pack of 8 pixelated food court friends!
All 8 pins will be produced using a printed hard enamel process. Printed hard enamel pins use the enamel + die-struck process, with the image printed directly onto the enamel. I chose this method to ensure the pixels are captured perfectly! The backs and edges of each pin will be gold plated. Each pin will be between 1” and 1.5”, perfect to rock on your jean jacket or fanny pack when you're hanging with your friends at the food court! Devil Spy is a teenage human animal hybrid who spends his days removing dead bodies from apartments, making his part of the city habitable for his own kind. But the only thing he really wants is to meet a live human being. Fortunately DS gets his wish one day when he stumbles upon a chubby teenager named Wyatt. The two quickly form a strong bond, and set out on a quest to find Wyatt's missing sister.
Devil Spy has a mix of sci fi, post apocalyptic, and adventure elements but it's mostly a story about loyalty and friendship. I started Devil Spy way back in July of 2014 and have been eagerly anticipating a time when I had enough pages to publish a graphic novel. That time is now, but I need your help to do it! Color printing is VERY expensive and I can't afford the cost on my own. I've successfully published two graphic novels previously; Willem and Split Screen, with your support on Kickstarter. I'm hoping you will lend your support again for Devil Spy.
My plan for the book:
A paperback book printed in full color. The webcomic pages are 6"x9" and the book will likely be the same size as my previous 2 books (6.5"x9.25"). The book will collect chapters 1-6 of the Devil Spy series and will include the 10 page prologue. There are seven chapter title pages and I'm planning to include a Q & A section, fan art, concept sketches and some series fun facts. I estimate the book will be around 105 pages.
Devil Spy is a series that is near and dear to my heart. I love Devil Spy and Wyatt so much and I really want to see this book become a reality! Please check out the rewards below and support the project where you can, and if you're able, please help spread the word! Thank you so much for taking the time to read about Devil Spy!

I started making these snowflakes, sort-of compulsively, last Christmas after my Dad died of cancer.  I think it became something I could do with my hands that helped me sit with my feelings.  I had a bunch of old 1950's/1960's Playboy and National Geographic magazines, and I really liked the feel of the paper, the vintage graphics, and the chance ways the images became altered when cut and unfolded into snowflakes.
Well, it's almost August, and I haven't stopped making them...even if a day feels particularly sad, I feel okay if I've made something beautiful. So I make snowflakes.  And I want to keep on making them, especially since so many of my friends and acquaintances love them, too. 
I bought a small laminating machine for $20 and matte laminating pouches (which are much more expensive!) because the snowflakes are very special, and I want to preserve them.  A pack of 100 matte laminating sheets costs $73.95 (plus shipping), and I'm close to running out of the pack that I bought back in January.  Oregon Laminations has the best prices for matte laminate pouches large enough to fit my snowflakes.  I also need to buy more vintage issues of National Geographic and Playboy Magazine on Ebay in order to have more material to work with.  The Playboys average about $7 per issue at 6-7 issues per stack, so I'd end up spending roughly $45 - $50 (plus shipping) for an order of seven Playboy magazines; here's an example.  The National Geographic magazines cost a little bit less (about $2-$4 per issue when bought in a stack of twelve), so an order would cost me on average $42; here's an example.
Many friends have encouraged me to keep making these because they're gorgeous, delightfully irreverent, one-of-a-kind art objects.  They're durable because of the fine, matte laminate (which I hand-cut by Xacto and swivel-blade), and they hang invisibly with clear fishing-line.  I've been thinking that another way to present and preserve the artwork would be with clear glass, double-sided picture frames that could stand alone or be hung in a window. I've researched framing options, and it looks like each frame would cost about $15 (plus shipping), from either Amazon or B&H Photo.
In either case, I've made so many already, and it would be wonderful to present them at Brooklyn Flea ($275/booth) and/or the Renegade Craft Fair ($500/booth) this holiday season.  It would be so nice to continue and further what's been a very beautiful and rewarding project for me this year.

If the project hits 200% funding, I'll add a holographic sticker featuring new Inkholm artwork to every reward for free!
Inkholm
Inkholm is a series of 31 illustrations of imagined landscapes, hand drawn in ink on paper, then cut out and layered onto a coloured ink background. Each piece explores some fantasy or sci-fi world, from quiet secluded cottages to vast sprawling cityscapes, with a few more unusual places in there too, all lovingly hand crafted in minute detail on an 8" square of paper.
Inktober
Inkholm was created in October 2018 as part of Inktober, a worldwide challenge to artists of all kinds to create with ink every day for an entire month. I chose to follow the official prompts, creating a new landscape each day inspired by the single word suggestions. It was the second time I'd done a daily art challenge, and the first time I'd really got to grips with working in ink, helping me overcome my fear of making a mistake. Working in ink means no rubbing out, so no second chances. Since doing Inktober last year, I've become obsessed with the medium, and working in ink has become one of my favourite ways to create.
I've fallen so in love with ink, I'll be taking part in Inktober again this year, with a different concept. To follow that, and keep up to date with my work, check out my Twitter or Instagram!
The Rewards
So what can you get for backing the project?
At the first reward tier, you can grab a set of 5 mini-prints of some of my favourite pieces from Inkholm. Each one is picked because it had a concept I loved, took particular skill to create, or was simply great fun to do. The prints will be 12cm (~ 5") squares printed in full colour on thick paper with a matte finish. They'll be perfect for framing, or display as they come.
At the second tier, you can grab a copy of the Inkholm art book. It's a 7.5" square coffee table book with all 31 pieces, some background information on the the project and Inktober, and even some extra photos of my design process included.
The third tier lets you grab both the book and the mini-print set at a discount!
And the fourth tier will get you your very own custom original artwork. You'll get to commission an Inkholm scene of your own, and get the original artwork ready for framing, or display as is. Each piece is 8" square, and hand drawn on 2 layers of 250gsm white card. You can give me an idea for what you'd like me to create, or leave it up to me for a total surprise!
Estragon Helmer
I'm an indie artist working in traditional and digital media. I've  recently been going all in on ink, with new projects like this one. I love sci-fi and fantasy, and have lately had a strong theme with spaceships and robots in my illustration. Alongside art, I also craft handmade products, and even build video games! You can find out more about my work on my website: www.estragonhelmer.com

THE STORY
Without giving to much away on the plot of the story or any spoilers, the film starts off with The Joker in a gritty abandoned nightclub set 4 years after the events of when he was in Arkham Asylum and first met Harley Quinn. He is trying to track down Harley Quinn after he finds out a Hijack went wrong and Batman captured Harley Quinn. We will also have some flashback scenes which will feature a 10 minute scene of how The Joker met Harley Quinn in Arkham and show you how she fell in love with The Joker. We will also see a few flashback scenes of why The Joker became the person you all know and love today. Without spoiling anymore or giving away too much there's going to be some amazing Easter Eggs within the film especially "The Killing Joke"
This film is made by the fans for the fans. I have had this idea going through my head for a while now and decided to sit down write the script and make this finally happen. The film will take a very different approach towards creating the characters The Joker and Harley Quinn, but the overall characters will stay true to the comics. The overall looks of Harley Quinn have been tweaked a bit but she will have her famous red and black look for her costume. The Joker will have a more classic look to him with a unique outfit but he will wear various outfits through the course of the film.
The Reason I am raising funds for this fan film are as follows:
Make Up 
Props 
Outfits 
Music 
Every penny counts so all the help is appreciated by the cast and crew! if we get backing more than the set goal then more will be filmed and will increase the quality of the film and special effects and maybe we might be able to add in a few more Batman villians in the film with extra funding than the goal set out. 
The video for this fund raiser is a TEST shot just to show you what it will be like, it's not a final shot just promotional for this fundraiser.

Surmountable \sər·moun’tə·bəl\, adj.
capable of being overcome or conquered despite the challenges ahead
the opposite of insurmountable
a new book by Brian Gruber and Adam Edwards
The American Constitution was revolutionary and inspired the world because it put citizens in charge with a specific blueprint for how to keep aristocrats, autocrats, and chaos at bay. We are at an extraordinary moment when Americans from every part of the political spectrum feel abandoned and disaffected, the system paralyzed and corrupted.
It wasn’t always this way. Throughout our history, everyday Americans organized and effectively moved the needle on big ideas and causes that mattered. Executive producer Adam Edwards and acclaimed author Brian Gruber are partnering to explore why that is no longer the case, what we can learn from history, and how citizens can engage in 2019 to move mountains. 
We believe our current challenges are surmountable as those came before us faced much greater odds and won -- from the women’s suffrage and civil rights movements to the single person responsible for the most recent Constitutional amendment to the Bonus Army veterans who helped swing the 1932 election to see justice served.
We have plenty of history books. We need a playbook. Adam is funding the writing process, but we are looking for your help to fund the travel, production, and other elements to deliver an important new book and big impact. We will harvest fresh narratives from witnesses to history, family members, key stakeholders, thought leaders, those behind the scenes who solved the logistics, and those who imagined the big ideas that moved the country.
Our goal is to understand how they surmounted seemingly impossible obstacles and how they brought the vision of the country’s founders alive. And, depending on the funds raised, we will travel to the scenes of historic global protests from Berlin to Tunis to Seoul to mine provocative stories for models and lessons learned. 
Adam Monier Edwards is an online marketer with 20 years of experience working with household names, now managing a team of nearly 50 digital experts at one of the world's top four advertising agencies. He has spoken at numerous conferences including Voice.ai, Search Marketing Expo (SMX) Advanced, and Yext Onward. Adam has been the executive producer on multiple films which have premiered at prestigious festivals such as Tribeca and DOC NYC. His experience on the board of Upwardly Global helped him understand that challenges are not always overcome easily but are indeed surmountable. The events he hosted for the non-profit, including a previously successful Kickstarter campaign, received press coverage in both the New York Times and New York Daily News. In his spare time, Adam is an avid crowdfunder, having backed nearly 300 Kickstarter projects.
Brian Gruber was the first director of marketing at C-SPAN where he hosted call-in shows with politically prominent guests such as Cesar Chavez, John McCain, and Nancy Pelosi. He founded and led FORA.tv, the world’s premiere thought leader video network, selected by TIME as one of the 50 best sites on the web, and livestreaming jazz network ShowGo.tv. Brian is a three-time author including the Kickstarter-funded “War: The Afterparty,” for which he traveled around the world to the scenes of a half century of U.S. military interventions to evaluate the human and economic costs of war from both ends of the gun barrel. His most recent book “Six Days at Ronnie Scott’s: Billy Cobham on Jazz Fusion and the Act of Creation” has garnered rave reviews from the world’s leading jazz, percussion, and music publications.
It is possible that our final subtitle or artwork may differ from these drafts.
Our itinerary may change due to unforeseen events over the next year.
Original source cover photo by Pierre Van Crombrugghe.
Original source stretch goal photo by Todd Diemer.
Book mockup template by Covervault; design by Adam Edwards.
The views expressed in this project do not necessarily reflect the views of any organizations listed above.

An old lady working all day to support her family
Hi Everyone,
    I am just a student who dreams to have my photobook be seen by everyone around the world. I will be photographing people and interview them with an interesting topic. 
An old man at Mount Bromo
     This year, I will be visiting Indonesia, Thailand and Taiwan for my December trip. My trip is more than just street photography because I am planning to do community services at the same time to understand the lifestyle of the people and get a better idea of their lifestyle before photographing them. My itinerary is being planned by my contact in the country itself.
----------------------------------------------------
12-17 December 2016, Malang, Indonesia:
Mount Bromo
I will be going to Mount Bromo which I had also visited last time but only able to spend a day there. I have seen a lot of people trying to earn their living with just renting out their horses for 10$SGD and they have to walk a few kilometre up and down hill with the person who rented the horse. Hence, I want to revisit the location to help out the local to improve their standard of living as well as increase their income if possible.
Horse Rental
**18 December 2016 - 2 Jan 2017, Bangkok, Thailand:
Thailand has just lost the King who had always been like a Father to them. There will be a lot of people going to the palace, queueing to show condolences to the late King. However, some people take advantage of this sad incident to make a business by raising the price of the essential things the people need for example, black t-shirt (used to be 2-4$ and now easily 20$), food and drinks. There are also people who could not afford to make their way down to Bangkok to say good-bye to the late King. Hence, I am planning to actually do a small documentary to see how the people feeling about all these after three months since the King has passed away.
**I will be spending in total around a week in Bangkok as I will be flying to Taiwan from Bangkok as it is cheaper than flying straight from either Singapore or Indonesia. 
A friendly hotdog seller
20-27 December 2016, Kaohsiung, Taiwan:
Taiwan has been affected by Typhoon for very long time due to the geographic location. However, the recent typhoon I had seen through photographs shared by my friends was horrible. I am planning to go to Kaohsiung and nearby city to see those people who are affected and could not afford to repair their house and pay hospital bills. I will be at the same time helping them to repair their home and photograph them. Furthermore, I am giving a free wedding photoshoot to a couple who cannot afford their dream pre-wedding shoot.
----------------------------------------------------
    This is my itinerary for the trip to help people and frame them up. I believe in understanding them first, before actually photograph them because we could be smiling and something might be killing us inside. 
     The true beauty of photography can be a lie to everybody's eyes.

The Story
 “I Have Something to Tell You," Adrain Chesser's biographical photo series, captures his loved one's reactions seconds after revealing to them he was HIV positive. Although the series was shot more than a decade ago, it has recently reached a much wider audience, having been picked up by sites like The Huffington Post, beautifuldecay.com,  among others. Adrain also gave a TED talk on the series and the events in his life that inspired it. In Adrain’s words, “I Have Something to Tell You” helped him overcome his childhood fear of abandonment by transforming the emotions that were stirring inside him into art. Adrain has always used photography as a way to better understand and interpret his life. "I Have Something to Tell You,"  is not just a photo series, it is an exploration of one artist's journey towards healing.
    In this short documentary, our vision is to not only share Adrain’s story in a cinematic way, but also to explore this notion of art as healing for the artist -- as a way of transforming emotions inside ourselves. We have already shot for one weekend with Adrain in his hometown. While there we captured some great b-roll and also several walking interviews. 
The Journey
We are now on to the final step of the production process and we need your help to see the project through. A majority of the film's content will be shot at Adrain's studio and home in Portland, OR. We came to Kickstarter to help fund this leg of the journey. Our expenses include transportation, lodging, food for the crew, equipment rental, insurance, music licensing, and film festival submission fees.  
The Team
We are a group of filmmakers from the Savannah College of Art & Design. We have spent the last several years cutting our teeth by making films together. 'I Have Something To Tell You" is a passion project of ours and a story that we really believe can positively impact people. But we can't do it alone. 
Dumaine Babcock // Director
Ben Joyner // Director of Photography, Producer
Zack Hetlage // Producer
Taylor MacDonald // Editor
The Rewards
In addition to an HD digital download of the completed film, a private link to our Kickstarter video blooper reel, and other digital rewards, we're also offering some signed copies of Adrain's work.
The first comes at a contribution of $250. It is a signed print from Adrain's series, "Orange Blossoms, Fire Ants, and the Tyranny of Memory." We have three different options available below.
The next reward at $500 is a signed copy of Adrain's book, THE RETURN. The work is about a group of people who are living nomadically. They travel with the seasons on what was referred to by first nations people as the “hoop”. Their idea is to live wild and free, untethered from society, to thrive by utilizing traditional hunter gatherer skills. The book itself was also accompanied by a kickstarter, which was successfully funded in December of 2013.
PREVIOUS WORK:
 Ben Joyner // Cinematography Reel 
Taylor MacDonald // Self-Portrait [Project for directing class]
"A Toast to Our Youth" // Produced by Dumaine Babcock
"Roast" // Footage from Zack's upcoming documentary project - "A Complex Cup"

Puc the Artist is set in a world where everything that exists, is drawn into existence. If you want a birthday cake, just master your pencil work, and draw yourself a birthday cake. Some are skilled at watercolor, some with charcoal or etchings. Each has their own unique ability to create...or destroy. But in this world of ink and artists something important and vibrant has been lost and forgotten - Color. Our story is about the happenstances of discovering it, and the problems three youths must deal with to return it to the world.  
Puc the Artist is a story about friendship, learning one's place in the grand scheme of things, and adventure. The story is planned with a complete beginning, middle, and end. This book will be the begging of the adventure. Just like how Star Wars: A New Hope, stand on it's own as a film. So too will the first Puc The Artist book. If we are so lucky to have the support, the story has room to expand into the other two arcs in the future.  
Garret and I are co-creating this story, so the same art team and writer will be on it the whole way threw. It's a labor of love for the both of us, with Garret being the originator of the character designs and look of this world. And Miles Greb plotting out the story and fleshing out the characters. 
The main book will be 66 pages, a hearty start to the story, and half of the first arch. However if you look below we have a REALLY great stretch goal in mind. 
If we reach the goal of $12,000 everyone getting a Puc The Artist comic will get an upgraded copy. Instead of printing the 66 page large size "Floppy" comic, we will instead be printing a graphic novel that is the full first arch of the story. I hope we can do this, as it gives everyone more for their money, and we get to tell the whole first arch with just one Kickstarter and with one book! So please be sure to share it around to help us reach this goal!   
Jay, Miles, Garret, Milsea, and Jamie.
Miles Greb - Writer, Co-creator - Former Bob Dylan impersonator who's obsession with Star Trek is annoying to everyone.  
Garrett Richer -  Illustrator - Co,Creator - The actual artist for the fictional Artist, non-fictionally. 
Jay Bendt - Illustrator- Fantasy loving hoarder of color pencils and coffee mugs. Draws pictures for a living.
Milsae Kim - Females. Strong females." I just love female characters so much :) 
Andrew Pierce -  Editor - Lovable goof. Escaped Kipling protagonist.
 An Orphan from the nomadic tribes of the Cold North. Separated from her family at a very young age Asta has had to learn to fend for herself. She has a quick temper, and picks fights with about everyone. Although some people in town think she is a bit cold, her close friends Tolo and Puc know she would do anything to protect them. She secretly wants to be a start her own Strawberry farm...but she won't ever tell anyone cause she has to keep up appearances.   
 Tolo is a son of a famous explorer and a famous artist. He grew up with stories of far off places from his mother, and watching his father paint images of them. His dream though, was to help others explore the world like his mother so Tolo became a Cartographer. Well, he is training to be one at-least. He carries with him a giant compass that can read the land, but also in a pinch move the ground before him.   
Well read, and more formally educated then his two friends, Tolo is normally the plan maker of the gang. 
 Puc spends his day at his drawing desk in his granddads basement. Introverted by nature, Puc has a good heart and often gets dragged outside by his friends. Even when they do get him to leave his drawing desk, he normally finds something to draw while out and about.  
 He is a Rat Burglar, pun intended. He makes his coin by bounty hunting, in turning in people for petite crimes. He travels with his ally Fink, a husky Mouse who is't the most sophiscated - but he is loyal.
