Ghostheads is a documentary that explores the extreme side of the Ghostbusters fandom, and looks back at the impact the franchise has had on the world over the past three decades. Through interviews with key cast and crew, including Dan Aykroyd, Ivan Reitman, Ernie Hudson and many more, as well as with Ghostbusters fans all over the world, Ghostheads presents countless humanizing stories that will connect with audiences about comradery, overcoming obstacles, and that no one should ever feel alone or isolated.
Ghostheads will show what really separates a fandom from the rest. Every Ghosthead is unique. Every Franchise is its own.
It's been over 30 years since Ghostbusters first premiered on the big screen back in 1984, with the film spawning generations of fans all over the world. We're looking to capture the magic these movies created by traveling to film the fans and get reactions from the cast and crew involved with the productions of the original film series, as well as the reboot releasing this summer.
Todd Whalen of the British Columbia Ghostbusters, travels more than half way across Canada to reunite with old friends/meet the Ontario Ghostbusters for the first time, all because they share the same Ghostbusters passion.
Tom Gebhardt of the New Jersey Ghostbusters, gets a visit of a lifetime as he Drives his Ecto-1 from Jersey to the set of the Ghostbusters (2016) film.
Alex Newborn of the Florence Ghostbusters, dives deep into his Ghostbusters hobby/passion as it spans almost 3 decades. We also get to see what it's like when a father spreads his love of the franchise to his two sons who then share the same passion as their father.
We're asking YOU to help us raise the remaining funds need for our Post-Production. Here is a breakdown of our budget:
35% - Animation
25% - Post-Production/Color Correction/Sound Mixing
35% - Licensing Fees
5% - Film Festival Fees
Thank you for visiting our Interdenominational cross-rip campaign page and taking a look into the interesting lives of extreme Ghostbuster fans known as "Ghostheads". Select which perk is best suited for yourself and slime your way into helping us complete this project.
                 ****ALL PRICES ARE IN U.S. DOLLARS ON THE IMAGES BELOW****
Share this Kickstarter campaign with your friends, Ghostbuster fans, co-workers, loved ones and possessed Carpathian paintings located your local museum. We cannot make this film without your support and we cannot thank you enough for that. 
Brendan Mertens ("Ghostheads", Director/Writer) has been involved with the online Ghostbusters community for some time as he hosted a Ghostbusters themed podcast. While pursuing the podcast in his spare time, he was able to meet Ghostbuster fans across the globe and see exactly how the Ghostbusters phenomenon had created generations of fans. With each country having multiple Ghostbusters chapters, Brendan noticed that each and every group was incredibly different from how they were run.
Tommy Avallone ("Ghostheads", Producer) is a producer and director known for Community College (2009), and I Am Santa Claus (2014). Tommy's been a lifelong fan of the Ghostbusters franchise and is using his expertise to elevate Ghostheads to a whole new level of film-making.
Lee Leshen ("Ghostheads", Producer) is the founder of Patchwork Media, and has produced the Back to the Future documentary Back in Time. Lee's cut his teeth in the film industry as he worked in the production finance area at Miramax Films and later, partnership marketing at The Weinstein Company.
Raymond Esposito ("Ghostheads", Executive Producer) is the co-founder of Old Lime Productions and has produced such films as Some Velvet Morning starring Stanley Tucci. Raymond has been a life-long Ghostbusters fan and has no problem strapping on a proton pack and suiting up to be apart of the Ghostheads team.
Kevin Sisti ("Ghostheads", Executive Producer) is the co-founder of Old Lime Productions and has produced such films as Some Velvet Morning starring Stanley Tucci.
Derrick Kunzer ("Ghostheads", Cinematographer) is known for his work on I am Santa Claus (2014), and the YouTube series Top Rope Tuesday (2015).
Jay MacKay ("Ghostheads", Art Director) is a Canadian Television graphics designer, video editor, podcaster and all around content creator on the ground floor.
Follow us on Twitter, Facebook and Instagram.
If you have any questions, comments or concerns about our Kickstarter campaign, the documentary or the rewards we have listed, then please contact us at brendan@ghostheadsmovie.com

Have you ever attended a wedding ceremony and reception? I mean not just any wedding but a good wedding! Do you remember how much fun it was to dress up, meet new people, witness love, and still have an amazing time. Or maybe you're like several people apart of this new growing trend that has never been invited to a wedding as an adult, let alone be a part of one. 
The Fake Wedding Experience is the solution to this problem.
The fake wedding experience will take place September 1, 2018. The fake wedding experience will offer everything a real wedding has to offer with the exception of "REEEEEEEAAAAAAAAAAALLLLLLL LOOVVVVVEEE". What is real love anyways? Who knows, and who cares? Not every guest at your wedding. Believe it or not most people go to weddings just for the food, the party, the show, to meet new people, and the experience. Thats is everything the Fake Wedding Experience will offer to its guest. 
The Wedding Program 
When the guest arrive they will be greeted and given a wedding program as if they where actually coming to a classy upscale wedding. When the guest walk in they will walk in to a light reception that is going on almost like a meet and greet. The ceremony will start 45 minutes into the event once everyone has arrived. 
The Ceremony 
The event will have a very dramatic ceremony with a twist. Since it is a fake wedding I think it is only right for it to have a theatrical side to it. One way this theatrical side will be highlighted will be in the wedding party. Everyone a part of the wedding party will be random people that have never met before. For example the best man, and the groomsmen, the maid of honor, and brides maid, even down to the parents of the bride and groom.  
When I market the event I will market it stating the first 50 people to purchase tickets will qualify to have a role in the wedding. 
The more serious roles like the groom, bride, and priest will be held by actual actors just for the sake of the show going as comically smooth as possible.
While the ceremony is happening there will be a plot twist, for example the groom may never show up and the bride marries the priest or maybe the maid of honor is in love with the groom and she speaks up about her feelings at the alter. The married couple will be presented (Whoever ends up getting married)So many potential plot twist just to keep it funny and fun.
After the ceremony the actual reception will start and there will be a bride and groom first dance, a toast and speech by the best man and maid of honor, cake cutting, father daughter dance, mother son dance, more partying and of course no wedding is complete without the garter and bouquet toss. (Each one will  have a twist in some way) 
This amazing event will offer every single thing any other wedding has to offer except "REEEEEEEAAAAAAAAAAALLLLLLL LOOVVVVVEEE"
What will the funds go towards?
 $2,000 will go towards the venues that it is in the center of downtown Little Rock, Arkansas 
$ 2,000 will go towards the experience dj that has hosted over 3000 events in his career. 
$ 1,500 will go towards marketing; Flyers, Social Media Advertisements, and Radio Advertisement. If we exceed the desired goal then I am hoping to lease a billboard. 
$ 1,500 will go towards decorations for the event.
There are other things that will need funded that I plan on funding out of pocket and as we continue to sell tickets  for example. Drinks, food, photographer, and photo booth with fun props.
P.S. 
Link to part of where I got the idea from 
https://www.nytimes.com/2017/11/05/world/americas/argentina-fake-wedding-falsa-boda.html
https://www.vice.com/en_us/article/mvkq4y/fake-weddings-argentina
You monetize by selling tickets. $35 a ticket with open bar. Everyone will pay to attend an event like this. Reinvest the proceeds, have another event, and build a brand. Eventually license it out(thats the long goal). Or simply travel the US and host one every other month or so. Business created! Nothing is simple but definitely POSSIBLE. AND A PROVEN BUSINESS MODEL MAKES IT EVEN BETTER.

Forgotten Roots is a fantasy comic about five white-haired guys trying to reunite their country after the fall of their gods, but being absolutely horrible at their jobs because of their own shortcomings and interference from outside forces.
Forgotten Roots has been a free-to-read webcomic since 2014, but it's now ready to see the world as a fully realized graphic novel, featuring the first three chapters of the story and additional worldbuilding tidbits. This Kickstarter campaign is meant to fund the production of Volume 1, which will be a 250+ page, full color graphic novel.
This first volume follows Scaevus and Durantes as they travel to the sleepy town of Zenidian and are now involved with the nefarious plotting of the Gebara family and a thief by the name of Kier, who is being hunted for the theft of an ancient artifact. All the while, Scaevus struggles with the grief stemming from the death of his husband, Korvin.
Forgotten Roots is ripe with representation for marginalized people - featuring Queer characters, characters of color, and disabled characters. I’ve published the first two chapters as individual books out of pocket for the past 2 years, but I have launched this Kickstarter campaign to help make Volume 1 happen. Volume 1 consists of the first three chapters of Forgotten Roots. Here are some examples of some of the pages in the comic.

The Project
The Last Incantation is an independent short film (approximately 20 minutes long) based on the short story by Clark Ashton Smith. The film has been shot but we are looking for post-production funds to finish the film and submit the film to film festivals and other venues. With your help, we hope that The Last Incantation will be the first in a whole line of Weird Tale and Cosmic Horror film adaptations.
Background
Andrew Migliore, after sitting on his script for over 10 years, felt it was high time that the rich bounty of Clark Ashton Smith's work be brought to the screen. Woodruff Laputka, having read the script, said, "We can totally do this!" The rest as we say is history.
The Last Incantation is a short story about Malygris, a necromancer, who has learned all that there is to learn, having mastered all occult lore, all forbidden knowledge, and having dominion over the spirits of earth and sea and air... and the living and the dead. But there is still one lesson he has yet to learn with the last incantation.
Our many thanks goes out to author Scott Connors and the Clark Ashton Smith Estate for supporting this project.
Malygris (played by actor Brian Hutton) calling forth Nylissa.
The Unforgotten Author
Clark Ashton Smith was a poet, sculptor, painter and author of fantasy, horror and science fiction who was one of the major contributors to the golden age of Weird Tales magazine in the late 1920s through the late 1930s. He was in good company with Robert E. Howard and H.P. Lovecraft.
Getting advice from a daemon familiar is always a tricky proposition.
 “As for the problem of phantasy, my own standpoint is that there is absolutely no justification for literature unless it serves to release the imagination from the bounds of every-day life.” — Clark Ashton Smith

I am thrilled to welcome you to my first Kickstarter campaign to bring my book to life!  
I need your support for my dream to come true to help save the arts and provide visual literacy in the 21st Century!
Why?
Visual literacy is:
understanding what you see
a form of critical thinking
what it means to be literate in the digital age
It is more important than ever before that we have this ability.   Consider how technology continues to give us more ways to communicate and evoke emotion using images.  
The paradox is, that the revolution in visual communication is happening at a time of drastic cuts to the Arts and Arts Education.   
The book, Art For All Ages, is my response to this paradox.  
Why this book?   Why now?
Because making art in the way presented in this book, is a real path for anyone to become confident and knowledgeable in discussing and making visual decisions.   
Help me get my book, Art For All Ages, out to the world!  I need your support!
To help cover:
Quality color printing
Graphic design formatting
Proofreading costs
Copyright of famous museum artists
The goal for publication of this book is ambitious.   With your help, though, I know we can make it happen!
The activities within Art For All Ages are designed to be interactive and multi-generational, with experiences that can be shared with young and old, siblings, support groups, best friends, children with parents and grandparents, couples, and adult friends.
While each activity can be done alone, the full benefit emerges within an interactive group.  How better to reach as wide an audience as possible?
Three Generations, AKA "3 gens"
From the book...
Making visual decisions is an increasingly valuable skill.   Yet so many of us are stuck in the the belief that we are not creative.   
"I'm not an artist.  I can't even draw a stick figure."  
Have you ever had such thoughts?   Throughout my 35 years of teaching, I've heard similar frustrations from young students and high school athletes to my 71 year old neighbor, attorneys and others at art gatherings in my studio.   All were initially held back by preconceived notions of what their art "should" look like. 
"Every child is an artist.  The problem is staying an artist when you grow up."                              - Pablo Picasso
An everyday miracle is available within these pages.   Just as exercise physically activates endorphins that reduce stress and make us feel great, making art, as presented, can produce a similar experience that I call, "Pizzazz of the Heart." 
Self Discovery
Where are you now?
By now you can see that this is not just another art book!   Art For All Ages is truly a hybrid of genres:
 Art History:   Art history is an important component within this book.  However, Art For All Ages is more than just a survey of finished art or bodies of work.  Few books on art history teach the art process; none guide the artist's experience. 
 Art Therapy: I am passionate about nurturing the artists' experience: an energized focus, feelings of reconnection and centeredness that are, above all, therapeutic.    
 How-to Art Instruction: Art For All Ages is a visual step by step rendering of how to create quality art.   The book's focus on the artist's experience is unique.   It differs in other ways as well.   For example, Art For All Ages DOES NOT in any way resemble a paint by number book as do many in the "how-to" genre.  
 New Age - Self Discovery: The meditative states cultivated in Art For All Ages are addressed in some "new age" books, with a key difference: Art For All Ages is easily accessible and fun!
 Coffee Table Book: Best of all, Art For All Ages is a beautiful, color-printed book filled with original artwork by me, my former students and great renowned fine artists.   It can be on display or shared as a wonderful gift!
 Art For All Ages is organized into three mutually integrated parts as follows:
Recipes for Success
The activity lessons in Art For All Ages are time-tested -- selected from the visual curriculum that I developed over 35 years teaching arts in public schools and privately to adults and multi-generational groups.    Art history is an important component, seamlessly woven into the activity lessons. 
Essential Ingredients
Each recipe calls for its own Essential Ingredients, one or more art skills that you will use to complete the recipe's activity.  Adults (or adults with children) can dive into the book at any point to find inspiration, choose activities, and acquire skills in easily accessible ways.
Sample pages from the book
Self-discovery Vignettes
Self-discovery pieces are scattered throughout, such as "The Art of Aging" and "The Universal Age of Symbols."  Some are fact-based, like "Harmony of the Brain," which invites you to the awareness that you are inherently creative and artistic.  Others are more inspirational, like "Mindfulness, Meditation, and Art," which describes the feelings and focus of reconnection that you can experience while you are making art.  
This is the only book that provides exceptional, how-to instruction while also nurturing and guiding the wholistic experiences available to anyone making art in the way presented.   

About the Author
Art For All Ages author, Corinne Miller Schaff (AKA, Mrs. Art) taught art for over 35 years in the public schools primarily in Irvine Unified School District.   With both an undergrad (Indiana University) and a masters degree (Stanford University) in Art Education, she is highly qualified to pay forward her passion for the artistic process by offering experiences, skills and techniques.   
Cori is also a juried artist whose work is found in galleries, homes and businesses throughout the country.   Her commitment is to make the transformative artist experience - the Pizzazz of the Heart - an everyday miracle for students of all ages. 
Why I need your support:
Printing and development costs for this book have been substantial.   I have funded approximately a third of the project to date including a designer's fee to format the book, professional proofreader fees to perfect the editing, and securing copywriting and digital fees.  I need help to get the book printed and distributed.  I need your Kickstarter support to make this a reality.
Any overage contribution from the campaign goal will be used for additional printings.  I intend to reach out to schools for book signings and contribute a percentage of the profits in support of art education programs!
In return for supporting my cause, please check out the various rewards as my gift to you. See more at Corinne Designs. 
PLAY

Thank you for your support to make my dream a reality!
With gratitude,
art4all.me

Victoria Van Arnam is a Renaissance festival performer specializing in Celtic and medieval music on the hammered dulcimer. 
Victoria Van Arnam è un'artista del festival del Rinascimento specializzata in musica celtica e medievale sul cembalo Scozzese.
After growing up visiting the local renaissance festival in Gainesville, Florida, Victoria fell in love with the hammered dulcimer and musics of the period. Since 2013 she has been performing on the dulcimer and has been touring since 2016 all across the United States and Italy.
What is Tranquil Tones?
Tranquil Tones is Victoria’s seventh album and long awaited solo endeavor. After many requests for an album with “JUST dulcimer” this is the one. The album will feature twelve traditional and popular instrumental tunes. “Bella Ciao” and “Ashokan’s Farewell” will be featured on this album. Victoria's music has often been described as "incredibly soothing" and "great to relax with."
2019 Tour
Why support this project?
Victoria tours with the specific goal of exposing as many people as possible to the wonders of the hammered dulcimer and the joys of traditional music. “Keep the music alive” is the driving force behind this album and her continued efforts to perform in live settings. 
 What are the Rewards: 
T-Shirt: The Hammered-Dulcimer-Head Shark T-Shirt is designed by Britta Miller and is an absolute masterpiece. This is a custom commissioned design, brand new for this project. These will be printed in white ink on black shirts. Tank tops will be available. Pictured below is a DRAFT of the design.
Artwork and Shirt not final
Six Previous Albums: These are offered either as a download or on a custom “The Lady Victoria” wooden USB on a lanyard. They all have heavy hammered dulcimer influence with a wide variety of textures. 
Celtic Folk albums by her first project Jig to a Milestone, The Adventures of Dulcimer Girl and Captain Tin Whistle (2013) and Crawford's Pub (2015). Soothing instrumental albums with her second band Dancing Hammers: Tuning Point (2016) and Nostalgic Christmas (2016). Her most recent album, Dulcet Dreams (2017) includes accompaniment by guitar, banjo, bass and bodhran. And the Incredible musical theater style adventure with Thomas Leidenfrost in Beyond the Hills (2018).
All Six Previous Albums packed on one drive!
Wooden USB Drive, Loaded with six previous albums!
 Pins and Stickers: High quality vinyl stickers and a standard tin badge, (actual pin sent may vary, but these are in stock right now. )
Artwork on stickers and pins by Lily Hufnagel.
Stretch Goal
Enamel pin: If this project receives $4000 in funding all orders will receive an enamel pin as an upgrade from the current tin badge style pin.
Where will the funding go?
Making an album has all sorts of hidden costs, here is the best estimation of the budget for this project so far. ( "~" Indicates approximated amounts.)
$1,800 Recording
~$1,500 Mixing/Mastering
$800 Printing Physical CDs
~$500 Other merchandise / T-shirts
~$300 Kickstarter/Processing fees

~$100 shipping
What is the timeline for this project?
The album has already been recorded in Cincinnati, Ohio, by DaShane Watkins. It will be mixed and mastered by Jacob Lawson (who worked on previous dulcimer projects Dulcet Dreams and Nostalgic Christmas). Printing will be by Copycats Media. Processing time on printing the album and merchandise will put the album ready to be shipped late January, early February 2020 at the latest.
Thank You
Thank you for checking out this Kickstarter, if you are a return supporter, thank you for your help along the way, every little bit helps when it comes to keeping live music alive.

From Dead Mouse Productions and the Producer of 'Leviathan: The Story of Hellraiser & Hellbound: Hellraiser II', comes the new 'Fright Night' documentary 'You're So Cool, Brewster! The Story of Fright Night'.
The Story of Fright Night will feature detailed interviews with those who helped shape and create this much loved movie. Guided by Tom Holland (Fright Night, Child's Play, Psycho II, Class of 1984) the makers of this new documentary will raise the stakes and unearth the behind the scenes stories including footage and images from Tom's personal archives.
Fully supported and produced by original Fright Night writer and director Tom Holland, this documentary is the ultimate insight into the making of this cult classic movie as well as a tribute to the late, great Roddy McDowall.
TOM HOLLAND (PRODUCER/CREATIVE CONSULTANT)  
Living legend and all-round movie genius Holland is a writer, director and actor. Holland is best known for directing and writing horror movies like 'Psycho II' (1983), 'Fright Night' (1985), 'Child's Play' (1988) and 'Thinner' (1996).
GARY SMART (PRODUCER/WRITER)
In 2010 Smart co-authored the book ‘The Complete History of the Return of the Living Dead’ along with Christian Sellers. The following year Smart and Sellers were asked by documentary maestro Thommy Hutson to pen the documentary ‘More Brains! A Return to the Living Dead’. In 2013 Smart commenced work as Producer and Writer of the epic 9 hour documentary ‘Leviathan: The Story of Hellraiser and Hellbound: Hellraiser II’.
CHRISTOPHER GRIFFITHS (DIRECTOR)
A movie aficionado and skilled editor, Griffiths will make his directorial debut with ‘You’re So Cool, Brewster!’ after associate producing ‘‘Leviathan: The Story of Hellraiser and Hellbound: Hellraiser II’ as well as being chief editor on all 9 bonus documentaries. Griffiths is also Assistant Producer for a UK Television company.
KIERAN NOLAN JONES (ASSISTANT PRODUCER/DIRECTOR OF PHOTOGRAPHY)
Nolan Jones recently joined Dead Mouse Productions and has already shown his skills and expertise for film. Nolan Jones has worked on a number of high profile UK commercials and is currently developing a number of documentary and feature projects.
ADAM EVANS (LINE PRODUCER)
Evans honed his skills as Line Producer on ‘Leviathan: The Story of Hellraiser and Hellbound: Hellraiser II’ and ensured the smooth and efficient running of the production both in the UK and USA. Evans is also the co-director of Cult Screenings UK Ltd and Dead Mouse Productions Ltd with Smart.
LITO VELASCO (COMPOSER)
Talented composer Velasco is best known for his work on 'Never Sleep Again: The Elm Street Legacy' (2010), 'More Brains! A Return to the Living Dead' (2011) and 'Found' (2012). Velasco joined the production team of ‘Leviathan: The Story of Hellraiser and Hellbound: Hellraiser II’ in 2014 as composer and scored an amazingly haunting soundtrack.
Featuring interviews with key members of the cast and crew! (many more to be added)
AND MANY MORE TO BE ANNOUNCED SOON......

Featuring actor Simon Bamford (Hellraiser, Nightbreed, Books of Blood) as the documentary's host 'Peter Vincent - The Great Vampire Killer' with special makeup effects by Stuart Conran (Shaun of the Dead, Braindead, Hellraiser, Saving Private Ryan).
Produced by Dead Mouse Productions Ltd, Leviathan: The Story of Hellraiser and Hellbound: Hellraiser II (2015) proved that an independent documentary supported solely by the fans and a dedicated team of filmmakers can result in a fully detailed retrospective documentary.
Leviathan was a 3-disc, 9 hour treat for Hellraiser fans, the intention is to give Fright Night the same respect and treatment.
There are lots of fantastic rewards for those who pledge such as, Posters, Thanks, copies of the DVD, T-Shirts, Documentary credits and much more.

The Quad Traverse (that's a working title, by the way) will be a documentary film about three regular guys trying to do something nobody's ever done before: ascend and descend New Hampshire's Mount Washington four times from four different directions in twenty-four hours...in winter.

Specifically, the film will cover three Maine residents and definitely-not-professional mountaineers, Charlie, Rick, and Barrett, as they attempt to prepare physically and mentally for the biggest athletic challenge, and possibly the biggest psychological challenge, of their lives. They'll face extreme cold, high winds, night climbing, and a course that'll see them cover 29 miles and ascend more than 15,000 feet. That's (roughly) like moving a marathon distance while covering the elevation gain of Mount Everest (base camp to summit), all on a mountain that's famous for having the worst weather on earth. 

We're aiming for a runtime of around 30 minutes. Sounds awesome, right? Then help us make it happen and we'll give you some cool stuff in return!
      For full details on all of the available rewards, check the column on the right side of the screen → → →
  I'm Charlie, one of the three guys attempting this crazy climb, and I'll be directing the film. I'm an experienced editor, videographer, and animator. I previously wrote, produced, directed, and edited the feature-length documentary Living with Dead Hearts. It was pretty well-received, but that was also way back in 2013. I've learned a ton in the years since, and I'm confident this film is going to be even better.
We're financing the climb ourselves, and I have most of the software and equipment needed to make the film, so we don't need much. We're aiming for $1,500, which would help us cover a couple additional necessary pieces of equipment (lenses and lights). Anything beyond that is gravy, and will be put towards improving the quality of the film!

Note: Kickstarter is all or nothing. If we don't make that $1,500, we get $0.
Well, aside from showing it to all of our lovely backers, our hope is to get it into adventure and mountain film festivals across the country and across the world. We plan to donate any profits the film* makes to environmental nonprofit organizations. Our goal here isn't making money, it's telling a story about how it's possible to achieve a lofty athletic goal, even if you - like us - aren't a pro, but just a weekend warrior with a dream. 
* Note: This is our plan, but it's not part of this Kickstarter campaign, as Kickstarter doesn't allow accepting donations for charity. If you choose to donate to this campaign, your money will go towards helping us make this film a reality. Your donation to this film is not tax deductible.

Like many of us, I use Facebook as a conglomerate of news sites so that I can get a breadth of perspectives as I develop my opinions. 
Given the growing distrust of news sites in the U.S., I have been searching for a site that would present multiple news stories side-by-side, for my to do a direct comparison on how stories are being reported. 
This stems from an experience with two major news sites last winter: 
1. Fox News reported a front page story about a man who was targeted for having a "Blue Lives Matter" bumper sticker. His truck was vandalized -- the culprits spray-painted "Black Lives Matter" on his truck, smashed the windows, broke lights... 
KICKER: When I cross-checked this story on CNN's site, it was nowhere to be found! 
2. A couple days later, CNN reported a front page story about a man who was caught by police trying to cash in on the "Black Lives Matter" movement when he could no longer afford his truck payments, so he vandalized his truck himself in an attempt to collect insurance (apparently the truck owner went back and did more damage to his truck after CSI took their initial crime scene photographs)! 
KICKER: When I cross-checked this story on Fox News' site, it was nowhere to be found! 
Out of this the idea for a comparative news site was born. I have researched legalities around streaming news sources. Legally, a "news aggregator" like this passes the 'fair use' test because the site is "transformative" in nature (see Perfect 10, Inc. v. Amazon.com, Inc.). 
There is nobody doing a site like this!! Let's get it up and running so that the PEOPLE can form their own opinions through the muck of biased reporting! I have purchased a URL for the site: uDecideNews.com. Now we need to get working on the design of the site itself!
I want to build in algorithms for streaming top stories based on trending hashtags (#'s) or keywords, allowing the user to select various news icons on a sidebar, enter a search term and be presented with all stories related to that keyword coming from the news outlets selected. 
Let's make a platform for comparative news stories!!

Why an artist residency?
The residency at GlogauAIR would give me the opportunity to work within a new space and culture and interact with different people and their ideas to extend my own thoughts and practice. The three months would give me the opportunity to focus on my process and work through some ideas I have been thinking about as well as simply reacting to a new space. 
As I am very interested in our relationship with spaces and create very site specific work, I am dependant on having new places to react to in order to make work, making residencies a very important structure for my practice. While this residency is unfunded, beginning with a residency such as this will be an important stepping stone to me being able to make a living for myself as a practising artist.
Artist Statement
My work explores the physical experience of architecture; looking at the way individuals as bodies move about spaces in order to investigate the three-way relationship between body, space and work. I am particularly interested in the spaces we don’t usually look at, use or think about, for instance the ceiling and spaces above our heads. Through my work I look at breaking the habits people have within architectural spaces to alter the way they move about or look at the space. Rather than setting up internal relationships within the work and creating my own spaces, I seek to alter the existing space by creating a relationship between the work and the architecture. 
Recently I have been working by installing columns into spaces. These works transcend objectness, sculpture and installation to become part of the architecture, dictating the way in which the space is used without the viewer realising. It is important that these interventions are not directly looked at except in the way the existing walls, floor and ceiling are as the work becomes the relationship between the columns and the existing architecture and the user’s experience of it.
Untitled (column) 2013
Column 2013 in progress
Working drawing for Column 2013
Working drawing for Column 2013
For more examples of my work and to see my full artist CV, please visit www.libbyireland.co.uk.
About GlogauAIR
In GlogauAIR artists from diverse social and geographical backgrounds find a place to develop their works in a dynamic environment of cooexistence, exchange of ideas and internationalization. At the same time they get to know a new culture and landscape in Berlin, getting influences from the city, which has become a pioneer place for contemporary culture.
The non profit organization GlogauAIR was founded by the Spanish artist Chema Alvargonzález in 2006 with the intention to create a meeting point between artists from all disciplines to work in collaboration, expanding their practice in terms of materials, formats and style. The processes are shown every three months in an open studios exhibition where the public can see the works of the resident artists in a relaxed and festive event.  
Parallel to the Residency Programme and the open studios we organise activities and exchange projects in collaboration with other institutions such as Videoart, Sound Art or Performance Festivals, exhibitions or artist presentations, where we invite local public, art lovers and professionals.  
Artists from all artistic disciplines (installation, video art, net.art, sculpture, creative writing, architecture, electronic music, painting, drawing, performance, photography, etc.) are invited to come as far as their project fits with our installations. Fourth times a year the artists can apply with a project for a residency for three or six months.
The applications are evaluated by a jury formed by professionals from the Berlin art community. Moreover some artists are selected and granted by different institutions in their home countries, with which we have collaboration agreements.

Since moving to Baltimore half a decade ago, I have been fascinated with the convention scene of the area. Having lived in San Diego previously, I found the cons of Maryland, much more diverse in their audience and make up. For the last few years I have been involved in the convention scene in many roles: as an attendee, artist, vendor, panelist, community guest, department head, and senior staffer. During that time I have been researching the story of these events and have interviewed the people who run them.
The story of pop culture conventions is a fascinating one. Using the conventions of Maryland and DC as an entry point, I plan to put together a history book that details the history of such cons in the context of how they have affected fandoms, their host cities, and their various industries. However, as much passion as I have for this project, such a task is time consuming and I am not sure this niche topic will find an audience. Therefore I have launched a Kickstarter to gauge the public interest in such a history book. If this sounds like something that interests you, feel free to show your support by donating to the project. Even if you can’t, if you have interesting con experiences, we would love to know. Tell us your story.
Fandom Con History Comic Book 
For Phase I will be a mixed comic and text booklet on the history of Maryland's and DC's fan culture and connecting subjects. Each section of this history book plans to look at specific cons, divided by type and era. The first section looks at fandoms in a historical context. It looks at the centuries old argument whether fandoms and the entertainment arts are pure escapism or serve a fundamental human purpose.
The main body of this book is divided into six sections. Each section will be divided into three parts. The first part will be an introduction to the specific fandom and industry and its influence leading the next section on the list. Next, a belief overview of the historical formation of the different cons. Then finally the main part of each section focuses on the local cons themselves, the people who run them, the city that hosts them, and the years of stories from attendees.

Alex and I (EC) founded an improv comedy team at our high school in the Fall of our Junior year. The past two years have been amazing, and we have turned a good profit! The downside? All profit goes to the drama department of our school, which is GREAT...buttttttttt, Alex and I are now seniors and about to go off to college. We will be leaving behind our team where we trained sixteen students on a weekly basis to perform gut-busting improv comedy shows!
We both had an idea to begin a comedy club downtown here in our homeland of JOHNSON CITY, TENNESSEEEEEEE *faint, yet dramatic echo*, but the issue arose that with how we are working, it will be many years before we can save up the money to even begin opening up our club, and as of the past twenty years, downtown Johnson City (actually, the entire city) hasn't had a good comedy club!
We have found an excellent building, but as of right now, that's it. We don't have the necessary funds to build a stage, buy chairs and tables, or even fix up the electrical in the building for that matter, so we are asking for YOUR help!
We plan to teach improvisational comedy classes as well as perform improv comedy shows every weekend, and hopefully begin doing sketch comedy as we further the club!
Our shows will be family friendly except for a "No Holds Barred" Comedy Show late Saturday nights.
Alex and I both will begin college in September in 2017, so we would like to begin the process of building sets, running lights, and everything we can do as soon as possible, so we can open by (HOPEFULLY) Spring of 2018!
Alex is going to study Performing Arts at East Tennessee State University while I plan on beginning my Business major at Northeast State Community College (and eventually transferring to ETSU after two years).
The two of us have both been doing improv all of our lives and have won many awards in competitive improv including 4th place out of 72 improv teams at a Tennessee State Tournament this past year!
Alex and I want to provide top notch improvisational comedy to audiences both locally and to those travelers who are coming to visit!

Between Worlds is the story of a knight cast out of her kingdom, falsely accused of Witchcraft. Her punishment? A shattering self, of memories, of identity and of home. Her sanctuary? A city of witches, incense, crystals and enchantments. Only issue is, she has no idea how she got there, not to mention, she HATES witches. She'll have to learn to make some friends if she wants to start a new life, and survive it.
A few pages from the completed comic
This special edition hardback is in celebration of 10 years since the launch of Between Worlds. Since 2009, it has lived in and on various formats until I took it down in retirement. The entire comic totals over 300 pages. This is to be the definitive version of Between Worlds.
As it is a webcomic created over such a span of time, there's a fair amount of fixing, primping and polish needed to bring it into our current, terrifying world. 
The majority of this work is basic reformatting and re-lettering in order to make it consistent (and pretty)
I also plan to give some of the rougher pages a little bit of a polish, though I don't plan on any significant changes or rewriting as that tends to be a bit of a creative black hole/Sisyphean nightmare. The aim of the game is collecting and presenting this comic in the smartest way possible.
If this project is funded, it'll enable me to take that time to format all 300+ pages into a beautiful book you'll be proud to have on your shelf.
The book I'm planning will be an A5 (148mm x 210mm) casebound hardcover book and will be a whopping 350(approx) pages.
Mockup, cover artwork is not final

Beyond A Thousand Hills
Beyond A Thousand Hills will take you on a powerful visual journey through contemporary Rwanda. From inspiring entrepreneurs to captivating landscapes, explore the untold stories creating one of Africa’s most exciting destinations.
Using the power of photography over a 12 month period, award winning photographer Cate Gunn and innovation expert and adventurer John Gunn, intimately documented the local people, businesses and projects that are shaping the future of Rwanda.
Through an official partnership with the African Entrepreneur Collective and by working closely with local development initiatives, they discovered a unique entrepreneurial culture that’s become the beating heart of a rapidly progressing but often misunderstood nation.
Beyond A Thousand Hills will visually document that culture and its manifestation across all aspects of Rwandan life.
By funding this book, you'll be helping to create and publish the first photographic celebration of modern day Rwanda.
A Unique Photography Book
Beyond A Thousand Hills: Edition of 1000 
Photographs: 250 photos will cover 20 fully narrated chapters, each exploring a unique aspect of contemporary Rwanda.
Size: 36cm x 36cm, hard-back with approximately 150 pages
The Authors
Cate Gunn
Cate is a published and award winning travel and arts photographer. With a background in Sociology & Collaborative Arts, and a passion for community and culture. She has spent time living in the UK, Africa and Asia.
Her work is largely humanitarian, and the majority of her photography focuses on capturing the essence of people and the unique places in which they live. Cate also facilitates participatory photography projects, working therapeutically with the camera to promote well being and positive social change.
Capturing the true nature of Rwanda’s inhabitants and culture, Cate continues to explore a visual documentation of the changing face of Rwanda. 
Visit Captured Once Photography
  John Gunn 
John is a British Adventurer, Endurance Athlete and Innovation Expert. He has a passion for entrepreneurship and in the summer of 2016, he partnered with Cate and the African Entrepreneur Collective to found Run Rwanda, a pioneering 450km run across Rwanda with an ambitious objective to shine a light on a unique culture of entrepreneurship in the country.
Voted by the City of London as one of the 50 most inspirational people in London, John is a Fellow at the Royal Geographical Society and a regular commentator in the adventure press.
As co-author of Beyond A Thousand Hills, he is tasked with sharing the infections spirit of Africa's first entrepreneurial state.
Example Chapter Summaries
Introducing Africa's First Entrepreneurial State
Rwanda: a country nearly always judged by its tragic past and a destination not traditionally on tourists’ bucket lists.
Dig a little deeper, however, and you will find an exciting, evolving nation that is taking a unique approach to growth and development. Redefining what it means to be an entrepreneur, Rwanda is living up to its name as Africa’s First Entrepreneurial State. It is a fitting title for a country where a business can be started in 48 hours and children are taught entrepreneurship as part of the national curriculum. 
By 2020 the Rwandan Government aims to transform the country from a low-income, agricultural based economy to a middle-income, knowledge-based, service-oriented economy. A strong commitment to entrepreneurship as a driver for 21st century growth guides this aim. 
In 2016, award-winning photographer Cate Gunn and innovation specialist John Gunn partnered with the African Entrepreneur Collective in Rwanda to visually explore the untold stories fuelling one of Africa’s fastest growing economies.
Entrepreneurship From The Bottom Up
Entrepreneurs start young in Rwanda; the county's youth have been given the responsibility to dive economic growth and development as well as to build a culture of entrepreneurship from the bottom up.
In 2007, a series of entrepreneurship education programmes were developed for secondary schools that aimed to encourage a more entrepreneurial culture, transforming individuals and social norms.
By 2012, all secondary schools in the country were teaching entrepreneurship. Children as young as 11 were encouraged to develop entrepreneurial attitudes and taught how to identify and manage business opportunities as well as how to start and manage a business.
Over a million children had taken the course within its first two years.
 Rwanda's Digital City
Kigali, Rwanda’s charismatic and orderly capital city is leading the country’s digital revolution. 
Located in Rwanda’s centre and home to over a million people, Kigali is becoming known as an incubator for innovation. Across the city’s sprawling hills, budding entrepreneurs can choose from a selection of Innovation Hubs to network, cross-pollinate ideas and build their businesses. 
From SafeMotos, an Uber-esque moto-taxi company created to improve motorcycle taxi safety (80% of all road accidents in Kigali involve ‘motos'), to Jumia Food, Rwanda’s fast growing food service app and equivalent to Deliveroo, the clean and developed capital is home to more than a handful of Africa’s most exciting digital entrepreneurs.
Pioneering Conservation
The country's entrepreneurial culture has helped to drive innovation across every district.
Rwanda is now, for instance, leading the way in pioneering wildlife conservation. Home to three national parks, the biggest conservation success story lies deep in the forests of the Virunga Volcanoes. Discovered in 1902, Rwanda’s mountain gorillas – the world’s largest primate – have since suffered constant persecution. 
Critically endangered, an innovative conservation initiative has helped rebuild the remaining population. Centred on inclusive and sustainable eco-tourism, a limited number of highly priced tracking permits have been made available, providing the funds to protect the gorillas day and night with armed security. 
While offering a once-in-a-lifetime encounter for guests, 5% of all permit revenues are invested back into the local community, providing infrastructure and employment across the northwest region of Rwanda. 
Celebrated as one of the world’s best conservation case studies, the mountain gorillas are now the only primate species in the world that are increasing in numbers.
Innovation In Sport
Innovation in Rwanda stretches beyond the private sector. 
The Rwanda Cricket Stadium Foundation is currently constructing the country’s first international standard cricket facility on a 4.5-hectare plot on the outskirts of Kigali. By providing a green and pleasant environment where Rwandans of all ages can learn and improve their cricket, their mission is to provide people with skills they can use in their wider lives and, ultimately – on a broader scale – help promote reconciliation.
 For the Discerning Traveller
Over the last decade, Rwanda has emerged as a leading tourist destination in Africa.
This unique gem nestled in the heart of East Africa offers an evocative and enlightening lens on humanity, progression and conservation of natural beauty. From a turbulent past Rwanda has risen with unrivalled stamina and welcomes exploration, foreign investment and tourism with open arms.
Rwanda offers the discerning traveller a diverse range of experiences unparalleled on the continent. While wildlife enthusiasts can enjoy open-top jeep safaris across Akagera National Park, in search of lions, Hikers can explore the riches of Nyungwe Forest and Volcanoes National Parks. That’s not to mention the volcano crater lakes, age old mountain gorillas and a thriving capital city, Kigali.
  Rewards
Beyond A Thousand Hills Postcards: Cate's favourite images from the book will be translated into unique Beyond A Thousand Hills Postcards.
Beyond A Thousand Hills Prints: Choose from a large selection of limited edition 30cm x 20cm high quality prints from Beyond A Thousand Hills, ready to be mounted and framed.
Beyond A Thousand Hills: Enjoy the book itself, and be one of the first to receive Beyond A Thousand Hills, a unique hard-back coffee table photography book
Beyond A Thousand Hills Framed Print: Receive a limited edition fully mounted and framed, signed and numbered print, delivered ready to take pride of place on your wall.
Beyond A Thousand Hills Photography Lesson: Enjoy a 4 hour photography lesson with award winning photographer Cate Gunn. The lesson will need to take place in the UK (travel expenses outside of London not included).
Beyond A Thousand Hills Exhibition: Enjoy a fully installed 7 day, Beyond A Thousand Hills Photography Exhibition, curated by Cate Gunn. The exhibition will include 40 captioned images mounted across 22 independently standing boards, ideal for both public or private spaces. 
Stretch Goals
The £4,500 goal set will cover design, production and printing costs for Beyond A Thousand Hills. Once we hit target, we have the opportunity to increase the impact of the project through stretch goals!
If we raise in excess of £6,500 we'll be in a position to fund an official book launch, combined with a Beyond A Thousand Hills photography exhibition in Kigali, Rwanda.
A launch and exhibition will help to generate increased awareness as we continue to scale the project by working with East African tourist boards and local retailers.
Partners
The unique access to some of Rwanda's most exciting and inspiring stories wouldn't have been possible without the Beyond A Thousand Hills partners, based in Rwanda. 
The African Entrepreneur Collective (AEC) was founded in Rwanda in 2012, as a collection of Business Accelerators that support local entrepreneurs to drive job growth across the country.
AEC Accelerators partner with young entrepreneurs to build their skills, expand their networks, and grow their businesses so that they may employ others. Since launch, the model has already helped to create over 1200 jobs.
Akagera Aviation is one of Rwanda's leading aviation companies, with a unique fleet of helicopters offering services ranging from medical evacuation, wildlife surveying and national pilot training. Akagera Aviation have partnered with Beyond A Thousand Hills by offering unique aerial photography opportunities.
  Go Kigali was founded by Eliza Richman and Xavier Curtis in 2016 following the success of Go Addis (previously Addis Eats), Ethiopia’s #1 ranked tour company established in 2013. Go Kigali is the first tour company devoted to unique city tours in Kigali, Rwanda's charismatic capital city.
Local Impact
Despite the book still being in the production stage, the Beyond A Thousand Hills project has already captured hearts and minds out in Rwanda. Press coverage endorsing the book has been significant and the project even made the national news late last year.
PLAY

Where The Funds Will Go
To date, the entire project has been 100% self-funded and all the content and photographs are in place.
A specialist London based design team is already on-board and working through initial mock-ups of the book.
We're turning to Kickstarter to raise the final amount necessary to print and publish the book. All the funds raised will be invested in the production of the book.
Find Out More
To find out more, please visit:
Twitter: @beyond1000hills
Instagram: beyond1000hills
Facebook: www.facebook.com/beyondathousandhills
Web: www.beyondathousandhills.com

Ever dream of traveling the world? Let us tell you a little bit about our dreams to travel the globe:
Traveling is an expensive endeavor - while we planned, and saved and hustled as hard as we could... there are still a handful of expenses we have yet to pay for in the upcoming months leading to our departure date.  Some of these items include: vaccinations, travelers' Insurance, train passes, airfare to different regions, new camera gear and accommodations for stay.  
While some of these expenses are more of a priority than others - we cannot waste time in raising and saving enough money before we leave to journey and tour the world in September 2015.   
Not only is this fund an effort to raise money for our trip but it is also an opportunity for you to invest in my new business: Frankieboy Photography LLC.  This company and passion of mine is a dedication to my father Frank H. Spontelli Jr. - my father has always motivate me to create, build and operate a business of my own as he once did.  I recently purchased the LLC to officially turn my little photography 'idea/hobby' into a reality - a business of my own.  While I may never own the giant warehouses filled with printing presses as my Dad once did - this LLC is the start at a small empire of photography printing mastery.  My dream is to return from traveling the world with a plethora of images and build a photo printing studio of my own.  We also want to take our blog www.meetyouthere.me to the next level - so that we can continue to travel and adventure while sharing our ventures with the rest of the world.

A young couple decided to move in together. They move into an apartment complex. They are starting to put their lives just the way they want, but they start to notice a lot of odd occurances around the apartments with the other tenents and the landlord, but more so with the repairman. He does not look too scary, not like anyone would expect, he seems nice, but there is something about him they just dont trust and with good reason. He just got out of jail and to earn his keep he has to do what the boss tells him, the boss happens to be the landlord. How far will he go to stay out of jail, what was he in jail for to begin with, just how twisted are they all......

It started with a text-message conversation between my husband Brian and I (while we were both in the same house). I had just finished reading this Grounded Parents post, and sent the link to Brian along with the brief statement: “We need to make a documentary about these women.” His response: “Let’s do it.” And so, “Science Moms” was born.
To me, this is more than a film project. It’s a quest to find moms (and dads) who haven’t fallen under the spell of the anti-vax, anti-GMO, anti-science movements. We want to amplify the voices of scientists and activists, but we also want to hear from other parents who are making rational, science-based decisions in their everyday lives. After seeing Gwyneth Paltrow go to Washington, “not as a scientist, but as a mother,” I feel compelled to make a similar statement. Brian and I are not scientists (he works in TV/film, and I’m a Montessori school administrator). We’re parents to two awesome kids. We're also advocates for reason and science, and, just as importantly, advocates against the fear that plagues so many parents today. 
The anti-vax and anti-GMO movements, in particular, seem to me to be rooted in fear. If, through this project, we could alleviate just one person’s fears about food, medicine, and health, we’ve succeeded. Brian and I will share personal anecdotes about science-minded living as we move through this project. We would love to hear from you about your experiences as science-minded parents and science-lovers, through posts to our FaceBook page, or through messages to us on FB. Tell us why you vaccinate your children. Tell us why you support biotechnology. Tell us about some rad science experiments that you did with your kids. We want to hear it!
In addition to your enthusiasm and feedback, we would love to receive your financial backing for this project. This Kickstarter campaign, when successful, will repay us for the cost of our fabulous directors of photography from our Madison, WI-based shoot with Kavin Senapathy, our Atlanta shoot with Alison Bernstein, and our local shoot with Anastasia Bodnar, and will cover the cost of future DPs, travel expenses, and animation. 
*Natalie Newell

***UPDATE 22/12/15  We made it! Thank you to everyone for your support and backing. A wonderful campaign and glad to have shared it with you. Any additional pledges still welcomed and additional funds raised as a result will still be of benefit to the film. Our thanks again.
Warm greetings and welcome to London Recruits - the sensational story of the young men and women who undertook clandestine missions for the ANC during the bleakest years of the apartheid regime. With your help, their gripping tale that remained secret for over 40 years, will come to the big screen for the first time. 
Ronnie Kasrils (left) recruited young Londoners for the missions, himself under instruction from the ANC leader in exile Oliver Tambo (right)
At a time when ANC membership was banned, its activists executed or imprisoned, exiled leader Oliver Tambo lit the fuse on a plan that saw young women and men travel to South Africa disguised as honeymooning couples, tourists and business trippers. Recruited by Ronnie Kasrils, working undercover in London, the volunteers exploited the ‘whites only’ policies of apartheid South Africa. Under the noses of the police they unfurled banners from landmarks, exploded home-made leaflet bombs at packed train stations and played rousing speeches to crowds from improvised sound systems, signalling to thousands of Africans living under the regime that the struggle for freedom was very much alive.
London Recruits: Mary Chamberlain, Norman Lucas and John Rose. The first missions were in 1969 and over the next five years Ronnie recruited and ran over 40 top secret missions into apartheid South Africa.
The huge personal risk involved in these missions was brought all too sharply into focus for those few who were caught, tortured and imprisoned. Many recruits remained anonymous long after apartheid had ended, reflective of the danger and secrecy of their missions against one of the 20th century's most brutal regimes. Now, nearly 50 years on, the legacy of their work can finally be celebrated on film. With unique access to the brave women and men who risked their lives in solidarity with the liberation struggle, London Recruits will tell their story. 
The Film
This is documentary as high drama. London Recruits is a thriller in every sense of the word. British and South African intelligence are hot on their heels, the recruits have little or no back up on the ground and for many this is their first trip abroad. There’s humour in their near misses, but the dangers are all too real. Those who are caught face torture and solitary confinement. The wider struggle often appears hopeless and the missions are absolutely secret, even from loved ones.
The film is a roller coaster adventure that offers a timely challenge to us today: in a world still full of racism and injustice, have any of us got what it takes to be London Recruits? We will mix archive footage, interviews and dramatisation to tell this dramatic thriller about those who risked their lives for what is right.
The Timeline
We have recorded initial interviews with many of the London Recruits, alongside work conducted on the ground in South Africa. We've tracked down journalists, police officers and security officials who were involved in the events as they unfolded. We've met with eye witnesses who remember the leaflet bombs, the banners and the sense of euphoria when spirits were lifted by successful missions. 
We are preparing the final shooting script for the drama reconstruction elements. We will shoot the bulk of that reconstruction in the summer of 2016, with a premiere in mind for the autumn.  
The Team
We've assembled an amazing team for London Recruits, a crew that can deliver a great result for this important story. Heading up the project are Barefoot Rascals, a production company led by Gordon Main and Peter Edwards. They put compelling stories and great characters into the heart of everything they do. We have the overwhelming support from many of the London Recruits whose participation and contribution to the film is paramount. Moreover, Ronnie Kasrils has lent the production his full backing and is a vital player as we uncover the secrets and mysteries of this fascinating time in the South African struggle. 
Ronnie Kasrils with London Recruit Ken Keable. The film is based on Ken's book of the same name.
Why Crowdfund?
We have raised seed development funding from Ffilm Cymru Wales and received support from trade unions in the UK. Those unions were at the forefront of the international struggle against apartheid with their members playing a crucial role in solidarity work. We have carried out initial research and interviews but rely upon an injection of fresh funding to bring us into production. We appreciate the story will have wide appeal to a generation who participated in the anti apartheid movement alongside a new generation that draws inspiration from it. We've carefully chosen rewards we think you will like and in the spirit of the story. 
By backing the campaign you'll play an integral role to realise the project and become part of the London Recruits community of friends and supporters. Every penny will help get this project made. The producers are committed to paying cast and crew fairly and we face the costs that come with shooting abroad; transportation, rentals and so on. Funding independent films is tougher than ever and eternal thanks and gratitude go to those who'll help us fulfil this part of our budget.
We hope our friends and supporters will enjoy sharing this incredible journey with us and play a part in getting such a vitally important story to the big screen.

Almost 200 years ago, Norwegians settled down in Illinois, US for the first time. How do you keep your Norwegian heritage and culture 200 years after your ancestors arrived, and your original culture is on the other side of the earth?

I have started the work of making a photo documentary about the people in the small town of Stavanger, Illinois. 10 houses, 20 people and a church. Who are they? And how is the everyday life in Stavanger and the sorrounding area?

During the time the project has expanded, and is now including the surrounding areas and the people connected to Stavanger, Illinois.
The funds are going to be used on one last trip to Stavanger, Illinois to finish the project. Because one day it may be too late.

Our idea is to make a social network for CLI lovers. Many developers prefer vim (text editor) over many high-tech dev environments, so we thought Why wouldn't they prefer socialize over other "high-tech" social networks. 
Socialize should stay minimalistic and simply beautiful. We won't display any ads - because there are no ads on the CLI.
Who is "we"? We actually means I, and I means Dominic. I'm a young software developer from Switzerland.
Even though the social network seems to be on the CLI - It's actually not. Socialize will be a web-based social network. The CLI/Terminal/CMD Look&Feel will be provided by a jQuery Plugin from jcubic. 
Check it out here
Obviously - the schedule is a big subject.  
March 2016: The Kickstarter campaign ends. Backers will be added to a mailing list, to get updates quick. Main updates will also be added to the kickstarter page.
August 2016: Beta opens for our backers. Bugs and suggestions can be added. Socialize-Mugs will be shipped.
Around Oktober 2016: If everything is ok, beta will get closed and socialize opens for all members. This could also happen around November or December, if there are major problems in the beta.
We don't want to display any ads on our beautiful social network, nor will we ever spam you with our mails. Still we need to pay hosting and the domain. Plus, we need to make a security check to be sure, that your data is save from hackers. 
With the target of 5'000 CHF/USD, we can get a penetration test and pay hosting and domain for a foreseeable future.
Thanks for reading, have a cookie.

Shrink-O-Lantern.. Step-up Your Pumpkin Game!! Not just a product, it's a movement!
 With the funding from Kickstarter, Shrink-O-Lantern‘s mission is to be the leader in introducing innovative, high quality, first-to-the-market pumpkin designs with a diversified appeal that enhance our customer’s pumpkin decorating experience while at the same time reaching numerous stylized societies. The timing is perfect for the starting of this new venture as the pumpkin design industry is currently experiencing a lull in innovative designs and creativity. Traditionally pumpkin decorating consist of removing its top, scooping out the interior pulp, and cutting the desired forms into the side of the pumpkin, producing an image composed of variously shaped holes or pits in the pumpkin's walls.The addition of a light within the pumpkin causes the holes and other cut-away portions of the pumpkin to appear to glow.While the effect produced by this technique can be pleasing, it produces a limited range of images: it takes skill and specialized tools to produce most of the shapes in the pumpkin's thick walls, and the use of color, aside from the natural color of the pumpkin, is of course impossible.Thus far the Phase 1, Shrink-O-Lantern designs have received positive feedback throughout the US for its fresh outlook and edgy designs. Our immediate future plans are to introduce glow in the dark, 3D, Collegiate, and Holographic Shrink-O-Lanterns, thus producing a more diverse product line. Like us on Facebook:
http://www.facebook.com/pages/Shrink-O-Lantern-Step-Up-Your-Pumpkin-Game/412479228808986?ref=hl 
The picture link below will take you to the S.O.L. website.
SHRINK-O-LANTERN...IT'S NOT JUST A PRODUCT, IT'S A MOVEMENT
STEP-UP YOUR PUMPKIN GAME
The SOL Story
In Oct of 2010 I was carving pumpkins the traditional way with my Girlfriend and her three boys. We cut the top, scooped out the insides causing a complete mess, poked a picture stencil for an hour, carved for another hour and a half..and then BAM!! hours later we had Jack-O-Lanterns!!! So if you read between the lines what I really just said is that the gutting of the pumpkin is a mess, the carving tools are unsafe for kids, the poking give you serious hand cramps.....oh and did I mention that after the first 15 mins into the carving process the boys were nowhere to be found! After all that work we set the pumpkins outside only to see them two day later completely mushed and folding in on themselves..sprinkle some mold and insects in the mix and you get the picture. So I decided that something needed to be done about this age old problem. So I created SHRINK-O-LANTERN, a product that eliminates ALL the dislikes of pumpkin carving! It requires minimal time (3-4 mins), is safe for ALL ages, increases the life of your pumpkin, give your pumpkins style & swagger...and get this, ALL YOU NEED IS A HAIRDRYER!! Don't just take my word for it though, just visit www.shrinkolantern.com and see this amazing product for yourself.

Hallo,
wir alle haben fast tagtäglich mit Flüchtlingen zu tun. Ob nun im direkten Austausch durch das Vorbeilaufen an Flüchtlingsheimen, durch das Spenden an Kleiderkammern oder Hilfsorganisationen oder mit dem Lesen der Tageszeitung.
Viele Menschen sehen zur Lösung dieser Aufgabe viele mögliche Ansätze, bei denen ein "richtig" oder "falsch" bisher nicht ersichtlich ist. Dennoch stellt sich die Frage, was wir als Bürger Deutschlands dafür tun können, um die Integration der Flüchtlinge zu beschleunigen, die Gemeinschaft zu stärken und die Ankunft zu vereinfachen.
Werte sind häufig sehr unterschiedlich. Der Eine setzt auf Qualität, der Andere auf Quantität. Gerade in einer diversifizierten Gesellschaft wie unserer ist es schwer, sich auf eine bestimmte Idee zu einigen. Dennoch gibt es eins, das uns vereint: 
Das Grundgesetz
Dieses Buch stellt wohl am effizientesten dar, worauf wir uns als Zusammenschluss von 80 Millionen Menschen berufen. Daher sollten wir dieses dazu nutzen, Flüchtlinge zu bilden und ihnen deren Rechte und Pflichten zu erläutern.
Das Projekt zielt darauf ab, dass jede Familie ein Grundgesetz besitzen sollte, um sich mit dem Staat Deutschland befassen zu können und etwas über das Land zu erfahren, in dem sie wohl eine längere Zeit verbringen werden. Viele Gesetze galten womöglich nicht in ihrem Heimatland, weshalb sie durch dieses Buchprojekt erfahren können, welche Rechte und Pflichten sie haben.
FAQ:
Was ist das Video, von dem in den Belohnungen gesprochen wird?
Ich werde von der Verteilung ein Video machen, um euch Supportern zu zeigen, was Ihr mit Eurer Spende erreicht habt. Zu diesem bekommt Ihr einen Link, der gültig ist noch bevor das Video für alle öffentlich gemacht wird.
Was passiert mit dem Geld, welches zu viel gespendet wird?
Ich werde von dem Geld zusätzliche Bücher drucken lassen, die verteilt werden.

InFocus Social Project
The project consists of distributing 45 disposable cameras to people affected by homelessness.
After allowing the participants 5 days to photograph Ottawa from their perspective, the InFocus team will collect and develop the film.
Once developed, the images will be organized into a photo book which will include the photographers comments and written insights.
A Gala will be hosted to display the prints and recognize the photographers for their work and participation. 
The Funds raised from the event and sales of the photo book will be donated to support those affected by homelessness in Ottawa.
These funds will be a valuable contribution to this sector, but the focus of this project is the creative process itself. Providing this demographic an opportunity to express creative freedom, explore artistically and find their voice among the Ottawa community.
Art is transformative for the creator, and also for the people whom observe it. For In focus, Art is the catalyst to break down barriers between citizens in the Ottawa community, form a dialogue, and raise awareness for needs of our homeless population.

We found a house, just a simple old one, and we started to imagine how to create a new idea of Home combining different styles and fashions.
A house that survived 2 World War and more than 100 years of Italian history has just become a Home.
We want to share with you our ideas with 60 pictures (1 for each day) from 1st November until the end of the year, with a special gift for the 31st of December.

Make your mark!
With the help of Kickstarter, and some very lovely backers, I was recently able to realise the dream of creating my very first enamel pin. So, fresh from the success of my first project I've been inspired to have another crack at it.
Backing card and pin concept.
2018 marks 100 years since the first women in the UK won the right to vote. As a passionate voter myself, I wanted to create a new pin to mark the occasion. Where better to draw inspiration than from the powerful legacy of The Suffragettes, after all I wouldn't be able to make a single mark on any ballot paper without their courageous campaigning.
The Pin
30mm
Hard enamel
Black Nickel Plating
Rubber Clutch
Comes attached to an illustrated backing card.
For my design, I've particularly drawn on the iconic purple, green and white Suffragette colour palette, which was often also reflected in the jewellery they wore at the time. Throughout history we’ve seen how important it is to speak up to effect change. So when you may be feeling frustrated and overwhelmed with the state of things, I hope this pin can help pick you back up and encourage you to keep making your mark. Just a small X in a box can be a powerful tool!

This project is to support Revolver Studios in adding an aerial program to their studio. 
WHY
We want to add an aerial program to our offerings because...
1)  We want to offer more ways for people to express themselves through movement. 
We know the value and benefits of movement, performing arts, and self-expression. Movement holds the ability to inspire, empower, and heal. We watch our students grow in profound ways from engaging in movement; whether it's dance, fitness, or otherwise. They are inspired to express and tap into their creativity. They are empowered to step outside their comfort zones and to truly believe in themselves. It's the #1 reason we do the work we do; because it changes people's lives. 
2) We will provide something needed in the aerial arts world (and the world in general); body-positivity. 
The unfortunate truth is that many studios/facilties in the world are not providing a body-positive environment at all; or claim to be but are lacking the knowledge, intention and deep commitment to do so. 
We recognize that many bodies have been entirely left out when it comes to dance, fitness, and aerial movement spaces. We recognize that many bodies have felt like a burden, and even unsafe in dance, fitness, and aerial movement spaces. 
This is simply not okay. So we're changing it. 
Revolver Studios is founded upon creating space where ALL people, ALL bodies, and ALL levels can enjoy movement. Our team is always learning & growing. Each staff member is trained to meet you where you're at with compassion, encouragement, and kindness; always using body-positive language and teaching methods. This applies to our students as well, we work to maintain a culture of inclusivity and support amongst everyone who steps through our doors. 
3) We believe in the St Cloud community and want to see it grow. 
Revolver Studios owner, Scarlette Revolver, is dedicated to elevating arts and culture in the St. Cloud area. Scarlette is a small business owner, avid supporter of downtown, and an active community member lending support to as many projects, events, and fellow artists/entrepreneurs as possible. Scarlette often gets asked why she chose to set up shop here in St. Cloud, rather than Minneapolis or another larger city. 
It's because she believes in watering the grass in her own backyard first, and she believes deeply in St. Cloud's potential. Scarlette knows that growing her business in the St. Cloud community will help boost the local economy and provide more unique experiences in the downtown area. The aerial program at Revolver Studios will also create more opportunities for dance and performing arts to grow and thrive in the area. Scarlette wants more people to experience the many incredible locally-owned businesses and blossoming arts community St Cloud has to offer. She knows Revolver Studios will add yet another reason for people to visit and discover what a special community St. Cloud truly is. 
4) You asked! 
Both Scarlette and Nicole's clients have been asking for YEARS when we're going to bring our brand of aerial classes to St Cloud...so we're finally making it happen! 
5) It's fun as hell, ya'll. 
I mean, enough said. Aerial is really, super fun. And we like fun. We like fun the MOST. 
HOW
The only way we'll accomplish this project is with YOUR help. 
Our budget for the project is as follows... 
Professional Rigging ... $600
Apparatuses ... $800 
Hardware ... $800 
Mats ... $1,000
Marketing ... $1,000 
Kickstarter Fees, backer rewards, shipping, etc ... $300
= $4,500 
We will be bringing in a highly trained and experienced professional rigger to install four rigs to ensure optimum safety and proper protocol. The apparatuses are the aerial fabrics themselves and all the necessary hardware to go along with them. Of course mats are essential for safety as well. We chose to add on a marketing budget because we need to make sure people KNOW who we are and what we are offering! Scarlette is experienced and proficient in marketing. She has created a detailed marketing plan utilizing social media, special events, radio, and other marketing services that will be executed over a six month time span. The remaining balance will help support kickstarter fees, cost of backer rewards, and any other miscellaneous cost associated with the project. 
WHEN
Our timeline is as follows... 
June 30 - July 31: Kickstarter Campaign 
Aug 1 - Aug 30: Renovate studio space and install rigging 
September 5:  Grand Re-Opening 
September 7: Aerial Classes Begin
Nov 1: All backer rewards delivered
