Cherry-veen Zine is Kristen Levine and Paige Walter, two Philly locals with a passion for music and a knack for friendship. As two regular concert-goers in the community, Kristen and Paige saw a need to document the ever-evolving music scene in Philadelphia. Since then, they've been broadcasting the achievements of local bands through a print zine, or miniature DIY magazine. 
The zine quickly became an authority on local music; recent accomplishments include partnerships with a local record label and media company, exhibiting at First Friday events, and being interviewed for the podcast Show Me Your Playlist. At shows, Kristen and Paige are recognized for their place in the community as journalists and avid music consumers, always eager to participate in new music. 
Attending a soft opening of a cafe in Fishtown
The artists featured in the zine are offered a unique opportunity to tell their story and give insight into their craft. More than ever, featured artists are being recognized by fans not only for their music, but also for their presence in the zine. On social media, CVZ promotes shows around town, and has proven to bump attendance at shows. CVZ's influence around Philadelphia is becoming undeniable, and is only continuing to grow.
A picture of the most recent issue taken by a featured artist
With Kickstarter contributions, the zine can afford to print more copies and expand its distribution network. CVZ has goals to distribute far beyond its home neighborhood of Fishtown and into coffee shops and music venues across the city. Recently, Paper Scissors Media offered to distribute the zine to as many as 20 shows a month, an incredible opportunity that CVZ could pursue with the help of Kickstarter contributions. 
Cherry-veen zine is a proven authority in the community with an established network of fans and partners--all that's missing is the funding to continue to grow. CVZ thanks you in advance for any contribution so that it may continue to serve the Philly music scene and bring joy to the community. 
Another kind testimonial from a featured artist
___________________________________________________________________
For the fully story on the zine's inception, and to get to know Kristen and Paige better, listen to their interview with the podcast Show Me Your Playlist here. 
You can also check us out on Instagram @cherryveenzine.

C.K Gyllerstrom and Erich J. Moffitt along with BearWolf Books present an adventurous retelling of the classic Greek Myth.
Join Herakles, an orphaned red squirrel, as he tries to make his way back to Mount Olympus.  Through his adventures he confronts the gods, battles monsters, and learns the importance of responsibility and friendship along the way.
Geared towards young readers and perfect for reading aloud, C.K. Gyllerstrom's writing has both a timeless quality and an accessibility that children will find fun and relatable.
The story is brought to life by artist Erich J. Moffitt with dynamic full color illustrations that inspire childhood curiosity and introduce young readers the central figures in classical mythology.
Herakles
For this Kickstarter Campaign we are offering two different editions of Herakles and His Twelve Adventures: A Hardcover Mass Market Edition and the hallmark BearWolf Books Limited Edition of 175 copies.  We would also like to present a softcover Coloring Book especially created for this project by the book's illustrator, Erich J. Moffitt.
This edition is a 8.5 by 11.75 inch Hardback book with a gloss art paper cover with gloss lamination.  The story will be around 44 pages long and features 19 full page color illustrations and several smaller spot designs.  Each pictures retains the vibrancy of the original acrylic painting, created for this story by Erich J. Moffitt.  The interior of the book will be printed on 200gsm paper. We are asking for financial help in order to finish our first full length album, which will be a mixture of original and traditional folk music on fiddle, guitar and vocals. There will be both songs and instrumental tunes. We have been playing together for two years, working up material that satisfies both of our hungry musical brains while enjoying a fluid creative process. We feel it is past time to set down the fruits of our labors on a record. A number of singular artists both old and new have inspired us. To name a few: Andy Irvine, Alasdair Fraser, Nic Jones, Martin Hayes, Dick Gaughan, Andre Brunet, and Nightingale. A common thread between these artists is their ability to thrive on playing old music with their own voice, to deliver their own version of these timeless songs and tunes. Like them, we're trying to build on the depth of this material by adding our own layers to what is already there, and adding our own story to the mix.
We’ve both made albums in recent years with other bands and projects, but this one is of particular importance because it will be a big step towards defining our sound together. We hope this album will be the first of many, and help us further refine our partnership. For this album we are working with Jim Prendergast at Mill Pond Music Studios in Portsmouth NH. Jim has quietly been creating many amazing records in the past five years, and we trust his ability to interpret our music. He is definitely the man to help us push this album forward. We also made an easy decision to invite the incredible Jeremiah McLane to join us as a guest on this album, playing accordion. He has paved the way for us with some of the singular recordings he has made in the past, and he is a huge inspiration to both of us. His presence on this recording will not only add color but a huge amount of depth that we could not achieve without him. 
 We're hoping that, in the end, both traditional and contemporary tastes in music will be satisfied when listening to this album, but we need your support to get there.

Since the move, I've created a great networking foundation of industry colleagues who are interested in my ideas, however, the first step to the campaign is content building. Upon manifesting my companies, I am now in the stages of building the campaign for the brand which entails a musical and visual project under my brand "The Frequency Chemist" and "CNJ Creations LLC." I am a supporter of holistic and natural healing of the mind and body. I want to bring more awareness to Vibrational therapy, the science of sound, and how music truly effects us physically and psychologically.  The "Journal Entry EP" will be the first project released under my company with myself as the artist and a collaboration of other producers, artists, and writers whom have already established themselves amongst the airwaves.   
   Pledging to this campaign allows for a proper budget in order to obtain what's needed for the groundwork such as equipment, studio time, artwork, startup marketing, and solidifying legal obligations which can cost (paperwork and other business documentation.)

What is the money for?
I am raising funds to build a website that will allow people to review home builders in their area. 

Why am I doing this?
To influence and educate future buyers.

What will the website look like?
A simple site where people can write reviews on a builder. The home screen will show the list of builders in the given area in a grid format (see attachment). Each builder will show; an overall score from the reviews people have posted, how many projects are currently under construction, and ready to move in houses. When you click on a builder, it will bring you to their profile page. The builder profile page will show a breakdown of their overall score and any reviews people have posted (see attachment). However, these reviews will have the option of being vetted or unvetted. Vetted reviews will have to send proof showing they did in fact use the builder. After the review has been posted, an email will be sent to the builder asking if they would like to comment on anything the review has said. This way each side gets to state their story. Outsiders will also be able to comment on the reviews to ensure every voice is heard. A home purchase is most likely the biggest financial decision some can make. The more informed the easier the decision comes.
Home Screen Example
Builder Profile Example
Reviews Example

The reason behind the why?
If you have ever built a house or know someone who has, chances are they wanted to pull their hair out on multiple occasions. This is typical; however, what’s not typical is getting the legal process involved because the builder is doing anything they can to cut corners. I want to give future buyers a better explanation of what to look out for when choosing a builder and hopefully save people from losing their entire life's savings (as you will read later on).

My personal why?
The cost of living is very reasonable in my area. Take that and combined it with cheap labor and enormous growth from the surrounding cities you get a builder’s market. It is actually hard to keep track of all the builders in the area because there always seems to be new ones.
When my wife and I decided it would be better for us to build rather than buy a house, we tried to narrow down which builder was right for us. After seeing countless open houses from multiple builders, we finally decided on one. We did as much research as we could to ensure we are making the right choice. He wasn’t the cheapest but he wasn’t the most expensive. It was a happy medium and the open house he showed us looked spectacular. We only found one review on the builder stating “stay away”. We asked the builder about the review but he said not to worry because whoever it was didn’t build with him. Since the site gave no option of trying to contact the reviewer, we decided to trust the builder. To this point he gave us no reason not to. He was very professional in how he presented himself and his company. Overall, we thought we had made a great choice and couldn’t be more excited.
The excitement faded as the construction process went on and the great choice, we thought we had made in our builder completely deteriorated. First it stared out small with project deadlines not being met, then it escalated to workers not getting paid by the builder so proposed liens were sent to us. We knew the builder was getting paid because we were signing the checks the bank made out to the builder on each draw request. When this was brought to his attention, he said it was a misunderstanding. 
My wife and I both work but we still were at the house every day to check on the progress and answer any question or help in anyway. This started to seem like a have-to rather than a want-to. Walls, doorways, electrical, etc. were being built not according to plans. We were constantly trying to get in touch with the project manager or owner to notify them of what was happening but they were mostly unavailable. The owner and project manager started lying about different things that were supposedly done on the house. For example:
· The vapor barrier was not installed but they reassured us it us it was. We had them remove the brick to show us it was there and long behold there was nothing. A ton of brick had to be removed to put the vapor barrier in.
· They tried to install regular insulation instead of the spray foam insulation and cover it up with drywall before we could see it. We had to show them a copy of the contract to get them to honor it. 
· They installed wrong counter tops (they switched them out later on). 
· Plumbing problems with the shower not draining due to incorrect plumbing fixtures.
· Secondary drain for AC was plumbed to drain into attic (soffit) rather than outside.
· The list could go on and on. 
It got down to the point of me taking pictures and making Power Point illustrations of what had to be done. On each picture it would have arrows pointing to different places showing what the issue was and what needed to be corrected. It seems silly but it appeared to be working. The relationship between the builder and us deteriorated over time because we were constantly on them. We were not trying to be a difficult customer by any means. We just wanted to make sure we were getting what we paid for.
As this process went on, I found out I was not the only one having multiple issues with this builder. Turns out everyone who we found that was currently building with this builder were all having similar problems. After we all got to together, we proposed legal action against the builder if he did not correct the issues. Slowly, we all got our houses completed but even now (a year after construction) we’re still trying to fight to get small things around the house taking care. At this point we all believe we’re on our own as we keep getting the run around from the builder. 
My wife and I now understand just because the model house we saw looked fantastic doesn’t mean the quality is there. We could only imagine what the quality of our house would have been like had we not been there each day. I believe this builder and others like him will continue to cut as many corners as possible to maximizes their profits unless people know.
To help this problem, I thought it would be beneficial to make a review website that strictly rates home builders. There are a ton of review websites but when it comes to home builders, there needs to be a reputable easy to use site that will show both sides of the story. The client and the builder can review each other so the potential future buyers will have an informed decision when it comes time to choose.
I have been working on a website through Wix to review builders but there seems to be too many limitations. I want people to give good honest reviews and not have to worry about the character count in a review or if they can post pictures/videos. I want the layout to navigate easy without set boundaries and limitations on what can or can’t go. After weeks of trial and error on the Wix website, a friend sent me a link to a builder who was charged for stealing over $400,000 of unfinished work from clients. https://www.krgv.com/news/home-builder-arrested-for-stealing-over-400-000-of-unfinished-work/ This builder turns out to be the brother of my builder with his own construction company. If only I had the review website up and running, I could have saved people like this from losing their life’s saving. Now the urgency is on to get a great review website up and running. It makes more sense to create the website on WordPress because I will not be limited to what I can or can’t have. The problem is, I don’t know a lot about WordPress and the months it will take for me to learn and hopefully get the website up and running is months builders will have to get other people.
The money I am requesting will be used to hire outside help in building the website. I've already posted a job on Upwork's website seeking qualified applicants as I'm familiar with Upwork’s process from previous experience. The break down for the budget would allow $3,000 for the website creation, $1,000 for marketing, and $800 for web hosting services, updates and bug fixes (for at lest the first two years).
Overall I do believe this website will help save people money, time, frustration and best of all make an informed decision on which builder to use.
Even if you do not donate, I want to thank you for taking them time in reading this and hope it will help you in the future.

This project is going to be a short film, possibly feature length film, about what would happen if an evil spirit was able to attack the living through YouTube. This is going to be a project that is entirely funded by Kickstarter, and worked on by a team of local writers, producers, and actors. It is going to be filmed on location in Kingston, Ontario, and hopefully premiered at local venues. All actors (except reward winners) will be found through a local casting call, and the film will be available through digital download.
I have started drawing up the storyboards, as well as contacting a couple writer's that I know, to get the ball rolling, so now all I need is you guys.
It may seem like a strange thing to do, ask people you don't know for money, but it is people like you that make the YouTube world, and the independent movie, music, and art world go round.
Also, because all rewards are digital, there will be no awkward waiting period, where you have to wonder if they are on their way. Once the film is released, all rewards will have been delivered.

STRETCH GOALS
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
$10,000 - All backers will get a #indieflick ballcap

Open Movement is a dance school and company that has been a part of the Vaud cultural scene since 2016. For its founder, Paolo Giglio, dance is much more than a discipline, it is an art, an incredible and infinite communication tool. The philosophy he has developed is based on freedom of movement, transdisciplinarity and the act of sharing. He favours self-development, encouraging self-confidence as well as confidence in others. This community is a source of inspiration since today's society is gradually leading towards individual isolation. This is why Paolo seeks to use dance to break this cycle by helping rebuild the channels of communication between people and within oneself. Coordination and musicality are both tools to forge a link between us and everything around us.@
The body speaks a special language and it has things to tell us, so listen, watch, share ...
The building that you see in the video, (Les Ateliers de La Côte) is a new cultural center. It is going to be a hot spot not just for artists to create their work but also a place they can share and perform their art with the global community. With Open Mouvement, we aim to connect not only with children but with people of all ages who share the love of dance. To make this dream come true, we will need your support to promote and spread the word about Open Mouvement.
We would greatly appreciate any contribution possible. Your support will not only help bring this project forward but it will encourage to build a greater sense of community through the magical art of dance. Please help us to make this project possible. We look forward to sharing Open Mouvement with you soon!
THANK YOU.
FRANCAIS
Open Mouvement se présente. Une école de danse et une compagnie insérées dans le réseau économique vaudois depuis 2016. Pour son fondateur, Paolo Giglio, la danse est bien plus qu’une discipline, c’est un art, un outil de communication incroyable et infini. La philosophie qu’il a su développer est basée sur la liberté de mouvement, la transdisciplinarité et le partage. Il privilégie le développement de soi qui passe dans la confiance en soi mais également dans la confiance envers les autres. Le collectif est source d’inspiration. En effet, notre société amène peu à peu l’individu à s’isoler. C’est pourquoi il cherche à utiliser la danse pour briser la solitude et aider à reconstruire des voies de communication vers les autres mais également vers soi-même. La coordination et la musicalité sont autant d’outils pour tisser un lien entre tout ce qui nous entoure et nous.
Le corps parle, il a des choses à nous raconter, écoutons, regardons, partageons...
Ce bâtiment que vous voyez dans la vidéo, ( Les Ateliers de la Côte) est le tout nouveau centre culturel de la région d'Etoy. Il va être amener à devenir le rendez-vous et le point de rencontre privilégié des artistes non seulement dans leur travail de création mais également un endroit de partage et un espace dédié à la pratique de l'art au sein d' une communauté interdisciplinaire et diversifiée.
Au sein d'Open Mouvement, notre objectif principal sera de partager notre amour de la danse non seulement avec les enfants mais avec des personnes de tout âge et de tout horizon. Pour que ce rêve devienne réalité, nous sollicitons votre soutien pour promouvoir et partager le concept Open Mouvement. Nous désirons pouvoir créer et consolider avec chacun de vous des partenariats durables et construire une grande communauté vivante, culturelle et dynamique autour de l'art magique de la danse!
Nous appelons chacun d'entre vous à faire partie de ce grand projet et de le rendre possible. Nous attendons avec impatience de vous rencontrer et de pouvoir partager avec vous Open Mouvement! 
Avec nos remerciements.
    Paolo Giglio

What does kidcare24.de offer?
kidcare24.de is a user friendly search platform for parents and caregivers available all over Germany. Pledges will be used entirely for the development of the platform and the algorithms it is based on.
At kidcare24.de, parents can easily get in contact with babysitters or childminders to find trustworthy caregivers in their area for their children. Additionally, Kidcare24.de offers the possibility to selectively search for day-care places in your region.
As a result, not just parents and their kids benefit from kidcare24.de, but also providers of any sort of caregiving. Daycare centres have the chance to present their facilities and promote free places. Private babysitters, childminders, and others can offer their support for one-off or regular care.
Thanks to our innovative algorithm that checks profiles of potential caregivers, abuse of the homepage is out of question. But to reach market maturity with this algorithm, kidcare24.de needs your financial support.
A precise matching system to facilitate your search, in order to find the perfect fitting carer or daycare center for the smallest members of your family, will be implemented. The Chat function will also give you the chance to get in contact with the caregiver, or the parent, before the arrangement.
One of the main aspects of kidcare24.de is the verification of its members. With that we want to guarantee the authenticity and trustworthiness of every single profile – parent or caregiver.
Was bietet kidcare24.de?
kidcare24.de ist das überregionale und benutzerfreundliche Suchportal für Eltern und Kinderbetreuer. Sämtliche finanzielle Zuwendungen werden alleine für die Entwicklung des Portals und der zugrunde liegenden Algorithmen verwendet.
Bei kidcare24.de können Eltern kinderleicht mit Babysittern, Tagesmüttern oder Leihomas- und opas in Kontakt treten und für ihre Liebsten eine vertrauenswürdige Kinderbetreuung in ihrer Nähe finden. Über das kurzfristige Betreuungsgesuch hinaus, bietet kidcare24.de ebenso die gezielte Suche von Kitaplätzen in Ihrer Region an.
Somit profitieren nicht nur Eltern und ihre Kinder von kidcare24.de sondern ebenso Anbieter von Kinderbetreuung jeglicher Art. Kitas haben die Möglichkeit ihre Einrichtung attraktiv zu präsentieren und regelmäßig freie Plätze auf kidcare24.de zu veröffentlichen. Private Babysitter, Tagesmütter bzw. Leihomas und -opas können ihre Unterstützung für einmalige oder regelmäßige Betreuung anbieten.
Dank unseres innovativen Algorithmus zur Überprüfung der Profile potenzieller Kinderbetreuer, ist ein Missbrauch nahezu unmöglich. Um diesen Algorithmus zur Marktreife zu bringen benötigen wir Ihre finanzielle Unterstützung.
Über ein gezieltes Matching, das vorab durch individuelle Kriterien festgelegt werden kann, werden genau die passenden Betreuer oder Kitas für ihre Familie vorgeschlagen. Hierbei haben Sie zudem die Möglichkeit per Chat-Funktion sich gegenseitig bereits vor dem ersten Treffen kennenzulernen. 
kidcare24.de legt besonderen Wert auf die Verifizierung und somit auf die Echtheit sowie Vertrauenswürdigkeit der einzelnen Betreuuerprofile.

Who are The Radiators From Space?
Then The Radiators From Space came out, "Television Screen", which was a great single, that was a real inspiration to us." (Bono, U2)
Dublin band The Radiators from Space are best known for their debut single "Television Screen" and for their legendary second album Ghostown. "Television Screen" was hailed by Rolling Stone as the best of the first batch of UK punk singles and was also the first punk single to place Top 20 anywhere in the world when it charted at No 17 in Ireland in April 1977. Ghostown, an exotic fantasia of a midnight walk around Dublin which seems to take place simultaneously in the 1970s and six decades earlier, has consistently featured in the lists of Best Irish Albums of All Time since it was recorded 35 years ago.
But that's not all there is to The Radiators. There's their debut album TV Tube Heart, widely considered a punk classic, and their stunning reunion album from 2006, Trouble Pilgrim. In the intervening years guitarist Philip Chevron found fame with The Pogues, Steve Averill became one of the music world's top designers and has been involved with the artwork for U2 from the very beginning, while Pete Holidai received the Hot Press/Smithwicks award for his work as a record producer.
What is Sound City Beat?
Sound City Beat is a tribute by The Radiators From Space to the Irish rock bands and beat groups of the 1960s who tenaciously flew the flag for rock music at a time when the country preferred to listen to dance bands and ballad singers.
Although a commercially viable rock scene did not really happen in Ireland until the 1980s, the urban areas of the country in the Sixties were hotbeds of exciting young beat groups who eked out short careers in blues cellars and tennis clubs, some of them, like The Strangers, The Creatures, Orange Machine, Bluesville, Ditch Cassidy and the King Bees, The Greenbeats and Sugar Shack made some fine singles, others, like Granny's Intentions, Dr Strangely Strange, Eire Apparent and Andwella's Dream, advanced to album deals, the Sixties' medium of choice, and still more, like Them, Skid Row and Thin Lizzy, were crucibles for major Irish talents like Van Morrison, Gary Moore, Philip Lynott, Terry Woods, Horslips, Henry McCullough and Rory Gallagher, whose work would come to maturity in the 70s, 80s and beyond.
Though much of this early Irish rock music has become prized among record collectors, very little of it is ever heard. But The Radiators, finding some kinship of spirit with garage bands who did not go all the way commercially, have spent years exploring this area and have come up with some surprising and, they think, illuminating connections between those early records and what we now take to be "Irish Rock". And it is in this spirit, with genuine affection and respect, that they embarked upon this album of cover versions of some long-forgotten classics.
The Tracks Covered by The Radiators From Space on Sound City Beat:
1. Head For The Sun (The Movement)
2. It's Happened Before, It'll Happen Again (Rory Gallagher & Taste)
3. I'm A King Bee (The King Bees)
4. 6. 10 Special (The Hootenannys)
5. Yes, I Need Someone (Eire Apparent)
6. Behind The Painted Screen (Andwella's Dream)
7. I'm Gonna Turn My Life Around (Peter Adler & The Next In Line)
8. You Got What I Need (Mitch Mahon & The Editions)
9. Gloria (Van Morrison & Them)
10. Dublin (Thin Lizzy)
11. The Lady Wrestler (Horslips)
12. Turn Out The Light (The Creatures)
13. Morning Dew (Sugar Shack)
14. That's All Right (The Blues Aces)
15. Never And Everyday Thing (Granny's Intentions)
16. Dr. Crippen's Waiting Room (Orange Machine)
17. New Places, Old Faces (Skid Row)
18. You Turn Me On (Ian Whitcomb and Bluesville)
The Guests:
Terry Woods (The Pogues, The Woods Band, Steeleye Span, Sweeney's Men)
Henry McCullough (Paul McCartney & Wings, Joe Cocker, Éire Apparent)
Eamon Carr (Horslips)
Why a Vinyl Release?
Primarily because there just has to be a vinyl release given the subject matter of Sound City Beat.
A vinyl version of SOUND CITY BEAT will give you the very best audio listening experience (as well as the full artwork and sleeve notes) that you just can't get with the digital and CD version. 
Sure vinyl crackles but to quote John Peel "Somebody was trying to tell me that CD's are better than vinyl because they don't have any surface noise. I said, 'Listen, mate, life has surface noise."
When I (Shite'n'Onions) released Trouble Pilgrim in the US in 2011, I had no intention of putting it out on vinyl initially, Philip Chevron made a suggestion that a vinyl version would be nice and I took the hint. When the finished LP's arrived from the pressing plant it was like holding a thing of beauty and playing the record was like hearing Trouble Pilgrim for the first time - the richness of the sound was just incredible.Vinyl is for those who value music not those who regard it as a disposable commodity.

Hey Kickstarter community, I'm Alex. An outdoor and travel photographer from California.
For this campaign, I'm more than excited to introduce to you my photobook - For Travelers.
Thanks for stopping by and showing some support!
New Zealand
Background
The desire to self-publish a photobook originally came to mind as a gift idea for my mom's birthday. Being an avid traveler herself, she cheered me on and supported me throughout my time abroad and I wanted to have a tangible way to share the memories I'd collected. Both to inspire us to make one together one day and to have a more permanent medium in which to view my photos in the future.
After putting a small book together to gift to her, I had a number of family members and friends reach out after she shared a few of my photos with them to see if I could send them a copy as well. Long story short, after sending out a few more, I felt inspired to create an even higher quality book to share with a larger audience. Which brings us here!
The Book
Over the past few months, I've sorted through thousands of photos and come up with 30 of my favorite memories to put together into a 10x8" dark blue softcover coffee table book. Intended to be minimal and timeless, the book will feature images from my experiences traveling through the provinces of Vietnam, on the beaches in Bali, trekking in the mountains of New Zealand, and around the central coast of California. Alongside each photo will be a short story written by myself, detailing the experience behind the picture and where it was taken.
For Travelers is intended to be an inspirational letter of sorts to all those who have traveled and to those who wish to one day. Hopefully, it will delight and excite whoever picks it up!
Here's an example of the book's layout, as well as a couple of photos that'll be in the book:

You can only contribute to this project if you’re a Manhattan or Brooklynite!*
As an alternative to the tote, fanny pack, jean pocket, and human hand, I use my Conceptual Waist Apron, or what others call an “apron,” to carry my stuff.
Of the few I’ve painted for myself, I’ve appropriated the prints for two: the roses and airplanes print was conceived of by urban wear designer Jeremy Scott, and the lollipop is a representation of Wayne Thiebaud’s colored pencil drawing, Sucker. As the son of two lawyers, I’ve been raised as a copyright infringement-fearing person, and therefore will not sell these.
This project is to distribute two other models of painted aprons: one depicting Lipstick & Pokéballs, and the other, Screwdrivers & Jellyfish. 
Blueprint of Screwdrivers & Jellyfish
By its site-specific design, this apron is a conceptual art object. The wearer activates its characters’ bodies as sexual organs, but the binary is not as clear as M/F: it’s a game of inversions and mirror-ish power dynamics. Both species are stable individually, yet excited and conscious when put into play with each other. 
To protect the art object’s commodity value, I will produce them as limited editions: two of each kind, four total (and I’ll label my initials with the edition number, “1/2” and “2/2,” on the back corner of each apron). However, unlike most fine art limited editions, these aprons will be washing machine friendly and pre-washed.
I paint these pretty meticulously, so they take me a while to make – moving at a steady rate, I’ll finish one apron about every two weeks. I’m aiming to have all four done in two and a half months (eight weeks plus a two week margin of error). 
I've recently moved to NY and don't have any of the materials to do this. The cost of aprons, paint, brushes, and other necessary tools will be absorbed by your pledges, and the remainder will be spent on future art supplies.
*NOTE: I’m localizing this project’s distribution, so only if you’re in Manhattan or Brooklyn can you receive one hand delivered by me.

According to England's Lord Mayor of Winchester Catherine Longworth , the British have become "addicted" to American marching bands. The Edna Karr Marching Band will try to feed that addiction by bringing our unique, New Orleans-style marching band to London for the New Year's Eve parade that will be televised to more than 2 billion people.
We perform in an energetic and passionate manner that features brass band breakouts, dancing, and sometimes singing. We are raising funds to send our entire band to London to perform in front of the London's finest. We have already raised more than $100,000 for our airfare, but we need to raise the remaining $70,000 to send our entire band to London.
Despite having a population of students that receive discounted or free lunch, we have been ranked among the nation's best high schools. http://www.nola.com/education/index.ssf/2014/09/3_new_orleans_area_high_school.html
Most of our students have never left the country and this would be an amazing opportunity for them to learn about London and for the Brits to learn about our music.

What's this all about?
This project is about a book with 400 photos. These images document Josef Albers in his preliminary courses at the Ulm School of Design (Hochschule für Gestaltung, HfG Ulm), 1953-55. 
A comparison: From all the other books published about Josef Albers – at Black Mountain College, at Bauhaus, and Yale – there are ca. 30 photos showing Albers in interaction with students and with other persons involved.
400 images, black and white
3 introductory essays on the historical situation, the context of this photography, and on Albers' teaching (English & German)
190 x 235 mm / 7.5 x 9,3 inch (portrait format)
272 pages (Munken Print cream 18 and MultiArt Silk)
Linen hardcover
Thread-stitching 
Proudly presenting: the book dummy.
PLAY

What kind of images are those?
The photos were taken between 1953 and 1955 by Hans G. Conrad. He was HfG Ulm's first student. This is old school analogue photography, Leica, 35 mm, black and white. 
The main idea behind these images is truly modern: The documentation of the making of a new life with new forms, new ideas, new technologies for a new society (after the end of the second world war). It's not about the traditional ideology of uniqueness and the artist as a super hero – but it's about transparency of the process of democratic exchange. 
This HfG approach is the conceptual foundation of Conrad's works: He didn't arrange the one and only artistic »masterpiece« portrait in the old way. But he developed sequences of images that correspond with Albers' sequences of interactions. 
An example of the original cardboards which were used by the photographer, Hans G. Conrad, for archiving the negatives. The contact proofs show the sequences of images as if it were a stop motion film. This historic material inspired the graphic designer of the book, Petra Hollenbach, to use a similar banderole for the book cover.
What do we see on these images?
We see Albers teaching and in interpersonal exchange with people like Otl Aicher, Inge Aicher-Scholl, Hans Gugelot, and Max Bill. 
We see the students working at Albers' tasks: 
They are arranging paper acording to his exercises on the interaction of color. 
They are folding paper and create huge spatial structures out of it. 
They follow Albers' gestures and body language in free space, at the black board, and at the tables working with sand. 
We see Albers showing the fine differences of human posture. 
A sequence of images was taken when students produced a film about and with Albers teaching. (Sadly, this film has never been finalized.)  
And finally we see Albers at the Ulm train station, surrounded by students together with Inge Aicher-Scholl and Max Bill, saying goodbye and leaving in summer of 1955. 
[Numbered b/w print A] Josef Albers in his first preliminary course at Ulm School of Design / Hochschule für Gestaltung (HfG) Ulm, January 1954.
[Silver gelatine portfolio image] Josef Albers with a spatial structure of folded paper in his first preliminary course, January 1954.

Josef Albers in his second preliminary course at HfG Ulm, 22 May, 1955. His lines at the black board: »Discrepancy between physical fact and psychological effect«.
Josef Albers in his second preliminary course with students; from left: Herbert Lindinger, Shoichi Kawai, Claude Schnaidt, and Peter Seitz (?), 25 July, 1955.
Student Frauke Koch-Weser working at interaction of color in Albers' second preliminary course, 5 July, 1955.

[Silver gelatine portfolio image] Josef Albers with student Frauke Koch-Weser in his second preliminary course, 22 May, 1955.
Students Shoichi Kawai and Herbert Lindinger (from left) in Albers' second preliminary course, 10 July, 1955.
Student Alexandre Wollner in Albers' second preliminary course, 10 July, 1955.
[Numbered b/w print B] Josef Albers in his second preliminary course, 26 July, 1955.

Josef Albers and Otl Aicher at HfG Ulm's terrace, 20 June, 1955.
[Poster] Inge Aicher-Scholl, Josef Albers and Otl Aicher at HfG Ulm's terrace, 20 June, 1955.

Josef Albers in the train leaving Ulm, 2 August, 1955.
The portfolio of 5 gelatine silver prints, 18x24 cm, consists of these images.
Why are these images so valuable? 
It is important to me that these 400 images are printed coherent and completely – not just a small selection. For a simple reason: When I show these images to experts from a variety of disciplines, all of them see different details that enrich their knowledge and help deepen their understanding of contexts and backgrounds.
We’re all experts in our small section, which we take a closer look at. These images contain a wealth of valuable information about the time, about the intentions of the people, about their actual actions, about motives and backgrounds. No single person can know all this. To preserve this knowledge, we need to merge the details. Then it will continue to provide valuable insights into things we do not even have in mind.
And why an expensive book? Digital publication might be nice, too.
Paper is truly a valuable storage of our cultural memory. What is stored on paper will outlive the generations. That's why it's important to me that all the images are merged and preserved in a book. And furthermore: Printed publication is the reason why Hans G. Conrad has shot them.
Finally, Kickstarter is a chance for smart production: If this book would be published in a traditional publishing house, 148 Euro per copy were needed.
Who was Hans G. Conrad? 
Hans G. Conrad with his Leica III, ca. 1955
His friends called him Cony. He was born in Switzerland, on 11 June, 1926. He was a perfectionist in terms of visual culture. 
After World War II he got into contact with Max Bill, the Bauhaus-trained artist, architect and designer in Zurich. Bill asked Cony to join him and the Ulm team for developing the Hochschule für Gestaltung. Cony became HfG's first student. 
After his studies he worked at Braun (together with Fritz Eichler, google him). In 1962 he became head of international advertising at Lufthansa, and he assigned Otl Aicher to develop the corporate design which has reached legendary status. Cony was member of the board of design of the 1972 Olympic Games in Munich.  From 1970 to 1989 he was co-editor in chief of German magazine Capital – this was a unique position because he was responsible of the visual expression and the second editor in chief was responsible of the verbal expression. 
Cony died on 26 December, 2003, in Cologne.
Why me?
Cony gave his works to me in the late 1990s. I got into contact with him when I wrote my dissertation thesis on the political history of the Ulm School of Design, 1953-68. He said to me that he trusted in me, and that I would do the right thing with his works (16,000 images, 1,200 paper works). Well, do the right thing, that was a burden. 
Three years ago, I made the decision that I want to publish most of his images in books structured according to his groups of work. One group focuses on Josef Albers, for example. Another one focuses on Max Bill; on Otl Aicher; on Tomás Maldonado; on Hans Gugelot; on Friedrich Vordemberge-Gildewart; on Konrad Wachsmann; on HfG guests like Walter Gropius, Mies van der Rohe, Norbert Wiener, or Charles and Ray Eames; etc. – I want to start this series of printed publication with this first book on Josef Albers. 
I studied history, German language, and communication studies in Munich and Cologne. In the late 1980s I worked together with Otl Aicher for the Italian company durst. I published several books and essays on design and related topics. Since 2015 I'm earning a living as Professor of Design Theory in Cologne, Germany. The main focus of my research is the designers' societal responsibility and the future of design education. And yes, I must admit it: I‘m a little bit mad about the history of the Ulm School of Design. 
Credits

 Biography
I started drawing faces on money in Oct 1995 in 5/1997 I started painting clown dollars in 1999 the first clown dollar were published into art prints.
In 2002 Jury had a daughter. Late in the year he realized he was never home due to the success of his Clown Dollr Art Prints. So Jury decided to put his brush down and become a stay at home dad to raise his daughter till she started school.
In 2006 Jury resumed his Artwork, but in late 2009 suffered a very bad mental break down and could barly function let alone paint. This lasted 5 years.
Finally in 2014 Jury once again picked up the brush with a fire like never before. And started out turning the best work of his career.
Earlier last year Jury has a Hugely successful kickstarter project with the Clown Dollar Art Prints.
In Oct 2014 Jury had 2 Painting's Published in The Art Of Living Dead Dolls - Art Book
NOW here is some of Jury's Defaced Money spanning 18 Years in Prints, Clown Dollar Art Prints
As written about Jury The Clown by Charles Scott Gallery
Jury The Clown
We wanted to write up something special for Jury the Clown. Not the usual slick marketing/sell copy you’d see elsewhere. Because he’s a different kind of artist. Every communication we (or anyone) receives from Jury ends with: All Love Jury The Clown "LIFE Over Money" A conversation with Jury is like a wonderful ride on a living amusement park ride. His views are different, exuberant and full of strong ideas. Here’s just one example: he refuses call people who enjoy his art “fans” – he calls them “supporters,“ because he, “never wants anyone to feel that he is ‘above’ them.” Another quote from Jury: “I want to use my voice and part of the money I make from art to help them.” He’s talking about the homeless. He has an almost manic passion about helping the homeless and to show that, “there are good people that care about others even if they don't know them.”
Gold Silly Dollars - JURY THE CLOWN COMMISSIONED ARTWORK Click on the link before for more information! Jury the clown 22k Gold - AND able to be turned in for a COMMISSIONED piece of art. In terms of his art: we like to say that he “defaces” money. It’s a bit of a violent word, but his paintings, or “Clown Dollars” literally remove the face from money. To take away it’s power and it’s evil and to remind us that life is about fun and living and art. Not money and greed and materialism. And these incredible hand-painted bills represent a little of that Jury love…that you can bring home to you. Jury’s art first hit the streets around 1997 and by 1999 his art was appearing in publications around the world. While his hand-painted, defaced bills can be purchased exclusively through the Charles Scott Gallery. EACH BILL comes signed by Jury, is Matted and includes a Charles Scott Gallery COA. NOTE: a "c" after the price denotes a circulated bill, which means it may have wrinkles or slight stains, etc. These circulated bills have been discounted because of this. Also, neither Jury nor the Charles Scott Gallery implies any ownership of copyrighted images or characters - the images below are purely artful representations.

UNA DÉCADA APOSTANDO POR EL DOCUMENTAL.
Hola, somos Zanate, un festival de cine dedicado única y exclusivamente al documental mexicano, y tenemos nuestro nido en la bella ciudad de Colima, México.
Creemos en un diseño que sea de gran calidad en su programación y organización, pero regido por la sencillez y la inclusión. Un festival pensado para los realizadores y para el público por igual, que permita la convivencia de todos los involucrados en un ambiente cálido y cercano, como una gran familia.
Apostamos por un formato íntimo y de puertas abiertas, donde cada proyección constituya una experiencia única e irrepetible para los realizadores y el público. Una programación pequeña, pero minuciosamente cuidada. Un formato que permita vivir la experiencia del festival por completo, en el que cada actividad pueda coexistir y complementarse con el resto del programa.
Durante estos 10 años de vida hemos logrado un festival sui generis, tanto por su diseño como por su identidad, ya que somos el único festival exclusivamente de cine documental mexicano en el país. Ese es nuestro sello identitario y nuestro granito de arena.
Trabajamos arduamente en la formación de público y fomentamos la producción local de documentales. Contamos con un programa de formación continua y un proyecto de exhibición que va mucho más allá del festival mismo. Sumamos voluntades y creamos lazos con otros colectivos, festivales, individuos; para la difusión, formación y exhibición del documental.
Clausura de 10ª edición Zanate
Este 2018 estaremos celebrando nuestra undécima edición.
Ha sido un maravilloso viaje, logrado desde la (imprescindible) independencia y en una ciudad pequeña (y encantadora) como Colima, apostando por la descentralización y la creación de nuevos espacios.
Y esto se ha logrado gracias a la voluntad de muchas personas e instituciones (públicas y privadas) que creen y apuestan junto a nosotros por el documental mexicano.
Es por eso hoy que tocamos tu puerta, porque buscamos más aliados para poder continuar el camino.
Celebrando 10 años apostando por el documental.
¿QUÉ BUSCAMOS HACER?
Con tu aportación nos ayudas a solventar muchos de los gastos de producción, indispensables para la realización del festival. Cada persona que se involucra en el proyecto nos permite hacer más y más cosas.
Creemos en los fondos mixtos, en que los proyectos se pueden realizar con la suma de muchas voluntades. Eso es lo que nos da la independencia, y esa independencia nos da libertad. Por eso apostamos para que nuestro público, amigos, aliados y cualquier persona que se quiera sumar sean parte de la producción de este proyecto.
Estamos por dar los primeros pasos hacia una nueva década y es algo que queremos celebrar junto a ustedes.
ESTO ES UNA FIESTA, ASÍ QUE LLENÉMONOS DE REGALOS.
Creemos en el cine como un proyecto colaborativo y somos muy agradecidos. Por eso tenemos una serie de recompensas para todas las personas que decidan sumarse a esta iniciativa. Recompensas hechas con amor y a la medida. Un distintivo especial para Zanates honorarios.
Elaboraremos piezas únicas e irrepetibles, con un tiraje mínimo, diseñadas por nuestros amigos de Simbiosis Estudio de Diseño, Bienmesabes Clothing y la ilustradora Abril Márquez.
Las recompensas serán entregadas durante los días del festival en nuestras distintas sedes. Para quienes no puedan estar, podemos entregarlas en el área metropolitana de las ciudades de Colima y Guadalajara, sin costo, o en su defecto, se las enviamos por paquetería con todo el gusto del mundo (más gastos de envío, claro está).
Ayúdanos a seguir conquistando espacios para compartir historias.
¡Apuesta por el documental!

Bounce aspiration is to make it easy and affordable for people to seize life opportunities in line with their aspirations, anywhere in the world, zeroing accommodation costs for long-term stay, ranging from few weeks to some months.
Bounce is based on a community of people that instead of using their homes as their exclusive possession, they transform them into a key to access thousands of other properties of like-minded people.
Bounce is about the efficient use of already existing resources to jump on projects and opportunities, attend events, and live differently, regardless of where this is going to happen. Because today, as the world gets smaller and smaller, your life may happen somewhere else.
Unlike other platforms, this is neither about renting a place nor about the accommodation itself It’s more about solving the problem of the accommodation to let you focus on what you need to do in this specific moment of your life. And it’s not about holidays: other platforms ask you “where would you like to go?”.
Bounce asks you “where do you need to be?”.
HOW IT WORKS
It’s very easy.
You must own a property that you are willing to share with other users while you are not there. Then you feel compelled to pursue an opportunity which implies to move to another city or country. You list your place and then enter the destination of your choice and the period, ranging from 3 weeks to 26 weeks. Bounce will match all the information entered by users like you to create as many viable combinations as possible, according to the requirements, which include place, period, number of bouncing people, special needs and flexibility on dates and destinations.
The other option is a direct search: in this case you find a person, in the Bounce community, who might have a suitable property that is already available or could be, and you contact her. Is the period matching? Are you happy with each other?
Then you just subscribe and leave to enjoy your life there.
You can enjoy someone else's place as long as you made your property available to others: in Bounce, for every transaction, we use time as the currency, not money, apart from subscription (see Costs).  
A rating system, the possibility to communicate with other users, feedbacks and technical support will help you to make it run smoothly.  
The Bounce platform can be joined on invitation. This means that as a user, you contribute to the network trust and growth directly by inviting people you esteem, with homes in different and attractive locations. Inviting people is part of a reward mechanism offering benefits.
The Bounce philosophy is based on the idea that its users own their own words and actions: it’s a direct call to assume responsibility. Bounce has one major rule: leave every place as you found it, possibly a little bit better off. It’s an invitation to care about others, about future others, like we should do for our future generations. It’s an invitation to make things better.
WHY BOUNCE? 
It may sound strange to you but it all started with a single question: why as a collective we produce results that individually we don't want, like environmental issues, economic crisis, cultural clashes and spiritual disconnection?
One of the answers we came with was that too many people are not living their lives according to their expectations, and so they do not bring their best contribution to life. Many people are trapped into repetitive loops, under inspired by their employers and disengaged by their jobs, disappointed by corporations’ goals and targets they do not understand or share anymore.
Many others postponed their dreams for too long, while some other simply gave up. They made reasonable compromises.
We also believe that sometimes the outcomes we generate do not reflect our innate ability to perform but the complexion of the situation in which the performance occurs. 
So we came with the idea that as the world gets smaller and smaller, stretched by constant disruption and fuelled by unprecedented opportunities, we can help you to do something more fulfilling and rewarding, something with a larger impact on your life and the lives of those close to you. According to us there’s plenty of reasons to bounce. 
And that’s why we define Bounce a B2Be.
WHY KICKSTARTER?
We have four priorities guiding our decision to crowdfund Bounce. In order of importance they are:
Make it happen: we deeply believe in the positive social impact of Bounce and this is motivating us to transform a concept into a project, no matter what.
Build a community: there’s no value co-creation and delivery without a critical mass of users that offers (share?) a reasonable number of locations. Bounce is for people, not for us.
Be independent: we dream about creating Bounce together with its users, before turning to business angels. We want to promote a culture of trust and respect, not of exponential growth.
Think long-term: we think of additional services and smoother operations, and those mentioned so far represent the first steps of many we have in mind.
We believe that Kickstarter is the right place to achieve them.
IS BOUNCE FOR YOU? 
Do you sense a call to action, to adventure? Is it an invitation to a true calling, something you feel you can’t not do? Is life asking you to cross your personal threshold and return with a gift? Then, you may find yourself in the list below and start gathering the courage to follow your aspirations.
The Digital Nomad: you can work from almost any location in the world, you just need a computer, a wi-fi connection and some good coffee. You like to change your spot to get inspired by fresh people, new places and good food. You sit, watch and work your magic. From one place, and another and another.
The Career Seeker: you are looking into the opportunity to step up your career, and you need to move to another city or country. You want to live there for a while before selling your house, buying a new one or rent a place for the long term. You want to get familiar with the new job, with the new colleagues as well as with the place and the culture.
The Temporary Guy: you have the opportunity to work for your company in a different location. You feel like it would be important to seize the opportunity but company benefits do not cover all additional expenses. And yet you don’t want to give up.
The Student: your background is no longer sufficient to win challenges in a constantly evolving job market. You would like to acquire fresh competences but you feel like education costs are already too high, not to mention the accommodation costs.
The Doctoral: you have taken this as far as you could, getting a master in your area of research, and the only step missing is moving to the lab where they have tools, knowledge and funds for your final work. You just need to find an affordable accommodation. Everything else is set.
The Seasonal: you can take advantage of your skills and expertise somewhere else, for a limited period. But the risk is that all the economical advantages are zeroed by temporary relocation costs. Finding an accommodation at no costs will make it only as expensive as buying flight tickets or drive there.
The Breaker: you decided that time has come to take a year off and you want to make sure you live it at the fullest. You want to use the money you saved for experiences, not to rent a room or a house.
The Artist: life for you is about beauty. You are creative and you like to spend time with people that breathe and celebrate art and beauty. Exhibitions, festivals, parades and events: wherever visionaries play the notes and colors of tomorrow, you have to be there. With them. 
The Patient: you need to get a medical treatment for your condition. Doctors are positive about the therapy which is already quite expensive. Solving the accommodation cost would relieve your already troubled mind.
The Family Guy: you want time for you and your family. You need to run away from a life where you do not even have time to enjoy each other with your wife and your kids. You want to discover how it would be to live and grow your children somewhere else.
 The Globetrotter: you believe that life at its fullest is experiencing other cultures and places. You love meeting new people, the more different from you, the better. You like collecting experiences instead of Hard Rock Café T-shirts.
The Language Lover: you get crazy about languages. You are never satisfied with learning few words just to be able to have a crappy chat. And you know that the best way to learn and keep a language alive is using it. Daily.
 The Homesitter: no, that’s not you! That’s what you are looking for when you are leaving for a period, either for holiday or on a business trip where your boss covers all accommodation costs. But you love the idea of someone taking take care of your place, the same as you would do. Maybe of your car too. And why not of your pets and plants. Your home needs someone to watch over her.
The Displaced: you have more than one property and you believe in the value of true sharing. You like the idea that someone might do something good and beautiful with your help making your day more than a handful of bucks. And at the same time you earn time to spend somewhere else once you are ready to go.

COSTS
Bounce uses time, not money, as the currency
You make your place available for 3 weeks? Then, you earn 3 weeks to stay at someone else’s home. Anywhere, as long as there’s a Bounce user available. The only cost is the annual subscription of 99 Euro.
WHERE WILL BOUNCE BE AVAILABLE?
Bounce will kick off in Europe, USA, Canada, Japan, Australia, Singapore, Hong Kong.
Other locations will follow depending on requests and invitations.

The Canadian Aboriginal Regalia Project by MiLan
The Canadian Aboriginal Regalia Project by MiLan
Canadian Aboriginal Regalia Project by MiLan
This project is a Canadian Aboriginal Regalia creation project, an endangered or almost extinct indigenous practice.
Through the Ministry of Environment my family has received many sacred to our Aboriginal Peoples animals that have died in various ways and are honored by creating what is known as "Regalia".
The creation of this regalia will take approximately 10 months, harvesting the medicines and then creating the body of work. This project will preserve a very important aspect of indigenous lifestyle.
Once the project is completed it shall go on public exhibition in Vancouver to share with the Canadian people.
Mark MiLan is committed to this project and it shall bring honour to his family and as well to the Aboriginal community.
With many new Canadians arriving and integration to Canada it is important that our culture be showcased/preserved to educate about our unique history.

FRUTO
Laura es una chica muy solitaria que sufre de una fuerte tristeza,  en su día a día se la pasa pensando en su amiga de la secundaria, Alondra quien formo parte importante de esa época.
Debido a que su padre esta muy ocupado en el trabajo, ella empieza a padecer alucinaciones  que la llevan a caer en la obsesión, destruyendo a la gente de su alrededor.
Laura is a very lonely girl who suffers from a strong sadness, in her day to day she spends her time thinking about her high school friend, Alondra who was an important part of that time.
Because her father is very busy at work, she begins to suffer hallucinations that lead her to become obsessed, destroying the people around her.
images of the film
images of the film
images of the film
EL PROYECTO - The Project
Mi nombre es Antonio Peralta Naranjos, Director, guionista y editor de el filme FRUTO, he participado previamente en el festival Smart Films y Rally en corto y últimamente en el cortometraje "Delirios de Un Gato Callejero".
My name is Antonio Peralta Naranjos, Director, screenwriter and editor of the film FRUTO, I have previously participated in the Smart Films and Rally festival in short and lately in the short film "Delirios de Un Gato Callejero".
FRUTO es un drama surrealista de horror que se centra en la mente de su protagonista, de como lo que podemos interpretar como amor nos puede destruir.
Todas las emociones de Laura se retrataran de manera onírica implícita para demostrar el odio, deseo y culpa.
La idea de este largometraje es el de perturbar y conocer los lados más oscuros de la mente humana de una forma diferente y que a pesar de sus escenas surrealistas todo sea muy real.
FRUTO is a surreal horror drama that focuses on the mind of its protagonist, on how what we can interpret as love can destroy us.
All of Laura's emotions will be portrayed in an implicit dreamlike way to demonstrate hatred, desire and guilt.
The idea of this feature film is to disturb and know the darkest sides of the human mind in a different way and that despite its surreal scenes everything is very real.
REFERENCIAS VISUALES - Visual References
Para la cinematografía del film, utilizamos de referencia distintas películas y pinturas para darle un tono surrealista y bizarro.
For the cinematography of the film, we use different films and paintings as reference to give it a surreal and bizarre tone.
CAST
El cast esta conformado por actores y actrices no profesionales, esto se hizo con la idea de que los personajes tengan una personalidad más realista, similar a quienes les interpretan.
The cast is made up of non-professional actors and actresses, this was done with the idea that the characters have a more realistic personality, similar to those who play them.
Paulina Ortiz (actriz) - Laura Peralta
Angel Illescas (actor) - Alfonso Contreras
Elizabeth Muñoz (actriz) - Greta Bautista
Danna García (actriz) - Alondra Alv.
CREW
El crew está conformado por chicos muy apasionados al cine que de verdad haran su gran esfuerzo para crear una gran obra
The crew is made up of guys who are very passionate about cinema and who will really do their best to create a great work.
Lo que necesitamos y para que lo necesitamos - What we need and why we need it
necesitamos los fondos para realizar la filmación de la película y la postproducción (utilizando equipo profesional), ya que prácticamente no contamos con nada para la realización, también necesitaremos recursos para el transporte y alimento de los actores junto con algunos efectos especiales.
We need the funds to do the filming of the film and the post-production (using professional equipment), since we have practically nothing for the making, we will also need resources for the transportation and food of the actors along with some special effects.
EL IMPACTO - The impact
El proyecto tiene como meta demostrar que se puede hacer buen cine con lo minimo, ya que mucha justifica la baja calidad de la cintas de hoy en día en México por que supuestamente utilizan poco dinero, cosa que es totalmente absurda, ya que grandes cineastas lograron hacer muy buenas películas con mucho menos dinero que ellos.
The project aims to demonstrate that good cinema can be made with the minimum, since much justifies the low quality of the films of today in Mexico because they supposedly use little money, which is totally absurd, since great filmmakers managed make very good movies with much less money than them.
Puedes ayudar de otras formas - You can help in other ways
simplemente si no puedes apoyarnos economicamente puedes correr la voz para que este proyecto se haga una realidad,
simply if you cannot support us financially you can spread the word so that this project becomes a reality,
HAZ QUE SEA POSIBLE LO IMPOSIBLE.
Para cualquier duda o pregunta pueden acudir a nuestras paginas

Hi, my name is Jon Beagle. My fiance, Tiffany, and I are about to embark on a spiritual journey around the world. Starting in Colombia and continuing on to where ever the wind takes us, we will be backpacking, staying in tents and couchsurfing as means of sleeping.
But that's not why you're here. You see, I've loved music ever since I was about 5 when I got my first guitar. From there on I would bang on anything that made a sound, always finding a new instrument to learn. I want to broadcast this type of creativity to the world through a Youtube channel featuring people that have no way of being heard outside of their towns. Whether it's a simple street violinist playing in the subways of Brazil., or a beautiful pianist that grew up outside of the technology age and would have no clue where to begin to be heard on the web.
My project is called World Sessions, a place to hear the unheard. I think music produces an amazing energy, but as an energy it can make one feel good or bad. I feel as though the world is more exposed to the bad. I want to lighten the vibe and bring a new type of music to humanity, music with a message, with soul. 
Posted is a video as an example of the project idea.
I need funding for plane tickets, filming and sound equipment. We thank you all for any contribution and really hope others can see my vision of exposing a new beauty to the music scene that tends to be overlooked or hidden behind the garbage we hear today.
Also, if all goes well I plan on turning it in to a whole website, where you could download music at a price you choose fitting even if that price is free. Also, I would like to get artists to do paintings and drawings that would be sold the same way as a donation, instead of at a set price.
Thank you once again for your time. I really hope we can make this happen.
This is just the beginning of my project so I'm going to put up a couple of my friends songs as a start.
https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCl9B-lsMMqfo8P15hO8xUSA

We're happy to say we reached our goal on May 15th, which appropriately was Endangered Species Day! Now that we know we can make a good film, we'd love your support in helping us make it even better! With more funds, we'll be able to bring on more support in post-production, bring together panels at screenings to lead a more thoughtful discussion, and allow us to distribute the film more effectively. Every dollar will help us make a better film, and every backer will help us engage more people in this important story.
North Carolina is the last home to one of the most endangered mammals on the planet: The red wolf. The state has also signed a resolution that formally asks the federal government to abandon the recovery project and declare the wolves extinct in the wild.
Red wolves are an elusive species native to the southern US, and used to roam from Pennsylvania to Florida, and as far west as Texas. Because of habitat loss and hunting, the species was driven down to near extinction. Through a series of ambitious precautions, the wolves were successfully re-introduced to North Carolina, where they are found to this day. Now, roughly 100 individuals live in the wild. This program became the initial groundwork for the grey wolf re-introduction in Yellowstone National Park and a blueprint for the California condor program.
The reasons outlined in the resolution are complicated. There are questions of land use, culture, and science that muddle together into a variety of difficult problems. While the US Fish and Wildlife Service considers the future of the program, people in North Carolina are voicing their opinions. After speaking with several residents, scientists, and landowners, it is clear that the issue isn't as simple as being "pro-wolf" or "anti-wolf," as it is often portrayed.
This short film will investigate the reasons for North Carolina wanting this species extinct in the wild, and help the variety of perspectives see eye-to-eye. We hope the film can help the conversation reach a point that considers the importance of wild species, while recognizing and addressing concerns from people being directly affected by these decisions.
Though the wolves may remain in zoos and nature centers across the country, this decision could effectively terminate the red wolf's chance for survival in the wild. Further, it would set a precedent for endangered species across the country that would allow for irreversible changes to our biodiversity as we see fit. For that reason, we think this issue needs our attention as storytellers.
To keep up with our progress and photos from the field, consider following our Facebook page: facebook.com/RedWolfRevival
