You play as ex-sheriff turned bounty hunter Louis Wesley on the trail of a dangerous outlaw named Butch Colt on the run from justice. You must blast your way through amazing arcade style Wild West levels filled with outlaws and bandits as you try bring colt and his gang to justice.  
Players must tap their phone screen to fire Louis’s gun and kill the enemies, but don’t get excited kid…because once an enemy is killed, one of his mates is sure to take his spot. When you run out of bullets you need to hit the on screen bullet chamber to reload your gun. 
Tapshot will also feature animated comic book style sequences at the beginning of each level to tell the story, and introduce characters.
The goal of Tapshot is to achieve a high score by shooting down as many of colt’s bandits as possible. Shooting different parts of the bandit’s bodies will increase your hit multipliers and push up your high score! But be careful, bandits are a deadly shot and can easily take down a careless cowboy...
Beautiful Hand Drawn Graphics
Unique "Flip" Style Animations
Online Leaderboards
Social media competitions
Unique Wild West Story and Cut scenes
Graphics
Tapshot features a simplistic outlined hand drawn graphic style, with a blend of more realistic dust and lighting effects to create a a style that really looks nice in a smaller screen. The game is styled more realistic than cartoony.
Levels
Tapshot features a level progression System. the game will launch with 5 levels, with the view to create another set of 5 levels after launch and further level packs down the track. 
Music
I am pleased to announce that Port Macquarie locals Mojo Bluesmen will be doing the music for Tapshot!!! If you have not heard them before go check them out at www.mojobluesmen.com
Mojo Bluesmen - Whiskey and Women
Tapshot is at it’s a core an arcade level based shooter, When you reach the end of the level you are presented with a score and a breakdown of the level and how you did, kill streaks, headshots etc. Biased on the score and achievements you are presented with a star rating out of 5.
 This is where Tapshot really shines, competition.
Our goal with Tapshot is to really engage and connect our gaming community, keep you interested and get you the most bang for your buck. Tapshot contains 3 main connected competitive features:
Cloud log-in and saves
 This will enable players to log into their player from any device and take their progress and scores with them…even across platforms! Players will be able to log in via Facebook, twitter or both to allow us to connect you with your friends.
Global and Friend Leaderboards.
Leaderboards offer a way for players to compete in Tapshot, main high score leaderboards will exist for each level, also for each level will be a ‘Friends’ leaderboard that will enable players connected via Facebook and twitter to compete with friends. 
The friend’s leaderboard will compare friends biased on score, when a friend beats another friends score they will receive a push notification and a Facebook update to inform them that a friend has beaten their score.
Challenge Night!
The concept of challenge night really excites us here at gamesyne…challenges will be sent out on a specific night and will appear on the main title screen of the game as a separate icon. Challenges will be sent out via Facebook, twitter and in game via push notification. Players can decide to participate in that nights challenge, such as Toppling a high score or achieving a certain kill streak without getting hit, this will be tracked on special leader boards set up for the challenge. We are really hoping that we can build a community around these challenge night and make them a weekly highlight!
Opt out...
before you all start waving your hands in the air and flipping desks about Facebook log-on and push notifications...Tapshot also has a non-social connected log in to save your progress if you want, and of course all of the above features are opt out.
Progress on Tapshot has steadily increased over the span of the project, we currently have one level complete with another in early production. Our main constraint is purely time to work on the project and get it done.
Most of the core systems are in and working, including the social features and challenges. Kickstarter will help us fund the time to build out the levels and perfect the gameplay, so we can release the best possible game we can.
The game is built entirely in Flash and Adobe Air and is currently targeting Android and iOS, with the view to explore blackberry once we have launched.
Formed in August 2011, Game Synesthesia is an independent video game developer with a goal to create new and original experiences in video games. 
Production on Tapshot started in late 2011 as simple proof of concept, since then production has progressed to the point of getting the game relesed and finally finished! 
And here lays the biggest hurdle, TIME. I have been working on Tapshot for what seems like an ETERNITY, Being only able to work on the game in my 'spare' time due to stupid life commitments like a full time jobs and the such...
This is where Kickstarter and the wonderful community that is you come in, to help us get Tapshot finally DONE and out the door, and also pick up some sweet rewards!
What will the money be used for?
The money raised from the kickstarter will go towards:
Funding my time to work on the game
Buying essential licences and assets
Funding artwork by our part time artist Aaron
Providing rewards to backers
Extra money will be put back into the project to make the game even better, and to offer bigger rewards to backers and stretch goals!
Have a question about Tapshot? Join in on the discussion at 
http://crowdfundingforum.com/showthread.php/9104-(Kickstarter)-Tapshot

Providence is Alan Moore’s quintessential horror series! In it, he weaves and reinvents the works of H.P. Lovecraft through historical events. It is both a sequel and prequel to Neonomicon, and the resulting masterpiece owes a great deal to his artistic partner, Jacen Burrows. Dreadful Beauty: The Art of Providence is a celebration of the amazing work of Burrows. Over 15 years of his works are featured here, all showcasing Burrows' original pencils and inks. Included is a complete cover gallery -- from The Courtyard to Neonomicon to Providence -- as well as choice pages, designs, and lots of unused and never-before-made-public art! For fans of the series, this is a wonderful companion volume showcasing the haunting artwork and painstaking labor that went into bringing it to life. We offer a special hardcover edition for your support that you won't want to miss. But don't just take our word for it -
 "Jacen Burrows, somehow combining immaculate Swiss-watch precision and wrenching human emotion, is a contemporary master of comic-book art with an instantly classical style that looks like it’s surely been around forever; a timeless line that is as distinctive and original as anything the medium has ever produced. And while I am admittedly biased, I believe his astonishing work on Providence to represent a new level of accomplishment in the career of this already stellar artist and craftsman. A unique and genuinely remarkable talent." - Alan Moore 
And what better way to showcase this incredible series than with the Providence Complete Slipcase: A beautiful set of all the related works in hardcover editions in an exclusive slipcase with new art by Burrows. The Slipcase Set includes five volumes: Neonomicon, Providence Act 1, Providence Act 2, Providence Act 3, and Dreadful Beauty: The Art of Providence. This incredible set is limited to just 1000 units and none of the volumes within will have further hardcover editions. This is THE slipcase set for Alan Moore fans! 
        Shipping is included in the level amounts, for all addresses in the USA. International customers: please see each level for additional shipping costs, and thank you, for your understanding -- these are really heavy!
$9 - DIGITAL DREADFUL - We get the nightmares started with this DIGITAL ONLY level. This copy of Dreadful Beauty: The Art of Providence will be delivered as PDF or CBZ files from the Comic Cavalcade digital store! This will be sent the same day the product is released in print. We also offer our appreciation and gratitude for your support!
$29 - PATRON OF THE ARTS - As well as a digital copy, with this level you get a copy of the limited Dreadful Beauty Hardcover. This hardcover edition is only available via this campaign and in the Providence Complete Slipcase.
$129 - EMBRACE THE DARKNESS - This is where things get very exciting! We start with digital copies of Dreadful Beauty and add the Providence Digital Omnibus, which includes all 12 issues of that series! Then we unleash a chilling hardcover set of everything in a deluxe slipcase! The Providence Complete Slipcase is a beautiful set of all the related works in five hardcover editions. Neonomicon, Providence Act 1, Act 2, Act 3, and Dreadful Beauty: The Art of Providence are all included. Only 1000 copies will be printed!
$199 - FEAST OF THE GHOULS - Welcome to the elite tiers where we add Alan Moore Signed books and more ultra-limited editions! All the prior treasures are included, but we replace your copy of Dreadful Beauty Hardcover with one signed by both Alan Moore and Jacen Burrows! So your copy will be in the Complete Slipcase set, but signed. But that's not all: Providence #12 has a couple very limited editions and we add the Gold Leather (gold foil over faux-white leather) and the limited-to-250 Ghoul Feast VIP cover -- each with new Jacen Burrows covers! Thanks for going that extra mile to support us!
$299 - VISIONS OF MADNESS - The pile of artifacts we include at this level will drive you crazy! All the prior treasures are included, but we replace your copy of Neonomicon Hardcover with one of the first printing -- and it's signed by Jacen Burrows! Your Dreadful Beauty Hardcover is still one signed by both Alan Moore and Jacen Burrows! Those will be in the Complete Slipcase set, but both signed. Century editions are the most coveted of collectibles, limited to just 100 copies each, and at this level we add FOUR more! The Providence #12 Pickman's Necrotica, Visions, Courtyard and Wraparound Century all feature stunning images from when Jacen first started working with Alan Moore! Also included, and limited to 100 copies, is the Royal Blue Leather! Your support at this level is a huge help, thank you!
$599 - MASTER OF AKLO - All the previous level items are included, but then we unleash Elder powers and bring forth a beast of a bundle of unimaginable magnitude! Behold, FOUR books dual-signed by Alan Moore and Jacen Burrows! There is no other way to get Act 2 and Act 3 with both signatures! Providence Act 1 (now a first printing), Act 2, Act 3, and Dreadful Beauty all are dual-signed, and your Neonomicon HC is signed by Jacen Burrows! Every tome in the Complete Slipcase set will be signed! You also get a copy of the Providence #12 Platinum Leather, limited to 33 copies, graded by CGC 9.8 or better! Finally, THREE books with remarqued sketches by Jacen Burrows! Dual-signed Courtyard #1, Neonomicon Hardcover, and Dreadful Beauty Dual-signed Hardcover. These each have amazing original pieces of art by Jacen and they are only available at this level of support! Your support means so much to us, thank you!
Fulfillment date: We expect to ship all backers' physical orders by October 15, 2017. The time used is to get the slipcase created, printed, and packaged. Digital copies will be sent out the day of release of the printed edition and will be delivered as PDF or CBZ files from the Comic Cavalcade digital store

Bryony is a comedian and actor and is taking her debut Show, 'Flamingo' to the Edinburgh Fringe Festival for the first time. She was a little unlucky last year and didn't manage to get the right venue for her show and now three years since her first Camden Fringe preview she has bagged herself a space at Underbelly and a fab time slot. 
In the show 'Flamingo" I have six different characters and they are all intertwined in their own little world, I suppose thats what will set it apart from other character comedy shows on the circuit in that most of the characters are linked so you feel like your following the journey of each of them and they feel finished rather than seeing one and then never coming back to them. I felt this was important in the creative process, I don't want the audience to feel hard done by and that they haven't heard all their stories.
Bryony has been super busy in the last two years selling out previews at Pleasance, Brighton Fringe Festival, Sydenham Arts Festival and recently selling out her Vaults Festival debut. She's even had some nice reviews along the way! -
'Bryony twydle has a comedy show with some great material, sharp comic timing, fleshed out characterisation and thoughtful design...comic gold.' ★★★★★- view from the gods
Impressively dynamic and effortlessly charismatic, she will surely only go from strength to strength' - londontheatre1 ★★★★ 
'She is definitely one to watch for the future' reviewshub ★★★★ 
'Twydle pulls it off with aplomb!'- funny women ‘
She has so far managed to raise £5000 to pay for her venue and PR and photos for the show through bits of acting work she has had over the last year. She still however as a way to go! 
WHY EDINBURGH THOUGH YOU ASK?!
It will be potentially a fantastic opportunity to build new audiences and be seen by press, casting directors and people in the industry and its also one of the largest arts festivals and a place where I can finally debut my full length show! For me its an amazing opportunity and a hugely important step for me in my career as a comedian and actor.
The money raised is going to go towards -
Flyers
Technician's fee 
Marketing costs
Travel expenses 
Accomadation
The kickstarter fee 10% contingency fund 
If I don't reach my target of £1000 I don't get any of the money so its sooooo important that I reach my target and even better if I manage to make more as there's still things i'm sure I haven't accounted for! Also this isn't something that I could afford to do every year so for me although it could be seen as a risk financially I see it as an investment in my career and something I should throw myself whole heartedly into!

Summary:
      DARREL has just graduated High School with his two best friends, TREVOR and JENNIE. He is under the impression that all 3 of them will stay together in the small town during college, Trevor and Jennie have different plans. They plan to move away to start their own separate adventures.
      In the hope to change Darrel’s mind and motivate him to move on, Jennie and Trevor have dug up the time capsule the 3 buried together as children. One last trip down memory lane turns into a night of nightmares, when the 3 friends don’t only open a box of memories but open the gate for a fiendish and horrific figure, called The Gazer.
     As Jennie and Trevor work to rid themselves of The Gazer’s torture, Darrel is determined to show the true potential The Gazer has as the savior of their friendship.

Enrich Your Everyday.
The Self Care Adventure Cards are something I needed to create. Most solutions that have taken over, seemingly every feed I scroll through, involve strict systems and frameworks to follow that I simply didn't have time for. 
Self care should be intuitive, ﬁt into my lifestyle, and only when I need to focus on myself. I wanted to make it as easy as possible to tap into self care - whenever and wherever - and that's why I created this deck.   
Click here to back today! 
My friends and I agree that life can get monotonous. The same activities that brought us joy, pleasure, and relaxation, have slowly become uninteresting and tedious. As we matured, we realized what we were doing to "take care" of ourselves, were just distractions to cope with the stress of our lives (hello, scrolling Netflix anybody?!) We needed actual satisfaction to maintain our wellbeing.
By designing this deck, deﬁned by its natural aesthetic, I was able to offer an open-ended solution to create a stress-free environment for my self-care adventure, anytime and anywhere I needed to replenish my quality of life.
Each activity is designed to spark inspiration in the moment, and driven to action entirely by my needs. With 150+ prompts, we can draw a card, see if it sparks, and either carry it through or draw another. 
In creating the deck, I found certain themes in my various activities emerge. "Self care" as a whole can feel huge, and I aimed to break down self care into 5 different categories. With these categories, you can better your routine by choosing what theme works for you in the moment. 
 Draw one, and bring some zest back into your life through movement and by clearing stale energy. 
When you pull a card to nourish yourself, you can ﬁll your cup back up by taking the time to love yourself.

 Taking a card to focus on using your words, body, and mind to bring something of your own into this word.
 A reminder to connect the dots between yourself and those around you, is where a card may inspire the next fulﬁlling conversation.
 To prompt yourself into digging deeper, either actively or passively, use these to reﬂect on your journey through life.
At the end of the day, making decisions is taxing. The Self Care Adventure Cards take that out of that equation by giving us a portable deck of inspiration to draw on and ﬁnally have the tool to progress your self care adventure.
No stress. No Strict Program. Just a better quality of life. 
With the Self Care Adventure Cards, I make room for myself to practice when I need it to keep on in the pursuit of what I care most about in life: creativity, friendships, and connecting with myself.
The Self Care Adventure Rewards are more than just cards. 


We've spent over 3 months building out your rewards. We've partnered with a great company that has the best quality card decks.  We have ensured support in the manufacturing. The card cloth is soft and 100% cotton. The wood block is locally manufactured by a carpenter and made from oak. 
In an attempt to ensure the best shipping rates for our backers we are waiting until after the campaign to finalize shipping costs.  Here are the estimates:  
There are many ways to use the deck, but it's entirely up to you. 
Here are a few ways to get your imagination started: 
1. Shuffle the deck and choose at random.

2. Sift through the cards and choose what pops out.

3. Separate the deck into piles by each category and go from there.  
Hi, I'm Jenni Kowal. 
I am a multipassionate visual artist with a taste for photography, design and huge pops of color. My business, Anytime Creative, helped me ﬁnally get the Self Care Adventure Cards off the ground and allow me to share this wonderful tool with you. Because I believe that anyone, anywhere, at anytime can be creative, my life's passion is to help other artists and creatives with their self care routines to live a more creative and fulﬁlling life. I draw my inspiration at the intersection where (wo)man meets nature by traveling the world or splitting my time between New Jersey and Nashville. My primary focus is self care and the belief that taking care of yourself ﬁrst will allow everything else in life to fall into place. 
Click here to back the project now :) 
** We are working diligently to get these in your hands, however there is no guarantee these will be in by the holidays. We are trying to do what we can to expedite the first shipment, but with how the world is slowing down in light of the pandemic, we've been informed by the suppliers that it might not be feasible to deliver by the December date.

Photography Across the United States
About the Project
This summer I am planning to travel across the United States like I have done the past few summers to capture different places across the United States. I will start in Southern California and travel to Arizona, New Mexico, Texas, Oklahoma, Missouri, Illinois, Indiana and possibly a few others. I want to offer images taken on this trip into a special book to be delivered in October 2014 called The Summer 2014 Book of Images. I also want to offer images I have taken in the past in the book The Journey So Far. 
I will be using Blurb to create and print the books The Journey So Far and The Summer 2014 Book of Images.
About Me
Hi My name is Marissa Turner. I from Rosamond, California and I am a Photographer. I fell in love with Photography my Junior Year of High School. Since then I have been taking mostly Landscape, Flowers and Sky Photographs.I recently started experimenting with Night Photography as well. I recently started my own website marissaturnerphotography.zenfolio.com. I also started social media sites like Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Flickr, Blogger and Linkedin.

Press Release
PHOTOGRAPHY ACROSS THE UNITED STATES
A Photographer’s Journey to Photograph and Produce Her First Photography Book
Many photographer’s have traveled the United States and gotten great photographs. They visited big towns and places that many people know about. What about small town USA. The places you never heard about. The places that are not on a map. That is what Photography Across the United States is about, seeing the beauty in the places not found on the map.
Photography Across the United States is being done by a photographer who grew up in a small town an hour or two away from the big city lights of Los Angeles and Hollywood in Rosamond, CA. Originally a one stop light town with miles between your home and a grocery store. While we have added a few stop lights and homes are closer together, Rosamond, CA still embodies small town USA. Many people do not see the glamour in small town USA and Photography Across the United States is aiming at changing that through the creation of the Summer 2014 book of images and the Journey So Far.
Photography Across the United States is traveling across the United States by car for three to four weeks to see the places not on the map, in an effort to show people the beauty of small town USA. To show people places they have never heard about before. Come join us on the journey to see the beauty you did not know existed outside the big lights of Los Angeles and Hollywood. Join a small town kid chase there dream to produce her first photography book.

ENGLISH (SPANISH AND FRENCH BELOW)
Selva de Mar has been playing 'aquatic music' since 2006. Aside from touring around Europe, Japan and the Middle East, we have recorded 3 full-length albums and many of our songs have been used for movies and video art works.
Our self-titled debut was recorded in 3 hours in Barcelona. One year later we made “Olas Invisibles” which was recorded over 2 days in a cathedral in Catalonia. With the third album “Club Eden” we went in a live experimental direction: we recorded with live audio processing over the course of 4 days.
Now we are very pleased to announce that we're cooking our 4th album, once again recording in a church. But this time it will take longer, this album is a different story it is much more complex and deep; each time we are trying to dive deeper to explore new sounds and textures.
Our duo (hang, cello, percussion) has the pleasure to invite for this work artists such as :

Voices: Stephanie Pan, singer and performance artist living in Holland and originally from the United States; mû , singer, poet and multi instrumentalist from Guinea Bissau.
Bassoon: Eyal Street, whose register includes all kinds of bassoons and different wind instruments, early and modern.
Drummer: Oriol Roca, originally from Catalonia and capable of adapting to any kind of music styles.

and our super Producer from whatabout music: Dave Bianchi
Now we are nearly done with the recording process, and we're entering the process of post-production. There is a secret artist who is part of this process, he is taking selva de mar recordings into a new voyage, adding a new processed layer to our crystal sound.
There are many people working behind this “birth” and yet still a lot of work to be done. This is why we approach you to come and take part in this adventure. With Kickstarter you can start a new journey as a producer!
the donations will fund:

transports (some of the musicians live abroad)
production
post-prodution

web
promotion
hard copies of the album

CASTELLANO
Selva de Mar ha estado tocando `música acuática´ desde el 2006. Aparte de las giras por Europa, Japón y Medio Oriente, hemos grabado tres álbumes y muchas de nuestras canciones han sido usadas para películas y obras de video arte.
Nuestro debut homónimo fue grabado en 3 horas en Barcelona. Un año más tarde hicimos “Olas Invisibles”, grabado durante dos días en una catedral en Catalunya. Con el tercer álbum “Club Eden” nos adentramos en una experimentación en vivo, procesando el audio a lo largo de 4 días.

Ahora anunciamos con gran alegría que estamos cocinando nuestro 4to álbum, una vez más grabado en una iglesia. Pero esta vez tardaremos más tiempo: este álbum es una historia diferente, mucho más complejo y profundo. Cada vez tratamos de bucear más profundo para explorar nuevos sonidos y texturas.
Nuestro dúo (hang, cello, percusión) tiene el agrado de invitar para este trabajo a los siguientes artistas :

Voces: Stephanie Pan,  cantante y "performance artist" que actualmente recide en Holanda, originaria de Estados Unidos; mû, cantante, poeta y multi instrumentista originario de Guinea Bissau.

Fagot: Eyal Street, cuyo registro comprende todo tipo de fagots y diferentes instrumentos de viento antiguos y modernos.

Batería: Oriol Roca, originario de Catalunya y capaz de adaptarse a cualquier estilo musical.
Ahora que hemos terminado con el proceso de grabación, estamos entrando en el de post-producción. Hay un artista secreto que es parte de este proceso, con el objetivo de llevar las grabaciones de Selva de Mar en un nuevo viaje, añadiendo una capa a nuestro sonido cristalino.
Hay muchas personas que trabajan detrás de este “nacimiento” y queda sin embargo todavía mucho más por hacer. Por eso os invitamos a venir y participar en esta aventura. Con Kickstarter puedes iniciar tu camino como productor!

GRACIAS Y BIENVENIDOS
FRANÇAIS
Selva de Mar joue de la “musique aquatique” depuis 2006. En plus de nos tournées en Europe, au Japon et au Moyen-Orient, nous avons enregistré trois albums et nombreuses de nos chansons ont été utilisées pour des films ou des œuvres d’art vidéo.
Notre album début a été enregistré durant 3 heures à Barcelone. Une année plus tard naît “Olas Invisibles” (vagues invisibles) enregistré pendant 2 jours dans une cathédrale catalane. Dans notre 3ème album “Club Eden”, nous nous sommes prêtés à une expérimentation en live, grâce à des effets audio ajoutés à l’enregistrement, sur une durée de 4 jours.
Aujourd’hui nous vous annonçons avec enthousiasme que nous cuisinons notre 4ème album, utilisant de nouveau une église comme studio d’enregistrement. Mais cette fois il s’agit d’une autre histoire, plus longue, et aussi plus complexe. Notre idée est de plonger chaque fois un peu plus profond dans l’exploration de nouveaux sons et nouvelles textures.
Notre duo (hang, cello, percussion) a le plaisir d'inviter pour ce travail les artistes suivants :
Voix: Stephanie Pan,  chanteuse et "performance artist" résidant actuellement aux Pays-Bas, originaire des États-Unis ;  mû, chanteur, poète et multi instrumentiste né à Guinée-Bissau.

Fagot: Eyal Street, qui touche à tous types de fagots et à de nombreux instruments à vent, traditionnels ou modernes.

Batterie: Oriol Roca, catalan, capable de s'adapter à n'importe quel style de musique.

et notre super producteur du label Whatabout Music : Dave Bianchi
Maintenant que nous avons terminé la phase d’enregistrement, nous entrons dans celle de post-production. C’est à ce moment-ci qu’intervient l’artiste secret, qui emène les enregistrements de Selva de Mar vers un autre voyage, rajoutant une nouvelle touche à notre son cristallin.
Nous sommes plusieurs à travailler à cette “naissance”, et il nous reste encore beaucoup à faire. C’est pourquoi nous vous invitons à participer à l’aventure. Avec Kickstarter devenez vous aussi producteur !

MERCI ET BIENVENUS

Legend has it that flying creatures once brought the three great warring races together in a distant land. But despite their efforts, they were forced to flee their homeland in search of a new world. Little did they know, the place they would call home is also the birthplace of the flying terrors. Follow the orphan, Sora, and his journey of discovery as he travels across a vast world of magic and mystery as he strives to join the mystical Knights of the Dragons Tablet.
~~~
About the Author -
Ian "Shikibara" Berendsen is a college student at the University of Wisconsin - Whitewater. He is working on a double major in Japanese Studies and Journalism. He has always had a love for fantasy and adventure, running around his neighborhood and creating worlds for everything he would see.
~~~
About the KickStarter -
Land of Dragons is one of My earliest worlds I developed, having created the original concept at the age of 12. With summer giving me a break from my studies, I have decided to take this time to work on a couple of books I started with the plan to finish LoD by the end of the year. If successful, I will make it a goal to publish at least 1 book a year, with next year's book focusing on Native Americans. All earnings from the KickStarter will go directly to my college funds, as that is not cheap!
~~~
Why KickStarter? -
I am a college student looking to make up the last bit needed to pay for the next academic year. $1000 is what I expect will be the most needed that isn't covered by scholarships I have earned, and I would like to avoid taking out a loan again. I currently have a part time job, but if I can manage to meet my goal on this campaign, I will shift my focus from that to my writing, knowing my needs are met for college. I will still work on the book if the campaign doesn't meet the goal, the only difference will be what takes the focus of my time. If the campaign fails, I will just work on the book in my free time.

Traveling to mysterious pyramids graced by adorned jaguar sculptures, watching the Son Jarocho musicians and dancers of Vera Cruz, witnessing the beauty of the Celestial Gardens, and stumbling upon inherent beauty in between, will provide the most precious of inspiration to paint.  The plan is to immerse myself into beautiful and culturally rich places such places as Oaxaca and Coatzacoalcos.   I'll be expanding and evolving as an artist, and creating paintings inspired by Mexico's beloved landscapes and culture. 
   First off, I'll fly into Mexico City where I'll explore ancient pyramids.  From there I'll begin making my way North to the most colorful city in the world Guanajuato.  After that I will be headed South to Vera Cruz, then to beautiful Coatzacoalcos, then to Oaxaca.  I will be painting while I travel as well as taking photos for referencing.  I will stay in each place for a week or so, to get a good feel of the revered attributes of the location, including any wildlife and nature. I also plan on being flexible about the destinations, as I may feel called to certain places in the moment.  The voyage is set to be a little over a month.
   Many people say that my art has a Mexican vibe to it, so it's going to be amazing to have Mexico make a direct impact and influence on my art and new paintings.  I will bring you colorful art full of inspiration, culture, and sacred love.  You will feel the travels through the art.  
  My art is inspired by my upbringing and experiences in life.  I was born in the Antelope Valley Desert in Southern, California just east of the Mojave.  I spent most of my childhood on a ranch in the desert.  I found the desert to be beautiful and mysterious.  The desert is calm and peaceful, but can also be a very harsh environment for life.  The desert is a place where one can easily find solitude.  The vibrant desert sunset is a magnificent source for meditation, and rebirth.  My goal is to create paintings that bring the onlooker peace, stillness, and a place to remember we are all eternal burning love. 
Pachamama Desert ~ The inspiration for the mama and her pups comes from the photo 'Howling Lesson' taken by the talented wildlife photographer Debbie Dicarlo (www.debbiedicarlophotography.com)
  In my twenties I lived in the woods of Topanga, Ca.  It's a small hippie town in the Santa Monica mountains.  I felt at home there because the small town and solitude of nature reminded me of childhood.  I learned a lot about living alternatively there.  There were many people that grew up there during the 60's and the influence was still alive and strong.   I enjoyed hearing their wild stories of the past and how it used to be.  The town had an overall hippie vibe.  I revisited psychedelic music that I was first exposed to as a child through my parents.  I had a different perspective this time around because I had a greater understanding of the message.  I attribute the freedom of this music as an inspiration to my style of painting.  Psychedelic music gives a sense of peace, wonderment, freedom, mystery, and burning love.  I describe some of my art as psychedelic desert scenes, when asked what style of art I paint.
   The art I paint is very heart chakra centered.  Often times, people say that the scene makes them feel the love.  It makes their hearts smile.  The sacred heart is a symbol of burning love.  It's that feeling of loving and being loved.  It's those times when you think, "Wow I'm happy".  It's that feeling you get when you're expressing your heart's passions.
   My Grandmother Tomasa Molinar, mother of thirteen, was a huge influence.  I lived with her and my mother throughout most of my childhood.  She was born in Mexico, but my mother was born in the States.  Sometimes it's difficult for people to pass down cultural knowledge from generation to generation because of acclimation to a new culture.  Grandma Tomasa did her best to keep tradition alive.  She made the most delicious authentic food everyday and made enough for everyone.  Her heart was always so full of compassion.  I used to love watching her light prayer candles with the beautiful illustrations of saints and Mother Mary on them.  She would kneel down with her rosary between her palms and pray for everyone she loved.  It was beautiful to witness her heartfelt tradition.  She would be so proud to see me following my divine passions, especially in Mexico! 
 It's such a gift to have the opportunity to learn more about my roots in a very artistic way. My son Milo will be traveling with me.  I'm so over the moon he'll get to learn about where his great grandmother is from on top of the gift of exposure to another country.  It's really important to me that he gets to experience new places, culture and language.  It's also a true blessing that he gets to be right next to me watching and learning invaluable information while we journey.
   Air travel to and from Mexico is $429.  Travel while in Mexico is $400.  Lodging for a month staying at air bnbs and such, will be $500.  Food for Milo and I will be $400. The cost of art supplies and shipping materials is $600.  Kickstarter fees will be $143.30.  That brings the venture to a grand total of $2,329.  
  I'm so thankful for this incredible venture.  I'm looking forward to painting for all of you.  Thank you for your contribution to this project and supporting my artistic soul path. And most of all thank you for loving art.

What's Hire Y'all? 
Hire Y'all is a professional network aiming to connect retail and service industry employees with hiring managers. We've created a pretty cool employment service platform, tailored it towards our industry, and optimized the search process making it easier to find the right fit for job-seekers and employers alike. 
How'd We Get Started?
We have deep roots in the Dallas retail industry. We also know how difficult it is to find productive, conscientious, and hard-working employees. Platforms are constantly raising prices from the upwards of $75+ per post, without any guarantee of quality of talent. That's why we started Hire Y'all. We wanted to make it easier and affordable to find all-star employees. 
Why Are We Raising Funds?
We have watched Hire Y'all grow in Dallas with our internal efforts. The number of active user job-seekers has grown steadily, as has the number of business users. But we're not satisfied yet - we want to see Hire Y'all grow to the next level. For that reason, we want to raise money to hire a Sales team. By leveraging their relationships, our sales team will work towards locking in corporate accounts and expanding growth to the next level. We started in Dallas and have seen surprising growth, so we are confident that with the right sales team we can grow Hire Y'all into an even greater success.

(English)
Help us launch Sweden's first Arabic-language weekly newspaper!
Sweden is experiencing a lot of social and political change. Thousands of refugees are arriving at its boarders and political parties that are against multiculturalism are getting stronger. In the media there are a lot of people that are talking about migrants and refugees, especially the Arabic-speaking group. Now we want to create a platform so that the Arabic-speaking community can speak for itself.
We have in the past year issued the free monthly newspaper Al Kompis and got some great response. But people have said that they want more. Now we want to give it to them! 
With your help we can create Sweden's first Arabic-language weekly newspaper. This is a historic step for us and for the Arabic-speaking community in Sweden. 
With the help of Al Kompis weekly newspaper, we the arabic speakers in Sweden will contribute to a better integration-process in which our own views are heard as well. 
What do we need to start a newspaper? 
For us to be able to start a weekly newspaper, we need your help. We need to raise 375 000 Swedish crowns in funds. 
Please remember that we will only get money from the campaign if we succeed in getting 375 000 kr. So please share our link, and tell a friend about the campaign. 
 SINCERELY 
/ Al Kompis team 
(Arabic)
ساهم معنا بإطلاق أول جريدة إخبارية اسبوعية ناطقة بالعربية في السويد: السويد الآن تشهد متغيرات كبيرة ومتلاحقة، ومن المهم أن نكون دائما على اطلاع ونعرف ما يدور حولنا، ومع تدفق المزيد من اللاجئين إلى السويد تزداد الحاجة إلى توفر معلومات مجتمعية صحيحة وتتمتع بالمصداقية عن أهم ما يلزم للانخراط في المجتمع. بعد نجاح شعبية وانتشار جريدة الكومبس الحالية بإصدارها الشهري، نرى أن الوقت قد حان الآن لوجود جريدة أسبوعية، تكون بمثابة منبر ومنصة لكل الناطقين باللغة العربية في السويد، تعبر عنهم وعن تطلعاتهم وتبرز مساهماتهم الإيجابية في المجتمع وتتناول الظواهر السلبية المرافقة لعملية تفاعلهم واندماجهم في المجتمع. من خلال تفهمكم ومساهماتكم البسيطة يمكننا معا تحقيق مشروع تأسيس الجريد الأسبوعية والتي ستكون بمثابة انجاز تاريخي في السويد، ليس لشبكة الكومبس، بل لجميع الناطقين بالعربية في السويد. مساعدتكم تتمثل بالاشتراك في الجريدة ودفع مبلغ 390 كرون (350 + 10% تكاليف الحملة) كرسوم اشتراك سنوية، وهو عبارة عن اجور البريد فقط لتصلكم الجريدة كل اسبوع على عناوينكم. متابعة ما يجري من أحداث ونقاشات حول قضايا تمسنا وتمس مستقبل أطفالنا، يحتاج إلى منبر إعلامي يكون أيضا منصة للتعبير عن آرائنا وافكارنا وتعريف القادمين الجدد على مشتركات المواطنة السويدية التي تجمعنا. نحن نعتقد أننا جزء من هذا المجتمع ولكي نكرس هذا الاعتقاد يجب علينا أن نعرف أكثر عن السويد والمجتمع السويدي ونواكب ما يجري به من أحداث تهمنا وتهم مستقبل الأجيال القادمة، تسخير الإعلام والصحافة وبشكل مهني وبمصداقية عالية يساعدنا أكثر على الاندماج الايجابي بالمجتمع مع المحافظة على هويتنا ومعتقداتنا الخاصة لكي نستطيع تحقيق هذا الهدف والنجاح بإطلاق جريدة الكومبس الاسبوعية نحن بحاجة لاشتراكاتكم. فقط 375 كرون هي رسوم الاشتراك السنوية نحن وضعنا هدف جمع 375 ألف كرون من وراء هذه الحملة، ونأمل أن نتفهم أهمية هذا المشروع ونتساعد على جمع هذا المبلغ كاشتراكات في جريدة الكومبس الأسبوعية. تذكر أننا سنحاول جمع هذا المبلغ فقط عبر موقع Crowdfundingen لذلك نتمنى أن تنشر الرابط بين أصدقائك ومعارفك.
(Swedish)
Hjälp oss att starta Sveriges första arabiskspråkiga veckotidning!
Vi upplever just nu en värld i förändring. Tusentals flyktingar anländer till Sverige från krigshärjade nationer och politiska krafter som är emot det mångkulturella samhället blir allt starkare. Många pratar just nu om invandrare och flyktingar, i synnerhet den arabisktalande gruppen. Nu vill vi skapa en plattform för att arabtalande i Sverige själva ska få prata och ta plats.
Vi har under det senaste året gett ut månadstidningen Al Kompis och fått fantastisk gensvar från våra läsare som har hört av sig till oss och berättat att de vill ha mer Al Kompis.
Nu vill vi ge det till er!
Genom er hjälp kan vi tillsammans skapa Sveriges första arabiskspråkiga veckotidning. Detta är ett historiskt steg, både för vår del och den arabisktalande gruppen i Sverige.
Med hjälp av Al Kompis veckotidning kan vi, de arabtalande i Sverige, ta plats i samhället och bidra till en bättre integration där också våra röster kommer till tals.
Vad behöver vi för att starta tidningen?
För att vi ska kunna starta veckotidningen behöver vi er hjälp. Vi behöver få ihop 375 000 kr i startkapital.
Men kom ihåg att vi kommer bara få pengar från Crowdfundingen om vi lyckas få ihop hela summan så dela gärna vår länk och tipsa en vän om kampanjen.
MVH
/Al Kompis
INFO
Al Kompis Media Network is an independent news organisation with no political or religious alignments.
The plan is to start publishing the new weekly newspaper on the first week of  February 2016.
A father and son album, music video and tour fund.

I am the artist David Willardson 

I feel most inspired by the artists Claus Oldenburg and Richard Tuttle. They have been most influential in giving me the insight into the void where most of my inspiration comes from.

My works of art should fall into the category or abstract expressionism.
To complete my “Elegant Surprise” series, I would like to create 6 more works to be shown in this series. One of those works will be a 5’9” tall female sculpture with this material. She will ultimately complete this series.

I like to create small works that look like they are too heavy to hang on a wall but in fact they are very light.. I feel that they should look you in the face when you look at them. I also believe that they are humble and playful and that they invite you to reconsider your view when you confront them.
Different views will create a different experience in that you should not get the same experience from your previous view.I am a big believer in up cycling and all of my “Elegant Surprise” works will involve up cycling.
I feel that I am making something of importance with this new medium that I love to work with. Most of my experience in sculpture has been in clay. In high school I won an Art “Award of Excellence” in a State High School competition where my work of art was the only sculpture out of all of the different mediums to get an award. That sculpture is called facial expressions. That award also brought much attention from universities to my talent. Facial expressions has 365 different heads that form a vase and everyone who views it gets quite a different experience. I want those who view my works have a desire to interact with it in many ways such as touching it and even falling in love with it which many have told me that they have.

My artwork is created with an inward experience from an exterior experience that I have had. I feel that each one of my pieces has its own personal expression that comes from a part of my sublimation. IT has helped me develop as an individual finding a spiritual redirection which is important for everyone to experience. Creating artwork and viewing artwork is a spiritual experience for me transforming me into a different dimension when I need that escape.
My goal with Kickstarter is to raise enough money to get into a gallery and have a show, transportation costs, and finish my collection to be shown at the gallery.

THE STORY
Welcome to the world of Scissor Sisters, a fantastical reality where the time stream is a living and well-traveled path between wheres and whens. We think you'll like it here, and we'd love for you to stay, check the place out and help us fund printing of this massive, sweeping story. 
Last Summer, with the help of 102 generous Backers, we successfully funded Scissor Sisters, a 120-page graphic novel - the story of Candi and Ash, a pair of women separated by millennia but whose love is an inevitability. They are thrown together in the least likely of times and places and hunted by The Continuum, a cross-time conspiracy of the elite and the sinister deeply frightened of the destiny of the couple they refer to as The Sisters.
The Original Scissor Sisters Graphic Novel - Available in a Bundle with Swan Song at the $25 Reward Tier!
We loved it so much – and got so much terrific feedback on it – that we decided to continue the story in the 54-page graphic novel, Scissor Sisters: Swan Song. This new volume follows the time-tripping assassin Cygnet, vanquished by the Sisters to ancient times in our first chapter, her only ally a friend of one of the Sisters. Faced with traitors to her wicked Master, Cygnet must steal a powerful mask to repair her time-traveling armor and resume her quest to fulfill her mission and destroy the Sisters.
THE PROJECT
The Star of the Show - Scissor Sisters: Swan Song!
Scissor Sisters: Swan Song is written by Kevin LaPorte (Vicious Circus, Last Ride for Horsemen, Roadkill du Jour, Scales of Time, and The Absentee) and illustrated by Marvel and DC veteran Rich Perotta (Scales of Time, The Ray, Deadpool) with colors by Vito Potenza. Scissor Sisters  was co-created by Erica J. Heflin (Zenescope's Wonderland, Cosmic Times' Flesh of White, and Antithesis). Consider it rated PG-13 for violence/gore and adult themes.
This is the second of several planned volumes of Scissor Sisters, all with the same committed team of creators, and our plans go far beyond crowdfunding, to include broad distribution through comic shops and other retail channels! But, first, we have to pay for the initial print run, which is the purpose of this Kickstarter campaign and where you come in!
THE PREVIEW
Cygnet stalks her prey...
  ...and manipulates the very hands of time to secure her enemies...
  ...frozen in the numbers of her clock, they fall...
  ...her assassin's skills unveiled, she tightens her temporary alliance...
CHARACTERS
  THE CREATORS
Writer - Kevin LaPorte
Fairhope, Alabama-based writer and co-creator of genre comics with a horror bent, the worlds Kevin creates range from the bayou territory of a lone motorcycle gangster seeking vengeance for his cursed appetite for street meat and the slaughter of his brothers-in-arms (Roadkill du Jour) to dark carnivals overrun by killer clowns violently avenging abused children (Vicious Circus) to dying frontier towns in the Old West beset by Steampunk versions of the Four Horsemen of the Apocalypse (Last Ride for Horsemen) to hellish dimensions replete with untapped energy mined by unsuspecting adventurers ripe for demonic possession (The Absentee)!
Artist - Rich Perotta
Starting as an intern for the X-Men office in 1993, Rich soon became a staff artist and then a freelance inker for Marvel with a dash of Dark Horse and Crusade Entertainment thrown in for good measure. Rich inked for Marvel for roughly ten years. In 2004, he took a break from comics and in 2010, re-entered the comic industry working for DC Comics inking titles Booster Gold and The Ray limited series. Rich is now pencilling and inking independent titles such as Mice & Man, Magma-Man for Source Point Press and the Scales of Time one-shot and Scissor Sisters series for INVERSE PRESS. Rich currently resides in New York City.
Colorist - Vito Potenza
Born in Mola di Bari (BA) – Italy in 1983, Vito attended and graduated at International School of Comics – Rome [2005-2008] and subsequently worked as illustrator/comics artist for The First Place and Edizioni Master [2005-2012]. He then moved on to be illustrator and storyboard artist for Video Explainers [2013-today] and has worked from July 2016 as colorist for Inverse Press.

This Kickstarter campaign is designed to help artist Kaz McCue self-publish a book of his photographic work entitled “Photographic Impression from M-22.” This will be a 96-page hardcover book with the dimensions of 10"x10".
Kaz has lived in northwestern Michigan for the past ten years and has lived in Leelanau County for the past five years. Through all of this time Michigan State Highway M-22 has been at the center of his photographic explorations and he has used this meandering 119 mile motorway to search out the many niches and environs that exist in this part of Michigan. Most of M-22 runs through Leelanau County, which is noted as one of the most beautiful places in America. This remote destination features farms, vineyards, fruit orchards, small towns, forests, the shores of Lake Michigan, and Sleeping Bears Dunes National Lakeshore. 
For those that live here–and for many who visit this area–M-22 is not simply the designation of this trunkline state highway but it has become a symbol for a simpler, more down-to-earth way of life and an emblem for the beauty that exists in this corner of northern Michigan affectionately called “the pinkie.”
As a resident of Leelanau County, Kaz notes that; "As an artist, I have been struck by the ever-changing light, the continual evolution of the seasons, the quietness of place and time. Being out in nature and exploring this area has taken me to unexpected places in a familiar environment. The more I explore, the more I discover."
Indeed, M-22 has found a place in Kaz's heart that is so comfortable, so familiar. This book, then, is a record of his ongoing relationship with this place and the road that helps to connect him with all of its charms. "The images contained within this book chronicle my time here and each one is a detail of a memory that I gladly share through this project."

As advertised, this book will try its best to KILL you. Now that we've gotten that out of the way, we can get down to business. I'm not a real doctor, but I assume that when your mind is blown, your brain explodes. I could be mistaken, but when the human brain explodes, you're fairly certain to shuffle off the mortal coil. Trust me, it doesn't benefit me in the least for you to die. In fact, I'm counting on you, oh courageous reader, to live.
"I'm not here to drop yet another hammer on the evils of humanity, nor to offer an emotional and hopeful appeal for peace and utopia through text. My intent and aspiration in this project is to take the most hotly contested, most chaos-inducing, and most "difficult" to answer questions of life, and to answer them. How is this different from so many other past attempts to bring humankind together? Because this time, it's going to WORK.
I am an average human being. This statement is not meant to belittle myself, but to paint a picture of similarity between us all. It takes only a few moments of personal thought to establish the things we need in life, and the things we want in living it. Easy enough. The real challenge rests in exercising those desires, and THAT is only difficult because the workings of the world seem constructed to directly resist us from achieving our goals.
It doesn't take hundreds of chapters of exhaustingly researched facts, a psychological breakdown of the human condition, or an uber-intellectual denouncement of the world at large. Addressing and solving the world's problems can (and shall) be done with simplicity. All it takes is a casual digital stroll around YouTube, Reddit, Twitter or Facebook to observe the attitude of the world at large.
This Book Will KILL You is a straightforward, sensible, and modern attempt to communicate with each and every human being that it can reach. Ten is an excellent number, and holds a feeling of completion in itself. For that reason, I have established ten points to be addressed in this first installment. I believe that offering these ten points in a rational, non-biased conversation with the reader will invoke the spirit of commonality in us all. They are:
1. Religion. No, not a discussion of why religion is good or bad, but a way for us all to cope with our differences in the myriad views on our origins, our purpose, and our destiny. It's not hard, and it makes no excuses for those who use it as a means to inflict harm on others.
2. Politics. Wow, numbers one and two are the topics that are generally held to be the worst possible discussion points in polite conversation. Too bad, because they are both so relevant to how and why we live our lives, and I've found a way to make them easy to digest, and without ruling any one ideology out as invalid or foolish. Winning.
3. Love. How many times in just the past decade has the subject of interpersonal love been muddied with violence, hatred and sensationalism. No longer. If hearing how easy it is to live alongside your fellow human beings despite your sexual and emotional differences will kill you, chapter three is the end for you, friend.
4. Children. Are they, or are they not the future? OUR future, as the next chapter in the story of human kind.. why then is there no standard for the aspects of their growth that will either help them become thoughtful, creative, inspired, loving builders.. or pessimistic and intolerant psychopaths. The latter dies out with THIS generation, or are converted to the former.
5. Money. Despite the branding of money as the ultimate evil, and the weapon of injustice, money is honestly meant to be tracker for one's productivity and helpfulness to the whole. That simple standard ideal has been thoroughly corrupted, but in just a few easy conversations, we can get back on track. For a nominal fee, of course ;)
6. Craziness. A general term, but what it describes is a foreign idea to no one. People have been crazy since the first batch of us came around, and won't cease to be any time soon. Coping with craziness will help us all do everything possible to counteract the negativity it spreads, and just may aid us in significantly diminishing human lunacy to a more manageable level.
7. Violence. Like the Muppet formerly known as Cookie Monster (Now Veggie Monster) informs youngsters, cookies are a "sometimes" food. Likewise, the human currently known as Dave says violence is a "sometimes" answer. When we really get down into the nitty-gritty of change and enlightenment, there are some people that are so stuck in their ways that they will resist to the bitter end, opting for destruction and menace rather than coexist with those that differ from them. For those people, I invoke not a bloodbath with hot lead and explosives, but a fair, honest and straightforward round of fisticuffs. Or, even better, vie for dominance on the latest first person shooter. Either way, the way to deal with, and eventually curb human violence, is laid out for generations young and old. Let's not repeat our past mistakes here, guys.
8. Trust. Thanks to information availability in a decent portion of the planet, we have access to great spans of information about the past, present and future. Most of it details the horrors of human cruelty, and what some call 'mindless' drivel to satisfy the masses. I would argue that there are as many theories detailing the secrecy, conspiracy, and underhandedness of our unseen rulers as there are examples of 7+ billion other human beings doing all they can to survive and thrive. In discussing trusting in yourself, and in the rest of your species, in the hope of helping humans realize that we have only to unite to succeed at well.. everything.
9. The Past. Whew, how about our ancestors, right? So caught up in the need for more territory, more wealth, more legacy, that a fraction of a percent of us (in the past) wrought misery and slaughter on one another through the use of others with iron and fire. There are as many stories of conquest, betrayal, enslavement and violent nationalism as there are nations past and present. While sometimes exciting, horrifying or dramatic to read and relive, is this what we want future generations to remember us for? We have ascended past this stage, whether you might think so or not, but a few simple discussions about our roots may damn well put our present to rights. No sugar-coating, bias or favoritism to be found.
10. The Future. How bright and beautiful it could be. How miserable, dark and desolate as well. Only by taking the time now, here and with one another in cooperation, do we stand to reach the gilded images of luxury and glory that our predecessors envisioned for us. It won't take long. No more than the final chapter of ten in a brief, simple book as a matter of fact. We can have that conversation, you and I, and I promise not to fill it full of sugary sweet pictures of utopia. This is a real portrait of our timeline if we get off our collective asses and stop being ridiculous. Sounds impossible, but I disagree!"

This is my passion and my way of giving back to the Veteran community with whom I have served and have revered all my life. I wanted to share a story of every Veteran: An eternal struggle with the transition from fighting the war abroad to the internal war at home. Veterans have fought wars for many different reasons and their experiences are as varied. Some fought, some did not, some return with survivor’s guilt, some with demons, others return gravely wounded, and some return physically unscathed. But we all struggle with coming home physically and emotionally, usually upset at how much society has changed, often perceived for the worse. It is only after the internal conflict, the war within oneself, that we realize it is not society that has so greatly changed, it is not society with whom we are so upset, but rather, it is ourselves. 
  A man, changed forever by the scars of battle returns home after many years of war to find his city unrecognizable, seemingly not what it once was. Feeling betrayed by a substandard society he fought to defend and of the corruption by those who sent him to fight, Death Trap embarks on a mission to carve out a bloody path to redemption for both his city and himself...and to perhaps regain something he has lost.
  Years of war have revealed our character mysteriously unable to die; however, haunted by the experiences of war, the mental and emotional scars left by the never ending picture show of death and chaos struggling to consume his every thought, have rendered our character incapable of experiencing any emotion other than the burning rage that fuels his mission. Death Trap must harness the inferno of hate that he uses to lay waste to a corrupt and degenerate society before it consumes him, and his humanity, forever blurring the line between the enemy and for those whom he is fighting...

Mission - Who-Death Trap. What-Reset the city. Where-Detroit Michigan. When-Now Why-Some things just need to die...

Command and Control- Location of command - Detroit, MI, USA: classified underground location. Use encrypted radios and cyber exploitation of news agencies, street cameras, and media outlets. projector screens.

Do What You Want is a one-off magazine, curated and edited by author and food writer Ruby Tandoh and her partner Leah Pritchard, to raise money for the mental health charities Mind, Beat and some smaller local charities and initiatives. It features an interview with writer and actress Mara Wilson; food writers Diana Henry (Sunday Telegraph), Tejal Rao (NY Times) and Joanna Weinberg (The Times); Heather Havrilesky (Ask Polly, NY Mag); Laura Snapes (Pitchfork, Rookie); and illustrations from Laura Callaghan (NYLON, Refinery 29), Rose Blake (The New York Times, Disney) and Julia Scheele (Vice, The Guardian).
From Ruby: “Over the years we have both suffered from mental health problems and one of the most difficult things about those times was how difficult it was to seek help, and how isolating the illness was. We both know first hand the stigma of being mentally ill, of not being able to be honest with friends and family about why you have withdrawn from work, social plans, studies, relationships. Although we have grown up in a generation that is more aware of mental health (and illness) than ever, we still felt that social pressure to “just cheer up” acutely. There is a real lack of understanding about the many different ways that mental illness can manifest, the things that trigger it, and what can be done to help.” 
From Leah: “Even for those who haven’t personally experienced mental ill health, we all know someone who has. So many of us suffer in silence because we’re afraid of how people might react. That’s why we wanted to make this magazine. As well as raising money for charities that help those with mental health problems, we wanted to make something that would provide a channel for people to engage with discussions around mental health and give a platform to those suffering from mental illness. As someone who has suffered trauma, and experienced anxiety and depression, my hope is that the magazine will promote empowerment and compassion in the face of the stigma, misinformation and oppression that issues around mental health so often carry.”
We have writers and editors on board already from the Guardian, New York magazine, the New York Times, Rolling Stone, Rookie, and Pitchfork. Some of the features include: Why Should I Go to Therapy? by Heather Havrilesky, the writer behind The Cut’s Ask Polly; recipes for taking care of yourself, by Ruby Tandoh, Diana Henry, Tejal Rao, Izy Hossack, and more; The Many Faces of Eating Disorders, showing how they can affect anyone, regardless of gender, sexual orientation, age, race, and size; and The Cost of Care, interviewing Sally Burke of Channel 4’s Kids on the Edge, and investigating mental health provision in the North East.
Do What You Want will be released in April, retailing at £7, with all profit going to charity.
What do we need money for?
We want to make sure that we maximise the amount of the proceeds from sales of the zine that will go to charity. With that in mind, we're calling for businesses and individuals to come forward and donate whatever they can to help us meet printing costs in advance, so that 100% of proceeds from sales can go direct to Mind, Beat, and other smaller mental health initiatives. We (Ruby and Leah) as well as all of our writers, illustrators, editors and designers are working for free, donating our time to make this project happen. We hope that you can help it become a reality!

Evadrion was a rebellious Angel until her memories were taken. Her winged peers have brought her back to the light but keep her in the dark. The imminent threat of the Diabolics keeps her under control. She wants to help, truly! But an Angel becomes more trouble than she’s worth when too many questions are asked...
The story is rated R for the occasional sex and boobs. Blood and gore is common but never gratuitous.
Authorities That Be includes the first and complete story arc of Angels Power finally printed in a perfect-bound softcover.

  Hi! I’m Amélie Hutt.
Originally from Belgium, I’ve been living in California for over ten years now. The sun is a little harsh on my fragile amphibian skin (Belgium is cold and rainy! Don’t go!! We want the chocolate all for ourselves!) so I stay in my cave all day and paint at night, dreaming of real chocolate.

I’ve been working as a professional illustrator since 2012, contributing to super cool projects like Lord of the Rings LCG, Game of Thrones LCG, Star Wars LCG, Android Netrunner, Fury of Dracula...
Need more? You can see the rest of my illustration work at: https://www.artstation.com/artist/smirt
Why do I make comics?
High school was hell for me so I spent the whole time inside of my head, building up the place of birth of Evadrion, Metatron and Azazel...
I always found myself at home with images, drawing everyday for as long as I can remember.

People used to tell me: “You should draw comics.” Belgium is the birth place of European comics if you will (Tintin, Astérix & Obélix, ...) but for some reason, it never clicked. I felt disconnected.
It's only after looking at amazing webcomics like SSSS (Minna Sundberg), Unsounded (Ashley Cope) and Spindrift (Elsa Kroese/Charlotte E. English), all amazing artists, that I realized I didn’t have to fit into a mold. I could do it my own way!

Why Kickstarter?I want this book to be as beautiful as I envisioned it. To make it a reality, I need the funds to hire the talented KrakenPrint for a 500 offset print run. Because I’m not big on conventions, (Out of my cave?? Imagine that!) participating to this Kickstarter is your guaranteed opportunity to get your own copy of this book. Not only that but this campaign is the only place to acquire the Kickstarter-exclusive cover variant of the Graïnne, with a numbered and signed bookplate. Amazing. And rare! Oh.
What will the funds be used for?
58% of the funds are for printing alone because it's such a nice thick book. A good 28% goes into shipping because it's a HEAVY 2 lbs book! (But what's more seductive than a thick, heavy book? Please answer that for me.)
The remaining 14% goes into fees and contingencies, in case anything happens. It's good to be cautious.
     Did you need a taste? Oh, but please! Take a peek, a good bite!
    You can read the entirety of Volume I (except for the 38 unpublished pages that will be in the book) for free at:
http://apcomic.com/
             Of all the pages featured in Volume I, 38 pages haven't been published online!
