The Influencers Movement (TIM) makes influencers marketing accessible for everyone in the most honest and cost-effective way. 
TIM will be a revolutionary online platform that offers an open, worldwide marketplace and all the tools both influencers, mediating agencies and clients need in order to efficiently match and manage collaborations. So, from pitching to monitoring and from analyses to payments, TIM does all the work for you.
Technology will enable TIM to make sure influencers (bloggers, vloggers and social media influencers) will keep their rewards 100% and clients will only be paying a set fee in order to use the platform.
An open market will improve efficiency and relevance in influencers marketing. With TIM, inspiration will be available for the right audience, at the right place, in the form of the most valuable content.
We feel the urge to start a movement because we believe that only by joining forces, we can realize an honest and open marketplace like TIM and stop the unnecessary commissioning. We invite you to join the movement: share TIM's story and enthuse other people to fund TIM's dream as well. Every backer counts!
TIM is a movement, a platform and a manager. Huh? Yes, TIM will be all that! Because our experience at our first company Bloggers Network has taught us that influencers, as well as brands and mediating agencies need a superhero like TIM!
So, how does TIM work? First, TIM THE MOVEMENT, is created to make a change in the way we approach influencers marketing. 

Why do we need a movement? Working together with influencers to spread your story as a brand could potentially be the most credible and effective marketing asset of the future. Unfortunately, it is not that simple. The problem comes down to this: an unnecessary amount of time and money is lost for all parties involved.

Why? Well, first of all, most brands lack knowledge on how, but most of all, which influencers they should approach for their campaigns. Media-, PR- and advertising agencies have tried to meet the needs of brands by mediating between them. But there are still no tools available to efficiently manage all the processes or to get an overview of the whole influencers market. Probably that is why most agencies still take up to an average of 40% of the financial contributions given to the influencers.

On the other side, the influencers. Apart from the fact that they are earning less than they should, they also lose a lot of time by going through an overload of irrelevant requests on a daily basis. With the result that they miss out on campaigns that would truly add value to their blog, vlog or social media channel.
The movement is created to show everyone how many influencers, brands and mediators would want influencers marketing to be more accessible and cost-effective. Also, we want to create awareness of the value of influencers marketing. TIM's motto: Credits to the creators!
Second, TIM THE PLATFORM. We have everything in place to build the worldwide influencers marketplace. A platform that will allow influencers to get an overview of all possible campaigns they can pitch on. On the other side, it will enable clients (brands and mediating agencies) to publish their campaigns anytime and anyway they would want and to find out by their selves which influencer would fit their campaign best.   
Clients will publish campaigns on the marketplace
Influencers will pitch on campaigns they love & determine their own rates per campaign component.
And last but not least, we need TIM THE MANAGER, to efficiently manage all the processes involved in a collaboration. TIM will offer all the tools our clients and influencers would need.
Pitching tool
With only one click, influencers can pitch on a campaign. TIM knows their members, so information about themselves, their channel and statistics are already known and forwarded by the system. Also, TIM wants influencers to be in control over what they earn per campaign. Influencers can adjust their rates per campaign, which they will get to keep for the full 100%.
Matching tool
TIM has access to real-time statistics of all subscribed influencers. These real-time statistics do not only include reach, but also SEO value, engagement and references. The client can choose with which influencer they would want to work with.
Briefing tool:
TIM provides all the tools to efficiently keep in touch with each other. As an influencer you can find all the instructions per campaign in the briefing tool. And as a client you can easily send new information regarding to their campaigns.
Monitoring tool:
Some clients want to check content before it will be published. Via the monitoring tool influencers can easily sent their content to the client and clients can suggest potential adjustments.
Analysis tool:
One of the most important tools from our clients' wishlist: a tool that provides them with analyses of the results of their campaigns. Conversion, CTR, views, engagement, the analysis tool provides all the information you need.
Feedback tool:
References are very important for influencers to build a reputation on TIM, but also to improve their work. It's not mandatory, but we do kindly request clients to rate the influencers' work. 
Payment tool:
And this is a tool that we found very important for both influencers and clients. TIM will take care of your financial administration! All campaigns will be handled by the invoice and payment system of TIM at once. No more hassling with invoices and e-mailing, TIM will take care of it from now on.
Circle tool:
Imagine, you're an influencer; maybe you would want to only receive campaigns of your preferred PR- and media agencies. Or maybe you would not want to miss out on any campaign of your favorite brand. Well, than you can easily request access to the circles of those clients and get a notification whenever they publish a new campaign. On the other hand, brands and mediators will be able to keep in touch with their favourite influencers. A win-win situation!
On March 28th, 2015, The Influencers Movement was selected as one of the three finalists for the TEDxAmsterdam Women Startup Awards at the preliminary rounds of this contest. 
The goal of the Startup Awards is to assist women in making the transition from an idea into a business, but also to provide them with an opportunity and having the chance to present a TED Talk during the TEDxAmsterdamWomen event on May 29th at the Okura Hotel in Amsterdam. In addition there will be offered coaching, assistance with crowdfunding, mentorship by partners like TomTom, ING and PWC and several other great prizes.
This Kickstarter campaign is an important part of this competition. All three finalists will launch a campaign on Kickstarter from april 20 till may 18 and the number of backers, impact, engagement and of course the success of this campaign will increase our chances of winning the Startup Awards!
Do you want to show your support at the finals on May 29? Registration is now open on the website of TEDx Amsterdam Women. And for our international followers, it will also be possible to livestream the TED talk of Myrthe and Dorit. 
The Influencers Movement was founded because we feel the urge to bring a positive change into the influencers market, based on the needs and interests of the influencers, and not based on the sole purpose of earning money. Curious why you - as an influencer - will love TIM? 
Get to keep 100% of your self chosen financial rewards 
Only get notifications of campaigns that you love
Get to pitch on all campaigns and events worldwide
Stay in touch with your favorite brands, PR- and media agencies
Gain financial and legal security
Create a portfolio with corresponding references and statistics
Get a real-time mediakit (incl. content, social & display advertising)
After a year of experience in consulting brands in what way they could best collaborate with influencers, we have noticed there is one big universal problem: an unnecessary amount of time and money is lost by finding the right influencers and managing the processes involved in collaborations. Curious how TIM will solve this problem for all of you brands?
Publish a campaign on the marketplace by yourself anytime, anyway you want.
A campaign can include a combination of content, social and display advertising.
Rewards for the influencers can be a barterdeal, financial reward or an invitation for your event.
Get access to the whole influencers market on one platform.
Pay per campaign or subscribe so you'll be able to use TIM's tools on a continuous basis.
Get access to realtime statistics of the influencers, that have pitched on your campaign, in advance.
Stay in touch with the influencers you'll work with through the briefing tool.
Monitor the content before publication by using the monitoring tool.
Evaluate the statistics (CTR, Engagement, Views etc.) of your campaign with the evaluation tool.
All payments will be handled automatically by TIM.
Stay in touch with your favorite influencers by creating a circle.
We want to make influencers marketing more accessible, just like a lot of media- PR- and advertising agencies have already been trying to do for many years. 
Unfortunately, most of these mediating agencies don't have access to software that manage the processes in an effective way. This still causes the current collaborations made by mediating agencies to be rather time and cost ineffective. Probably that's why most of the mediators still take up to an average of 40% of the financial rewards of the influencers. 
Besides that, we have noticed that contracts of these agencies restrict influencers to accept requests of other parties. Isn't that a shame? Wouldn't everyone profit from an open market where the focus lies on the most relevant match?
We think media- PR- and advertising agencies play a crucial role in consulting brands in what way a campaign could be established in the most profitable and relevant way. We don't want to replace these agencies, we want to provide them with tools to efficiently manage their processes. In fact, we think mediating agencies could potentially be the most successful users of TIM, because they already know how to set up a successful campaign and select the most relevant influencers.
We also know the value of niches. We understand that a PR agency that focusses on high fashion would only want to address the influencers they already know. That's why we created 'circles'. All clients will be able to invite their own influencers into their circle so they can publish a campaign only for them and still profit from all the tools TIM provides.
In short, mediating agencies will love TIM because:
Circles will enable mediators to invite their already connected influencers into their circle.
TIM's tools will help them to manage collaborations in a more efficient way.
Access to not only their own circle, but the public network as well.
(Also see all the reasons we have summed up in the section above at 'Brands ♥ TIM')
With the help of TIM’s efficient tools, we can stop the unnecessary commissioning. So, TIM does not benefit from the financial contributions given to the influencers, TIM strives for the influencers to earn what they deserve: 100% of their rewards!
Only clients will pay a set fee in order to use TIM. €500,- per campaign, or clients can subscribe to a TIM BASIC, TIM PLUS or a TIM ULTIMATE account where they’ll be able to use TIM's tools on a continuous basis and get the opportunity to start a circle. 
Based on a platform that has all the tools as presented above (TIM's dream), the costs for clients could be:
 Ok, what’s the catch? There is none. TIM is just a really good guy that wants to make the influencers world a better and more accessible place.
Have you seen Derek Siver's TED-talk: How to start a movement? Than you must know how important you all - as the first followers - are for TIM! It's incredibly appreciated if you show the world that you have joined TIM. How? Write a little blog, film a vlog or share an update on social media with the hashtag #JoinTIM. Also you can follow, like and share our updates on:
Facebook
Twitter
Instagram
Derek Sivers: "if you notice that the first follower is actually an underestimated form of leadership in itself. It takes guts to stand out like that. The first follower is what transforms a lone nut into a leader."
We believe that every little bit helps and that by joining forces we can establish major things. That is why TIM has decided that funding from €1,- is a major help already. Of course you are more than welcome to donate more! We have thought of some nice rewards, but, we did have kept in mind that the biggest reward we can offer all you guy's, is our limitless dedication to building the best platform possible!
We have set our funding goal at €10.000,- but we are striving to go beyond this amount and reach a total of €150.000,- in order to create TIM's dream as described above.
By reaching our first goal of €10.000,- we will already be able to launch the first, basic version on which we can built further: the marketplace. Unfortunately, for €10.000 ,- we won't be able to build the tools as presented above yet. So, the more money we'll raise, the faster and better we'll be able to launch TIM's dream. Every cent counts!
Nice to meet you! We are Dorit Roest and Myrthe Stapper, the proud founders of The Influencers Movement and Bloggers Network. Both 25 years old, living in Amsterdam and absolutely nuts about blogs, vlogs and social media.
But, with our experience as freelancers in marketing, sales and journalism we have also noticed that collaborations between influencers and brands are still realized in a conservative, inefficient way. Why isn't influencers marketing accessible for everyone?
That’s why, one year ago, Dorit as a foodblogger of Dolly's Dish and Myrthe as a sales fanatic, started our first company Bloggers Network. We created a central database of the Dutch and Belgian bloggers market and started to switch supply and demand by building a marketplace filled with campaigns where the bloggers could pitch on.
And with success. For the past 9 months we completed more then 60 successful campaigns and our biggest pride: With 1.300 bloggers we are already the biggest network of bloggers in the Netherlands.
But we also know that there’s a lot more work to do. So now it’s time to not only create a movement in the Netherlands, but worldwide! That’s why we created The Influencers Movement! With TIM we want to take Bloggers Network’s mission to the next level.
From left to right: Roos, Vivienne, Dorit, Myrthe, Kelly, Wouter
And let us introduce to you, our team:
Vivienne Pickkers 
First, Vivienne, our talented designer that also showed her talents in sales and account management already. By showing she's a great allrounder, Viev has already proven to be a great asset of our team.
Kelly Camfferman 
Our other account manager, and successful foodblogger of Goodfoodlove, Kelly uses all of her energy - and that's a lot - to help other influencers by matching them to the most relevant campaigns. Kelly will take every opportunity she has to enthuse other people about Bloggers Network and of course... Our beloved TIM.
Roos van 't Hof 
Roos is our creative, strategic and organizational brain and although we all love TIM very much, Roos might love him most and does everything in her power to fulfill TIM's dream! 
Wouter Offringa 
Wouter is our talent on social media, marketing and project management. His down to earth view on everything brings some much-needed testosterone into our team. 
Future CTO
At this moment we are also very close to a deal with our future CTO, let us tell you this already... He/she can work wonders! With this CTO we also bring a team of talented and professional technological experts into our company. We hope to bring you more information about this soon!
Ok... This was TIM's story! Just one more recap (Hint: this could make some nice sharing-material on social media!). Looking forward to welcome you to our movement soon!

Life imitates art. Or is it the other way around?  Both adventures have begun.  Through the amazing platform of Kickstarter, and with your awesome support, my lifelong dream to create a fictional universe for a comic book based adventure has become reality with the release and success of the first volume of Nuns vs Nurses. The support and feedback I received on the first book was overwhelmingly positive. You funded the project and then told me you were glad you did and wanted more. So here it is.  Now the adventure continues in the eagerly awaited second chapter: Nuns vs Nurses Volume 2.   
I am thrilled to have a chance to tell this story.  With your continued support and interest in Volume 2 I will be able to conclude the initial 3 part story arc as soon as possible.  As with the first book, I have actually already taken the hit of personally funding the creative work of this chapter myself.  This story is happening simply because I could no longer resist the creative urge to produce it.  With the creative aspects completed it relieves you of any  traditional worries in supporting the work. Your support will pay for printing, distribution, the campaign rewards, and the continued promotion of the project.  It will also help me as I take the time needed to complete the third chapter with the thought and care that I feel will make it the most satisfying to all of us.
Despite going over my goal on the funding for Vol. 1,  I set a much lower funding goal on this campaign. The first chapter had a lot of momentum in support from people who love me and wanted to see this get off the ground.  The long term success will have to come from a growing crowd made of curious readers willing to invest in only the book and rewards.
Make no mistake, I need all the support possible to be able to complete this story and promote it properly so please find any reason you can to participate at the highest levels.  All support is needed and appreciated, but the best support I can get is, after you choose your own reward level, for you to share this page with anyone you know who has an interest reading something fun.  If you have read volume 1, tell everyone you loved it and they should read it too.  Tell them how cool Kickstarter is and that you support this project. Better yet buy them a copy by letting me know you are adding on $15 to any of the packages for each copy.  I"ll do my best to get you any gift copies of Vol 1 before Christmas if possible.  
Whether you are a new reader or coming back for more fun, I hope the story and characters find a way into your heart and affect you in a positive way.  That is the ultimate goal of making this dream come true.  It seems to be working.  Thanks for your continued support.  I think you will find Volume 2 is worth it.  Never miss the middle chapter.  I've seen it.  I'm sure you will love it.  Cary.

Hello!  My Name is Gary Morgan. I'm an artist from Pittsburgh PA.  All my life I have been fascinated with fantasy, horror and comic books.  Like most nerdy kids in the eighties, Batman, The Uncanny X-men and the Amazing Spider-man were high on the list of must haves!  I tried my hardest to emulate artists such as Arthur Adams, Bill Sienkiewicz, John Buscema and John Byrne.   The talents of other great artist icons enamored me as well.  Frank Frazetta, Joe Jusko, the Hildebrandt Brothers and   Jeffrey Catherine Jones were always in arms reach. 
  My biggest influence however, is  Bernie Wrightson.  Everything he did was magic. I would spend hours looking at The Frankenstein illustrations, in awe of the immense detail involved.  I met him at a comic convention in Baltimore one year, he was such a nice guy!
     During my teenage years I fell in love with the written word as well.  I would read stories by J.R.R. Tolkien,  Richard Mattheson, Clive Barker and of course Stephen King.  Later I would discover Neil Gaimen.  His comic book The Sandman would become my favorite of all time.  
  I have always  enjoyed creating art and stories, but around eight years ago I made it a goal of mine to  one day become a full time artist.  I'm still on that road, learning new things everyday.  Getting a few jobs illustrating books and even trying my hand at  children books. www.dynamicresources.org 
   I love setting up at  comic-cons and art festivals.  Its such an exciting  feeling to put your work on display for all to look at. That's what being a visual artist is, right?  All the insecurities and fears met head on,  showing the world something held special to you.  Some won't like it, which is fine, but others will!  And that's what its all about. Connecting with people on another level. 
  I know we are living in some crazy times, this virus has changed every aspect of our lives.  I miss connecting with people and sharing my passion to create. That's what made me finally put together this book. Its always been on my to do list, but with your help I hope to make it a reality.  
  The work is all done. I picked out my favorites to make a 62 page book. With over 70 images , both color and black and white.   That's were you come in... I'm doing this kickstarter to help with the printing cost.  The book will be 8.5 by 11 inches, printed on 100# paper, with a soft cover.  I decided to make the rewards simple.  

 REWARD BREAKDOWN
  The first level is an 11" by 14" high quality print for 15 dollars.  You can choose from these prints I have listed. It will be signed and is printed on a nice,  photo paper stock.  
    The second level is 25 dollars. For this amount you will receive a copy of the book with a small , one of a kind sketch.  The book measures at 8.5 " by 11" with 62 pages of both color and black and white images. It will be printed on durable 100# paper , perfect bound with soft cover.

  The third level is 35 dollars. For this amount you will receive the first two levels combined, The book and a print of your choice from the above list.

  The fourth  level is the best bang for your buck! It is 75 dollars and you will receive the previous rewards mentioned, along with an original  9" by 12" piece with a single character of your choice in black and white  with gray wash( and probably a splash of color).  There are only 25 spots available, so act fast!!
 EXAMPLES


     The fifth level is broken into  three special rewards.  For 125 dollars you can receive the book and one of these originals 1. Pans Labyrinth  2. Sandman and Death  3. Swamp Thing . They are each 9" by 12" graphite on multi media paper.  It took me around 7 or 8 hours to finish each one. This is a steal of a deal...practically getting the book for little to no cost!!
   Thanks so much for taking the time to look at my campaign!  It was a lot of fun putting together and if you did support me, I greatly appreciate it!!  Take care !! 
 Gary

A MESSAGE FROM THE ROOFTOP FILMS STAFF:
Support Rooftop Films as we embark on our 22nd year of bringing spectacular and meaningful film and music events to the roofs, streets, parks, and waterways of New York City.
Do you want to sit at home alone streaming movies on your laptop, or do you want to meet up with hundreds of interesting people and together get wrapped up in a film glowing on a giant screen? Do you want to be hushed up in some boring black box, or do you want to hang out on the roof of a 100-year-old high school while the city churns below, the wide-open sky stretching out above? Do you want to get kicked out of the theater for the next seating, or do you want to hang out with the filmmakers at an after-party with free drinks? Do you want the same old passive movie experience, or do you want to be a part of something more?
WHO WE ARE 
Rooftop Films is a Brooklyn based nonprofit whose mission is to engage diverse communities by showing independent films in amazing outdoor locations throughout New York City. We are best known for the Rooftop Films Summer Series, an annual, outdoor, summer-long film festival that showcases the best new independent and foreign films in the world on rooftops and in other scenic locations. That massive series features more than 100 new films in 15 different locations and attracts tens of thousands of attendees—and almost all of the planning and preparation for that series is done by 7 year-round employees who work their butts off all year long.
Even if that was all we did, we would still need your help. But we also do so much more..
Through the Rooftop Films Community Fund we offer equipment and our event production expertise at low rates and even free to artists, nonprofits, and community groups. These events include more than 50 additional, FREE, large scale partner events and community happenings in locations throughout NYC.
And through the Rooftop Filmmakers’ Fund, Rooftop works to foster talent in the independent filmmaking community by providing more than $200,000 worth of cash and services every year to help films get made—exhilarating, innovative, independent films like Obvious Child, Beasts of the Southern Wild, and Casting JonBenet.
In order for Rooftop to continue to serve our audience, filmmakers and support the broader cultural community all across New York City, year-round, we need YOU—the members of our community—to support all that we do. So please make a (tax deductible) contribution today!
NO ONE DOES WHAT WE DO 
We at Rooftop strive to create events with meaning. More than a film festival, Rooftop Films screenings are innovative, once-in a lifetime film events. We bring films directly to communities across the city and create unique holistic events tying together the film, venue and live music.
'Beach Rats' @ Coney Art Walls
  'Rat Film' @ The Old American Can Factory
  'Band Aid' @ House of Vans
  'New York Non Fiction' @ New Design High School
WHY YOUR SUPPORT MATTERS
As a small non-profit organization, Rooftop accomplishes a great deal with a small, passionate staff of 7 full time employees. Every penny we earn goes back into the Rooftop community and towards providing a quality experience for our artists, audience and members.
Because of you we are able to travel the city to present events on rooftops, in parks, and along waterways and to celebrate film, music, and spectacular locales.
Because of you we are able to support emerging filmmakers and connect them with new audiences across the city.
Because of you we are able to showcase the best new independent films in the world--like Menashe, The Big Sick, The Fits, Cameraperson, Tangerine, The Wolfpack, and many more.
And because of you we all get to explore hidden corners of the city together; from the top of the William Vale Hotel, 25 stories above Brooklyn, to the graffiti covered roof of New Design High School overlooking the Lower East Side.
PLEDGE TODAY 
Be a part of our community! Let’s create thousands of new moments together! Make a donation or become a member today and support Rooftop Films as we continue to create unforgettable events featuring the best in film, live music and culture to diverse communities. And your support of Rooftop will directly support the broader community of artists, filmmakers, musicians, schools and nonprofit organizations – the cultural and artistic community of NYC we all share.
And to thank you, our amazing supporters, you get cool stuff too! 
What could make supporting the arts even more exciting? How about some great perks and discounts? Rewards include DVDs and Blu-Rays as well as tickets to Rooftop shows, discounted tickets to our Annual Gala, and the best reward of all: Rooftop Films Memberships, which offer great benefits at discounted prices including discounted access to the Summer Series, priority access and entry, and invites to year-round special events, premieres, and parties.


    THE SECOND ANNUAL ROOFTOP GALA
Date: Thursday, February 15. 6:30 PM-10:00 PM
Venue: St. Bart's Church: 325 Park Ave, New York, NY. 10022
Rooftop strives to make all of our events unique, and this year’s Gala will be as vibrant and inclusive as any of our past events. We will transform St. Bart’s Church on Park Avenue into a boisterous, celebratory, Rooftop-style party that brings together the brightest leaders and lovers of the film community. This year we will be honoring two of the most gifted and fearless filmmakers working in film today: Yance Ford, whose hauntingly intimate documentary Strong Island brought a fresh perspective to conversations about race and violence; and Sean Baker, who has been redefining realism in cinema for years with brilliant films like Starlet, Tangerine, and this year’s breakout, The Florida Project.
Thank you from all of us at Rooftop Films!

EL CUARTO DE DANTE

 Somos una agrupación mexicana compuesta por Roberto Varona, Marcel Franco y Emmanuel Navarro. Fusionamos la Rumba Flamenca, los ritmos Latinos, Rock y Jazz, 
Inspirados por La Divina Comedia, de Dante Alighieri, EL CUARTO DE DANTE se refiere al 4to círculo del infierno, el limbo, que es donde están los artistas. 
Todo comenzó hace 7 años, siendo de la misma familia Roberto Varona y Marcel Franco, deciden empezar a construir un proyecto de está índole por su afición a la música española. 
Durante sus estudios académicos  en bellas artes, Marcel conoce a Emmanuel Navarro para finalmente formar la alineación actual.... el resto es historia.
Roberto Varona: Guitarra
Nuestra música es nuestra vida y llevamos ya 7 años compartiéndola con el mundo, presentándonos en escenarios y eventos maravillosos, como el Foro del Tejedor, Auditorio Alejo Peralta, Teatro Narciso Mendoza, los Premios FIA (Autódromo Hermanos Rodríguez) y Glorieta de la Palma, entre otros.
Emmanuel Navarro: Percusiones
Nuestro objetivo como agrupación es llegar a los oídos de millones de personas y despertar conciencias... por eso estamos aquí.
Marcel Franco: Guitarra
Nuestro EP: LIMBO
Nuestro espectáculo incluye un recorrido en los círculos del infierno, donde convergen las virtudes y pecados a través de la música y la poesía. 
De este recorrido hemos extraído 6 piezas musicales instrumentales, con las cuales queremos producir y distribuír nuestro primer EP. 
Necesitamos de todo tu apoyo para que podamos terminarlo, lanzarlo y que nuestra música se escuche en todo el mundo.
El Cuarto de Dante, hace 7 años
 Metas de Kickstarter
Nada de lo recaudado irá para nuestra bolsa... absolutamente todos los fondos irán destinados a hacer crecer nuestro proyecto. Para poder lograr el primer objetivo de esta campaña serán necesarios  $66,600 Pesos Mexicanos (cerca de $3,300 Dólares) sin embargo, nuestra verdadera visión es lograr varios objetivos a lo  largo de la campaña:
Primer objetivo: $66,600 MXN / $3,300 USD - Infierno (Producción del EP)
Con esta cantidad podremos finalizar la producción de LIMBO. Esto incluye grabación y mezcla en Taxicab Studio 
Segundo objetivo: $111,000 MXN / $5,500 USD - Purgatorio (Mastering, Distribución y Promoción)
Con esta meta podremos también hacer el Mastering de las 6 piezas instrumentales en Classic Master, Brasil y ya establecer la estrategia de distribución en todas las plataformas de streaming y venta, para también arrancar con presencia en playlists destacados de estas plataformas, promoción en redes sociales y varios conciertos promocionales, cubriendo todos los gastos necesarios.
Tercer objetivo: $333,000 MXN / $16,500 USD - Limbo (Videos, Lanzamiento, promoción y Tour del espectáculo LIMBO en México)
Con este objetivo cumplido podremos realizar muchísimas cosas a favor de LIMBO: La producción de nuestro espectáculo, donde se combinan el Teatro, la Danza, la Literatura y, por supuesto, la Música. 
Videoclips para tener un mayor alcance a nivel mundial, un concierto especial de lanzamiento con la cobertura de medios y promoción que necesita LIMBO, además del inicio de un Tour por varios puntos de la República Mexicana.
Cuarto objetivo: $666,000 MXN / $35,000 USD - Cielo (Gira Internacional)
Sabemos que nuestra música gusta en varios países y pretendemos visitarlos TODOS! Es ambicioso, lo sabemos, pero es posible... todo es posible. 
El Cuarto de Dante

Hi everyone, my name is Ying Goo. I'm a fishing enthusiast who working in a fishing tackle shop. I'm so lucky can integrate the hobbies into work. When I'm not working I enjoy time to drawing anything via illustrator. 
The betta fish can bring a difference visual expression of impact. I thing colors and emotions are closely linked. What best represents your personality? 

The Siamese fighting fish (Betta splendens), also known as the betta, is a popular fish in the aquarium trade. Bettas are a member of the gourami family and are known to be highly territorial. Males in particular are prone to high levels of aggression and will attack each other if housed in the same tank. If there is no means of escape, this will usually result in the death of one or both of the fish. Female bettas can also become territorial towards each other if they are placed in too small an aquarium. It is typically not recommended to keep male and female bettas together, except temporarily for breeding purposes which should always be undertaken with caution.

This species is native to the Mekong basin of Thailand, Cambodia, Laos, and Vietnam and is mostly concentrated in the Chao Phraya river in Thailand. The fish can be found in standing waters of canals, rice paddies and floodplains. It is listed as Vulnerable by the IUCN. On 5 February 2019, Thailand's council of ministers confirmed "Siamese fighting fish" as Thailand's national aquatic animal.

I’ve spent a good part of my life working in the religious sphere. More specifically I’ve been trying to help people become better Christians. Yet religion is often part of the problem.
Last year in a small town in the south of Lebanon, my friend Josh and I talked about an idea. It had been brewing for years, but as we talked about it in Lebanon, there seemed to be an urgency to make this idea a reality. The context was fitting; Lebanon is a country where over a dozen religious and political factions have fought a bloody civil war that still to this day hangs like a dark shadow over the people’s daily lives. The impact of religion and conflict leaves a wake in almost every country on earth.
Our idea is to produce a series of short films to tell the stories of victims and peace builders in a variety of global conflicts; to inspire people to look at our own countries and examine how to be people of peace, and to ask the question, 'What is true religion?'
Rabbi Jonathan Sacks said:
‘Religion is like fire and like fire it warms, but it also burns. We are the guardians of the flame.’
Not everyone featured in this film is motivated by a faith. But all of them show a remarkable courage in choosing to value the flame of humanity in the face of indescribable pain and anguish. Those with a religious conviction show that religion is most purely lived out when we choose to “do unto others as we would have them do unto us”. This Golden Rule thinking is embodied by a variety of people in our film who could easily have chosen a life of bitterness and revenge, but instead have chosen to pursue reconciliation and sometimes even forgiveness.
"Guardians of the Flame" is a series of short films looking at conflicts around the world, beginning with Northern Ireland. ‘The Troubles’ were a tragic 30 year manifestation of violence and sectarian hatred on the streets of Belfast, Derry/Londonderry, the border regions and random small towns and villages all over the north of Ireland. At the time these six counties were a place filled with churches but sadly lacking in enough justice, or any culture of reconciliation. In 1969, Christianity in Northern Ireland did not equal reconciliation or justice.
Often in places of conflict, religion is either an apathetic bystander or, at worst the instigator of religious war. We want to look at the destructive role religion, and tribal Christianity in particular, has played in excluding others, building walls and fueling the sectarianism in places like Northern Ireland.
We also want to profile the heroes who show us how forgiveness can conquer hate, how true religion welcomes the marginalised, builds bridges and breaks down walls of isolation.
The Stories
Preview some of the stories and inspiration behind the documentary from other locations around the world...
Christine lost her family in the Rwandan Genocide...

About Us
Jonny Clark has over 20 years of experience in peacebuilding and reconciliation through Christian based ministries, including places such as Israel/Palestine, Burundi and Rwanda. Born in New Zealand, Jonny moved to Northern Ireland at a young age. He has since been based predominantly in Northern Ireland; working with Protestant and Catholic communities in Belfast, as well as running a peacebuilding and reconciliation school through YWAM (Youth With A Mission), offering scholarships to receive students from other nations that have experienced conflict. This in turn has resulted in establishing and sending out other Christian based peacebuilding teams to places such as Lebanon, Israel/Palestine, Bosnia and South Africa. Jonny has a wealth of experience from a variety of different contexts when it comes to conflict and peacemaking. He is passionate about a Christian theology that is underpinned by peace and reconciliation, and his knowledge on the topic has led him to speak and teach all over the world.
Josh Eaves helped to establish 'The Foundation for Forgiveness and Reconciliation' in Lebanon, an organisation that equips the emerging generation in Lebanon with skills of peacemaking and nonviolent conflict resolution. Following this he recently completed his MA in Peacebuilding and Reconciliation, which included a research project for an international relief and development organisation on the role of ecumenism in peacebuilding. Having come from a creative background, Josh is also a producer at Global Fire Creative (see below). From filming on the front lines in Northern Iraq to the slums of Nairobi, Josh's role at Global Fire Creative has given him significant experience in documentary storytelling, with particular regard to humanitarian issues.
In Partnership with Global Fire Creative 
Global Fire Creative is a creative agency based on the south coast of England. They believe in using media for good and are committed to supporting social change through their creative services. Global Fire have produced humanitarian and non-profit films covering topics from street children in the Philippines, to the refugee crisis in Northern Iraq and poverty in the rural villages of Ethiopia. 
Funding
We are seeking funding to contribute to the post-production of the Northern Ireland episode that you can preview above. So far we have funded the pre-production and filming ourselves with Global Fire Creative, however we are now at the point where we are in need of further funding to finish this inital 'pilot' episode. 
£2200 will go towards post production costs including editing, colour grading, purchasing of additional archive footage/imagery and any other graphic or animated elements. 8-10% of the £2200 will cover kickstarter fees. 
£3000 will enable us to go back to Northern Ireland for some extra filming which will benefit the completion of the documentary. 
Anything raised beyond this will allow us to contribute funds towards filming future episodes in other locations. (These locations are still to be confirmed, but could include places such as Lebanon, Bosnia, Burundi, Israel/Palestine etc...)

Overview 
Lurnity is a website where you can learn anything by taking a course online, the goal of this website is to help people who don't want to pay a fortune to go to college/university to learn a single subject in the course of anywhere from 1-8 years, when you can learn online from someone who has experience doing that one thing that you want to take a course on, for less than an 8th of the cost you would going to college when you don't really want to.
Let's get down to the questions everyone interested in supporting this project is wondering.
For Course Takers; 
Q: Will courses be made in writing or will there be videos?
A: That depends on the teacher, but we encourage  the teachers to create their course with videos.
Q: Will there be tests on the course to see what we've learned?
A: Yes, we want to implement tests so it helps not only the course takers by reviewing what they have learned but also teachers to see if they're missing any information on their course.
Q: How do we earn Lurnity points?
A: When you take a test on a course you're taking, if you pass, you earn a Lurnity Point. You also earn Lurnity points fully completing a course and using a referral system we plan on implementing.
Q: Do we have to purchase the course again after we've completed it?
A: No! Once you purchase a course, it will be on your account forever. We do this so if you forget something you've learned in that course, down the road you can review that course for free.
Q: If I purchase a course I don't end up wanting anymore, do I get a refund?
A: Yes! You're entitled to a refund as long as you request it within a 24 hour time period of you purchasing it or haven't completed the course.
Q: Will there be 24 hour technical support & a refund department?
A: Yes, we want our users to have the best possible experience. If something goes wrong, you will have access to our 24 hour tech support team, or if you're looking for a refund during after hours, we will have a dedicated department just for your needs!
Q: Will it be free to sign up?
A: Absolutely, all accounts are free to sign up, the only time you ever buy something is if you want to take a course!
For Teachers; 
Q: Who can sign up as a teacher?
A: Anyone, there are no requirements for you to share your knowledge with other people.
Q: Does it cost anything for a teachers account?
A:  No! Teaches accounts are also free, the only thing you have to do is upload a course within 2 weeks of creating your teacher account, otherwise you account may be switched to a course taker account.
Q: Can teachers earn Lurnity points?
A: Yes, just like a course taken, you have to take course, complete it and take a test to earn Lurnity points!
Q: Can I list my course at any price?
A: Yes, there will be a guideline for teachers and course prices when the website launches.
Q: Does Lurnity take any money from me after people purchased my course?
A: Yes, we want to keep the site open forever, so Lurnity will take 5% per purchase of each course. Example; Your course is $50, we will take $2.50 leaving you with $48.50.
We also plan on implementing a certificate system where you will receive a certificate after completing & passing the course you took.
Why Kickstarter?
We asked Kickstarter to help fund this project because to get the Lurnity to be the best, we need all custom work done. Design, course system, affiliate system, test system, chat system an more.
Exit; 
We hope you find this project interesting. We feel that it will help many people out, without the struggle of sitting in a class and spending big bucks on a course you can do online. Learn from home is the way to go!

La Ville Miraculeuse est un livre qui regroupe dix ans de photographie de rue, la pratique photographique dont je suis tombé amoureux. Dix ans de voyages, de rencontres, d’errances parfois, d’instants volés ou partagés.
Quel que soit l’endroit où mon travail m’emmène, j’ai toujours un appareil sur moi et j’ai toujours un moment pour “aller voir”. Quelle que soit la route que je prenne en photographie, je reviens toujours à la photographie de rue qui est pour moi sa forme la plus simple et naturelle, en même temps qu’un terrain de jeu infini.
Il n'y a rien de plus simple que de marcher, observer et capturer, le plus souvent en noir et blanc. J’ai commencé à sortir de chez moi avec un appareil pour apprendre la photo, et n’ai longtemps pensé qu’en noir et blanc dans les rues parisiennes. Avec les années et les voyages qui s'accumulent, je reviens toujours à ces premières amours : la cité en noir et blanc et ces moments de grâce.
Après 10 années de photographie , je voulais rassembler ces photos et leur donner un sens. N’étant pas journaliste, ces photos ne sont jamais liées à une histoire, un ensemble cohérent. Ce sont des petits bouts de Paris, de New York, de Hong Kong, de Rio ou de Tokyo et d’autres villes que j’ai vues quelques jours ou plusieurs mois.
"A street photographer has no fucking idea what’s going to happen on any given day. We go out on the boulevards of the world, just to be out, and just to be watching the way the world keeps presenting itself with ideas and incidents and moments of consciousness." 
- Meyerovitz
La Ville Miraculeuse - Paris
Pour mettre ces photos en histoire j'ai toujours pensé à Marie. Aux mots de Marie.
Marie était là quand je me suis passionné pour la photographie, et je crois avoir été là quand elle s'est passionné pour les mots et la prose. Parce que c’était drôle, tragique, magnifique, noir et blanc souvent… Je vois la photographie de rue comme une poésie et je ne connais pas de plus belle poésie que celle de Marie.
Alors naturellement, je lui ai proposé de mettre en mots ces images. Et le résultat est au niveau de mon espérance.
La Ville Miraculeuse - Le Livre
Le livre est écrit, pas encore ponctué mais presque terminé. Pour qu’il existe enfin, nous avons besoin d’en imprimer une petite série.
La maquette, l'impression et le choix du papier sont réfléchis avec Bastien Bouvier, Directeur Artistique, avec qui j’ai déjà eu la chance de travailler auparavant. Son talent et son expérience nous permettront d'obtenir un ouvrage qui corresponde le plus fidèlement possible à notre histoire photographique et littéraire.
Le projet est là, prêt à produire, il ne manque plus que quelques lecteurs, qui seraient prêts à voyager avec nous...
La Ville Miraculeuse - Maquette
Marie
La Ville Miraculeuse, c'est un voyage
Celui qui brouille les repères et gomme les contours des habitudes. C'est la traversée de villes inconnues, différentes, hostiles ou accueillantes, la solitude face à la foule, l'immensité contre l'individu. C'est l'inattendu qui surgit au coeur de ce vacarme incessant, ces lumières qui ne s'éteignent jamais, et dans la foule qui avance à pas lents ou dans l'urgence, soudain, une rencontre, un regard qu'on attrape, des sourires entre deux rames de métro, la chaleur humaine qui s'incarne, homme ou femme, vieillard ou enfant.
La Ville Miraculeuse saisit au vol ce voyageur solitaire qui parcourt le monde. Peut-être qu'il cherche quelque chose ou bien quelqu'un, peu importe, l'important se niche dans ces empreintes qu'il laisse derrière lui, comme autant de photographies.
La Ville Miraculeuse - Sienne
La Ville Miraculeuse, c'est une histoire
Genaro m'a proposé de mettre en mots ce voyage imaginaire, composé à partir de quelques unes de ses séries de photographies de rue, et j'ai imaginé un récit qui soit intemporel et universel, dans une ville qui serait à la fois Paris, Tokyo, Londres ou bien Rio. Si c'est autour de la photographie que nous avons lié notre amitié, ce sont les mots qui l'ont cimentée. Nous partageons le même amour pour eux, leur musique et leur poésie, et pour les projets qui sortent de l'ordinaire. 
La Ville Miraculeuse, c’est une invitation
Le titre s’inspire de ces quelques vers de Paul Nougé, poète belge :
"L'intérieur de votre tête n'est pas cette masse grise et blanche que l'on vous a dite
C'est un paysage de sources et de branches, une maison de feu
Mieux encore
La Ville Miraculeuse qu'il vous plaira d'inventer"
Ce livre que nous voulons faire exister, nous l'imaginons beau, comme un cadeau, unique, comme un objet rare, poétique, comme une parenthèse dans nos vies d’urbains pressés. C’est une invitation au lâcher-prise, à la découverte.
Et si pour une fois, on laissait l’imagination prendre le dessus ?
La Ville Miraculeuse de Genaro Bardy et Marie Lemeland
Les auteurs
Genaro - Photographe
Sur la route depuis plusieurs années, le photographe Genaro Bardy se décrit comme un storyteller muni d’un appareil. Auteur du livre Ville Déserte, il explore les plus grandes villes du monde la nuit quand elles sont abandonnées et le jour en quête d'instants décisifs.
Voyageur avant d'être photographe, il a commencé son périple urbain il y a dix ans. Il travaille régulièrement pour des agences de voyages comme Traveller Made, TUI ou Photographes du Monde, pour lesquelles il écrit, photographie ou enseigne.
Marie - Auteure
Marie Lemeland écrit et décrit des émotions, raconte des histoires vraies. Auteure de Bande de Bâtards, projet artistique et de reportage sur les secrets de famille, la sortie de son premier roman n'a jamais été aussi proche.
La meilleure manière de décrire sa poésie est de lui laisser la place :
"Je croise l’ancien et le nouveau monde, allant et venant entre surface et souterrains. La vie grouille en sous-sol, tandis qu’elle semble s’être figée à l’air libre. Le cours des choses en est inversé, je marche à la lisière, laissant venir à moi tous ces univers sans retrouver mon sens de l’orientation. Je pourrais dévier de mon chemin mais après tout, personne ne m’attend."
Bastien - Directeur Artistique
Bastien Bouvier est Directeur Artistique indépendant depuis 7 ans. Remarqué pour sa collaboration au studio de design Swimmingpoülp et le design du magazine de voyage Serendipia qui rassemble des histoires, des récits écrits non pas par des journalistes, mais des voyageurs en quête de moments unique et d'émotions. Il poursuit sa quête d'excellence avec le magazine Les Others.
La Ville Miraculeuse - Hong Kong

About a Book is raising $200,000. This will provide for the major update needed to the website to make it interactive with each reader, create an iPhone and Android app and cover marketing costs. The current version of the site allows readers to create a profile favoriting authors and books they have read but it is missing the engine that customizes the site to each reader. 
AboutaBook.net is a website that allows readers to easily find their next book to read. Users will have the ability to create their own profile favoriting authors they love and books they have read. Their customized homepage will show new releases from their favorite authors and series. Other features offered include tailored recommendations based on their favorited authors and books, recommendations from other users whose author list closely matches theirs, a random book selector that will let users try something new within their search parameters and be able to easily view the entire book and series list by author. 
While there are other sites that let you track books you have read and communicate directly with authors and other fans, the simple ability to keep track of authors you love and their new releases is still a very manual process. For authors releasing a new title who don't have a publisher willing to spend large amounts on advertising, getting your next release to your existing fans is challenging. Authors will benefit knowing their fan base can keep track of when their next book is being released and from new fans discovering their booklist.
About a Book is also a platform for authors to connect with readers directly. We can work directly with authors to target readers who already love reading what they write. Advertising inclusive of banner ads, email blasts, social media posts and in our monthly newsletter will connect authors to new and existing fans. 
About a Book will offer two levels of membership. Our free membership will provide limited results on the users' homepage showing a small selection of the new releases from their favorite authors and the ability to keep track of authors they love and books they have read and want to read.
The Premium membership shows all the new and upcoming releases from the users' favorite authors, provides unlimited recommendations based on the user profile & similar readers and allows for customization of favorite book lists. Premium members will enjoy an ad-free experience with enhanced features including a rewards program and access to book club resources and book trivia.

I have created a photography book to drive awareness and tell the tragic story of the Invisible People of Belarus. This book will provide education and expose secret lives of disabled people and Chernobyl victims locked up in the governmental institutions in Belarus.
The book will be written in two languages; Russian and English. It is important for me that it will be available for viewers who live in post-soviet countries, where issue with disablism is high. ‘Disablism: discriminatory, oppressive or abusive behavior arising from the belief that disabled people are inferior to others.’
The book will combines my photography with writing by Nobel Prize in Literature Winner Svetlana Alexievich, who is an investigative journalist from Belarus. Svetlana knows my project and is happy for me to use her writing.
'Invisible People of Belarus - 30th Anniversary of the Chernobyl Disaster'
The launch of the book will coincide with my first solo show in a late October/early November in London. This exhibition will be a charity event during which money will be raised for organizations helping in Belarusian Internats.
10% of the future proceeds (no Kickstarter funds) from the sale of this book will be donated to an amazing charity "Chernobyl Children's Trust " which supports people living in Belarusian Internats. CCT is striving to change the institutional system and advocates for disabilities by supporting families that choose to keep their disabled children at home.
About Me:
I was born in neighboring Poland, a satellite state of USSR at the time of the Chernobyl disaster in 1986. I decided to go to Belarus to document the stories of horrifically neglected and abandoned children, born with mental and physical deficiencies from the aftermath of this tragic accident 30 years ago. During my investigations, what surprised me the most was that it wasn’t just victims of the Chernobyl disaster that were housed in these institutions…
 Invisible People of Belarus
Belarus, located in the far-flung reaches of Eastern Europe is the last dictatorship on the continent and for some is still considered to be part of Russia. This is a place where the president, Alexander Lukashenko is seen as an unchallenged, fearsome and almost ‘God-like’ figure. Belarusians still fear the KGB and their ever-watchful eye. This is very much a place where ‘Soviet’ mentality is still the norm. 
When you walk the streets, one could easily mistake themselves as being on a movie set. Everything is extremely clean and organized, the grass is always clean-cut, and the architecture glitzy and reflecting perfectionism. It does make you wonder exactly what may be ‘hiding’ behind this facade. 
‘Invisible People of Belarus’ is a documentary project about the lives of disabled people and Chernobyl victims locked up in the governmental institutions called ‘Internats’. Internat is in Belarusian: name of the governmental institution that houses disabled people through their entire lives. Place, which is something in between an orphanage, asylum and hospice for people with mental disabilities, Down syndrome, autism, people with physical mutations, deformations, and people with Aids.
Lyosha. This severely autistic boy is very active and inpatient, however in front of a camera he would calm down immediately. He loved the flash light and would pose perfectly still until the light would fire.
The government has created Internats to separate Chernobyl victims and disabled children from other healthier orphans in order to keep them hidden from the society. These are places where tens of thousands of people spend their entire lives. These institutions have become a subject of folklore legends and made a stigma on their residents.
Sveta. The aftermath from Chernobyl has not yet passed is Belarus. Every year children are born with mental and physical deficiencies from the disaster of 1986. People still live in contaminated zones or carry ‘genetic marks’ from the past generation.
In general, disabled people are certainly still something of a taboo in Belarus, and often abandoning, or ‘giving them away’ is easier than being exiled from the local community. Mothers are told that institutions are better places for their disabled kids than home. In the past, mothers would be persuaded to give up their children and place them in the internats, nowadays they are manipulated into abortion.                   
Belarusian people themselves are not aware of what is really going on inside these places. People are not properly looked after, hardly any medical stuff works in the internats. Most of carers are ex-cleaners with no medical training. Internats are partly self-sufficient, where patients are forced to work in fields, clean and cook.
This project aims to indirectly expose the on-going problems with human rights violations; poor health care and free labour, which very often come with lack of money and knowledge.
Free Labor - Disabled women working in a field. Institutions are partly self-sufficient. Patients are forced to work in fields, clean and cook.
Book ‘Invisible People of Belarus’ focuses on disabled people who are physically and/or mentally more independent. 
These photos are a story of those people as human beings; as people who suffer and struggle against injustice everyday life; and as people who look after each other, build long lasting friendships, and even fall in love even within an environment that is far from civilized life. 
Room/cell for dangerous patients who are separated from the rest for security reasons. There has been incident’s when patients have killed another whilst sharing cells.
  Some of the older ‘residents’ are locked in a small room without windows. The tiny vision panel in the door is all they have
  Room with multiple rows of beds. Couples have no privacy, residents are divided by sex and sleep in different rooms.
These invisible people stay invisible. There may be nobody to remember them after all, and a picture might be the only proof of their existence. 
    I believe, to successfully improve the situation of the Belarusian internats, first we must change the mentality of the Belarusians. It’s in their hands to change the future of the people locked up. However, there is no free press in Belarus, that’s why, I decided to work on this project and share it with Belarusian people and the rest of the World.                                                 

What is more, the aftermath of Chernobyl and the issues with nuclear disasters are an on going problems around the world… We cannot forget about the victims of radiation and new victims born nowadays because of the modified gene their parents carried on.


'We’re often silent. We don’t yell and we don’t complain. We’re patient, as always. Because we don’t have the words yet. We’re afraid to talk about it. We don’t know how. It’s not an ordinary experience, and the questions it raises are not ordinary. The world has been split in two: there’s us, the Chernobylites, and then there’s you, the others. Have you noticed? No one here points out that they’re Russian or Belarussian or Ukrainian. We all call ourselves Chernobylites. “We’re from Chernobyl.” “I’m a Chernobylite.” As if this is a separate people. A new nation. '
                                                  'Voices from Chernobyl' Svetala Alexievich

The intent of this film is to participate and win the international competitions.
Dark Red Blood è un film horror realizzato tramite iPhone 6 e che sfrutta la tecnologia retrò del filmato in 8mm. La trama è stata scritta per spaventare il pubblico. Un gruppo di ragazzi partecipando ad un diabolico gioco entrano in contatto con un killer assetato di sangue che sembra avere le caratteristiche di un demone. Dark Red Blood sarà il secondo lungometraggio realizzato da questa produzione indipendente. Il primo fu Villa Dunardi che riscosse un successo internazionale ed oltre 150.000 visualizzazioni su YouTube. L'intento di questo film è quello di partecipare e vincere dei concorsi internazionali.

Cosmic Surgery is a photography project by Alma Haser in which the faces of the subjects she photographs are transformed into something unrecognisable. This book documents the results.
Cosmic Surgery started back in 2011 when Alma would construct origami shapes to attach to her own face, hiding or disguising her identity in a series of self-portraits. Friends and other willing participants eventually became the subjects, having intricate origami structures made from their faces. Each portrait is printed, sometimes numerous times, and folded into complicated origami shapes that are then placed over their original face. The combined assembly is then re-photographed creating unsettling results.
Last year a very limited run of 10 books were produced by hand. This Kickstarter is to help make the second edition happen.
A spread from the first edition
PLAY

 THE BOOK
In the process of producing the first limited edition pop-up book, science writer Piers Bizony and designer Emily Macaulay joined the Cosmic Surgery team to help introduce a narrative background, layout and unique construction. This second edition wants to expand on those ideas. It will be a photo book set in a fictional, not too distant future, at a point where “intelligent materials” are just about to transform the world of cosmetic surgery.
The book will have a hardcover printed and foil embossed. It will be 190x240mm (slightly smaller than A4) and contain 48 pages filled with the original portraits and a few new ones that haven’t been displayed before. There will also be a number of smaller booklets inside, containing the written content. And finally the book will include a pop-up portrait and a folded one which will be attached in the UK by our trusted team of pop-up makers, meaning this book has all the care and attention to detail that went in to first 10. We will be limiting this edition to 500 copies.
Book Cover
Page example from second edition
Page example from the second edition
WHO IS INVOLVED?
Alma Haser – The creator and Photographer of Cosmic Surgery.
Emily Macaulay (Stanley James Press) – The designer of the book. She has worked alongside Alma to get this project off the ground and has been involved ever since Alma asked her if she was interested in helping her create a unique photography pop-up book.
Piers Bizony – A famous science writer and the person who gave this photography series a story. Without his imagination and experience in science writing it would not have been the same. 
And of course all the beautiful 'patients' that have allowed themselves to be photographed and have their faces folded into unrecognisable new ones.
Alma hard at work finishing off the last of the Cosmic Surgery Portraits.
'Patient no. 16' Print
HOW WILL THE FUNDS BE USED?
Making a book doesn't have to cost £20,000.
When the 1st edition was released our main goal was to release a pop-up photo book that didn’t cost the earth. All the advice we were given in those early days was to ship the designs off to China where a book could be made inexpensively and in massive runs. Pop-up books are still made by hand, each pop-up stuck in by someone's hands. We decided early on that we wouldn’t be able to guarantee good working conditions for all the people involved if we sent the work halfway round the world.
So all in all this is not a cheap book to make. The funding will cover the printing and binding of the book here in the EU, we haven’t chosen the cheapest printers, we’ve chosen someone we can trust. It also covers the cost of our trusted pop-up team back in the UK who will attach the pop-up sections before packaging them and sending them on their way to all you lovely backers.
And finally it also includes some money for the people involved in the design, the story and making these books happen along the way.
Postcard Pack
Using magazines with the 'Fold your face' instruction pack
HOW LONG DOES IT TAKE TO MAKE A BOOK?
The book design is almost finished, we are just finalising the tiny details. The book will be ready to print as the Kickstarter ends. We are currently talking to two printers based in Europe and haven’t made up our mind which one to use yet, one is based in Belgium, the other in Germany.
If this Kickstarter campaign is successful then sometime in late April we should be making a trip to see the printers just as the first pages come off the press. The finished books will then be shipped to us sometime in mid June, where our pop-up team will fold and stick 500 pop-ups into 500 books, which is definitely not going to be easy! So if you have pledged you can expect to receive a beautiful, hand finished book by early to mid July.
Whilst we wait for the printers to do their thing we will also have time to work our way through the other rewards, running workshops, taking original origami portraits and posting postcards and prints to their lucky recipients.
CREDITS
Here are some other great people that helped us along the way…
Josh Emerson helped us build the Cosmic Surgery Simulator. Taking a crazy idea me and Emily had and made it happen.
Ali Graham helped us produce the Kickstarter video.
Simon James let us use his music in the Kickstarter video. We also have plans to collaborate with him again in the future of this project.
If you would like to talk about our project and Kickstarter campaign on your website the press kit below contains some bits you may need. If you find yourself needing more images or interviews then please send an email to alma@haser.org

I am an experienced Web Developer and Trainer. I am branching away from traditional brick and mortar educational institutes to learn Web Design. My online course will allow you to learn how to develop websites using techniques I have refined as an Web Development Trainer. This course is a practical based training program that will have you typing code from lesson one. You can only learn Web Development by doing it, not just reading about it.
The main program will include each participant building and developing several websites using current languages of HTML5, CSS3, JS5 and PHP. The Heist 
Okay, guys. Here's the skinny (fat). The Heist is our sophomore effort.  We have managed to pull together a slew of new material in this time, and we've decided the best way to release it was through a series of themed EPs. This would be the first. We have 6 spanking new songs that we want to shove down your throats in the nicest way possible. 
We're big into that noir stuff. We also like circus sideshows and cabaret. We wanted to explore this "burlesque" sound and molest it with loud rock music. We're good at molesting things with loud rock music. That aside, we want The Heist to sound huge, glamorous, and silly. And we've put LOTS and LOTS and LOTS of time and effort into these songs in the studio. If you've seen us live, you KNOW theatricality is our thing... So for The Heist release show/party, we wanted nothing less than a complete sideshow production; not just a concert, but a Burlesque Variety show, that would feature not just bands, but also fire dancers, belly dancers, regular dancers, boxing, striptease, ventriloquism, poetry, art/graffiti, comedians, etc. Essentially, artists of all trades... So that, and we wanted to have this filmed to capture a completely unique experience that isn't too common anymore.
Sounds pretty sick, right? But we can only pull this off if we make our goal... What you're donating to isn't just your pre-order of our new EP, but also mastering, pressing, merchandise, and the ability to make this grandiose Burlesque event happen!

I am veteran and owner of the production company, Roldan Entertainment, LLC. I started the company upon return from Afghanistan in 2014 to focus on film and video production, to include documentaries, training videos, short films and feature length films. 
We are currently seeking funding for our short horror film, MALO FACTO, for the purposes of producing, and submitting to upcoming film festivals. Our long term goal for the project is to have it made into a feature length film. The script has already been written by Michael Coulombe and we are now ready to move towards pre-production, with the intention of beginning principal photography the week of April 25th. 
We currently have the equipment necessary to shoot and edit the final project. We are seeking funding for:
minimum payments to cast and crew
lodging
meals
vehicle rentals 
and safety equipment
The project itself focuses on two females involved in a hit and run on their way to meet two male friends at a cabin. Initially thinking they got away with the crime, they soon find out something else awaits them when they arrive at the cabin as they become convinced that the punishment does not always fit the crime. The main theme of the story is what goes around comes around. The film is currently registered under IMDb with additional details on our company website, www.roldanentertainment.com.

Hello All.
We are a small new company (name still pending) that has an incredibly fun new idea for a puzzle game app, ChromaRaze.
Our game is a new take on a Rubik's puzzle right on your phone or tablet. The game promises to be both fun and challenging. The game's premise is a very simple one, much like a Rubik's cube, but achieving this goal will take some brain power.
We tried to develop the app ourselves, however, we have jobs outside of this project so we cannot dedicate the man power to develop it ourselves. However, we have identified a development company with a proven track record of making quality games that we will be partnering up to build our game.
The majority of the money that we are asking for is for the development cost of the app. The remainder will be used to file patents for the game to make sure that our idea is protected while the app is in development. 
Our goal is to have the game out sometime by Fall 2015/Winter 2016, if not earlier.
Help us make this game become reality. We promise a fun experience once the game is complete that you will not want to put it down.

As a hopefully refreshing alternative to the "demographically driven commercialism of the modern music market," my aim as an artist is simple: an appeal to the experience of the individual listener--INDEPENDENT of social class or education--art that helps remind and inspire us to be more human, "as unique individuals yet bound to a common field of understanding and compassion." With this in mind, I seek financial support to print and publish these recorded volumes as well as additional support to find the proper distributors for my wide-ranging market--this upon my experience of success at selling my music at everything from flea markets to school bazaars to harvest festivals with cowboys yelling and cows mooing in the background! To this end, the Atlanta Gift Show in July looks the most promising this year to find distributors; it costs $3,000 for the booth and of course there's the cost of getting and staying there from July 15-19th. The total cost of printing, publishing and making this trip for the calendar year will easily run close to $10,000, but $5,000 will get things moving!

With your help we can publish an Irish calendar like no other.
Front cover of your calendar
Back of Calendar
PLAY

Thank you for stopping by on our project page, we hope it catches your imagination.
In a nutshell, we're looking for your pledges of support to help print this unique calendar here in Ireland.  In return you will receive fantastic rewards.
I will tell you all about the calendar in a moment or two.  But first here is a little bit about my Kite photography, it's the coolest thing you may never have  known!
So how does this photography from a Kite work?  Like all the best ideas it's quite simple really but can be quite hard to explain but I'll give it a go. I fly the Kite up about 30 feet/10M, then attach a cradle containing my camera to the Kite line.  The Kite is flown higher lifting the camera and cradle further into the air.  While flying the Kite I operate the camera and cradle by remote control.  With 360 degrees pan and a tilt of 180 degrees there's full control of what is to be photographed.  Some might call it multitasking, I call it being happily busy.  If this still seems a bit confusing here's a little movie my children made to explain it better......
PLAY

Hope that helped, we had such fun making it.  In the real world there's a bit more technology at play in my photography.  Here's the camera and cradle attached to the Kite line and ready for take off.  But where's the Kite?........
Camera and cradle ready for take off on the Kite line
Here it is, isn't she a beauty?  I've seven Kites for different wind conditions and this is one of my favourites.....
The sail is full and ready to fly
and here's a rare photograph of me in my natural habitat.  The Cliffs of Moher at sunset flying a Kite and camera.  I can't think of anything more enjoyable.....
Doing my thing at the Cliffs of Moher
Keeping the fun in what we do
OK, so far so good.  I fly a Kite, it lifts a camera and I'm hoping I have given you a better understanding of this fine art.  But what is the outcome of my style of photography?  Well, it is photography, so it's going to be all about the image no matter how cool the process.......
Open air gallery
As much as I love doing what I do, and I do, it is all about the image!    Over the last ten years I've been flying ridiculously expensive cameras to capture images of Ireland that really speak for themselves.  Many thousands of miles nave been travelled around Ireland in the pursuit of a good breeze and some decent light........ 
Two wheels and a Kite on Rathlin Island
The open road somewhere in Donegal
Usually at very short notice and in reaction to our wonderfully unpredictable weather I'm off,(thank you Bryony and boys)at all hours and only on the promise of a bit of Kite flying somewhere in Ireland. If you're not there you will miss it.....
Sunrise at Fanad Head Donegal with a little help from my Kite
After 10 amazing years flying Kites in Ireland I am ready to share with you some of the fruits of that unique experience.  I'ts so exciting to be able to offer an affordable, accessible piece of Irish art that will keep on giving for a whole year and longer........
Here's a couple of images to wet your appetite.
Over the first few months the calendar will take you on a journey along the breadth of the now world famous Causeway Coast(thanks to Lonely Planet).
Carrick-a-Rede Rope Bridge Antrim
Then spend the rest of your 2018 along the length of the Wild Atlantic Way There will be lighthouses, seascapes, history, beauty and a surprise or two for good measure. This is a year long journey that will bring back great memories or have you planning your next trip.
Galley Head West Cork
I offer you Ireland's Coast from a Kite 2018 Calendar.            
All the images have been taken, the design is done and the printers are ready to get the press rolling.  It's all down to you now.  
So what will the calendar look like?  It's a wall calendar  and is landscape orientated, A4 (12 x 8) in size when closed and A3 (12 x 16) when open.  There will be an A4 photograph for each month with location name and county or Island name.  A full A4 sized dater page beneath with room to write notes for each day. Practical as well as beautiful.  On successful completion of our campaign the calendars will be immediately printed and will be shipped anywhere in the world.  Our calendar will make a perfect gift for you or for anyone you know who has a love of Ireland.
Here's our 2017 Fermanagh from a Kite Calendar that sold out!
Covering a small geographic and population area our 2017 Fermanagh calendar sold out and was posted/shipped worldwide in November 2016. The even more successful 2018 Fermanagh calendar will be back from our local printer in a few days ready to post/ship worldwide again.  
We've got the experience to deliver for you too!
2017 Fermanagh calendar
Back of Fermanagh calendar
Fermanagh calendar open
Fermanagh from a Kite 2018 Calendar
Here's how it will all happen.  Our funding campaign will run for two weeks only. With your pledges of support and the successful completion of our campaign the calendar will go off to the printers straight away.  The printers will turn them around in one week, then I'll go and collect them myself.  It's all part of the beauty of using a local printer.  
Give us a day or two to full-fill your rewards and then, they'll be on their way to new homes all over the world.  We will be using air-mail so the calendars will be arriving with you 5-7 days later.  For those further flung places it may take up to 10 days.  Everyone will have their calendars by the first week of December if not sooner.  Making good time as a wonderfully unique Irish gift for you, family and friends this Christmas/Holidays.    
Thank you so much for getting this far and we look forward to your pledges of support for some totally awesome rewards.  Don't forget to share our calendar on social media.  We would love to get it out to as wide an audience as possible.  With your pledges you will not only get a wonderful calendar but will also be supporting a wholly original Irish project and be part of a first for Irish photography.
Even if you are, or are not supporting our project we would really love you to share it here and on your social media.
Warmest Regards
Ciarán, Bryony & boys, AKA the Kite Team.
