The Basics (Español abajo)
     Los Coulters have recorded an instrumental MEGAMAN 6 tribute album and need help raising funds for publication and distribution.  The album's recording and artwork has already been finished and we simply need funds for printing, packaging and shipping. We are eager to share this music with our fans, but we need your help. So please share this project with friends!

Who are Los Coulters?
     Drummer Mark and saxophonist/keyboardist John grew up in Kansas City.  The brothers have eclectic interests ranging from 50's mambos, 70's salsas, and videogame music.  Artist Anna Frischknecht designs all of the bands album covers, posters and web promotions to give the group a unique style.

About the Megaman 6 Tribute Album
       We've recorded instrumental jazz versions of the eight main levels and the boss battle from NES game Megaman 6.  Yuko Takehara designed the game's original soundtrack on midi synthesizers with each level having it's own theme.  Each song is reflective of the original stage's environment. Plantman is tropical and Yamatoman features a Japanese-style war song. It's fun taking a song composed on one instrument and playing it on another.
       There are many Megaman remixes out there but very few instrumental albums dedicated to a single game.  These types of special projects need funding to receive attention and be enjoyed by fans.

Help us through Kickstarter
      Kickstarter is a great website to fund creative projects such as this.  We are accepting funds for this project until, October 31st Halloween. Any packages that have been pledged for should be delivered by December. 
        The money raised will go toward printing and packaging the phyical ablums, shirts, posters and the shipping of these rewards.

YOU CHOOSE THE NEXT SONG!
        Any money pledged allows you the chance to vote for the next song Los Coulters records from the Megaman or Megaman X series. The song voted for the most by pledgers will be released as a digital single online for FREE. 
       You can help bring this project to life and please make sure you look at other projects you can contribute to on the Kickstarter website.  Even if you can't contribute to this album please share it with friends who might be interested on facebook, or twitter.

Share and Enjoy amigos!

LOS ASPECTOS ESENCIALES
      Los Coulters de haber grabado un instrumental MEGAMAN 6 álbum tributo y necesita ayuda para recaudar fondos para su publicación y distribución.  Grabación del álbum y material gráfico ya se ha terminado y sólo necesitamos fondos para la impresión, el embalaje y el envío.  Queremos compartir esta música con nuestros fans, pero necesitamos su ayuda.  Por favor compartir este proyecto con amigos!

¿Quiénes son Los Coulters?
      El baterista Mark y saxofonista John son de Kansas City.  Los hermanos tienen intereses eclécticos, incluyendo mambos, salsas y la música de videojuegos.  Artista Anna Frischknecht diseña todas las bandas de portadas de discos, carteles y promociones de Internet para dar al grupo un estilo único.

Acerca de la álbum tributo a Megaman 6
    Hemos grabado versiones instrumentales de jazz de las ocho etapas principales y el 'Boss Battle' del  Megaman 6.  Yuko Takehara diseñado banda sonora original del juego en los sintetizadores midi con cada etapa tener su propio tema.  Plantman es tropical. Yamatoman es una canción de guerra japonés.  Hay muchos remixes de Megaman pero muy pocos álbumes instrumentales.  Este tipo de proyectos especiales necesitan financiamiento para recibir atención.

Ayúdanos con Kickstarter
      Kickstarter es un gran sitio para financiar proyectos creativos como éste.  Estamos aceptando fondos para este proyecto hasta que, Halloween 31 de octubre. El dinero recaudado se destinará a la impresión y el embalaje de los ablums phyical, camisetas, carteles y el envío de estos artículos.

TU DECIDES LA CANCION SIGUIENTE!
        Cualquier cantidad de dinero prometido le da la oportunidad de votar por la siguiente canción que Los Coulters registros del de la serie de Megaman o Megaman X.  La canción votaron a favor de la mayoría por pledgers se publicó en línea de forma gratuita.

Por favor, mire otros proyectos que puedan contribuir a la web Kickstarter.

                       I am starting a Kickstarter campaign because I know and love music. Period. And I want to invest in a city I truly believe in, one that has great potential for arts, technology, and business alike. Every day Windsor inspires me to do well and carry on the music culture that has existed between us and Detroit for decades. 
My sister and I plan on recording, teaching music, and selling hand-crafted, high-quality wooden instruments out of our (soon-to-be) own house.
Our college group, Waveform Network Group, also has plans on starting our net design consulting and installation services for personal homes and small businesses over the next year. 
Essentially this a small, grassroots business start-up, and we need your help to see our dream happen.

Waveform Network Group™ (We're on Facebook!)
https://www.facebook.com/pages/Waveform-Network-Group/668565813255016
Waveform Network Group
Started as a student group for St. Clair College's Computer Systems Technology programs 3rd year Technical Project, Waveform's path is quickly growing. Currently Waveform is finishing up the Technical project with Kelcom Mobility Solutions (1969) in Windsor ON. 
 After graduation Waveform plans on working with small business around Windsor Ontario as well as home users. Waveform Network Group will follow the Network Design Process, evaluate the user and business needs, evaluate the current network architecture, and make recommendations to make computer system networks more efficient and ultimately save our clients money on their Total Cost of Ownership. 
Waveform Network Group will soon be establishing a supplier relationship with a hardware supplier in London, Ontario, and with the help of a close-knit group of contracted installers and electrical technicians, Waveform can bring its network design recommendations into reality.
Waveform Network Group would like to partner with the Windsor Youth Centre, and with the help of Paul Christopher, create a non-profit organization that would teach kids the basics of electrical engineering, soldering, circuits, logic gates, desktop/laptop computer hardware, and even entrepreneurship. These kids would then have a chance to be employed as an installer or technician at Waveform Network Group, who would in turn donate its resources to the Windsor Youth Centre.
  THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT!

~Kyle James Colasanti

We plan to travel through every country in Latin America and make quality recordings of all the music we find there.This includes street music, indigenous music, big bands - everything.We will talk to people in every town and city and village and find and record all the musicians we can.We will take note of what it is they played, either original or cover and try to find out where it comes from.It will be recorded by 2 sets of high quality stereo condenser microphones and mastered at the end of the journey.
From Argentinian folk lore, to Brazilian samba, to indigenous tribal songs;every country and every province has it’s own style and history and we want to make a huge anthology of it all.To create something that will capture forever the music of the Americas at this point in time.We hope it will be studied and used in universities around the world, we hope that it will contain something never before heard by mass ears.
There may be some ticket expenses, but mostly we will be hitch hiking from village to village and talking to the locals and finding where the musicians are.We will also be making a film of this journey and we plan to spend over a year in total with this journey.We will also be playing music ourselves and will receive a small income from that, but our main mission is to create this anthology.Create something that will enrich the world culturally and show the vast diversity and brilliance of all the music of the Americas.
We need your help to get us started!First we need some equipment.We won’t be buying expensive equipment as it might attract the thieves, just an audio recorder with 4 condesnor microphones can record anything.We will also need a camera, and a computer to edit.As well as living and travelling expenses we think we can do this for 10.000!We realise that losing the data could be disastrous, so at the end of each day we will upload what we have to a secure cloud server.And make sure we have spares of the equipment we use.
When we have all the music recorded, then comes the hard part - Getting any copyright clearences, logging it, mastering it and lots of organizing and sorting through it all.In terms of final distribution.We will first offer it to the many world music record labels around the world who have already shown interest and support to this project.We feel that this music should be out there for all to hear and appreciate and to learn from.We want to record it and offer it to the world in the hope it inspires and enriches the culture of world music.
I am a producer by trade, I have recorded over 50 albums in the last ten years and worked at the BBC as technical manager for the much loved Popular Music Show with Roger Hill.I have always had a great ear for recording music and finding musicians. My wife is a violinist from Argentina, and together we make very beautiful music.We have recorded 3 albums so far and you can hear them at www.deadseacaravan.com
I have written a books worth of material on my travelling blog about busking around Europe.I am the top result on google for busking in Amsterdam and my blog is going viral with 25000 hits so far.You can read all about my past adventures at www.thedeadseacaptain.comMy whole life is music, and if you could help us with this next adventure; you will be helping create something that will live forever and be a strong study of the music of the Americas.

The all-volunteer curatorial committee at SPACE 4 ART is looking for you to join in the ongoing effort to present innovative and unique art experiences in San Diego.
If you believe in what we do, please give what you can and spread the word! 
You can change the face of San Diego’s emerging arts scene by participating in the arts experience at SPACE 4 ART. It’s that time a year to once again request your support of artists by participating in our Kickstarter. Funds will be used for the exhibitions and art installations in the SPACE 4 ART Gallery and more specifically, to partially compensate the artists and curators of the events as well as cover the costs of shipping artwork and supplies to ensure a maximum experience for you along with San Diego’s art seeking community when they arrive on the scene. 
Since 2010, SPACE 4 ART has showcased some of San Diego’s best artist's as well as bringing artists from across the globe.  It is our goal to promote the local art scene and foster a dialogue with the broader art world.  We show a diverse range of mediums such as visual arts, sound-art, sculpture, dance, spoken word and puppetry through free and low-cost programming. With your help, this year’s exhibition season will consist of six shows spanning varied media, geographic locations, styles, and conceptual interests. 
SPACE 4 ART is a thriving community-designed, volunteer-built art space that provides 40 affordable studios for San Diego’s finest artists, designers, and craftspeople. The facility has an abundance of natural light, spacious galleries, multiple community spaces, a multi-level stage, performance areas, and an educational classroom. 
 This Kickstarter will set the pace for 2013 exhibitions and is the first in a series of crowdsourcing and fundraising events that will take place by SPACE 4 ART this year as the arts community comes together to realize a permanent facility for San Diego’s working artists.

Olivia Cult: Tales of a Witch Detective
"Olivia Cult: Tales of a Witch Detective"  is an upcoming young adult fantasy novel which involves a young teenage girl who is disowned by her family at the age of eight for unlocking her family's long hidden and despised connection to an interdimensional demon known as Lilith . The demon bonds with Olivia and she becomes a witch.
Soon after she is abandoned, she is taken in by a paranormal agency from a different dimension known as Parabola to become a witch detective and stop mystical threats from destroying the mortal world.
After eight years of being trained as a witch detective, Olivia must return to the human world to stop an evil occult from merging the human world and Parabola together which would mean the end of all humanity.
Olivia Cult
 About Boss Kelly
Born and raised in Buffalo, NY, Josh "The Boss" Kelly grew up with a large and overactive imagination. Despite being diagnosed with a learning disability from grade school until his last year in high school, Boss Kelly found his true calling in life by creating brilliant and creative stories.
By writing and drawing his own characters, Boss Kelly now pursues his self-given task of uplifting young adults worldwide. By showing initiative and creating multiple tales of suspense, Boss Kelly teaches young adults who in some way feel alienated from the rest of the world that they too can be heroes in their own lives.
Boss Kelly has written his first young adult science fiction book, "The Ominous : Some play it safe , heroes don't".
This story involves six teenagers who each discover that they were born from an alien parents and possess strange abilities. The teenagers all go to a mysterious academy ran by a pure alien chancellor that learns and controls their powers. That is until they learn the chancellor has sinister motives for them so they must band together to stop her from exterminating all of humanity.
This book is now available both online and in local bookstores in the Buffalo New York area. Soon to be available nationwide and all local bookstores.
Find it here https://amzn.to/2MqMQMD.

Hi, everyone. This is Martin Renner, writer/director of "BUZZ KILL," a horror-comedy being filmed in New Zealand about a KILLER BEE KEEPER. After meeting Donna two years ago, I was inspired to write a key role for her in the hope that she could appear in my movie. Without spoiling too much, it’s a funny, crazy, scene-chewing role that will give Donna the opportunity to play a full-on VILLAIN for the first time!
As it's a modestly-budgeted feature, however, it has so far been difficult to include Donna (to misquote a certain theme song, "Oakland is a long way from N.Z.").
Then it occurred to me: if a significant percentage of Donna’s loyal fans pledged the price of a cup or two of coffee, the funds could be raised in no time! Basically, it's a win-win-win situation. Donna's fans get to see her in a new movie, I get to include Donna in my film, and Donna gets to have a STAB at the kind of role that Anthony Perkins and Betsy Palmer are still remembered for!
So, how about it? Let's send Donna to New Zealand, aka "Middle Earth," so she can reveal her DARK SIDE!

The East Loop is a new band that was started by a group of band leaders in Chicago.  It consists of 6 core members and a rotating roster of guest musicians.  The East Loop is an instrumental ensemble that blends a wide spectrum of traditions from around the globe, including Jazz, Middle Eastern, Latin American and Funk.  The compositions, by Wanees Zarour, Samuel Mosching, Bryan Pardo and others in the band employ complex rhythmic and melodic ideas to create a multi-faceted and layered musical experience like no other.  Also, we improvise, a lot.
We are recording 3 of our original pieces (audio and video) in October to be released in November.  They are called "Black", "Jurjina" and "East of Now."  Your help in funding this project will give us immeasurable support in spreading the word about the band and allowing us to perform in a venue near you. The videos will be shot at a studio during a live recording session.
The musicians are composer, buzuq and oud player Wanees Zarour, guitarist Samuel Mosching, saxophonist and clarinetist Bryan Pardo, Trombonist Chris Shuttleworth, drummer Nick Kabat and bassist Vinny Kabat.

ARAÑANDO EL ALMA
Andrés de Jerez con la guitarra de Samuelito
(Français)
En 2014, Andrés de Jerez et Samuelito se rencontrent au festival Arte Flamenco de Mont-de-Marsan, qui marque le début d'une belle amitié ponctuée de collaborations artistiques. De cette rencontre, un projet commun est né, faire un disque de flamenco puro, celui de l'émotion comme le cante d'Andrés, celui de la fraîcheur comme le toque de Samuelito.
Andrés de Jerez est un artiste d'intuition, patient, qui sait que chaque chose arrive en son temps, "sin prisa, pero sin pausa". Ce disque murit depuis très longtemps. Un rêve qu'il s'est forgé depuis ses 5 ans quand il chantait dans ses premiers tabancos, grâce à son grand-père qui a toujours cru en lui. Une vie de cante jondo jusqu'à l'extrême, d'expériences et de rencontres avec les plus grands.
Samuelito, l'enfant de 5 ans passionné par le flamenco de Manuel Agujetas que lui fait écouter son père, rêve déjà de guitare et s'imagine un jour accompagner le cante puro. Après des années d'études musicales, d'expériences artistiques variées, de rencontres flamencas, et avec la ténacité de vivre son art en accord avec ses convictions, il réalise son désir : un disque de flamenco puro.
Ce disque est bien plus qu'une performance musicale, c'est un aboutissement artistique et singulier.
Grâce à Jean-Louis Solans notre réalisateur, nous avons pu enregistrer dans les mythiques studios Ferber à Paris. L'acoustique est parfaitement adaptée au cante viscéral d'Andrés, au metal de sa voix, et au toque passionné de Samuelito. Nous étions accompagnés de trois palmeros, Isidoro de Jerez, Juan Manuel Cortes et Dani Barba, mais aussi de nos amis qui sont venus pour nous inspirer, nous soutenir, nous encourager.
Tout le long de l'enregistrement, les palos se sont enchaînés : soleá, siguiriya, corridos a capella, tientos.... un vrai répertoire de flamenco puro por derecho, qui, à travers le cante d'Andrés de Jerez, prennent une dimension émotionnelle forte.
Notre distributeur, Buda Musique, permettra le mastering, la fabrication du disque et sa diffusion en France et au niveau international. C'est avec eux que nous travaillerons la promotion.
Nous aurons l'honneur d'avoir les clichés de Miguel Angel Gonzalez, artiste photographe de Jerez, qui nous offrira tout le support visuel du disque. C'est pour Andrés un appui absolu, la consécration d'une longue et puissante amité.
La littérature du disque sera confiée à notre grand ami commun, Michel Mompontet, journaliste aficionado à la plume remarquable.
Ce disque ne serait rien sans vous, car la musique se doit d'être vivante à travers sa transmission. Sans vous, nous ne pourrons pas aller au bout de ce rêve, ni pouvoir le partager.
Nous avons besoin de vous, de votre appui financier, quel qu'il soit. Vous aurez en retour une rétribution qui compensera votre participation
Les différents frais que nous avons à couvrir :
Location du studio A de Ferber
Prise de son et mixage de Jean-Louis Solans
Photos et vidéos de FlamencoPhil
Frais de déplacement, de restauration...
Un budget communication (attaché de presse, clip, photos...) si nous dépassons l'objectif !
Pour que vive le cante jondo, pour que la transmission perdure, pour vous, pour nous, pour les générations à venir.
Merci par avance, nous vous sommes reconnaissants.
Portrait d'Andrés de Jerez par Miguel Angel Gonzalez
(Español)
En el año 2014, Andres de Jerez y Samuelito se conocen por primera vez en el festival de Mont de Marsan. Es el principio de una bella amistad, punteada de colaboraciones artísticas. De este encuentro, nació un proyecto común : grabar un disco flamenco puro, con la emoción del cante de Andres, y la joventud del toque de Samuelito.
Andrés de Jerez tiene 52 años, es un artista de intuición, paciente, que sabe que cada cosa llega en su tiempo, "sin prisa, pero sin pausa ". Este disco ha madurado desde hace mucho tiempo. Un sueño que tiene desde sus 5 años cuando cantaba en sus primeros tabancos, gracias a su abuelo que siempre creyó en él. Una vida de cante puro hasta el extremo, llena de existencia y encuentros con los más grandes.
Samuelito tiene 24 años. Desde sus 3 años fue apasionado por el flamenco de Manuel Agujetas cuando su padre lo inicio. Ya soñaba con guitarra y se imagina un día acompañar el cante puro. Después de bastante años de estudios musicales, de varias experiencias artísticas e encuentros flamencos, siempre con el deseo de vivir su arte en acuerdo con sus convicciones, realiza su sueño : un disco flamenco puro.
Este disco es mucho más que una realización musical, es un resultado artístico y singular.
Gracias a Jean-Louis Solans nuestro realizador, pudimos grabar en los míticos Studios Ferber en París. La acústica es perfectamente adaptada al cante visceral de Andrés, al metal de su voz y al toque apasionado de Samuelito. Fuimos acompañados por tres palmeros, Isidoro de Jerez, Juan Manuel Cortes y Dani Barba, pero también por nuestros amigos que asistieron para inspirarnos, sostenernos e animarnos.
Todo lo largo de la grabacion, los palos se encadenaron: soleá, siguiriya, corridos a capella, tientos... un autentico repertorio de flamenco puro por derecho, cual, a través del cante de Andrés de Jerez, toma una dimensión emocional poderosa.
Nuestro distribuidor, Buda Musique, permitirá el mastering, la fabricación del disco y su difusión en Francia y al nivel internacional. Con ellos tambien trabajaremos la promoción.
Tendremos el honor de beneficiar de las fotos de Miguel Angel Gonzalez, artista fotógrafo de Jerez, que nos ofrecerá todo el soporte visual del disco. Es para Andrés un apoyo absoluto, la consagración de una larga y poderosa amistad.
La literatura del disco será confiada a nuestro grande amigo comun, Michel Mompontet, periodista aficionado, a la pluma admirable.
Este disco no sería nada sin ustedes, porque la música tiene que ser viva a través de su transmisión. Sin ustedes, no podremos ir al cabo de este sueño, ni poder compartirlo.
Os necesitamos en su apoyo financiero, cualquiera que sea. Tendrán a cambio una retribución cual compensará su participación.
Los diferentes gastos que tenemos que cubrir:
 Alquiler del estudio A en Ferber
Grabación y mezcla de sonidos de Jean-Louis Solans
Fotos y vídeos de FlamencoPhil
Gastos de desplazamientos, de restauración...
¡ Un presupuesto comunicación (agente de prensa, clip video, fotos) si sobrepasamos el objetivo!
Para que viva el cante jondo, para que la transmisión perdure, para ustedes, para nosotros, para las generaciones futuras.
Gracias de antemano, les estamos muy agradecidos.
retrato de Andres de Jerez, foto de Miguel Angel Gonzalez
  (English)
Andrés de Jerez and Samuelito first met in 2014 at Mont-de-Marsan's Arte Flamenco festival and their beautiful friendship lead them to create music together eversince. Indeed, a project arised from their meeting : recording a flamenco puro album, which combines the emotion of Andrés' cante (flamenco singing) and Samuelito's fresh toque (flamenco playing).
Andrés de Jerez is a patient artist, always following his intuition when creating music, he knows that everything comes when it's meant to be : "sin prisa, pero sin pausa". This album has been blooming for quite some time, a dream that appeared to 5-years-old Andrés while singing in his first tabancos, thanks to his grand-father who never ceased to believe in him. A life of cante jondo (deep flamenco singing) pushed to the extreme, full of experiences and encounters with the most famous artists.
Samuelito, already passioned by flamenco music at the age of 5 listening to his dad's albums of Manuel Agujetas, dreams himself into a guitarist who can accompany cante puro. After years of musical studies, diverse artistic experiences, meetings with the flamenco culture and the desire to live his art in line with his convictions, he finally gets to achieve his goal : a flamenco puro album.
This album is more than a musical performance, it's an artistic and singular accomplishment.
Thanks to Jean-Louis Solans, our director, we had the opportunity to record in the well-known Ferber studios in Paris. The acoustics are completely in accordance with Andrés' deep cante, the metal of his voice, and Samuelito's passionate toque. We were accompanied by three palmeros, Isidoro de Jerez, Juan Manuel Cortes et Dani Barba, but also friends who came to inspire and support us.
Palos succeeded one another all along the recording : soleá, siguiriya, corridos a capella, tientos.... a true flamenco puro por derecho music repertoire, which, through Andrés' cante, lead to a realm strongly charged with emotion.
Our distributor, Buda Musique, will do the mastering, the production of the album and its dissemination in France and at the international scale.
We will have the great opportunity to have Miguel Angel Gonzalez, a photographer from Jerez, making the visual of the album. He's a great support for Andrés, his participation is a good proof of their powerful and long-time friendship.
The litterature of the album is Michel Mompontet's work, a common and great friend. He's a journalist with a dilightful writing style.
This album would be nothing without you, music is something that must be lived and passed on. We can't make this dream come true or spread it without you.
We need you and your financial support no matter how small it is. You will have a reward in return which will make up for your contribution.
We have to cover differents fees :
Rental of Ferber's studios
Work of sound recording and mix by Jean-Louis Solans
Photos and videos by FlamencoPhil
Travel expenses, alimentation...
Communication budget ( video clip, photos, press officer) if we overachieve the goal !
For the cante jondo to live, for the spreading to last, for you, for us, for generations to come.
Thank you in advance, we are very grateful.

Lady Vampire is an illustrated version of the classic vampire tale, Carmilla by Joseph Sheridan Le Fanu. Often sited as the first vampire literature and an influence on Bram Stoker's Dracula.
 The stunning model and art muse for this book is the incredible Deborah Anderson! Without her this book and art would not have happened. She is an inspiration greater than my words can express.
    Sometimes after an hour of apathy, my strange and beautiful companion would take my hand and hold it with a fond pressure, renewed again and again; blushing softly, gazing in my face with languid and burning eyes, and breathing so fast that her dress rose and fell with the tumultuous respiration. It was like the ardour of a lover; it embarrassed me; it was hateful and yet overpowering; and with gloating eyes she drew me to her, and her hot lips travelled along my cheek in kisses; and she would whisper, almost in sobs, "You are mine, you shall be mine, and you and I are one for ever". (Carmilla, Chapter 4).

It's a sELFie. Aha! Eh? Eh?
I'm Fran, an artist from London. I'm a big D&D and comics nerd who likes old gothic novels, tea and dogs. Thank you very much for checking out my book. Strap in, make yourself a cuppa, and here we go!

Well, wow. I am blown away. You have funded Drowgust 2020 in less than a day! Thank you all so much!
So that means... stretch goals.
Look how many stretchgoals you have unlocked! Moonrat is impressed.
We've unlocked 4 extra pages in the book, featuring some dark elf lore, monsters and artefacts.
Everyone from adventurer up will get an extra vinyl sticker (1 at random for adventurers, 6 in total for treasure hunters and above), a holo foil sticker and a bookmark.
Everyone from cyberpunk up gets more outfits for the printable Moonrat doll.
We have also now unlocked custom tissue paper to wrap rewards in! This not only means your rewards will look extra swanky, but it also helps me improve my own shop and makes me feel more professional at the art stuffs and things.
Finally, if we somehow manage to double the original goal, at £1400 I will draw a brand new comic all about one of the dark elf characters, which backers will get to download for free. (This would be available later than the rest of the rewards as I haven't drawn it yet.)
Dark elves, also known as drow, dunmer or dökkálfar. They're my favourite fantasy race, plus they're fun to draw. My first ever D&D character was a dark elf. Some people think they're evil, but I just think they're neat!
My first D&D character Cillian as a kid, not at all worried about the horror I would put him through when he grew up with my dice rolls
I've always loved fantasy books and comics like Elfquest and Drowtales. I love fairy folklore and the art of Brian Froud. Recently I have become obsessed- ahem interested in the TTRPG Spire and its sister game Heart, where you play drow revolutionaries fighting to rid their city of the evil high elves.
It's pretty trippy. There are magic bees.
Three years ago I came up with a drawing challenge I called Drowgust, because I also love puns*. Each day of August I draw a different dark elf, which I post online. I've been selling the collected Drowgust books online since we don't get to go to as many comic conventions these days. This year, I decided to try Kickstarting my 2020 Drowgust book, and here we are.

*It's like Drawgust, see, only instead of drawing, you're drow-ing, geddit? Eh? Hello?

The cover
A digital mockup of the book (courtesy of covervault)
The Drowgust 2020 book will be 44 pages , A5, full colour throughout. The cover is designed by my very talented friend and fellow D&D nerd Tara of Tara Roseblade Designs.

Each page features a different dark elf, a mixture of my own OCs, fan art and new characters made just for this, including all of the Heart classes and the four new Pathfinder 2e classes:

Hello there!
My name is Julie Okahara. I am a mixed media artist who focuses on illustration influenced by both American and Japanese pop art. I love doodling and making little characters. Some people say my style is cute, others find it a bit dark ;) 
Lately, I have been going to local events and conventions not only to share what I do, but also to make new friends and to find out what they love to do. I came across so many cool things, and one of them were cute little enamel pins! I already own some pins, but I just had a thought.. What if I can make my own pins with my characters..
That would be awesome!!! xD
With your help, I can make my silly dream come trueee!!!!
So when I decided to make my own pins, I wanted to make a brand new series. Since I like animals from the forest, I started sketching and designing. And I narrowed them down to a few of my favorite ones!
Yippieee!!! I just received a couple of sample pins for our pink bunny! 
I'm beyond super! It's so amazing and kind of surreal to see my character made into a pin!!! xD
I would also like to introduce 3 more designs! Just because they are too cute!!! xD

We are publishing a new edition of Gustave Doré's illustrations for Dante's Inferno at a level of detail never before made available!  

Gustave Doré's illustrations remain a high watermark for artists around the world. However, his work has never been reproduced accurately with the attention to detail it deserves.


Thanks to painstaking research, we have assembled all 75 plates of his legendary illustrations for Dante Alighieri's INFERNO. These are extremely detailed reproductions printed on a variety of high-quality art paper and unavailable anywhere else. Thanks to modern reproduction techniques, you can now enjoy Doré's work as it was meant to be seen, and examine the incredibly detailed line-work. Previous collections often featured mediocre print quality with washed-out, low-contrast grey and poor reproduction. We are determined to provide the highest-quality reproductions ever made available.
At last you can see the incredible detail of Gustave Dore's linework!

Now you can own all FIFTEEN High-Quality prints of Gustave Doré's artwork, printed by state-of-the-art technology that will bring out the finest detail of these pieces.  
Your Options
Collecting and researching various sources for these very high-resolution images has been an extremely time-consuming task. 
Producing the very best quality prints requires painstaking attention to detail, especially since we identify he best printing production technique for every single plate to ensure the highest quality for you.  
Also, our researchers have found the best heavy stock in 3 different types of paper to display these amazing pieces of art. The options available are:  
 • Medium-weight matte stock, (80 lb/177 gsm) printed on one side. Laid Bright White finish with crisp quality and strong contrast. You can select this option in the CAD$60.00 pledge (limited number of copies).

With bandwidth and web development an expensive upgrade from our modest advertising revenue, we're looking to move some of our T-shirts, limited edition vinyl and compilation CDs into your hands. We want Brooklyn Radio to work better for you. And, to do that, we need to build a stronger site that can handle the volume of people tuning in. What happens to a family after they lose their father suddenly to cancer, a likely result of his work as a contractor in the Iraq War? What is the impact on the next generation after the family’s eldest son survives an AK-47 round to the head? Their life suddenly centered in the Middle East draw the only daughter to Iraq where she ironically falls in love and marries. This film explores the unexpected impact of the tragic invasion of Iraq through the lens of the family’s second son, revealing the very personal effect of skewed politics and policies on one American family. My name is Estes Chastain. In 2005 my father, Kenneth at the age of 51, and older brother K.C., took construction contract jobs in Iraq. They departed with HAZMAT suits and not even as much as a pocket knife to Iraqi “hot zones” at the time the most dangerous places on the globe. My 21 year old sister, Rose, the spoiled, over-protected baby of the family, stunned everyone in 2008 with her plan to board a military transport as a civilian contractor too “to have an adventure.” Suddenly half the family was in the Middle East. Over the course of five years, these family members would have life altering experiences that would consequently alter our lives permanently. This film highlights the succession of events which resulted in wealth, joy, pain, and immeasurable loss. K.C. worked alongside American and Iraqi troops and workers on a forward operating base as a labor foreman. Soon he is an accident investigator and sees many gruesome war related injuries. After three years there he is shot in head. The trajectory was incredibly lucky and KC survives. His abrupt exit for the states results in divorce, home foreclosure, heavy drinking and unemployment. He struggles depression and PTSD. Kenneth often worked in deadly toxic burn pits on base. He returned home after five years in Iraq literally sick and tired. He soon learned he had an aggressive, advanced cancer. He died within nine months of his return home. His position as patriarch and strong personality resulted in a family adrift for many months. Sister Rose, brought a youthful, sunny personality to her warzone assignment. She planned to travel the work but fell in love with a fellow Texan and coworker she met in Talafar Iraq. The impact of the losses and damage to her parents and brothers would redirect her path to home and a new sense of safety with the man she marries. This film chronicles the powerful impact the generally unheralded role the civilian contractors played in the Iraq War and the powerful aftermath of the war on one American middle class family.

Our Story.
Anyone who has googled most African cities like Nairobi will know that the images that come up are not exactly flattering. It's mostly slums, conflict or at best, wildlife.
One day, Mutua Matheka went up to the rooftop of one of the taller buildings in Nairobi and saw the city, from a perspective new even to him. He realised Nairobi is actually beautiful. This moment changed everything. Mutua saw the distortion of what is presented to the world versus what is. He set out to photograph his city, in order to show the beauty he saw in it and, to balance the imagery that introduces the world to Nairobi.
This journey has led him to like-minded individuals who share the passion for shattering the common perceptions associated with African cities. We all share the conviction that perspective shapes what we see and, what we see shapes our mindsets and ideas about places. Together, we are preparing for a new adventure, with the purpose to disrupt the narrative about urban Africa. We have all worked, in our individual capacities, on telling stories from the African continent that educate people about this place we call home – Africa.
We four storytellers are now in preparation for an ambitious road trip around Southern Africa, to capture images that balance existing perceptions of African cities. We would love for you to be part of this quest. As Mutua likes to say, "together we are stronger and better". That's why we've chosen crowdfunding as a tool to kickstart this project and why we want you to join our journey.
Unscrambling Africa 
Kampala
This is a road trip project with the purpose of exploring what defines urbanity across our continent. From Nairobi to Durban, the team will see and document what these cities look like, meet the people that reside in them, discover the sub-cultures and photograph the built environment. The journey, stories and photos will be shared with all who are interested, via various social media platforms.
why cities?
In the city we affectionately refer to as, "Nairobae"
There are over a billion people living in Africa and it is projected that in the next 15 years, half of them will live in our cities. As city dwellers ourselves, proud citizens of Nairobi, we have seen our city grow and evolve so rapidly in the last 10 years. We have been shaped by these developments and in a way have also shaped the urban landscape and the culture that is inextricably linked to it. 
why Unscrambling Africa?
The scramble and partition of Africa in the 1880’s and 90’s totally interfered with Africa’s progress – its social and economic life. Over a century later, we still live and feel the effects of this partition especially in the separation of people on the continent. It’s hard for Africans to travel within the continent and so it’s hard to have information and experience of what life and people are like in different countries. We have to rely on news channels, whom we see not to share the interest of unifying the continent as their top priority.
Dusk in Cape Town
Unscrambling Africa is a project that seeks to ‘discover’ urban areas all over the continent, from Alexandria to CapeTown, Yaoundé through to Addis Ababa exploring the different personalities to African cities. Mutua has already documented 5 African cities and will be taking this opportunity to photograph 13 more cities to document what urbanity means in the African context. His passion leads him to uncover how we use, define and relate with our spaces in Africa, whether explicitly or implicitly defined; to explore African architecture; to discover how different or similar the cultures of urbanity are in different African cities, and most importantly to share this information so that more of us can gain an insight of what stories our neighbouring cities behold. Undoubtedly photography and video will be one of the most impressionable ways to unscramble our continent.
how we plan to do this
Our visual exploration begins on January 10th 2017.  
We plan to travel to more than 13 cities, on a journey covering 15,000km within a period of 8 weeks – documenting Architecture, public spaces and the people and cultures that exist within them.
We depart from Nairobi and drive through; Tanzania – Malawi – Zambia – Botswana – Namibia – South Africa – Lesotho – Swaziland – Mozambique – Zimbabwe …
…and then all the way back home to Nairobi.
We want our journey to demonstrate what’s possible with imagination, collaboration and action. We want to overturn the widely held belief that it is difficult to cross borders and travel within our continent. Through this we aim to illustrate that the distances between us need not separate us. We will do all this by leveraging off the virtual relationships that we have managed to forge, thanks to social media, internet and mobile technology.
The Team
Mutua Matheka
Photographer, artist, former architect and avid traveler, with a great eye for showcasing African landscapes, architecture and cultures. He has been a photographer since 2010 and has a dream of photographing all African cities. Mutua chooses to see the beauty in the mundane.
 Instagram: @truthslinger
Joe Were 
Travel and documentary photographer, linguist, Instagram influencer and adventure-seeker. Joe has an eye for landscapes and capturing human moments of beauty.
Instagram: @jaydabliu
Lulu Kitololo 
Artist, designer, creative director and storyteller whose current tools of choice are illustration and graphic design. Inspired by nature, tropical colour as well as culture and craft traditions from across the continent – content creation is her cup of tea.
Instagram: @lulukitololo
Josh Kisamwa
Travel & Documentary storyteller using film as his medium. Inspired by the stories he hears from the people he meets all over the continent.
Instagram: @joshkisamwa
we would love to take you with us!
Kampala
We want to travel lightly and respectfully through the places we go, learning from and collaborating with people we meet and leaving both parties with many positives from the experience.
Vlogging, behind-the-scenes
Some of the content we will be creating includes:
Daily Instagram posts, photography and illustration
Weekly vlogs on YouTube 
Weekly blog posts on our respective blogs: mutuamatheka.co.ke/blog, joewere.net/blog, afri-love.com 
Regular podcasts 
These activities will begin in the run-up to the journey, documenting the preparation.

After our travels we plan to compile and showcase our collective work in a variety of ways including:
A video web series (12 episodes)
A photography coffee table book
Photographic prints
A colouring book 
Postcards
An exhibition that will eventually travel to all the cities we visited

Vilka är Teater Satelliten?
Teater Satelliten är en ensemble där personer med och utan diagnoser framför musikaler på professionell nivå. Ensemblens styrka ligger i att lyfta artisternas styrkor på scenen, där du inte alltid vet vem som har andra förutsättningar än det samhället kallar det "normala".  
På Teater Satelliten ser vi till varje individs talang och låter dem växa på scen utifrån sina egna förutsättningar. Vi har alla något att lära av varandra och alla ska ha möjlighet att utveckla sin fulla potential på samma villkor. Teater Satelliten står på scenen tillsammans, som EN grupp med samma mål och med samma villkor! Vi vill arbeta för en inkluderande teaterscen oavsett diagnos, ursprung, eller förutsättningar.
En dokumentär om att trotsa hinder och nå oanade höjder
Vi vill skapa en dokumentär som dels följer ensemblens arbete som helhet fram till urpremiären av musikalen Mitt Liv den 15 maj 2019 och dels följa några ur ensemblen mer privat, hur deras medgångar, motgångar och framgångar ser ut i livet. Personer som trotsar sina hinder och utmanar sig själva på vägen mot en professionell karriär.
Här möter du personer som skulle kunna ligga i Sveriges toppelit på kulturscenen, men som pga. av exempelvis psykisk ohälsa, dåliga myndighetsbeslut eller ett samhälle som inte tagit till vara på fördelarna med personens diagnoser, inte fått möjligheten att bidra med sina unika förmågor.
Det finns så mycket talang som bara kastas i papperskorgen, så länge vi inte tillåts ta plats och accepteras för den vi är. I sammanhang tillsammans med andra, oberoende diagnos. Det händer något med oss när någon vågar tro på oss, en känsla av att lyckas och att tro på sig själv.
Öppna upp för mångfald på Sveriges kulturscener!
Vi vill visa att det går att arbeta på en teaterscenen tillsammans oavsett vad du fötts med för förutsättningar. Cirka 10% av Sveriges vuxna säger att de har någon form av funktionsnedsättning och 25% av Sveriges befolkning som har utländsk bakgrund. Men hur avspeglar sig det på Sveriges Kulturscener? Vem är välkommen på Sveriges kulturscener?
Vi visa att när vi väljer att se en människa för deras positiva egenskaper och talang och inte för deras brister och diagnoser, så kan den människan växa till oanade höjder. 
Vårt mål är att dokumentären ska sändas på TV, vilket är ett mål som inte går att garantera. Men vi kommer oavsett att arbeta för att nå ut med vår dokumentär på ett eller annat sätt, även om vi nekas i en TV pitch. Det kan t.ex. vara en miniserie på Youtube, en dokumentär via UR, utbildningsmaterial via andra utbildningsforum, föreläsningar med filmvisning osv. Dokumentären ska leva, utmaningen är bara hur brett vi kan nå.
Stöd vår dokumentär och gör skillnad! 
Hjälp oss att öppna upp för mångfalden på Sveriges kulturscener! Genom vår dokumentär kan vi visa att det går att arbeta på en teaterscenen tillsammans oavsett vad du fötts med för förutsättningar. 
För 6000:- kan vi hyra en professionell videokamera och mikrofon för att skapa dokumentären.
För 15.000 kan vi fortsätta följa vår ensemble i vardagen med professionell fotograf
För 30.000 kan professionell redigerare klippa och redigera dokumentären. 
För 60.000 kan en producent gå igenom materialet och pitcha mot tv.

For the third year in a row, I participate in the widely known Inktober challenge - every year with my own list of prompts. This time I've let my Instagram followers decide with theme I should tackle on and surprisingly enough, "Gods & Myths" was the winner of each poll. 
The Book
The book will be an 5.8"x8.3" perfect-bound softcover book with a minimalistic soft touch cover. Inside will be 68 pages total of all of the illustrations created throughout the month-long challenge, information about the myths the characters I've created are based on, plus 2 exclusive illustrations which will not be shown in public. Most of the illustrations are black and white, some are additionally highlighted with gold ink.
I will also added 1 exclusive bookmark to every physical copy of the Artbook. The design will be revealed soon.

With this Kickstarter you can help me to make this happen. Thank you also for your long-running support on Instagram.  sinicitas.instagram 
Thanks again for every support this premiere project will get. You guys deceive every wine in my non existing cellar.
Greetings,
sinicitas.

UPDATE: After meeting our $10,000 goal, we have set a NEW GOAL of $11,900 so that we can visit more locations and talk to more people about how the nuclear industry has impacted their community. Scroll down below to see the breakdown.
For the past two years we have traveled throughout Colorado and New Mexico, interviewing activists and community members whose lives have been impacted by the nuclear weapons industry.  We have listened to stories both heartbreaking and inspiring. We have heard about calling into work sick to go on a Backcountry Action in Nevada to stop an underground nuclear weapons test, about quitting your job to dedicate your life full-time to shutting down Rocky Flats, and we have heard about sickness, death, and imprisonment. In the face of both adversity and triumph, these are stories about solidarity, community and a profound commitment to environmental and racial justice.  
Taylor reviewing footage
Our project is a feature-length experimental documentary and multimedia oral history archive that examines three regions in the west, the former Rocky Flats Plant, the White Sands Missile Range and the Nevada Test Site. Off Country investigates the environmental consequences of the nuclear weapons industry as well as racist and classist policies inherent in the storage, mining, and production of radioactive material. We have driven more than 8000 miles, shot over two and a half hours of 16mm film and collected nearly twenty hours of interviews and field recordings. 
The film was started with a small grant from CU Boulder, this grant allowed us to perform field work for 4 weeks in the summer of 2016. We shot over 2000 feet of film during this period. Since then we have traveled to New Mexico  numerous times and have spent $8,000 on our own conducting fieldwork. Thanks to a small grant from The Puffin Foundation we were able to process and transfer about half of our footage. At bare minimum, we need an additional $10,000 to process the remaining film and transfer it to video. 
In order to continue our work we have started a Kickstarter campaign and invite you to help. We are fiscally sponsored by Basement Films so all donations are tax deductible.
  www.off-country.com
Taylor and Eric location scouting at the gates of White Sands Missile Range
Why Now?
In 1992 the closing of the Rocky Flats Plant outside of Boulder Colorado halted the industrial production of nuclear weapons. There are currently plans underway to construct a plutonium pit production facility at Los Alamos National Labs in New Mexico, in order to modernize the U.S. nuclear stockpile for the 21st Century, despite lingering environmental contamination left by the legacy of the 20th century. 
In the 1940s, New Mexico was chosen as the site for the Manhattan Project and the world's first atomic weapons test because of its remoteness and the military’s perception that “no one” lived there. However, the Mescalero Indian reservation was established just seven miles from ground zero, and Hispanic families had been ranching in the area for generations. What the military meant by “no one” was that no Anglo-Americans lived in the area. 
The film will be bilingual and focus on nuclear weapons testing, manufacturing, and storage, with an emphasis on social justice and environmental restoration. Additionally, the archive will document and catalog a diverse chorus of voices whom history has neglected. This archive will be a tool for researchers, historians, and activists, to learn not only about history but the human stories of people resisting environmental contamination and political oppression.
Tularosa Downwinders protesting at the Trinity Site Open House
Impact:
The lives and histories of the communities living around White Sands, Los Alamos National Lab and the extensive uranium mining in New Mexico’s Pueblos is an overlooked and undocumented legacy. New Mexico was intentionally chosen because of its marginalized and underprivileged population. Mining was done on reservations as a way of sidestepping federal and state regulations. The Off Country film and archive will document and bear witness to the struggle of these communities bringing their stories and voices into a broader cultural awareness.
Stretch Goal Details:
Research Trip to Idaho National Laboratory
This is the location of the first operational nuclear power plant but it is also where the contaminated material form Rocky Flats was stored. Later, under pressure from the Idaho legislature the contaminated material was removed and they did a better job cleaning up the stored waste from Rocky Flats then they did cleaning up Rocky Flats itself.
How the Funds Will be Used:
We will use the Kickstarter funds to process and transfer the remaining film that we shot so that we may begin editing. We will also use funds for production trips to Nevada and Idaho.

Distribution: Taylor and Eric are accomplished filmmakers who tour nationally and internationally. They love showing their films and engaging with local communities through public discussion and media workshops. Once completed the film will be toured throughout the Southwest and shown at local community centers. The film will be submitted to festivals and seek distribution, including online streaming. We will build lesson plans to accompany the film for accession into University libraries. 
Film still of The World's Largest Pistachio in Alamogordo, NM
 Rewards:
We appreciate any and all support. Every dollar counts! The column on the right lists the rewards with the dollar donation. 
Very special reward: limited edition silver gelatin print
We are shooting our project on B&W reversal 16mm film because we are dedicated to analog photography in the 21st century. The B&W aesthetic in the film connects to the atomic era and 20th-century landscape photography. By donating you have a unique opportunity to receive a very special reward, a limited edition silver gelatin print from a medium format camera.
Taylor Dunne and Eric Stewart filming at the Trinity Test Site open house
About Us:
Taylor Dunne (director/producer/editor) is a filmmaker, curator and university lecturer based in Colorado’s San Luis Valley and the Catskill Mountains of New York State. She has an affinity for photographic processes, amateur film, the personal archive and the history of the cinematic apparatus. She uses these obsessions, and a wide range of media, to paint intimate poetic essays that examine the interconnectedness of time, history and landscape. Her work strives to make visible underrepresented histories and to inspire citizens to participate in shaping future trends in cultural representation. Her works have been exhibited widely at venues that include; the New York Film Festival, the Tribeca Film Festival, Crossroads Film and Video Festival (San Francisco), FOL: Experimental Film Society (Istanbul), EXDOC (Paris) and The Deluge Center for Contemporary Art (Victoria, BC). Most recently she co-curated Mountain Time: Films the Interior of North America, a program of artist-made films and toured with them at micro-cinemas across Europe. 
Taylor capturing sound near Kirtland Airforce Base
Eric Stewart (director/producer/sound design) is an interdisciplinary multimedia artist and educator. Working predominantly with 16mm film, his artistic practice invokes photochemical and darkroom processes to investigate landscape, place and cultural identity in the American West. Before moving to Colorado in 2013, Eric lived in the San Francisco Bay Area where he taught a biweekly analog filmmaking workshop called “The Elements of Image Making”. He was awarded the 2015 Mono No Aware Award for Excellence in Filmmaking at the Haverhill Experimental Film Festival and his films have shown at The Yerba Buena Center for Fine Arts (SF), Yale University, Crossroads Film Festival (SF Cinematheque), 25fps (Zagreb) and The Florida Experimental Film Festival.  He holds a BFA from the School of the Art Institute of Chicago, an MFA from the University of Colorado, Boulder and is currently Assistant Professor in Photography at Adams State University in the beautiful San Luis Valley of Southern Colorado.
Eric taking a light meter reading outside the National Nuclear History Museum

Fight Life Atlanta (FLA), is a star-studded, Music and Modeling Showcase centered around; you guessed it...Boxing and Mixed Martial Arts. I will host live music showcases and have the models work the events as promotional models. My events will give local talent a legit chance to create a fan base and grow as an artist. The events will be held 5 times per year and will attract socialites, celebs, record execs, athletes, and sport enthusiasts. These will be full scale events with 5-6 Fights both male and Female Athletes with the Main event being the last fight. There will be local media coverage and press, photo ops and even an after party! My goal is to help give the creatives in Atlanta an opportunity to shine, and make money while doing so.  I am working with several up & coming artists and aspiring models who are excited about the opportunity to have real experience that pays. Fight Life Atlanta also serves to put a spotlight on very talented boxers and mixed martial arts athletes in Georgia. Promo videos will be created by the up & coming artists and the models will be new and fresh faces in the industry. These events will give Atlanta another opportunity to be a great sports and entertainment centered city. These events will also present the community with great new music and the opportunity to show support of the Atlanta based talent as they progress in their careers. We are all facing Giants in our lives, we are all striving towards a goal and the only way to achieve what we want out of life is to get up, decide not to give up, and give every day our best shot. Help me make this one a knockout for years to come! Fight Life: Atlanta

It started out in early 2009 as a nebulous thought that kept tickling the mind of Canadian musician, Patrick Lajeunesse: Could he use Indaba Music, an on-line collaborative-music site, to bring together musicians from around the world to write and record original songs dedicated to the twin ideals of peace and freedom?
Patrick proposed his idea in an Indaba "group" message and the rest, as they say, is history!
Over the past year, more than fifty musicians from eleven countries have collaborated on and contributed thirty-five songs to Patrick's Peace Partners project.
These songs are truly international in scope. The various Peace Partners composers and collaborators (only a few of whom have ever met in “real life”) hail from the U.S., Canada, the U.K., Italy, Germany, and Australia...to name but a few of the globe-spanning locations these incredibly talented individuals call "home". Taking full advantage of modern technology, they composed, discussed, arranged, recorded, refined, mixed, and mastered their musical creations exclusively through on-line collaborations - sharing initial ideas and, ultimately, individual musical contributions, over the Internet.
That's pretty darn amazing, if you think about it!!
The resulting Peace Partners songs are as diverse, musically, as the nationalities of their musical collaborators - ranging from pop to “classic rock” to classical to “world music” to jazz-fusion to good ol’, kick-@ss Rock & Roll…and everything in-between.
And, man, do they sound good!!
But don't take our word for it. We've posted a representative sampling of already-completed Peace Partners songs on a special Web page, where you can go and hear for yourself the amazing music that's created when dedicated musicians from around the globe contribute their talents to a cause they are passionate about. Head over there...crank up your speakers...give 'em a listen...then come back here for the rest of our pitch.
Don't worry. We'll wait...
*tap* *tap* *tap* *tap* (the sound of fingertips tapping on a desktop)
Are you back? Good. Let's continue, shall we?
Once all those incredible Peace Partners songs started rolling in, the next logical question became, what to do with them.
Patrick decided that, assuming all the musicians agreed, he'd find some way to sell these 35-and-counting songs on-line and, if possible, even produce a CD containing 15-20 tracks selected from all those Peace Partners submissions. Patrick also suggested that we donate the proceeds from these sales to established, non-profit organizations whose missions reflect the overarching themes of the various Peace Partners songs: Peace and Freedom.
Well, the musicians all agreed, making their compositions and musical contributions available through "Creative Commons" licenses and donating the resulting songs to the Peace Partners project for on-line and CD sales and distribution - so long as the purpose of these sales was to support legitimate non-profit organizations and activities. Patrick, in turn, formed his own non-profit "pass-through" organization (fittingly named "Peace Partners") and established alliances with Amnesty International Canada and War Child Canada as initial recipients of the potential proceeds from any "Peace Partners" music sales. More associations with additional non-profit organizations will surely follow.
And that brings us to where things currently stand: The music's largely completed and ready for release; on-line distribution has already been arranged; the legal channels have been established to process and distribute any proceeds generated by the Peace Partners project. All that remains is to physically produce the hoped-for CD.
Unfortunately, this last step requires something neither Patrick nor the participating musicians possess in excess:
loot...moolah...lucre...
dough...dinero...dosh...
scratch...shekels...simoleons...
in other words...fairly straightforward words: cold, hard cash!!!
And that's where you come in! We need "seed" money to...um..."kick-start" the CD component of the Peace Partners project. (Now do you see how we ended up here?)
The goal of this Kickstarter project is to raise the money required to professionally design and print full-color CD covers, labels and inserts...to replicate at a professional manufacturing plant an initial run of 1,000 CDs containing those 15-20 selected songs mentioned earlier...and, finally, to prepare these 1,000 professionally produced CD packages for marketing and distribution, so they can enter the sales' chain and themselves, in turn, generate the funds required to produce and sell more CDs that, in turn, will pay for more CDs, which, in turn, will...well...you get the picture. Once things gets started, it's a self-perpetuating process.
We just need a little financial backing to start the ball rolling.
So, check out the various "rewards" we're offering for different pledge levels, listed over there to the right...pick out a pledge level that's comfortable for you...pry open the ol' wallet or purse...and help us turn our dream of a "Peace Partners" CD into reality.
Even if we meet our stated Kickstarter fundraising goal, which we're confident we will, that doesn't mean you should just click away from this page and not submit a pledge. There are a couple of good reasons to help us exceed that initial target of $4,000. You'll not only share the wonderful feeling that comes from being involved in a worthwhile project, you'll also get some amazing music created by some truly talented musicians from all around the world...and any additional funds collected through this project are for a great cause!!
Thank you, in advance, for your belief in our project. If you'd like to learn even more, feel free to visit the Peace Partners Web site.
Peace

In 2018, I introduced The ImpeachMint Project right here on Kickstarter. The project began as a response to the White House Gift Shop's propaganda-esque commemorative coins praising the Trump administration for events that were skewed or had flat out never happened (remember the coin for the first "peace talk" with Kim Jong Un?). I got a lot of love from people all over the world and within just a few days we reached our goal to create the first coin in the series, The Trump Tower Commemorative Coin (aka "I Love It").  Since then the project has grown, now with 16 coins and counting, and has been featured in The Guardian, Vice, Artnet, ARTNews, and BoingBoing! I even was able to create a real-life Impeach Mint shop and bring it to life earlier this year at SPRING/BREAK Art Show in NYC. I've also dedicated a portion of all regular direct sales (through my personal website) to benefit various groups that are working on the forefront of important issues; this year, through the sales of Impeach Mint coins, I have raised and donated over $2,000 to Color of Change, the Bail Project, The Loveland Foundation, and Swing Left.
But after almost three years, and with another general election looming, I feel it's time to bring this project to a close. So, no matter how this election turns out, the Impeach Mint Project is now wrapping up its final designs. 
the real-life Impeach Mint installation was featured in Artnet earlier this year when it debuted at SPRING/BREAK Art Show in New York City (pre-covid!)
This Kickstarter campaign is for six new coins and custom cases, bringing the Project to completion.
The six new coins will be dedicated to Pence, Barr, Kushner, Miller, and two yet-to-be-announced people or events. The great news is that I've already raised most of the funds needed through previous sales of coins, so there's only a little more needed to get this last leg up and running. The six new coins will join the rest of the series to complete the full 20-piece Full Collection.
During this Kickstarter campaign, a limited number of 20-piece Full Collections and a la carte coins will be offered at very special pricing.
I tried my best to create a number of backer reward tiers and add-ons so that everyone can get the coins they want, whether it's the full set or just their very favorite design!

We are working to bring the world a look into the unique collection of Jamie Ross, featuring unusual letters and imagery not traditionally found in Navajo designs. We will first be applying basic conservation to the textiles. After any deterioration effects have been mitigated we will continue photographing each piece with a 4x5 camera. The 4x5 camera will have a digital back, that will give us the opportunity to shoot highly detailed images that could potentially be printed at large sizes. Once each piece has been photographed, they will then be stored in proper archival textile storage to be shipment ready for future exhibitions. Any donations received will cover the cost of archival materials, conservation and photography supplies, and printing costs.
 The collector of the blankets, Jamie Ross, first started his collection at the age of three and has continued to build his collection today. His love and passion for Navajo weaving is what drew to starting this project and in the end a book dedicated to Jamie Ross. The collection itself consists of over 400 blankets and each of them unique because they focus on incorporation the English language into the weaving's. The blankets gives a unique look into pictorial Navajo blankets and the influences that shaped Navajo Nation today. As Native American ourselves, we would want to be able to show the world the diverse history of Navajo weaving and bring new light into traditional Native arts. Please feel free to email back with any questions or concerns. We appreciate your time and support with the project.

Mais qui sommes nous ?
Installation Ok ! Tout est prêt ? Eeeet.. on live !
Actuellement basés à Niort nous nous plaisons aussi à proposer des streams sur les jeux actuels, discuter avec les communauté et découvrir avec vous de nouveau jeux vidéo qui font parler d'eux,

On peut nous retrouver sur twitch mais nous sommes aussi présent sur youtube pour les redif et tous le travail que l'on réalise avant et après les events : trailers, vlog, vidéo montage d'un évent etc...

Pour le prochain événement nous avons une place de choix au Stunfest  pour rediffuser le tournoi de Super Smash Bros Wii U le 20 Mai dès 12h, la scène versus fighting la plus hype de france !!

Pour vous inscrire c'est par ici !
 Avec un événement de cette ampleur, nous nous devons de présenter le meilleurs stream qu'il faut pour la communauté, de bonne qualité, sans freezes, sans problèmes de son, avec des animateurs de qualité, et des commentaires au top du top !
Mais pour ça il nous les faut des moyens, c'est la qu'on fait appel à vous !
Image non contractuelle d'un mec qui commente du Sm4sh
 On commence par le plus important : le cast !
Car avoir de la qualité c'est aussi avoir de la voix, un bon débit de paroles et connaitre le jeu sur le bout des doigts, pas facile quand on s’occupe du stream de rester concentré sur le jeu qui se déroule,
Mais évidemment, les faire venir représente aussi un coût ;)
La somme totale réunie sera déterminante sur le choix des commentateurs pour caster au Stunfest le tournoi de Super Smash Bros Wii U, ils passeront aussi bien sur le stream que sur la scène principale devant plus de 500 personnes et représenter du mieux possible la communauté de Super Smash Bros !
Notre matériel se retrouve inlassablement en panne et chaque évènement on a un petit lot de : boitier d'acquisition qui déconne, le splitter HDMI hors service, les cable HDMI avec des pattes arrachées, les micro grésilles sans raisons ou les casques qui se font voler, notre matériel en voit de toute les couleurs pendant nos déplacements !
La logistique aussi, bien qu'on se fasse rembourser par les organisateurs la plupart du temps, les frais liés à la route comme les petites pannes et réparations ne sont pas non plus anodins,
 En conclusion, l'argent ainsi récoltée grâce à ce kickstater servira exclusivement au casting pour le Stunfest et aussi au stream Canapé Fight à l'amélioration de la qualité de nos rediffusions,
Et pas de panique si vous ne pouvez pas aider financièrement, un partage du projet sur vos réseaux sociaux sera tout aussi apprécié ! 
        Mille merci pour votre aide ! :D
Thx for Watching !
 Si vous désirez nous soutenir vous pouvez aussi nous suivre sur facebook ou tweeter, nous sommes aussi présent sur instagram ;)

I've always been inspired by cooking shows and travel documentaries, and especially people that are able to combine the two! And that inspiration has pushed me to want to make my own video series dedicated to food, and drink, and travel, and eventually turn it into something that can then inspire others the way I've been inspired. 
In order to do that, I've gotta start somewhere. And that somewhere is here. I hope to be able to turn these early videos into a channel that focuses on culture and culinary arts, but also focuses on the history and ecology of the world around us. I plan to start locally in the cities around me, expand to the rest of the states, and then one day to other countries around the world, exploring new cultures and ways of life and sharing with people their rich and vibrant history, their incredible culinary delights, their exquisite drinks, and their incredible music, as well as touch on how people around the world are affected by the things we do elsewhere and how we can help other cultures, and our own, continue and thrive for future generations.
It sounds like a lot, and I know projects of this scale seem like they could be insurmountable. But I know with your help, I really can make this come true. I just need that little kickstart to help me get this off the ground. Whatever funds I can't raise through here, I will raise by myself. Because this isn't just some dream. It's a legitimate goal, and I will make it happen. But I know I could make it happen much sooner with your help and contributions. 
Each camera I'm planning on using only costs $45 each, lighting is another $37, camera accessories like tripods and handles are $30, and the final cost would be memory cards at $20 a pop.

About Us Home / About Us
The Concept is simple, A Flint Resident will post a bill need and we will help them reach their goal!
Life Line Me empowers residents to raise money for monthly bills during the ongoing water crisis. Flint residents can create a campaign need on the platform and people around the world can assist them in reaching desired goals This platform will provide Flint MI residents with the tools to meet their needs with the help of your peers. Our goal is to provide both a superior customer experience and tremendous value into the people of Flint lives. Life Line Me is a Platform dedicated To Flint MI Residents Effected By The Flint Water Crisis.
The Flint water crisis began in 2014 when the drinking water source for the city of Flint, Michigan was changed to the Flint River. Due to insufficient water treatment, over 100,000 residents were potentially exposed to high levels of lead in the drinking water. After a pair of scientific studies proved lead contamination was present in the water supply, a federal state of emergency was declared in January 2016 and Flint residents were instructed to use only bottled or filtered water for drinking, cooking, cleaning, and bathing. As of early 2017, the water quality had returned to acceptable levels; however, residents were instructed to continue to use bottled or filtered water until all the lead pipes have been replaced, which is expected to be completed no sooner than 2020.
This city still needs assistance both in the form of clean drinking water and direct funds to families in need. The platform does not charge any fees to its users at this time and all funds raised pour back into Flint Michigan’s community.  
Assist us in spreading the word! Sow & Reap Greatness.
“We stand for Justice for all people but understand that each fight has a unique voice. Pick up the tools and become a leader at the local level in your community today.”- Jasmine Rogers

Extraversal Year 1
A quest to unite 99 magical swords. A ship at play in the space between worlds. A mysterious walled city. A vast alien being in a broken century. A cat and a meringue.
Welcome to the worlds of Big Punch Studios.
From the creators of 7STRING and Afterlife Inc. comes Extraversal, a quarterly magazine serialising five ongoing series from the Big Punch Multiverse. Now, for the first time, issues 1-4 of Extraversal are being collected as a luxury, 164-page graphic novel.
Extraversal Year 1 has arrived. Time to fly.
Enter the Extraverse, the space between worlds, in the pages of CUCKOOS, as the crew of the Reflektor set sail in search of trade, adventure and perhaps a home…
A giant stone warship appears in the skies of an alternate New York in ORB, casting utopia into chaos, and leaving the fate of the world in the hands of a young girl and a superhuman prophet…
Years ago, a legendary swordsmith forged 99 SWORDS of great power. Now, in a world forever changed by their magic, Elsie Blackwood joins the ranks of Swordhunters seeking to unite the 99 Swords and claim the ultimate prize…
High above the city of Prizm, Cyanne and her skilled team of catchers defend their home from showers of deadly crystals, ever wondering what lies beyond THE WALL that separates them from the outside world…
Fresh from their 1,000 days of adventures, CAT AND MERINGUE return for more mirth and madness on an ocean of possibilities…
Hi. We're Big Punch Studios (a.k.a. Nich, Lucy, Jon and Ali) and together we make all manner of adventures in comics and games. We're the team behind 7STRING and Afterlife Inc., and we also made Sandwich Masters, a game of strategy, sabotage and sandwiches. Together, we handle all aspects of production on Extraversal, from script to art to publication, with help from our amazing team of freelance artists: Jack, Verity and James.
We began publishing Extraversal in 2015 as a way of telling more stories from our expanding multiverse. But don't be fooled: while the genres are different - spanning sci-fi, fantasy and comedy - this is one world, one story, told from different angles. Characters walk between pages, appearing in unexpected places. A mystery is developing across the Extraverse, and it's too big for any one universe to contain.
The individual issues of Extraversal are available to our Patrons and followers as a subscription service, but you can catch up on the story so far on our website. We're so excited to bring the collected edition of Extraversal Year 1 to life as a beautiful new book. We hope you enjoy reading it as much as we've enjoyed working on it.
Thanks for your time, gang. Welcome to our worlds.
Nich, Lucy, Jon and Ali
Big Punch Studios

"There's never really been a guitarist quite like Sylvia, not only in Hollywood, but anywhere." - The L.A. Weekly
"The thing about Sylvia Juncosa - the woman can play guitar. And she has a style all her own." - Music Connection Magazine
"One of the last of the true rock 'n roll wild ones" - Tip Magazine, Germany
Sylvia Juncosa is a unique figure in rock n' roll - a wild guitar bandit queen with serious skills, a tender singer with thoughtful lyrics, a restless soul who traveled the world. With a brash stage persona and an innovative musical style that bounds exuberantly between alternative rock, hard rock, psychedelic and '60's, Sylvia has been called "the female Jimi Hendrix". She first made a name for herself in the Los Angeles music scene of the 1980's, as one of very few bold, expressive and unique female guitarists of the time. During the '80s and '90s her career included two albums with her early band To Damascus, three solo albums under the name Sylvia Juncosa, an album  with the SST band SWA, numerous compilations and guest appearances, and extensive touring of the U.S. and Europe, including a U.S. tour as the opening band for Soundgarden, until at last in the later 1990's she mysteriously disappeared from the public eye. 
Now Sylvia is back, with a batch of strong songs and determined to make her best album ever. She is currently in the process of recording with one of the finest rhythm sections Los Angeles has to offer: on bass and backing vocals is Steve Reed (Legal Weapon, Carnage Asada), and on drums is Joe Berardi (Deadbeats, Double Naught Spy Car, Abby Travis) and John Montgomery (Virginia City Revival, Breakestra). 
We ask for your help to get this project completed. Funding will cover completion of the recording, and pressing of CDs with nice packaging, lyric sheet insert, and fold out panels featuring photos and artwork. We believe the packaging should be like the LPs of the past, with a wealth of material to read and look at while listening to the album.

We plan to outfit a Truck or Jeep and bring ourselves to promotional events raising awareness and support for current and former Canadian Forces members, we plan to interview record and hear from current and former serving personnel, through their stories and experiences we are hoping raise awareness and educate people on what it means to serve and what life can be like after deployment. we will not raise funds as per kickstarter rules however we will operate as a not for profit or non-profit so after operational costs to keep going and keep helping those who don't know how to help themselves, we will donate all additional funds to current existing military support organizations. Our goal after meeting the brave men and women of our Canadian Forces is to produce a magazine with photos stories and use all filler pages to promote support programs, when on location at a promotional event we will hand out reading material business cards and copys of our magazine not only raising further awareness but also providing information some serving personnel just dont know where to otherwise look for, And in this respect I can speak personally. We would also aim at taking some of the men and women we meet during our interviews and get them to personally tell their story in schools events we host and any other opportunities we can be a part of our create ourselves
