Imagine a More Efficient Air Travel System - SkiptheLayover.com
For the better part of 2019 I've been working diligently with my team on a new system  for eliminating layovers.  I am very excited about the potential benefits of what we have been working on.  I even took the important step of patenting the system and method that would enable those layovers to be eliminated.
We built the company that can move this idea to full implementation, and we can coordinate all of the players needed to make the system work.  We also have a powerful database which can sort through the millions of itineraries with layovers to find the matches which will allow some of those layovers to be eliminated.
How many layovers will be eliminated with this system?  It is hard to know the exact amount. It could be hundreds per a day or even thousands per day.  But no matter how many it is, there is no doubt that it will be something useful and appreciated for the travelers that are able to take advantage it.
-Rudy Crichlow

Our world is moving at an astonishing speed. In the past two centuries, humanity has countered almost every deadly infectious disease, engineered a vast food supply chain and thwarted almost every attempt by nature to curtail our skyrocketing population. Yet, despite all the good we’ve done to improve man’s life on Earth, the damage we’ve done to the planet is becoming more and more apparent everyday.
Today, humanity’s demand for resources vastly exceeds nature’s ability to supply them. Food, water, climate and extinction emergencies are unfolding before our eyes. 8 Billion Angels dares to tell the truth about the conflict between our population and the sustainability of our planet. It dispels the myth that technology can save us, that reducing consumption is possible and that the problem lies solely in the developing world.
8 Billion Angels addresses overpopulation honestly and compassionately. By clearly depicting the problem and empowering the audience to take actions that can start to heal the planet, we can give humanity the best chance of living in a more just, peaceful and sustainable world.
Poster Design by Chris Davidson
Overpopulation is always in the news but is never named. It impacts all of us, from the loss of green space to urban sprawl, from gridlocked traffic to beaches strewn with plastic or closed due to water pollution. 
Overpopulation is the single fundamental upstream cause of every environmental crisis and many social injustices. By addressing overpopulation responsibly, compassionately, and humanely, we hope to inspire others, including members of the environmental community, press and government, to address the affect of family size, women's education and healthcare and family planning on the health of our planet. If we are successful in that paradigm shift, we can reverse the damage we have done to our natural world more effectively than all other "green" solutions combined.
Terry Spahr - Executive Producer
Terry Spahr was a successful businessman in Ardmore, PA with three kids, two dogs, a cat and 10,000 bees. But one day, his concern for the environment and the world his children might inhabit became too much to bear. Spahr left the real estate industry to become an ecologist, activist and documentary filmmaker. Nearly three years later, Spahr is accomplishing his goal of refocusing our conversation about the environment to include ecological overshoot and our population crises .
Victor Velle - Director
Victor Velle is the director of several documentaries, including Nomad, an award-winning feature-length documentary and Four, a documentary short about an orphanage in Zambia. After studying Visual Media Arts at Emerson College, Victor co-founded CQ Studios and has worked on popular television shows including Bones and at Hollywood production companies including Silver Pictures.
Katya Alexander - Producer
Katya Alexander got her first taste of the film industry at an early age, actively working on sets (The Great Gilly Hopkins and A Rising Tide) while studying film at Emerson College. While in college, she produced a large variety of films, one of which, was accepted into seven film festivals. Alexander co-founded CQ Studios, a Los Angeles-based production company. Her work includes a documentary filmed in Zambia, Africa with The African Education Program and a documentary entitled Nomad, which takes place on a boat, and was filmed 60 miles out in the ocean. Nomad has been accepted into The New York Short Film and Screenplay Competition and The Amsterdam Lift-Off Festival.  
Doug Emerson - Producer
Doug Emerson is the founder of Los Angeles-based c49 production company. Through his company, Emerson has cultivated many clients from the tech start-up community, including Tekuma, Humon, and TruEnergy, as well from more established organizations such as the Massachusetts Institute for Technology. For this work, c49 has received 5 Telly Awards, which showcase the best work created by the world’s most respected advertising agencies, television stations, production companies and publishers.
Jake Mitchell - Director of Photography
A recipient of the Congressional Black Caucus’s Visual Arts scholarship in 2015, Jake Mitchell is currently pursuing a Bachelor of Fine Arts in Visual Media Studies at Emerson College in Boston, Massachusetts. He has studied extensively under his mentor, Producer Ryan Hartsock, including working on his film, Everyday Yeti, which screened at Cannes and won the 2015 Nashville 48-Hour Film Project. Most recently, Mitchell won the 2016 “Outstanding Cinematic Achievement” award for his film, Zoo at Emerson’s Evvy Awards.
Darianna Cardilli - Editor
Darianna Cardilli has over two decades experience as a documentary editor. Her credits include several TV series and specials, which have aired on A&E, AMC, the Biography Channel, the History Channel and Bravo, as well as numerous independent documentaries. She has edited for World of Wonder’s Fenton Bailey & Randy Barbato, Oscar-nominated producer Stuart Sender, and Academy Award-winner Morgan Neville. She is a graduate of the American Film Institute, where she received an MFA in Editing. She is also a Contributing Editor for Documentary, the magazine of the International Documentary Association. When not editing or writing, Darianna enjoys organic gardening and plein-air painting.
8 Billion Angels makes the issue of overpopulation understandable and relatable. By bringing a narrative style to this genre of documentary, we intend to expand the audience for its message well-beyond the typical environmental movie devotee. 8 Billion Angels connects with the audience by focusing on human emotions instead of solely on scientific facts. We convey beauty and hope through images, even when covering a serious subject. The film tells the stories of individuals around the world, painting a tableau of the larger issue of overpopulation. We follow our mosaic of characters as they tell us, on a personal level, about the impact of overpopulation on their lives. By showing our characters as they go about their day-to-day routines, the same ones we all perform, the audience feels a shared connection. Ultimately, 8 Billion Angels shows that the larger issue of overpopulation is really a diverse collection of many individual experiences.  
8 Billion Angels was created to inspire international dialogue and provoke action about population's role in our global humanitarian and environmental crises. 
To do this, it outlines 4 key action steps: supporting organizations that improve women's access to family planning and education; adopting measures to reduce our global carbon emissions, promoting a small family ethic among all people; and advocating for governmental policies that slow and reverse population growth. 
By partnering with non-governmental organizations (NGOs) with a track record of advocating for these initiatives and addressing them directly "on the ground" the film will inspire programming that will help students, community activists, business leaders, and government representatives learn about ecological overshoot and direct them to a path leading to a more sustainable, peaceful and prosperous future.
We have covered our production costs and have completed the filming. We are now in post-production and in our last phase of funding to finish the film and make sure it is seen. 
We've established a variety of tiers for fundraising for post-production. We don't want to put all of our eggs in one basket (it would be overpopulated anyways!). We need to complete a first edit of the film regardless, beyond that, we've created separate tiers of fundraising as stretch goals to supplement any additional fundraising we'll need to do. Once we know we can edit the film, we'll hone in on other professional services and distribution. However, that can't be done if we don't hit our initial goal.
Our Post-Production Budget:
At 34,000, we'll be able to professionally cut together the months of footage we have, and have something to show for it.
At 61,600, we'll be able to fully mix and master all of our sound and our original score. Sound is incredible important for the experience of watching a film, and we can't have a finished product without it.
at 84,200, we'll be able to finalize our visual effects and color grading to make 8 Billion Angels look and feel like every other cinematic environmental documentary. It will fit in along the most venerable films in this topic.
at 154,700, we'll use these final funds to make sure this film is shown, anywhere and everywhere, to anyone, to everyone. This film needs to travel to film festivals so dedicated film-going audiences know the stakes. Beyond that, we'll need to negogiate distribution with streaming services and other exhibition formats. At this level, we're confidant people will see this film no matter where they are.
To show our appreciation for your contribution, and our dedication to environmentally conscious production, we have curated a selection of sustainable rewards in gratitude for helping us finish this film.
You can check out all of our rewards in the column to the right, but here are a few images for you to consider.
Official Plantable Postcard
Limited Edition 100% Recycled 8BA Shopper Tote
Official "8" 8 Billion Angels Logo T-Shirt

FedCon Events-Fotoband „Stars im Fokus“
Seit 1992 organisiert die Augsburger FedCon GmbH populäre Conventions wie die MagicCon (www.magiccon.de) für Fantasy-Fans oder die FedCon (www.fedcon.de), die jedes Jahr Tausende von Science-Fiction-Begeisterten ins Maritim Hotel nach Bonn lockt.
Im Jahr 2020 wäre die FedCon bereits in die 29ste Runde gegangen, doch die Corona-Pandemie war schließlich der Grund dafür, die Convention nun vom 21.05. – 23.05.2021 zu präsentieren. Nachdem auch die MagicCon verschoben werden musste (jetzt 15.10. – 17.10.2021), steht die FedCon GmbH als Eventveranstalter vor einer gigantischen finanziellen Herausforderung.
Doch im Zeichen der Krise entstanden in den letzten Wochen eine Reihe schöner Ideen, wie diese schwere Zeit besser überstanden werden kann.  Viele Anregungen kamen dabei auch durch unsere Conbesucher, die immer wieder ihre aktive Unterstützung anbieten. Für diesen überwältigenden Zuspruch unserer Community sind wir sehr dankbar.
Wir freuen uns daher, mit dem FedCon Events-Fotoband „Stars im Fokus“ ein weiteres ambitioniertes Kickstarter-Projekt ankündigen zu können. Auf insgesamt über 200 Seiten präsentieren unsere professionellen Event-Fotografen Rafael Cantero, Daniel Dornhöfer und sichtlichmensch beeindruckende Starporträts vieler Gäste von FedCon und MagicCon. Das Hardcover-Buch wird im „Coffee Table Book“-Format (ca. 30 x 30 cm) produziert werden und stellt neben den Porträts auch die drei Künstler vor.
Einen ersten Eindruck zum FedCon Events-Fotoband „Stars im Fokus“ vermittelt der Videoclip, der erneut von unserer Nessi in Szene gesetzt wurde. Natürlich gibt es wieder mehrere Optionen, dieses Kickstarter-Projekt zu unterstützen. Eine Möglichkeit ist, sich namentlich als Förderer im Buch verewigen zu lassen. Oder wie wäre es z. B. mit dem „VIP-Paket“, bei dem man am Vorabend der MagicCon oder FedCon 2021 (jeweils Donnerstagabend) an einem Galadinner im  Maritim Hotel teilnehmen kann in Anwesenheit von einigen Stars.
Um auch unser zweites Projekt, den FedCon Events-Fotoband „Stars im Fokus“, Wirklichkeit werden zu lassen, zählen wir jetzt auf deine Unterstützung dieser Kickstarter-Aktion.
Vier Wochen lang hast du nun die Möglichkeit, die Finanzierung dieser aufwendigen Buchproduktion mit zu sichern und gleichzeitig einen wertvollen Beitrag dafür zu leisten, dass dir die FedCon GmbH auch in Zukunft Fan-Events wie MagicCon oder FedCon präsentieren kann.
Dafür im Voraus ein dickes DANKESCHÖN von deinem Team der FedCon GmbH

"Museum grade deep space artworks that are beautifully vibrant and glow in the mf dark!
Update - new stretch goal unlocked
WOW, Huge thanks to everyone for the incredible support so far we've unlocked another stretch goal!!!!!! More information further down the page! 
Hey You! (yes... you) 
Isn't space just incredibly beautiful?
I'm Cat, and three years ago I quit my day job and taught myself how to paint so I could share the universe in the most beautiful way possible... 
...by making galaxies that GLOW in the dark. :)
When we tried to make these prints, we uncovered a huge issue...
Every printing company we approached said the special type of fine-art printing we wanted to do was *impossible* to print with glow. 
So we did what we do best... We invented our own printing technology to make it happen!
After years of development I'm so excited to announce our Latest Groundbreaking Development...
"Ultra-glow print technology" Now twice as bright as our earlier prints - you can enjoy artwork printed to fine-art standards in the day... and experience the them glowing at night for up to 8+ hours.
Our new process allows us to use up to FIVE glow layers! It outshines anything we've ever created before. Not only that but its far quicker too meaning deliveries will happen even sooner.
DON'T WORRY - you don't need to pick right now - selections are made at the end
Update - New Stretch goal added, Cosmic Embrace. 
For the Canvas and Paper prints, you can choose from any of the 10+ designs to have printed in stunning glow in the dark. 
For the Mural Prints there is only one beautiful design - the milky way galaxy.
You get to choose exactly which designs the paper and canvas prints are.  The Selections are made once the campaign ends via a survey you'll receive.
 Designs - You can pick from 10+ designs for the canvas and paper prints, for the murals there is only one design.
 Charging - The glow can be charged by any source of light, UV and daylight is best, but normal bulbs also work too, LED is less effective than other types.
 Glow Time - Once they are charged they can glow up to 8 hours, The first hour is brightest and it slowly dims over the night. 
 Glow Colour - The glow on the canvas and paper prints is a light green yellow (this is the brightest and lasts the longest), the murals are printed with multiple colours of glow including blues, turquoise, and green/yellow. 
 Longevity - The glow pigment is expected to continue working for over two decades. In an archival setting the colour pigments should last for 80-100 years. The more UV exposure the fewer years it will glow for and the sooner the colour will fade.
 Framing - The paper prints can be framed behind a glass frame. The canvas prints should be stretched around a wooden frame using a gallery wrap. The murals don't need framing, you just stick them up on the ceiling
 Applying Murals - It's literally peel off the backing and stick it up. Its ridiculously simple. They are specially designed to never get air bubbles with no special tools required. The surface you're applying it to must be smooth and Teflon free.
 Moving Murals - They can be peeled off and re-stuck multiple times - I tested re-positioning after 6 months and it worked fine - if you need to move them, just remember to peel slowly, and save the backing paper so the glue dots don't get dirty when you're moving.
 Shipping - Everything is delivered rolled in a tube to keep them safe in transport. Nice and Easy :D 
 Large Paper prints are (500mm x 707 mm | 19.7" x 27.8")
The Extra Large Canvas Prints are  (1210mm x 855 mm | 47.6" x 33.6")
The Extra Extra Large Murals are  (7.8ft long x 25.5in wide | 2.4m long x 65cm Wide)
 ✔   Incredible Glow - Ultra Glow Technology, our brightest glow-in-the-dark prints yet. 
Why is this important?-  Normal Glow inks are very dim, so other glow in the dark pictures don't glow brightly. Our method allows us to layer the pigments over and over so they glow far brighter.
✔   Museum Quality - Printed on archival FSC certified opalescent paper milled in Italy.
Why is this important? -  Fading prints are a collectors worst nightmare. Almost all cheap papers and canvases contain Acid &  Brightening Agents and these make your precious artwork fade. We've ensured that all of our stock is archival this means your investments last a lifetime, they don't contain these harsh chemicals and we also source our paper from a responsibly managed forest.
✔   Rare Collectables - Authenticity Certificate, Limited edition embossed & numbered.
Why is this important? -  Scarcity is really important when it comes to the value of collecting artwork. Every print is verified as authentic with special marks, and you can see how many prints are ever produced. 
Whilst I could make loads of money selling the same designs for years and years, ensuring you have a solid investment is more important to me. Therefore designs are only ever sold for one calendar year and after that, they are never available again as limited edition prints.
Lets impact the lives of those outside of our project
Every year we put any surplus funds into a bigger art project to benefit the lives of people outside of Kickstarter.
This time, we're building a galaxy chandelier of the milky way, 3D printed in crystal clear resin and suspended from thousands of fibre optic threads. 
Oh and it'll be 26ft / 8m in diameter
Built using data from the European Space Agencies GAIA Mission, I've already been fortunate to have several meetings with data scientist and people who worked on the mission as well as 3D printing companies and our development is underway. 
It will be the largest physical model of our galaxy and it'll give everyone who sees it, the unique opportunity to connect with our beautiful home - the Milky way. 
I calculated it'll cost around 250k to build, so I'll be funding it's production over several projects. So it's not going to be a deliverable for this project but I'm going to be taking you all on the adventure with me :) 
The best part - Once built, we'll be giving it away... for free... to Museum or Art Gallery.

The idea behind Utilo began while Brian was working alongside his former partner in his previous startup in March of 2017. They were working on a project that connected liquor retailers to their consumers based on geolocation targeting. 
As they ran into more issues and problems, they continuously messaged friends who they knew that had startups or knew about subjects they didn't. Brian quickly realized a huge problem they were facing, although they were actively networking with the contacts and popular social and professional platforms they had, they simply did not have enough access to contacts or personalized information at scale.  
So, Brian's partner in his first startup reached out to one of his friend's who worked in a WeWork office space in NYC. He asked if the friend could post their question in the WeWork app platform to see if we could get any help with the problem we were struggling with at the time. For those who don't know, WeWork offers a platform that connects those in their given office space so that they have the ability to reach out to one another. Within about 5-10 minutes, we had received 4 messages from people who were willing to help. It was shocking but intriguing at the same time. Brian then began to think about why services such as these are so limited, selective, and pricey. This is where the idea for Utilo started.  
After thinking more and more about how this model could be implemented at scale without discriminating against a massive population based on limited accessibility options and price, the complete idea finally came. From this point on, Brian then began working on Utilo full-time in order to completely develop the model. Utilo eventually became what it is today, which is a professional networking platform that allows users to share knowledge, ideas, expertise, and network with users from locations of the individual's choosing.  
Oh, and just to clarify, 'Utilo' translates to 'Useful'.  
We are now ready to begin raising funds to start the project. We believe that Utilo has the ability to disrupt two massive markets, professional networking and knowledge sharing, and create an uncontested market space due to our unique features as well as our mission of providing users with the highest amount of value and opportunity needed to scale their businesses and careers. But, we need your help to get started. We are raising the $6,000 to develop the web app as well as launch a successful beta that you have the unique opportunity to be a part of!  
Insight into Utilo and it's abilities:  
Free Subscription Abilities:  
1.) Ability to interact with two different locational settings (university as long as you are at or near a university) and regional, as well as a main delocalized feed, called 'Utilo Hub', that all Utilo members can access  
2.) Ability to connect with and follow other users  
3.) Ability to direct message other users on the platform that you follow, as long as they follow you back  
4.) Ability to access a 'Discover' feature that suggests possible connections nearby based on the locational setting you've selected, as well as details for events near you  
5.) Ability to upvote and downvote posts  
6.) Ability to achieve a 'Top Contributor' tag that reflects a high engagement rate and high amount of upvotes on each of your posts or responses  
7.) And MUCH more!  
Premium Subscription Abilities:  
1.) All free access abilities  
2.) Ability to select the location of your choosing, regardless of where your their current location actually is. This allows you to have full access to any location, ex: Select 'Greater New York City area' as your current location even if your actual current location is in the 'Greater Chicago area'  
3.) Enhanced search abilities (more search filters, more shown profiles, etc.)
4.) Ability to direct message individuals who do not follow you back in a separate messaging feature  
5.) Ability to see who has viewed your profile  
6.) And MUCH more!
Stretch Goals for the project:  
$10,000 - Hire a UI designer to help perfect the platform 
$15,000  - Fully implement all Utilo features into the platform
$25,000 - iOS and Android platform development
$50,000 - Host the first Utilo networking event in the city of YOUR choice!

The Wonderings art book has been completely designed and is ready to send through to the printers as soon as it has been funded.
To ensure the highest quality we will be trusting our previous printers who looked after The Guidebook and 2014 sketchbook.
The book will be offset printed (hell yes!) and will feature a 300gsm Soft cover with matt laminate and a stunning spot gloss feature finish.
The book will be 'perfect bound', which is a combination of stitching and glue, this will give the spine better stability and the book better strength. Basically, we tried it once on the 2014 sketchbook and just never looked back! This binding style is the best for soft covers.
For those of you who know the original Guidebook from Nightmare's and Vision's, this book will be the same size 18.5 cm x 26 cm (this is just a bit smaller than A4.) 

Wonderings will be my biggest sketchbook EVER! I had so many sketches we actually had to choose the best pages for this book.



**** Details about how to secure a commission slot will be forthcoming, thank you for your patience****


PRINTING AND SHIPPING TIMELINE:
• Printing will begin  March 2019
• Shipping of rewards will happen in APRIL, with the possibility of it extending into MAY depending on how many backers we have to process.

SHIPPING INFO:
• Please note we will be shipping all books via Australia Post's standard service. We have used this for many years and are confident with the service, however; it does not include tracking. 
• If you would like tracking on your book, place your pledge as normal and then please contact us through kickstarter, as we can upgrade your shipping to include a tracking number at an additional cost of $5 aud. Please contact us before March 1st to ensure this service.

From all it's famous history and stories that have been told through the years, people from all around the world have had their eye on 'Main Street of America.' I am no exception. After almost four years, this July 2019, I'm finally able and going to travel the entire length of Route 66. So, besides traveling the route, what would be the next best thing for you? How about putting together a picture book of my journey to share with you and anyone else who wishes to come along? 
   This Kick Starter campaign is just for that, a chronicle of my adventure: 'The Mother Road.' It will feature a collection of my own, unique, captioned images and story articles I've gathered from my trip. Each book will be $30 to produce.
   Hello, my name is Michael Gault. I’m a photographer, adventurer, and Youtuber who likes to just go and travel to places on a mere whim. This road trip will start from Chicago, Illinois, and end at Santa Monica Pier, California. I will travel Route 66 as much as possible... this means a bit of off-roading, hiking to great scenic spots and camping beneath the stars in most areas. I have researched, for years, for my time with this iconic road and it is time to experience it! That said, my approach to this trip is about the experience and not about time. I've planned and budgeted for a three-week trip but don't be surprised if I stay out even longer. When I get this kind of itch, I scratch to fulfillment... 
   In addition to taking along my digital and film cameras, I'm also bringing along my drone and my vlogging equipment. There will be frequent uploads to my YouTube channel detailing my progress for you to support and follow :)
   Why support me when it's been done so many times? Because Route 66 is rapidly changing, no person's trip is the same as another. Travelers of the route approach it with their own perspectives and express their own takeaways from it. All have their own unique approach, style, and level of photography. Me, I'm very good at photography and often push myself through my boundaries... being comfortable with just an 'okay' photograph is just not my style. Only the best of my best can be expected to be featured in my book. 

Books will be shipped out the second week of September. Every backer's name, state, and country will be acknowledged and every book will be signed by me. This will be a limited run. I'm only going to print 150 books for this project... and each will be numbered. 
Prints of images will be available for purchase on my website after books ship.

How it started
In 2009, I quit my architecture career in the Netherlands and moved to Vietnam to study water and climate challenges in the Mekong delta. A few years later, I published my book Living with the Mekong. Vietnamese readers were enthusiastic and told me there was so much more to explore. They asked me to make a documentary about their lives, challenges and resilience.
I decided to do it and Me and Mekong was born: an interactive documentary to raise awareness and support for change by showing everyday climate and water challenges through the eyes of local people. My ultimate goal is to give hope and offer a new future to children and their families who live with water. They are the first and hardest hit by climate change. Though, during my journeys through the Mekong delta I also discovered that it is not all doom and gloom. I got impressed by the local resilience and innovation power of farmers, fisher(wo)men and young entrepreneurs. In Me and Mekong I want to show both: the hardships and local answers to climate change.
I asked Vietnamese researcher Long Hoang from Wageningen University to join hands. He is dedicated to work towards positive change for local communities in the Mekong delta. My Nextblue colleagues were enthusiastic and documentary photographer Thomas van den Berg completed our team.
We shared our film plan with Henk Ovink, Dutch Envoy for International Water Affairs. He immediately agreed that now is the right time and that he is 100% committed to support our project. He endorses our fundraising campaign. Will you join us?
Please pledge any amount you can and give local communities a voice in tackling climate change. Every contribution or share helps.
Joep Janssen
Director of Me and Mekong
Joep Janssen with a fisherman on a boat in the Mekong delta.
What is this film about?
We need your help to put a human face on climate and water challenges in one of the world's most vulnerable regions: the Mekong delta in Vietnam.
Each year, increasingly intense weather events and floods cause fatalities and damage to infrastructure. The livelihoods of poor communities are especially affected by these natural disasters. Their schools get flooded, bamboo houses are washed away, and agricultural land becomes infertile. We want to make an interactive, web documentary to show living with water in a changing delta through the eyes of these people.
Me and Mekong is a solution-driven film made with and for local people in the Mekong delta. It portrays five citizens who act now to strengthen their resilience to climate change. They take you on a virtual journey through their delta while showing you a wide range of issues, from salinisation and subsidence to flooded streets and mangrove restoration. You'll discover unique local perspectives on climate change adaptation.
Join us. Together we'll increase the pressure on politicians and companies to act now.
Together we can build a better future for Vietnam's Mekong delta!
*****
We are looking for €10,000 to cover production costs. Me and Mekong is a locally-driven film. The budget includes reservations to actively involve local partners in the script development and film shooting. Furthermore, we don’t want this to be a one-off initiative. Therefore, we will facilitate a workshop and train young people with a smartphone to make their own videos. By doing so, we will build a community of local climate and water journalists with whom we will continue working beyond completion of the documentary. 
Dutch Water Envoy Henk Ovink is one of the ambassadors for our campaign.
Meet the team
Joep Janssen - Director of Me and Mekong
Joep Janssen is an architect, researcher and publicist. He became fascinated by delta cities after having lived in Vietnam for four years. His book Living with the Mekong (2015) was published by the publishing company Blauwdruk and is about climate change and urban development in Ho Chi Minh City and the Mekong Delta. Joep founded Nextblue. 
Long Hoang Phi - Researcher & local manager 
Long Hoàng is Postdoc Researcher at Wageningen University & Research. He has been active as a researcher in the Mekong delta since 2012, and recently finished the PhD thesis The Mekong’s Future Flows (2017). Long also contributed to the Dutch-Vietnamese collaborative project to develop the strategic Mekong Delta Plan.
Thomas van den Berg - Director of Photography
Thomas van den Berg is landscape architect at the Municipality of Rotterdam. He studied at Wageningen University & Research and gained experience in China and Indonesia. During his travels through Asia in 2017 he focused on documentary photography and film, and published in Dutch newspaper NRC Handelsblad.
Heavy rain events are becoming more common in Vietnam. Photo: Living with the Mekong.
Narrative
Your journey begins in Chau Doc, which is located in the northern part of the Mekong delta, a couple of hours west from Ho Chi Minh City. You travel from there down the Mekong river and visit five different locations and people who show their daily life, including footage from their activities, in house and outside.
Map of the Mekong delta with five fictional characters.
Language
Narrations and voice-overs are used to guide the story. The documentary will be available in Vietnamese, English and Dutch. Dialogues are in Vietnamese, taking the viewer deeper into the world of the Mekong delta and its people.
Filming conditions
We go for an authentic documentary style. This means we will use natural lighting as much as possible to achieve a genuine look and feel. In addition to the main film, which will be in digital HD format, we will invite local people to submit their own home-video style footage. We will also train local people on making good quality videos with their smartphones.
Screening
The documentary will be launched in the Netherlands and Vietnam. After the launch, Me and Mekong will be freely available online. As a crowdfunder you will get access to exclusive imagery of the making off.
How can I help to make this project a success? 
Spread the word on social media! Follow us on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram. Share our campaign using #MeAndMekong.

Welcome to our Kickstarter for the documentary, "The Twotakes - Hit or Bust." We are a small crew looking to make something big! 
Story Synopsis:
The Twotakes is a documentary about four young adults who have different responsibilities but share one common passion, music. Giovanni Turra and Josh Riccio are full-time students at Savannah College of Art and Design, whereas Chase Brown and Beau Anderson work in construction and at a fencing company. During the day, these four young men are so busy with their jobs and entering adulthood, that they hardly have time for themselves let alone a band. Nevertheless, when the sun goes down and they clock out of work, Gio, Josh, Chase, and Beau put their daytime worries aside, pack their gear up into an old van and drive off to play a show. After hours of driving, they arrive at a bar that changes everything. Everyone armors up with their instruments. Gio and Beau with their guitars, Josh with his drums, and Chase with his bass. The stage-lights shine bright as fans from all over, cheer at the top of their lungs. The curtains draw back, revealing the indie rock band, The Twotakes. In this documentary, we will dive deep into the band showing intimate moments as they work hard to manage the daily grind and struggle of their nine-to-five's, sacrifice desires for a stable future, solving the conflicts within the band, and going through personal struggles. Throughout this documentary, the audience will be able to learn more about the Twotakes as regular guys, as opposed to the characters they put on for the stage. Will the band be able to overcome their individual responsibilities, while pursuing music and fulfilling their dreams? 
 Your donation feeds straight into payment for our crew and supporting us on the road!
 As thanks for your lovely donation, we are giving out multiple different goodies from enamel pins, t-shirts, signed posters, and so much more. It will be a challenge to choose which one to get and bring it home!
 Diane is from Seoul, South Korea. She is based in Atlanta and currently studying at Savannah College of Art and Design. She has participated in many school projects under many different roles for her colleagues at SCAD. The Twotakes is a documentary concept she created a year ago and has been in development ever since! Find her work at www.dianemaengdm.wixsite.com/dayoung-diane-maeng
Kenna is from Austin, Texas and is a senior at Savannah College of Art and Design. She comes from a journalistic background and grew up working at her mom's newspaper. One day she watched a documentary about child labor in Cambodia and thus, it sparked a fire in her to tell peoples stories through the cinematic lens. Her love for documentaries has only grown stronger over the years and can't wait to bring Diane's concept to life!
Lanese is from Georgia and is a recent graduate from Savannah College of Art and Design. She knew she wanted to be a filmmaker the day she received a 'Barbie Wireless Video Camera' for one Christmas back in 2002, and is currently freelancing under the title "The Love Productions." Find her work at www.theloveproductions.com
Victor Chavez is from Austell, Georgia. Being the 3rd born son of Mexican immigrants, he is no stranger to hard work. He has showcased his talents worked on many productions inside and out of his college campus (Savannah College of Art and Design). He always strives to capture excellent audio for every project he is on.  
 Deepthi comes from Muscat, Oman. She has a background in 2D animation and holds a Bachelor of Fine Arts Degree in Visual Effects, along with a Minor in Motion Media Design. Find her works at www.deepthidivakaran.com 
 Yewon is from Seoul, South Korea. She is based in New York and recently graduated from Fashion Institute of Technology with a background in communication design. Yewon designed the promotional poster for our documentary! Find her work at www.yewonshin.com

KHABAY is the a great way to order a range of meals in your area anywhere from chef dishes to homemade meals.

It's also a great platform for all types of cooks who are looking for people to experience their delicious meals.

We all have busy lives. Most of us don't have the time to cook healthy, delicious meals. We can't always eat out either. For years, our only option was to order take-outs and fast foods, but that needs to change with more and more people focused on healthier diets and lifestyles as well. That's where KHABAY comes in. It's our solution to having meals upon demand literally at our fingertips. This project is based on the "shared economy" concept. If you believe in shared economy, please contribute to this project. Here's the demo website http://www.khabay.com/. It can be best viewed on your desktop for the moment.
Ordering a Dish
KHABAY is simple and easy to use. It takes only minutes to order food from anywhere. Just simply browse for available cooks. You can narrow it down to the food you want by filtering for Chinese, Italian, Hamburger, for example. The platform gives users the ability to view and compare what's cooking around their area.
Browsing dishes in your area
  View available Menu
 After enjoying your meal, there's an option to rate and comment on the dish and your food experience.
Dish description
  Hiring a Chef
You'll be able to use KHABAY to hire a chef to your place. Whether it's for a small dinner party or a large gathering or for special events such as:

• Cocktail Parties
• Holiday Gatherings
• Summer Barbecues and Picnics
• Bridal and Baby Showers

You can browse for chefs in your area:
Browsing Chefs in your area
And you can see their expertise and rates here:
Chef expertise
Leftovers

This concept allows you to give away extra food for free before it goes bad. In this way, you'll have a chance to give back to the community and make a difference. With a simple click on the app, the food will be given to others for free, so it's not wasted.
"Roughly one third of the food produced in the world for human consumption every year – approximately 1.3 billion tons – gets lost or wasted. Food losses and waste amounts to roughly $680 billion in industrialized countries and $310 billion in developing countries."
Food Safety:
This is one thing that is on the top of the list in this project and we would love to hear back your input on how to make it safer please provide your feedback as it is very much needed.
As you know nothing can be fool proof even the best of the best restaurants out there can have some issues but we would like to make it as safe as possible.

Geraldo Olivo and Robert Cortez, Tranquilo Way Productions
Tranquilo Way was founded in 2015 by producer Geraldo Olivo, director Robert Cortez and photographer Alfredo Cortez as a way to produce short films and tell stories that they weren’t seeing anywhere else. Since then, we’ve worked with talented cast and crews on films for the 48 Hour Film Race and The Zone Film Race, as well as our own entries for 100 Hour Film Race (“Missed”) and CineSpace film competition (“Signs of Life”) which you can watch at www.tranquiloway.com/films/.
Stills from "Missed" (2015)
  Stills from "Signs of Life" (2016)
 But that was all just the beginning. We’re taking our skills and vision to the next level with the help of Dave Cebrero (co-founder of the Houston Latino Film Festival) as our cinematographer and an eclectic cast from theater, comedy and modeling backgrounds, including Jonathan Gonzalez, Nicolai Mitchell, Jose Gonzalez and Kelli Ham.
The cast of Visitors Only: Jonathan Gonzalez, Nicolai Mitchell, Jose Gonzalez, Kelli Ham
Add to that a film crew of skilled artists and filmmakers, and we’ve got a potent team ready to tackle this production.
Getting lost in a parking garage isn’t as hard as you might think. Take a one of those concrete mazes late at night, add two oblivious businessmen from out of town, send in a beautiful-yet-mysterious-and-totally-bloodthirsty woman after them... now you’ve got the basic idea behind “Visitors Only.” 
“Visitors Only” is the story of Rome and Patrick as they close out a deal with a client that will make them all rich at the expense of the masses. Despite an invitation to stay and celebrate, they bid farewell for the night to catch a red-eye flight home. When their attempts to leave are thwarted at every turn, they realize they’ve been locked in after hours. That’s when our two visitors discover there are always consequences for their actions, and retribution comes in a form they'd least expect.
We envision “Visitors Only” as an oddball collision of comedy and terror (along with some moral questions about social inequality and injustice) and our goal is to make audiences laugh, maybe even squirm, and definitely take them by surprise.
The goal for our team is to see “Visitors Only” find an audience in film festivals across the country. We’re confident that our film will rival so many other great short films that get selected every year, and we want this to be our entry into the scene. 
With your backing, we’ll be able to incorporate some advanced special makeup effects and stunts, as well as cover a portion of our equipment and post-production expenses.
Just as essential, you’ll also help us with entry fees and travel expenses throughout our anticipated film festival run in 2017 in which we’ll be submitting to the likes of SXSW, Fantastic Fest, Sundance and more.
In return, we're making a number of fun rewards available to backers of all levels, from the kitschiest of souvenirs (a fridge magnet) to being our guest at a special event (a closed invitiation-only screening) to a chance to be in the film (in a limited availability walk-on role).

Our goal with this kickstarter is to raise funds for our first box. To get licensed products, handmade, and indie horror collectibles that you would enjoy. The kickstarter rewards are mostly the boxes because that is what you are wanting. There will be 4 types of boxes. Small, Large, and Collectors and Ultimate Collectors! Small will have 2-3 items per box, Large with have 5-6 items per box, and Collectors/Ultimate Collectors will have 3-5 HIGH QUALITY COLLECTORS ITEMS *More info below*. I have subscribed to other horror boxes and they are mostly filled with filler. This is one of the easiest genres to do a subscription box and there is no reason they should be messing up, the only reason I can see they do is because they want as much profit as possible so they make "exclusive in house generic items" to save money. We want quality outside of quantity. In the future we are looking into possibly including Fangoria magazine or Scream Magazine. We are also in talks with Fright Rags about inlcuding shirts once in awhile. What can you expect in these boxes? Dvd's, shirts, collectibles, handmade items and more.    
Special Note with the Collectors Edition boxes. What we will do is send out a survey after you have signed up an extensive one that asks for instance, are you into comics, are you into older horror movies, indie, b horror, what is your favorite horror movies, are you into foreign horror movies, what do you NOT want in your box, are you into handmade items, are you into supernatural *ghosts etc*, what are your favorite horror characters, are you into horror tv shows, and more. It will have questions to fill out and checklist type. Just like BoBoS does but way more extensive because we don't want to give you in the Collectors Edition anything you already have or DON'T WANT! This box will be for the Hardcore collector. We are talking Neca Figures, Autographs/Autographed merch, Mini Busts etc.
Our ultimate goal is to make you the customer coming back and happy, not quantity of customers. We are modeling our business after Big Ol Box of Stuff as giving you the customer the collectibles you want with the personal touch. Right now our boxes are only available in the U.S. and Canada but we plan to expand worldwide if we get a steady subscriber base. We hope you take this journey with us as me and my wife are huge horror fanatics from everything like black and white Nosferatu to Killer Klowns from Outer Space to Freaks of Nature. We want to provide you with the collectibles of unique horror films that other boxes don't along with the classics. Tired of generic zombie stuff and the same stuff every box? Then come join us! There will be no refunds just because you don't like the items in the box. This is a mystery subscription box.

I'm a graphic designer and artist who has been studying and practicing shamanism since 2007. As a designer I am often drawn to visual symbolism that has value and meaning, and over the past few months, through my own shamanic practice, I have been developing a series of geometric sacred designs, using power symbols that, I think, will appeal to both those with, or without, a shamanic (and/or other interests) background. 
These designs are rooted in ancient symbolism where the symbols have held strong sacred meaning throughout the ages and with which I have been inspired to create my own contemporary versions. You may choose to see these just as modern graphic designs and I would also invite you to bring your own meaning to them. 
The posters will be beautifully silkscreen printed, using a range of solid Pantone colours, including metallic inks, onto a high quality recycled paper. A local specialist printer with an excellent reputation will be responsible for the silkscreen printing and I will be close-by to monitor that each design is being met to the highest standard. Each colour version of a design is limited to a print run of 36 and will be numbered, signed and will include a blind-embossed monogram stamp for authentication. When ready, each poster, or posters, will be supplied unframed, carefully packaged, and posted using a strong heavyweight wide diameter (150mm) tube to minimise the poster roll.
All of the listed designs will be limited colour editions set below market price and once the initial programme is complete, the cost of the artwork will be adjusted accordingly. Check out the list of rewards which also includes unique offers for this Kickstarter programme. 
Please note that due to the differences with on-screen digital colour (along with screen contrast, brightness and so on) and printed colour, the colours seen on this page are a representation only of what will be the final printed colours, and should not be considered to be accurate to the final artworks (which will be more magnificent!), although the designs seen here are the digital versions of the final artworks (see also risks and challenges note below). All frames shown are for visual purposes only – posters will be supplied unframed.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Crystal
The hexagon is widely considered to be a sacred shape often associated with the geometry of the natural world and is thought to be a symbol of harmony and balance. It is seen in the construction of the bee's honeycomb hive and in the make-up of the bee's eyes. The shape can be found in crystals, snowflakes and in natural rock formations such as the Giants Causeway, in Ireland. It is seen on Saturn's north pole as a cloud formation and, back-down-to-Earth, the Benzene Ring (six carbon atoms joined to form a hexagon) is the basic component of many organic compounds.
The number six is also considered to be a sacred number (and being the number of sides to the hexagon), so I designed this series of artworks with six descending hexagons in outline to make a geometric design which I've named Crystal. In this series of artworks, a set of four posters, each printed in two colours, there will be three that each use a different metallic ink – gold, silver and indigo – plus white. A fourth version which will be close to white-on-white will create a more subtle, although visible design. The poster size will be 600 x 600mm, printed on 100% recycled Paperback Cairn board (320gsm). There will be a limited edition of 36 of each one of these colour versions, with a reward opportunity to buy a complete set.
Crystal Gold
Crystal Silver
Crystal Indigo
Crystal White
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Two Serpents
The Serpent or Snake is considered to be one of the oldest and most widespread of sacred symbols. It is often seen in mythological stories and cultural rituals, and can represent the duality of things – light and dark for example.
They can be seen as symbols of fertility, creative life force, rebirth and transformation – shedding their skin – immortality, healing – the venom being used both as poison and the cure. Two serpents are seen in the Cadusceus, the staff carried by Hermes in Greek mythology and as one serpent in the Staff of Asclepius, a Greek deity associated with healing and medicine. The Hopi people of North America perform a snake dance as a rain ceremony to help in the fertility of their lands. In fact, there are so many places and occasions that serpents appear culturally around the world that it would take a few more pages to list them all here.
So, to the artworks; two serpents entwined representing the duality of the masculine and the feminine. They are connected at their tails and tongues by the Lemniscate (the sacred infinity symbol) making them 'one' – woven as a continual form that is never-ending – infinite. For some, they may see these as the world serpents Python and Typhon and, as with the other artworks, you are also invited to bring your own sacred interpretation to them.
The poster size will be 360 x 600mm, printed on 100% recycled Paperback Cairn board (320gsm). This series of four posters will be printed using three-colours (a metallic ink, plus black, plus white) for which there will be a limited edition of 36 of each. And there is a reward opportunity to buy a complete set. In addition I've included a 'special' version using the three sacred colours silver, black and red, which will also be limited to an edition of 36.
Two Serpents Gold
Two Serpents Silver
Two Serpents Turquoise
Two Serpents Green
Two Serpents Special Edition
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Six Hexagons: The Seasons Series
Using the hexagon form and rationale that can be seen and read in the Crystal design (see above), this series of artworks with six descending hexagons are printed as solid parts in a series of four posters; each one using five Pantone special colours representing a season – Winter, Spring, Summer and Autumn. The poster size will be 600 x 600mm and printed on 100% recycled Paperback Cairn board (320gsm). There will be a limited edition of 36 of each one of these colour versions, with a reward opportunity to buy a complete set.
Six Hexagons: Winter
Six Hexagons: Spring

Six Hexagons: Autumn

Cheat Day Land is a pop-up museum under construction in Los Angeles. The creators want to add a free exhibit dedicated to the subject of body positivity while addressing body dysmorphia in the food and fitness industry. Just weeks into creating an active online presence for the museum to be, thousands of people flocked to our Instagram to share their concerns about the name of our creation, Cheat Day Land. They expressed that the word “cheat” is connected with diet culture creating a trigger that can be dangerous for people with eating disorders.
The eating disorder community did make one big request, to change the name of our museum, however, for Rubi and our family (The co-founders) altering the name of our pop-up museum point would change the message altogether, and the honesty of our perspective and experience coming through our art would be lost, but we are listening.
Body dysmorphia, is a real problem within the food and fitness industry; the industry that inspired the creation of Cheat Day Land. We would like to create a free exhibit in the museum dedicated to the discussion of body positivity as it relates to body dysmorphia addressing the subjects of eating disorders, muscle dysmorphia, and the negative stigmas attached to the foods we eat and love that have existed for so long in our society. The money will be used to pay architects and engineers to help us redesign the layout of the museum, so we can offer this exhibit for free, while meeting building and safety regulations. Building materials. Funding to collaborate with experts in the fields of body positivity and body dysmorphia, for both the design of the exhibit and to hold talks to educate the public about these issues. And of course MORE ART! We want to reach out to artists with experience and passion for this very subject matter.
This part of the exhibit would address the habits that lead to body dysmorphia, and discuss how the “cheat meal” may not be a healthy choice for people who are struggling with eating disorders. It will discuss body positivity, self acceptance, and body autonomy. We want to make this a free part of the museum that is open to everyone, even if they choose not to purchase a ticket to the rest of Cheat Day Land. This exhibit is meant to educate the public about body positivity and body disorders and provide education on healthy ways to attain your personal optimal health.

PLAY

Hi! 
My name is Mateo, I was born in Uruguay and moved to Spain when I was 5 years old. Music has always been in my life ever since I remember and decided I wanted to study and pursue music at the age of 6. I started by playing saxophone, and then moved on to piano and guitar, having taught myself how to play those last two. 
When I was awarded a full scholarship to go to London for a year to study music songwriting and production, I was so excited that I started to write plenty of songs. Some of those were pretty bad, but some others were actually quite good, and to be honest, I used to dedicate them to my to-be girlfriends. 
I've been writing music ever since, mostly for the US Market, having reached two #1 radio singles here in Spain, and millions of streams worldwide. 
Now, I've put together a team of 3 songwriters and 2 producers to be able to develop this platform, where you will be able to "buy" a song and dedicate it to someone you love. 
We will write and produce 40-60 professional and modern instrumentals, and those will be completed with what you enter in the quick form. When you purchase a song, you'll get a professional recording from one of our singers, and also the instrumental in case you want to sing it yourself, but you will never get the rights to either publish or sell the song. So it is not a songwriting service for artists, but for normal people who want to give something personal, special, and really original. 
We really believe in this project and think that with the right promotion and hard work it can grow exponentially in a matter of months. 
We're already working on the website with a professional company, fully functional in April 2020. The beta version of the website can be visited here: www.wish4asong.com 

Everything is going to move so quickly from now on, therefore, we need your help and support to make sure we have the resources needed to run everything smoothly and correctly, and to provide the idea with organic growth across the world.

Thank you so much for taking the time to read all of this, and we'll see each other along the journey!

Kelly’s story exemplifies everything that’s wrong with surrogacy. She loved being pregnant and helping others, but as a surrogate mother, #BigFertility lied to her, lied about her, used her, exploited her, and nearly ruined her financially. 
In the end, she barely escaped with her life.
Kelly went with us to New York to speak at our “Trading on the Female Body” event and at the United Nations as part of the 61st Commission on the Status of Women. She even went with us to Madrid, Spain, where she spoke to numerous media outlets, to a large crowd attending a screening of our film Breeders: A Subclass of Women?, and to members of every faction in the Spanish Parliament. 
We want for even more people to hear her story, so we are making a full documentary on her. 
We are working with an incredibly talented editor, and together we’re in the midst of cutting the film, honing the story, adding in b-roll, and all the other technical details that will make our film the very best it can be.
Then, in the Fall, we'll launch it out into the world. We need to market the film, put it up on all our usual distribution platforms, and do premiere screenings, especially in places where surrogacy-related legislation is under discussion. 
We cannot do this without you!
Take a look at the rewards or give simply because this is for a good cause. Please help us finish Kelly’s story and share it with the world. 
Thank you!

The project
This project involves the following areas:
1. Travel and tourism
2. Art and culture
3. Computer Science and Technology
4. Gastronomy and Entertainment
5. History
6. Accessibility
The idea
Our idea is to create a tourist information platform but also to 360 degrees with which you will find all the information you need to sleep, eat, move, find, buy, watch etc., without having to use other applications. In addiction, thanks to geolocation, will be a tutor in real time but also in advance will provide possible routes and locations to visit. Ideal for last minute travelers who bring the bare necessities but also for those who want to plan your trip from home ...
the slogan
Do not miss nothing of your trip ... I just have a smartphone ... paesechevai.org the journey begin.


General description
This project aims at the creation of web and mobile application that will allow travelers to consult quickly, direct and intuitive all the information about where they are or of those who will visit. The project involves the creation of an archive containing all the locations to census on Italian territory and subsequently on international territory.
The idea is to provide all possible information of the place, for example, opening hours or prices of a public house, photo galleries, museums which you can visit and how to get there, where to stay or where and how to enjoy the local specialties.
Specifically, it will be made available to the following categories of consultation:
history and demographic information
monuments
recurring events and festivals
bars and restaurants
transport services
wines and dishes
traditions and crafts
cinema and shows
offers and suggestions
Each fact sheet will be accompanied by:
1. iterative map for geolocation: providing your location, the system will automatically calculate the distances from the places
2. image gallery
3. Useful documents to download
4. information
It will also be provided for the following features to businesses, municipalities and anyone who wants to be surveyed in the portal:
1. access to a reserved area for editing of the own registration
2. editing and inclusion of its activities such as events, prices and curiosity
3. Highlighting the portal.
In addition to the part reserved for municipal and tourist facilities will provide for the registration system for ordinary users, which a virtual dashboard will have to:
1. save your favorite places
2. enter your travel-stories with photos and text
3. insert and modify their profile ***
4. comments and provide information on places
*** All the given information will not be disclosed to third parties and can only be changed by the system and of course the owner of these.
Later the following features will be provided:
creating route guidance.
Offline mode for the app version
ad-hoc developments on request
The functionality "I-aid" that will allow users to request support the portal that are nearby.


platforms
The portal will be built using the latest technologies on the web, you can be viewed on desktop PCs, tablets and smartphones.
Also it will be provided an app for IOS, ANDROID and WINDOWS.

Used technologies
1. OO PHP version greater than 5.5
2. Mysql latest version
3. Jquery latest version
4. CSS
5. Framework bootstrap
6. CMS owner for the construction of the pages and populating the database
7. Senchatouch for the app version

Brian was severely burned when he was 5 years old. He lost his father in the fire that  destroyed his house and left him in the hospital for months. Now a teenager, the burns are still visible and the memories still haunting. Brian is subject to bullies at school, and has often thought about killing himself. 
Joan, a new girl in school, befriends him. Joan is blind, and can't understand why people tease Brian. Freak is a story about friendship, overcoming obstacles in life and finding meaning with each other.
Story behind the inspiration.
I was working at a local school, helping with book week. One day, we had a wear a quote to school day. I searched the internet and found a quote from Mark Twain. It read, 'Kindness is the language  the blind can see and the deaf can hear.' 
The words inspired the idea for Freak. I had never read a  story where the two main characters were either blind or burned. I wondered what would happen to these characters, and how they would help each other. Joan, who is blind, would be less concerned about the appearance of people, and more concerned about the sole and character of the person. Brian, a young man on the verge of suicide might find hope in humanity by Joan's actions. 
I hope this story can teach lessons about bullying in school, and help other young people subjected to this kind of treatment.

Any donations made during this kickstarter will help make that dream a reality. 
Thank you so much for your interest in Lily Among Thorns. We are looking forward to completing this project with your help. 
God Bless, 
LAT

Background information about this project:
I have travelled to México, Guatemala, and El Salvador over the past three years to document the surgical treatment of children affected by birth defects, primarily cleft lip and palate, microtia, and Treacher Collins syndrome. Central American children are roughly twice as likely to be born with a birth defect than children in the United States. This high prevalence can be attributed to the low maternal socioeconomic status as well as environmental factors. Affected children are more often born into poverty; the relationship between this high rate of birth defects and poverty is positively correlated. 
I have been on four trips with medical teams that seek to amend many of the difficulties in health, comfort, and functionality that these children face. Aside from the difficulties in health these children will address through many stage of their lives, they are typically subjected to ostracism in their communities and from their peers. Often born into poverty, they are unable to break the cycle and lead more fulfilled lives. What I am trying to do with this trip is to spend time with families that are affected by both poverty and by the high rate of birth defects its effects on the emotional and social wellness of the child- to further analyze and highlight through photography the relationship between the consequences of poverty, such as poor to no prenatal healthcare and family planning, diet, lack of education, and the commonality of birth defects. 
What I'm doing with this trip:
The images I hope to capture from this trip will offer insight and perspective on international healthcare and the deeper effects of poverty in our neighboring countries - in an individualized, personal way; visual storytelling. I feel that I have thoroughly covered the medical perspective of this social epidemic, and now I would like to show daily life. I hope to gather a better understanding of the causes  of these defects (education? Prenatal care? Diet? Environment?) and how life in poverty is proven more difficult with a potentially debilitating condition. 
These are the questions burning to be addressed: 
Do these children feel they have the same opportunities as their peers of similar socioeconomic standing? Do they hope and plan for the future? Do they feel that they are treated differently? Do they feel overall content in their lives?
My questions pertaining to the relationship between poverty and the rate of congenital anomalies that I will address regard the families' social and economic standing that will be identified through photographic imagery. I am not a scientist or an epidemiologist, however, I feel that this issue can be highlighted through visual imagery and allow the stories to speak for themselves through my photography. 
Where your funding goes:
I have a place to stay, a translator, and safe transportation for my trip. All I need is the plane ticket and funding for various printing or book making following the completion of this project. Your funding will serve these children by visually sharing their stories and experiences, and will allow them the attention and international focus they deserve.

Hello! Welcome to my artbook project "Mermaid Adventure, journey Through the magical seas ". Hi! We’re Katarina and Justine, the two people behind Jelly Kat Studio. We’ve been making enamel pins since September 2019, and started selling on our website in December 2019. Since then, we’ve made more than 15 different designs in multiple versions; mostly original designs, though a couple have been of games/shows we really love.
This is our first time doing a Kickstarter, so hopefully things go well! 
So far, we’ve self funded every single pin we’ve produced, but we’ve never done a large set all at once, since that requires a much higher investment! Thus, we’re hoping running this as a Kickstarter will allow us to make this full set all at once!
Kickstarter as a crowd-funding platform is super; it’s an all-or-nothing campaign, so if we don’t get enough to make the pins, you won’t be charged at all! And if you don’t have the money right now, don’t fret! You can select your reward tier, then at the end date listed on the top of the page, if we’re successful, you’ll be charged then.
You can always increase/decrease or even cancel your pledge at any time during the campaign, risk-free. With your pledges, we’ll be able to have more of this collection made, so do pledge for how many of them you’d love to have!
This will also be the cheapest you’ll be able to obtain these pins - once they show up on our website, they will be more expensive to purchase. We've also included tracked shipping worldwide in our budget, so you won't need to worry about where you're pledging from!
Of course, don’t hesitate to ask any questions if you have them!
These pins will be approximately 1.8 inches (4.5cm), with Gold, Silver or Rose Gold Plating, which you can see in detail below. They will all be Hard Enamel, sections of glitter and with screen printing.
They will also have 2 pin backs with rubber backings and a branded back stamp.

Naturally, this being our first ever campaign, this is both terrifying and exciting. But we’d love to thank each and every one of you for supporting, sharing and even reading through our campaign!
If you want to see more of our stuff, you can check it out on our website or social media pages. We also have a Discord! You can find all the links here. We’d absolutely love to hear from you.
Having done this for almost a year now, we’re very confident with our manufacturing process. We work directly with our factories and account reps, and maintain good relationships and communication. The factory we’ll be using for the manufacturing of these pins will be one we’ve worked with on similar levels of complexity in design.

For our new album ‘Gypsy Hill: Producing’ we took a slightly different approach - by exploring carefully chosen collaborations with some of our favourite artists. The album features the not inconsiderable talents of Koby Israelite, Simo Lagnawi, Swingrowers, Hallouminati, Alejandro Toledo, The Din and last but not least, globetrotting super-group The Turbans.
Much more than the remix approach we’ve used in the past, this time around we produced each artist’s song from the ground up. The result is a mix of electronic driven tunes and more traditional ones, all tied together with our production values and ear for a good hook!
The album has already been recorded, mixed & mastered - so now we're looking to raise funds in order to cover production of the CDs and a beautiful colour vinyl with gatefold cover. The latter features behind-the scenes-photos from the recording sessions we've had with all these amazing artists. It really will be a treat and we can wait to share it with you all.
If you’re not familiar with Gypsy Hill, check out the link below for some live clips, along with a select few tracks which are featured on the campaign reward albums. You’ll also find a clip from our recent trip out to India, to give you an idea of what we’ve been up to so far this year!
