The Vision.
Our vision is to collaborate with Asian Americans across the country to share their stories and further their goals. We will do so by creating powerful written and video interviews and delivering them on an accessible platform. Our team is dedicated to creating and sharing stories that both break traditional views and inspire our community members to pursue their passions. To see our first collaboration and to view our beta platform visit: www.MottStreetMonster.com
On Site Filming Of A Story
 The Story.
Absence. Where I grew up, there was no Asian-American community. I faced my differences alone. How I looked. What I ate. Even what I believed in. It wasn't until I moved to Mott Street in New York City's Chinatown that I found a sense of belonging.
Mott Street Heart Monster Sticker In Chinatown, NYC
Community. Chinatown showed me the importance of similarity. By working together, its people overcome what makes them different. But Manhattan's Chinatown, like many others, is an insular community. Our community needs a platform to share our experiences beyond the boundaries of these isolated communities.
Fruit Stand On Mott Street
Collaboration. Working together is the essence of community. By collaborating, we further ourselves and build a community that fosters itself. Mott Street Monster is a platform for our community to work together—regardless of what we do or where we are.
Mott Street Monster '16 Sticker Pack Mockup
Transcend. Mott Street brought me community. Mott Street Monster brings us all community.
Mott Street Monster Heart Shirt

Hi there! 
I'm Victoria Van Arnam and I rock socks on the hammered dulcimer! This is my fifth album, first solo album. It was recorded in May, 2017, in St. Augustine, FL, right before I left on a five month tour. I am currently traveling the east coast (and Colorado) performing at Renaissance fairs. I recorded with several incredible musicians from the Renaissance world to showcase the hammered dulcimer and my favorite traditional Celtic tunes.
Note: There is no singing on this album. Just could not convince anyone that “diedle deedle dee deedle dooo” are deep and heartfelt lyrics. ;)
I've played the hammered dulcimer for five years, four professionally. Previously performing at Celtic festivals, Steampunk events and house concerts with the bands Jig to a Milestone and Dancing Hammers.
The hammered dulcimer has an incredible quality and ability to reach people. The instrument and sound harkens back to an earlier age. Hammered dulcimer has opened up the world to me; it gives me a reason, a passion to share and experience music with others. Sharing the instrument's culture and history all while making it accessible to the modern world is one of my life’s goals. 
What does it sound like?
20 Tunes! ~12 Tracks! A whole hour of Celtic goodness! 
This is my first solo album, it features accompaniments by local and national renaissance fair performers. When I reached out, many of you suggested I go with the a session sound for this album. (Though if you like just dulcimer, might I suggest my Christmas album?) Multiple instruments give the music a variety of textures, besides, it is always more fun to play with other people! 
 This album uses traditional instrumentation such as the Bodhran: a Celtic frame drum, the tenor banjo: a four stringed pain in the butt to keep in tune, and the Irish flute: also known as a wooden tooter. This traditional accompaniment brings the joy of an Irish Session into your very own home.
That's us, well some of us, doing what we do.
 Irish Sessions are a lovely affair where in many unsuspecting victims, I mean patrons, happen upon a bunch of musicians piled into the corner of an Irish pub. These musicians are all furiously beating their instruments, playing what sounds like same tune with periodic stops for drinking, key changes and bouts of laughter. They continue to do so for about three hours. Through this recording I hope you can hear the joy of a session you might run into at your local Irish pub on a Sunday night. 
Featuring!
This album is full of my favorite people (at least the ones I could get to St. Augustine before I left on tour). These amazing performers came together to help me showcase everything the hammered dulcimer has to offer.
Not the most flattering photo, but fairly accurate.
 Bret Blackshear has been on ¾ of my previous albums and takes a real spotlight in this one. He plays tenor banjo and guitar on most of the tracks. Without him I could not have recorded this album.
Recording and playing at the same time!
It was a dream come true working with Billy Miller from Hooligan. I visited him in St. Petersburg, FL. Billy played guitar and flute, he also recorded the four tracks he is on. 
So much focus.
Tyler Solomon rips into the bodhran. He had also recorded with me on Crawford's Pub. His grasp of the melodic nature of the drum is tremendous. 
After a long day of recording!
Robbie Zukauskas is the most technically talented musician I have ever had the pleasure of performing with. She is a force of nature on the Irish flute and penny whistle. Recording with her again was a delight. 
He gets a glamour shot.
Jerry Barry brought the bass for this album. Though he is best know for his incredible songwriting previously in Minstrels of Mayhem and currently in the New Minstrel Revue.
He had to record himself.
 Daniel O'Ryan of The Craic added his own touch to two of the tracks while we were in Colorado together. 
Mixing and recording in his natural environment.
This album is recorded and mixed by Micah Gilliam in St. Augustine, FL. He performs solo and with the groups the Young Step and the Will-o-Wacks. 
Rewards
Lots of music! My previous albums along with this new one are avalible as rewards. They all have heavy hammered dulcimer influence with a wide variety of textures. If you like jamming to Celtic folk grab the Jig to a Milestone albums: The Adventures of Dulcimer Girl and Captain Tin Whistle and Crawford's Pub. If you like soothing instrumental then grab the Dancing Hammer's albums: Tuning Point and Nostalgic Christmas. If you want my favorite of both groups, pick up my "best of" rewards package. 
The Adventures of Dulcimer Girl and Captain Tin Whistle Download: Jig to a Milestone's first album. Featuring Jason Catron and I in our debut work. Instrumental and classic celtic pub songs. Released in 2013. (Physical album not avalible).
  Crawford's Pub Album: Jig to a Milestone's second album, featuring Jason Catron and the sounds of the St. Augustine Irish Session players! Includes ballads, originals, instrumentals and a cappella. Released in 2015.
  Tuning Point Album: Dancing Hammer’s Debut Album shows off the Hammered Dulcimer through Celtic and Renaissance tunes. Released in 2016.
  Nostalgic Christmas Album: Dancing Hammer's all instrumental Christmas music! Hammered dulcimers only! Released in 2016.
Thanks for Checking it out! 
This album is currently recorded, getting mixed and mastered. I need your help to get it printed and finalized. Many of you have helped me with my previous Kickstarters, and to you I am utterly grateful. You are the people who make it possible for me to travel and perform. You gave me the confidence to produce this brand new album experience! To all of you new to my music or perhaps new to the hammered dulcimer, welcome! I hope you enjoy.

Hi, my name is Jack Mifflin. I am a wildlife photographer with a passion for less appreciated animals, seeking to bring an awareness to what otherwise can be overlooked in the eyes of many. These goats are an animal I have become very passionate about. After documenting this species, you can see that each animal has a personality. Some are more lively than others and some more willing to be photographed. In this book I will share with you the life of this beautiful and overlooked animal, I hope you can see my passion through my work and enjoy the beauty of this species. 
The story
This story all started whilst researching suitable subjects for my dissertation. I didn't really know about, and had not thought about feral goats in Britain, so was instantly fascinated by these nimble goats and the fact they could be found so close to home. I realised that I knew nothing about the species because very little have been published about them. As I dug further into my research, I was shocked by the negativity these goats are facing and how they are considered to be a pest by many people in Scotland. Furthermore, there is not an abundance of photographs of these goats, unlike the other favoured Scottish wildlife such as red squirrels, deer and eagles. The main issue facing this animal is culling. Everyone knows about the deer culling happening in Scotland. However, I had not heard about goats being culled. I decided I needed to photograph these goats, and see for myself what they were like, the problems they could cause but also see if there are benefits to this species.

From the moment I first saw this species I was captivated. I knew I had to tell their story and set about taking photographs to show the goats as a glorious, amazing species. I wanted to show them as something other than a nuisance or a target. I followed the goats up the steepest cliff faces, watched them nurse their newborn kids and their interactions with each other, as well as watching them eat the days away. As I was in Scotland over December, January and February, I was lucky enough to see many new kids, as the goats give birth during these harsh winter months. I learnt the struggle of these kids to stay alive as they faces the harsh Scottish environment and became attached to the beautiful species.
Over my time in Scotland, I met many people whom I asked about the goats. It became clear that some of these people were incredibly passionate about the goats and were desperate not to lose the species, they viewed them as a delight. However, lots of people viewed the goats as a nuisance, destroying land and getting in the way with their habits of destruction. There were also a few that I saw did not have a clear love or hate opinion, they were conflicted as to whether the joy of the goats was outweighed by their destruction and vice versa.
The British Primitive Goat is thought to have arrived in Britain when the first Neolithic farmers landed, about 5000 years ago, originating from south-eastern Europe and the Middle East. This small-bodied, long-haired, hardy goat; produced rich milk, meat, skins, hair and tallow for many Mediaeval manors and herders. This made it an invaluable resource and was often considered the ‘poor man's cow’ due to its resourcefulness and affordability. The species was crucial to the Cheddar Cheese industry until the late 18th century. However, when new Swiss and Nubian breeds were introduced, they could produce far more milk and so the British Primitive Goats became less appealing and were eventually disregarded completely.
Today, the goats are subject to constant debate over whether they should be culled. Management of the Feral Goats can alter according to the estate in which they are found. The main reason behind the culling of this species is to manage the numbers in a herd. These animals can cause significant damage to an area if they remain there for a prolonged amount of time. A single goat can eat up to 2kg of food each day and with 70% of their diet being wood- based, a small herd can strip an area in a small amount of time. If this is a Site of Special Scientific Interest (SSSI) or an area where woodland regeneration is taking place, then many organisations and individuals want the goats to be eradicated before they can damage to an important habitat.
Although culling is important to many species, it helps overgrazing of a certain habitat and reduces the possibility of starvation to a herd. I believe the British Primitive Goat needs to be managed in a specific way. With less than 1200 individuals remaining, it is important for organisations such as Scottish National Heritage (SNH) to look into different options in controlling herd populations. Another option that is currently being trialled, is birth control in the RSPB Inversnaid Reserve. This involved 50 goats (both male and female) at RSPB Inversnaid Reserves being shot with a contraceptive dart. This way of controlling numbers without death is more costly as it took a team of marksmen from Animal Welfare Solutions a week to complete, but it does mean that the goats cannot breed for 3 years after injection, and numbers will naturally fall. Another solution to culling and birth control of the goats is to be taken into an animal sanctuary. Hillside animal sanctuary (based outside Norwich) has offered to take a number of the goats instead of the alternatives. Unfortunately this has not been in effect as the commute from the highlands of Scotland to Norwich could be stressful and damaging to any goats that make the journey. These goats have an important heritage and they were once a frequent sight on British landscapes. As this is no longer the case, should we look to preserve these wild goats that do remain?
Where your pledge would go
Your pledge will cover the cost of printing and finish a high-quality photo book. It is common for the artist to fund and share the cost of the book. Unfortunately, as a student, I cannot finish this project by myself. I am asking for your help to make this dream a reality. This book is important because the goats have a story to be told, it should not go unnoticed or become forgotten.  All the funding from Kickstarter will go into printing and finishing the final book, which I am self-publishing. The cost of printing 250 copies of the book will be £2,138. The rest has been allocated to postage and fees. The trips to, from, and around Scotland, as well as the design of the book have all been funded and paid for by myself. This means that 100% of your donation will go into funding the production of the book. If my goal is reached, or even better, peaks the original target, all money not allocated for printing and postage will be donated to the Feral Goat Research Group (link below). They are the only group carrying out in-depth research of this species. 
If you like my project, and chose to support it, I am deeply appreciative and thank you in advance for helping raise awareness of this incredible species.
http://britishferalgoat.org.uk/
Breakdown In chart form.
  Giving back for my project
While shooting my project I did travel nearly 2400 miles. With energy use for printing and shipping my entire project would have produced around 2.296 tonnes of CO2e. So I have decided to offset my carbon footprint with the help of Carbon Footprint LTD. By planting a number of trees in school areas around the South West of England, my project will educate children on issues facing their local habitat and support a number of habitats across the South West.

This book has a limited print run of 250 copies. The book itself will be a 27cm x 27cm hardcover book. With 60 internal pages printed on 170gsm high quality Gloss Stock. It will tell and illustrate the story of many herds around Scotland In a beautiful way. All profits made from the sale of the book will go direct to the Feral Goat Research Organisation.

Terremoto est une maison d’édition née en 2016 à Bordeaux sous l’impulsion de trois jeunes passionnés d’art (Pierrick Falmon, Clémentine Moncla et Adrien Torgina).
La composante majeure de ce projet est l’édition de livres de tous formats (bande dessinée, roman, conte, recueil, etc.) impliquant la mise en valeur de personnalités artistiques qui se situent au croisement des arts : nous travaillons avec des illustrateurs, street artists, directeurs artistiques ou encore musiciens.
Quel est notre premier projet ? 
 Le premier projet de Terremoto est la publication du roman graphique intitulé Le Désorganisme de Daniel Johnston, réalisé par l’artiste espagnol Ricardo Cavolo. Cet ouvrage est une biographie dessinée qui retrace la vie tumultueuse du chanteur américain Daniel Johnston à travers le trait sensible et la palette ultra-colorée bien propres à Ricardo Cavolo.
Le Désorganisme de Daniel Johnston propose au néophyte de découvrir l’univers déluré du mythe américain qu’est Daniel Johnston, et à l’amateur aguerri de s’y replonger en savourant l’interprétation graphique et narrative de l’auteur.
Ce roman graphique sortira en France en novembre 2016 si vous remplissez cette campagne participative avec nous !
Couverture du Désorganisme de Daniel Johnston
Qui est Ricardo Cavolo ? 
Parmi toutes les casquettes qu’il revêt, Ricardo Cavolo apparaît comme un des artistes espagnols les plus internationaux de cette décennie.
Ses fresques murales peuvent se voir dans les plus grandes villes du monde (Montréal, Moscou, Londres, Madrid, Mexico, Barcelone, etc.) et ses illustrations ornent bon nombre de livres publiés dans le monde hispanophone et anglosaxon. Il est lui-même l’auteur de plusieurs ouvrages publiés en Espagne (Lunwerg, Edicions de Ponent) et aux Etats-Unis (Two Dollars Radio).
Seule erreur dans l’équation : Ricardo Cavolo n’a encore jamais eu l’occasion de montrer ses super-pouvoirs en France. Aidez-nous à remédier à cette tragédie !
Ricardo Cavolo devant une de ses fresques
Comment rendre ce projet réel ? 
A ce jour, le travail d’édition du Désorganisme de Daniel Johnston est déjà très avancé puisque nous avons :
- Acheté les droits du livre à la maison d’édition espagnole (Edicions de Ponent) pour être autorisés à le publier en France;
- Traduit intégralement le texte (sous la vigilance de notre correctrice Amélie Blais);
- Réalisé la couverture avec l’aide de Ricardo Cavolo;
- Préparé la maquette pour l’imprimeur (grâce à l'application de Valentin Verardo)
- Choisi le papier sur lequel sera imprimé le livre;
- Déterminé une liste des libraires susceptibles de le proposer à la vente.
Jusqu’à présent, l’intégralité de la réalisation de ce livre a été assurée par nos soins, ce qui nous a permis des économies importantes pour le lancement d’une telle activité. Avant que ce livre ne se retrouve chez vos libraires préférés, une étape s’impose que nous ne pouvons pas réaliser nous-mêmes: l’impression. C’est l’étape la plus coûteuse et nous n’avons aujourd’hui pas les fonds nécessaires pour la faire réaliser.
...Et c’est là que vous intervenez !
(La première page du livre)
  A quoi sert cette campagne de financement participatif ? 
Nous avons besoin de 10,000€ pour couvrir les frais du lancement de notre premier livre :
- 8,500€ pour imprimer le livre sur un papier de qualité et avec des méthodes mettant en valeur les illustrations de Ricardo Cavolo (budget estimé à partir de devis réalisés auprès de différents imprimeurs français)
- 1,500€ pour couvrir nos frais de communication liés au lancement du premier livre (création du site Internet, impression des cartes de visites et documents de présentation, etc.)
Cette campagne de financement participatif nous permet de concrétiser un projet éditorial passionnant qui se trouve sur le point d'exister, et vous permet de participer à l'aventure de Terremoto à la hauteur de votre choix.
A noter : 10,000€ représente pour nous un minimum à atteindre. Aidez nous à dépasser ce palier ! Plus nombreux vous serez à vous mobiliser, meilleure sera la qualité d'impression de notre premier livre et plus fous seront les projets que nous pourrons lancer en suivant.
10,000€ = lancement de l'impression du premier livre
> 10,000€ = lancement du deuxième livre (plus d’information une fois le palier dépassé)
Pourquoi participer à cette campagne de financement participatif ? 
Pour recevoir Le Désorganisme de Daniel Johnston dès son impression et/ou des tas d’autres contreparties originales.
Pour le plaisir de voir Terremoto et Ricardo Cavolo sur les étagères de vos libraires préférés, mais aussi de vos amis.
Pour soutenir le projet d’une maison d’édition (Terremoto) qui va bien au-delà de la publication d’un ouvrage : autobiographies d’artistes, contes musicaux, romans graphiques et beaucoup d’autres projets sont déjà en train de mijoter…
Petit aperçu des cadeaux que nous avons prévus pour vous
---------------FOR OUR NON-FRENCH-SPEAKER FRIENDS---------------
In 2016 the publishing house Terremoto was created in Bordeaux, France by three art lovers: Pierrick Falmon, Clémentine Moncla, and Adrian Torgina.
The major goal of this project is to publish books under various formats (graphic novels, novels, fairytales, poetry, etc.). All of our publications seek to highlight multidisciplinary artists. We are working with illustrators, street artists, art directors, and even musicians.
What is our first project? 
Terremoto's first publication will be a French translation of Spanish artist, Ricardo Cavolo’s, graphic novel entitled Le Désorganisme de Daniel Johnston. This book is a drawn biography which, in a colorful and sensitive way, tells the stormy life of legendary American singer Daniel Johnston.
Le Désorganisme de Daniel Johnston is an invitation to discover Daniel Johnston's mad and genius universe and/or to rediscover it through graphical interpretation and storytelling.
The book will launch in November of 2016 if you can help us reach our 10,000€ goal in this Kickstarter campaign!
Who is Ricardo Cavolo? 
Ricardo Cavolo is one of the most internationally recognized Spanish artists of the past ten years.
His murals can be seen in major cities all around the world including: Montréal, Moscow, London, Madrid, Mexico City, and Barcelona. He is the author of books published in Spain through Lunwerg and Editions de Ponent, and in the United States through Two Dollar Radio. His art has been used to illustrate many books written by authors in both Spanish and English.
There is one issue with Ricardo Cavolo’s career: he has never shared his super-powers in France! Help us fix this problem!
How will you make this project real? 
Currently, we are very close to finishing our project. So far we have:
- Purchased the rights for Le Désorganisme de Daniel Johnston from the Spanish publishing house Edicions de Ponent, and have been authorized to publish it in French;
- Painstakingly translated the text from Spanish to French with the help of our proofreader, Amélie Blais;
- Created a new cover design for the French edition with the help of Ricardo Cavolo;
- Prepared the model for the printer;
- Chosen the paper the book will be printed on;
- Identified the points of sales.
Until now we have been responsible for all the work in this process, and it has allowed us to save a lot of money. The last step, before you can find our book in your favorite bookshops, is the printing. This is the most expensive part of the project, and we can’t make it happen without your help!
What is this Kickstarter campaign for? 
We must raise 10,000€ to launch our first book. The cost breakdown is as follows:
- 8,500€ to print the book on high quality paper which will properly showcase Ricardo Cavolo's illustrations (price established after comparing several French professional printers);
- 1,500€ to pay for our website and promotional materials.
Important note: 10,000€ is a minimum goal! In this campaign more money means a higher quality of production. It will also help us launch the many more crazy, fantastic, and whimsical projects we have planned for the future.
10,000€ = First book printed
> 10,000€ = Second book launched (more information when first goal is reached!)
Why do you need to take part in this campaign? 
It is the easiest way to get Le Désorganisme de Daniel Johnston as soon as it is printed, and a lot of nice goodies.
It is the only way to be able see Terremoto and Ricardo Cavolo some day on French bookshops' shelves.
It is the best way to help a new publishing house lead a lot of passionating projects: artists' autobiographies, musical fairytales, more graphic novels and plenty of other things are coming !
THANK YOU!!!

Thanks for checking out my project.
In 2009, horror writer Nicholas Grabowsky released his book of short stories and novellas entitled Red, Wet, Dirt.  Filled with a variety of unique stories, Red, Wet, Dirt provided great material to adapt into the comic book medium and I immediately took an interest in The Father Keeper, a story featuring a legendary flesh eater that arrives on the shores of an ancient Minoan city, infecting its population. A young boy's father is summoned by the pompous king to watch over this creature which has become an undead garbage disposal, but the father is soon infected himself. This begins a tale of a son who must journey with his undead father to see the king as a natural disaster looms over the island.
I quickly went to work creating the comic adaptation for a graphic novel format of this great story.  With the help of artist Joseph Canave and Inker / Colorist Terence Muncy, what was once just words on a page have become a fully illustrated graphic novel.
 By supporting this project, you are helping to establish the black and white run of this book that will be offered at many Midwestern comic book conventions during 2015.  The goal is to eventually create a full-color version as we continue to spread the word about this great story.
As a special incentive for our Kickstarter backers on this project, we have created three prints from the book that you can enjoy.  These full color 8X10 prints will be a great addition to your Nicholas Grabowsky collection and will look great adorning your wall.
 If you can't get enough of zombies, then check out the incentive levels featuring my other book called, The Survivor's Zombinac.  This black and white 116 pg graphic novel is described as Mad Magazine meets The Walking Dead in the 1950's.  Find out more about the book at FIGIDPress.com.
 In exchange for your support, I've put together some great incentives for you.  The book is ready to print and my goal is to get all incentives shipped in November so you have them in time for Christmas.
Incentive Levels!

Det svenska samhällskontraktet är under förändring. Men utan någon egentlig diskussion. Vi befinner oss, inom en snar framtid, vid en punkt där vi måste välja väg, ett val där vi som samhälle måste hantera en rad målkonflikter som blivit akuta. Utvecklingen är inte ny, den började egentligen för mer än 30 år sedan men har forcerats på grund av de senaste årens okontrollerbara befolkningsökning. Vi hade, även utan migrationen 2011-2015 hamnat i denna situation förr eller senare. De senaste årens migration har bara forcerat behovet av att göra ett val för nästa generation.
Nästa generation kommer inte som vi ta emot ett bättre samhälle än de själva ärvde av sina föräldrar och farföräldrar. Väljer vi inte klokt, och under kontrollerade former, riskerar vi lämna över ett samhälle med i allt väsentligt sämre förutsättningar till våra barn och barnbarn än det vi fick.
Syftet med "Efter Sverige - En bok om samhällskontrakt" är att dels ge en bas för vad ett samhällskontrakt, eller socialt kontrakt, är. En historisk tillbakablick sedan två tusen år där det blir klart att människan är ett socialt väsen som hela tiden måste förhålla sig till en större gemenskap för sitt skydd och sin utveckling. 
Samhällskontraktet i sin svenska version ges även det ett utrymme. Vad vi upplever vi har avtalat om och var vi egentligen står idag.
Boken ger en bred bild av hur Sverige mår idag. Vad som skiljer från det kontrakt vi upplever och vad som egentligen levereras av oss till oss själva. Allt är inte siffror utan även hur vi börjat förhålla oss till varandra.

I den slutliga diskussionen presenteras fyra alternativ där ett av alternativen är att inte göra något val alls. Där finns det omfattande internationell empiri att dra erfarenheter av vilket gör att vi redan nu kan predestinera vad ett icke-val kommer leda till.
De ekonomiska medel som förhoppningsvis kommer in kommer att finansiera dels en assistent på deltid, dels att kunna köpa loss den statistik som finns på bland annat SCB. Den statistik, och de tvärvetenskapliga undersökningar som måste genomföras, finns inte idag som standardprodukter utan det kommer kräva unika samkörningar av olika databaser.

LIFE IS PAWSOME: ULTIMATE COFFEE TABLE BOOK FOR DOG LOVERS
 WHAT IS KICKSTARTER
PLAY

  Hello, My name is Pan. I’m an IT geek from 9-5 and a dog nerd at all others times. A few years ago, on weekends, I started visiting dog parks. Pretending to read a book, I would wait for dogs to approach me so that I could play with them. Since then, this was my weekly adventure.
MY HAPPINESS.
LOOKING FOR DOGS!
I used to be a part-time wedding photographer. While my photos were good, I still didn't feel fulfilled. I didn't like asking people to “smile". A smile should be natural rather than forced, especially on a wedding day. This was not my idea of true happiness, so I stopped.
These days, I’m proud to be a Pawtographer - a story teller sharing dog tales on Instagram @ThePawsome.co. My journey has begun.
"Cloud talks a lot to people and that is amusing to me." Cloud, 12-year-old Cardigan Welsh Corgi
  Since founding The Pawsome in 2016, I have photographed more than 300 dogs, and have not had to ask a single one to “smile”. Dogs always give me a big smile - a genuine smile.
"This morning I went to grab a coffee and asked Pipa to be a good girl and stay calm. She was trying to be calm but it didn't last long, she exploded and gave a Boston Terrier a great big hug!" Pipa, one-year-old Boxer
  "Bobby loves chicken neck. He's had it since we brought him home. So when I say 'Do you want a chicken neck?' He'll get very excited." Bobby, two-year-old King Charles Cavalier
  "Everyday when we come home, Betty will bring shoes in her mouth and say hello to us." Betty, five-year-old British Bulldog
Through my lenses and perspective, I can sense a dog’s true mood and personalities. The more photos I take and the more stories I hear, the more I am convinced that what I’ve captured is precious and truly worthy sharing with the world. That is what inspired me to create this coffee table book project, 'LIFE IS PAWSOME'.
  'LIFE IS PAWSOME' is a hardcover coffee table book with a collection of my best works of capturing pictures and stories belonging to more than 300 dogs I've met from parks and streets across Melbourne, Australia. I would love for my book to make you say “AWWW…. this is so CUTE” and break into a broad smile. I have curated photographs of my doggy friends and told their stories to evoke warmth and affection. I want every single page in this book to bring you instant happiness and joy.
'LIFE IS PAWSOME' will be published as a 23cm x 18cm hardcover art coffee table book featuring over 200 pages of happiness, 150+ dog stories and over 60 dog breeds.
During my weekend Pawtographer journey, to my surprise, I have encountered so many happy rescued dogs. Their new family enrich their life. And more importantly, in every single case, they give back so much love. They've given back hundredfold. I LOVE hearing rescued dog stories.
"Teddy is like a big brother to our girl. We adopted him eight weeks ago and he has been re-homed three times - this is definitely the last time! He has found his forever home as long as he doesn't eat our thongs!" Teddy, 18-month-old mix terrier.
It is a fact that most animal shelters operate relying on donations from the community. Often, the financial resources the shelters have do not even come close to the amount of need they face. So, I’d like to use this campaign to raise awareness and funds for the rescue shelters and the dogs they save.
I pledge that at least 50% profit from the sales of the book will go to donation for dog shelters.
We'll donate profit to SoiDog and Starting Over Dog Rescue group
I hope that we can all come together to support more rescued dogs to find their forever home!
  We have 100% Awwwness guarantee on every book. However, if you receive this book, read all pages and you don’t say the magic word, "AWWW... this is so CUTE", even once. Meaning, if this book doesn't serve its purpose to give you instant happiness, you will be fully refunded.
This is a risk-free project.
My dream is to get this book to all dog lovers on this planet. To enjoy this book. To make you feel happy to be a dog lover. The book will make you smile and give you instant happiness while reading any pages. To me, this is so much more than a photo book. It is a labour of my love for dogs. Most importantly, your support of this project will help increase the chances of homeless dogs to find their forever homes.
DOG LOVERS please support the project and most importantly share it with other dog lovers and the world.  
To acknowledge your generous support of this project, I will offer you, the supporter, the opportunity to include your name in the ‘thank you’ section called ‘YOU ARE PAWSOME!’ of my book.
Because “You Are Pawsome”
  Reach 60K   - Donate minimum 50% of profit
Reach 90K   - Donate minimum 60% of profit
Reach 150K - Donate minimum 70% of profit
Reach 250K - Donate minimum 80% of profit
Reach 400K - Donate minimum 90% of profit
Reach 500K - Donate 100% of profit
If this project can reach the ultimate stretch goal of 500 K. I will donate all profits from the sale of my book to animal rescue shelters. That is my Pawsome promise!
Elton, 17-week-old German Shepherd
  Wallace, one-year-old Staffie
  Douglas, 2-year-old Dachshund & Max, 2-year-old Griffon
      Click to visit The Pawsome website

Welcome,
My name is Kirk Lindo and thank you for taking the time to view my Kickstarter Campaign.
I am an Artist, Author and Self-Publisher best known for my Vampress Luxura, Vamperoica and Super Fantasy Girls Comics, Graphic Novels and Art Books. 
The goal of this Kickstarter Campaign is to publish for the first time ever the COMPLETE COLLECTION of my VAMPEROTICA MAGAZINE series.
  In the late 1990's when the original Vamperotica Comic series was at the height of it's popularity, I decided to expand the Vamperotica brand by creating a mass market Vampire Entertainment Magazine. 
  The publication featured Comics, Art, Articles and Photo Features of Vampire related entertainment and entertainers including Artists, Models, Actors and much more. 
  These 4 volumes contain all 16 of the original issues plus 2 bonus magazines that were also published at the time. 
In addition to the Regular Cover Versions I have also created an entire ALTERNATE NUDE COVER SET that features some of the very best of the original covers.
Each book is over 140 Pages for a total combined page count of over 600 pages of Sexy Vampire Entertainment.
Almost all of the Reward Levels also have the Digital PDF versions included so that you can take these books with you wherever you go. 
The interior is scanned from the original books so all of the content is represented in this collection. 
Here are the actual page counts for each volume:
Volume One- 144 pages
Volume Two- 168 pages
Volume Three- 140 pages
Volume Four- 154 pages
This Magazine series is incredibly RARE and it is nearly impossible to find a complete collection. It took me 2 years and a lot of luck to compile these books into this set of 4 volumes.
With a total of 16 issues this was the 2nd longest running Vamperotica publication aside from the original comic series.
Each book has a gorgeous Full Color Painted cover with Black & White Interiors.
Thank you for taking the time view this campaign. Please take a moment to look at the rewards listed in this campaign and make your pledge today to become a backer of KIRK LINDO'S VAMPEROTICA MAGAZINE COLLECTION V1 - V4!

Cuando vemos fotos, casi siempre recordamos lo que vivíamos en aquel momento, dónde estábamos y con quién. Para mi, esa es la belleza de una fotografía, así se convierten en algo más que solo una imagen, también son historias que contar. Con este proyecto busco compartir mi perspectiva de la fotografía de viaje y paisaje junto con algunos de los recuerdos que tengo de los veranos de 2015 y 2016. El libro contiene una selección de 30 fotografías con sus respectivas historias escritas en inglés y español.
- - -
When we look at pictures, we often remember the moments we were living at that time; where we were and who we were with. To me, that's the beauty of a photograph, then they become more than just an image, they are also stories to tell. With this project, I aim to share my perspective of travel and landscape photography along with some of the memories I have from the summers of 2015 and 2016. The book contains a selection of 30 photographs with their stories written both in English and Spanish.

Hello! This is Neo :D
Born and raised in Mexico City. I majored in Graphic Design at UAM-X, but my real passion lies in traveling and photography. I have never considered myself an office person therefore, by spring 2015, I quit my boring job and pushed myself to go out of my comfort zone, leaving everything behind. Iceland charmed me from the very first moment, so I spent the last two summers in that enigmatic Nordic country and now it feels like my second home.  Without any fancy gear, I try to reflect the essence of moments and places, putting my heart into each photograph.

HELLO! 
Thank you so much for making your way to my kickstarter campaign page and taking time to see what its all about. My name is Andrew Peña! Or if you've made your way here from my instagram : Dasdrew.
 I am a painter that has been going out as much as I can over these last two years to plein air paint anywhere and everywhere I can take my gouache. 
Painting has consistently opened many unexpected doors. I formed many friendships with different artists that also went out painting weekly. I would host paint meet ups where people would actually respond and join me for a few hours of painting. I was even lucky enough to collaborate with a fellow artist to have an art show that showcased my work from 2018. And now this!
 With your help, I will hopefully be able to make these two books a reality!
The books are called  "Ins and Outs" and "The Small Things" .
"Ins and Outs" is a 5X6 book with 56+ pages of my larger plein air paintings. This size allowed me to have each painting keep to its true size that I painted it. I also have some cinematic paintings that stretch across the book. The book lays flat so the paintings are not affected by the crease and can be enjoyed in all their glory! I named it "Ins and Outs" because it starts off with my paintings I would do inside cafes and ends with all my outdoor paintings! Keep on scrolling to see examples of the pages in this book! XD 

 "The Small Things" is 40 pages of the small studies I do either before the larger paintings, or when I have a very small amount of time to get a painting done. It is this size because... well.... that literally how big these paintings are painted! The small size lets me not worry about detail and paint the big picture. I also learned a long time ago that doing a larger amount of small studies vs one or two larger paintings allows more growth as a painter. Needless to say I adopted that lesson and with this book hope now to share that small but amazingly helpful knowledge! Plus they are so crazy adorable at this size!!
There will be many opportunities to support, by either getting the 2 books separately or as a pair, getting a (3) postcard set, and/or getting original paintings! Below, you will find  photos that better explain the options, as well as a layout of all the original paintings offered as part of the funding. 
First come first serve! 
"The Post Card Set" is a great way to support without going all in, but still getting a little something for making these books a reality.
"The Package Deal" includes both “Ins and Outs” and ”The Small Things”. These  go hand and hand because you can see my color studies and final paintings together of a lot of the same locations... 
(also.....small book is SO CUTE!) 

“The Everything Set” is the chance to get the pair of books and the post card set strictly made for this kickstarter all together!

This year has been a tough year, both in the world and personally, and I hope everyone takes care! I'm back again for a short project to raise some funds for more art supplies :D This year especially has been a financially tough year so it would be a great help to be able to replenish some art supplies. This would also be a slightly smaller project as things have been very busy lately. 
Food! 
This time, the theme is food! They always say, the way to a person's heart is through his stomach. What's more unique and fulfilling than good food? 
To give some background, I come from Singapore, which is located in Southeast Asia. It is a tiny country but comes with its own unique food culture :3
Singapore's food is very special! Taking pride in its ethnic diversity, Singapore offers a wide variety of food from many different cultures (local food consists mostly of Chinese, Indian and Malay food), so I thought it would be meaningful to paint food during these tough times, and hopefully they will open the way to your heart ;) 
I will include information with every reward about the Singaporean food you receive, written at the back of the cards, to let you guys know more about the food! This gives a little mystery and excitement to the rewards ;)) 
Back side of the otah colour ink drawing
For now I will briefly explain the 4 foods I have drawn as samples for the rewards. 
Otah: A Southeast Asian grilled fish cake made of ground fish meat mixed with tapioca starch and spices, usually wrapped in pandan leaves to grill. 
Laksa: Laksa is a spicy noodle soup that consists of thick wheat noodles or rice vermicelli with tau pok, prawn or fish, served in spicy soup based on either rich and spicy curry coconut milk or on sour asam. 
Chilli crab: A Singaporean seafood dish, usually using mud crabs and are stir-fried in a semi-thick, sweet and savoury tomato-and-chilli-based sauce. 
Satay: A Southeast Asian dish of seasoned, skewered and grilled meat, served with a sauce (usually peanut sauce!)

FLOATING ANARCHY
The halcyon days of the seventies free festivals are long gone, yet the memories of these days live strong. We will be digging into archives to find out the inside story of hippy punk band Here and Now, journeying through time and space to discover what it was like to be centrally involved in a subversive movement.
We have a wide selection of interviewees currently confirmed including:
Gavin Da Blitz (Synthesizer/Vocals 1976-1985)
Keith th' Bass (Bass Guitar 1975-Now)
Kif Kif (Drums, 1974-1978)
Rob Bougie (Drums, 1979-1981)
Dean (Guitar, 1980-1986)
Jonathan Barnett [JB] (Journalist and band roadie 1977-1985)
Grant Showbiz (Producer/band manager, 1976-1981)
We are also trying to get hold of Steffi Sharpstrings (Guitar, 1975-1980)
Expenses breakdown: 
Most of the expenses regarding this project are for travel as we are based in Bristol but will be driving to our interviewees locations which include London, Norfolk and Glastonbury to name a few! We also require money to create promotional materials such as posters and DVD's for promoting the documentary. If we raise enough money, we would like to be able to provide a small thank you to each participant of the film too, to show our gratitude for their help. 
Director, Hayley Allardyce speaks about her influences for the film: 
"Since I found out my Dad was in Here and Now, making a documentary about the band Here and Now has always been at the back of my mind due to the fact the my Dad played with them in the 70s/80s. Growing up as a child I heard many crazy stories along with photographs I found in dusty albums, the whole family thought he should either write a book or do a documentary. Now attending uni and under going research on the band, I have found out that I'm not the only one who wants to hear the stories and reminisce in the life of the band. Which brings us to this documentary that will focus on the early years in the 70’s to the mid 80’s when the band ‘split’, looking into the how the music industry has changed, where the band fit into the industry, how they operated as a band and a family, also finding out where their ideas and inspiration came from.
My team and myself are currently beginning the interview process, however we are asking for your help by funding us, so we can finish our film. Your money will help us travel to the locations of the band members and some of the loyal companions we are talking to - Keith the Bass, Kif Kif, Gavin the Blitz, Dion, Rob, Grant Showbiz and JB (Jonathan Barrnett). You will also be helping and supporting us to enter our film into film festivals and provide advertisements in the forms of posters, media advertising and merchandise."
----
We are working in a small, closely knit team so that we can maintain a consistent vision for the direction of the film: 
Director/Editor - Hayley Allardyce  
Producer - Ruth Liddell
Camera/Editor - Johnny Lennox 
Colour Grade - Nathan Kelly
Sound Designer - Owen Brown
Please note: this is a non-profit production and any extra money made that is not used towards the film will be distributed back to the band and its members.

Moment magazine is Chico State's first-ever magazine club. Our club will dive into the different stories, people, and subcultures within our community.
Moment Magazine will cover a variety of topics with stories, art, and photos from our community. We want to highlight topics that aren't discussed or recognized in mass media and highlight what makes people unique. Members will practice things such as writing, photography, layout, design, interviewing, and video production. Members will also have the creative freedom to tell their own stories as well as any other stories they feel are important or interesting.
What will the costs their funds be used for?
Most, if not all, the collected funds will be used to cover printing costs. We estimate printing costs will total around $600. Any extra funds will go towards savings account to sustain the club for future generations.
What kinds of stories will be going into the magazine?
Moment Magazine will dive into a variety of different stories, ranging from personal narratives to profiles. One of the stories is written by two of our writers, profiling two exotic dancers from the only strip club in Butte County while another writer will talk about the time he cheated on his long-distance girlfriend and the ramifications it had on his future relationships. Photographers will also cover stories on a local music venue and the process of starting a house show and hidden destination spots for recreational activities from Chico to Quincy.
When will the magazine be finished?
The magazine is expected to be ready for distribution by December 1st, 2019. Stories will both be able to be found in print as well as online.

When a group of zombie loving fans from the YouTube channel Scene Splice came together to make their own horror/drama, the Undead Silence web series was born. Do to the success of this web series phenomena fans have been begging for season 2 and to be honest we are equally excited. Zombie apocalypse stories are something we love to focus on and we plan on continuing that forward with your support. This time we are in need of new equipment, a camera, lighting equipment, and funding for zombie makeup and props. Season one was a success, but was unnecessarily difficult for not only the actors, but essentially every aspect of its creation, primarily editing as we struggled to make the web series/film appear more professional than its reality would entail. In season 2 we aim for ease, quick filming, and proper equipment to promise a more satisfying experience for our team, crew, and most importantly you, our audience. This is a project of love and passion from a very eager and very determined group of actors, writers, and amateur film makers that is there purely for the love of good story telling for the zombie fan audience. Help us bring to life the zombie resurrection of Undead Silence as we continue the story within an area of America where fallout exists and human mutilation is common. Together we can learn what happened and why a zombie apocalypse was the resting place for the small population of survivors after the bombs fell...
Currently the plot and screenplay are underway for this potential project, meaning that production would not begin until late fall to early spring of next year. The web series would continue for 6 - 10 months, immediately available to you to watch on our channel Scene Splice, and then ultimately becoming a film, just as the first film had done.

The Book was Better is a full color psychological romance graphic novel created entirely by the married artist team Alex & Kim Healey. This 1st chapter of 9 will be a printed 32 page complete story setting off the events for the full graphic novel.
Chapter 1: Synopsis
After the sudden loss of his family in an overseas plane crash, Bo retreats to the local aquarium in an attempt to distance himself from the disaster. However his worries begin to manifest, negatively distorting the way he sees the world. Seemingly by chance, he meets the bubbly Ashlyn who's very presence and odd perspective on life give the broken Bo new hope for overcoming his trauma. 
There are no villains in this story, but there is plenty of evil. There are no heroes to speak of, but plenty of people who need saving. This world is a cruel place. Each day we tell ourselves it’ll all be okay. We bury our heads from reality to keep it from getting the best of us. We tell ourselves stories to help make this life more bearable. But sometimes those stories aren’t a fair way to view the world. Sometimes those stories aren’t any good at all. Sometimes the book was better.

The Project:
Physical copies of The Book was Better chapters are Kickstarter exclusives, helping fund the creation of the full project as it progresses. Bonus content intended for the back of the final graphic novel will also be included in these issue format individual chapter releases. Funds raised go toward printing physical copies of the comic, and shipping them directly to backers, as well as funding future work on subsequent chapter development. 
Full color independent comics take a tremendous amount of time and effort to create, and something as ambitious as a graphic novel reaching nearly 300 pages is quite an undertaking. So we've decided to release by chapter to assist in funding the project as it is being created.

The Creative Team:
Alex & Kim Healey are married comic creators from Cincinnati OH. Alex is an experienced writer, inker, and letterer, whereas Kim works exclusively as the colorist. Their previous works include R, Dawn, & infiREM from Hamster Bomb Studios. They can both be found on Alex's comedy gaming YouTube channel, HamsterBomb. Links below!

The Rewards:
Backers have the opportunity to be personally thanked in the back of The Book was Better: Chapter 1, which will also carry over to the final complete Graphic Novel. They can also secure a Kickstarter exclusive printed (and even signed) copy, or choose to read the comic digitally. 
Bonus rewards include gaining access to the entire HamsterBomb library of comics digitally, and getting physical copies of the entire printed comic library along with a HamsterBomb poster and T-shirt! You can find the following comics in both bundles.
Included specifically in the HamsterBomb Digital Comics Bundle, you'll gain access to the following bonus digital comics.
Included specifically in the HamsterBomb Comics Collector Bundle, you'll also be given a HamsterBomb themed comic poster and T-shirt. The 11x17 poster features unique splash art from the comics R and Dawn. The T-shirts are available in Medium, Large, and Extra Large sizes, featuring various characters from R and Dawn. This bundle has limited stock so don't miss out! Size chart below.

Background:
Hi guys, I’m Ben and I am a very enthusiastic photographer and have always enjoyed photography my entire life. I recently bought my Sony NEX-7 (with the 18-200mm lens), which I will be taking to Nepal to photograph the wonderful landscape, people and wildlife. I have already traveled abroad and would say that I am experienced in travelogue photography, the project photo was taken when I was in Morocco.
I am traveling to Nepal from July to August 2014. 
My trip is split into 4 sections:
Acclimatisation
The first 2 days will be in Kathmandu getting provisions for the project as well as exploring Kathmandu. This is where I'll take close-ups of the merchants and in depth photos of the busy streets of this amazing city.
Project
For 1 week, I will be working at a secondary school just outside Pokhara. I'll be building and painting classrooms.
Trekking 
For 12 days, I will be trekking part of the Annapurna circuit, the circuit includes many rural villages and breathtaking scenery shots. The trek will begin in Bhulbhule and end in Jomson, reaching a maximum altitude of 5416m at the Thorang-la Pass. I will be staying in traditional tea houses every night. These 12 days is where I will take the majority of landscape, night-time and long exposure shots.
Rest and Relaxation 
For 4 days, I will be in Chitwan National Park for an elephant and jungle safari and canoe ride as well as a walk through the dense jungle. For the last few days, I'll be in Kathmandu, going around the busy markets and buying commercial products from the local people and might also go to Durbar Square and the Monkey Temple, as well as the Garden of Dreams and the Bodnath Stupa or swayambhunath temple. These days will most likely be city and wildlife photos.
Below are some of the photos I took in Morocco:
Just another day...
Shoe maker hard at work
...and my recent hike in the Lake District (for Gold Duke of Edinburgh):
Curious lambs
Eye candy
All photos of these trips are available to view on my Flickr account (the link is in my full bio)
I hope you fund my project and love the results you will receive...
Ben

I've been thrilled to share my Sun-Blessed Trilogy with the world, and recently I decided the story needed to be expanded. I'm nearly done with a prequel called Birth of Magic.
It's a novella (a short book, about 30% the length of Facing the Sun), and it's full of characters I think you'll adore. 
While Birth of Magic takes place in the same world as the trilogy, you can read it before or after the other books.
In the Sun-Blessed Trilogy, Kari is a nearly mythical figure, honored as the First Midwife. But before she was a legend, she was a teenager fighting for her life, her self-worth, and her child. This is her story.
I'll be providing the e-book version absolutely free, and knowing people can read it for free, I haven't been sure whether I should publish paperback copies. So it's up to you! If you'd like a paperback copy of Birth of Magic on your bookshelf,  let me know your interest by backing the Kickstarter!
Thanks for supporting indie authors!

Quick JavaScript Switcher (Chrome extension) has been designed just for one thing:
Disable JavaScript in one click.
He comes very popular for that (currently used by 250 000 users!), and had many many good reviews by users (4.4 out of 5 based on 700+ rates)
Since few months, Chrome has evolved, some users asked for new features, and I had many ideas for QJS. 
But I have no time to working on, because as many of us, I need to eat.
This is why I launch this fund campaign.

So, here are my plans for the next release:
First, the one-click action remains the same
In case you had a doubt
New design (retina)
QJS current design (1.4)
QJS Next design
New options interface
Based on VueJS, the next options interface will be more user friendly to manage your rules (search, add, edit, remove).
This video is an alpha version, and not the final release.
PLAY

Custom rules!
Custom rules allows you to fine-tune your allow/block rules on every part of the url (scheme, subdomain, domain, port, path... etc...!)

Let's take an example:If we want to block javascript on every google.com domain except mail.google.com.
You can enter these two rules through the new options interface (or from the new contextual menu):
Block  *.google.com/*
Allow  mail.google.com/*
It's also working for a specific page:
Allow  https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/geddoclleiomckbhadiaipdggiiccfje
These rules follows pattern precedence, the rule with the more specific pattern takes precedence.  And that solves these issues #13 #24.
Better contextual menu
Because the most common cases are to allow/block a whole domain, a specific subdomain, or an exact url, these quick rules will be available on the context menu (right click on the QJS icon or on a page)!
And everything will be synced over your Chrome account settings
I hope you will like these new features!
-
One last word, if you like my extensions
I've just released a new extension, Bar Translate, which allows you to translate in any language without leaving the address bar (Omnibox), when typing things like 'en bonjour' to get hello (english), 'es hello' for hola (spanish), or 'zh hello' for 你好 (chinese).
It's Open Source, with a buy if you love pricing model:
Bar Translate on the Chrome webstore

Hey there! Thanks for visiting our Kickstarter page. With your help, we're hoping to get To All My Dear Friends on the road touring with a new album!
To All My Dear Friends is myself, Marc Hennessey, and Greg Stull, who plays the drums while I play the violin and guitar. In order to produce a rich and emotional sound, I loop my instruments live, creating an orchestra of tones which Greg enhances with deep rhythms. A recent newspaper review described seeing To All My Dear Friends live as "nothing short of a religious experience."
In today 's fast-paced society, our music is here to channel emotions and offer peace of mind. Connection with emotions. Clarity through connection. We play from the heart, to the heart.
Recently, we finished recording a brand-new album. Thousands of dollars have gone into recording, mixing and mastering it, but in order to go to the presses, we need your help. Our goal is to raise $3500 for the album and the merchandise necessary to take it around the country.
Even if you can only support us with a small amount, your generosity and belief in us will make this happen. Check out all the goodies that you can grab to the right on this page, and while you're at it, please pass this page on to your friends & family via email, blogs, Facebook & Twitter. Heartfelt thanks to all of you from To All My Dear Friends.

In Southeast Asia, when people are unable to care for their animals, they often leave them at the temples where they know the monks and nuns will look after them.  It turns out that there are far fewer animal shelters in Asia than in most western countries.
I began photographing the animals at the temples in 2007, concentrating mainly on the temple cats.  I have been back to Asia three times since then.

The Hmong in this area of Central Laos make a living picking wild Chinese herbs growing on the mountains in the morning and then selling them at the market in town during the day.  In the evening they return to their villages with empty baskets.

Book Cover
 My Perfect Little Secret
On the first day of sophomore year, Lillian Grace Parker organizes handouts with sticky tabs, assigns different colored highlighters to each class, and loads the whole thing into a bubblegum-pink binder. Lilly’s pencil-straight brown hair and a sea of freckles feel even more annoying to her with the few extra pounds she’s gained over summer break. But Lilly never met a problem she can’t fix. As the number on the scale goes down, Lilly keeps changing her goal to a lower weight. Everything’s going even better than planned. She’s got a BFF who’s awesome, all A’s (not to mention every extra credit available), and on the soccer field, she’s scoring goal after goal. Best of all, she’s head over heels in love with Sean, the quirky, sensitive guy who sweeps her off her feet the first week of school. Then why doesn’t she feel good? Lilly thinks if she can just lose a few more pounds all her troubles will melt away. With coffee for breakfast, her favorite foods on the NO EAT list, and her dog getting fat from the scraps she’s feeding her under the table, Lilly is losing not only pounds, but herself. When Lilly collapses on the soccer field, she’s forced to make one of the biggest decisions of her life. Will she continue to lie to everyone she loves to hide her little secret and maintain her distorted version of a perfect body or will she have the courage to fight for her life and see herself for more than the reflection in the mirror?
Praise from readers: 
 “Rebecca Glenski Coppage has written an important book about a tough, sweet, real teenage girl who will steal your heart. This is a story for anyone who is or has been a teen. And anyone who eats food. “ —David Henry Sterry, bestselling author of Chicken “This book deals with a serious health problem that is prevalent in our society. In all the right places, this book does not mince words. It describes precisely the phenomenon of an altered body image.” —C.M., age 61 (whose daughter suffered from an eating disorder) 
 “It was so good. Literally one of the best books I’ve ever read.” —M.G., age 17
“As an adult who grappled with an eating disorder as a teen, I’m struck by how in-tune Rebecca Glenski Coppage is with the mindset of high school girls who fall prey to anorexia. This book is an excellent point of departure for conversation between teenagers and their parents, as the author accurately points out that even the most astute parents can miss the warning signs of eating disorders. Coppage writes this cautionary tale from the empathetic perspective of someone who clearly understands kids today and remembers what it feels like to be in high school. And she does it with an engrossing narrative that’s hard to put down.” —K.A.S. 
Kickstarter Goal:  
Get My Perfect Little Secret into the hands of teenagers everywhere!!!  The money raised with Kickstarter will pay for the printing and marketing of my book, My Perfect Little Secret.
The initial $3,000 budget covers digital servicing to Amazon and other e-retailers, promotions and my first run of 500 copies of the book, and to cost of the rewards for my awesome supporters!  My Perfect Little Secret is a necessary addition to every teenager's bookshelf!  I want to get the word out there that the novel exists and I want it to be available to all teenagers, whether it is at the bookstore or at their local library.
My Perfect Little Secret is already been professionally edited and designed by David Henry Sterry and Kim Gledhill.   If I am able to meet my kickstarter goal and exceed my initial goal, I will use any leftover money to purchase additional books, do more promoting of the book, and expand the sales into further venues.
About the author: 
 Rebecca Glenski Coppage struggled with an eating disorder from the time she was twelve until young adulthood. Now thriving and healthy, she is a pediatric intensive care nurse practitioner, a position in which she has experienced everything from being thrown up on to taking care of the sickest kids in the Midwest. Additionally, Rebecca has provided medical services on several mission trips to the Dominican Republic, where she helped operate on patients with birth defects as well as on burn victims. As a college student, she lived in Ecuador for a summer, finessing her Spanish. Other early experiences that shaped her perspective were training at the Olympic Training Center in Lake Placid for figure skating during high school, and training as a gymnast rigorously for eleven years. She also lived in a cabin with twelve 13-year-old girls as a camp counselor, which provided further insight into the teenage psyche. Rebecca credits her husband and daughter with adding great joy to her life, and they eagerly await the arrival of the newest member of their family at the end of the year. My Perfect Little Secret is Rebecca Glenski Coppage’s debut novel.

LP (Long Play) is a 20 minute short film that explores the topic of how difficult it is for a rock band to become successful. The protagonist band consists of 3 girls (vocals , guitar and bass ) and a boy (drums ).They don´t even have money to pay the rehearsal and suddenly, when they think of disappear from the world of rock, a mysterious man who claims to be a big fan of the band appears and their destiny will change.
The story is set in the 80s, when rock n roll was the TOP and many bands struggled to succeed. Our short part of the idea : What is a band willing to do to success ? The protagonists of our short will have to answer this question when a strange fan approaches and offers them something very strange.
ABOUT US
Hello everybody! We are Gaby and Dani and are two enterprising young movie lovers. So far, we have carried out lowcost projects with all the resources at our disposal. One example is our short "In the Dark ":
Gaby , plus filmaker , is a guitarist and musician of the 'Darjeeling Pop' band. He will be responsible for composing the short soundtrack  . These are some of the great songs:
But this time we aspire to more , our goal is to present LP in the Sitges Film Festival (Spain) and other international festivals, so we need funding to hire and develop our new short film .
WHY DO YOU NEED YOUR HELP?
We, as directors, we won´t enrich with your contributions , we want to use the money to pay some actors and rent audiovisual equipment ( cameras, dolly , steady cam , cranes , microphones... ) and pay set dressing & props .
The postproduction will be our thing , because we are good lovers of video editing and sound and have studied much about it.
What do you get for your help ?
Check out the rewards on offer for people that back this project.
Addiotionally, your kind pledges are an investment in independent filmmaking, telling the different stories that the big Hollywood production houses don't feel are commercial enough, and helping artists without resources who want to translate their creativity on the big screen.
Please do feel free to get in contact if you have any questions about the project. Thanks for getting this far! :D

Production started in October 2013 and so far we have completed principle photography and initial editing.  
This project has been self funded by our dedicated team, however we need extra funding so we can finish post production and pay for some of the work that has been contributed by our outstanding talent.
LOVECRAFT
H.P. Lovecraft has been highly influential in a number of horror films over the years.  Virtually unknown during his lifetime, being published primarily in pulp magazines, he passed away in poverty.  Posthumously, however, he has been considered to be one of the most significant 20th century writers for the horror fiction genre.
STORY
 "The Terrible Old Man" was written by H.P. Lovecraft in 1920.  The story follows a set of 3 criminals who come to the town of Kingsport to rob an old man who is rumoured to have a sizeable wealth of gold coins.  What the criminals don't know, due to their unfamiliarity with the region, is that the locals stay away from the old man and his house due to some... odd practices that they have noticed about him.
The Terrible Old Man expands the 3 page story into a 20 minute short film, which will give more insight into the criminals Ricci, Silva, and Czanek.
DIRECTOR
 Ryan Smith is a lifelong fan of horror films and a long-time reader of Lovecraft fiction.  He has produced and directed a number of short films successfully and continues to build his portfolio with larger and more elaborate films with each production.  For the Terrible Old Man, Ryan created the screenplay adaptation, directed the film, edited the film, and created the visual effects and color grading.
Here is a sample of Ryan's previous work (a portion of the short "The Flashback"):
