We want to find a million words that haven't been included in major English dictionaries and give them each a home on the Internet.
At Wordnik we believe that every word of English deserves to be lookupable!
The internet is, for all practical purposes, infinite. Wordnik can and should include every English word that's ever been used.
Why?
Every word deserves a recorded place in our language's history. We want to collect, preserve, and share every word of English, and provide a place where people can find, learn, annotate, comment on, and argue about every word.
If you want to know more about a word—any word!—we want to help you find the information you need. If you're curious about a word, why should you have to wait until someone else decides that a word is worth knowing?
How?
The reason so few words are added to traditional dictionaries is because writing definitions takes a long time. A very talented editor may write seven entries in a day, or she may need weeks to describe just one word. Dictionary definitions are very difficult to write. 
Wordnik takes a different approach. Instead of writing traditional definitions, we search for casual definitions that have already been created. You see these casual definitions all the time in good writing!  Here's an excellent casual definition for the word bibliobesity from Terry Teachout, in the New York Times:
"The problem of bloated books—bibliobesity, as it were—has always been with us."
And another, for cookprint, from Consumer Reports:
"And cut down on your cookprint—the energy you use to prepare the food you eat."
And for misophonia, by The Huffington Post:
"The condition is called misophonia—literally 'hatred of sound'—and occurs when a common noise, whether it's something like a person chewing loudly, water dripping or someone 'ahem'-ing, causes you to become anxious or angry, more so than a typical response, TODAY reported."
Sometimes we call these self-defining, explanatory sentences "free-range definitions", or "FRDs" (pronounced "freds").
By finding these sentences (and we've already found a lot of them) we can help people understand new and rare words the way people normally learn new words: in context.
Why Wordnik?
Wordnik has been collecting and sharing words since 2009.
Our mission is to collect all the words of English and share them with everyone. We share words through our website at Wordnik.com, and through our API at developer.wordnik.com. Last year, we reincorporated as a non-profit, because we believe the English language belongs to everyone.
Every word at Wordnik gets its own full page, with as much data shown as possible: a standard definition (if one already exists), example sentences; synonyms, antonyms, and other related words; space for community-added tags, lists, and comments; images from Flickr and tweets from Twitter; and statistics on usage, including how many times a word has been favorited, listed, tagged, commented-upon, and, of course, whether or not it's valid in Scrabble (and how many points it scores).
Wordnik also has an open API! For web and native app developers, instead of licensing a less-complete dictionary or finding public-domain resources and adapting them, you can use our API to incorporate information from our site in search results or as full definitions.
At Wordnik, we don't want to be a gatekeeper between you and the word you're interested in; we just want to show you the data that exists and let you make up your own mind! And we want to do this for every word.
How exactly will Wordnik do this?
We'll start by taking the thousands of free-range-definition examples (FRDs, or "Freds") we've already found, and use those as a training set for a new machine-learning-based tool. 
We have lots of example sentences like this one!
Then we'll start looking for more great sentences, beginning with the hundreds of thousands of words that have already been looked up on Wordnik but for which we don't have good data. (If a real human looked something up, it is more likely to be interesting.)
We'll also update Wordnik so that any time a word is looked up that we've never seen before, we'll kick off a search to find more data about it.
We won't limit ourselves to words that are more frequent than one-in-a-billion, either. If a word exists at all, we'll show you what we can! 
A million words missing from dictionaries? How can there be that many?
In 2010, Harvard researchers published findings in the journal Science that began to quantify the number of definition-less words in English. Using the Google Books Corpus (5 million books, 361 billion words) and comparing samples to major dictionaries (including the Oxford English Dictionary [OED] and the Merriam-Webster Unabridged Dictionary [MWD]), the researchers estimated that "52% of the English lexicon—the majority of the words used in English books—consists of lexical 'dark matter' undocumented in standard references."
Jean-Baptiste Michel, Erez Lieberman Aiden, and the other authors of the Science paper defined a word as a meaningful string of letters that occurs more often than once every billion words. (1 in a billion is the frequency of the least common words in the dictionaries they analyzed.) Using this definition, they used their data to estimate that the English language contains 1,022,000 words—each of which appeared at least 362 times in their 361 billion word dataset.
The second edition of the OED has 615,100 "word forms defined and/or illustrated"; MWD has around 470,000 main entries (not including word forms).
Once you take into account words that appear less frequently than once every billion words, there may be a million or more missing words!
Do we really need all these words?
We already have all these words in English! They exist right now in articles, books, blog posts, and even tweets. But they've never all been recorded in one place where they can be discovered and loved.
Have you ever felt that the right word was out there, but you just couldn't find it? 
Have you ever learned a weird word that made your whole day? Perhaps a word like thoil, which means 'to be able to justify the expense of a purchase'? Or pandiculation, which means 'yawning and stretching (as when first waking up)'?
Many of these missing words aren't words we use every day, but their existence enriches the whole language. We believe every word should have the right to be included in the dictionary.
At Wordnik, we want to gather data about every word—and then you can use that data to decide whether a word is worth adding to your vocabulary. We'll just find the words: what happens next is up to you!
What Will Backers Get?
In addition to adding all these new words to Wordnik for everyone to enjoy, we will be releasing a report to backers in March of 2016 detailing our progress and giving an overview of the words we've found and added. Every backer will receive this (digital) report.
We have some other splendiferous rewards, too!
RANDOM BACKER: for one measly greenback, you can be a random word adopter. We'll add your name to a "random sponsor" list that will display one random sponsor's name every time someone clicks the "Random Word" link at Wordnik.com. We'll also choose one random backer to receive all the other under-$500 rewards!
WE ❤️ STICKERS BACKER: At $10, we'll send you a complete set of Wordnik stickers, plus a sticker conferring membership in the Semicolon Appreciation Society. We'll also add a "Backer" badge to your Wordnik profile page.
 ADOPT A WORD:  For $25, we'll list you as the proud adopter of your word for a year, and send you a full set of Wordnik stickers, plus special word adoption stickers and a downloadable commemorative adoption certificate. We'll tweet about your adoption to Wordnik's wordy followers (more than nineteen thousand of them!), and we'll also add an "Adopter" badge to your Wordnik profile page. Words are first-come, first-served, so back early!
YOU DESERVE A MEDAL!: Seriously. For helping Wordnik and adopting a word, backers at the $45 level will get an honest-to-goodness backer medal, plus all the Adopt a Word rewards!
Your medal will look something like this, only more Wordnik-y.
OOH, POSTER: For $75, we'll send you an 18x24 poster featuring a selection of the new words added to Wordnik! What will it look like? We don't know! But we'll be sending regular updates to backers at this level to get your input on the design! (Extra $15 shipping for international backers) [Limited reward: only 500]
NOMINATE A WORD: want to suggest a specific missing word? At the $100 level, we'll add your candidate to our research list and update it (data permitting) in the first batch. You'll also be able to record the audio pronunciation for your word! Of course, you'll also get all the $25-level adopter perks, and your Wordnik user page will show a "Nominator" badge! [Limited reward: only 1000]
WORDSMITH: For $250, not only can you suggest a specific missing word and record the audio pronunciation, we'll also include the example sentence of your choice and link to its source. (Great for writers!) And we'll make your word one of our words of the day for 2016, through the Wordnik site, our email list, and Twitter. You'll also be the adopter of record for your word for TWO years, and get the full set of $25 adopter perks. (Your Wordnik user badge will read "Wordsmith".) [Limited reward: only 45]
WORD-OF-THE-DAY TAKEOVER! At the $1000 level, you choose our words of the day for a whole week. Yep, choose any seven words you want (with the examples of your choice!), and we'll send them out to thousands of word-hungry recipients! [Limited reward: only 12]
FOREVER ADOPTION: For $5000, adopt the word of your choice ... FOREVER. We're only making ten slots available! Obviously you'll get all the other adoption perks, and your Wordnik user badge will read "Patron". [Limited reward: only 10]
NEOLOGISM FOR YOU: Looking for a word that just doesn't exist? At the $7500 level, we will create one for you to your specifications! Obviously you'll get all the other adoption perks, and your Wordnik user badge will read "Neologist". [Limited reward: only 5]
SPONSOR A LETTER: For $10,000, your name will appear on every word beginning with the letter you sponsor! Letters will be first-come, first-served. (The letter S has already been sponsored.) [Limited reward: only 25]
Your donation is tax-deductible!
Wordnik is a non-profit effort. For US backers, your donation is tax-deductible and may also qualify for matching funds from your employer if they support such a program for charitable contributions. While we file for our own non-profit status we have teamed up with a well-known 501(c)3 fiscal sponsor, Planetwork (they were also the fiscal sponsor for Hypothes.is). For any contributions you make you will receive a letter from Planetwork/Wordnik verifying that your contribution qualifies as tax-deductible.
How Will We Spend This Money?
A rough breakdown
Our biggest expenses for this project are adding the extra servers and storage to find, process, and serve data for a million (or more!) new words. Although we believe we can be more efficient than our current setup, we're basing our costs on what we spend now to run Wordnik's servers now.  
We also are hiring some amazing machine learning consultants to ensure that we're doing this The Right Way. (We expect to make their names public very shortly after launch of the campaign.)
We also will be spending a little money to make cool stuff to reward our backers, and and, of course, there are Kickstarter fees.
Wait, What Do You Mean By "Word"?
This is a very good question! Linguists, lexicographers, and grammarians often struggle with what makes something "a word". Here are some types of words that are A-OK with us and that we will include when we find them:
Nonce-words (words used just once)
Affixes (prefixes and suffixes), and words created by adding affixes to existing words
Fixed phrases and idioms
Words borrowed from other languages and not yet considered naturalized in English by other dictionaries, but used by English speakers and writers.
Here are some things we DON'T consider "words" for the purposes of this project:
obvious typos or OCR errors. Of course, then you have to figure out what's "obvious" ... we'll be looking at words that are very similar to existing words and show up in identical contexts, e.g.:
keysmash, e.g. asjdlkfjasdf. We'll be doing some filtering to see if new strings we find are "shaped" like English words.
Emoji(s). Sorry! Go look them up at Emojipedia.
Even More Things To Look At! 
If you want even more information about why MORE WORDS ARE BETTER, you probably will like these two TED videos: 
 Thanks so much for making it all the way to the end!

Occult Ornithology- A bird themed tarot deck
The aim of this Kickstarter is to fund a 22 card major arcana tarot deck, themed around birds as the tarot trump cards. The structure of the deck is based on the Rider-Waite  tarot deck from 1910, partially because I am most familiar with this deck and because the meanings and imagery in that deck seemed like a natural fit for an ornithological deck. The deck will come with gold edges as well as gold foiling on the front and back of the cards, I also want to beautifully finished guide book to accompany the deck. 
The Moon- Lyrebird, The Sun- Waldrapp, Judgement- Barn Owl
Why birds?  Folktales, feelings and archetypes have been associated with many species of birds across every culture since spoken word. The various associations we make with many species and mythologies surrounding them make them a perfect fit for the tarot. On top of this, the rich biodiversity of birds as well as our own unique feelings surrounding various species lend themselves well to both structured reading of the cards and allow for the personal interpretation of the reader allowing for a rich deck. 
Book cover idea
Many of my previous backers and people who follow me across various social media are aware of my affinity to birds and fascination with the species both from a spiritual and biological standpoint. Creating this tarot has given me the space to explore various species and allowed me to let my passion shine through in every card. In the accompanying book for the deck, you will not only have the meaning of the card for every tarot, but you will also have an explanation of why the bird was chosen and also a small piece about the depicted species. 
The Chariot- Canada Geese, Temperance- Lesser Flamingo, Strength- Kea
Why a tarot deck? The tarot have always fascinated me, I bought my first deck when I was 15 and made my own velvet bag for the cards. Going through the cards and studying the art and meaning in each one was always a great pleasure and comfort to me.  In later years, developing my styles and interests i've had many requests form people to design a deck, it wasn't until I sat and thought about the kind of deck that I personally felt was missing from my own collection that I realised that I would love to create a bird themed tarot deck!
Justice- Carrion Crow
What's in the Deck? The deck will consist of the 22 major arcana only, I made this decision because I wanted to create quite a simple deck with more streamlined meanings. I also felt that the iconography of the birds would be watered down in a traditional 78 card deck, I wanted the 22 birds to speak for themselves. The deck will have beautiful gold foiling on both the front and back of the cards, as gold edges and will be printed onto high quality 350gsm card stock. When designing this deck I decided that I wanted the finish to be a luxurious as possible, the deck is both designed as a working tarot and as a beautiful item to own. The box will be be book shaped with a magnetic lid to keep your deck secure and stored beautifully.
The cards
Birds represented in the deck:
 The Fool-White Stork
 The Magician- Satin Bowerbird
 The High Priestess- Great Crested Grebe
 The Emperor- King Vulture
 The Hierophant- Onagadori Rooster
 The Lovers- Rock Doves
 The Chariot- Canada Geese
 Justice- Carrion Crow
 The Hermit- Grey Heron
 The Wheel- Cuckoo and Wood Thrush
 Strength- Kea
 The Hanged Man- Ring-necked Pheasant
 House Sparrows- Death
 Temperance- Lesser Flamingo
 The Devil- Eurasian Magpie
 The Tower- Great Black-backed Gull
 The Star- Mistle Thrush 
 The Moon- Superb Lyrebird 
 The Sun- Waldrapp (Northern Bald Ibis)
 Judgement- Barn Owl
 The World- Wandering Albatross 


The deck is also accompanied by the 48 page guide, this 15x15cm book will be perfect bound with a foiled cover and full colour throughout. This book will serve both as a detailed guide to each of the cards, but also as a guide to birds. All of the cards will have a detailed explanation to what the card is, what it represents, why the bird has been chosen and information about that bird species. I want to bring together my natural love of both art and the natural world. 
PLAY


Rewards
There are several rewards available to those of you who would like to back the project! Note: all reward tiers receive the digital files of both the deck and the book 
£5- This is the tier for those of you who want to support the project but don't want physical rewards in return. For £5 you will get:

£15- You will get receive one A4 foiled print of 3 tarot designs available. The print will be on heavy stock paper with gold foiling on the details. This tier is ideal for those of you who appreciate the artwork but don't want and entire deck of cards. 
Judgement, The Empress and Justice available as prints

Mockup of the 48 page book

£200- This reward is limited to 5 people. In this tier, as well as the set of  cards and the book, you will also get a custom designed animal themed tarot card by myself. If the project is funded give me details of the animal you would like and what card you would like to represent and I will create it in the same style as this deck! You will receive a digital file of the design to do what you wish with (non commercial use only) and you will also receive a foiled copy of the design with the rest of your rewards. 
PLAY

So, why £6000?
To date this is the most i've ever asked for in a Kickstarter, with previous projects i've started by asking for the baseline to what I would need to bring the basic product to backers! In this case, while it would be tempting to ask for £3000 and scrap the Foil fronts and backs, and do a small booklet to accompany the deck I feel that I want to bring out the deck exactly how I envisioned it with the detailing that I personally love in other decks and pieces of art that I own. Because of this,  the cost to print 500 copies of the deck will be £3200 alone, the book will be an additional £1020, . The additional £2000 will cover Kickstarter fees, taxes and postage and packaging. I feel that this number is exactly what I require to bring the best version of the deck that I can. 
As with all my Kickstarters, any extra funding will go back directly to my backers in the form of stretch goals. 
The Devil- Eurasian Magpie

The Artist
At MCM comic con Birmingham last year!
My name is Katie and i'm a Liverpool based illustrator. I regularly attend comic cons and sell my wares, I have met many of my previous backers at these events! My artwork is mostly nature informed horror art, but I also dabble in scientific and conservation art, as you can see from my picture, the 2 subjects very much go hand in hand! 
Memento Mori
I've been combining the occult and nature for a while now, my previous artwork was a collection of my horror artworks and the connection between my interests was clear throughout the book. The project also allowed me to dabble in foiling and other print techniques which I will be applying to Occult Ornithology!
Owllustrations, pidgeonary (previously on kickstarter!) Seagulls: a cliff note and Baneful Herbs zines!
I've always been interested in educating people about nature, but also trying to represent the beauty in it. As you can see from the zines i've worked in over the years there is a big emphasis on birds especially, chances are if you meet me in real life i'll probably roll out a ton of bird facts at you! Compiling that knowledge and applying it to the tarot has been so much fun for me, i've not only picked birds that I adore but i've also picked birds that I felt get little attention in media but still represent so much.

The Project
After forming Velvet Caravan organically almost two years ago, we have decided to record an album capturing the essences of our unique style. Gypsy, Gypsy-Jazz, Honky-Tonk, Latin and Swing seem like an impossible musical combination, but after many months of playing together, an interesting sound has evolved.  The style can be called a lot of things, but we always seem to best describe it as European Redneck Music.  
This CD was recorded within three evenings with Kevin Rose, owner of Elevated Basement Recording Studio and the chief sound & recording engineer for the internationally-acclaimed Savannah Music Festival.  Not ones to do things traditionally, we recorded all the songs onstage at Savannah's historic Lucas Theatre.  The natural acoustic environment (designed specifically for non-amplified instruments) proved essential in capturing the high energy of our live performances onto this album.
We are seeking your support to complete this project before the end of the year (2013). By contributing to any of the rewards listed on this page, you will not only help us finish the project but also have the benefit of hearing the album before its release date in 2014, in addition to other awesome perks.
Our above video - though longer than others - is a work of art in itself by the talented Peter Marra of Savannah's 1M Studios and beautifully showcases the story behind the coming together of our unique group.  
We hope you enjoy, and your support truly means a lot to us.
Here is a link to photos from our recording at the Lucas Theatre for the Arts.  Photos by Jon Waits

We’re on a mission to reduce the risk of charity fraud and increase support for programs rescuing children and families from poverty.
We seek $10,000 to complete software that can distinguish a good charitable investment from a bad risk, instantly.   
Each year, we shell out more than $500 billion in charitable donations and taxpayer contributions for human services. 
How much of this money improves child and family well-being for good vs. for now? 
How much is likely to uplift children and families from poverty and reduce our taxpayer spending on social services? 
What’s a good baseline for the return on investment we should expect our dollars to yield? 
Getting answers to these and other market-value questions, helpful to reducing the risk of charitable giving and ensuring a bigger bang for our buck, is here. 
We, at Saint Wall Street, have designed an online calculator that will assess the value of the difference a social program makes, by analyzing and monetizing its officially reported performance data. The cost-benefits and return-on-investment findings will reveal the extent to which that program professing to improve child and family well-being is likely producing lasting social change, sustainable economic growth, and a good financial return on investment for all, including the families, communities and investors. 
It is important to note that the calculator will not enable making donations, nor recommend any social programs for support. Its sole purpose is to provide reliable market-value standards and measures that can be used to inform wiser program planning decisions and program funding decisions, to ensure better outcomes for children and families. 
America’s first-ever Philanthropic Return on Investment (PROI) calculator is in its final stages of development. Your support will help get it to market. Here’s a sample demonstration of the PROI calculator’s functionality.
The PROI calculator will be customized for use via philanthropic, nonprofit, and academic institutions -- some of which are awaiting the final product, right now. Funding will cover technology expertise for completion, professional services to ensure proper functionality and to double-check data and formulas, and initial website development for hosting and pre-market testing.

My name is Marcus Eaton, and I have been passionate about music my whole life.
One of my very first memories is being in my father's recording studio as a toddler. I began playing guitar when I was nine and I formed my first band in high school. When I was 22, my band was signed to a record deal and we continued to travel and build a following throughout the Northwest.
As any artist will tell you, it takes years to develop one's craft. I continue to work every day to master my instrument, my singing and my songwriting. I have collected a few amazing mentors along the way and now I am at a crossroads. Everything has lead up to this extraordinary opportunity that allows me to express my artistry in a way that I’ve never been able to before.
With many shifting tides in the music industry and the music delivery method, you now have the ability to do what a record label used to do. This is the first time in history where you can be involved with the recording process.
I am thrilled to announce my dream-come-true project: the pinnacle of years’ worth of work – MY NEW ALBUM.
Over the last few years, I’ve had the incredible opportunity to collaborate with the legendary David Crosby on his first solo album in 20 years. Now, some of the same renowned musicians will be working with me on my new album. I have a collection of new songs (some written with David Crosby and his son, LA musician and producer James Raymond), and an innovative approach that will undoubtedly lead to the best sonic sensation I have ever created.  
The money generated from this campaign will fund my new recording. (studio time, musicians fees, art, photography, printing costs, hard drives, mastering, etc.) Any additional funding will go towards album promotion and touring.
In return for your generous contributions, you will receive some really cool incentives and have the opportunity to join me for what will assuredly be a fun and very memorable experience. 
Please feel free to write me to create custom high level rewards.
I am very thrilled to have your backing on this project and I can't wait for you to hear the results!
Thank you for your support,
MARCUS

More about  "Juicy body"
My body’s so juicy! It can be naked, it can be dressed in silk or leather. It needs a lot of space because it is so juicy. My body has different smells, it can smell differently, taste differently. Many different fluids can come out of it. And at the same time that it does all these things, it also carries so many feelings within. My body’s elastic, it can make all sorts of moves, and transform if I want it to transform. It needs no criticism, ‘cause there’s only one like it, it’s a unique example. One edition, not for sale.
"Juicy body", 2015
For more than a decade I’ve been working with self-portrait, staging my body in front of the camera. During the last four years I’ve been shooting with the book Juicy Body in mind. I’ve developed my own way of working and have come to a place where my intention aligns with my expression. This process has produced a body of work that constitutes a fierce and playful book, one that reaches out to a broader audience – a queer manifesto for the female body. 
The book consists of forty photographs in color. Each picture shows a body in nature. The body prepares itself to run into the mist wearing a green bathing suit, stands in a lake dressed in golden shorts, or moves under a fullmoon directing a flashlight towards itself. Together the images create a collection of stills in which the subject is presented in a sometimes humoristic and sometimes vulnerable way, but always an active one. This body is continuously relating to an imaginary audience. 
All images are taken with an analogue middle format-camera. I act behind as well as in front of the camera, with help from a self-timer connected to a remote-control that can be fired off by standing on it or holding it. This is a perfect method for playing with being in or out of control, exploring everything that my body’s been taught and responds to when a camera enters the scene. 
In addition to my photographs, the book will consist of a foreword about my work, written by an artcritic, as well as a few short texts written by myself about the moment when five of the specific images were taken. “Juicy body” already has a printer (Livonia), and will be published by Black Book Publishing. It will also be ready for my opening at YA Gallery in Stockholm on the 5th of oktober 2017, and will be launched at the bookstore Konst-ig during the same week.
"Gotta get in gotta get out", 2015
In october 2017 eight pictures from "Juicy body" will be exhibited in large scale at NAU Gallery in Stockholm. My idea is to have the book ready for the opening, as a possibility for the audience there as well as outside the gallery room to see more of my work. I know there's a lot of people out there who's been following my work for a long time. And for me this book will definitely be an opportunity for me to reach out to an even broader audience.
Together I'm convinced we can make this happen!
The book
WIth your support, we will create a high-quality book with a release-date in oktober 2017. I've chosen the best 35 pictures from four years of work for this exclusive book, that will be printed in an edition of 500 at Livonia Print, published at Black book Publications. 
NOTE: Book pictured is a digital mock-up, final version will differ.
  Hello!
About Casia Bromberg
Casia Bromberg (b. 1984) is a visual artist based in Stockholm, Sweden. She graduated from the University of Photography/in Gothenburg, Sweden in 2011. She works mainly with photography, often together with text and sound. Central to her work is the use of her own body, as well as her friends’ bodies, to raise questions about human relationships, sexuality, socially constructed gender, and ideas about "the staged" and "the authentic". She explores what it means to be in control or self-aware in our time, by playing with stereotypes and identification. The suggestive narrative and movement in the images charge her work with excitement and a sense of self-empowerment.

When I was a kid, I always loved those "Choose your own adventure" books. I remember reading them and getting so excited that I could really choose how the story goes.
Now that I'm older, I wanted to bring this idea to the mobile front. 
I've found some friends and their friends knew some people and this sounded like it could actually be done. 
The writer I found has written some pilots and other interesting stuff for Hollywood and his writing style ended up being perfect for this story. 
This writer knew some graphics designers and also some music composers. Together, we have been able to gather nearly all the requirements for this game, such as background music, loading music and even death music!
The graphic artist was able to custom draw several art work pieces that will go in the game, and several that wont make the cut just due to so many pieces of art.
Some Sample Art Work
Another sample, animated
We have little features like timed choices in the game, as well as special inventory items you can find that will help with certain parts of the story.
It is a very simple, but fun and engaging game. You read what is on the screen, and you are presented with options to choose that relate to that you have just read. Depending on your choice, you will see new text to read. There are many dead ends and fun little surprises.
Here is a little example: 
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
The river narrows even more, sloshing up the sides of the cave on both sides. An enormous boulder takes up most of the space ahead of you, splitting the river left and right. The left is violent. Whitewater splashes everywhere. Foam hangs on the rocks. The right looks calmer, but sounds louder. You can't see far enough to know.
You have 10 seconds to choose or a choice will be made for you:
Paddle Left?Paddle Right?
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
You give yourself up to fate and slide past the door. Hopefully, it won't be the last light you see for too long – or for, you know – ever. 
It isn't. The slide gradually becomes less steep, and then it shoots you into a new, well-lit room from a hole near the ceiling. You fall a few feet and skin your elbows on the floor, but you're just fine. What did the door you passed up lead to, though? You get the feeling you'll wonder about that for a long time. 
Whatever. You take a look around. 
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
For being a supporter of any amount, you will automatically get the paid version for free. The paid version enables you to go back after you make a choice you did not like. In the free version, if you die or make a mistake in your choice, you will need to start over.
We are so excited to finish this project. This is where you come in. We are trying to raise a little bit of funding so we can get this finished quickly.
We plan to deliver version 1.0 before Christmas, 2014.

How would you live your life if you discovered that you had an incurable disease? This is the question we explore in this poignant documentary about the women who are living with stage 4 metastatic breast cancer.
Approximately 30% of women with breast cancer will ultimately have the disease spread and will receive the Metastatic Breast Cancer diagnosis. There is no cure. In the last 40 years, the MBC death toll has not changed significantly, nor has the mean survival rate of three years. Despite early detection, awareness campaigns, and new treatments, we are still losing about 40,000 women a year to this disease. Those numbers need to drop. 
This three-part documentary series will look at the journey of the women who have this disease, the researchers and physicians who are trying to cure it, and the youngest generation that is at risk and is fighting for more funding and better treatment. Our team has unique access to a remarkable group of women at the Huntsman Cancer Institute in Utah, and now we want to spend time with other groups of breast cancer patients in diverse regions of the country. 
We are hoping to raise $50,000 to continue working on this film in other locations. We will use the funding to complete an additional 20-25 days of filming in more rural areas of the South and on the East Coast. It will also help us to pay for a professional editor. If we don’t reach our goal, we won’t get any of the funds we raise, so please share this link and donate today in memory of someone you know who’s died from breast cancer, in honor of someone who’s a survivor, or for someone that you hope never gets breast cancer. 
Monthly support group for women with stage 4 breast cancer.
Part One: In Salt Lake City, Utah, a monthly support group for women with stage 4 breast cancer was started in December 2015 by an oncology team. The team consists of a social worker and a breast cancer physician who recognized that there were not enough resources specifically for women with metastatic breast cancer. The women in the group exchange bucket list ideas, talk about how to help their families cope with grief, discuss the process of dying, and talk about their own funerals. Two of women have widespread disease in a variety of organs. A few have it in just one organ and continue to look for the best possible treatment options. Others have disease that progresses significantly from month to month. We get to know four of the patients in more depth at home, with their families, and through their cancer treatments. Through intimate interviews, archival materials, and vérité footage, the role of protagonist shifts from one woman to the next as their lives intersect. As time progresses, we learn more about our characters' home lives, their experiences in the workforce, and the realities of living with a deadly disease.

Lisa Gauchay, the oncology social worker that started the monthly breast cancer support group.
Lisa Gauchay, LCSW, is an oncology social worker at the Huntsman Cancer Institute who started the monthly metastatic breast cancer group. One of her patients who had widespread triple negative breast cancer at the age of 33 said that she “was the Komen Foundation’s worst nightmare with a disease that had no cure." Lisa was determined to do more for the women with metastatic breast cancer and felt as though a support group was a good way for these women to come together through their common experiences.

Dr. Saundra Buys, is focused on providing top-notch clinical treatment as well as focusing on her patients' emotional well-being.
Dr. Saundra Buys co-facilitates the groups with Lisa. Recognizing the difficult diagnosis of metastatic breast cancer, and having a sister and a daughter who are breast cancer survivors, Dr. Buys is a compassionate health care provider who is invested in providing top-notch clinical treatment while also focusing on her patients' emotional well-being at the renowned Huntsman Cancer Institute.

Amanda, a devoted wife, mother of three, member of the LDS church in Salt Lake City, Utah, and cancer warrior for the past three years.
However Long highlights four patients from the Salt Lake City group. Amanda is a devoted wife, mother of three, and a member of the LDS church, and she has been battling her cancer for over three years. She struggles with a variety of emotions as she considers writing her own obituary and tries to continue to live each day without having cancer be her only focus.

Barb Chatfield is a devoted pediatric pulmonologist, renowned researcher, loving wife, and mother to three college-aged daughters.
Barb Chatfield is a devoted pediatric pulmonologist, renowned researcher, feminist, loving wife, and mother to three college-aged daughters. As her disease progresses, she reflects on the difficulties of living with cancer while trying to stay present with her family. Recognizing that “this holiday” may be her last, she manufactures events like picking out wedding dresses with her daughters to make the most of the time she has.

Having outlived many of her own clients with cancer at her hair salon, Patty is grateful for every day.
Patty is a hair stylist who moves forward with gratitude and positivity in the face of her diagnosis. Having outlived many of her own personal clients with cancer, Patty still works full time and is trying to enjoy her remaining time to the fullest.

Lisa is now on disability due to her treatment regimen and medication side effects.
Lisa Church is a big-hearted dog lover who is now on disability due to the frequency of her treatments. She lives with Elaine, her life partner, who helps to support Lisa through the process. As a self-proclaimed "planner," cancer has reshaped the way that Lisa "plans" her future. 

Part Two: Two thousand miles away in Boston, MA; Washington, DC; and Birmingham, Alabama, we watch different kinds of support for breast cancer patients unfold. Located in the heart of the metropolitan city of Boston are women who have different life challenges and battles. We meet two stage 4 breast cancer patients two weeks before they go to their MBC retreat. One lives in Jamaica Plains and is working two jobs while raising her two young sons as a single mother. The other lives in Quincy, Massachusetts, with her two sisters and mother. We follow these women as they participate in an all-expenses-paid two-day MBC retreat in rural Maine and connect with eight other women from across the country with stage 4 breast cancer.

The mortality rates for breast cancer are higher for African-Americans in Alabama and Mississippi.
In rural areas of Alabama and Mississippi, we are hoping to follow an outreach team at The Deep South Network for Cancer Control through the UAB Cancer Center. This NCI-designated facility is a nationally recognized leader in cancer education, research, and patient care. The Center is also a leader in community outreach, most notably for work in increasing education and awareness of cancer in minority and underserved populations. The mortality rates for breast cancer are higher for African-Americans in Alabama and Mississippi, and the Center's Deep South Network for Cancer Control seeks to eliminate such health disparities - particularly in rural areas - and provide access to these populations.

The UAB Cancer Center is a nationally recognized leader in cancer education, research, and patient care.
Artistic production notes on Part Two: We have reached out to five potential locations for the second phase of filming: Boston, MA; Washington, DC; Baltimore, MD; New York, NY; and Birmingham, AL. Based on the response from cancer retreats and top cancer hospitals, our team is confident that we will have the opportunity to follow these subjects and health care teams. Funding we receive through this project will support filming in these new areas.

Part Three: As women from Salt Lake City, UT, and Boston, MA, with MBC advocate for more research, better insurance coverage, and additional social-emotional resources, Dr. Saundra Buys works with multigenerational families in the High Risk Breast Cancer Clinic. Over a fifteen-year period, the HRBCC enrolled more than 1,500 individuals from 256 families, collecting data and biospecimens that have been made available for research. Internationally, over 30,000 individuals from nearly 12,000 families have contributed data and/or biospecimens to this valuable resource that has resulted in hundreds of publications and research projects. We see young women who have lost mothers and other relatives to MBC enroll in the study and move forward in their lives. We look at how they reconcile their own risk factors and face their futures.

Barb, her husband, and their three daughters
Artistic production notes on Part Three: We have reached out to three potential locations for the third phase of filming – we hope to follow two multigenerational families at two High Risk Breast Cancer Clinics. Our first location is at the Huntsman Cancer Institute, and the other two options are at Mount Sinai or Columbia University in NY.  Based on the response from these two cohort sites, the medical facilities believe that our creative team will have the opportunity to follow an additional family or two who are at high risk for MBC.   

Over 30,000 individuals from nearly 12,000 families have contributed data and/or biospecimens to The High Risk Breast Cancer Clinics.
 *Donate today "IN MEMORY OF" someone you know who’s died from breast cancer, "IN HONOR OF" someone who’s a survivor, or "FOR" someone that you hope never gets breast cancer.*
The Creative Team:

The creative team from left to right: Marissa Lila, Scott Thornton, and Jenny Mackenzie.
  Jenny Mackenzie Ph.D., Director and Producer: Jenny Mackenzie, Ph.D.’s previous work focuses on bringing social and racial justice issues as well as public health dilemmas far beyond the screening room to maximize discussions, education, outreach, and social change. Breast cancer is a personal issue for Jenny, having lost an aunt in 2002 and a dear friend seven months ago. Jenny has a BA from Brown University, an MSW from Simmons College, and a Ph.D. from the University of Utah.

Scott Thornton, Director of Photography, Editor, and Producer: Scott is a talented, compassionate, and experienced filmmaker and owner of Dogspeed Films. He has recently worked on two poignant public health documentaries - one about HIV/AIDS in the 1980’s and the other about childhood nutritional issues. With a personal connection and commitment to fighting cancer, Scott is excited to be working on However Long.

Marissa Lila, Producer: Marissa is an award-winning documentary producer, writer, and editor. She loves telling underrepresented stories that help build empathy and understanding. She has produced and edited documentary films that have won awards at International film festivals and been featured in The New York Times, The Atlantic, USA Today, People Magazine, and The Huffington Post.


*Special thanks to City of Hope, Fox News 7, and National Cancer Institute for providing some of the images seen here.*

Mark and Loren first met at the Soundquest Fest music festival in Tucson, Arizona, in 2010. Both were participating as solo artists. The two decided at the last moment to try playing together during Loren's set. It went over well and people afterward suggested that the two should collaborate together some more.  They decided that it was a great idea and started  working on what became the album ‘Tree of Life’ to much success.  
Now, for the past year Loren and Mark have been working on their follow up to ‘Tree of Life’ called ‘Cave Dwellers’. It is over two hours of droned, atmospheric, world music that explores the depth of your imagination, taking you on a journey through our oldest known habitats, the caves of our ancestors.  Loren and Mark would like to make you curious and enlist your support for our Kickstarter Campaign, to see this album to it's completion. Please consider making a pledge to manifest ‘Cave Dwellers’ into musical reality.

It happens every year...right after Black Friday. "The new year is right around the corner...", "Have you started planning for the next year?", "Your goals won't accomplish themselves!"
Every December, we're inundated with planning for the new year...while the current one is still going. 
We sit down and start planning for the year ahead, but get caught up in our day-to-day and fall right back into planning month-to-month...just trying to keep up. Then we end up like this:
Credit: K.C. Green
 Going into 2020, I want to do something different!
We all have learned about or heard about the million and one ways to set, track, and complete goals. There are tons of videos, articles, seminars, webinars on this topic- but I haven't been able to find anything that teaches how to lay these goals out for a full year. So I wanted to create something that would help!
I took everything I know about goal setting, organizing, and scheduling, mixed it all together and.....The Creatress Planner was born!
The Creatress Planner's birth wasn't easy. It took hours and hours of revisions and concept changes, midnight dreams about things to add and take away, and numerous confirmation seeking conversations with God, but I'm extremely proud of the final product: A 12-month planner and goal setting tool, ready to help you take control of and crush 2020!
This planner is designed to help guide you through a year full of manifesting your goals. Take a look at what's included:
PLAY

We all have our talents and skills that can drive our visions forward and this planner will help organize those things to keep you moving forward! 
Grab your Creatress Planner today, and watch your 2020 be magical!

In today's day and age computers,cellphones, and social media rule everything which is great and terrible all at the same time. It's great because you can acquire and share vast amounts of information within minutes versus forty years ago when it took days to find out what was happening across the globe. On the other hand, it has its downfalls. The world is a very large place with an endless amount of sights and activities to see and do. People are missing out on all of the great things this planet has to offer by being distracted by social media and other sources of electronic entertainment. What if there was a way to combine the two and subliminally get people back into the outdoors? A place where anyone involved in the outdoors can come, share their ideas, tips, tricks, and experiences with other like minded individuals. Facebook is great, don't get me wrong, but I don't relate to half of the things that roll trough my news feed on a daily basis so it gets a bit annoying after a while. This will be a place where all of the information you need relating to the outdoors  will be easily accessible. Information regarding hunting, hiking, fishing, camping, scuba diving, mountain climbing, mountain biking, snow and water sport activities, gun enthusiasm, and much more.  Information such as the state park locations, hours fees, and activities, areas of interest both state side and abroad, all hunting and fishing information worldwide subdivided into seasons, license costs, game fish and animals, and bag limits, outdoor activities and events and a timeline schedule so you don't miss a tournament, group hike, scuba session, or downhill race, world events and news such as new world records and crazy catches related to the outdoors, plus all of the information the other club members will be bringing to the table and sharing. You will be surrounded by people who share the same interests as you so you will always be able to find something new and fascinating that you can relate to. We can even sub divide it so you are completely surrounded by people who are in the exact same field of interest as you. On top of the vast information relating to all aspects of the outdoors there will be a store that will allow members and non-members to acquire the gear they need to pursue interests in the outdoors. Club members will also receive a discount on gear. To top it all off we will have seasonal and monthly competitions and giveaways. Take for example whoever submits the most extraordinary scenic mountain climb photo will receive free climbing gear, or at the beginning of bass season we promote a largest bass caught competition. If you win you will receive a free bass set up with lures and a box. After all that said we will offer what no other outdoor company offers, excursions with the team. Every year we will have a different outdoor excursion so we can relate to all of our members. With every purchase of X amount your name will be put into a hat and at the end of the drawing date up to 5 club members will be going on an all inclusive excursion with the Outdoorsman team. I truly believe that this is something the world could definitely use, it would connect more like minded people than ever before and it will be a great new source of information for new and existing outdoor men, women and children.

Hi. I'm Laura, a cultural education designer. When I was very young, I realized there were lots of different cultures, and no matter which one we lived in, it was fun & inspiring to participate in someone else's.
~~~ ~~~~~~~~~~Our Boys & Girls Need ZoomerangKidz~~~~~~~~~~~~
In 77% of US households someone owns a Smartphone and due to that 43% of the children are using one. 65% of children are using a Smartphone on a daily basis, 28% weekly and 6% less often. These figures are very likely to increase in the future.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~All I Really Need to Know~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
The saying, "All I really need to know I learned in Kindergarten" is true today in a new way. Teachers stretched for time and resources are barely able to teach core curriculum in diverse classrooms, much less find ways to bridge cultural and gender gaps. I am creating ZoomerangKidz Adventures for mobile to inspire girls and boys to take an interest in the world around them, to be adventurous and brave whatever their gender or cultural background, at home and in school.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~A New World Perspective~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
When I consulted in schools I delivered ZoomerangKidz Adventures to numerous classes where hundreds of children 5 to 9 participated. The project happened in classes, yet many smartphones and tablets were in the hands of children at home. Teachers and parents found mobile content distracting children away from classroom learning. Today, boys in particular are losing interest in school as early as 8, in favor of playing games. Too many boys relate to games as meaningful, and to school as being "for girls". More girls are playing mobile games, but again, parents say most content is fluff and filled with gender stereotypes. We can change that now.
~~~~~~What is the Difference this New World Story makes?~~~~~~~
Children 5 to 9 are curious, shy and excited to learn what is outside their neighborhoods. ZKz opens the world so the sparks stay lit.
Games that boys relate to as meaningful, that also provide core curriculum within the adventure, help them stay dialed into school.
Games where girl characters take the same risks as boy characters increases girls' interests in subject areas that may be seen as for boys, like science, math & engineering.
When all children have a tool that enables them to explore the greater world, they rise to the occasion. Children want to expand their reach. ZKz is expansive storytelling merged with core curriculum, built to keep them feeling interconnected & motivated to keep learning as they grow past 3rd grade.
The world is shrinking. Children need to be culturally savvy to succeed.
Children in this age segment believe they can make a difference, and they believe it wholeheartedly as they master their Universe, one culture at a time, when they enter ZoomerangKidz Adventure Series.
How the App & Cartoon Series can Make a Difference for Everyone
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ZKz Characters Break Stereotypes~~~~~~~~~~
Children help save the Zoomerangians from extinction. Part of the knowledge they gain as the game expands shows them the state of this planet and how they can make a difference in it. See what Zemi sees, explore with her, or choose Isabella, Dozer or Widget. They are from diverse backgrounds, adventurous and daring! ZKz entertains children and their families by providing:
1) Games where there is something important to solve, with risks and rewards.
2)  Humorous YouTube Cartoons that are part of a bigger story and hold clues to the games
3) Engaging characters to root for and identify with, that break through gender and cultural stereotypes & biases.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~This is how we are going to do it~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
The Big Story - Helping save Zoomerangians from extinction through collecting knowledge is created up to a point, and has lots of room to grow. Come grow with us! The Apps are designed. Producing this App Series and YouTube Cartoon Series just needs a Kickstart!! The funds we are raising all go towards evolving what we have developed so far, to take it to the next level. Join the Movement that enables children everywhere to be included and connected in the Global Community!
Join us in creating a refreshing, entertaining and educationally relevant mobile media alternative. Our goal is to ensure a positive future for children everywhere. Your participation is paramount in chronicling the adventures of the ...
So, who are these ZoomerangKidz® 
Well … they were average … until they met Aldo … that is ...
Aldo, is a strange and adorable creature who the children meet during a routine walk through the forest.  After meeting Aldo the children learn that his species, the Zoomerangians® are becoming extinct.  Aldo explains that he needs help collecting Power Gems called ZoomBlooms® …
“Yes,” Aldo explains. “Zoomerangians eat (actually absorb) ZoomBlooms … and ZoomBlooms are getting harder to find.”
Aldo continues, “The extract that comes from deeply focusing and learning something new is the power of the Universe.  It is this extract, present in ZoomBlooms, that keeps Zoomerangians alive.”
“And now, since ZoomBlooms are getting harder to find, my fellow Zoomerangians are in danger of becoming extinct”
The children want to help.  They ask where they can find these ZoomBlooms.
Aldo explains, “Well, learning in and about new cultures brings the most power to ZoomBlooms.  So, the best way to find ZoomBlooms is to travel around the globe and explore the world’s cultures and gain knowledge of…
Aldo responds … “Don’t worry about traveling thousands of miles.  These ZoomPlumes® will help you in your travels.”
Then, Aldo gifts the children with ZoomPlumes®, magical feathers which give the children super hero powers and enhances their personal strengths.
And this is the just the beginning ... Our average elementary school age children are now the ZoomerangKidz Adventurers!
These ZoomerangKidz travel the globe collecting all sorts of knowledge from the places and cultures they visit (that is, they learn stuff). As the kids learn they are rewarded with ZoomBlooms that nourish the Zoomerangians. With each new fact the adventurers move one step closer to saving Aldo and the Zoomerangians … A Zoomerangian Revival!.
The ZoomerangKidz Adventures® is a series of YouTube Cartoons and companion mobile game apps, for 5 to 9 year olds, designed to enrich childhood playtime with mobile content that is fun and engaging. ZoomerangKidz creatively enables kids to
Go to cities, states, and locations around the world
Experience the history, landmarks and actually feel the culture each of these locations offer
Play entertaining educationally relevant games ... The players learn about the world they live in
The ZoomerangKidz Adventures® is a series of YouTube Cartoons and companion Mobile App games (Transmedia). Each episode in the series consists of one YouTube Cartoon and one Mobile App Game. 
The YouTube Cartoon tells a story of ZoomerangKidz Adventures exploring a world culture.  The Mobile App Game allows the players (our kids) to interactively explore and play games that enhance and reinforce the YouTube Cartoon Story.
The Mobile App game is built around a map that the kids explore to collect knowledge.  They may sometimes just pick up "knowledge" (e.g., artifacts) as they explore; other times they may play knowledge enhancing mini-games.  As the kids collect knowledge they receive ZoomBlooms, which in turn, help the Zoomerangians.
The ZoomerangKidz Adventures Cartoons and Mobile App Games go together.
The YouTube Cartoons provide context and clues for the games.
The games enable players to interactively explore in the same setting presented by the YouTube Cartoon.
As we add ZoomerangKidz episodes, the virtual game board expands until, ultimately, it includes the entire globe.  In the process, children thread facts about the real world and deepen their understanding of their own and other cultures. 
The ZK Adventures global virtual game board will be displayed on the ZK web site.Children will be able to track the progress of the Zoomerangian Revival by viewing this global virtual game board.
Saving the Zoomerangian Species from extinction, Exploration, Play, and even Learning always bring the children back to the Series.
There are plenty of locations and cultures to explore in our world (and even in other worlds).The possibilities are endless.
Each Episode explores a new location ... A new culture. The children explore landmarks, wildlife, flora & fauna, agriculture, clothing, food, animals, languages, music and geography receiving a deep, diverse cultural experience. Math, science and reading are also woven into the experiences.
ZoomerangKidz merges game-play with the cultural content of the companion cartoon, core school curriculum, and problem solving.  By so doing, the ZoomerangKidz Adventures enable a deeper understanding of the similarities within your child’s own culture and other cultures around the world.
It makes sense to turn children's media time into a high-quality, creative learning experience. This is our goal.  Our mission is to build a Series of YouTube Cartoons and companion game apps that
Hold children's interest with fresh, exciting content,
Provides real value and
Helps them succeed.
To bring ZoomerangKidz Adventure series to market we need your help. By funding our project, you will contribute to getting the Episode (a YouTube cartoon and companion game set in Colorado). We expect this first episode to be highly successful and to generate revenue in a wider market, to enable production of subsequent ZoomerangKidz Series.
The 5 to 9 year old market is an underserved market. 66% of the apps for mobile devices are built for the 5 and younger age group.  There is a gap for innovative apps for children 5 to 9.
Children this age are naturally curious about finding and understanding the connection between what they are exposed to via media and how that relates to their "real life".  One way to keep that (curiosity) spark alive is to involve them in ongoing playful exploration that broadens their awareness and mirrors the life styles around them.
Creator ... Laura Weston Leighton.  Laura created and evolved the ZoomerangKidz project.  It has been a labor of love.  She has networked, collaborated and motivated many people to contribute to this project.  She has put this winning team together and will continue to provide the glue and motivation to ensure the project's success.
Technical Consultant … Dr. Chris Leighton.  Dr. Leighton has over 30 years experience planning, managing and contributing to systems and software development.  He will ensure our development plans are sound, well integrated & well executed.
Creative Director, Lead Animator and Head Writer … Rich Moyer.  Rich and his team did the introductory animation for this KickStarter campaign will continue to lead production of the YouTube Cartoons.  Rich will also ensure the Mobile App Games are well aligned with the YouTube Cartoons.Rich started his career as a syndicated cartoonist with Tribune Media Services in Chicago. Rich now combines his cartooning skills with gag writing and animation.  Rich has had development contracts with all of the major studios.
Voice Over Talent … Rich brings the additional talents of Maggie Roswell and Hal Rayle, to our adventure series.
Maggie Roswell is an Emmy nominated Voice Over talent recognized for her Voice Over work on Fox's The Simpsons.
Hal Rayle is also an Emmy nominated Voice Over talent recognized for his Voice Over work on Disney's - Rotten Ralph, Transformers & GI Joe.
Rich, Maggie and Hal have a long track record of producing hilarious, engaging cartoons in a variety of styles.
Developer … We have worked hard to find the most experienced team possible who "get" kids and who enjoy programming around our content. The Denver/Boulder corridor is bustling with game development talent, and we are happy to have found a local game developer team that has consistently delivered on-time & on-budget games for brand name companies.
Since the real world provides our context and content, we don't have to look very far for compelling and interesting details to fill our stories. Our first episode is set in Colorado; urban and rural with mountains and prairies, and a broad range of plants and animals, a compelling, colorful beginning to world exploration. Future episodes traverse the globe.
Keep up with the ZK Adventures progress using the ZK Supporter Blog.
Receive mementos associated with the progress of development. These mementos include sketches, storyboards, animatics and animated clips.
Beta test the software if you wish. Every supporter will have a chance to be a beta tester.
Receive recognition ranging from a souvenir Thank You Postcard to recognition in the first episode credits.
Receive ZoomerangKidz Art ranging from Limited Edition Trading Cards to ZoomerangKidz prints suitable for framing to custom ZoomerangKidz prints (also suitable for framing).
Receive merchandize ranging from washable ZoomerangKidz Tattoos to Limited Edition ZoomerangKidz T-Shirts.
Receive ZoomerangKidz Episodes. By supporting our KS project, you receive Episode 1. There are reward levels which allow for season passes to follow-on episodes of ZoomerangKidz Adventures.
Receive invitation as ZoomerangKidz guests to the ZoomerangKidz Completion event in Denver, Colorado.

Here at Fearless, we believe that a scared world needs a fearless church. A church that is bold, full of love, and full of faith. We have a heart to show the world what God is doing in and through Fearless LA, and the way we want to do this is by creating a documentary that captures the heart of this movement. Every movement has a sound that resembles it, and that sound is Fearless BND, the worship team of Fearless La. This documentary will take you along the journey of Fearless La, and the sound of worship that encompasses it.  
Donating to this project will make it possible for us to create, produce, distribute, and market this documentary to TV networks and Netflix. By donating toward this documentary, you are helping us reach the world with the message of Jesus and the story of Fearless. 
We are believing that people would come to know Jesus through this documentary. We are also believing for Christians to be inspired and ignited to share their faith, grow their local church, and be deeply rooted in their church community. We also believe that pastors and leaders will be greatly encouraged through this documentary, and that many will gain the courage they need to follow the voice of God in their lives after watching.
Thank you so much for giving, praying, and supporting this vision to reach as many as possible with this documentary, and ultimately, with the message of Jesus' love. We couldn't accomplish this goal without your partnership.

        The deets
We are teaching a Permaculture Design Certificate (PDC) Course and Appropriate Technology Course (ATC), back to back, May 28 through June 23, 2017. With 8 guest instructors, and a major focus on homestead-scale permaculture. The PDC will have a heavy emphasis on Design.
Instructor, Tim Barker
The tickets sold quickly for these courses. We have had a lot of interest from people wanting to purchase video footage of the courses. Someone suggested live streaming of the courses. 
Hard working permaculture design course students
Now we need some equipment to make all of this magic happen. So, here’s an opportunity for everyone who is interested to help out with purchasing some special equipment, and getting these amazing courses on film.
Rocket Mass Heater - amazing appropriate technology
Read all about the courses here: the Permaculture Design Course and the Appropriate Technology Course.
2015 Permaculture Design Course class
 Instructors
Our instructors and guest instructors were chosen for their expertise and passion, and will all add their unique and distinctive flavors to the courses.
Tim Barker, PDC & ATC instructor
Tim Barker, PDC & ATC Instructor
   Tim spends his time between Australia and New Zealand (and sometimes the US) as a semi-professional pyromaniac and mad scientist, teaching people how to burn stuff and make really cool machines and devices for low-carbon living. He has a history of teaching Permaculture Design Courses with Geoff Lawton and currently teaches appropriate technology for the Koanga institute in New Zealand and Very Edible Gardens (VEG) in Melbourne, to name a few.
Paul Wheaton, PDC instructor
Paul Wheaton, PDC Instructor
  Paul Wheaton, the bad boy of Permaculture, was proclaimed by Geoff Lawton in 2012 to be the Duke of Permaculture. He is the creator of two on-line communities. One is about Permaculture, permies.com, and one is about software engineering, CodeRanch.com. He is keen on making permaculture both beautiful and profitable.
Thomas J. Elpel
Thomas J. Elpel, Guest Instructor
 Thomas is an author, natural builder, educator and conservationist. He has authored multiple books: Foraging the Mountain West, Botany in a Day, Shanleya's Quest and others about plant identification, wilderness survival, and sustainable living, and has multiple videos. Thomas regularly teaches classes on plant identification, primitive skills and natural building. He is founder/director of Green University, LLC in Pony, Montana.  
Helen Atthowe
Helen Atthowe, Guest Instructor
 Dubbed Goddess of the Soil by Paul Wheaton, Helen is a master gardener, farmer and consultant. She had first hand experience with Masanobu Fukuoka and was a horticulture extension agent in Montana for 15 years. She owned and operated Biodesign Farm near Missoula, Montana for 17 years. She has been doing consulting for different vegetable growers, including a 2000 acre organic fruit and vegetable farm. She is now an advocate of veganic permaculture.
Ernie Wisner
Ernie Wisner, Guest Instructor
 Ernie is a botanist, educator, writer, researcher, rocket mass heater innovator, natural builder, and boat aficionado. He worked in the merchant navy and has tremendous experience with hydraulic and hot water systems. Ernie is semi-retired due to a disabling injury, but still makes time for the occasional workshop or fascinating prototype project. He co-authored multiple books with his wife, Erica, and is featured in many videos, documentaries and podcasts. Ernie studied permaculture under Ianto Evans and played a role in hosting Bill Mollison and Masanobu Fukuoka.
Erica Wisner
Erica Wisner
 Erica is a science and art educator, curriculum developer, writer, illustrator, researcher, and rocket mass heater innovator. She loves making things from scratch - anything from blueberry scones to the oven itself. Erica is a skilled educator and project coordinator, with over 15 years experience building teamwork and leading hands-on learning experiences. She and Ernie have taught numerous workshops on natural building and rocket mass heaters. Erica has written multiple books on rocket mass heaters, fire making, and survival shelters. She is featured in many videos, documentaries, and podcasts on rocket mass heaters.
Jacqueline Freeman
Jacqueline Freeman
 Jacqueline is a biodynamic farmer, author, and natural beekeeper. She is known for her gentle and understanding way with bees. She appears in the honeybee documentary, Queen of the Sun, and was hired by the USDA to work with rural farmers and beekeepers in the Dominican Republic using historic methods of respectful beekeeping. She lives on a farm in Washington state with her husband, Joseph, where they have orchards, gardens, two big greenhouses, a small forest, rich pastures and plenty of flowering bee forage. Jacqueline also has lots of experience raising livestock: cows, goats, chickens for laying and broilers, turkeys, and horses. She has two websites: SpiritBee.com and friendlyhaven.com.
Zach Weiss
Zach Weiss
 Protégé of legendary Austrian farmer, Sepp Holzer, Zach is the first person to earn Holzer Practitioner Certification outside of the Krameterhof training program. Blending a unique combination of systems thinking, empathy, and awareness, Zach uses an action-oriented process to improve human relationships with earth. Enhancing ecosystems and harvesting natural productivity over time is the ultimate goal - with high initial input, high yield systems that will last until the next ice age.
Zach currently has projects in 11 nations on 4 continents, spanning a wide range of climates, contexts, land-forms and ecosystems. Having experience with a wide range of techniques and systems (natural building, greenhouses, carpentry, watershed restoration), Zach also graduated summa cum laude with a degree in Ecology. He has two websites elementalecosystems.com and holzerpermaculture.us
Davin Hoyt
Davin Hoyt, Guest Instructor
   Davin is an architect, artist, and entrepreneur. He holds a Bachelor's Degree in Architecture and has 16 years of drafting experience. Davin has established two community gardens in Georgetown, Texas and he is the first to map Wheaton Labs. Davin practices architecture as a one-man firm and will soon be a small restaurant chain partner. He is the future illustrator of Paul's book on "Wofatis".
Reward Descriptions
$1 THANKS!
Support us at any level and you get everything in the "THANKS" level. We want to express our gratitude with stuff. Good stuff! Useful stuff!
Hugelkultur Micro Documentary
Hugelkulture micro documentary
  This was our "thanks" packagecreated for our "World Domination Gardening 3-dvd set" kickstarter. Hugelkultur is soil on wood. If you do it right, you can grow your favorite garden without irrigation. This video shows a dozen different hugelkultur sites and is packed with advice. 16 minutes long. kickstarter / dvds / microdoc.
21 Podcast Review of Sepp Holzer's Permaculture
Sepp Holzer's Permaculture review
  We review every page of Sepp Holzer's book on Permaculture, hashing through every detail. About 25 hours of content. book / 21 podcasts / sample
Care and Feeding of a Rocket Mass Heater micro documentary
Care and Feeding of a Rocket Mass Heater
  Switching from electric heat to a rocket mass heater reduces your carbon footprint as much as parking seven cars. This is a DIY wood burning contraption that heats your home with one-tenth the wood a conventional wood stove uses, and puts out about one one-hundredth the smoke. A 30-minute video showing five different people using a rocket mass heater and talking about their favorite way to light and care for rocket mass heaters. This was our "thanks" for our "Better Wood Heat: DIY Rocket Mass Heaters" 4-DVD set kickstarter. kickstarter / dvds / microdoc.
PDF version of the permaculture playing cards
Ebook of Permaculture Playing Cards
  Another kickstarter that did really well; and we had many requests that the cards be turned into a book. Each card covers a powerful aspect of permaculture. Some feature people, some feature a philosophy and some feature a technique. I'm told that it takes an hour and a half to read the ebook. kickstarter / cards / ebook.
Natural Beekeeping Presentation
Natural Beekeeping with Jacqueline Freeman
   Jacqueline Freeman is author of "The Song of Increase", a book about a very different style of relationship with honeybees. In this presentation she covers some of the practical aspects of raising bees. I've called her techniques "Reverence for Bees". The presentation covers "Treatment-Free Beekeeping".
Rocket Cooker/Canner/Forge Plans
Rocket Forge plans
  If you look at DVD 4 from the "Wood Burning Stoves 2.0" kickstarter, you will see where we had a contest between a J-Tube style-rocket cook stove and a propane turkey cooker. Naturally, the rocket cook stove won. Lots of heat for your big cooking and canning needs. And then we stumbled onto using the same contraption as something of a forge. Actually, a pretty good forge that doesn't need bellows. Erica Wisner has put that design into plans for you. And, as you can see above, Erica will also be one of our PDC instructors. kickstarter / dvds / plans.
Public Thanks
I've seen some other kickstarters do this and I wanna do it much, much better. They post your name to a facebook page where it is lost and forgotten within a couple days. We are going to post it to our thread at permies.com where we have perennial discussions. Thousands of people will actually look at the list for years to come.
