Hey there, Comics Party People (and other non-comics people who still like to party)!  
Comics creators Claire Connelly and Erica Schultz are known in both indie and mainstream comics circles as the second coming of Kirby and Lee. Maybe not, but at least in their own heads. They've partnered MANY times to bring the world such delightful stories as The Unauthorized Biography of Winston Churchill: A Documentary and Cheese: A Love Story, as well as "Bishop Takes Rook; Knight Takes Pawn" in the anthology This Nightmare Kills Fascists and Space Man (available here).
Well, they're collaborating again for STRANGE TAILS, starring the sci-fi space opera Eve: The Immortal Lobster!
 Eve is an oversized tale of alien lobsters fighting for freedom! YES! Lobsters and Freedom!  
Art by Claire Connelly
A Captain in the Jastogian Navy on the normally peaceful planet of Uisce, Eve's life is turned upside down when the warmongering Beurre invade her planet in search of Asin (salt). Eve assembles a small group of rebel fighters that make a last ditch effort at survival. The losses are many. Was the price of freedom too high?   
Art by Claire Connelly
Art by Claire Connelly
Claire and Erica are asking for help to fund a print run of Strange Tails, a book not only collecting the brand new, colorful comic Eve: The Immortal Lobster, but ALSO including new TECHNICOLOR editions of the popular favorites The Unauthorized Biography of Winston Churchill: A Documentary and Cheese: A Love Story . 
From Cheese: A Love Story, Art by Claire Connelly, Liana Kangas, and Matt Emmons
You heard that right! Claire and Erica have enlisted the help of Liana Kangas, Matt Emmons, Gab Contreras, and Cardinal Rae to give these stories the Wizard of Oz treatment! (Minus the flying monkeys.) 
From The Unauthorized Biography of Winston Churchill: A Documentary, Art by Claire Connelly and Cardinal Rae
That's 94 pages of full color awesomeness from these two incredible creators, rounding out what is lovingly known as the "Tail Trilogy."  
Cover by Claire Connelly.
A better look at Claire's INCREDIBLE cover! 
Art by Claire Connelly. Not commission for this Kickstarter.
Art by Claire Connelly. Letters by Cardinal Rae.
Art by Claire Connelly. Letters by Cardinal Rae.
Art by Claire Connelly. Letters by Cardinal Rae.
Claire Connelly (Co-Creator/Artist) is a cryptid that roams through the suburbs of New Jersey. She is best known for her off-beat mini comics and zines. Connelly has written, drawn, and published the mini series Black Eyes, Down with the Ship: A collection of Comics, The Long Year, and Bird Song, and is the artist on the series Animals written by Eric Grissom. Claire has illustrated several short stories for mini comics and anthologies, as well has drawn several covers and pin-ups for comics floating in the comic-verse.
Erica Schultz (Co-Creator/Writer) is a comic book writer and editor best known for writing Xena: Warrior Princess and Charmed for Dynamite Entertainment, her participation in DC Comics' first Talent Development Writers Workshop, and the award-winning, creator-owned crime series, M3 with artist Vicente Alcázar. Her latest work includes the Daredevil Annual for Marvel Comics with artist Marcio Takara and Twelve Devils Dancing with artist Dave Acosta for Action Lab Danger Zone. She just might be the Jersey Devil.
Liana Kangas (Colorist) is a freelance comic artist and a self proclaimed edgelord dog mom, working in both digital and traditional formats. With a lifelong love of comics and a professional background in marketing and outreach, she combined the two to pursue a full time career in comics; including being published in 2000 AD's 2018 Sci-Fi Special, Comic Mix's Ringo Award Winning anthology graphic novel Mine! to support Planned Parenthood, Black Mask Studio’s Black AF series Devil’s Dye, and Image Comic's Where We Live.
Matt Emmons (Colorist) is an up and coming comic artist and writer based in the Boston area. Raised on a healthy diet of 80s sci-fi and horror movies, these genres became an integral part of his work. Matt is currently a freelance illustrator that also self publishes his own comics, primarily Gardener,  with several shorter self-contained comics. He also runs a small clothing brand under the name Second at Best, using illustrations for screen printed and embroidered apparel.
Gab Contreras (Colorist) is a graphic designer, colorist, and illustrator from Lima, Peru. She has worked on several books for various publishers, most notably All We Ever Wanted: Stories of a Better World (A Wave Blue World), 2000 AD Summer Special 2018 (2000 AD), A Princess Of Mars, and others. She is also the layout artist and letterer for Editora Vuk, a Peruvian publisher of the Spanish editions of U.S. comic books such as The Walking Dead, Locke & Key, Invincible, Hellboy, and Star Wars.
Cardinal Rae (Letterer) is a letterer and graphic designer with Fenix Works, Inc. in New Jersey. They've worked with Image Comics (Crowded, Rose, Where We Live), DC Comics (The Coming of the Supermen), Dynamite Entertainment (Xena: Warrior Princess), A Wave Blue World (This Nightmare Kills Fascists), Dark Horse (Once Upon A Time Machine), Oneshi Press (Pack, Tracy Queen), and other publishers. They also designs logos for comic books and other comics related things. 
QUESTIONS OR CONCERNS?
You can reach out to Claire or Erica. 
THANK YOU FOR YOUR TIME AND SUPPORT!

BRiSK WORKS: A New, Innovative Approach to Job Boards
A job board that connects the job seeker to work that fulfills them.
BRiSK Works is an innovative new approach to finding a job AND finding the right applicant for your job. Traditional job boards bring back unimpressive results and confusing user experience on both sides of the job search. Companies are often hit with high and hidden fees, only to be let down with the resulting candidates. Candidates are overwhelmed and have a hard time finding the RIGHT job for them. It’s hard for everyone.
We’ve changed that.
In a nutshell – the mission of BRiSK is to better connect the job seeker to work that fulfills them. A job board and resume database that is FREE for companies to list their open positions, as well as provide other business services that they need from a central portal/profile.
How did BRiSK WORKS start? I’m glad you asked…
BRiSK was originally founded to provide a platform that would promote and support the lean and efficient operations of our affiliate company, Dental Temps Staffing Solutions (DTSS), LLC.  After developing BRiSK Ops 1.0, BRiSK turned to some of the nation’s leading job board/resume databases to supply us with candidates. In short, after receiving unimpressive results and a poor user experience, we realized a change was drastically needed, so we developed our own solution.
Benefits of BRiSK Works:
Free job postings for employers
No hidden surcharges or fees
BRiSK MATCH: a powerful matching tool to provide instantaneous and accurate matching of candidates, based on job requirements and on a scale from highest likelihood to lowest
Video Content: Upload personalized, high definition videos to enhance the messaging and communication for both candidates and employers
Networking Tools: enhanced opportunities to connect with employers and candidates
Targeted Advertising Available
BRiSK WORKS is designed to be the most advanced job board/resume database on the market, as well as the leading on-demand staffing platform designed to support a gig economy, as well as a business services marketplace that will support entrepreneurs and small-to-medium businesses.
PLAY

Our mission is to stimulate economics in central West Virginia by providing a place for musical artists to record their works and to better the community by reaching out to youth to find a productive way to express themselves.  he idea for Screen Door Recording Studios was originated in September 2015 and has since grown to have a physical location in downtown Buckhannon, West Virginia and the equipment required to create professional quality music. The founder of this organization is Shane Workman. His role as of now is to facilitate funding to get the business off the ground and to facilitate a clientele base in his local area. He boasts years of experience in playing instruments and recording and producing music.  Though we have no investors as of yet, we are adamantly seeking financial assistance to help get us on our feet so as to be able to more efficiently run this business.  Being the first recording studio of its kind in Buckhannon, West Virginia, it is hard to tell how much Screen Door Recordings will grow over the course of time. However, the town of Buckhannon hosts an array of musical acts without the means to piece together a professionally recorded product. This will give us a steady clientele basis with no competition established, so we expect to grow at an accelerated rate once satisfied clients spread the word and share their product with those around them.  Screen Door Recording Studios is our trade name and we are a Limited Liability Corporation. Our full LLC name is Screen Door Studio & Services LLC. Primarily we are a recording studio located in downtown Buckhannon, WV and our customer base will consist of musical artists and bands in Buckhannon and other parts of central West Virginia. While this is our target demographic we will keep an open mind to expansion of our clientele base and will treat customers from other regions to the same quality products and services. Currently there is no recording studio in the downtown Buckhannon area that offers high quality audio recording and mastering. This serves as a competitive advantage and helps us to aid customer needs that are not being currently met in the area. Another advantage is the years of experience the co- founders have with playing and producing music. Being a unique business in the area, we will be able to easily tap into our target demographic and establish a customer loyalty base with ease. We aim to tap into this currently unused resource to generate revenue and expand business. We aim to get our start helping grass roots artists record their works and utilizing social media as well as more traditional outlets such as word of mouth and distribution of the artists’ music to not only promote the performers but to expand our name as well. We believe that we can gain the vast majority of the market share with ease in that no other professional recording studio exists in the city limits of Buckhannon. Though this town is small in size, artistry resonates throughout it at a high frequency and we believe that having access to a conveniently located studio will stimulate more artistry in the community. Even more into this approach, offering lessons in music theory will help these prospective new artists hone their skills to create quality pieces of musical expression. Our market penetration strategy begins by recording and mastering tracks for a select handful of artists of different genres and promoting the finished products through social media. This should prove effective as it demonstrates the array of music we will be able to produce and social media is a cost- effective and efficient form of advertising. We will primarily utilize Facebook, but are willing to adapt to other forms of social media in the near future as well.

Este proyecto es un curso intensivo realizado para entrenar, capacitar y unir a la comunidad de danza en la ciudad, con maestros foraneos y expertos en su disciplina, para la formacion y union de nuestros bailarines, el financiamiento de este proyecto es para poder llevarlo a cabo mas que nada, pagar los viaticos de los maestros, y lo que haga falta dentro de publicidad y props para realizar el proyecto para nuestra comunidad, ya que el gobierno ni nadie nos apoya monetariamente, siendo que tambien para nosotros es una inversion a nuestra carrera.
Gracias a las personas que tengan pensado colaborar, estaremos eternamente agradecidos por impulsar la carrera dancistica de jovenes que estan empeñados en esta disciplina que nos mantiene fuera de otros malos habitos.

¿Tienes a algún buen gilipollas en tu entorno cercano? ¿Cuantas veces has pensado en reconocer la excelencia de esa persona en el campo del gilipollismo? ¿Has buscado sin éxito la mejor manera de expresar la admiración que sientes hacia tal profunda dedicación en ser un gilipollas cada minuto de su existencia? 
Aquí queremos acabar con este problema que preocupa a la gente todos los días.
¿Que queremos hacer? 
Queremos diseñar una forma fácil de transmitir la admiración que sentimos por el Gilipollas que hay en nuestra vida. Además, queremos fomentar sus ganas de mejorar. A través de Diplomas y cartas motivaciones especialmente diseñadas para gilipollas expertos, queremos que entiendan la admiración, respeto y cariño que sentimos hacia ellos.
Ayudanos a reunir al mejor equipo de personas capaces de lograr esta meta y a construir la plataforma donde todos los gilipollas del planeta puedan obtener ese reconocimiento y motivación que merecen.

Starbound is a big budget movie and in order to pitch it properly to investors, we want to have high quality conception art work done for our business plan. This conception art will show some of the film's key scenes. The art direction will be done by Pierre Fortin from Canada. Pierre's style is very close to the director's vision of backgrounds and characters.
Much of the conception art will also focus on two digitally created alien creature characters, Mr. Legs and the terrifying saber-toothed panther.
Starbound is a Sci-Fi family adventure brings together the flavor of a classic Swiss Family Robinson story together with a flavor of a Star Wars escapade in a high action space adventure.

"A journey into the split mind of a crazy man
Take a deep spiral into the deep depths of Mental illness, Depression, Anxiety and Dissociative identity disorder with this Diary of a dead man that spiraled into “Craziness”
What happened to him?
You Decide?"

POYECTO
“Tobías en el Fin del Mundo“ es una idea original de Goyo Carrillo que cuenta la historia de tres personajes que por circunstancias ajenas a ellos mismos deben salvar al mundo de su inminente fin. La obra sucede, en un inicio en Ensenada, Baja California y recorre otros puntos de nuestro Estado. PROYECTO Como colectivo nos interesa además de unir nuestra fuerza creativa, reactivar el quehacer teatral de nuestra ciudad, no sólo estamos trabajando para los niños de la ciudad, este proyecto nos abre las puertas a otros públicos también muy importantes de atender, los jóvenes.
SINOPSIS
Tobías, un simple trabajador de infonvit podría ser el héroe de la mayor de las catástrofes; el fin del mundo, y con la ayuda de una extraña en camisón y un adivino de la televisión, se enfrentarán a la más grande las aventuras para salvar a la humanidad.
ANTECEDENTES 
Dante Gaspar, Un Hombre en aguas peligrosas, estrenada en 2016 nos llevo a otros públicos y foros, fue seleccionada para representar a Baja California en la 37 Muestra Nacional de Teatro en 2016 y en 2017 participó en el 13 Festival de Monólogos Teatro a Una Sola Voz, Festival Universitario de Teatro, Mérida, Capital Americana de la Cultura, Encuentro de Teatro Tijuana, Festival de Unipersonales en Xalapa y otros foros nacionales. Apostamos a un trabajo colectivo donde confiamos plenamente en lo que cada creativo aporta al montaje.  
Dante Gaspar
EL COLECTIVO
Considerado como el grupo emblemático del teatro para niños en el Estado de Baja California el Colectivo de Teatro en Espiral fue fundado en el año 2005, y desde entonces ha cumplido su propósito de generar productos escénicos de calidad, basándose en un riguroso trabajo actoral y encontrando su particular lenguaje para acercarse a todos los públicos. Sus más recientes proyectos son: “Con-templar” en colaboración con el grupo de Danza Contemporánea Lux Boreal y “Nana” realizado en colaboración con Fundación Eos de la ciudad de Bogotá Colombia, ambos espectáculos para niños de 0 a 3 años. En 2016 estrena “Dante Gaspar, un hombre en aguas peligrosas” de Goyo Carrillo, resulta seleccionada para representar a Baja California en la 37 Muestra Nacional de Teatro 2016 y para el 13 Festival de Monólogos: Teatro a una sola voz en 2017, XX Festival Universitario de Teatro, IX Encuentro de Dramaturgia y XXI de Teatro, Tijuana 2017, Mérida Capital Americana de la Cultura y el Festival de Unipersonales Xalapa 2017. El proyecto “La Nave” resulta ganador de la convocatoria del Programa Nacional de Teatro Escolar en Baja California, el cual cumplió una temporada de 80 funciones en el Foro Experimental de CEART Ensenada entre octubre y diciembre de 2016. En 2018 el Colectivo estrenará “El Muro” de Elba Cortez dirigida a niños de 1 a 3 años, “Casa Caja” de Michelle Guerra para niños de 0 a 3 años y “Tobías en el fin del mundo” de Goyo Carrillo, una obra para jóvenes y adultos.
Colectivo de Teatro en Espiral

The Start
Being a bit cooped up recently, I started watching a particular animated show about the Pines family up in a strange, Oregon town, and I instantly fell in love and couldn't stop thinking about it.
At the same time, I've become more and more interested in oracle decks and tokens as "mini guides" for the day, and given the mysterious and fantastical nature of the show, I figured, "Why not combine the two?"
So, here you have it, a homemade, 24-card Oracle "deck of coins" that will come in a pocket-sized carrying case!
What to expect...
Given Kickstarter's challenge to make something at home, that's just what I'm doing. This set of 24 "coin" cards will be fully designed by me, printed on my Canon Pixma Pro-100 on French Paper Co. 140 lb. Cardstock, hand-punched out, and contained in a two-piece metal tin with a label on the lid.
Outside fo the tin, everything will be homemade! (That being said, I may solicit backers for requests for the final few cards!)
24 Cards in Total! Each measures 2.25 inches
These will be considered "Talismans" for your day. At the start of your day, or when you need some extra courage for a situation, you'll simply draw one off the pile and receive some guidance! The items are inspired by the show, many of which you will recognize and be able to interpret with your own associations with the item! But, of course, the suggested interpretations are based on the show's use. (My ultimate goal is to expand these out. If these are successful, there will be new sets with the same backings to build this into an even bigger oracle collection!)
They will be super compact and pocket-sized, as they are 2.25", printed front and back. Even in their black-tin case, they're travel size for any length of trip! 
Final Case May Be Slightly Different Based on Needs
As an additional bonus, while I've designed these using Blue as a spot color, you can Pledge to Pick Your Color and have a deck UNIQUE TO YOU! 
A few samples of what you can do to make a unique deck for yourself!
The Funds...
My goal is to simply get the cost of materials to make 50 of these decks, and cover some of the Kickstarter and shipping fees, which is why this has such a low funding goal.
Stretch Goals!
As this has such a low funding goal, I hope to add some cool bonuses for Kickstarter Folks!
$150 - A FREE, Vinyl Sticker for Pledges $8 and up! This will be created just for the Project!
$350 - I'll create and include a mini-guide to the deck that will fit into the case! It will contain additional information for interpreting your deck. This will come with EVERY DECK!
$500 - An Enamel Pin inspired by the deck and show! I'll design an enamel pin that will be included with Pledges $8 and up! This will be manufactured elsewhere.
Possible Setbacks
Since most everything will be handmade, there shouldn't be any problems or issues involved! That being said, if this does blow up beyond what I'm planning for here, it may take me longer to make and fulfill all of the orders, as this is a one-man operation.
The other possible delays are beyond my control, as shipping these days may cause some delays. Even more, if the Stretch Goals are hit, there could be a delay in the manufacturing and shipping of the stickers or pins.
If this happens, though, you'll hear it from me as soon as possible!
In general, though, this will be my Fifth Kickstarter, the previous four all being successful, and I have kept on track, on time, and provided what I proposed--and more in some cases!

As technology and methods of media consumption progress, sports journalism has lost quality. The industry has been taken over by yelling ridiculous statements and claiming it as a “hot take.” Great writers have been booted off of the internet to clear bandwidth for video-only sites. It seems that websites only create Clickbait to draw users. Once the site is opened, all the user finds is a page plastered with advertisements and poor content. 
That is not our goal. It is deplorable that sites bring in millions of dollars by exaggerating headlines that drive people to click on a link with no story. We want to bring an end to Clickbait and make sure that anything we post is relevant and worthy of its own page on the internet. It is important that media outlets provide content in all forms to best fit the needs of individuals while also keeping the quality that was found in “old fashioned” journalism. Sideline Intel does exactly that. It provides good content across multiple platforms. With time, Sideline Intel can become a driving force and perhaps an example in the journalism world. 
The money gained from crowdfunding will be used to finish building our website to perfect specifications and legal fees for making Sideline Intel an LLC, as well as marketing purposes to begin pushing our brand.

"The real winner in the Tchaikovsky competition" 
as the London Spectator called Debargue (July 2015)
  Lucas Debargue, a young French pianist, won 4th prize of the XV International Tchaïkovski Competition as well as the Moscow Music Critics Association Prize. And this is just the beginning!
The Documentary is seen through the eyes of his friend, Martin Mirabel, to explore Lucas' passion and shed light on his unique relationship between musicians and music. 
There have been many documentaries on musicians, usually when they are at the peak of their careers. The originality of the project is to follow Lucas Debargue, who is at the beginning of his career…
Juin 2015, Lucas Debargue remporte le 4ème prix au concours Tchaïkovski et le prix spécial de la Critique. Une nouvelle vie commence.
A travers les yeux de son ami et réalisateur du documentaire, Martin Mirabel, le film explore la passion de Lucas et met en lumière les relations entre la musique et les musiciens. 
Il y a déjà eu beaucoup de documentaires sur les musiciens, le plus souvent lorsque ces derniers sont au sommet de leurs carrières. L’originalité du projet consiste à suivre Lucas Debargue, qui est lui, au début de la sienne...
Молодой французский пианист Люка Дебарг завоевал на конкурсе имени Чайковского в Москве четвёртую премию и приз ассоциации музыкальных критиков Москвы. Началась новая жизнь.
Глазами его друга и режиссёра Мартена Мирабеля, этот документальный фильм раскроет страсть к музыке молодого артиста, а также осветит уникальную взаимосвязь музыкантов и музыки.
Много документальных фильмов делается о музыкантах на пике их карьеры. Оригинальность нашего проекта в том, что мы хотим проследить за Люка Дебаргом в начале его карьеры...
    Lucas Debargue is the perfect incarnation of his music. He reads it, talks about it, plays it and listens to it. The film delves into the details of the life of this young pianist and follows him in his discoveries and quest through music and all its galaxies.
The film is structured around three main axes, which correspond to the  axes that define and characterize all musicians: interpretation, composition and improvisation.  
These match with a country, an atmosphere and a temperament.
Le pianiste Lucas Debargue respire la musique sous toutes ses formes. Il la lit, en parle, en joue et en écoute. Le film entre dans l'intimité de ce jeune pianiste épris d'absolu et le suit dans ses découvertes et sa quête à travers la musique et toutes ses galaxies.
Le film est structuré autour de trois axes principaux correspondant aux trois axes qui définissent et caractérisent tout musicien : l’interprétation, la composition et l’improvisation.
A chaque axe correspond un pays, une atmosphère et une temporalité.
 Люка Дебарг является идеальным воплощением музыки: он это читает, говорит о ней, исполняет и слушает. Этот фильм углубляется в подробности жизни молодого пианиста и следует по пятам во всех его открытиях, в поисках в музыке и связанных с ней галактиках.
Структурально фильм делится на три основные сферы, которые определяют и характеризуют всех музыкантов в принципе: интерпретация, композиция и импровизация.
Страна, атмосфера и время происходящего – это то, что определяет каждую из этих сфер.
      Lucas and Martin met at university in 2007. At that time, Lucas had stopped playing piano. Martin himself had set aside his film projects to devote himself to literature. With time and support of Martin, Lucas got back to the music...
Lucas et Martin se sont rencontrés à l'université en 2007. A cette époque, Lucas avait arrêté le piano. Martin, lui, avait mis de côté le cinéma pour se consacrer à la littérature. Avec le temps et le soutien de Martin, Lucas s'est remis à la musique... 
Люка и Мартен познакомились в 2007 году в университете. В то время Люка прекратил играть на фортепиано, а Мартен отложил занятие фильмом, чтобы посвятить себя литературе. Со временем и с поддержкой Мартена Люка вернулся к музыке...
     "People are loving Lucas Debargue because he is a real musician. He loves music passionately and knows everything about it. And not only music. He has a brilliant knowledge of literature and art. The reach of his personality is unbelievable. He is kind of a genius, just a genius. If someone's playing with such a conviction and love, it will be transmitted. It’s 100% hypnotic: a hypnotic personality. The audience has no chance to resist such a personality and he has got a very strong one." —Pianist Boris Berezovsky to Russian Radio Program 'Orfei', July, 2015 
« There has never been a foreign pianist who caused such a stir since Glenn Gould's arrival in Moscow and Van Cliburn's victory at the Tchaikovsky Competition. » Olivier Bellamy, Huffington Post France, July 2015 
« First, the piece form Medtner is unbelievable! Additionally I doubt that anyone has ever heard Ravel’s Gaspard performed like this. The French pianist Lucas Debargue must be a another world. Simply the most miraculous playing. » Seymour Bernstein, pianist
  « Les gens aiment Lucas Debargue parce que c’est un vrai musicien. Il aime la musique passionnément et sait tout d’elle. Mais pas que de la musique. Il a une connaissance brillante en littérature et en art. La portée de sa personnalité est incroyable. C’est une sorte de génie, juste un génie. « Il n’y a jamais eu un pianiste étranger qui a causé une telle agitation depuis l’arrivée de Glenn Gould à Moscou et la victoire de Van Cliburn au concours Tchaïkovski. » Olivier Bellamy, journaliste et animateur radiophonique, Huffington Post France, Juillet 2015

The Brave Songs CD album is done!  It was a thrill and an honor to have musicians of the caliber of David Bragman, sound engineer, banjo master; L.J. Slavin on flute, mandolin and violin; Dennis Huston and Sol Dolnick.  Many others were involved with ths project, translating text to Arabic, Kiswahili, Hindi and Urdu:  teachers Hebba Abassi of Chicago and  Margaret Muthiga of Kenya, and Hayat Ahmad, a Canadian engineer who gifted me with a beautiful ghazal poem in Urdu, when I had simply asked for an Urdu  translation.  Eavon Ngo-Solis and her students wrote poignant narratives of their experiences as refugees and undocumented youth.  Joan Castro and I had the delight of creating a Rap poem with our Modern World History students at Sullivan High School.  Songwriters Jim Page, Anna Stange and Theresa Kubasak generously  let me share their songs.  The CD album is a 6-panel color digipak which has a synopsis of each song, and gives the grade level.  The art concept I had was beautifully executed by Arely Ramirez, a Little Village Chicago artist and former student of mine from Social Justice High School.  Graphic designer Renee Witherwax took Arely's scratchboard design and brought it to life!   This incredible artwork is also on the thank you cards and 11"x17" poster.
My intent is to advocate for the use of song, as a means for sharing the stories of how people young and old work and sacrifice for social change and a more just world.  I want educators to use music, and see the literacy benefits in building fluency and thus empowering the voices and experiences of young people.

The best magicians of the 21st century set out on a journey to search  for the lost author of the most legendary book about the art of  sleight of hand. 
S.W. Erdnase… the pseudonym of the man thought to be the most notorious card shark of the 19th century. His book “The Expert at the Card Table” is now considered the card conjurer’s bible, making it compulsory reading for any magician.
It took more than 30 years after its publication for the true value of the book to be appreciated – too late for the author to witness the success of his work and too late for all the magicians who would have enjoyed meeting him. His true identity is still uncertain and remains a great mystery, leaving even the best illusionists in the dark.
The greatest magicians of our time go in search of the long-lost genius. They talk about the rumors of his supposed suicide and other stories that will chill you to the bone. No proof of the many legends appears to exist, but in searching for him we learn the true significance of this book. Along the way, we are given valuable insights into the history of deception through the ages and the origin of some of the best-kept secrets of the contemporary world of magic.
The film is geared to magicians already familiar with the story of Erdnase as well as people generally fascinated by the art of the illusionist. It provides a glimpse behind the scenes of the contemporary and historic magic scene and explores the depth of human curiosity. The prevailing question of the film is whether it is better to be left in the dark and fascinated or enlightened and disenchanted. The phenomenon of how legends are made is also a central element of the documentary. Erdnase is an excellent example of the importance that can come to be attributed to a story or a person despite the fact that very little information is available about them. The aim is for the audience to critically examine what they think they know about their own role models. 
Production of such a film is hugely expensive. Although we already have some funding from the German Film Fund and a team putting an incredible amount of energy into the project, the costs of flights and other travel, technical effects, catering, equipment, costumes, props etc. are all adding up — which is where you come in. You have an opportunity here to support the project. By chipping in, you can help us make this film a reality. 
 We are a young German film production company with a focus on feature films and documentaries. Our director Hans-Joachim Brucherseifer has been a card magician since he was 15. He learnt the art of sleight of hand from “The Expert at the Card Table”. In this docudrama he teams up with the most influential magicians of our time in search of the elusive author of the book. 
 You can also follow us on Instagram, Facebook, and Twitter.
www.erdnase-film.com

As a medium that is described as ‘accessible’ and ‘easy-to-use’ the photographic - with its forever-changing digital technologies - is something that is still not in everybody’s reach. This artists project will develop an understanding of the photo booth and propose an alternative way to accessing, using and developing photography as an expanding medium.  This project is leading towards a public exhibition of emerging photography graduates in London (Free Range 2013), and will fund the production and display of new work.  Supporters of the project will receive versions of the work and publications as a thank-you.
As a fixed device the photobooth offers a limit for both camera and subject, and turns the subject into an object. Social and theoretical arguments surrounding vernacular ideas of photography often centre on the photobooth as a space where both formal documentation and leisure activities take place side by side, though few artists use the medium in-depth: the photobooth provides a historical recording of our existence, our passing through official processes (identification photographs) and leisure time (mementoes, records of play, and of romance): there is enough to be said about the current day functions of the photobooth and the reasons for its part within this project. 
The work will be initiated through a series of tests to understand not only the physical space of the photobooth, but its performance and functioning as a camera. The tests will explore the technical aspects of the camera including depth of field, auto focus and facial recognition. Whilst acknowledging the booth as a fixed studio, tests will be carried out to record the cameras reaction to a change in environment. In other words, the tests will challenge the camera to perform outside of its ordinary default settings.  These test will explore a range of photobooths from digital to analogue to home made. 
There have been around 20 tests made for this project so far using a Photo-Me booth. these tests are allowing me to understand how the photobooth can be used to make day-to-day imagery, and from this I will make a "how to" user manual for the photobooth reminiscent of the how to photography guides seen in bookshops today.  An additional project questions the ID photo by challenging its rules and regulations - the first set of these are shown in the project updates section.
The project will be part of my graduate show in London 2013 at the Free Range fair. The Free-Range show is held in the Truman building on Brick Lane, London. Free Range provides a brilliant platform for graduates to showcase their creative talents to a diverse audience in the epicentre of London's creative scene. This event attracts upwards of 20,000 visitors and is an excellent opportunity to show my work to an audience.  All backers will receive a personal invitation to this exhibition by post.
Fundraising: What I am seeking
I am aiming to raise £400.00 to help the production costs of this work which includes testing the photobooth, printing and production, for prints and publication, and presentation tests and final display costs such as framing and mounting; Any contribution will help sustain the production of my project and help produce final pieces for the show next year as well as a book. The work will in turn help sustain my practice as an artist.
About my work
I have provided links to my previous work '26 Photographers': this is another project that deals with social elements of photography, and its users within the framing of Amateur or Vernacular photography.  It questions the ownership of the photograph by delegating the role of the photographer out to various subjects - please feel free to take a look at this and other projects to get a feel for my interests and the work I make. 
Please get in touch if you have any further questions, I very much enjoy talking about my work and would be happy discuss this with you. Here are a few examples of the work produced so far....

A startup for Startups  
Entrepreneurs may have a hard time gattering official data required to get estimated values requiered to quantify the potential for their future businesses. 
Market Size Q is a self-service web app which uses official open data sources to get estimated Market Values for many available product classifications among countries.
The app allows entrepreneurs to get a free estimated market value with the possibility of acquiring an affordable full report with more detailed information about the market.
Website landing page (Screenshot)
Entrepreneur-friendly app
We want to develop a pragmatic way to get a standard market size report based in the following principles:
 User Friendly - Entrepreneurs don't have to struggle with excel and formulas. We created a self-service web app focusing on the user experience (UX) and User Interface (UI).
 Market reports - Reports uses official sources by country including Total Outputs, Imports, Exports and Employment data in order to get market value estimates and trends for more than 900 available product and services classifications.
 Efficient - An affordable, fast and reliable way to get basic insights required for a business plan.
Sample report header (screenshot)
Context
Open Data and Big Data have been growing during the last decade. Nowadays companies (from micro to big enterprises) may take advantage of public open data in order to make decisions and improve their business strategies.
In the other hand, dealing with databases and data processing may be a constraint for entrepreneurs who don't have the requiered technical background. That's where Market Size Q borns. We have the mission of support entrepreneurs with an easy-quick way to get their market value estimations without incurring in big expenses or traditional consulting services during the first phase of their projects.
We developed "Market Size Q" web in Python, which is an open source programming language broadly used by many big web companies like Reddit or Instagram.
So far we have uploaded and calculated Market Size values for more than 900 classifications in 3 North American Countries (Canada, Mexico and United States) , but we need to scale the project and develop a marketing plan if we want to reach the potential users among the world.
"Create a new report" screen
Success factors
We have 2 objectives in mind for the following months:
 Spread the word and achieve at least more than a 1,000 registered users by June 2020.
Include 3 new country databases in 2020.

Why we need funds?
 (70%) $4,000 usd of the funds will be used to Spread the word through marketing campaigns in Google Ads,  Linkedin Campaigns and Facebook ads.
 (17%) $1,000 usd of the funds will be used in fixed costs including 1 year hosting (in pythonanywhere.com), domain maintanance and 1 year of Google Suite for 3 users (used for email forwarding)
 (13%) $800 usd of the funds will be used in administrative processes including legal status for the startup hub in Mexico City.

【 Introduction 自己紹介 】
Shigeru Okada, I am a stop motion animator active in Japan.
I started to work as stop motion animator at the age of 33 and for 15 years I have been involved in the making of television shows, commercials, and other visual works.
I have also taught children in animation workshops and authored a book on stop motion animation.
オカダシゲル　日本で活動しているストップモーションアニメーター。
３３歳で業界に入り、１５年間、テレビ番組やCM・映像作品などの制作に関わる。
その他にも、子供対象のアニメーションワークショップで講師をしたり、
ストップモーションアニメーションの書籍を執筆。
【 Articles about this project / プロジェクト紹介記事 】
Rilakkuma and Kaoru Stop-Motion Animator Shigeru Okada Seeks Crowdfunding for Horror Project / Anime News Network
Interview / Anime UK News
【 About title / タイトルについて 】
YAGEN is a kind of mortar for grinding down a material of drug. roll the disk-shape back and forth.
薬研とは、 漢方薬などの薬の材料（薬種）を細粉にひくのに用いる器具。円盤状のものを前後に動かして材料をすりつぶすのに使う。 
YAGEN
【 Plot / ストーリー 】
The Depth of Yagen
Once upon a time in Japan, there was a poor couple living with their only daughter.
One day, the father, an avid gambler, sells his daughter to human traffickers in order to settle his gambling debts.
The traffickers, on their way back to the village with the man's daughter, decide to take a shortcut by entering the forbidden mountain.
The girl's mother pursues the traffickers into the mountain in a bid to reclaim her daughter.
The mother begins a terrifying transformation as the curse of the mountain settles on her. Yet, she continues her pursuit to save her daughter...
昔々、日本のある村に貧乏な夫婦と一人の娘がいた。
ある日、博打好きの父親が借りた金を返せなくなり、娘を人買い達に売り渡してしまう。
人買い達が娘を連れて町へ戻る途中、近道をするため、禁じられている山に入っていく。
母親も娘を取り返すために人買い達を追いかけて、その山へ足を踏み入れる。
山の呪いで母親が恐ろしい姿に変わりながらも、娘を助けるため人買い達に迫っていく…。
【 Characters / 登場人物 】
Atakichiro: Chiyo's husband. Timid and short-tempered. Never commits to anything for the long term. Accumulates debts through his love of gambling and sells off his daughter to settle them.
与吉郎（あたきちろう）：ちよの夫。気弱で短気。何事も長続きしない。博打好きで借金を作ってしまい、一人娘のゆきを人買いに売ってしまう。
Atakichiro
Chiyo: Atakichiro's wife. Lovingly cares for her daughter despite their indigent lifestyle.
ちよ：与吉郎の妻。貧乏な暮らしをしながらも、一人娘のゆきを大事に育てている。
chiyo
Yuki: Atakichiro and Chiyo's daughter. Her adult-like behavior belies her youth. Is calm, collected, and sharp.
ゆき：与吉郎とゆきの娘。子供とは思えない大人びた態度をとる。冷静で賢い。
yuki
Okiku: Purchases young girls to sell at a higher price to brothels. Was once herself a harlot. Trusts neither men nor women. Has no class. Has courage and is unexpectedly clever.
お菊（おきく）：若い女を買い取っては売春宿に高く売っている。元々は自身も遊女。男も女も信用しない。品が悪い。度胸もあって意外と賢い。
okiku
Yazahachi: Okiku's henchman. While he is loutish, he is also a serious person with great physical strength. Has feelings for Okiku. While not very clever, he will do anything for Okiku, even lay down his life.
八三八（やざはち）：お菊の子分。柄は悪いが真面目で力持ち。お菊のことを慕っている。頭は悪いが、お菊のためなら命もかける。
yazahachi
Sakichi: Okiku's henchman. Is quick to dismiss others. While he thinks he is very clever, he is actually not so. Dislikes Okiku. However, he plans to set up his own trafficking business and become like Okiku.
佐吉（さきち）：お菊の子分。人をすぐに見下す。自分は頭が良いと思っているが実はそうでもない。お菊が嫌いだが、いつかは独立してお菊のようになりたいと思っている。
sakichi
【 Production outline / 作品概要 】
A horror film made from stop motion animation techniques.
A total of five episodes, each lasting for about seven to eight minutes.
The short version (approximately three minutes long) will be made viewable for free on YouTube.
stop motion animation horror channel NARIOMARUDARKSIDE
The full version will be published on payable video viewing sites, such as VIMEO. 
(One episode: 300JPY. All five episodes: 1,500JPY)
Language: Japanese. English and Spanish subtitles will be added.
ストップモーションアニメーションを使ったホラー作品。
全５話で、１話が７～８分程度。
YouTubeで３分程度に編集したショートバージョンを無料で公開。
コマ撮りホラーチャンネル　NARIOMARUDARKSIDE
VIMEOなどの動画配信サービスを使ってフルバージョンを有料で公開。
（１話：￥300。全５話で￥1,500）
言語は日本語。字幕は英語・スペイン語などをつける。
【 Making / メイキング 】
The process of making the entire stop motion animation, fabricating the puppets and props, lighting, animate, editorial, and sound inclusion processes, will be described in a book. Photographs will be included in it and a digital copy of it as a PDF file will be made. It's not just introducing the backstage, I will use this work as an example to introduce how to make stop motion animation.
Making book SAMPLE DATA
A video version of the making will also be created by using footage taken during the process.　I will add a commentary to make it look like you are actually watching the work from small tips to tips.
Through these means, I would like to share my skills as a stop motion animator and encourage and assist others who are creating stop motion films. 
人形や美術の制作方法、照明・アニメート・編集・音入れまで、ストップモーションアニメーション作品を作るまでの工程を写真付きで紹介。PDF形式などで書籍形式のデジタルデータを制作します。単にメイキングを載せるだけでは無く、この作品を実例としてストップモーションアニメーションの作り方を紹介する内容にします。
メイキングブックのサンプルデータはこちら
制作中の動画を収録した映像バージョンも作ります。こちらも解説しながら、ちょっとした小技から上手く作るコツまで、実際に現場で作業を見ているような内容にします。
Making Movie Sample （メイキングムービーのサンプル）
自分が持っている技術をシェアして、自分と同じようにストップモーションアニメーション作品を作っている人達を支援したい。
【 Schedule / スケジュール 】
The project end date is set for this year (2019). Upon completion, the animation will be distributed through YouTube and other video streaming platforms. 
2019年内に完成目標。完成次第、YouTubeと動画配信サービスを使って配信を開始します。
【 Pledge / プレッジ 】
 The pledge that you can receive.
Pledge
 DVD BOX (There are 5 episode:paid version and Making book and Making movie) 
DVD BOX
【 Goal / 目標 】
There are many people in Japan who wish to become involved in the business of creating stop motion animations. However, there are very few opportunities available. By showcasing my work to the world, I hope to provide a case example in which people will begin to realize the viability of creating and distributing stop motion animations through video streaming sites, such as YouTube and VIMEO.
Furthermore, I wish to encourage more people to become involved in making stop motion animations. Ultimately, I would like to see more high-quality animations be created.
ストップモーションアニメーションを仕事にしたいと考えている人達は多いが、日本では業界の間口は狭く、仕事は少ない。自分の作品を世界にアピールし、仕事を生み出す場として、YouTubeやVIMEOなどの動画配信サービスを活用する実例を作り上げていきたい。
そして、ストップモーションアニメーションに携わる人達を増やし、面白い作品がたくさん生まれるようになることが最終的な目標です。
【 A personal request / お願い 】
My project will be an independent venture. As such, I will need assistance in terms of promotion. I would deeply appreciate it if you could share and advertise information about my endeavor. 
個人の自主制作なので、宣伝力が十分ではありません。このプロジェクトのシェア・拡散にご協力をお願いします。

After designing the first collection of Words of Heroes, I was hungry for more. Pin making is as addictive as pin collecting, and there's nothing quite as validating as an artist as having my own art, on display in other people's homes and lives. It brings me joy to see my work bring joy to others, and that's what I endeavor to do with this new pin collection.
This secondary collection is focused on characters who were not in the first, and especially beloved characters - whether they have been in the Marvel Universe since Iron Man 1, or if they're somewhat new favorites! Like the previous collection, each pin is 2 inches in height and done using hard enamel and screenprinting. Each pin will have two posts, which include butterfly clasps. There will be a final freebie for all backers, which is one of these designs in the form of your sticker. Every backer will get one sticker of their choice, and the option to purchase additional stickers will be available in Backerkit. There are no unlockables to follow in the hopes that, like the first collection, we'll be able to unlock more designs than the original twelve - if we get past the final design, then you'll be able to choose other characters to focus on! Art and writing have been some of the most important influences in my life. With these tools, I learned so much about myself, my identity, the world around me and how to structure my life. Something about art and writing can communicate deeper meanings, feelings, and ideas in a personal and relatable way. 
Much of how we structure our identity and ability to relate with this world has to do with the ideas and experiences we are exposed to. This development of self begins at a young age, and children are highly impacted by the ways others teach them about this world. Often, we don’t talk to our children about big things like developing identity, choosing education and breaking out of the boxes people are limited to, yet they have been some of the most important, influential things I have had to learn in my life. Why don’t we start talking to kids about this earlier? Well, sometimes its hard to find a place to start.
A photo of the artist, exploring the world of South America after taking control of their life.
For me, learning how to do this all started when I met my love, my life partner, Raven. At that point, without knowing there were other options, I had gone through public school and was desperately trying to discover how to be who I wanted to be, in a world where being myself seemed unwelcome. Raven introduced me to the wonders of self-directed learning and opened me up to the concept of having control of my own life, identity, education, and relationships. I have been working over the following years to continue learning, growing, and actively taking the driver’s seat in my life, something that high school simply never taught me to do.
Then, while studying gender studies at the University of Utah, I had the amazing opportunity to begin talking to kids about the same things I was learning. There was a notion of empowering children, giving them a space to speak about the big things they were thinking about, one of those being identity development. I was so ecstatic to see 8 and 9 year olds talking about and exploring things that I simply never had a chance to when I was younger! 
When it came time for our final assignment, we were told that we would write a children’s book about a turning point in our identity, a big moment that really changed things for us. Filled with inspiration and excited to put my years of art and writing experience to use, I leapt in immediately. I started to design full watercolor and pen pages, trying to capture the magic of the moment when Raven looked into my eyes and told me: “You can do anything you set your mind to.” I worked day after day, hurrying to meet the deadline. 
The Original Watercolor Pages
I still remember the magic of that first reading, watching the enraptured looks on the kid’s faces as they followed Ikiyo, my persona, and Raven through the story of breaking out of boxes and creating a magical life. After my final was finished, I set the book aside for a while, until later that year when I went to Not Back to School Camp. 
A camp that was designed for unschoolers, homeschoolers, and self-directed learners, 2017 was my last year of camp. However, camp was probably one of the biggest moments that changed my path besides meeting Raven and learning about a different way to engage life. As I watched all the younger campers, I had an idea. I pulled the watercolor pages from my car and decided to set up a reading during camp, while my partner Raven accompanied with music. Yet again, I remember enraptured faces and excited silence as I turned slowly through the pages, and when I was finished I was greeted by overwhelming enthusiasm. One of the dear staff members at camp approached me and communicated just how amazing the book was, how captured he was in the story and how it was the highlight of his entire camp experience. He told me that I should get the book published to be able to be an influence to others positively. 
A look at one of the pages, showing one of the main characters, Raven.
For a couple years now I’ve revisited the watercolor pages, making adjustments and trying to figure out how I would publish it, but unsure of what to do. 
Finally, with another push from that same staff member long ago, with encouragement from my partner Raven, I’m trying to embody the idea that I can do anything I put my mind to by finally finishing this project and offering it to the world. My story, my development, has saved me from dark, scared, small places where I had no idea who I was. If with that story I can touch even one child to break out of their boxes, to be themselves and to take control of their life, then I believe I will have changed the world. After all, children are our future, and empowering them to be unique, to take the driver’s seat in life, and to be themselves is part of giving them the chance to start this journey early and take the future into their own hands. 
A closeup of one of the pages, showing the magical world that Ikiyo and Raven travel to.
Help me share my story with others, see if we can touch just one little soul at a time, to make this world a better place for all of us.

Imprisoned in Burma in 1990 as the communists began to take over, Modi Thiranai, with no medical experience, became the prison doctor to hundreds of dying men. Meanwhile, his wife fled to northern Thailand in search of refuge where Modi joined her 3 years later. Today Modi, a Lahu man who is 90% blind, runs a dormitory to support the education of children from the diverse ethnic hilltribes of Northern Thailand.
The story of Modi Thiranai encapsulates the adversity and struggle of thousands of hill tribe people. His journey from school teacher to opium seller, from prison doctor to dormitory director, frames the resilience of the human spirit and the struggles that have faced minority groups for centuries.
Modi’s story needs to be told to bring attention to the importance of being a conscientious global citizen. There are two predominant ways to travel: one is to enjoy the sights, photo opportunities, and “splashes” of culture; and the other revolves around connecting with locals, hearing their stories, and experiencing their culture and way of life as they become family and friends. 
We envision a world where people are recognized for their humanness, not for their differences. Modi’s story in our documentary will help others recognize that these stories exist and it is possible for anyone to find their own inspiring “Modi story” while traveling with a conscious mindset. The first step to unite us as humans is to recognize our society’s ethnocentric disposition towards “different” cultures and then present an opportunity for altering this mentality. We are here to expose the wander-prone generation to a new kind of adventure, one that is human-centric and sustainable, and creates a sense of community that is necessary for our ever-expanding and connecting world. Our invitation to travelers is to consider slowing down on their adventures and be curious about the people around them and the rich stories they have to share.
Our Kickstarter goal is $6500 and that is to cover the basics needed for production (we’ll be hunting down post-production funding later), including the three of us getting to Thailand and staying there over the summer. If we don't meet the $6500 goal, no money will change hands (aka costs nothing to you and our project isn't funded). 
We have two higher goals: 
Raise $11,500; this will get us some solid film, audio, and lighting equipment in addition to getting us to Thailand
Raise $14,000 and we can buy some dream equipment to bring with us! Drones and gimbals are the dream; we wake up at 4am with jaw-dropping aerial shots of Huai Nam Khun dancing in our head.

I am currently a sophomore at the University of Nebraska.  I spend every day at a University smack dab in the middle of the country, and surrounded by flat farmland.  I am seeking a life-changing experience in a far away country.  It's a bit pricey, but I know I can make it happen one way or another.  I will be spending next fall in Montpellier, France and I want your help in exchange for bits and pieces of my experience.  I love to take photos and journal.  Writing is a hobby, and photography is a passion.  I am a French minor and know this will do wonders for my French.  Anything helps, so come along on this journey with me!  Please :)

Ethan Cogwheel is the pseudonym of an Italian author. He worked for seven years on the Smart Project trilogy, of which "Blackwood" is the first book. Seven years to carefully study the young-adult readers, to understand which story would have been able to amaze them. And he found it.
The trilogy is one great story, subsequently divided into three books. Blackwood is the first to be published. While the book received positive feedback from both young readers and adults, the booktrailer - which is the video of the project - was shown at the Venice Cinema Festival and at the Anteo cinema in Milan, finalist in the Booktrailer Film Festival and Trailers Film Fest competitions.

Blackwood plot
"Ethan Cogwheel is Unit Ninety-nine of the Smart Campus, a complex of buildings aimed at preserving the last remaining human nucleus. There, boys and girls are empowered in mind and body so as to ensure the continuation of the species. The role that everyone will have in society is imposed at birth, by assigning a number that indicates the value. When Mike One, at the head of the entire organization, proclaims a competition with the chance to go out into the world as a prize, the protagonist participates to escape the system. The disappearance of a Master, an unusual blackout, conflicting rumors and a mysterious auburn-haired girl are phenomena that Ethan cannot ignore, but he will have to concentrate to be able to pass the five tests of the competition and thus cancel his number"

If the structure may seem strictly dystopian, reading, you suddenly realize the numerous levels that the author has built.
A boy who grows up and desires his recognized individuality. The topic of school competitiveness masked and then faced. A look at a future that is a critique of the present. Blackwood branches out on several themes and deals with them in its gray future.
Blackwood cover

An explosive scene of action from Route 3 #3. Pencils/ inks Sean Damien Hill. Colors, Omi Remalante
  Route 3 is a super-powered road trip from hell. A Stone Mountain, GA teen finds out he’s been granted with a set of spectacular abilities, that he knows nothing about. He’s now on the run from a wide array of folks in a sort of super powered arms race across the Southeastern United States. Explosions, gunfights, telekinetic feats of awesomeness, and a little personal growth are all thrown into the mix.
We've collected all three issues of the first story arc into a superb collected edition that also includes a cover page gallery, "DVD" extras, and a forward by the talented artist/ writer Takeia Marie (Contributor to Rosarium Publishing's APB: Artists Against Police Brutality). 
Route 3 piece of art by Takeia Marie, featuring series protagonist, Sean Anderson
We are raising funds primarily to get the completed collected edition, Route 3 Vol. 1, printed.
Let me repeat this: 
THE BOOK IS FINISHED. COMPLETE. IN THE CAN. 
All three issues of the award winning comic book series are completed, and are ready to be placed into your hands.
All we literally need to do is raise funds for copies of the collected graphic novel, get the finished copy to the printer, and get the book in to readers, new and old. In addition to this, we're hoping to use these same funds to begin to get the books into a variety of locations, including future conventions, comic book stores, book stores, and libraries.
In addition to getting the book into you our awesome contributors, we have other perks available as rewards, and as possible stretch goals as you can see on the right side of this page.
The series has been featured on such websites as Comic Book Resources, Black Girl Nerds, Bleeding Cool News, and Comic Crusaders, won the 2014 Glyph Comics Award for Best Cover, and was nominated for the 2017 Glyph Comics Award for Best Reprint Publication for Route 3 Vol 1. 
Check out some of the awesome pieces of art from the Route 3 series with pencils/ inks by Sean Hill, colors by Ann Siri O'Brien and Omi Remalante, and award winning cover art by Anthony "Antboi" Piper.
The Route 3 Vol 1. cover, pencils/ inks by Sean Hill, colors by Lavata O'Neal

  Route 3 Team Bios (aka People You Need to Hire For Your Next Project): 
Robert Jeffrey II (Writer/ Creator): 
 Robert Jeffrey II is a freelance writer based out of Atlanta, GA, and his portfolio includes work in print/ web journalism, and comics. He’s written for J’Adore Magazine, The Atlanta Voice Newspaper, and Urban Voices in Comics. He is a guest contributor to the TesseraGuild.com and is the Editor In Chief for BlackSci-Fi.com. His comics work includes the creator owned titles Route 3 and Daddy’s Little Girl. 
His other comic book work includes contracted client work such as the Glyph Comic Award nominated Radio Free Amerika,Terminus Team Up #1, Stealth: The Life and Times of Allen White, and Soul of Suw. He’s also handled co-scripting/editing duties for clients such as the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), and international tire manufacturer Nitto Tires. 
Robert is a recipient of the 2008 Miller Brewing Company A. Philip Randolph Messenger Award/ Journalism Award of Excellence in the field of AIDS/Health, and his creator owned series, Route 3, won the 2014 Glyph Comics Award for Best Cover. In 2016 he was named as one of ComicsAlliance.com’s “20 Black Comic Book Creators on the Rise”.  In 2017 Route 3 Vol 1 was nominated for the Glyph Comics Award for Best Reprint Publication. 
He’s yet fulfilled his dream of pop-locking to save a community center.
Sean Damien Hill (Pencils/ Inks): 
Sean Damien Hill is a Washington, D.C native who is an accomplished artist, with specialties including fine arts, comic book penciling, and inking. Sean’s credits include penciling/ inking on such comic books as the Route 3 series, Terminus Team Up #1, and Vegas Baby. Sean Hill’s work has appeared in Jaycen Wise and The Secret of The Rose, and he is a part of the award winning creative team of which received numerous awards at the 2014 HBO/Cinemax Sponsored Urban Action Expo Awards. Sean was the penciller/ inker on the critically acclaimed, Zenescope Entertainment mini-series, Dark Shaman, and has contributed cover art to the upcoming Deathforce series.  
Anthony Piper (Cover Artist): 
Anthony “Antboi” Piper (Blk Ant) is a self-taught Chicago based illustrator & designer. Being a lover of video games, comics, cartoons, manga and hip-hop, he’s focused his career on providing illustration and design work for companies and artists in these particular industries. He also has a passion for advertising and marketing, and is highly conscious when it comes to aligning his illustrative style in accordance to his client’s “brand” in order to adapt and create a unique look for their product and marketing campaign.He received the Glyph Comics Award for Best Cover of 2014, for his cover work on Terminus Media’s Route 3 #2. Anthony is the creator of the popular Trill League series, and his numerous credits/client list includes work for Marvel Comics, the IDW Comics published Blaze Brothers series, and work as lead character designer on FOX TV’s Major Lazer and Axe Cop animated series.

Funding raised will be used to a) complete development of the manuscript; b) publish the book; c) develop professional training videos and related equipment/merchandise; d) hire a golf PR agency; e) cover marketing and travel expenses. 
Training sessions are typically one-hour and includes relevant instruction in the Yang long form of Tai Chi, and golf drills based on selected movements and postures from the form. The Tai Chi of Golf benefits all levels of golfers, from beginners to tournament professionals. 
Each type of student derives benefit from a different aspect of the methodology:.beginners will achieve correct alignment, flowing movement and efficient stroke production. Advanced golfers, on the other hand, will benefit most from the practice of breath control, improved clarity and focus, and the mastery of intent.
A major market opportunity for this product/service is China. The growth of the sport of golf there is exponential, and the principles of TCOG have been in their culture for thousands of years. Chinese translations of the materials developed is important.

Hello, my name is Katie Skelly and I'm a cartoonist in Brooklyn, New York. My comics work includes MY PRETTY VAMPIRE, MAIDS, THE AGENCY, and NURSE NURSE. I am also the creator of BAD GIRL TAROT, a 78-card tarot deck I produced through a Kickstarter fundraiser in 2018.
Creating BAD GIRL TAROT was a wonderful experience and opportunity for me to learn the language of tarot and interpret its coda in my style, and I'm so pleased that two years later people are still discovering and enjoying the deck. As time went on I found myself still thinking about how I could further connect my art with divination, and what I would like to see both visually and structurally if I created a brand new deck from scratch. And so after further research and encouraging words from followers I've created a new project: BAD GIRL ORACLE.  
BAD GIRL ORACLE tuck-box cover
BAD GIRL ORACLE is a 40-card divination deck meant to connect readers to the spirit and energy of bad girl archetypes using the visual language of genre film and pulp fiction. The archetypes represented balance qualities human and supernatural, authoritative and subversive, young and mature, corrupt and innocent, among others. The cards can be read on their own or used to clarify or complement a tarot reading, as tools for manifestation or meditation, or for entertainment. 
The BAD GIRL ORACLE cards include: The Acid Queen, The Alien, The Avenger, The Career Girl, The Cat Burglar, The Coquette, The Courtesan, The Cyborg, The Dancer, The Delinquent, The Demon Mother, The Diva, The Domme, The Earth Mother, The Femme Fatale, The Final Girl, The Gamine, The Goth, The Headmistress, The Heretic, The Ingenue, The Maid, The Mastermind, The Moll, The Muse, The Mystic, The Outlaw, The Party Girl, The Possessed, The Psychic, The Queen Bee, The She-Wolf, The Siren, The Spinster, The Star, The Succubus, The Vampire, The Widow, and The Witch. 
I'll be posting card art in progress on my site here: https://www.katieskellycomics.com/bad-girl-oracle
The cards may be read both upright and reversed, and the deck will come with a folded instruction sheet to provide guidance for interpretation.
 The deck pieces consist of:
40 cards printed on durable, high quality card stock
A custom printed tuck box
A folded instruction sheet
I will be using the same vendor as BAD GIRL TAROT, and all pieces will be produced in the USA. For visual reference, at 4x6 inches the BAD GIRL ORACLE cards will be slightly larger than the BAD GIRL TAROT cards:  
Using this Kickstarter, I am aiming to raise enough to cover the cost of printing and shipping the decks. If we are to raise over the initial fundraising goal, I'll expand the print run and add more ORACLE related merch, including stickers and pins. I have over 60% of the final artwork completed, and I conservatively estimate that the decks will be ready to ship by August 2020. I am keeping the rewards simple in order to get the decks in your hands as soon as possible.
Thank you so much for your consideration, and hope you'll back the first printing of BAD GIRL ORACLE.
Design for the back of the cards
Update 6/20/20: to say thanks to everyone for pushing the project way beyond its goal, all pledges $35+ will receive a BAD GIRL ORACLE enamel pin. THANK YOU!

Hey hi folks! I'm Alex Zandra, gamedev everything person, artist, writer, and light novel author—and I have a new book! I Signed Up To Be The Substitute Familiar Of A Struggling Witch To Pay My Bills And I'm Just Now Realizing What I Got Myself Into (or, Substitute Familiar) is my third light novel; it's about magic, witches, demons, and getting in over your head. It's also my biggest book yet!
Which brings me to this campaign: I need help to print it! It's too big to make a saddle stitch print, so it's going to be perfect bound like a paperback. However, that means the print run will be more expensive—and that's why I need your help!
Here's your chance to preorder the book, get some fun extras (like having it dedicated, get your name on the kickstarter backer appreciation page at the end of the book, commission custom sketches and stories, get turned into a demon) and help me make my third light novel a reality in print form!
If you'd like to read the digital version, it's available on itch.io (where you can find the first two chapters as a free demo) as well as Amazon! You can also find my earlier books Squid Maids (itch, amazon) and Cat Wishes (itch, amazon) there if you'd like! And if physical versions are more your style, you can order the print versions of my earlier works in this kickstarter too.
I printed a sleeve that I slipped over an existing book I had to give you an idea of what the finished product will be like; here it is next to my other books!
mockup of Substitute Familiar's print form
Thank you so much for your support! :D
UPDATE:
goals tbh
Oh my gosh we got funded!! :D I was planning to have to wait on these for a little bit more, but here are some stretch goals!
I had some savings put aside to help make sure I didn't need to ask too much from the campaign but you folks blew past that in record time! So here's what I had planned for beyond that: short stories! These would be in digital formats (PDF/ePub) and about the length of a single chapter. They'd give some additional backstory on existing characters, or a peek at things that happened off-camera in zandraverse books! I've wanted to do small stories like this for a while and this campaign should give me the resources and motivation to do it. ^^ Here's what I have in mind:
Tora's First Day: the origin story of Cat Wishes' intimidating tiger girl!
Penelope and the Council: this scene was alluded to in Substitute Familiar, but we never got to know what actually happened... until now!
Therapy Catgirl Tabbi: everyone's favorite striped catgirl from Cat Wishes finds herself a part-time occupation as a therapy cat!
(These are all text-only, but if we reach the illustration stretch goal, each story above and below will get exclusive art!)
A Drink To Amanda: time for Substitute Familiar's number one magical girl to shed some light on her origin story!
Of course, everyone who backs this kickstarter campaign at any level will get access to any and all stretch goal short stories as soon as they're made; but just in case, I've also added digital tiers for folks who want to support Substitute Familiar (and get just the bonus digital content) but who don't want or need physical things!
...and because everyone's been absolutely amazing, we reached the final stretch goals: cosplay photoshoots! I'll put together outfits for some of the characters of each respective book and take some pictures! :D (You can also bet I'll be in costume at future events where I table if I can help it.)
I'll also finally get around to taking that nap I really need. =_=
So that's all the stretch goals! Any money beyond this point will go towards making those short stories and cosplays even BETTER!
Thanks again so much for your support! I'm stoked that we made it this far and I can't wait to see how much further this campaign can go! <3
