On s’est souvent choqué face aux infos, en écoutant des débats ou de simples personnes discutant à la caisse du supermarché : stigmatisation, généralisation, stéréotypes et parfois, violence, agressivité gratuite ou autres actes dictés par l’ignorance… Quels que soient la cause, le sujet, le débat : c’est frustrant. Frustrant de voir des personnes suivre un mouvement, d’adopter des idées sans chercher à comprendre, et encore moins apprendre.
Nous sommes trois jeunes femmes et avons conçu le projet Work to Gather pour lutter contre les idées reçues et ainsi favoriser une prise de conscience menant à l’acceptation de l’autre dans sa différence. 
Pour cela, nous avons choisi un sujet sensible qui fait effectivement la une des média et alimente bien des discussions. En effet, nous avons grandi dans un monde où l’Islam est constamment stigmatisée et représentée de manière négative par les médias. 
Comme beaucoup, nous avons constaté à quel point la simplification et la généralisation des discours médiatiques ont contribué à la construction d’amalgames et au renforcement des stéréotypes dans l’imaginaire collectif favorisant ainsi le développement de l’islamophobie. 
Aujourd’hui, de façon naïve, nous nous posons une question : pourquoi sommes-nous incapables de vivre ensemble, de coexister, d’aller au-delà de nos différences et de nous voir les uns et les autres simplement comme des êtres humains ? 
Voulant sincèrement comprendre l’état d’esprit de chacun et répondre à cette question, nous filmons un documentaire appelé Togæther – une contraction de Together (ensemble) et To Gather (se rassembler) – sur la perception des musulmans aux Etats-Unis. 
Les attentats du 11 septembre ont marqué un tournant géopolitique majeur dans l'histoire de l'humanité et ont bouleversé la représentation de l'Islam et des musulmans en occident. C'est pour cette raison précise que nous avons ressenti le besoin de traverser l'atlantique pour réaliser ce documentaire. 
À travers ce projet, nous rencontrerons des personnes de toutes confessions religieuses et de tous milieux. Nous ferons des interviews, des portraits ; nous écouterons leurs perspectives, leurs points de vue et expériences ainsi que leurs anecdotes. Nous sommes conscientes que nous vivons tous dans des réalités différentes. Chacun de nous voit le monde à travers son propre regard subjectif. Nous interprétons la vie, l'histoire, les événements et l'actualité à travers le prisme de la réalité dans laquelle nous sommes ancrés. Dans ce documentaire, nous allons à la rencontre de musulmans et non-musulmans pour découvrir leurs réalités. Notre but principal est de construire des ponts entre les personnes, d'apporter une autre perspective dans leurs vies et de promouvoir des valeurs que nous considérons vitales pour notre futur : la tolérance et la coexistence. 
Ce documentaire se base sur l'idée que nous sommes tous liés les uns aux autres par notre humanité. Nous tenons avant tout à diffuser un message universel qui est de choisir en toutes circonstances le respect, la coexistence, la tolérance et la paix pour tous les êtres humains, quelle que soit leur religion, leur origine ou leur sexualité. Nous créons ce en quoi nous croyons alors autant croire et rêver à la lumière et à une humanité qui permet au meilleur de l’homme de se réaliser.
Au 1er juin 2016, cela fait déjà un mois que nous sommes installées à New York, berceau du melting-pot, où nous avons déjà eu la chance de nous entretenir avec des citoyens de tous quartiers et milieux, de rencontrer des personnalités telles que Sally ("Salwa") Shatila Kader qui est présidente et co-fondatrice de la Fédération aux Etats-Unis pour la Paix aux Moyen-Orient, des artistes tels que le rappeur Salim El Bey, l'acteur Abraham Makany qui a joué dans des séries comme Person of Interest, Blindspot ou encore Homeland, de jeunes étudiants de l'association étudiante Muslim-Christian Dialogue, la journaliste Sarah Harvard, et d'autres personnes aux profils divers et variés... 
New-York offre une riche mosaïque culturelle que nous avons pris plaisir à explorer tout au long de ce premier mois. Néanmoins, afin d'enrichir le contenu de notre documentaire nous ne voulons pas nous limiter à la population New-Yorkaise. Pour la suite du projet, nous envisageons donc de rencontrer d'autres anonymes et figures importantes dans d’autres régions des États-Unis (Washington DC, Philaldelphia, Chicago, Los Angeles et San Francisco). 
Le financement Kickstarter sera consacré plus particulièrement aux dépenses que vous pouvez apercevoir sur le camembert ci-dessous pour les prochains mois.
Merci de croire en nous et aux valeurs que nous désirons transmettre à travers ce documentaire. Nous tenons également à vous remercier pour le soutien que vous apporterez au projet.
- English version -
Work to Gather project is an initiative created by three young women who hope to connect people despite their differences.  
To do so we chose to address a particular topic, the perception of Muslims in the US - an issue at the core of one of the most divisive political and media conversation. We have grown up in a world where Islam is stigmatized and portrayed negatively by the mainstream media, witnessed the simplification and generalisation of media discourses around Muslim Faith and watched all of this build up stereotypes conflating Islam and terrorism, causing inherently the development of Islamophobia.  
Today, we would like to ask a naïve question: why are we still incapable of living together, to coexist, unable to see beyond our differences and incompetent to see each other as human beings?
We sincerely want to understand the mindset of each and answer this question, by filming a documentary called Togæther - a contraction Together (together) and To Gather (gather) - on the perception of Muslims in the United States. Through this project, we meet people of all faiths and all backgrounds. We will do interviews, portraits; we will listen to their perspectives, their views and experiences and anecdotes.
We are aware that everyone lives in different realities and to see the world in different lenses is an endless possibility. Each one of us views the world through a prism that reflects our own version of it. Our interpretation of everything we take in, shape our life experiences and biases, both positive and negative; from encounters and relationships to situations and our view of the world. These form our beliefs, values and expectations. However, as a coin has two sides, so does every story. For this documentary, we reach out to Muslims and non-Muslims to uncover their realities.
It's been a month since we are in New York, in a cradle of cultures and melting pot where we had the opportunity to meet people from everywhere and different social classes, as Sally ("Salwa") Shatila Kader who is a peace activist and currently leads United States Federation for Middle East Peace programs and events at the United Nations Headquarters in New York City and around the world, artist rapper Salim El Bey, actor Abraham Makany (who played in Person of interest, Blindspot, Homeland...), a group of students who are a part of Muslims Christians Dialogue student's union, activist and journalist Sarah Harvard... And many more!
New York has a very diverse cultural mosaic that we enjoy to explore. But we would like to visit other cities to have a better understanding of the perception of Muslims in the US. The next step of this project is to meet more people and peronnalities in other cities as DC, Philadelphia, Chicago, Los Angeles and San Fransisco.
The funding is dedicated to complete our budget for the future trips; plane tickets, accomodation, communication, post production, broadcasting and transport. More details on a pie chart above.
Thank you for believing in us and in the values that we aim at conveying through this documentary which we hope will reach as much as possible. We also want to thank you for the support!

Our Story 
Could I breastfeed in this? This is the number one question nursing moms ask themselves before getting dressed. Women should not have to sacrifice style and comfort for functionality! To solve this problem, Le Regard Apparel created The Emery suit and The Lucie dress to provide stylish post-partum clothing with functionality, longevity, class and comfort. These staple pieces simplify women’s lives as professionals, stay-at-home moms, or momtrepreneurs. Being a mom should not hinder your professional life.
Nursing moms struggle to find functional, stylish, and comfortable clothing. As a new mom, I faced that reality – the lack of nursing-friendly attire. Like most moms, I had to return to work outside the home soon after the birth of my daughter. I searched the market for clothing that will cater to the nursing mom’s most pressing need, enable her to breastfeed conveniently, and simultaneously flatter her post-partum body. The clothes I found resulted in either stretched necklines or extra fabric on my baby’s face.

Let's save Studio Corazon.
  Why did we decide to run a campaign? 
PLAY

Although it sounds cliché, we believe that every crisis is an opportunity. For us, this is the perfect opportunity to reinvent ourselves. We realized that the education, music, and entertainment industry migrated one hundred percent to the digital world. Even though this switch to digital was already happening before this crisis, we were way too comfortable in our adorable studio in Santa Monica to see this change.
Time to get out of our comfort zone and bring Studio Corazón to the digital world!

Project:  We want to create an easily accessible digital platform for Studio Corazon to share our passion and knowledge for salsa & bachata with the world.
For the development of our platform and the future development of an app, we need to raise a total of 8,000 dollars.
We firmly believe that with everyone's help, we can make this project a reality.
Instead of asking for money, we came up with the idea of creating an exchange: "our knowledge for your support."
So we created valuable rewards according to the amount donated that will, for sure, keep your dance training exciting!
VINTAGE DVD's

Proposal: In dance, like in life, every action has an equal reaction.
"Our knowledge for your support!"
We created a course that will help our community to continue connecting with music and dance as a reward for any donation made to our project.
VINTAGE DVD's
Vintage Salsa: The Magic of Salsa is a three-volume course so the user can learn salsa from the basic to the most advanced level. Vintage Salsa Vol.1 Vintage Salsa Vol. 2 Vintage Salsa Vol. 3.
This course is so vintage that you can get it on DVD but no worries you will get a digital version also.

Made with Yak fiber from the Tibetan Plateau, and an amazing natural fiber called Tencel, we have engineered three lightweight baselayers that excel in the most extreme environments, and can handle anything you put them through.
As outdoor adventurers we are constantly striving to go further, higher, lighter and faster. Stay warm and comfortable with our yak wool baselayers while you explore the world and push yourself to the limit.
  Peak to Plateau was founded by Stefan Warnaar, a young Kiwi entrepreneur looking to create the World’s Best Baselayers. Stefan first stumbled upon the benefits of yak wool when he spent three months in Mongolia, Central Asia and the Himalayas. He spent his time living with local herders and nomads, surrounded by yaks, goats and sheep.
Realising the huge, untapped potential of yak fiber, Stefan returned home to New Zealand and has since sought to make a difference in the outdoor clothing industry. Peak to Plateau was born and the real journey had just begun.
Inspired by the people living on the Tibetan Plateau and their way of life, we set out to develop yak fiber into outdoor clothing that could outperform anything else on the market, and would allow you to hike, ski, climb or travel in the most extreme and beautiful environments.
By sourcing the fiber directly from the Tibetan Plateau we ensure that we get the best fiber, and the yak herders are guaranteed a fair income. Yak fiber is collected every spring from communities in the North Eastern region of the Tibetan Plateau. The fiber is then cleaned and sorted, and only the superfine 18 micron fiber is used by us.
It has taken 12 months working with the leading suppliers and manufacturers in the industry to develop fabrics and products. Trial runs, developing samples, and months of testing have finally paid off and the results are amazing. Now we are ready to launch our new products, and have big plans for 2017.
  Named after the holiest mountain in Tibet, the Kailash is the first item on the list for any adventurer — whether your hiking, skiing, climbing, mountaineering, or travelling. Wear it all year round under your waterproof jacket, or as your only layer when the sun is out. The 1/4 length zip gives you full control over your temperature, so you can focus on what matters. Say goodbye to the hassle of adding or removing layers when the weather changes.
  Inspired by people always on the move, the Nomad is simple and comfortable, and ready to go wherever you take it. We think of it as a symbol of freedom — the freedom of movement it allows, and the freedom to experience things in our own way. Wear it everywhere you go, whether it is adventuring in the mountains, or relaxing in the hut after a long day.
  The Namtso Tee defies expectations, just like the high altitude Tibetan lake that it's named after. Wear this lightweight, comfortable tee year round thanks to the perfect blend of Yak and Tencel fibers that keep you warm when it's cold, and cool when it's hot. Stay fresh and dry, and always ready for the next adventure.
  With a focus on performance, comfort and style, we started with a tailored cut that functions as well as it fits. We then added raglan sleeves so you can freely move your arms without restriction. Flat seams are used to get rid of chafing, and the seams are placed away from where rubbing occurs (such as under the arms, and on top of the shoulders). An extended torso doesn't ride up and gives extra coverage and warmth. We placed our labels with care, so they stay out of your way and don't itch and scratch.
  Measurements refer to body size, not garment dimensions. If you fall between two sizes, choose the smaller size for a tighter fit or the larger size for a looser fit.
The chest measurement is the most important if you are unsure of your size. The tailored slim fit means that our garments fit men as well as women, however women may want to select the size down from normal (e.g. if you are normally a S you may fit the XS better).
   It all begins with the Yak — evolved to survive at temperatures down to -40 C and altitudes up to 5000 m, and used by nomads on the Tibetan Plateau for centuries. The soft down under-fiber collected every spring is the secret to a yaks ability to get through the winter.
  The perfect fabric is a combination of warmth, breathability, odor resistance, durability and comfort. That is why we have blended yak fiber with Tencel. Our 65% Yak 35% Tencel blend means that we can take advantage of the properties of both fibers, and create a fabric that has never been done before.
  Tencel is softer than silk, stronger than steel and more absorbent than cotton. Made from the fibers of the Eucalyptus tree it has all the properties that make it the perfect choice to blend with Yak — strength, durability, comfort, and breathability. Plus it is produced with an award-winning eco-friendly process.
    By helping us, you are helping the yaks herders we work with, because none of this would be possible without them. Tibetan herders are facing a tough choice — stay and keep their way of life, or leave everything behind for the city — Yak fiber is an opportunity that will keep them connected to their culture and way of life, but also provide a source of income and a connection to the world around them.
We need to reach our target to complete a full manufacturing run. To be able to work with the best manufacturers we need to be able to reach their minimum order quantity. Backing this campaign will ensure that we can get the first of many products into your hands, and continue to work with our yak herding communities.
Photo credit: Steve Hicks, Dai Luo, Jody McIntyre
We have extensively tested our products in New Zealand, which is the perfect testing ground for serious outdoor adventure. Our products have also been worn in Chile, Argentina, the United States, Canada and more. Now you can start wearing Peak to Plateau for all of your adventures and travels.
  Make sure to let others know about our campaign! Thank you for your support, and we can't wait to see you wearing Peak to Plateau.

What are you doing?
     We’re making a yearbook and creating future journalists, dynamic leaders, and successful students along the way!!! Yearbooks are a tradition for many middle schools across the country, but that tradition is just beginning at The Pinnacle Charter Middle School this year. Prior to this year the college-prep middle school students had been briefly included in The Pinnacle Charter High School yearbook. But this year is different. For the first time the middle school students at The Pinnacle Charter School in Federal Heights, Colorado, are creating, designing, selling, marketing, and leading the FIRST EVER Pinnacle Charter Middle School (ONLY!!) Yearbook. But we need your help in making this project happen!
Our Cover Sketch
Why is yearbook SO important?
     In a day and age when elective classes are being cut and trimmed from schools, yearbook class remains a great educational experience for all involved. Jostens, a yearbook printing company, has published a list of 30 skills students learn by being a part of yearbook/journalism classes. These include technology skills (business software, desktop publishing, photo-editing software, online design, online research), life skills (communication, leadership, time management, project management, problem solving, writing, photography, teambuilding, conflict resolution, public speaking), journalism skills (concept brainstorming, reporting, researching, copy editing, photo editing, graphic arts, public relations, media law, design), and business skills (budget planning, promotion and advertising, marketing, selling, customer relations, market research).
     These skills will not only help students in middle school, but will carry them into success in high school, college, and beyond. In fact, The Newspaper Association of America in 2008 released a study showing that students who participate in their school’s newspaper or yearbook scored better on college entrance exams and demonstrated better writing and grammar than those who did not.
     The yearbook students also have an opportunity to showcase their artistic, academic, and leadership talents outside of a traditional class and athletics. For many of the 32 staff members, yearbook class is their first taste at creative freedom and leadership. All five of the 8th graders in the class have been given a leadership position this year. For some of them it is their first opportunity to have such great responsibility and earn their peers’ respect.
     In addition to brightening the future of the students involved in yearbook class, the yearbook helps the student body by representing everyone from school in the book. The goal of the Pinnacle Middle School Yearbook staff is to have every middle school student in the book three times. This creates a whole picture of the student body, not simply a snapshot of those most involved. 
How much do you need?
     We’re trying to raise $4,000. This is two-thirds of the total $6,000 we need to produce and print 250+ copies of the yearbook. The 250+ production number is important because this keeps the cost of the yearbooks to $30 per book and will provide a very small reserve to purchase one or two digital cameras for the students to use. We believe, through survey responses from students, many students will purchase a yearbook once printed. However, buying it after it is printed makes it difficult for us to front the money to print the books from our non-existent budget, especially since this is the first year of the class and product.
     The Pinnacle Charter School operates grades kindergarten through 12th grade, with approximately 56 percent of students on free or reduced lunch plans. This means that asking many students to purchase something they have never seen before and do not quite know the value of is asking too much. In the past the middle school students did not have their own yearbook and thus many students did not purchase one. However, through a survey we have discovered that many students want to purchase one this year, but either do not know what a yearbook is or do not have the money. 
     If we are unable to order an adequate number of books, we may have to refund the yearbooks purchased so far and all of the students’ hard work and effort will be for naught. We truly believe with some generous community backing we will be able to produce an amazing book that captures the year and provides students with memories for ever.
What will the money go toward?
     The money raised here will go toward printing the remainder of the unsold 250 copies of the book to keep the costs at $30 per yearbook. These yearbooks will then be sold or given to students determined to be economically unable to afford to purchase one and deserving of one by counselors, administrators, teachers, and peers.
     The money we make back from the sales of the yearbooks, or that remains from this project will be used to purchase cameras for the Pinnacle Middle School Yearbook course. The staff currently has access to only one camera -- a 10-year-old camera that was graciously donated to us – to share among 32 excited student journalists. By being able to purchase more cameras the students will be able to put the photography skills they have learned to use and capture more memories of the student body for the yearbook.
What else can I do to help?
     Pass this along to everyone you know! Every dollar will help us meet our goal and make our class better this year and in the future. You can also donate digital cameras you no longer use or even your time. We could always use volunteers.
Thank you!

The Starlet and The Viper
This is a film that has been a year in the making. From conception to writing to plans, to schedules, we are ready to bring this vision to life! The Starlet and The Viper is an independent fiction feature film. The film explores society, living conditions, social structure, and corruption in an American town through the eyes of a 24 year-old woman out for answers. 
This baby right here!
What is The Starlet and The Viper About?
The film follows Grace Idle, a 24 year old woman, as she attempts to uncover the mystery behind her fiance's suicide in this hard-boiled modern noir, told in the style of an Alex Cross mystery. An outsider by nature, Grace, is forced to penetrate the elaborate inter-workings of her city and its more insidious underbelly when the body of her former fiancé, Michael Dunne is found floating in a remote river. Grace can't seem to shake the hysterical phone call from the top of a bridge that she received from Michael the day before his body was discovered. A call in which the police have claimed to be proof of his apparent suicide. From the highest-ranking political power to the lowest-level burnout, no one is above suspicion of murder. As Grace infiltrates the social and political web more deeply, her theory solidifies and each player's role becomes clear, from the mystery woman who has offered her help, to the shifty police department. Grace may soon be ready to make her case, even if it's too late for her to get out.
Want to see what the film is intended to look like? Here is the Lookbook for the film! 
Is it Going to be Good?
It's totally going to be good! I've spent a year working on the screenplay for this film and we have a lot of pre-production worked out. You may find yourself asking "Who are you to be doing this?"  I'm honored to have some awards under my belt. 
Best Youth Film in the San Antonio Film Festival: The Light Monster 2011
Best Short Documentary Film in the Aesthetica Film Festival: Shotgun Education  2012
1st place San Antonio 48-Hour Film Festival 2009-2011
Best Short Narrative: Chicago Film Festival 2013
Best Short Narrative: Manhattan Film Festival 2014
Best Short Film Script: Screencraft Contest 2014
I have also sold a half an hour pilot script to NBC      
I also have a reel for your viewing pleasure!
Another way you can participate, besides donating, is to SPREAD THE WORD about the project! E-mail a friend, share it on Facebook, post it to an online forum, make smoke signals... any way you can get the word out is a HUGE help.
Feel free to ask me any questions you have by using the "Send Message" link at the top of this page.Thank you for your support!
*Music by, Stevie Rey who will score the film!
Personal Story
I've been asked about my personal connection to the story, and why I started it in the first place. When I was younger my best friend committed suicide and I refused to believe it. I know I was simply going through the stages of depression, but the denial stage lasted significantly longer than the rest. I suspected a lot of different reasons for her death. I went through a lot of different situations that could have happened to her before accepting the reality that she was sick. When I began conception of this film, I started with the idea of "What if I was right?" What if there was this woman who was in the same position I was in? Told the same things I was told. But what if she kept pushing? What if she found a secret reason why this apparent suicide was not a suicide? The story is basically my thoughts while going through my experiences. I want to share this story because I feel it has a great progression of the characters to the point where you end up caring about them as much as I do.

I am kicking off this KickStarter in the hopes that I can raise enough funds to start this new podcast. This podcast will focus in on regular people doing pretty cool things. I believe most people would enjoy it because they'd be able to connect with the guest and my hope is that by listening in they'll make an effort to live the life they want, not the life they have now. 
By bringing in a wide selection of guests there will be something for everyone. Whether you're thinking of going back to the gym, school, or starting your own business hearing other people that took the risk and listening first hand to the struggles they overcame will guide you in the right direction.
The episodes themselves will run un-timed, unscripted and uncensored meaning the conversation may lead wherever the guest would like. It won't be a boring interview like setting, guests will be welcome to talk about what they feel is important and what has made them successful as well as giving the audience a few pointers to guide them in the right direction.
Podcasting is expensive, and I will need to allocate the money to buy new equipment (microphones, headphones, mixing board) as well as renting a studio to record the episodes. That's not taking the time and money needed to engineer the episodes so that they are of the best quality. 
As for myself I am a 30 year old Jack of all trades/Master of none. As I updated my resume for a new round of interviewing I realized I had experience in a lot of fields. I've met some really interesting people along the way and thought it would be pretty sweet to record some of these people in 1-on-1  episodes.  I reached out to many other people and there is about 10 episodes lined up as well as many on the fence. Once they hear a few episodes I'm certain they'll see the podcast is a great idea for them personally and professionally.
Anything you pledge really, really helps. Costs add up quickly! If you'd like to pledge but can't right now I completely understand (that's why I'm running a KickStarter.) I still hope you come check the podcast out. We'll be starting soon. So give us a listen.
TheCoolKidsTablePodcast.com
-Hector Aguilar

Add flexibility to your Jasper or Duchess gaming table!
Introducing Geode Gaming, a 3D printed gaming accessories company.  We’ve been 3D printing for years, both as a hobby, educationally, and professionally, and now we’re launching, focused on tabletop gaming and the community.
Today we’re launching a line of accessories designed to upgrade the Jasper and the Duchess gaming tables (produced by BoardGameTables.com™)
Product Details
Jasper Cup Holder/Wine Glass Holder compatible mounts
These cup holder mounts were designed to be compatible with the Jasper’s dove-tail style cup holders and wine glass holders.  Use these to:
Add Jasper Cup Holder mounts to your Duchess table or add new mount locations to the long edges of your Jasper table.
We think corner mounting the cup holders on the long side of your table are great for:
Accommodating left and right handed players in all seating positions
Giving more seating options to sit closer to the center of the table with smaller gaming groups
Giving you the ability to have more than 1 cup per player at the table for larger parties
Support squeezing more than 6 players around the table, each with a cup needing a home
  Jasper Side Table compatible mounts
The side table mount was designed to be compatible with the Jasper’s dove-tail style side table.  Use these to:
Add Jasper Side Table mounts to your Duchess table or to add new side table mount locations to the long edge of your Jasper table. 
Add two cup holder locations to the corner of your table
We think corner mounting a side table (or two cup holders) is great for:
Giving your DM/GM/Rules reference designee somewhere to sit manuals at the table without taking precious gaming space
All the benefits of a corner mounted cup holder, plus the flexibility to double up on cup holders, or a side table - the ultimate mounting flexibility for your Jasper accessories
  Jasper Wine Glass Holder Riser
Give your wine glasses a lift.  This riser lets your glass sit comfortably, and allows you to pick up the glass closer to how you’d pick it up were it sitting on your dinner table.
The wine glass riser features a large chamfered ring to be compatible with many different diameter wine glasses, and even some other glasses you might not be comfortable with in the normal cup holder. 
Bonus feature!  The wine glass riser can easily be rotated to give you (some) added safety against your elbow knocking your glass out of the holder.
Don't have Jasper Cup Holders, Wine Glass Holders, or a Side Table?  No problem.  Boardgametables.com™  offers the cup holders for sale without a gaming table, so you can get some to add to your Duchess, or pick up some more for your Jasper table.
Don't have a gaming table? Want to upgrade your gaming setup to a Jasper?  Good news everyone!  BoardGameTables.com currently has a campaign running for the Jasper with some new stain and shipping options.  You can check out that campaign here, and if you missed it, you can late pledge on their website.
Update - New use case added for Side Shelf Mounts and Cup Holder Mounts!
We've added a new use case for the mounts, based on the suggestion of a Backer.  You can now use your mounts for storage of up to 6 cup holders/wine glass holders below your gaming vault!
To store 6 cup holders (three per cross-support under your table), add 1 Side Shelf Mount and 1 Cup Holder Mount to each cross support.
Mix and match up to 2 mounts per side to store 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, or 6 cup holders.  Bonus, the Wine Glass Riser can be flipped to the underside of the wine glass holder to be stored with the wine glass holder.
Installation
All pledges that include at least 1 Cup Holder Mount or Side Table Mount will also receive an alignment tool.   
The alignment tool inserts snugly into the underside of the cup holder and side table mounts.  It features a built-in spacer to set the mount at the correct distance from the gaming vault on your Jasper or Duchess table (to prevent interference when installing a cup holder or side table) and also features a handle to hold onto while installing. 
Here’s a link to the installation video we made, showing how you’ll install the mounts onto your Jasper or Duchess table: 
All pledges will also include the necessary mounting hardware, which has been selected and thoroughly tested to be safe for installation in your Jasper or Duchess table without the risk of protruding through your arm rests, or risk of splitting the wood.  NOTE: If you’re installing these somewhere besides your Jasper or Duchess table, you must pre-drill the wood before screwing them in.  Some hardwoods run the risk of splitting, if not pre-drilled.
Manufacturing and Materials
All of the accessories offered in this campaign are planned to be 3D printed in house on our print farm.  All printed parts will be made of engineering grade PET based materials.  What does that mean for you?  It means that unlike other 3D printed parts you may have, which are likely printed out of PLA, these parts have some significant advantages:
PET printed parts do not degrade over time
They do not deform from being left under load - so no reason to take that side table off after you’re done gaming
They also flex, instead of crack - great for those accidental bumps, and repeated load cycling
  We are offering color options for all the printed rewards as well.  You can match your gaming room, your gaming surface, or pick a color that will blend in with the stain color of your gaming table.  Select from the following 10 colors, or mix and match:
Blue
Orange
Teal
Black
White
Grey
Purple
Red
Yellow
Green
  So, PET based 3D printed parts are just awesome, no downsides?  Not exactly… If you do some searching around, you’ll find no shortage of print quality issues to overcome when using PET.  Fortunately, we’ve got you covered.  We’ve spent considerable time fine tuning the models and the print settings to achieve excellent quality straight off the printer.
We’re also exploring some post processing options.  If the volume of parts far exceeds our planning, we will also explore other methods of fabrication (injection molding, etc) to help you get your pledges quickly.
Rewards and Add-ons in Detail
All pledges include the required mounting hardware and alignment tools for the parts you’ve pledged for.  We’ll be sending out a survey at the end of the campaign for you to let us know what items you’ve over-pledged for, and what colors you’d like everything printed in (selectable by part).
We have an “Early Beta Bird” pledge level which gets you all of the following, and ships shortly after the funds have been received after campaign closing:
1 Side Table Mount
2 Cup Holder Mounts
1 Wine Glass Riser
All Required Mounting Hardware
$30 of Add-on credit, to be used in the campaign survey
  Note that with the Beta pledge level, the Add-on credit items will ship in your choice of colors, along with any additional Add-on items you over-pledge for, in the normal fulfillment window.  You’ll receive 2 separate shipments.
There are three normal pledge levels, all with unlimited time, unlimited quantities, and all supporting Add-ons by over-pledging.  The table below summarizes what you receive for each of the three pledge levels. 
The following table lists all the Add-ons and their pricing.  For the Add-ons, the shipping is included in the price listed in the table. 
New Add-on Packs!
These Add-on packs are offered to backers in all shipping regions and extend the discounted pricing of the Maximum Flexibility and the + Storage pledge levels for however many packs you'd like.
Add-ons for international backers cost slightly more, to account for the added costs of customs and taxes.
 As an example, we’ve calculated some of the over-pledge amounts for various pledges with Add-ons.  If you have any questions, please do ask in the comments about the appropriate pledge, and we’ll help out.
Looking for international shipping?  Please comment and let us know where your gaming table lives.
 When the campaign ends, we’ll be using Kickstarters built-in survey to find out what Add-on items you’d like, and what colors you want each part printed in.  There will not be a pledge manager, so please do over-pledge before the end of the campaign if you’d like to add any additional items at their Kickstarter pricing.  After the campaign closes, late pledges will be done through our website, at pre-order pricing, which will be higher than the Kickstarter launch pricing in this campaign.
Thank you!

ABOUT US
Founded in June 2017, The Warblr is a New York-based digital media site that incorporates elements of Buzzfeed, The Onion, and HuffPost. We are dedicated to bringing readers quality content across six verticals: 
Politics
Satire
Entertainment
Arts + Culture
Food + Travel
Lifestyle
  ORIGINS STORY
In early June 2017, over bottomless brunch in the West Village, Ying and Hillary both agreed that they were tired of crying over the Trump administration. The ultimate antidote to crying? Laughing. And most importantly, having as many people as possible join in. 
Over time and after much brainstorming and trial and error, the direction of The Warblr became two-fold: Laugh, but also contribute in ways that are meaningful. In instances where news is just too serious to incite laughter, long-form opinion essays are where we turn raw emotion into potent narrative, particularly through our op-ed writers who bring depth and personal experience to national events and crises. 
  HOW THE FUNDS WILL BE USED
We are ready to take The Warblr to the next level. The funds will be deployed towards immediate needs to remain competitive, including increasing traffic, improving data analytics, and building out a stronger backend of tech support. 
And as any sharp mind in digital publishing knows: Video is king. Beginning in 2018, we plan to roll out video content across our verticals, establishing The Warblr as a true full-spectrum digital media brand. 
  MEET THE TEAM
Hillary Adler is Co-Founder and the Editor-in-Chief of The Warblr. She is a New York City-based poet and journalist, and holds an MFA in poetry and fiction from The New School. Her work has appeared or is forthcoming in New York Magazine, Marie Claire, The Huffington Post, The Poetry Foundation, Bustle and elsewhere. She can be found on Twitter @HillaryAdler.
Ying Cheng is Co-Founder and CFO of The Warblr. She has degrees from Dartmouth College, Cornell University and the McGill University Faculty of Law. She works at a full-service law firm in New York. She enjoys running, good writing, eating well and spending time with her dog.
Chala Giron is the Managing Editor for The Warblr, and a poet and writer residing in England. She holds a BA in Literature Studies and Creative Writing from Roanoke College and an MA in Creative Writing from Lancaster University. She spends her free weekends traveling and eating food. Her work has appeared in Tidal Echoes Literary Journal and Green Rush Daily. She is currently working on her first novel.
Aisha Sidibe has had a deep love for books her entire life. She was nine when she began to share her writing. As a multi-ethnic writer, intersectionality has been a driving force behind her work. She is working on her first memoir and learning her fifth language – German. She hopes to perfect both by 2020. Aisha is an adjunct instructor at the City University of New York. She lives with her husband, a fiction writer, and two sons in New York.
Eric Griffin is an LA-based writer and artist, and the food and drink writer for The Warblr. His work has been featured in various art exhibitions in Virginia and in media outlets such as the Huffington Post and past catalogs for the Scholastic Art & Writing Awards. He has also been nationally recognized at Carnegie Hall for a piece that earned him Scholastic’s American Visions award. His client outreach spans multiple states, with mural commissions in Alabama and Los Angeles, and graphic design work for companies working out of Southwest Virginia. Eric is currently working towards a graduate degree in computer animation in Los Angeles.
Virginia Valenzuela is a poet, essayist, and yogi living in Manhattan. She holds BA’s in Creative Writing, Literary Studies, and Women’s Studies, and a minor in Film Studies. She is a second-year MFA candidate for Poetry and Creative Nonfiction at The New School. She writes about entertainment, films, and lifestyle for The Warblr. Her work has appeared on the Best American Poetry Blog and will eventually find its way elsewhere.
Hollie Ferguson is an editorial intern for The Warblr and a journalism student at the University of Alabama. Her work has appeared in The Tab, Odyssey, Thought Catalog, Green Rush Daily and elsewhere. She loves writing, exploring, and playing with rescue pups.

In the Lost City of the Inca, Diane takes a Kodak moment with Mallku, renowned Peruvian Shaman and author, and Hebert Jordan, the Shaman of Machu Picchu, before conducting a full-moon eclipse Energy Attunement Salon.
Welcome to Angelic Reality's Energy Attunement Deck, a completely new invention from an ancient tradition.
I was an Emmy Award-winning art direcor when I died and 7 Chakra Angels brought me back into my body. To this day they continue to inspire and guide my life of painting, recording albums and conducting Energy Attunement Salons internationally - salons that connect people with their inner power, and with each other.  And Kickstarter is providing this fabulous opportunity to bring my work directly to you.
I am happy to introduce two completely new tools I created  to help you bring fresh perception to any situation, make healthy choices in each moment, and share this power with others.  These tools are a fine-art deck of 49  cards illustrated with my original paintings, called the "Energy Attunement Deck", and its companion, the "Mystic Tapestry" which locates each card in a matrix of Energy Centers that mirror ourselves.
 The Energy Attunement Deck
49 fine art cards reflect the Energy Centers within each of us, and help us connect and communicate deeper things in a fun way.
The Energy Attunement Deck first showed up in my life as a notion. I have been conducting Path of Illumination Salons for one to hundreds of people, from venues throughout the Americas to the crop circles in England, and leading guided spiritual tours to sacred places - from Alaskan glaciers to Machu Picchu, Peru.  
I saw firsthand how these experiences can empower us with the fresh perspective, and even bring us to life-changing realizations.  And  I thought, How can each of us connect with, refresh and empower ourselves -  everyday, on our own?  So I began a long process of inventing the tools to do just that.  
The Energy Attunement Deck and Mystic Tapestry are my reward. You can put them to work in any number of ways. Draw a card for the day, or for a specific question. Draw 7 cards for a full read. Hold your own salon with just you (and the 7 Chakra Angels.) Hold an Energy Attunement Salon with others. Play an "Express & Guess" game with friends. Or simply practice each card with yoga-like interpretive motion, to activate your energy and feel the flow.
The cards are simple. Each of the 49 cards has a one-word essence (the title of its painting) that finds its place on a matrix called the "Mystic Tapestry".
The Mystic Tapestry
The Mystic Tapestry is also simple. Unlike the conventional vertical column of chakras stacked on the human body, the Tapestry's matrix of 49 positions  articulates a much more complex view of life's energy into a clear and simple organization that makes sense - and gives each of us much more personal content to understand and work with.
Seven vertical columns of activated energy intersect seven horizontal rows of receptive energy centers. Colored ribbons match each card to its place on the Tapestry, and reflect the healing modality of its color, as well as each color's healing sound frequency.
At every point on the Mystic Tapestry where an activated energy intersects an energy center - there is a card with it’s Essence.  
The Mystic Tapestry casts these cards into a nexus of relationships and dynamics that mirror us at any moment, offering the opportunity for contemplation and fresh insight. Draw a card, and let your self-discovery begin. You are your instrument. The Energy Attunement Deck and Mystic Tapestry are your tools. 
Chakras and Angels...
Our knowledge of Energy Centers derive from ancient teaching of chakras (which means "spinning wheels" in Sanskrit), a name for concentrations of specific energy related to specific portals in and around each of us. Western science finds their corollary in our "glandular system" - regulating mood, metabolism, crisis response, etc. 
Scientist Candice Pert broke the old convention when she identified the way our intelligence resides in our cells. Likewise, my body of work sees each of us as "a community of Energy Centers".  Each center, or chakra, has its own specific gift that we can call on to support our other six centers, and our whole wellbeing.
For example, we can call on the Chakra Angel "Innocence" to help us activate our Power Energy from our solar plexus to support our Love Center, our Heart Chakra. This is the card "Choice" inviting you to contemplate what this alchemical experience means to you in the "now" moment. In this way your Energy Attunement Deck becomes a "self-coaching" tool.
The 7 Chakra Angels hold their places in the deck and tapestry as the guides for activating the Energy Centers. "Destiny" is the Chakra Angel for our gift of Grounding, "Passion" for the gift of Relationship, "Innocence" for Power, "Freedom" for Love, "Patience" for Expression, and "Grace" for Insight. "Joy" supports us with the unconditional loving energy of our Soul.
"Diane's work is beautiful and powerful...it is really needed in this crazy society.  Many people are looking for peace and joy....the kind Diane can give them with her work."    
 Lydia Kramer
All the things you can do with your deck:
Read Your Cards: 
Choose a card for the day, or reflect on a particular subject or question.
Rhiannan displays her 3-card "Cause & Effect" reading
Draw 7 cards for a full card spread reading to develop more perspective - 1.“Here/now", reflecting you in the "now" moment, 2.”Cause”, 3.”Effect”, 4. “Foundation”, and 5.“Illumination”. Then draw two "Go Deeper" cards and cross any cards you want to contemplate further. Give yourself a reading, and give a reading to a friend.  
Hold your own Energy Attunement Salon: 
The cards are all about process. I designed them to serve the process  expressed in my Path of Illumination Energy Attunement Salons, “a gathering of people who love the truth”. 
PLAY

Your Energy Attunement Salon can be a few hundred close friends and a rock band celebrating the 7 Chakra Angels, or four cards over dinner for two. The Energy Attunement Deck is a perfect formula for any occasion.  
Laci and Joe experience a read for their newly arriving baby, Jude, and cross "Integration" (Soul supporting Grounding in the world) with a "Go Deeper" card, "Legacy" (invisible footprints of the Soul).
You don't have to worry about these cards wrecking an event. They are "baby-safe" - a new and fresh frame through which to view whatever you bring to your cards.  You do the interpreting.  As I always ask, "What does this mean to you?"
Practice the Deck: 
Much like a Yoga that you interpret yourself. You can’t go wrong. Why shouldn’t connecting with your own energy be a pleasing, relaxing, physical experience… a practice? And you can come out of it aligned and refreshed for what’s to come.
Kristen practices the "Play" card in a "Cause and Effect" read, bringing Soul Energy (1) into her Power Center(3). before she's off picking up some Grounding Energy (4) for her next card.
Play the Game: 
Engage friends and family in an "Express & Guess" game and have fun acting out - and talking about - real subjects. This game is about you.
Draw a card, act it out, pass it to the winning guesser to explain and choose the next actor! Audrey guessed "Play" and then got straight to the point.
 Text a Card to a Friend:
Herald their birthday; Offer a moment of support; Make a statement; Share a sentiment; Give a fresh view to a question or issue they’re facing.  As funding exceeds our goal we'll hire web wizards to build our card app that will  make this easy on your iPad or phone.
The Energy Attunement Deck brings insight and fun, anywhere, any time to anyone, in just about any situation.  
It’s a New Year’s Resolution:
Start your New Year right with a daily dose of fresh energy and insight.
Your Energy Attunement Deck
However you use it, you have chosen a first-time-in-the-world, artist proof original, ready to give years of fresh insights, quiet reflection and active fun - any time, anywhere.  No batteries, plugs or software required -  You are the software and the power.  Includes 7 Chakra Angels.  
Our Project:
We’re market-ready!
After years of work, and over $300,000 personally invested, my body of work is ready to publish and market market. Our team is fully engaged in this Kickstarter launch, and are already preparing our “Post-Kickstarter Beyond”. 
We're a great team.

In the event we exceed our Kickstarter goal, we will expand our business with larger print runs, additional card apps, printed books, outreach and support to our growing online community.

This is a feature film we shot in March and April this year on location in London, Dungeness and Chipping Norton.
The story was written by Andrew Keatley (whose new play, 'The Gathered Leaves', will be on at the Park Theatre from July 15th - August 15th) and developed by our incredibly talented cast - Jacob Casselden, Sophie Roberts, David Acton, Carolyn Pertwee, Rita Davies, Racheal Joseph, Daryl Jackson, Nicholas Bishop, Christopher Doyle and Grace Goulding. The film looks and sounds amazing, thanks to our cinematographers Iris Lebrun & Scott Norris and our sound recordist Guy Fixsen. 
We made the film with our own money and now we just need a little bit extra to pay for post-production and to finish the movie to the highest possible standards. 
This next stage is expensive. We need time in an editing studio and we need to record a score and grade the picture. So we need your help. We can't do this without you!
Any help you can give us will make a huge difference and we can't emphasise enough how much your generosity is appreciated. Now the filming is completed have a sneak peek of some of the raw footage. 
We feel like we have the potential to make a great film that we hope all of you will one day enjoy.
Thank you so much for your help!

In humanity, there have been so many tragedies based on fear. Where fear exists, hatred grows and humanity, for a time, ceases to exist as it should. Our country and the world around us has been faced with hard choices. We can choose to live in fear of the unknown or we can choose to let our humanity rule in our hearts. The threat of terrorism looms over societies across the world, and yet, it has tragically effected many with no place left to go. People have lost homes, family members, and their way of life. They have become refugees, desperate for safety, stability, a place to go on living until war and fighting stops destroying their homes. Many refugees are small children and some who are alone with no families. So many of these children without parents and siblings to watch over them have been lost to sex trafficking and have disappeared from the safety and protection of communities. We cannot allow fear to drive us from the humanity of helping those in need. My painting series is to expose the vulnerability of refugee children to give a face to the supposed “enemy” that has created so much fear. In creating this series, it is of the utmost importance to me that I do not promote propaganda with the portrayal of random sad faced children. On the contrary, my work will represent hope, dignity, and humanity. This series will initially consist of twelve portraits and will continue as an ongoing project.

Synopsis
Maroon is about a boy who runs away from home because he believes he can find a better life somewhere else... "How about the woods?" 
While cold at night and regretting his decision, the boy is knocked out by an unknown force in the middle of the woods. He awakens in an encampment of boys who were all run-aways. The boy is treated badly and forced to fight against an opposing group of kids. 
Why
We have made videos/shorts for a long time now, and thought we were ready to step it up a notch. We are creating Maroon to learn, grow, and have fun. 
Georgia Woods
 Helping Without Donating
You may not want or be able to donate, but you can still help! Tell your friends and family about the movie. We need all the support we can get! 
Friends Living their Dream
Cole and William, and much of the cast members have been friends for a long time. To see a group of kids come together to bring something like this to life is just mind-blowing. Kids really do have a potential that can become a meaningful part of your life.

Ever feel like our government is OUT OF CONTROL?
Gardener turns activist in this compelling story with real answers. Find out the secrets to taking charge, the way this country was meant to operate. If you've ever felt that Congress is doing a horrible job, this is an entertaining read that will give you actionable solutions.
How your support will help:
With your pledge, we can spread the message of organizing a tsumami of activism to wrest control of our government from the cronies and special interests who think they own the USA! Your support will promote the book's important message of specific tools of empowerment through book sales. The author will tour political events, activist rallies, conferences, colleges and book stores. In the first six months of book sales, Judy will be traveling California to give talks, partner with activist groups and faith-based communities, listen to voters, and blog about her experiences.

– Mary Hatch, Campaigner for Ross Perot
The U.S. Government is Broken!
In Search of the Next POTUS (President of the United States) tackles the seemingly impossible task of making Congress work!
In this true adventure, food activist Judy Frankel shows how to combat corruption in Congress while choosing a qualified leader for the White House. Her humorous and heartbreaking crusade to overhaul Washington from the top down navigates the pitfalls of being a David in Goliath's world.
Now is the Time To Take Control of the U.S. Government!
Judy illuminates today's unpublicized political landscape to reveal a six-point plan that is gaining momentum in grassroots groups across the United States. Without having to wait for Congress to get their act together, In Search of the Next POTUS gives voters the power to fix the U.S. government for good.
Join Judy's impassioned battle to safeguard our future.
About The Author
Judy Frankel is the founder of Writeindependent.org, an interactive federal elections website. Public speaker and blogger for Huffington Post, she motivates audiences to get money out of politics and engage in democracy. As a master gardener and food activist, she fights for healthy water, air, soil, and seed freedom.

How the Book Works:
The book works to fix Washington by explaining the process through the Six Step Plan.
The nucleus of the Six Step Plan is the Pledge for Honest Candidates, which addresses gerrymandering, the electoral college, Citizens United, and campaign reform. To receive a free copy of the Pledge, click this photo:
Discover the Pledge for Honest Candidates that will clean up Congress
Do you have a huge desire that isn’t being addressed because our government is controlled by money? Want to prepare for the effects of climate change? Want to stop the Trans Pacific Partnership because you’re afraid that companies like Monsanto will sue our government, thus making taxpayers into their piggybank? Do you want to protect net neutrality, stop fracking, or get off fossil fuels?
We can stop the cronies and the monopolies from writing their own laws. No more taxation without representation. No more financial institutions extracting money with their Ponzi schemes and opaque market practices. The tools in this book are exactly what the American people need to revolt without violence! Find out the specific actions that local communities have been taking to change the course of our country.
With your support, we can spread the message of organizing people power to take control. Join Judy as we ramp up to the 2016 elections, and take part in making history.
#applepie can save the country!
How your support will help:
The purpose of your support is to promote the book's message through book sales at political events, activist rallies, conferences, and through social media. In the first six months of book sales, Judy will be traveling California to give talks, partner with activist groups and faith-based communities, listen to voters, and blog about her experiences.
Your money goes to Writeindependent.org, a 501(c)(4) nonprofit designed to promote voting and clean elections. All proceeds are tax exempt, which means we use every dime to meet our objectives. Donations are not tax deductible. Gifts greater than two hundred dollars will be recorded with the Federal Elections Commission. We run a totally transparent organization!
As election season ramps up and word of mouth for the book spreads, Judy will travel to as many of following states along the Presidential primary tour as humanly possible, reaching audiences at caucuses, through libraries, bookstores, and through activist organizations. Please invite Judy to your town, especially if you live in a battleground area. All offers are considered, regardless of financial support. Contact the campaign for more information.

Historiekanon är kortspelet som ger dig historisk överblick, samtidigt som du spelar och har roligt.
Du samlar på några av de viktigaste kändisarna från renässansen till år 1900. Genom händelsekorten ändras spelet snabbt, när krig, revolutioner och uppfinningar stjälper eller hjälper dig och dina medspelare. ”Historiekanon” är ett pedagogiskt spel som hjälper dig att skapa en mental tidslinje, samtidigt som du spelar och har roligt.
Jag som gjort spelet heter Frida Malmgren, och är förutom historienörd verksam som psykolog, författare och serietecknare. I mitt arbete som skolpsykolog har jag märkt är att många saknar en röd tråd att förhålla sig till. Då blir historia bara ett virrvarr av kungar, krig och konstiga gubbar i peruk. Detta vill jag ändra på med spelet! Genom att spela, se samband, och lära dig några nyckelpersoner, får du en baslinje att knyta upp nya fakta på. Därför är det så bra att spelet består av kort. De kan användas som stödbilder, grupperas, eller skapa tidslinjer när du läser läxor tillsammans med barnen. Jag har valt att avbilda karaktärerna så porträttlikt som möjligt, utifrån gamla målningar. Min tanke är att det är viktigt att du känner igen figurerna om du senare stöter på dem i en historiebok. Urvalet är framtagen i samarbete med flera historielärare från mellanstadiet upp till universitetsnivå, vilket gör att det passar utmärkt för att spela för både stora och små.
Det är över ett år sen jag startade det här projektet, och det vore så fantastiskt att få se korten bli verklighet! Spelet är i stort sett färdigt och jag är redo att be tryckeriet dra igång maskinerna så fort jag fått finansiering för projektet. Min stora förhoppning är att de är redo att levereras i god tid för att bli den perfekta julklappen, så att du har spelet redo tilljulklappsutdelningen i år. (Men är det något Postnord och 2020 lärt mig är det tyvärr att allt kan hända).
Jag skulle bli fantastiskt glad om du vill stötta projektet och beställa ett spel eller två till dig, kusinen, dottern, tanten på konsum eller grannen. Stort tack på förhand!
OBS! Tack vare att vi tillsammans nått en massa stretch goals kommer spelet bli ännu maffigare, med 230 kort! 🌟 Dessutom får alla, utöver innehållet i det paket du väljer, 1 bokmärke och tre vykort. Når vi nästa stretch goal (300 000kr) får alla kungalängden i A5-format. Läs mer under Stretch goals nedan. 👇
REWARDPAKET:
Välj vilket paket du vill ha och backa här till höger! Notera att frakt tillkommer när kampanjen avslutas, beräknat till ca 69 kr inom Sverige, men exakt siffra kan ej ges nu. Spelet kan skickas överallt i världen, frakt beräknas och tillkommer. Är du lärare/skolpersonal och intresserad av att beställa andra mängder och kombinationer till skolan? Skicka ett meddekande så kan vi säkert lösa det.  Obs! I och med att vi nått ett stretch goal får alla som backat  ett extra bokmärke med profil från spelet, utöver det som anges i paketen.

Skiss till konsttryck.
Hur spelar man?
Spelet  består av cirka 100 karaktärskort, sorterade i olika kategorier som ”astronomer”, ”franska monarker” och "upplysningsfilosofer". Därtill finns lika många händelsekort: tex. ”Franska revolutionen 1789-93”, dessa kort påverkar ger möjlighet att få extrapoäng, eller spelets gång och kopplar personerna till händelserna. Uppgiften är att samla på “familjer”, dvs olika grupper av karaktärskorten. Familjerna kan bestå av allt mellan mellan 1 till 7 kort. Korten är även grupperade utifrån historiska epoker, som vasaätten, stormaktstiden, frihetstiden och 1800-talet som avgör när i spelet de presenteras.
Varje karaktärskort visar en person, namn och mellan vilka år personen levde. Kortet visar också vilken familj personen tillhör. Som exempel visar kortet “Gustav Vasa” att han tillhör familjen ”Vasa”, på kortet presenteras listan med de andra sju medlemmarna.
Spelet börjar med att given delar ut fem karaktärskort till varje spelare för att sedan lägga resterande kort med bildsidan nedåt mitt på bordet. Händelsekorten skall också placeras på bordet, men delas inte ut. Utse vem som börjar och sätt igång!
Spelrunda:
Dra ett händelsekort. Läs högt och följ instruktionen på händelsekortet. Fortsätt därefter med nästa punkt om inte händelsekortet säger något annat.
Välj en person att fråga efter ett kort du samlar på. Till exempel: “Lisa, har du upptäcksresande”. Om spelaren har ett kort som tillhör kategorin så måste hen lämna över dem till dig och då får du fortsätta fråga tills du får ett nej eller “finns i sjön”. Det går även att svara “finns i annalen” då korthögen med god humoristisk vilja passerar som en form av årsbok. Turen går därefter över medurs.
Du avslutar rundan med plocka upp ett karaktärskort från högen. 
Spelet är slut när alla karaktärskort är slut och samlade i familjer hos spelarna. Vinnaren är den som får flest poäng, både från antalet familjer och från händelsekorten.
ENGLISH (google translate):
NB! Since the game is in Swedish, and the and many of the characters are Swedes, please think twice before ordering if you do not speak Swedish, Danish or Norweigan. Historiekanon is a card game filled with historical characters and events from the Renaissance until the year 1900. You collect groups of cards, like "mathematicians" "French regents" etc. The winner is whoever collect most families. The games target groups is kids and adult who wish to play a fun and educative game together.  History Canon is the card game that gives you a historical overview, while you play and have fun.
You collect some of the most important celebrities from the Renaissance to the year 1900. Through the event cards, the game changes quickly, when wars, revolutionaries and inventions overthrow or use you and your teammates.
"History Cannon" is an educational game and the purpose is, in addition to entertaining, to help the player create a mental timeline.Something I have noticed in my work as a school psychologist is
that many people lack a common thread to relate to. Then history becomes just a jumble of kings, wars and strange old men in wigs. I want to change this with the game! By playing, seeing connections, and learning some key people, you get a baseline to tie new facts on. That is why it is so good that it is with only cards. The cards can be used to group, act as supporting pictures, or create timelines when reading homework with the children. The content of the card game is the future in collaboration with several history teachers from middle school up to university level, which makes it excellent for playing for both young and old.
My name is Frida Malmgren, and in addition to being a history nerd am a psychologist, author and cartoonist. I have chosen to portray the characters as portrait-like as possible, based on old paintings. As a cartoonist, it was tempting to make simpler caricatures, but my thought is that it is important that you can come back to the filigues if you later come across them in a history book. It's been over a year since I started this project, and it would be so amazing to see the cards come true! During the year I have read, made lists, sketched, tore my hair and drew, drew, drew. The game is now almost finished and I am ready to be the printer to start the machines as soon as I have received funding for the project. My great hope is that they are ready to be delivered in good time to become the perfect Christmas present, so that you have it in your hand for the Christmas present this year.
I would be fantastic if you would support this project and order a game or two for you, the cousin, the daughter, the auntor or the neighbor! Thanks in advance!

The ultimate campaign setting for your tabletop roleplaying game, story, or movie within the world of JourneyQuest and The Gamers!
After two years of writing, editing, art, layout, and review, The Fartherall Companion is complete... and the books begin printing as soon as this Kickstarter campaign ends!
This deluxe guide to the Nine Ages of Fartherall is a collectible that will take a place of pride on any shelf: 
460 pages, including over 100 in full color, on 100# silk paper
The complete history of the world of The Gamers and JourneyQuest 
8.5x8.5 inch format (fits perfectly next to the Strowlers World Bible!)
Foil-embossed leatherette cover
Written by Matt Vancil, the creator of The Gamers and JourneyQuest, this book represents over twenty years of worldbuilding from a master of fantasy.
Don't want the deluxe edition? You may also pledge for a standard softcover edition, with a cover painted by Wayne Reynolds and a black and white interior.
The Softcover Edition
What is Fartherall? 
This is not the only world there is.
Even in the world’s earliest ages, its inhabitants, both mortal and divine, were aware of the existence of other worlds. From the emergence of the gods from the primordial chaos to the arrival of the two migrant elder races, Fartherall’s history has involved visitors from elsewhere.
In the middle ages of Fartherall, waves of peoples arrived en masse or awakened in the abandoned places of the world. Its pantheon expanded and contracted as deific entities arrived, departed, transformed, or were slain. And in the margins of the world, in the wildest corners and sealed away in tomb-like ruins, lay Creation’s most dangerous pitfalls—black circles—those indestructible holes in the universe that lead to destinations unknown even to the gods.
A fantasy world created by Matt Vancil, Fartherall is the setting of dozens of stories told over the last twenty years: from The Gamers to JourneyQuest and from The Gamers: Nodwick's Tale (by Aaron Williams) and The Shadow's Dungeon (by Sean Reynolds) to Nethadrick's Pranks (by Kevin Mickelson). 
Plus, the book features hundreds of new characters, from heroes to villains to demigods, created by the Fartherall fan community!
While many of these stories and characters originated in comedy, Fartherall the world isn't a farce. Matt Vancil has meticulously built a fantasy world around consistent physics, themes, and rules, a world where unlimited new stories are possible, from the early ages of gods and mythic heroes to the grimy protagonists of the Age of Steam, from intimate fairy tales to dimension-hopping epics.
Although only gnomes are allowed to break the laws of physics when they fall. It's in the rules. Sorry.
Who is This Book Made For? 
Everyone has a place in Fartherall
Fantasy Fans — If you love worldbuilding, this book is for you. This epic history is a compelling story all on its own, with a shocking reveal in the Eighth Age that ties together tens of thousands of years of in-depth fantasy storytelling.
Tabletop Gamers — This book is intentionally rules-agnostic, but contains enough detail to adapt cleanly to your game of choice. From the schools of magic to dozens of fantasy races, you and your party can find infinite ideas and adventure hooks within these pages.
Writers, Artists, and Filmmakers — The SCULA (see below) gives you broad permission to create and sell your own stories, films, and art from within the world of Fartherall. Use this book to help your own creations qualify for Canon status within Fartheral as an official part of the story.
JourneyQuest and Gamers Fans — This book is the definitive guide to the entire history of the world. While some details are kept secret (we don't want to spoil the end of either series) there's enough information and backstory here to provide endless context for the events of existing films, novels, and games, from the disappearance of the elves to exactly what happened in Pwned at the end of the 6th Age.

Why Kickstarter?
It's simple: the interior of this book is gorgeous and we want deluxe editions for our own shelves. We also checked in with the backers of the original Fartherall Companion campaign and many said the same thing. And then we checked in with the wider JourneyQuest fandom and they said "Gimme!"
That's why we're doing an ultra-short campaign to reach the threshold where we can print this deluxe edition affordably. If we reach our goal, the deluxe edition happens. If we don't reach our goal, we'll print the standard black and white books as planned.
What's the Timeline?
The moment this campaign closes, we submit a print order to the manufacturer. Printing will take about two weeks, then the books will ship directly to our fulfillment partners at ShipMonk. They will begin worldwide fulfillment shortly thereafter!
Barring the effects of major natural disasters, political unrest, or economic crises on our manufacturing and fulfillment partners, this book is scheduled to be delivered to backers by mid-December of 2020.
What's in the Book?
The short answer? Everything. Except for spoilers. (We don't want to ruin the end of JourneyQuest and The Gamers for you!)
You can download a free PDF preview of The Fartherall Companion right here.

We've been approved by Kickstarter for a new beta program that allows add-ons to be selected and billed within this campaign! If you select a physical reward you'll have the option of adding these additional items as well.

It is currently out of print, but we are prepared to make a special reprint order for this campaign, for those people who want the complete set.

Shipping
We are collecting shipping fees directly within Kickstarter. Please add your country and your fees will be collected as part of your pledge.
If you live in Canada, most of Europe, Australia, New Zealand, or Japan, we will collect duties or VAT as part of your shipping fee. Your order will ship with duties pre-paid, thanks to our international fulfillment partners at Passport!
Fulfillment is managed and executed by the team at ShipMonk from their Pennsylvania warehouse, who will make sure that your order is delivered perfectly.
Note: The Fartherall Map add-on is printed and fulfilled separately, by Printful. VAT/duties are not included for this item. Learn more here.
Social Impact Statement
Fartherall is for everyone who welcomes others around the storytelling campfire. 
We hope that you will find reflections of yourself and your identity represented within these pages, that you will feel inspired and encouraged to tell the stories that resonate with you, and that you will extend that same care and courtesy to other travelers and storytellers. 
Zombie Orpheus Entertainment is committed to collaborative, global storytelling with people from many backgrounds and perspectives. If you are bothered by the representation of BIPOC and LGBTQ persons within this book and their full acceptance within the ZOE community, this fandom is not for you.
Shared Cinematic Universe License Agreement (SCULA)
The World of Fartherall isn’t locked behind traditional copyright restrictions. Instead, we all play by a set of simple, shared rules. 
Every work is released under our Fartherall Shared Cinematic Universe License & Agreement (the SCULA), which gives you broad rights to remix, imagine anew, and play. Do what you want with your creation, and then get excited about how others remix it into one big, collaborative story.
Learn more

BLABEL is the game where players speak different fictional languages and have to cooperate to build the Tower of Blabel together.
In Blabel, you'll have to communicate using only the languages of the game! You can't point, mimic, or show your cards!
At the beginning, players barely understand each other, and they have to rely on similarities in their languages, but as the game progresses, they can learn to understand and speak each other's languages to communicate more efficiently.
The dictionaries are the core mechanic of the game. Each player gets a unique dictionary that teaches them how to say the words of the game in their unique language. 
 Learn each other's languages and have somewhat complex conversations!
3 players manage to understand each other
