Hi, Im a final year BA Art Pratice student, who specialises in handmade ceramics. I am trying to raidse funds to help create and run my final year degree show. My work revolves around mental helath awareness and showing the breaks in connections between the person with mental health issues and the people around them. I create handmade ceramic square plates using the imagery of puzzle pieces to represent people with mental helath issues. 
The money will raised will go towards costs of materials, printing costs for businesses cards and the overall setup for the show,such as food,drink and painting supplies. With your help I can make my final year show look professional and hoepfully it will be a set in the right direction for further my art career.
My Artwork

Thank you for taking the time to read about my novel, "The Marked." I have been researching and writing this book for two years. I have always had a fascination with the Paleoindian period and wanted to find a way to create something that would interest others about it. There is a lot to be discovered about the first native people, and I hope my books gives a voice to a historical subject that has not had enough attention.
My book is just a fictional tale, but I hope it will open the door to young adult interest in the fascinating world of archaeological discoveries.
To read an excerpt from the novel, please visit my blog:
http://redriverpublishing.blogspot.com/2014/12/the-marked-chapter-1.html
I am a writer and science teacher living in Arkansas. I have a master's degree in education and a bachelor's degree in creative writing. I am looking to self-publish and have my book on the shelves by December 2015.

Hey, my name is Beth Gregory and I'm the sole artist and creator behind Cotton and Clay Design. First of all, I want to thank you for coming here to check out my Kickstarter to raise funds for my kiln. 
I have recently moved into a new house which has the space for me to set-up a studio in the garage, which is a dream come true for me. I used to create and fire my work at Cardiff Pottery Workshops, but I have now moved too far away for this to be an option. I have some money saved to put towards getting the space fire-proofed and to purchase a kiln, however, I still need to raise between £500 and £1000 to go towards the purchase of the kiln.  If I manage to raise £500 this will go towards getting me a small top loader and if I can raise over £1000 this will go towards getting me a slightly larger top loader.
This is where you can help, I am offering a wide range of rewards for donations, so you can help me to purchase a kiln, as well as getting your hands on a piece of my work.  Clay is my passion, my life, my love. It is my dream to be able to create my work full-time and it is becoming more and more possible. The support that I have had in my first year of Cotton and Clay Design has been beyond my wildest dreams.
Example of mini succulent planter with Forest Eye design
Examples of small 6-8oz mugs with larger 18oz mug with Forest Eye design.

  So, how did I get here? 

     Clay has always been a part of my life, my Granny used to be a potter, creating her work from a little shed at the bottom of her garden. I would spend my childhood playing in there and making little fairy houses for the fairies (gnats ha ha) by the stream. I was surrounded by so much creativity growing up, my Mum is also always so inspiring to me, she has always dabbled in different techniques and materials, creating pieces with such fine details. My Dad was also very talented and I have fond memories of drawing with him when I was little. Creativity is in my blood.   
Example of Mushroom Fields design on a large 22oz mug

     I went to Cardiff Met Uni where I graduated with a BA (hons) in Ceramics in 2016. When I set-up Cotton and Clay Design in 2018, it was a way for me to heal after a traumatic experience. I started creating for  love, making things that I wanted to make and things that I wanted for myself. Realising that my work resonated with so many people, I started to create larger bodies of work, expanding my range and creating pieces that I only dreamed of.   
Collaboration with Morgin Riley -Her custom 4oz espresso mug with Forest Eye design.
1 year later, I am making connections with people, collaborating with some of my favourite artists and sending my work around the world, further than I have ever been. This is why I feel that now is the time to make the jump and set-up a studio at home so that I can have more control over firings and more space to work in.   
My Work 
Example of Full Moon Design on a Vase

   My work is an expression of myself and my love for clay, every piece I create is unique and one of a kind. Every piece starts as a ball of clay, I then use a pinch pot technique to form the base of the shape and then, for larger pieces, I add coils to build it up. I use cobalt oxide to either hand-paint my designs on or I use it as an oxide wash to pick out texture on other pieces. Each piece is high fired to 1280 degrees c. and sanded with extra fine sandpaper to create a very smooth and tactile surface. My mugs are glazed with a clear glaze on the inside and left raw on the outside, exposing the pure beauty of the porcelain.   
     I am inspired by a number of things in this world but, nature, astrology and symbolism are my true passions. I adorn each piece with these meaningful and powerful symbols, reflecting my pure love and fascination for them.   
Examples of designs on mini dishes
Example of large full moon wall-hanging

How long will it take to receive your piece? 

   I will need get the fire board fitted and purchase a kiln, which I am hoping won't take longer than a month. I can purchase some porcelain before the end of the campaign so that I can make a start on creating your rewards. Please be aware that I will also be creating these alongside creating my main work so it could take up to 5-6 months before you receive your piece, depending on how many pledges I get. This is because I am only able to make and fire a certain amount of pieces a month. However I will be making a list and working through them as quickly as possible, pledges will be my main priority and I am aiming to tick off 20 pieces a month. These will be done in the order that the pledges come in. All pledges will also have the option of first dibs on updates as well.
Example of Large 24oz Hand-sculpted bracket fungus mug
I want to thank you all for your love and support in helping me make my dreams come true. It means more to me than I can express. I can't wait to start creating all of your special pieces.

PORTRAIT
Photographic mosaics in high resolution using 100 colours, all made from natural materials. Unique and Individual.
For the production of two samples, with a combined size of 30 m2 and the launch and creation of a website I require 23.415 EUR.
Our technology allows me to transfer any sort of digital image onto a suitable set of building modules.
Imagine the wall of a large concrete building that looks like the countryside in the background, or a large hall whose walls shine with wonderful baroque colours, reproducing the work of a renowned artist. Imagine transforming the bottom of your swimming pool into a picture of your choice. Imagine your living room coming to life with a group image of your family, spanning three or four generations. Imagine any interesting image, from nature to still life, a scene from a beloved film, anything whatsoever – all in the form of a beautiful mosaic based on a photograph or photomontage, in 100 colours, constructed with tiles made from natural materials varying in size from 0.5 cm2 (for indoor purposes) to 0.5 m2 (for outside purposes). 
The uses of our mosaics are only limited by a client’s imagination.
The mosaics are intended for use in architecture, interior design, portraits, family compositions, artwork reproductions, transfer of photographs on walls and ceilings: with the resolution of 4 dots per cm2. 
Thermally insulated module 230 mm x 155 mm
Description: 
Handmade with natural materials. Mosaics will be constructed from wooden, concrete or aluminium modules, depending on the wishes of a client. 
Blank, Constructed Sample Module (Concrete)
The sample model, a still life piece, will be constructed using 96 colours. It will measure 3,9 m x 3.12 m equalling 12.17 m2. It will be constructed using 120 thermally insulated modules measuring at 230 mm x 155 mm. Each individual aforementioned module will consist of 1014 concrete colour elements measuring 0.5 cm2. The mosaic will be fitted on a wall on aluminium supports (acting as thermal insulation).
 The cost of preparation and production by hand of a 1m2 (metre squared) mosaic will be EUR 1,050. The cost of 12.17 m2 will be EUR 12.776.40.
The individual mosaic elements will be painted using acrylic paint, however other types of pain will also be used, depending on the material.
120 thermally insulated modules - 230 mm x 155 mm

Il y a quatre ans...
Une première quête 
 Début 2016, je publiais mon premier livre ULTRA-ORDINAIRE - JOURNAL D’UN COUREUR (Éditions de l’Homme).
Vendu à près de 8 600 exemplaires dans toute la francophonie, j'y décris en mots et en photos ma progression en tant que coureur, du débutant peinant à franchir un maigre deux kilomètres à l’ultra-marathonien confirmé enchaînant six courses de 120 km ou plus en une seule saison.
Et les lecteurs adorent : Amazon.ca 5/5 (17 avis), Amazon.fr 4,5/5 (37), GoodReads 4,1/5 (33), Babelio 4,1/5 (11), FNAC 5/5 (7)
Puis une pause de tout
Après plusieurs mois de promotion et de conférences, j’ai écrit ceci après une course de 100 km en Australie :
« Je termine cette course, mais après, c’est fini. Plus jamais ça. (...) Je n’ai plus la force d’avoir froid. Ni chaud. Ni faim. Ni soif. Ni mal. Ni d’être fatigué. Ni de courir en pleine nuit à 3000 m d’altitude. »
Oh, il y a aussi eu quelques soucis financiers (merci à mon comptable de l’époque) et le début de la fin de mon couple. Bref. Du jour au lendemain, j’ai arrêté de courir. Pendant dix mois, rien. Comme tout le monde, j’ai pris le métro pour aller travailler.
Mais c’est difficile de ne pas courir.
Autoportraits de l'auteur en coureur de fond
Un retour à la course
C’est difficile de ne pas courir alors que je me retrouve coincé dans le métro et que je connais par cœur le sentier qui me sépare du bureau.
Alors, presque par dépit, je prends de nouveau mes jambes à mon cou et le résultat est à la hauteur de mes attentes : pénible, lent et douloureux.
Parfait, je n’ai pas idéalisé ce sport.
Il me faudra plusieurs mois pour retrouver le conditionnement nécessaire pour effectuer de nouveau mes allers-retours. Mais, encore une fois, ce sont les photos qui vont dicter ma motivation quotidienne.
Puis à la photographie
 Pour ce retour à la photo, j’ai décidé cette fois de tourner l’objectif vers moi, de prendre le coureur en action dans son environnement.
Le défi technique venait de monter d’un cran car il me fallait alors réaliser des autoportraits en pleine nature avec du matériel assez léger et robuste pour survivre aux mêmes conditions que moi.
Cliché après cliché, j’ai appris à placer ma caméra aux endroits les plus inusités, comment contrôler l’appareil à distance, à profiter de conditions éphémères en déployant mon attirail en quelques secondes ou planifier certaines scènes pendant des jours et des jours, optant parfois pour le montage pour créer des scènes surréalistes.
Une nouvelle Odyssée
Redécouvrir le fleuve Saint-Laurent 
Depuis la publication de JOURNAL D’UN COUREUR, l’idée de publier une suite me travaille sans cesse. Il me manquait cependant un point focal, une clé qui fournirait la cohésion nécessaire à un nouveau récit. J'avais prévu d'aller courir plus de 1 000 km aux États-Unis quand la COVID-19 a frappé.
J'ai alors profité du confinement pour courir pendant des heures autour de chez moi.
Irrémédiablement, je me dirigeais vers le fleuve Saint-Laurent, majestueux et toujours spectaculaire.
De Percé au sommet du mont Royal
Désireux de trouver un défi sportif estival à ma hauteur, j'ai cherché un parcours qui me permette de profiter de la lumière et des paysages offerts par le fleuve.
Soudain, tout s'est mis en place.
En partant de Percé, puis en longeant le littoral en gardant le Saint-Laurent sur ma droite jusqu'à Montréal, j'allais pouvoir visiter ce que le Québec a de plus beau à offrir, puis partager mon expérience en mots et en photos.
 Une aventure digne d'un deuxième livre 
À paraître en mars 2021 aux Éditions de l'Homme, la plus grande maison d'édition au Québec, mon deuxième livre sera la suite directe de mon premier best-seller : 256 pages couleur, récits de courses et anecdotes, de très nombreuses photos et une mise en page dynamique, respectant ce qui avait fait le succès du premier volume.
En parallèle, mes aventures seront aussi documentées grâce à une expo photo itinérante.
 Prenez part à l'aventure !  
En échange de vos contributions, qui me permettront à court terme de terminer mon livre (écriture et photographies), je vous offre des exemplaires dédicacés de mon futur livre et, pour ceux qui ne l'ont pas encore, des exemplaires dédicacés du premier volume. Et pour la postérité, votre nom sera présent dans la page des remerciements.

Synopsis
Swann follows the story of a brash small town girl on an adolescent journey to find meaning in life. At sunrise, at the beautiful Rio Grande Gorge Bridge in the New Mexico desert, she crosses paths with Elizabeth Wolff, a newly retired woman determined to start her own adventurous life after a lifetime working as a number cruncher for the government. This mismatched pair drive off on a 24-hour life-changing odyssey into the desert. When Elizabeth’s car runs out of gas, they stumble across Martin Falls, a gun-toting priest undergoing a crisis of faith and his teenage son Simon, who’s in the process of growing up and away from the only home he has ever known - the desert. Simon and Swann, drawn to one another and to the thrill of an adventure, drive off into the night to visit the ancient cliffs and caves that dot the desert sky. Against a starry backdrop of breathtaking beauty, Swann is finally speechless, dropping the sarcasm that has been her armor, accepting that she has finally found something in life which really means something to her. As this beautiful night comes to an end, Swann is suddenly faced with unexplainable violence, and the possibility of losing everything that she has come to love.
Director’s statement
Swann is a little story with a big heart. A story about evolving, letting go and making a change. Based on a play developed at The Cleveland Play House by acclaimed playwright Sandra Perlman, Swann is a character-driven, quick-witted love story that demonstrates the power of love, connection and community in the face of life’s inevitable questions.
There’s a lot of wit and humor coming from this story, mainly from Swann’s sarcastic way of looking at life and her outrageously know-it-all way of expressing herself - at times reminding us of Juno from the movie with the same title. Swann takes her completely honest views of life and makes us smile or even laugh at her rants while she fearlessly challenges everything that gets in the way on her quest to find the answers she needs. This is what keeps the story’s edgy. 
Shooting location
Swann is set in the beautiful New Mexico desert - at and around the Rio Grande Gorge Bridge.
About the creators
Daniel Börjesson - Writer, Director, Producer 
Swedish born DANIEL BÖRJESSON is an experienced award-winning director noted for his compelling work of visual storytelling. Daniel caught the directing bug while attending film school in Los Angeles. Remaining in the US, Daniel utilized his film school studies and began working in the film industry as an assistant director and assistant editor on a variety of projects. A return to his homeland invited work as a producer on commercials and music videos offering invaluable experience before crossing over to directing.  
“Using my background as a producer helps me a great deal, especially in times like these when you have to be more efficient and be able to create more for less.” - Daniel Börjesson 
Like every storyteller, concept and idea come first to Daniel. This has lead him to quickly build a reputation and a well-known name in the advertisement industry. His sense for detail has earned him numerous awards and prestigious work for clients and artists such as Kylie Minogue, Axwell, Giorgio Moroder (Scarface, Midnight Express, Top Gun), BMW, Coca-Cola, Chevrolet and Volvo to name a few. 
Daniel is currently working on his first feature documentary. A dance documentary starring superstar choreographer Sidi Larbi Cherkaoui (Anna Karenina, Girl, Beyonce). This project will be released in mid 2019. Swann is Daniel's debut into feature films.
Learn more about Daniel - www.danielborjesson.com
Sandra Perlman, Writer 
SANDRA PERLMAN is an award winning playwright with more than a dozen plays produced around the world including The Cleveland PlayHouse, New Jersey Rep Perlman's plays are dramatic, funny - sometimes absurd. They may explore contemporary life (Swann)  or include a new look at an old Greek tragedy (Jocasta), Shakespeare's King Lear (Lunacy), the sacrifice of a real family in Ohio during WWI (Dear Mother and All) or the impact of the May 4th shootings on the campus of Kent State during anti-war demonstrations in 1970 (Nightwalking). Perlman is the recipient of three Ohio Arts Council fellowships in playwriting including Swann. She was nominated for the American Theatre Critics Associations M. Elizabeth Osborn Award for Emerging Playwright and was a finalist for the Jane Chambers Playwriting award. She was a writer and producer for PBS Channels 45/49 in addition to teaching and lecturing about playwriting. Perlman has been published by Dramatic Publishing, Smith & Krauss and the Middle Tennessee State University Press.
Born and raised in Philadelphia, Perlman lives in Kent, Ohio with her artist husband, Henry Halem.

Help make new Wild @ Heart shirts get made!
What is Wild @ Heart?
Back in 2011 I launched the first designs of my Wild @ Heart shirts in Grey Canine (Wolf or Dog) and White Feline (Tiger), and later, Brown Horse, Blue Dragon and Orange Fox. Each design features a pawprint heart logo on the front and a matching critter tail on the back. 
Here's me wearing one of the original Grey Canine!
I like the idea of having fun 'costumes' that are as simple to wear as putting on a comfy t-shirt, one that you can change depending on today's mood. Design are printed on Gildan Softstyle shirts and are available in sizes S-2XL, with Gildan Ultra Cotton shirts for sizes 3XL-5XL.
As production of screen-printed shirts is an expensive proposition, I have been running them in small batches of 25 shirts, but would frequently run out of sizes, and it is difficult to produce them for online sale.
My target for this Kickstarter is to be able to order a large enough batch from my screen printer that I can cover Anthrocon sales as well as give folks who do not attend conventions the opportunity to purchase shirts. I also introduced new colors for the original designs and would like to be able to reprint those as well. If there is enough support, I would like to launch brand new designs as well!
Grey Canine (wolf or dog)
The first two designs to be reprinted will be the Grey Canine and Orange Fox. Target first available date will be around Anthrocon (early July 2015) but shirts may ship after the convention depending on how close to the convention they arrive from the printer.
Orange Fox

My goal is to keep backer fulfillment as simple as possible, so the main rewards are solely for the shirts themselves.

You can also contact me to find out which sizes/designs are available in backstock, but my existing inventory is very low at the moment. If stretch goals get close to being funded, they will be added to the rewards list and you can easily switch your pledge to one of them.
Shipping with insurance and tracking is $6 in the USA or $30 international
"Budget" shipping option available ($4 USA/$15 international). Please note that there is NO insurance or tracking available on the Budget options.
$275 - Custom Color Shirt
Want a green and yellow tiger? A blue and white fox? I have often gotten asked about getting custom colors on a shirt, and my shirt printer can accommodate one-off orders...but ONLY printed along with a normal run of shirts. You specify species, colors, shirt color, and shirt size. No alterations to art, please. Number and placement of colors must be the same or fewer than the original design due to screen printing processes (Most shirts only have 2-3 colors). Shipping with insurance and tracking is $6 in the USA or $30 international (no budget shipping on this one due to cost of production).
For any tier (including the custom color) if you would like to order more than one shirt, just add $25 to your pledge total for each additional shirt. The survey that will be issued at the end of the campaign will ask you for your choices of designs and sizes.

 Regular Permission For Commercial Use
Regular Permission for 3D Printing: Commercial License - Printing 
Constituent Factors of this Regular Permission 
Understanding how this Regular Permission works is necessary to make sure that the Purchaser is able to access the digital file(s) that he/she wants to buy and is unable to improperly use the 3D printed item from such digital file(s) owned by SaYJo Corp. 
1. This Regular Permission covers the matters concerning the digital file(s) that a Purchaser buys and the 3D printed items (physical object) that are 3D printed from such digital file(s). Read the rest of this Regular Permission to learn the details that apply to the use of the 3D printed model, and the FAQs which form part of this Permission. 
2. The copyrights of the digital files are owned by SaYJo Corp, which creates and uploads the files for special sale on Kickstarter. 
3. The Regular Permission grants the Purchaser the right to use the digital file(s) he/she has purchased and the 3D printed item produced from the digital file(s) for commercial use. 
4. The digital file(s) of a 3D model purchased by the Regular Permission holder are designed for 3D printing only. 
5. All files purchased under the Regular Permission are subject to the Purchaser’s personal handling and 3D printing. 

Things You Can Do Under This Regular Permission 
1. You can purchase digital file(s) and 3D print them. 
2. You can create printed elements from digital files of acquired 3D models. (Unlimited) 3. You can use such 3D printed items for commercial / gift / donation use. 
4. You can put the 3D printed items up for charity as long as their number doesn’t exceed the number of 3D printed items regulated by this Regular Permission. 

Things You Can’t Do Under This Regular Permission 
1. You can’t sell or otherwise distribute the digital file(s) under this Regular Permission. 
2. You can’t modify the digital files and then sell the files as a new product. 

Other Terms of the Regular Permission 
1. SaYJo Corp will be entitled to terminate this Regular Permission if the Purchaser infringes any of the provisions hereof. 
2. SaYJo Corp will have the right to claim any damage compensation incurred as a result of the infringement by the Purchaser of the provisions herein. 
3. SaYJo Corp will have the right to perform improvements and updates of the digital file(s) without the prior notice of the Purchaser. 
4. SaYJo Corp is entitled to remove any digital file(s) at the request of the 3D designer without prior notice of the Purchaser. 

Definitions 
 Purchaser refers to a person who purchases an available digital file, in this case it is special for distribution through Kickstarter.. 
 Digital file(s) refers to the STL or OBJ files that describe the surface geometry of a threedimensional object, widely used for 3D printing. 
 3D Printed Item refers to the object 3D printed from the digital file(s). 
 3D Designer refers to the creator of digital files for 3D printing, in this case: José Francisco Bautista.

The switch robot can be directly attached to your traditional switch panel without the help of electricians, easily intelligentizing your home. The robot brings a solution for intelligent control of household switches, and it can be conveniently applied in various scenarios for its multiple functions.
How it works
In the following video, we will give a demonstration showing how to use the switch robot. 

Black & White
Two colours are available. You can choose the colour of the robot after the campaign.
 Features 
Adaprox Controller App
We also introduce Adaprox Controller App with a super user-friendly UI design.
Communicate with your switch robot.
Turn the switch on/off with one click.  
Set a timer to control your device.
Inspect device battery status.
Turn your switch robot into SOS mode.
Make the switch robot an ultimate alarm clock.
Update the robot's firmware.
More future features coming soon.

Voice Control
Voice communication between the user and the switch robot is implemented with latest APIs. You can talk with either Apple Siri or Google Assistant to control  the switch robot. 

Product Specifications
Product Model: ASB101 (white)  ASB102 (black)
Package Contents: Switch Robot, Magnet Board, Charging Cable and Gaskets
Product Dimensions: 7.5*7.5*2.0
Product Weight: 160 g
Communication Protocol: BLE 4.2
Functionalities: Touch Control, Remote Control, Timer Switch, Voice Control, SOS
System Support: IOS 11 or later, Android 8.0 or later
Charging Port: USB Type-C
Installation Method: Magnetic Attraction
Stall Torque: 2.0 kgf·cm
Working Temperature: -10 - +45℃
Charging Duration: 2.5 hours
Battery Type: rechargeable lithium battery
Battery Capacity: 1300 mAh 
Charging Current: 500 mA

Prototypes
We designed several prototypes of  the switch robot with different mechanisms and finally found an appropriate one which is both simple and powerful.
Future Plans
GateBox
We will introduce GateBox in the second half of 2019. With GateBox, you can control all the Adaprox products via the Internet wherever you like on the earth.

I want to discover what London and Paris look like through a child's eyes. I wonder what things will stand out to a child that an adult might not notice. 
I want to take my daughters, Eliza (age 5) and Olivia (age 18 months) to London and document their experience. Think of it as travel writing from the perspective of a child. I will keep a daily blog where I will write about the experience and upload pictures taken by my daughter. If I get really crazy, I might let the 18 month old take some photos as well. I will also have my daughter write about her experience and upload pictures of her journaling and pictures she draws.  After we return, I plan to use the blog to create a book.
I have noticed that there aren't a lot of books that focus on a child's view of life. Some famous authors will reflect upon their childhoods and try to recreate it. But I think that there is something valuable in capturing what a child sees.
I want to allow my supporters to be a part of this experience. For various donations, you will receive a postcard from Europe, a print of one of Eliza's pictures, or for a substantial donation Eliza will write you a small book about her experience with illustrations. 
My plan is to spend between 2 weeks and 1 month in London while taking side trips to Paris, Amsterdam, and other places. Our home base will be in London though. I think $25,000 is a conservative amount given the cost of plane tickets, lodging, food, etc. I will do my best to be a savvy spender and save money wherever possible.

Update! Special opportunity for backers!
Aurelie Dupont, longtime star of the Paris Opera Ballet was recently named as its Director! She will perform "Lament" from Acts of Light and Appalachian Spring in the Graham Company’s Gala Performance on April 18. Read on to see how you can be a part of this historic night. 
The Martha Graham Dance Company celebrates its 90th anniversary with The Next 90!, marking nearly a century of innovation in modern dance and American art. 
In 1926 Martha Graham created a company that would go on to shape modern dance for generations to come. Often collaborating with other artistic leaders of her time, Martha Graham created some of the first masterpieces of the art form and developed a technique that embraces the natural expressiveness of the  body.
Today the Company continues Graham’s legacy, showcasing her masterpieces alongside brand new dances by today’s top choreographers. The Next 90! – yes, the Company’s 90th anniversary season – is filled with exciting, creative and ambitious events. 
On the occasion of this special milestone, the Company is bringing back Graham classics that haven’t been seen in years, commissioning brand new works from top choreographers Marie Chouinard, Mats Ek, and Pontus Lidberg, and restoring stage sets designed by sculptor Isamu Noguchi. In addition the New York Season (April 14-18) will include live music every night by The Mannes Orchestra, introducing a new educational partnership with The New School’s Mannes School of Music in NYC.
We want you to be part of it, and we need your help. We are raising $90K to celebrate 90 years. We have $30K from our Board, $30K from foundation support – and the last $30K comes from hundreds of Kickstarter supporters. We hope you will be one of them!
Erick Hawkins, Merce Cunningham, Martha Graham, Sophie Maslow, Jane Dudley, Nina Fonaroff, Ethel Butler, Pearl Lang, and an unknown dancer in "Deaths and Entrances."
Lloyd Knight, Lorenzo Pagano and Xin Ying in "Depak Ine" by Nacho Duato. Photo by Christopher Jones
We love Kickstarter because it gives us the opportunity to celebrate and honor the followers and patrons who have helped get us this far, and reach out to those new to Martha Graham and her legacy. In this celebratory 90th year, we plan to go bigger than ever and bring Graham fans – old and new – behind the scenes, into our archives, and even on tour!
As a Kickstarter backer you will have rare access to intimate studio events, artistic tutorials, and the chance to make your own Graham dance to share with the world!
We hope you will join us in celebrating our nine-decade run and help us shape The Next 90!
Back us early if you are in the NYC area! We're inviting you to a one-time studio event on Tuesday February 9th. The evening will feature a live open rehearsal of Martha Graham's Night Journey and the chance to explore our historic Isamu Noguchi sets. Learn about their famed collaboration through anecdotes from Martha Graham Artistic Director Janet Eilber and the Noguchi Museum Senior Curator Dakin Hart.
We hope you'll check out all of our rewards for both local fans and those around the world (see the right of the page). All backers $5 and above receive the $5 reward package, including digital photos from our archives, project updates and more! Here are some of our personal favorites:

We’ll pick our five favorite videos, and then send them back to you to vote on a winner. The most popular #gramyourgraham choreography will be performed by Graham dancers and shared on the Company's Instagram, Facebook, and website.
Janet Eilber: (Artistic Director) has been the Center’s artistic director since 2005. Her direction has focused on creating new forms of audience access to the Graham masterworks. These initiatives include designing contextual programming, educational and community partnerships, use of new media, commissions and creative events such as the Lamentation Variations and Prelude and Revolt. She has also remixed Graham choreography and created new staging in the Graham style for theater/dance productions of The Bacchae and Prometheus Bound. Earlier in her career, as a principal dancer with the Martha Graham Dance Company, Ms. Eilber worked closely with Martha Graham. She danced many of Graham’s greatest roles, had roles created for her by Graham, and was directed by Graham in most of the major roles of the repertoire. She soloed at the White House, was partnered by Rudolf Nureyev, starred in three segments of Dance in America, and has since taught, lectured, and directed Graham ballets internationally. Apart from her work with Graham, Eilber has performed in films, on television and on Broadway directed by such greats as Agnes deMille and Bob Fosse and has received four Lester Horton Awards for her reconstruction and performance of seminal American modern dance. She has served as Director of Arts Education for the Dana Foundation, guiding the Foundation’s support for Teaching Artist training and contributing regularly to its arts education publications. Eilber is a Trustee Emeritus of the Interlochen Center for the Arts. She is married to screenwriter/director John Warren, with whom she has two daughters, Madeline and Eva.
Photo courtesy of NYC Dance Project
The Next 90! Season Choreographers
Marie Chouinard: In 1978, Montreal choreographer Marie Chouinard presented her first dance work, Cristallisation, establishing her reputation as a highly original artist. This work was followed by thirty solos, performed for international audiences. In 1990, Ms. Chouinard founded her own company, COMPAGNIE MARIE CHOUINARD. COMPAGNIE MARIE CHOUINARD co-produces its pieces with different partners such as the Venice Biennale, the ImPulsTanz Dance Festival (Vienna), Théâtre de la Ville (Paris), the Fondazione Musica Per Roma (Rome), Festival TransAmériques (Montreal), Place des Arts (Montreal), and the National Arts Centre (Ottawa). Marie Chouinard has won several awards for her contribution to the arts, including the the Order of Canada (2007), the Grand Prix du Conseil des arts de Montréal (2006), the Ordre des Arts et des Lettres (France, 2009), the prix Denise-Pelletier (Quebec, 2010), the Prix culturel Samuel de Champlain (France, 2014), the Ordre des arts et des lettres du Québec (2015) and the Ordre national du Québec (2015).
Swedish choreographer, filmmaker and dancer Pontus Lidberg has created more than 35 works for major international dance companies, such as Les Ballets de Monte-Carlo, SemperOper Ballet Dresden, Le Ballet du Grand Théâtre de Genève, The Royal Danish Ballet, The Beijing Dance Theatre, The Royal Swedish Ballet, Morphoses, and for his own group Pontus Lidberg Dance. Mr. Lidberg is most recognized for his dance film The Rain for which he received numerous awards around the world. , has created more than 35 works for major international dance companies, such as Les Ballets de Monte-Carlo, SemperOper Ballet Dresden, Le Ballet du Grand Théâtre de Genève, The Royal Danish Ballet, The Beijing Dance Theatre, The Royal Swedish Ballet, Morphoses, and for his own group Pontus Lidberg Dance. Mr. Lidberg is most recognized for his dance film The Rain for which he received numerous awards around the world.
Mats Ek: With a diverse body of work, ranging from short pieces that explore psychological subjects, to full-length ballets such as Giselle and Rome and Juliet, Mats Ek has been developing his expressionist style for nearly four decades. Although his chosen subjects can be dark, his work is often laced with subtle humor. Mr. Ek is the son of celebrated actor Ander Ek, and choreographer Birgit Cullberg, founder of the ballet company that bore her name. Following an early career as an actor, Mr. Ek began his own dance training as a teenager, joining the Cullberg Ballet in 1972 and eventually became its sole artistic director in 1985. Additionally, he has worked extensively as a dancer and choreographer with Nederlans Dans Theater.

Welcome to your most dangerous holidays in the Big Apple!
NYC is a 1-4 player cooperative game (solo play included), where you will take the role of a family enjoying their holidays in New York City, who accidentally find themselves involved in different adventures.
Now with upgraded scenarios and extended thematic content, where you will have to prove your innocence from crimes you didn’t commit, save the city from hungry ghosts, or even defeat a psycho clown trying to throw New York into chaos!
Our new scenarios will surely bring you memories of fan classics.
Mission: Tutorial
The Smith family were on a trip in New York City when, suddenly, they find themselves wrongly accused of a crime they did not commit. In a moment of chaos, their adventure begins, although they don’t even know what is going on. What they do know is that they are willing to find the real culprits and prove their innocence.

Mission: Who you gonna call?
Caroline’s eccentric brother Phil Murray invites the Smiths to enjoy a few days in New York City. Little did they know that this seemingly innocent invitation was in fact a cry for help from Phil to face the supernatural threat pending over the city.
Phil knew that a gate to the beyond was about to open, but now that the Smiths were here, he was ready and had the equipment to prove it!
Kickstarter Exclusive miniatures
Mission: Die Harsh
Doug Smith and family head down to enjoy some bagels with his old friend, officer Joe McLane. But things take an unexpected twist when the NYPD comes to arrest Joe after a bomb set off somewhere in town…
Help Joe McLane clear his name and meet Jupiter, Joe’s cab driver friend, who will drive you around town to help you stop the crazy terrorist trying to frame Joe!
Kickstarter exclusive miniatures

Mission: The heroes NY deserves
After watching a show, the Smith family enters a dark alley where they witness the murder of the Vaynes, owners of Vayne Enterprises. Knowing you are innocent, your good friend Commissioner Gorden helps you escape the scene to try to help young Brock Vayne find out who is responsible for this tragedy.
But criminal gangs are roaming freely around the city, and there is a rumor that they are all working under the leadership of a very dangerous criminal mastermind with a wicked sense of humor...
Kickstarter exclusive miniatures (w.i.p.)

New York Crisis includes 4 fully replayable scenarios: 1 tutorial and 3 full-length scenarios.
Duration: 45-60 min per game.
What makes it unique
● Fun and easy to learn.

● Every scenario can be replayed.
● Narrative flavor texts in each scenario card that will guide you through the story.

We are raising money for a billboard campaign to make people aware of jury nullification. Unfortunately, when the day comes that you receive that letter for the dreaded jury duty, most people do whatever they can to get out of it. As a country we need to take a stand and do whatever we can to make people aware of the impact they can make as a member of the jury.
We need to help people understand that being part of a jury is a service that we provide to make sure that the law is not only upheld, but that it is also just. We need to take a stand as a country and make sure jurors know that they must make their final vote mean something, there are too many people who vote with the group. 
Why is this our job? In most states, including Ohio, a defense attorney can not tell the jurors about their power to nullify a law. It is time to stand up and educate the people about the impact they can make as an active member of a jury.
With the billboards we will be able to open the eyes of individuals all over the nation with your help! The billboards will run for a minimum of 3 months and will be located near courthouses or some place where potential jurors will be walking/driving by. The campaign will start in Cincinnati and with enough money we could make this a national campaign. 
Please keep in mind we are not graphic artists so what you see pictured is not the final product. A professional will complete the final product.

I love art + I love love-notes.
This project combines both.
Each of these watercolors was inspired by a natural space that is sacred + alive for me: a park near my house, the Rocky Mountains in Colorado, and a plot of land my family has tended for generations.
These felt the perfect pieces to bring to life with greeting cards.
I imagine them being used as blank canvases for love letters, notes of gratitude, congratulatory salutations, words of encouragement, creative doodles, and/or incantations of magic and blessing.
Here's the art:
Inspired by Havenwoods State Park (Wisconsin) + the Autumn Aspens of Rocky Mountain National Park (Colorado)
Inspired by "the Ranch" (Minnesota)
Each card features one of these paintings + is blank on the inside.
Cards measure 4.25” x 5.5” and are printed on sturdy 17 pt., 100% recycled textured paper. 
Envelopes are included.

Egg tempera and oil on panel by Caroline Adams - 10x8"
Many thanks to all of you who have bought paintings, prints, and studio visits.
 You have helped me reach my initial goal and much more. I started painting today, sharing the kitchen table with homework and coloring on a sunny Sunday morning:
First Layer
Next Color
Part of my reason for doing this project was the desire to paint the 50 small egg tempera pieces. But it is also as a way of getting my work out in front of more eyes. Please keep passing along the link, posting it on Facebook and tweeting it so I can get some more exposure and interest in my work.
This Kickstarter isn't only a way for people to support me. It is a way to buy art at a great price. Every contribution from $75 and up receives an original piece of artwork. Some of the pledge levels buy a painting from the exhibit and some buy a painting that I have already completed -- they are shown on my website and can be chosen in a first-pledge-first-served order. You can see the existing paintings here: http://www.carolineadamsart.com/rewards.html
I have 10 days left and I am setting a new goal of $10,000 as a way of pushing myself to get the word out even further. If you know of anyone who might be interested in my work, please pass along the link to this Kickstarter campaign.
Many thanks again for your support and help. It's been a great success and I'm grateful to all who have supported me thus far.
Now back to the eggs and brushes!
Painting with Eggs
For thousands of years, painters have mixed powdered pigment made from earth and plants with egg yolk and water to create translucent paint (watch the video to see how!). Egyptian sarcophagi, Botticelli masterpieces, and Andrew Wyeth’s haunting landscapes all derive part of their power from egg tempera.
Egg tempera is different. It is translucent and delicate.  Its surface is smooth, but holds great depth. The paint is applied stroke by stroke -- sometimes with a single hair -- taking care not to overlap until the previous layer has dried.  Very slowly, layers of paint build to create a surface that appears to glow from within.
Botticelli's 'Birth of Venus,' an egg tempera masterpiece
With your help, I will make 50 egg tempera paintings.
I have used egg tempera in the past.  I love the slow brush work. I love the way the paint dries almost instantly.  I love the process, building layer after layer of translucent color to create the subtle, ephemeral changes so well suited to landscapes filled with light, clouds, and atmosphere.
Egg tempera and oil on panel by Caroline Adams - 5x7"
Egg tempera and oil on panel by Caroline Adams - 5x7"
Egg tempera and oil on panel by Caroline Adams - 5x7"
I will work on the paintings in batches, 10-15 at a time depending on size and spend around two months on each batch.
I will create a variety of sizes:
7x5" - 15 paintings
10x8" - 20 paintings
9x12" - 5 paintings
14x11" - 5 paintings
20x16" - 5 paintings
My brother, Tristram MacDonnell, will build handmade maple frames with splined corners.
When the paintings are finished and framed -- in summer 2014 -- I will rent gallery space from Susan Calloway Fine Arts in Georgetown, Washington, DC, and hang all 50 pieces.  I often think of my smaller work as being part of a larger whole.   I envision the whole room full of small, intimate glimpses of one larger, shared landscape.
With your generous support the following will be possible:
Materials - Ampersand Clay Board panels, new brushes, powdered pigments, eggs
Time - I am an artist but also a mother of two and I work at a gallery part time.  Paying for two extra days of aftercare at my kids' school will give me the time I need to paint.
Presentation - Beautifully handmade frames are an essential finishing element to the paintings
Space - I need to rent the gallery space to exhibit the work
Marketing - Postcards to advertise show, catalogue of show, preview party/opening

They will have a similar feel to some of the paintings shown above.  I will post the paintings as I finish them throughout the year.

ICUERO WALLET STAND sticks to the back of a phone or phone case as a kickstand and a wallet built in one. It holds your phone in portrait or landscape mode with adjustable angle for comfortable handsfree viewing.    
It holds up to 2 cards securely for easy access. It is super slim, wireless charging friendly and great for everyday organization and improved display and viewing comfort to relieve finger, elbow and neck pain caused by your smartphone.
PLAY

ICUERO WALLET STAND attaches to the back of your iPhone and cases and can go anywhere with you. 
It can be exhausting to hold your phone up when you are Facetiming, watching videos, chatting with a friend, checking emails, referring online recipes while cooking, which is why you need icuero wallet stand to do all the work for you by freeing your hands. 
It's super easy for you to use icuero wallet stand and only takes One Second to open and close it. 
Your iPhone can be displayed in both landscape and portrait orientation as needed with icuero to conduct your everyday tasks such as watching a long clip, browsing the Internet or taking a picture.

Better viewing angles protect eyesight and largely reduce the risk of neck pain. You can adjust icuero wallet stand to hold your phone at preferred viewing angles from 0° to 90° vertically and 0° to 135° horizontally, to watch movies in a more comfortable position.
When you don’t want to carry a wallet or have a bulging pocket, icuero wallet stand comes in handy.  
It features two standard-sized (85mm/3.4in) card slots that can hold up to 2 cards (credit card, ID, business card and some pocket money) to keep important items nearby and easily accessible.
ICUERO WALLET STAND is custom made to perfectly match various models of iPhone, including iPhone 6,7,8, 6S Plus, 7 Plus, 8 Plus, X, XR, XS and XS Max. Its exquisite cutout precisely exposes the rear cameras.

What about Android phones?
We would be glad to support different smartphones. As there are thousands of different Android phones in the market, we suggest user use our dimension guide to see if ICUERO WALLET STAND fits well with the Android phone in question. 
For most cases, iPhone 8 Plus version may be suitable to majority of the Android phone. Please kindly refer to the dimension of each ICUERO WALLET STAND to determine if your phone is supported.
ICUERO WALLET STAND is very easy to set up, just remove 3M protective film and place the protective films on it and attach it to the back of your iPhone. 
P.S. icuero wallet stand works best with flat, smooth cases, and most case materials. Silicone cases do not properly adhere to icuero. (For best results, we have included transparent films for use with glass back iPhone).
ICUERO WALLET STAND is made of premium Oxford cloth which is ultra slim and yet rigid and almost invisible when viewed from the side. It fits comfortably in your palm, adds no bulk to your pocket or purse and more importantly, won’t inhibit wireless charging (with one card) or Apple Pay even with the cards in.
Genuine high quality 3M adhesive on icuero wallet stand guarantees a safe and enduring bonding to the back of your phone or phone case. It leaves no residue after peeling off.

Throughout the past year my life was consumed by dance, I went from dancing ballet twice a week, to 5 times a week. This past January I auditioned for a few dance schools hoping to get accepted into at least one of their summer intensives, but I ended up getting into 3/4 of the schools I auditioned for. I ended up choosing Orlando Ballet. As some of you may know attending one of these intensives is not cheap, and can really leave a dent in anyone's wallet. This 5 week long intensive will require me to stay in one of the dorms they provide, but that adds onto the total costs. Making the total $5,000. Luckily I have an extremely supportive family who is willing to let me attended. If I can find ways to get the extra money we need. I am not an only child, My brother is also extremely active and my parents have to pay for his activities along with my own, which as you can imagine can be stressful at times. Thank you for taking the time to read a little bit about me and for helping make my dreams a reality.

If you missed our project, please look for us at High Desert Botanicals.  Thank you to everyone who supported our project!
---------------------------------------------
The Do-It-Yourself Tonic Kit
Bond ordered a double gin and tonic and one whole green lime. When the drink came he cut the lime in half, dropped the two squeezed halves into the long glass, almost filled the glass with ice cubes and then poured in the tonic. He took the drink out on to the balcony, and sat and looked out across the spectacular view.
From “Dr. No” by Ian Fleming, 1958
With the arrival of summer, it’s time to offer a cool, delicious DIY drink kit appropriate for the season: the tonic kit. High Desert Botanicals specializes in providing collections of spices used for cocktail and drink flavorings. I buy in bulk and sell at affordable prices. My kits are intended for the do-it-yourselfers and the experimenters out there who are guided by their own, unique tastes and not the trends of the masses.
I already sell a basic tonic kit in our Etsy store. While it has been very popular, it could be even better:
Better prices! By purchasing the raw materials in even larger quantities, I can offer the kits for less.
More choices! I’m adding options with more spices, different sizes, and even a DIY Gin Kit to accompany the tonic kit. Sure, you could make tonic that tastes just the stuff in those little, yellow bottles at the supermarket, but why would you want to do that? Make a tonic that stands out, that your friends will remember and ask for, and is totally your own, distinct blend. And then do something completely different next week. 
Did I mention the DIY Gin Kit? Tired of the same gin from the green bottle? Need a little less juniper and more spice flavors? Start with neutral grain spirits and add my botanicals to get just the taste you want.
History of Tonic
The British, inventors of India Pale Ale, created tonic water to improve the taste of the daily ration of quinine given to sailors and soldiers as an anti-malarial medication. Limes had long been used to prevent scurvy so adding lime and sugar to the quinine was a convenient pairing. Naturally, dry London gin soon found its way into the mix. Since malaria is endemic to tropical climates, tonic often appears in refreshing drinks from those regions.
For more information on the fascinating history of the plant and beverage, check out the links below.
University of Cambridge
Slate
Active History
Raintree Tropical Plant Database
Wikipedia 
Check the blog at HighDesertBotanicals.com and our Facebook page for recipes and tutorials.

For this Kickstarter project I am seeking $3,500 funding to buy the basic kit components in bulk to get better discounts.

Stretch goals:

$7,000 – Add upgraded Jyannan Tonnyx Kits with glass and stainless steel soda siphons.These gorgeous old-fashioned style glass soda siphons are modeled after antique siphons and have a stainless steel safety mesh and black plastic top. While I don’t have a photo that I’m allowed to use here, you can see images of similar looking antique models in this Google image search. Due to the long ordering and shipping lead time on the glass siphons, these kits may not be available for the June 5th shipping date but will ship shortly after we receive them.
Kits - All herbs and spices are packaged in resealable plastic bags unless otherwise noted.We are planning to have everything shipped by June 5 so it will arrive in time in time for Father’s Day for US customers.

Includes quart sized mason jar, plus a storage and serving bottle, plus an aluminum soda siphon with 3 chargers.
Jynnan Tonnyx - Deluxe Tonic Kit plus a DIY Gin Kit with juniper berries, coriander, orris root, grains of paradise, cubeb berries, cassia (cinnamon), licorice root, and sarsaparilla to make three 750ml bottles of gin, and another storage bottle.
I’m happy to supply multiples of the Bare Bones, Basic, or Large Kits. Simply select the kit you would like and multiply the cost by number of kits you would like to calculate your total pledge. For instance, three Bare Bones Kits will be $30.
Disclaimers
The glass dishes shown in the photographs are for display purposes only and not included with the kits.
By purchasing this product you release the manufacturer from any and all legal responsibility. Some ingredients contained herein can be harmful if taken in excess. Due to natural variation in the cinchona bark, the precise amount of quinine in each batch of tonic cannot be specified. Cinchona officinalis bark varies from 2 to 7 % quinine by weight, depending on genetics and growing conditions. Please consult a reliable medical professional if you have any questions or concerns. Keep out of reach of children.

Keeping the Bastards Honest is a new investigative journalism fund launched by the Flagstaff this month. We have noticed over the years that the number of substantive reports coming through council to the Devonport-Takapuna Local Board have become less and less. There is also a marked lack of early engagement between the Government and Devonport residents, particularly on land issues that affect the area. We want to be more proactive in getting hold of the information on the spending and decision-making processes council and government bodies want to keep from the public. The trouble is that it comes at a not unsubstantial cost. The bill for our Official Act (OIA) Information request to the Ministry of Lands for documents over the sale of the Bayswater Marina reclamation was $350. And this was a relatively straightforward request. We have four OIA requests in the system at the moment and are expecting bills of between $400 to $1000 for each request to be actioned. With the furore over the planned axing of the Campbell Live current affairs show, and the subsequent surge in public support for the programme, we thought we would turn things on their head. Through the Keeping the Bastards Honest fund, local people can contribute directly to an increase in the freedom of information available to our community and the accountability of Government and Auckland Council. The Flagstaff is paid for by advertising and delivered for free so we hope people will contribute – a grass-roots response to keeping democracy alive and kicking. Every dollar will go towards Keeping the Bastards Honest. Our initial target is $2000. You can contribute online th

The design behind our SeaThread Collection was inspired by a vintage fisherman's sweater I pulled out of my father's closet. Always a conversation piece, the garment boasted a timeless pattern with thick ribbed cuffs and collars to promote thermal regulation and warmth for windy days by the water. A true multi-season garment, our sweaters are made from an incredibly soft blend that promotes comfort and versatility above all else.

It's no secret that ocean plastics are one of the biggest environmental challenges of our generation. Experts believe that, at our current rates of consumption, plastic will outnumber fish in the sea by the year 2050. Additionally, millions of pounds of oyster shells are discarded and end up in landfills every year. By developing high quality and timeless garments that promote the use of recycled materials, we hope to reduce waste, change the narrative, and do a small part in cleaning up our waterways for the next generation.
Our manufacturing partners leverage a patented nanotechnology to create rPET yarn by fusing both the recycled oyster shells and recycled water bottles. That material is then blended with some of the finest yarns on the planet adding different benefits and characteristics to the final knit garments.
Each oyster filters up to 50 gallons of seawater per day naturally regulating waterways. We've already begun partnering with a handful of organizations and non-profits committed to the well-being of oyster populations. We're proud to say that a portion of sales from each sweater will be invested in reseeding coastal oyster reefs promoting the long-term health of our inshore ecosystems.
We've partnered with world-class manufacturers who have worked tirelessly to produce the first SeaThread Sweaters. All of our partners are excited for this collection to go into production and we're scheduled for early November delivery.

MEET THE INSPIRATION BEHIND THE BOOK
Hi, my name is Aria. I am a first-time author, a mother of two, and wife to the adventurous hubby! We love nature so much that we spend most of our time outdoors with the kids. We have thrived and grown so much through interacting with nature.
In return, I wrote the story Jojo to raise awareness in kids to protect our nature.  
INTRODUCTION
Jojo is a fiction picture book about getting along with the wildlife. The main character, Jojo, is a special girl who can speak to animals. In the story, she solves the conflict between her brother and the animals. Her special ability has also brought her to the treasure keeper of the rainforest. 
Jojo's father hunted animals for his family.
Jojo is strange among her people because she doe not eat meat.
She accidentally discovered her ability to talk to animal
Abhi need to learn to get along with the animals.
*It is a 30 pages fully illustrated digital picture book, best for age 6 and above. 
The main character, Jojo, is based on the image of my daughter, Boo. Jojo is the virtual image of Boo, who is going on a mission to save the rainforest.
Watch the story of Boo here. 
Jojo is UNIQUE, LOVING and BRAVE. 
Jojo is UNIQUE among her people, because she doesn't eat meat. That is because she wants to protect the animal. Jojo is LOVING. She risked her life to save her brother from the animal. Jojo is BRAVE to negotiate with the animals when she was rescuing her brother.
We hope to bring the positive energy to kids all around the world!
 OUR MISSION 
We want to raise awareness in kids to protect mother nature through the picture book Jojo. We would like to encourage kids to immerse themselves in mother nature as well.
Besides that, we also pay attention to kid’s wellbeing. We want to encourage kids to be unique, courageous, and adventurous at the same time.
 CONTRIBUTE TO Mother Nature 
Rainforests are an important part of life on our planet. They provide us with the air we breathe, and they are home to plants and animals too. Yet, towards the end of 2019 and the start of 2020, forest fires started to destroy the forests of the Amazon, Australia, and Indonesia.
We have lost several forests within half a year, but to regrow a forest takes decades. With all the forest we have lost, the time to start regrowing them is now.
Half of your pledge will go to Danau Girang Field Centre (DGFC). DGFC is a collaborative research centre located in the east coast of Sabah and dedicated to the applied conservation of tropical ecosystems and the effective management of wildlife in a fragmented landscape. FOLLOW THEM HERE.
By repairing areas of rainforest, we will be increasing forest connectivity which is an essential part of saving the orangutan and other endangered species.
Danau Girang Field Centre will manage the donation and use our donation to regrow the rainforest on appropriate sites.
The number of trees planted will be monitored and reported back. Danau Girang Field Centre will track the growth of the planted trees. We will get the updates on the amount of carbon taken out of the atmosphere, as well as other social, environmental, and economic impacts.
EXTRA VALUE!!!!
 We decided to go green this time. We do not want to cut down any tree to print our book since we are going to regrow the rainforest. 
In addition to thank you for supporting our Kickstarter project, we will be adding another ebook in the pledge!
Jojo features indigenous people, Sun Bear, Clouded Leopard, Proboscis Monkey, Orangutan, and some other endangered animals. Your pledge will include an ebook that introduces the endangered animals of Borneo that were featured in Jojo.
Let’s learn about the endangered animals of Borneo with Jojo!
Follow Woah Wild Wild (www.instagram.com/woahwildwild) to get more information.
With a combination of personal funds and your pre-orders/contributions, it will help us pay for the following:
Illustrations
Regrow the rainforests and protect the wildlife

Stretch Goal Progress
Thanks for checking out the project!
Hopefully you are here because you are interested and a fellow fan of PlayStation games. The short of it, I am looking to produce an unnofficial book I have created for fans of Sony and the original PlayStation. Inside the book are nearly 1000 screenshots from games released on the original PlayStation, filling over 700 pages. The focus of this book are on all the games Sony Computer Entertainment of America (SCEA) published during the complete life of the system. That spans games from 1995 all the way through the twilight years (and beyond, really) in 2005. Giant screenshots, no fluff, all nostalgia.
What is it?
Sony's PlayStation: A Chronological Visual Retrospective of SCEA Published Games from 1995-2005 is a mouthful, but its a book. An 8" x 6" book covering 151 different games, 700+ pages, nearly 1000 screenshots, and that's it. There are plenty of other excellent people and publishers producing quality retro gaming content with interviews, developer stories, history and more. This book isn't that. I see this being a companion book for fans looking for more simple, nostalgic content. My goal is to let the games and your own memories tell the story. The filter and scope is that all the titles inside this book were games published by SCEA themselves. It is organized by release date, so with each page you see the progression and evolution of the technological feats and eras of the original PlayStation.
Cover Mock
Inside Mock
Why?
I am posing this question, but I don't have a real answer. Basically, I just want a copy of this book for myself. I am hoping there are enough others interested in it so I can actually print it and have one. I've been a long time fan of Retro Gamer magazine and Retro Micro Games Action magazine. They do an excellent job covering the classic games, and sometimes those full page and double page blown up images tell a whole story. That was the inspiration for this project. 
Personally, I have always loved what Sony has done. I know many people swear by and pray at the alter of Nintendo, but call me a blasphemer, there is no better publisher than Sony. Now I will admit not all of their games are gold, but they take chances on all styles of games. They do unique and weird games, AAA games, hardcore, casual, everything. I love that about them, and I love the partnerships they make doing that. Some people think I am crazy, but I know plenty of others agree with me. This project is for us.
Is my favorite game XYZ in this? That game was sooooooo good!
Maybe? If SCEA published it, it's in here. This is EVERY game they supported and published here in North America. Nothing is missing from their catalog, but if your favorite game is Street Fighter Alpha 3 or Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 2, then you'll be disappointed. Is your favorite game PaRappa the Rapper or Twisted Metal 2? They're here! Is it Final Fantasy VII? You're in luck! Squaresoft (at the time) had a publishing deal and SCEA was the publisher here in NA. If this project does well, I would love to do smaller follow-up companions like Capcom's PlayStation, Konami's PlayStation, Namco's PlayStation and more. I hope that clears up the direction of the project.
I backed the project but what does "plus any additional unlocks from campaign progress" mean? Is the goal not actually $2300?
Good eye! I want this project to exist, so that is how I built this campaign. The printing quote I got was the smallest print run I could do. Meeting this goal would produce an awesome softcover book for us all to have, but I personally want to see more. The more support this campaign gets the more it will upgrade what you all get as a reward with no extra costs required from you. The ultimate version I want to produce that I got a quote for would be a matte finished cover with unique spot finish UV bound hardcover book with a cool slipcase to protect it all (this is happening!). I have an idea of some fun "memory card" bookmarks (and we made them!). If it gets REAL crazy, additional pages with more screenshots, improved paper quality, etc (and we did this!). All funds will allow the project to grow and improve and benefit everyone getting a copy of the book. This is also factoring in Kickstarter taking their 5% and other taxes and processing fees that come with completing projects in this platform. 
How did you find these games and data? Are you sure this is everything?
Yeah, I think so. I did a lot of research and organizing info and data for this project. I don’t even know if i could factor how much time was spent total. To start, I found two conflicting lists of complete games released for the original PlayStation along with inaccurate release date information. I merged the two and found some more inaccuracies within that new list. I then used two separate data-based websites (Moby Games and the PlayStation DataCenter) to cross check and validate info. I then took all that data and read through old issues of EGM, Game Informer, GamePro, GameFan, Game Players and more to be a 3rd source of validation for release dates and details. Everything I now have is as accurate as it can be, at this point. For fun, I also included Sony's SCUS identifier with each game... just because.
Now, is there a chance I still missed something? Sure. I hope I didn't, but if I did, I'd love to know about it so I can correct and/or update my data and be as complete as I can be. I know I didn't miss NBA ShootOut 99, because that game doesn't exist. It was cancelled just weeks before release and you can technically find a playable build of it, but it wasn't ever officially in the wild. It was one of the last NBA games SISA/989 Studios made before Killer Games took over developing for NBA ShootOut 2001. That's info you'll have at your fingertips if you get a copy of this book.
I have a question, what do I do?
Reach out to me here on Kickstarter or find me on social media. Twitter and Instagram I am @darrenhupke, Facebook you can search for Darren Hupke. I think that's it, really. You can leave a comment on this project page, as well. I will address or answer any questions coming my way as quickly as I can.
Okay, I read this whole page, but is there just a list of all the games included inside?
Sure, I can do that. Games in bold have more than the standard 4 page/6 screenshot template. Here you go:

As someone who has recently started a fine arts career I have experienced the ups and downs of trying to make it in the art world. It is when you get that one big approval that makes all of the rejection notices worthwhile. That is where I am at this moment. My submission of a exhibit proposal was accepted by the Cleveland Botanical Gardens for a show in their gallery space. I am being asked to hold an exhibit during their "Big Spring" event which will take place from March 21st through April 27th , 2015. The kicker is they would really like me to display my most recent work of extreme close-ups of butterfly wings which I do not have printed out. 
So I am almost there. I have the images ready to be printed. I have the venue lined up to host the exhibit. I just need your help to have my artwork printed out so I can hold an awesome exhibit. 
I have switched from photo paper to having my photographs printed as aluminum metal prints. This is a process in which the printing company uses a special photo paper to reverse print the image I give them. They place it on a specially coated sheet of aluminum and then it is heated up and pressed together, fusing the photographic image directly into the aluminum. The image is in the aluminum, not sitting on it. This makes it very durable, water proof, scratch resistant, and with a very long archival duration.
The only downside for using metal prints for a large show is that they are much more expensive to have printed out than traditional photo paper prints. However, the added benefits of metal prints mentioned above far outweigh the added expense. This is the reason for presenting you with this fundraiser.

WE'VE INTRODUCED A STRETCH GOAL WITH BONUS REWARDS!
Since every dollar raised through Kickstarter will help to make this project a success we're introducing a stretch goal of $25,000.
How does a stretch goal work?   If we're able to reach our stretch goal of $25,000, every backer that has pledged more than $24, will receive a bonus reward! This will apply to BOTH existing backers and new backers! This is our way of saying thank you for such a successful campaign.
     WHAT THE HECK HAPPENED?
MISHAP! Brewing Company didn’t always look like this. We were once named after a local creek, and people came through our doors knowing we offered well-devised, unique craft beers that had a story to tell. We are the little guy—the home-grown, local favorite that refused to quit when the big guy came to town. Today, we are still offering the same great-tasting beer and communal gathering place—but this time, our name pays homage to the occasional “whoops!” moments and happy mistakes that have made us who we are.
Want to learn more about the backstory of our name change? Here's some of the coverage: Buffalo Bulletin Story - Wyoming Magazine Story - Casper Star Tribune Story 
** For those new to KickStarter, you are able to manage your reward and change it. We will be adding new reward packages to allow you to bundle multiple products. After the campaign ends, you will be asked to send us your address and sizing. This information must be received by December 14th in order to have it produced for Christmas delivery. Thanks!! **
Our brewery was originally kick-started on this very platform 4 short years ago, and we're back to enlist the help of our friends and neighbors so we can continue brewing under a new name. See our original project here: click this.
 WHERE WILL YOUR FUNDING GO?
Simply put, it's covering the cost to relaunch our operation under a new name. There are so many costs associated with changing the name of an existing business including: lawyers, bankers, designers, documentation, new pints and growlers, updated signs and letterhead, website, printed kegs, printed apparel, and other merchandise.  With your funding, you get sweet new brew gear and we get to keep doing what we do best - make really damn good beer.
WHY KICKSTARTER?
You supported us before, and we thought this would be the best platform for us to launch and promote our new name with our friends and neighbors. We couldn't have done it without you the first time, and we are humbly asking for your help again.
Remember, Kickstarter is an all or nothing funding mechanism.  If we fall short of our $20,000 goal in 30 days, you aren't charged and we also get nothing. BUT, if we go over our goal, we will roll out some sweet stretch rewards. Getting to $20,000 would be ideal, but extra funds will be used to cover the cost of the things we list above and produce all of the new merchandise.
MORE ABOUT US
The brewery started as a dream over 7 years ago, back when we were creating our craft as small batch home brews in our garage.  In the fall of 2011, our team sat down and began to turn the dream into reality and brewery began to take shape. We leased a historic building in downtown Buffalo just a block from the local landmark stream, Clear Creek.  We put deposits down on shiny new equipment and threw caution to the wind. 
Community support has been incredible, as word (and taste) got out, everything began to move from a dream to reality.  Now, as we continue to grow, we look forward to distributing our craft beer regionally.
