YOU CAN'T CHOOSE WHO YOU LOVE, OR WHO LOVES YOU.
Thank you for taking time to look at our Kickstarter page, it's a project we really believe in and hope you can join us in making it a reality.
TAME is a short film staring CAGGIE DUNLOP and LAURE STOCKLEY. The initial idea came from a frustration at the types of roles the two actresses were being offered and a desire to portray three dimensional rounded characters that suffer from the same faults and flaws as their male counterparts.
It's not that these roles don't exist entirely, it's just that there's less of them. 
Working with award winning director DAVID PETCH the two actresses started to explore themes of gender, sexuality and friendship. Through writing and acting workshops we developed the characters first and then built the story around them. 
An unusual approach to screenwriting but in this case it felt right, we want to make a film where people care about the characters, where they can relate and connect with them.
WHY KICKSTARTER?
We're opting to use Kickstarter as it provides filmmakers and actors the unique opportunity to be in control of the creative process. We want to make a film that doesn't conform to the usual gender stereotypes and we don't want to compromise our vision. 
We also want to battle preconceptions about what role an actor can or should play. One of our lead actresses Caggie is probably best know for appearing in the TV show Made in Chelsea. Although she's proud of her achievements in the show it shouldn't be something that defines her career. The kind of roles she's offered as an actress often reflect the stigma that reality television carries. TAME is a break from this. 
WHERE YOUR MONEY GOES.
Although none of our 'above the line talent' such as our actors or director are taking a fee we do need still need a budget. We have to pay for our crew, locations and equipment and we need to feed people on set. 
We'll be working with top of the range equipment such as the Arri Alexa camera, prime lenses and editing on an AVID. You may know what all of this is or it might sound like a foreign language. All it means is that we'll have the ability to make an incredible looking film. Although the best equipment in the world means nothing without having the right people to use it.
Luckily we're working with some of the top Heads of Department in the industry. Our Director of Photography, Production Designer, Editor are all working for a fraction of their usual rates but we do still need to cover some of their expenses.
We want to be 100% transparent with you, our investors so that's why we're also sending a simplified copy of our line budget to everyone who invests. We want you to see exactly where your money's going and also thought it might be of interest to any aspiring filmmakers out there.
CAST
Caggie Dunlop
Laure Stockley
SYNOPSIS
We follow two close friends Amanda and Nicole over the course of a weekend spent with Amanda's estranged father.
Tensions between the two girls arise when they're forced to confront their true feelings for each other. Leading them to look at who they really are and what they want for the future. 
TAME explores themes of love, friendship and gender in the modern world.

Glad you asked. Chippo is our very own invention: a patent pending, mind-blowing mash-up of golf and traditional backyard games. We like to call Chippo the glorious lovechild of golf and cornhole (the popular bean bag toss game). We’ve combined the old fashioned, beer-slugging, tailgate-dominating, sunshine-basking goodness of games like cornhole with the gentlemanly, giddiness-inducing, side-betting beauty of golf. Chippo is the only backyard game where you can work over your buddies, while working on your short game. Sound good? Well, we are ready to bring Chippo to beaches, backyards, tailgates, gym classes and golf clubhouses all over these great United States of America...but we need your help!
    We’ve done a lot so far to get Chippo to this point. We've started a company; done a bunch of research; built and tested countless prototypes; obtained legal protection by filing for patents and trademarks; chosen a trusted manufacturing partner; perfected our prototypes; finalized the awesome design of Chippo; found a trusted, efficient and experienced storage/order fulfillment/shipping partner; and built an in-depth business plan and financial model...to name a few things. Now, we need your help in order to fund our first large order from the manufacturer. Kickstarter offers an amazing platform to connect Chippo with other like-minded and passionate golf enthusiasts and backyard game gurus. By backing Chippo, you’ll be supporting young inventors/entrepreneurs and joining the growing herd of Chippopotamuses...But also: Can you imagine being the first one of your friends to roll up to the beach, backyard, tailgate or clubhouse with Chippo? That’s the stuff legends are made of.
    Each Chippo set includes two target boards.
Each board measures 40" x 24" x 1.4" and weighs just under 10 lbs.
Quality artificial turf covers the surface of each board, mimicking the feel of a real green and making for some sick spins and bounces.
Each board includes three strategically placed holes for scoring.
Netting is attached to each hole to catch scoring shots, leaving no confusion over the tally and preventing fist fights.
The legs fold under for easy storage and transportation.
There is a compartment to store the mats built into the underside of each board. 
Each Chippo set includes two chipping mats.
Our mats are made of quality artificial turf attached to heavy rubber so it doesn't move when you hit the ball.
The mats also enable you to play Chippo on any surface.
Here, we name a few surfaces on which one can play Chippo: sand at the beach, grass in a backyard or park, asphalt in a parking lot or driveway, the patio at the clubhouse, carpet at the office, tile in your bathroom, cheese or barbecue spare ribs (not sure which one is true) on the surface of the moon.
Each Chippo set includes six balls.
The balls are made of high quality, high density foam.
They travel 1/3 the distance of a regular golf ball but feel very similar off the club.
These balls are dense and balanced for true spin, trajectory and accuracy...
And soft enough that they will not dent car doors, break windows or noses, and won't bounce and roll like crazy. 
Safe to play with anyone, anywhere.
Like all great and beautiful things, playing Chippo is pretty simple: 

Step One: Set up the boards as depicted above.
Step Two: Find three friends (or highly skilled pets) and start chipping! 

Chippo is easy enough for non-golfers, and pros can move the boards back for a more challenging game. 
Gameplay is reminiscent of cornhole, washers or horseshoes, but with some cool new twists. Flip a coin to start, winners go first from there on out. You take three shots in a row at the target board and tally your total score like-a-this:

1 point: Just hit the board on a fly.
3 points: Drain your shot in the larger center hole. 
5 points: Send the ball to its home in either top corner hole. 
2x points: If you're a surgeon with a sixty degree wedge, bounce your shot off the chipping mat for double (2, 6 or 10) points. Promptly yell "Mashed Potatoes!" 

Your opponent standing next to you goes next. The player with the highest total score wins that “hole” for his/her team. The players on the other side then battle it out for "hole" #2, and so on. Play an 18 “hole” match. Settle ties with a sudden death playoff - intense! You can drink beer, heckle your friends and gamble while doing this. Life is good. Keep in mind, these are the standard Chippo Match Play Rules but, like golf, there are many different ways to keep score while playing Chippo such as Stroke Play and Nassau. We’ll have a full list with all the different scoring options soon.
  History books are strewn with great and prescient inventors. Men who were able to see into the future, beyond the boundaries of their own time and place, toward a version of the world that was better, more perfect, more beautiful. Men like Edison, Franklin, Tesla, Jobs. Brendan and Matt, the co-founders of Chippo Golf LLC, have one thing in common with these men: Brendan and Matt are also men. Other than that, they likely have very little in common with those other men. Brendan and Matt are somewhat intelligent, mediocre looking, washed up athletes, who happened to have a great idea (Chippo - a game that combines golf and cornhole - why doesn’t this already exist!?) and decided to man-up and make it happen! They are both avid golfers, intensely competitive backyard gamers, and both incredibly bad at both golf and backyard games. Brendan is a former collegiate athlete, with an MBA, two kids, a heart of gold, a receding hairline and ten years of experience in finance. Matt is a little older with slightly more hair (though an awkward percentage of it is gray given his age), two dogs with a total of seven legs, one kid on the way and over ten years of experience in marketing and design...and he can still do a kick-flip on his skateboard - whatever that means. Chippo is their first entrepreneurial venture together. They'd love it if you'd consider joining them on their mission to bring golf and backyard game infused fun to the world.
As if this baby hippo learning to swim isn't rewarding enough...
      TODAY: You pre-order Chippo/back us through Kickstarter.
END OF FEBRUARY 2017: Kickstarter campaign completed. Chippo places order with manufacturer.
MARCH 2017: Your Chippo swag (shirts and can coolers) is shipped.
APRIL 2017: Chippo receives first shipment from manufacturer and processes Kickstarter pre-orders.
MID/END APRIL 2017: The moment of truth. Love at first sight ♥. You receive your Chippo and instantly become cooler.
APRIL 2017 AND BEYOND: News of Chippo spreads like wildfire and, together, we make golf fun again.

I have always written. After my daughter was killed by a drunk driver in 2007, I started to panic that when I died, her entire life, which I carried in my memories, would be gone. She would be forgotten. In a panic to record every single one I could, I started to write obsessively. This also gave my mind something to focus on during those first horribly painful months. My writing changed from one of recording the past to surviving the present. I wrote poems to release the grief, I penned letters to my dead daughter. I spilled my emotions and thoughts onto the page, trying to find the answers in between the words. Attempting to make the unimaginable make sense. I ranted and raged. Slowly the sentences stopped carrying the weight of my anger and started to make way for the healing.  Along the way, I have learned more about myself, my daughter, and about the truth in others than I had imagined. The journey is cyclical, and I pass a stage in my grief, and thinking I have overcome it, and there it is again. Waiting on the horizon, for me to meet it again. I don't have all the answers. This book is very personal to me. Selfishly, it is a way to get my daughter's name into as many heads as I can. She isn't flesh and blood and laughter anymore. She is made of bits of dreams, memories, photos, and she lives when someone thinks of or says her name. I have shared my writing in very limited ways, to a few people, and I have been told I should publish, because my words resonate with those who have lost a child. I don't have a degree, I am not a trained writer. My words are merely those of a mother who has had to say good bye to a precious child.

DR HOPS KOMBUCHA BEER is meticulously crafted to be the most enlivening alcoholic beverage in the world.  Starting with carefully filtered water and pure organic teas, we are brewing a grain-free, probiotic beverage that's 8-10% alcohol.  It's unpasteurized and fully alive, with a tart, fruity taste and astounding aromatics.  There's nothing available like it!
 Our first tasting and fundraiser was awesome!
PLAY

Our most active and health-conscious friends are especially excited.  And our most sophisticated drinking friends are also pleased.  We even have one backer who has promised to match whatever else we raise, so YOUR CONTRIBUTION COUNTS DOUBLE!!  That is so grand.
first look... NEW logo!
 With your help we will be able to complete our current product development phase and get our product out by early next year.
YOUR MONEY will go towards:
1) Brewing and tasting equipment, including 10 large glass bubblers, a heated production case (we're building it in the photo just below), two kegs, a CO2 system, a custom water filtration system, and various growlers, bottles and labels.
2) Ingredients and supplies, including organic black tea, green tea and yerba mate, organic evaporated cane juice and turbinado, raspberries, ginger, hops, wood chips, and other herbs and spices.
3) Some remaining licensing fees and business certifications, including the $800 CA LLC tax and additional training and certifications for the team.
4) The gorgeous logo of the meditating, levitating rabbit and all those killer rewards we're offering!
5) Tastings and focus group events that we will be hosting later this year. Please stay tuned for more and then come participate!  Your feedback and participation will make us great.
---  
What We've Accomplished So Far:  We've already set-up the basics, like the LLC, the website, the business model and the plan.  We've also created a slew of promising prototypes and have identified our basic process.  We've also confirmed that there is a huge (untapped) demand for this product.  Now we are focusing on a much larger product development and testing phase.
Action Plan:  By later this year, we plan to have 12 strategic variations on our first core formula, about 72 gallons total.  These variations will be tasted and evaluated at a series of tastings and focus groups.  With your help, along with the help of our most discerning and market-savvy friends, we will dial in on the optimal formula for our first release.  Concurrently, we will continue to develop our business model and plan, enter competitions, and attract additional capital.  We'll make the jump to commercial production by early next year and get our life-changing product to market by spring.
Commitments:  Our long-term plans include a carbon-negative production and distribution set-up, (solar panels, energy-savvy systems, water conservation, and lots of plant life), a gorgeous light-filled taproom and outdoor area, and a strong social and animal friendly role in the community.  Expansion beyond the Bay Area will depend on a locally-owned, entrepreneurial business model, creating fun, rewarding lifestyles for go-getters in places like Austin, LA and Seattle.  And we will continually advance the craft of probiotic alcohol.
PLEASE CONTRIBUTE!
YOUR PARTICIPATION in our fundraisers and focus groups will make us that much stronger.
YOUR SHARING of this campaign (and what we're up to in general) will open new doors!  So please share with abandon!  That's how the magic really happens.  :-)
PLEASE SHARE!
And stay tuned for frequent updates and upgrades.  We're developing!
fermentation specialist Thomas Weaver checking for quality
INSIDE VIEW:  Temperature control is very important to the quality of our product.  And until we have an industrial facility we've just got to get creative!  (Even after that really, but you get the point.)  Thank goodness Tommy has excellent power tools.  ;-)
the crew building a case for product development and testing...
INSIDE VIEW:  One of our core commitments is to promote and foster responsible water.  After all, we are in California, and our product is almost all water!  On the most basic level, that means filtering our municipal water supply efficiently and effectively.  That's the most responsible practice we know of!
Our first step in that direction was to create a customized water filtration system.  It's specifically designed to remove exactly what we need it to remove, with no water wasted.  Won't you love knowing that the water in your kombucha beer is brilliant?  You bet!
Here is our first humble system, and here's to the difference we'll make in the long run.  Your support here is support for great water!
bye bye chlorine, chloramines & flouride, with no water wasted

DIDACTIQUE ET AFFECTIF Javelot.ch est un Média Digital bimestriel indépendant à l'interface d'une vraie revue munie de pages animées à lire sur un ordinateur ou une tablette. Les articles proposent de découvrir des niches de micro-entrepreneuriat et de Talent et la passion d'un métier. La cible du lectorat de Javelot.ch est le consommacteur curieux la seconde cible est de stimuler le Désir Métier chez les jeunes. Les reportages d'entrepreneurs passionnés comprennent des vidéos interactives didactiques sur un savoir-faire dont on en ignore souvent beaucoup. L'avantage certain de l'e-Journal est de pouvoir l'alimenter par des vidéos et des clics interactifs pour accéder rapidement aux sites des entrepreneurs qui s'y sont invités. La lecture dynamique de Javelot offre une alternative pour envisager l'avenir professionnel et surfe sur le Capital social, la toile du net incontournable qui lie les humains et permet les échanges et les informations. L'ADN de Javelot.ch: La consommation est liée aux métiers.
LA CONSOMMATION AFFECTIVE «On transforme l'acquisition en expérience, en ré-enchantement» (Filser, 2002). C'est le besoin d'affectivité, de sens et d'échange (Baudrillard, 1970). A travers la découverte d'un micro-entrepreneur et d'un Talent par son portrait, on découvre son métier dans sa didactique et des informations nécessaires à sa compréhension. La proximité est stimulée et la curiosité nourrie. Javelot entre dans le sujet et c'est ce que nous appelons «La consommation affective». Le financement d'expansion demandé nous permettrait d'améliorer nettement l'ergonomie du site et du journal grâce à un marketing efficace élaboré par des professionnels. Vu que j'assure toutes les choses qui font Javelot, il m'est nécessaire de renouveler mon matériel peu performant. En soutenant ce plan d'action, le nombre d'abonnés peut considérablement augmenter vers une autonomie d'ici un an et demi. En nous soutenant, vous nous permettez de continuer à assurer une meilleure visibilité aux micro-entreprises et de fait de proposer un journal qui stimule le désir et la connaissance des métiers. 
POUR QUI?
Qui sont ces micro-entrepreneurs VIP? Javelot c'est rendre une visibilité VIP à toute personne qui entreprend quelque chose. «Le talent n'est rien sans l’envie de faire quelque chose.» J. Brel, 1964 Avec plus de 2'000 adresses mails recevant notre Newsletter mensuelle, l'invitation aux micro-entreprises à se montrer et à parler de leur métier est un succès qui rend la démarche du journal viable à long terme. A chaque édition nous avons des bookings assurés. (Annexe 4) Avec notre proposition d'améliorer leur communication visuelle et de parler de leur métier, les micro-entreprises et les artisans bénéficient d'une belle visibilité. Pour certains, être invité est une nouveauté. Nous avons rendu Javelot.ch accessible pour toutes les classes sociales. 65.-/an pour tous, y compris l'interview pour les entrepreneurs dont la seule condition est de s'y abonner. C'est la Technique du Bonus spécifique basé sur l'échange de valeur. (point 5 Marketing). Le micro-entrepreneur gagne de la visibilité et de la reconnaissance et le lecteur de l'inspiration, en découvrant des niches d'entrepreneuriat et un outil de consommation qui satisfait sa curiosité.

Verve Collisionz is a hip hop group at the University of Colorado Boulder that was first created to introduce hip hop culture into the city of Boulder. Overtime it has grown into a safe space where individuals are encouraged to express themselves in a healthy and positive way while meeting dancers of various other backgrounds. Today, the event hosted by Verve Collisionz is the biggest hip hop competition in Colorado. It is a free show hosted at the university encouraging families and individuals of all ages to come share the love for hip hop. Every year we are honored to have crews from other states and countries, allowing different communities and cultures to come together as one. We have decided to create this project to help fundraise for the cash prices for our second and third place winners. 
Verve [vûrv] n.: Energy and enthusiasm in the expression of ideas, especially in artistic performance or composition

Ich bin zurzeit sehr glücklich über die vielversprechende und positive Entwicklung der Kunst, und zwar die Rückkehr zum Realismus. Jahr für Jahr gewinnt diese Kunstrichtung wieder mehr Begeisterte, auch auf den Leinwänden der berühmten Künstler unserer Zeit sieht man zunehmend realistische Darstellungen. Vor allem die Künstler der Europa und der USA arbeiten im realistischen Stil. Ich finde es sehr faszinierend und auch überraschend, da die Tendenz des letzten Jahrhunderts immer weiter in die abstrakte Kunst abdriftete und der Realismus immer an Bedeutung verlor. Aber auch das ist der Grund für die Rückkehr des Realismus in die Galerien und Ateliers, die Übersättigung des Marktes mit Abstraktion. Jetzt ist der Realismus modern und innovativ, auch die Kunstsammler der ganzen Welt greifen immer häufiger zu den im realistischen Stil gemalten Kunstwerken. Trotz der hartnäckigen Kritik mancher Kunstkritiker: die Kunst entwickelt sich nach eigenen, der Gesellschaft unbekannten Regeln, nimmt den eigenen Lauf und lässt wieder auferstehen oder in der Bedeutungslosigkeit versinken, ohne, dass die Kritiker oder Kenner einen Einfluss darauf nehmen können. Die Kunst wird nur durch die Künstler erschaffen, nur sie entscheiden, was aktuell, modern und angesagt ist. Man kann die Kunst in keine Rahmen zwingen, und die Künstler allein entscheiden, ob sie einen Pinsel schwingen oder eine Performance erstellen, ob Abstrakte Kunst oder Realismus – die Künstler entscheiden, was gesehen werden muss. Und jede Richtung hat ihre Daseinsberechtigung, in der Vergangenheit und der modernen Gesellschaft.
 Das Projekt wird mir die Chance geben, die Bildreihe zum Thema der Tiere und der Mythologie  zum malen. Den Vorgang meiner Arbeit möchte ich mit eine Camera aufnehmen so sollen spannende Videos entstehen. Anschließend  werde ich eine Ausstellung organisieren.

Wondering about carry it on a trip? No problem! Set it up with hotel or Airbnb guest house WiFi, it will start to work right away.

Unlike most home security cameras that require Cloud Storage to work, Litmor Battery Cam brings new local storage approach (Support micro-SD up to 128GB), while providing optional Cloud services. Less burden, more peace of mind.

Forget blurry, black and white night vision, the 1080p HD Litmor Cam reveals clear and colorful images no matter how dark the environment is. Cystal clear, day and night.

In order to better display the real environment, we turn off the camera's light at beginning of the recording. In the real use, the light will automatically turn on before you watch the video, so it's always color night vision whenever you watch it.
 Tell Alexa to switch the mode before you leave home or use Google Assistant to turn on alarm if there’s a stranger.  The Litmor Battery Cam has powerful integrations to help you manage your smart home.

Take advantage of those two rechargeable 18650 batteries, Litmor Team introduces ECO Battery mode. 
ECO Battery mode wakes up Litmor Battery Cam instantly and starts to record when motion is detected. And then Litmor App send notification to your phone, so you will get a clear look at who or what triggered the alert.

DAMAGEDANCE seeks, through dance, to explore the diversity of the human experience, increasing our awareness, understanding, and appreciation of our unique struggles, questions, and triumphs.  Our mission particularly rings true in our brand new piece WannaBe, to be revealed this May!
The Season
DAMAGEDANCE Spring Season
World premiere of WannaBe
May 3-4, 2014
Manhattan Movement and Arts Center
248 West 60th Street, NYC
The Inspiration
WannaBe plays upon masculinity versus femininity, and exposes expectations of gender identity. This solo is designed to be performed by a female or a male dancer, interchangeably. Inspiration is drawn from MGM films of 1940s and 1950s such as Singin' in the Rain and Easter Parade. The way a viewer connects with the lead characters, regardless of the viewer's gender, sparks the interest of Taylor. Especially during this period in time, gender roles were prominently portrayed in films like these. Personally, Taylor feels a stronger self-identity within the male characters played by Fred Astaire and Gene Kelly, as opposed to the leading ladies. Even when watching these movies as a child, she felt conflicted that she identified with the male figures way of moving, which was not expected of her gender.
The Goal
DAMAGEDANCE's new piece strives to deliver honest, dynamic, and genuinely thought-provoking art.  Not only is the company working with the dancers to build WannaBe--we are collaborating with our DD family to produce the most unique product possible. WannaBe will be presenting new choreography, new music, and new costumes!
Team WannaBe
Jessica Taylor/DAMAGEDANCE: The movers and muses
Ximena Borges: Internationally recognized musician and artist, crafting a new, original sound score
Laura Nitz: DD Costume Director and creator of the new costumes for this piece

Hello every one I'm here in hopes that I can start doing what I love to do and keeps calm which is my photography.
So a few years ago I was diagnosed with a few mental illnesses which is border line personality disorder, psd, anxiety and along with I.E.D they have been effectively interrupting my life and goals unfortunately it's been a rough ride I was told medication will help tone it down but after numerous attempts with different medications there was still no relief so I just started trying to fined things to help relax and distract me that's when I went out and got my Nikon D800 and multiple lenses and filters and off to the races we went I started off a little rough then after a bit I was hooked every day I was going out as early as I could to start shooting. I noticed unlike all the appointment and medications photography and going in to a zone that felt right was actually helping. Then I just thought to my self "I wonder if my photos would be good enough to catch people's attention I called up a local little art store to talk about carrying a bit of the photos I took I ended up actually selling a lot of my shots on canvas and just small prints it was a nice feeling that people were taking a liking to my stuff. Then one day in 2014 I left my gear in a friends car well we ran in to a restaurant to grab some food and when we returned to the car the window was smashed and every thing was gone. Iv since been unable to replace it because I am currently attending trios college for game design and technology's all the money that was saved up to replace the gear had to go in to tuition cost so it's still on the back burner till I am able to save up again which is why I am here today asking for help so I can get back out there and hopefully start shooting again to help cope with things and see if there are still people out there that would take a liking to my shots with a web site that I will be creating along with a few social media accounts when I get started again to help spread my work across and get noticed around the world instead of just locally
Thank you for taking the time to read my story and a massive thank you to all that help bring back my creative Spirit and peace of mind

SLO Bitter Co. Charred Cedar and Blackstrap Bitters
SLO Bitter Co. is a project of passion. For Cocktails, Craft, and Creativity.  Believing that a cocktail, like most things, is only as good as it's ingredients, we wanted to offer cocktail enthusiasts a product on a level with the current innovations in the Spirits world. Think local, drink local. Whenever possible, we source the ingredients for our bitters seasonally to ensure peak quality from local suppliers including: Central Coast Lavender Farm & Apothecary, The Secret Garden Herb Shoppe, and The Cal Poly Organic Farm.
Sourcing from RE:FIND Distillery of Paso Robles, SLO Bitter Co. produces small batch, hand crafted cocktail bitters with a base of neutral spirits made with the highest quality reclaimed grape juice form the Central Coast of California. This unique and innovative process shows itself in rich, complex flavors sure to bring that extra spark to all your favorite libations!
libations!
SLO Bitter Co. bitters are currently featured  the cocktail creations of local mixologists in the best bars and restaurants on the Central Coast. In order to move to the next level and place our bitters on shelves for retail sale, we need to obtain a Rectifier's License (sounds pretty badass, no?) and all sorts of other fun stuff from ABC. This process has been arduous and costly, but we are ALMOST there, and your help can bring this dream to fruition!
If you are interested in learning more about SLO Bitters, please give us a shout!

Hello, my name is Willie Williams and I am from Fort Lauderdale, Florida, and was raised in a Christian household with my mother and father. I have 15 siblings  9  of them sisters and I am the youngest.  I was raised by my sisters and watched their struggles and how strong they were which I admired. 
Through my sister's struggles is where the conception of Eden began. My goal is to have a place to create my art and showcase for the world to see. The funding will be used to acquire a warehouse, where I can not only work on my art but also showcase it in person and online. 
I have been interested in art since the age of six. As long as I can remember  I loved to draw, create, and playing music is my passion. This brand is special to me because of where I grew up and my religious background. Also, art saved me because I learn to focus on positive things and outside deterrents. My company Eden has directly connected me to the spirit within. 
Once Eden becomes established I want to reach out to local artists so they can display their work at my warehouse. In addition to reaching out to troubled youth and introduce them to art in hopes, it will give them something to inspire them to look towards the future.

Playhouse Website: www.elpasoplayhouse.com
Playhouse Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/elpaso.playhouse
                                    http://www.facebook.com/EPPlayhouse
We are El Paso's Longest Running Community Theatre going on 51 years.  The building that we are in has been ours since 1964.  The building itself is 14 years older than that and has seen only a handful of major makeovers. 
 This was the first major one. It has since seen a few minor ones such as a roof resealing a few back, emergency exits added in, and many superficial changes such as paint jobs.
All things tend to wear out over tie, especially things that see a lot of use.  Our lights are used constantly, day in and day out. We are still using stage lights from the 1960s. Little by little, they have been giving out so that as of now, our working lights are less than half the stage lights that we actually have.  We not only need new lights, but new wiring as well.  This is going to require a HUGE undertaking.  We need to bring in a professional electrician and basically gut everything out.  
As a non-profit organization, what we make in ticket sales goes towards the show royalties, our utilities,insurance,  costumes, sets, programs, and regular maintenance items such as cleaning supplies, office supplies, lightbulbs, etc.  Being able to set aside a little money at a time to replace the lights hasn't been possible because community theatre in El Paso has its times of growth and its times of struggle, but nothing consistent.
We would sincerely like to continue providing entertainment to the El Paso/Las Cruces (and beyond!) area for many more years to come, but without lights, it is hard to continue on.
We would also like to come into the 21st century and replace our old, dying lights with the newer, more energy-efficient LED lights.  Not only does this save the theatre money on electricity costs, but the lights are much cooler onstage so that our actors don't melt!
We have been working hard at renovating the lobby, concessions area, and outside.  As you can see, we've been doing quite well with our brick campaign to help beautify our outside area.  Not only do the bricks keep the area weed free and make it look nice and clean, our patrons will have a permanent spot in our theatre history!

Death Goddess Izanami  is a sculpture based on Izanami-no-Mikoto, the creation goddess and deity of the underworld as chronicled in Shinto mythology. 
The bold designs of Axis Mundi Games and the neoclassical virtuosity of CA Sculpts have merged to bring forth a boutique product designed for the most demanding collectors.
Death Goddess Izanami is a model that focuses on emotions as no model in the industry has done before. The sad majesty and woeful glory of a tormented goddess, the divine terror and eternal anguish of the departed, mere phantasms of their former conscience... all brought to life by a sculpture devised to match the style and the strength of neoclassical statues as never dared before.
As a surprise for the campaign launch, Progenitor God Izanagi has arrived! Izanami's husband and brother has manifested in all his mighty, progenitor of the new generation of gods and ordainer of the universe.
The aim of this kickstarter is to produce a limited collector's run called the Fukashi Sekai Run 不可視世界. All models forming part of the Fukashi Sekai Run will be numbered and signed.






The models are designed to be incredibly detailed and we are pushing our efforts to bring every detail to the highest point of clarity that is humanly possible!
Death Goddess Izanami has been 3D printed by one of the best artisans in the EU in high quality resin to ensure it can be cast smoothly and in great detail.
*Mana photo depicts a 1:10 example to show what can be done with the STL file. The resin model you can gain as reward for backing is in 54mm scale.

Death Goddess Izanami is part of the Sankokushin: Five Sacrifices project, the upcoming board game developed by Axis Mundi Games. Death Goddess Izanami campaign inaugurates the Sankokushin resin line, named Fukashi Sekai 不可視世界 (Invisible World), that we intend to develop for years to come with more and more models.
Sankokushin: Five Sacrifices is a solo-cooperative campaign game set in a fictional version of medieval Japan planned for Kickstarter in 2021.
 Can the Death Goddess - Izanami/Progenitor God Izanagi model be used in the actual game?
                                                 Yes. Specifically, they can be used as alternate sculpts for other models that will appear in a game's expansion. So, there is no locked gameplay content in Death Goddess - Izanami campaign.

Bonus - As we've more than 100 backers, all physical rewards will now include a 48 page notebook!
I've been uneasy for a while that it is easy to find a small number of fairytales, often from a limited number of classic collections, but quite hard to find English folk or fairy tales, particularly regional ones.
Over the last few years I've collected some together, running a Kickstarter just over a year ago that created a book of Yorkshire tales. This delivered ahead of schedule and is now available to buy
"Yorkshire" book
Since then, I've collected some more Yorkshire tales, managed to source a rare copy of Ammon Wrigley's book of Folklore / tales from Saddleworth (which I transcribed and shared), and did a mini-kickstarter recently for a language update of some Lincolnshire "Legends of the Carrs".
Saddleworth Book
This project is collecting together a group of Lancashire folk and fairy tales, similar to the Yorkshire collection I did previously. There are between 40 and 50 tales (I'm still working my way through some old newspapers as well as deciding exactly what to include), that will come out at a book roughly 200 pages long. My rough list so far is at the bottom of the page!
The target is set so it will cover most of the costs of production, campaign costs, printing, and distribution. If we make significantly more than the target, I could get a small contribution towards my time, but not at the target level! 
The main reward is the book of Lancashire tales (either PDF or paperback). The early bird rewards include a copy of "Saddleworth Superstitions and Folk Customs" as a bonus (transcribed and printed by me), and I've also included the option to get a copy of the Yorkshire folk tales book as well. The "Library Gift" reward level is two copies of the Lancashire book, which can either both sent to one address, or the second copy can be sent to a library of your choice (no additional P&P charged).
NEW: All the physical rewards now include a 48 page notebook, as an extra / bonus reward. They will have plain, high quality paper inside (I use a fountain pen and it writes beautifully on this paper) and either a dragon or giant on the front cover with a bit of folklore related text on the back, selected at random when I pack the rewards. The cover is a thick "velvet touch" laminated card.
notebooks
I've been deliberately pessimistic with the lead times, so I'm confident that we'll deliver early rather than late. I'm currently working on finishing off the book, so as soon as we hit the target we'll get started on the publication / printing process and be ready to go to print as soon as possible.

Welcome
A User Guide to Streaming, Downloads, and Personal Audio explains and explores three of the most important recent trends in high-end audio: streaming, high-resolution downloads, and personal audio — and additional related topics! The distribution and consumption of recorded music was forever transformed when it broke free of physical media in the 1990s. While many in the audiophile community still cherish their turntables, vinyl LPs, optical disc players, CD/DVD/BD discs, and even reel-to-reel tapes and decks, the digitization of music delivers greater fidelity, new modes of listening, portability, and the opportunity to listen to any song, anywhere, at any time, at the highest quality levels! Music's new normal is a major shift from traditional listening and requires a reexamination of equipment, content, and quality. This book breaks it all down for you with easy to understand, non-technical, explanations, example systems, and plenty of illustrations. 
My name is Mark Waldrep. I suspect some of you are already familiar with my work through my record company, the award-winning AIX Records, high-resolution music catalog, my over 1200 articles at RealHD-Audio.com, writing at Audiophile Review, or my previous book, which was successfully funded on Kickstarter in 2016. Music and Audio: A User Guide To Better Sound, is 880-pages long, comes with a demonstration Blu-ray disc (or file downloads), and has been recognized as the "gold standard" reference book on high-end audio. If you missed out on the first KS campaign, you can get both of my books as part of this campaign. The Absolute Sound's Andrew Quintet wrote, "Mark Waldrep Knows What He's Doing!" 
In the new book, I'll compare and contrast some of the most popular streaming music services — Tidal, Spotify, Qobuz, Deezer, Pandora, Amazon Music HD, Apple Music, and even the Neil Young Archive — and determine whether they deliver real high-resolution streaming or not! Many audiophiles prefer to "own" their music but purchasing and playing high-resolution music downloads is very different than picking a CD or vinyl LP off the shelf and playing it. What are the facts behind digital music downloads, are all files the same, and does recording provenance play a significant role in delivering fidelity? What role does "hi-res" audio play in the fidelity of streaming or downloaded music? 
High-resolution digital downloads began with iTrax.com back in the fall of 2007. Other services quickly followed. HDtracks, Onkyo Music, SuperHiRez.com, HiResAudio.com, and others make available a wide catalog of albums at 192 kHz/24-bit — and ever higher! Does it matter? Is it worth spending $24.95 on a high-resolution digital transfer of an analog album from 1971?
During a sabbatical I was granted in the fall of 2019, I designed and initiated the HD-Audio Challenge II. The goal of the survey was to determine whether audiophiles could reliably pick a native high-resolution audio recording over a Red Book or compact disc downconversion. Almost 500 people responded and my research was accepted by the Audio Engineering Society (AES) for presentation at their 2020 Fall Convention.
The availability of high quality files and streaming audio has brought networked audio to the audiophile world. The book will explore the necessary hardware and software components required to set up a NAS and make suggestions regarding the best players to use with your digital music collection. We'll discuss the advantages and disadvantages of Roon, Amarra, Audirvana, and other playback platforms.
Finally, we'll examine the world of personal music delivery from in ear monitors to high end headphones and immersive sound bars to surround automotive systems. The reproduction of high-fidelity audio is no longer the exclusive domain of well heeled audiophiles, limited to in home dedicated system setups, or bound to physical formats and large devices. Music has been set free! 
A User Guide to Streaming, Downloads, and Personal Audio will educate, clarify, and demonstrate how you can enhance your listening experience…simply and without spending a whole lot of money. The focus is on getting accurate information and achieving dramatic improvements in fidelity.
A User Guide to Streaming, Downloads, and Personal Audio brings these new and very important aspects of the audiophile hobby into focus. Like many of you, I've been embraced the transition from physical media to the the brave new digital age with all of its complexity and variations. The new book explores topics that I’ve learned and contributed to over the past decade. I'm not professional reviewer or journalist for major trade magazines or websites although I am asked to contribute to these outlets regularly. I write about what I know and what I want to know more about — and that you want to know about as well. 
Here's a proposed table of contents:
Chapter 1 – Introduction
Chapter 2 – The Future of Audio
Chapter 3 – Hi-Res Audio: A New Look
Chapter 4 – Audio Distribution: A Backgrounder
Chapter 5 – Producing for Downloads and Streams
Chapter 6 – Format Lexicon
Chapter 7 – HiFi: The New Normal
Chapter 8 – Downloading HD-Audio
Chapter 9 – Streaming: Low-Fi to HD
Chapter 10 – Personal Audio Basics
Chapter 11 – Audio Networking: Basic to Multi Room
Chapter 12 – Wired vs. Wireless: A Fidelity Reality Check
Chapter 13 – Components for Downloads and Streaming
Chapter 14 – Headphones: Stereo and Surround
Chapter 15 – Content Providers
Chapter 16 – Calibration and Optimization
Chapter 17 – System Recommendations
Chapter 18 – The Best of the Best
Chapter 19 – The Next Big Thing?
Chapter 20 – Post Roll
The writing style is conversational and avoids tech talk and techno jargon. Imagine the two of us sharing a few long afternoon sessions talking about the basic concepts of networked audio, audio distribution formats, and discussing simple, inexpensive ways to improve your system — and simplify its operation. 
Numerous illustrations will support the concepts and formats discussed in the text.
Illustrations
I have been a musician/composer, professional audio engineer, record producer, and university professor for over 40 years. My career spanned the analog era when 2" - 16 or 24 track multichannel decks were standard to the sophisticated digital systems used for production and reproduction today. The constant drive for higher fidelity and more efficient ways to distribute music have transformed the methods of producing AND releasing music to the public. There are innovative new technologies that can deliver immersive, HiFi sound to headphones and sound bars.
Mark Waldrep at Abbey Road Studios - the studio where the Beatles recorded!
Music and audio have dominated my life ever since I was a teenager. When Beatlemania swept across the country, I was one of thousands that took up the guitar, joined a band to seek fame and fortune as a rock star. But my future didn’t put me in front of a microphone. I found my place on the other side of the studio glass…I turned my love and knowledge of music and audio recording into a successful career as a recording engineer and music producer.
I studied architecture at the University of Michigan before dropping out and heading west to California. I followed my heart to see if music and audio could support me. Thankfully, with a lot of hard work and a fair amount of luck, they have.
More than 40 years later, I now own a state-of-the-art, multi-room recording and post production facility in Los Angeles, operate a high-end audiophile label AIX Records, a hi-res music download site iTrax, and have written a blog at RealHD-Audio since April 2013. I finished my academic education at UCLA in 1986 with a Ph.D. in Music Composition but also graduated with degrees in Computer Science and Art.
My production company AIX Media Group was responsible for the first DVD-Video titles released in the United States back in March of 1997 and the first DVD-Audio title three years later. In the subsequent few years, AIX grew to over 50 employees churning out DVDs for the likes of New Line Cinema, CBS, Morgan Creek, and a whole bunch of record companies. We did projects for The Rolling Stones, Britney Spears, The Backstreet Boys, Kiss, Tool, The Allman Brothers, and hundreds of others.
With the introduction of the DVD-Audio format in 2000, I started recording and releasing new high-resolution recordings. Twenty years later, the AIX Records catalog is one of the largest collections of native high-resolution music … albums that were actually recorded using high-res equipment. I’ve been encouraged by the awards, positive reviews, and continued sales of our catalog of DVD-Audio/Video discs, Blu-rays, and high-res music downloads. Andrew Quint, one of the senior editors of The Absolute Sound Magazine, commented in a feature article, “…the multi-channel audio, emanating from five B&W 801 loudspeakers, is quite simply the most realistic and involving instance of recorded sound I can recall, from any source format".
The new book is still in the writing phase so no reviews are currently available. However, the response to my first book, also crowdsourced on Kickstarter, was universally positive. Here is just some of the feedback I received:
"This is a staggeringly extensive but balanced and insightful work of outstanding merit. I would not say it will become a standard in its field but THE GOLD STANDARD."
Gary Reber - Publisher/Editor
"This is the first book that I've come across that lays out so much technical and practical audio knowledge in such an approachable manner. Positively outstanding!"
Carlo La Rosa - Senior Editor | Secrets of Home Theater and High Fidelity
"If you only purchase one reference book on high-end audio, Music and Audio: A User Guide To Better Sound is the clear winner!"
Jerry Del Colliano - Home Theater Review
"You've created what I now consider the 'Bible' of high-end audio."
Gene DellaSala - Audioholics
I started a daily blog in April of 2013 at RealHD-Audio.com. What began with less a few dozen readers has blossomed into one most read sites focusing on high-resolution audio and music. The site has technical information, interviews, equipment reviews, high-res music analyses, commentary, profiles on high profile equipment designers, guest editorials, and show reports. Today, the site reaches over 5000 readers everyday. Individuals from around the globe write to express their support and describe the site in glowing terms.
Get the new book, get both of my books on high-end audio, or a combination rewards including 5 AIX Records audiophile albums!
"Absolutely the best article I’ve read; what ever happened to the saying  'Pay Peanuts, Get Monkeys'. I’ve just turned 60 and my thoughts were that ALL of my knowledge over 30 years in providing mission critical communication systems in the industry would now count for something. Ha, providing I get it for free, it’s accepted. Your posts are a highlight on my mornings!! Thanks."

"Thanks a lot for all your work. I love and recommend your book whenever I can. Bundled with the results of the HD Audio Challenge your book is by far the best resource out there to face the realities of audio reproduction and keep the mysticism away that so many audiophiles seem to have bought into. Best regards, Jens"
"Let me take the opportunity to comment briefly: I love your book! Really seems like the 'audio bible'. It’s a big book so of course I didn’t finish it yet - I am a hobbyist audiophile so I’m in no hurry. As an electrical engineer (edu in high voltage power, but working with motion control automation last +25 years) it always surprised me to see people obsessed with old analog tech like tape and LPs when the CD is clearly so much better (not to mention high-res PCM). However I thought to myself “are those cable people on to something?”. Sooo nice to see you bring common sense and science into the equation. Really also love your explanations and experience from the professional recording environment. I was mildly shocked to learn how little quality you are allowed to produce for the high volume labels." Palle

According to a recent Kauffman study 99% of all US positive job creation in the last DECADE has been fueled by startups. In Silicon Valley, 52% of them were founded or co-founded by foreign entrepreneurs, according to TechCrunch.
In a time of soaring unemployment and tech competition with the rest of the World, foreign entrepreneurs thriving in innovation and employing US citizens are struggling to stay or enter in the US as a result of a tightening policies and arbitrary decisions. Some entrepreneurs have to move their company outside the US where the jobs and the money go.
We decided to investigate and speak out about the issue.

It is very challenging to market art, and to try to sell a piece of your heart and soul to the world. Artists often feel forced to be a jack of all trades, while sometimes sacrificing our more personal artistic inspirations. I've learned throughout the years that the business side of the art world is a vital aspect, and unfortunately the creative side is another entirely. I've also learned, that I am not good at doing both simultaneously, which has led me to this idea of going public with a plea for help.
I believe this is a breakout year for me as an artist. I've been an art teacher for almost 20 years, and the inspiration I get from my students is astounding. I hope to inspire and make my students proud.
I've earned the opportunity to show at Spectrum Miami during Miami's art week. It's the push I needed to have the courage to put myself and my art work out there for the world to see... To broaden my horizons and do what I was put on this earth to do. 
I hope that by connecting with art collectors, gallery directors and art institutions and by finally being able to share my labor of love with the world, my art will have a greater purpose. If this endeavor is successful, it will provide the catapult for me to be able to support philanthropic art entities, such as "Artists for a Cause" and "Women Supporting the Arts" in the future. 
Although the opportunity is outstanding, as a teacher, funding it on my own is nearly impossible. Please join me and Team MGMoriginals in helping me reach my goals!

We Built A Better Mouse Trap... Introducing The HumBug
After three years in the making we are proud to introduce the HumBug UltraSonic pest repeller device. Designed for greater coverage distance due to our high output xt-33 transducer. Designed to repel most household pests.
Just plug your HumBug into a wall outlet anywhere you have an insect problem in your house and watch the HumBug go to work!






Safe For Humans & Household Pets!
The Humbug operates at 32khz-55khz creating auditory stress in most pests driving them away. Humans don't hear above 20khz with the exception being children hearing as high as 30khz making the HumBug silent and harmless. Cats & dogs hear frequencies between 22khz-25khz making it safe for your household pets.
Here is a partial list of the pests that hear the frequencies of the HumBug:
Mosquitoes
Fleas
House Fly
Spiders
Cockroaches
Ants
Grasshoppers
Mice
Rats
Bats






Built To Work In Your Country
Talking with team of engineers we insisted that the Humbug was capable of working in almost every country.  All you have to do is back our project and based on the country we are shipping to we will make sure you have the correct plug type to work in your country. See Image below for available socket types. So where does the HumBug work? 
United States
Canada
Mexico
Japan
Europe
South America
Asia
Russia
United Kingdom
Ireland
Australia
New Zealand
China
Argentina & more



Easy To Install & Economical To Operate
Just plug it into any existing wall socket and watch it go to work. You can expect to see results in as little as 7 days. The cost to operate each unit is approximately 20 cents USD per month when using it 24 hours a day. The total electrical draw on each unit is less than 2 watts.

What People Actually Say About The Ultrasonic Pest Repeller
We relied heavily on feedback from actual users and made changes based on what they had to say. We are pleased to have reached a perfect 5 star rating from the actual users based on our final design.

 The HumBug Pest Repeller Is Built To Last
At the heart of the HumBug is our XT-33 extended range transducer which is designed to push our ultrasonic signal farther than the competition. Built of quality materials and components we are convinced that it's the best electronic pest repeller on the market. So convinced that we offer a 5 year no questions asked return policy. A Superior Product From A Simple Sketch
Three years ago we set out to design a great looking and superior performing pest repeller... and to think that the initial design was created on a restaurant napkin!
The initial design was changed and modified over the three years until we finalized the look and then set out to make the ultrasonic pest repeller... the HumBug was born!

A few years ago I visited an Art Gallery here in The Netherlands that to my great surprise had about 30 paintings of my late grandfather Louis Jacob Hartz on exhibition and for sale. 
Knowing that about 200 paintings were stolen by the Germans during the Second World War, I was truly very excited by this find. 
I want to use the money raised by this project to start buying the paintings, have them cleaned and restored. Also I would like to start a foundation in his name and start organizing small exhibitions. 
Please feel free to Google the name of Louis Jacob Hartz and find information about his work, life and his famous teacher Isaäc Meijer de Haan.

OUTLINE:
When a transgender couple finds an abandoned baby their first instinct is to take the baby to the police station. Ridiculed and humiliated, they are turned away. The couple decides to raise the child as their own. For society to accept this family, one of the couple decides to live as a man.
This movie, based on true events, follows their lives and exposes the hypocrisies of society as well as the struggles and humiliations the family, and the child in particular, faces.
WHY THIS STORY?
Transgender people have been part of Indian culture for several centuries. However, they have been seen as an object of ridicule over the last several years now. Transgender people are ostracised from society, but they are expected to be productive. They are not provided an education, but expected to find jobs. When it comes to movies, they are always used in comedy, but never as the protagonist.
PLAY

WHY KICKSTARTER?
The Director and the star of the film have tried several times to raise money to get this story made into a movie. Universally, on hearing the story, the producers are moved to tears but, they fear, commercially, due to prejudice of the viewing public, that this film will not be a box office success. This story needs to be told. The lives of transgender people, despite all that society imposes on them, can be rich, fulfilling and interesting. The only way to get mainstream attention to the lives of, and the difficulties faced by, transgender people is through film. 
WHAT WE HAVE LEARNED
When researching the story, we have spent a lot of time speaking and interacting with, and learning about, transgender people in Tamil Nadu. India. Here are the Top 4 professions for Transgenders in India.
PLAY

# 4 Dancing - a relatively new way to a livelihood
PLAY

 # 3 - Collections aka Begging
PLAY

 # 2 - Blessing. by #Trans people are considered auspicious

From the bestselling author of Storms of Malhadocomes a new historical novel delving into a captivating element of Galveston’s past: the world of prostitution.

Nobody comes to a brothel seeking a true story. But you will want to learn the truth about Aimée Bonnard, the best-paid woman in Galveston. Formerly known as Yvonne LaCroix, Aimée arrives on the Island in the summer of 1898. She’s looking for work in a high-end brothel, but she is also outrunning the consequences of a deadly night in New Orleans – a night in which a rival prostitute lost her life. Mistress of deception, Aimée charms and entices her way into an existence of extravagance and adventure in one of the most exclusive brothels of Galveston. But does the life of a high-end prostitute offer as much freedom as Aimée craves? 

Befriending artists, architects, merchants, and gamblers, as well as a modest but kind-hearted doctor, Aimée falls in love with Galveston Island and discovers aspects of her own personality that surprise her. As a talented courtesan, her glory days are only just beginning. But a different Aimée surfaces, one that wants things that could stand in the way of her professional success, including allowing herself to fall in love. Meanwhile the past is closing in on her and Aimée will have to choose between the protection of a despotic madam and the uncertainty of taking matters into her own hands.

This book idea was prompted by requests from readers: readers who love Galveston Island, readers who loved Storms of Malhado, readers who specifically asked me to write the story of a Galveston prostitute. I sat down with this project during the lockdown in April 2020, and the story practically wrote itself. The Glory Days of Aimée Bonnard wanted to come to life more than any other of my six previous novels. The story told itself, it cose its own path (Aimée surprised me by resisting some of the plans I'd made for her, and she will surprise you too!) and by pushing me to write and edit at a pace I've never before experienced, it put me into an unprecedented predicament: After publishing Storms of Malhado to rave reviews in March 2020, this strange year will be the year in which I publish two books!
Putting forth a quality product as an independently published author involves tons of work and also a serious financial committment. Having a book professionally edited is not cheap - and not something an author should scrimp on! Formatting and creating a professional cover come at their own cost. The biggest hurdle, however, in today's oversaturated book market is advertising. Even an exceptional book will get lost in a dark corner of the internet if an author doesn't have a successful advertising strategy and is not willing to commit the resources to bring the book to the attention of readers, reviewers, journalists, and bloggers who will spread the word! Yes, word of mouth ultimately prevails when readers love a book, but creating the initial buzz requires time, effort, and money. 
During the pandemic, aside from writing this story, I have spent countless hours learning how to properly market a book. Storms of Malhado is beloved by readers and has garnered more attention than any of my previous novels because I've put in more time and money than ever before in order to market it. I need your help to take this to the next level with The Glory Days of Aimée Bonnard. I've learned how to use Amazon keyword ads (but they're not cheap!). I've learned how to use Canva to create compelling visuals (again, not cheap but so worth it!). I've connected with book bloggers and influencers that appeal to my key audience and sent them copies of the book. I've learned that giving away 2,000 ebooks makes a big difference but that one can't do so without paying for advertising (and I've learned which advertisers do wonders with getting free books in front of well-suited readers). I've learned that reviews are fundamental, but that people are unwilling to write them, and that there are quality services (not free) that help find volunteer reviewers willing to review in exchange for a free book. I've learned so much more and am still learning. But for me to make The Gory Days of Aimée Bonnard a success I need your help!
You are both the fuel behind this project as well as part of the buzz I need to create around it. Seven is a lucky number and with the experience of my previous six books behind me I know that this time around I can apply everything I've learned and give this new book the release it deserves. 

I plan to publish the book on December 21st 2020. It will be available both as an ebook and as a paperback. 

Here is a breakdown of my budget to make this happen:
Professional editing: $1,176
Professional Formatting: $250
Professional Help with Cover Design: $150
Paperback copies given to book bloggers, influencers, journalists: $270 (these average to about $9 each including shipping)
Paperbacks sent to key readers: $90
An introduction chapter written by a beloved historian who wrote a best-selling book on prostitution in Galveston: $500 ($1 a word for 500 words)
Amazon ads for the first month: $100
Review Service (matches book with volunteer reviewers, one does not pay for reviews): $50
Goodreads Giveaway ($119) + 3 books: $146
Advertising for free ebook campaign: $300
Total Cost: $3032

The manuscript has already undergone the professional editing process. I am currently putting the final touches on it. Next step: professional formatting. This book is almost ready to go! 
In addition to helping make my dream come true and making my readers happy, the success of this book can help several small businesses on Galveston Island - businesses I like to partner with in selling paperback copies, businesses who benefit from yet another element that adds to the mystique of Galveston and its appeal to those who love to explore its history. 


The cover readers currently prefer. I will go with this elegant streamlined look for the paperback.
