Monster Fight Club Bring Their Metropolis Terrain to Kickstarter
For this campaign, we’re going to be doing the bulk of the manufacturing ourselves, in the US, which will reduce shipping times and avoid delays. 
All orders will be shipped directly from our offices in the USA. This allows us to offer affordable, $20 flat-rate shipping with the contiguous 48 states. That's roughly the cost to ship one Building Bundle. If you're getting more than one bundle, you're saving money on shipping.  All other orders will be charged actual shipping costs to their location, including all non-US addresses, Alaska, Hawaii, and other overseas US addresses.
Keep in mind, these buildings are made from dense, durable hardboard and a box full of them is heavy.  International shipping is going to be relatively expensive. 
These are shipped from the US and you'll be responsible for any import taxes or duties. If you have questions about international shipping costs, please email us: info@monsterfightclub.com.
Due to the size of the rewards and the risk of bounce back, we cannot ship to PO Boxes either domestically or internationally.
Note On 3D Files 
We’ve gotten lots of requests for STLs since launching our original scenery Kickstarter.  We weren’t originally intending to release our 3D files, but the recent global pandemic has changed our minds.  These days, international shipping is slowed, gamers are spending more time at home, and more people are exploring 3D printing. If releasing the 3D files allows more people around the world to enjoy the scenery we’ve proudly made, that’s a win in our books!  
All our 3D pieces are designed for 3D printing.  If your pledge includes digital files, you should receive the files within 30 days of the end of the Kickstarter. You’ll be getting the same files we’ve used.  All the STL files will be water-tight and tested on our in-house Form3 printer.  Supports vary from machine to machine; files will be provided without supports. Some larger pieces may not fit onto smaller print beds.  These files were designed with resin printing in mind, but should work on FDM printers (but we haven’t test-printed every piece on a FDM machine).
Monster Fight Club is a close-knit team of hobby industry veterans whose purpose is to evolve tabletop gaming through fun and unique board game experiences; innovative accessories, terrain and models for tabletop role-playing games and wargaming; and creating distinctive pop culture collectibles.
The team behind Monster Fight Club includes many former staff members of Gale Force Nine, including its founder, John Kovaleski. Other staffers and designers have worked for companies such as Games Workshop, EA, and Digital Domain. We have been innovating tabletop terrain for well over a decade; we know how to make and mass-produce awesome looking terrain that will bring your games table to life!
REFUND POLICY  We can refund you within 14 days of the campaign’s end, fees included. After that, we have a policy of no questions asked, though that’s minus Kickstarter and payment processing fees (which we can’t get back from them after 14 days). However, if we’ve begun packaging your pledge for shipment (usually 4 to 6 weeks before the actual shipping date), no refunds are possible. If a component cannot be delivered AT ALL, we refund that completely, including fees.  
All refunds after the 14 days close of the campaign may be processed via PayPal or reversed via Stripe to your credit card at our discretion. Refunds within 14 days are reversed via Stripe to your credit card.  
This project is being funded in USD and any refunds processed will be in USD for the exact amount received in USD, excluding any applicable fees depending on the time of the refund being processed.  
TERMS AND CONDITIONS  By pledging to this project, you acknowledge that the final look, materials, and content of the rewards (and the project) are subject to change and may differ substantially from what is presented while the Kickstarter project was active. 
 If you do not log in and confirm your pledge within 8 weeks of our notification via e-mail to confirm your pledge, you agree that we have fulfilled our obligations to you in full for payment or donations received. However, we may, at our discretion, refund or ship your pledge if you contact us and confirm your pledge after the 8-week window has elapsed. Unconfirmed pledges make it difficult for us to plan production and logistics, and may lead to project delays which could impact your fellow backers. For this project we do not intend to allow this to happen, which may mean if you confirm your pledge too late, exclusive items may not be produced in sufficient quantity for your pledge.

UPDATE: We've reached the funding goal!  The project will go forward with lots of galaxies!  Thank you from the participants of Burning Man!! 
REDUCE GREENHOUSE GASSES BY 75%?
What are they? They’re Solar FREAKING Galaxies!! What do they want from you? They’re Solar FREAKING Galaxies! What are they for? Ok, dig this: they’re technology that can be placed along side every roadway in America to generate FREE unlimited power for the whole nation! And they don’t have just dumb, boring solar panels. They have incredibly dumb, boring solar panels! But, they do have electronic circuits inside each one that makes millisecond decisions and each one can store FREE energy from the sun! The LED galaxies turn on at just the right time every night, and turn off again in the morning.
Please don't drive or park on these
See? They’re just like Solar FREAKING Roadways… they have solar panels, they have LED lights, they have electronics, but you don’t drive, walk, or park on them. They stand many feet over your head to capture all of the sun’s energy!
Mesmerized enemy combatants
MILITARY APPLICATIONS
Imagine hundreds of Solar FREAKING Galaxies parachuting down over enemy lines. Boring drills come out of the bottom and drive into the ground (or solid rock) while the parachute is quietly sucked back inside. The top opens up and lights up its LED galaxy lights up. The enemy is mesmerized and confused... must have a closer look. Are those real galaxies? Wham! A net flys out and captures them!  A sensor inside detects enemy capture and a built in rocket ignites taking the enemy combatants off to POW camps and gently drops them down where our troops can lock them up where they belong!
PIPE DREAMS
Reduce greenhouse gasses?  Power the nation?  Military applications?  Pipe dreams you say? Well, yes and no. I do need to buy some more pipes. 10 foot ones to be exact.  And all the rest?  One step at a time.  I brought this incredible technology to Burning Man 2013 as an Honorarium installation under the covert name “Star Stuff.” They were enjoyed by very many people. I heard a lot of "awesome" and "trippy" and "where are the bathrooms?"
Meet you at the galaxies!
SOLAR AND HUMAN POWER
Some of these galaxy poles also had solar and human powered devices.  One was a snowball with a solar powered video from the view of a train engineer driving through snow.  Just something to bring the hot desert heat down a degree. Another was a human powered jukebox, with a dynamo crank to generate the electricity to power the electronics, and several 3D viewers with cranks to power the back lights.
Solar and Human Powered Devices
REDUCE, REUSE, RECYCLE
After brought my installation home I heeded the mantra, “reduce, reuse, recycle” and took all of my Galaxies apart. I recycled all of the big heavy ¾” ground stakes, the inner metal structural EMT pipes, and the outer PVC pipes, selling them at pennies on the dollar. I also recycled the brand new rotary hammer I used to drive the stakes into the ground and the tool to pull them back out. I still had the solar panels, lights, and frames left to recycle.
Lonely galaxy frames waiting to be recycled
SOLAR FREAKING ROADWAYS!
Then I heard about Solar FREAKING Roadways and their the plan to replace every road, freeway, and parking lot surface in America with solar powered, LED enabled glass paving panels.  What an inspiration!  Was that just art I created for Burning Man 2013? Or was it the beginning of something more?
BRINGING THEM BACK
I want to bring my Solar FREAKING Galaxies back to Burning Man for 2014 and I need your help!  This is one step toward... toward... something.  Last year, Burning Man. This year, well... Burning Man again. But next year? The whole United States of America? The World? Who can say?  I'm not thinking of paving all roads and freeways with glass I do think displaying working solar systems to 70,000 people might inspire some to think of possibilities for reducing greenhouse gasses.
REBUILDING
I still have the tops frames, the solar panels, and LED lights. I just have to turn them back into galaxies again! That's the creative and fun part. I recycled the inner metal pipes, heavy ground stakes and stake puller to Lockewood Acres Organic Farms. But they have graciously decided to loan the ones they haven't used back to me for the 2014 event! Thanks, Ben!
I still need to buy new outer pipes and a tool to drive the stakes into the ground.  And, last year a tire blew out on my way to Black Rock City, so I need a new 2 new tires.  I’m also building a little seating area in the center of the galaxy forest.  I need pipes, paint, gas to transport the project there, hardware, and other miscellaneous stuff so I can get Solar FREAKING Galaxies back to Burning Man 2014… and maybe, beyond.
Next stop... ???
If I make my goal I will at least be able to get 25 galaxy poles built and transported.   Me and my helpers are gifting many hours building, transporting, setting up and taking down.  If I can stretch it to twice that much I should be able to get close to the 50 I had last year.
Risks and Challenges

We want to make your day easier, your workout better, your ideas brighter. We want to deliver the very best protein drink on the market, one that is miles ahead of anyone else in terms of quality ingredients and truly healthful nutrition. 
Introducing Smooth Oats & Protein, the cleanest and most natural protein drink ever.
YOUR PROTEIN DRINK NEEDS A DETOX 
Protein drinks on the market today are loaded with preservatives, additives, and synthetic flavors. And they often contain high levels of heavy metals, such as cadmium, lead, and arsenic. 
Organic drinks that are supposed to be healthy for you may be just the opposite. Most of organic soy and rice protein is imported from China, where up to one fifth of fields are estimated to be contaminated with heavy metals. 
WHY ALL THOSE CHEMICALS?
We've been programmed to look at calories first. Manufacturers know this, and they replace natural ingredients with artificial. Artificial ingredients are also much cheaper, and can make the product look more appealing both in color and texture, and extend its shelf live.
Chemicals may be a great solution for the food industry, but not for us.
SMOOTH OATS & PROTEIN, THE CLEANEST AND MOST NATURAL PROTEIN DRINK
With the help of doctors, nutritionists and consumers, we’ve created Smooth Oats & Protein, the cleanest and most natural vegan protein drink available. Smooth Oats & Protein offers the best of leading-edge nutrition science combined with an uncompromising commitment to quality the natural way. And a passion for real food that tastes great. 
Smooth Oats & Protein is made from all natural ingredients, with nothing artificial added. 
It's lactose-free and soy-free, has no preservatives or GMOs.
WE HARNESSED THE HUNGER-CURBING POWER OF OATS
Smooth Oats & Protein is based on 20 years of research on how to capture the hunger-curbing power of oats. 
Have you noticed that after eating a bowl of oatmeal you don’t feel hungry for hours? That’s the soluble fiber in oats, called beta glucan, in action.
The soluble fiber in oats is one of nature’s miracles. It helps lower cholesterol, balance blood sugar levels, and keep hunger on hold making you feel full and satisfied.
Because oats help balance blood sugar levels, you're able to stick to healthy eating throughout the day and stave off those sweet cravings. 
A SIMPLE BLEND OF A FEW NATURAL INGREDIENTS YOU CAN PRONOUNCE
Real food is supposed to taste good. And real food is made from real ingredients. 
Smooth Oats & Protein is made from whole grain oats and pea protein, lightly sweetened with agave nectar, for a low glycemic index overall. That means you avoid the unhealthy spike-and-crash cycles that lead to hunger pangs, binging, and sluggishness.
We are very particular about where our ingredients come from. Our oats are grown by family farmers in Scandinavia, where there’s less pollution and a greater commitment to traditional farming methods. Recent study by EFSA analyzing more than 77 000 food samples concluded that 70.8% of foods produced in Finland are free from pesticide residuals.
The organic pea protein comes from France and is the cleanest available.
Smooth Oats & Protein contains no GMOs, no preservatives or additives. Just the pure goodness of whole grain oats and pea protein.
THE GENTLE, DELICIOUSLY SATISFYING PROTEIN DRINK BEFORE AND AFTER WORKOUT 
Let’s get real about protein. We’re not Olympic athletes. What we need is a balanced, clean, and delicious protein drink that will sustain us through a busy day and workout.
Too much protein will store in our bodies as fat, and can even harm our kidneys. That’s why our drink is balanced with just the right amount of protein.
THE SMOOTH TEAM
We are athletes and foodies, busy moms and dads, chocolate lovers, dedicated workers, and creative obsessives. We have a background in, you guessed it, natural foods, and creating brands and advertising for global companies. We are passionate about natural foods and beverages, as well as active in the GMO-Free movement, supporting natural methods of farming that produce cleaner, more flavorful foods.
OAT DRINK, INTERRUPTED
In 2011 we launched Simpli, the first vegan oat-smoothie on the US market. In just 18 months, Simpli OatShake won three major industry awards and got into 2000 stores, including Whole Foods, Wegmans, Mollie Stones, and the likes.  
Our European manufacturer had other plans. They stopped supplying and sold the factory, with devastating consequences to our business in the United States.
However, consumers were still asking for the product two years later, so we know there's demand for delicious nondairy oat drinks. 
For the past two years we've been working on an improved recipe and process, and found a committed co-packer in the United States.
RAISING FUNDS FOR THE FIRST PRODUCTION RUN 
We have the recipe, and we've sourced the ingredients. We know how to make, package, market, and distribute this fantastic and much-needed new product. Now we just have to get the engine revved up, and we are asking for your help.
We are raising money to pay for the first production run. You can help us make this healthy and delicious drink available to distributors (and you!) by November 2015. 
Every dollar counts and brings us closer to achieving our goal. Your support is essential for this drink to reach the marketplace. Your support also signals to the US food industry that its time for healthier, more natural choices.
COMPARE THE INGREDIENT LISTS
YOU HAVE MANY WAYS TO SUPPORT 
Order Smooth Oats & Protein, 4-packs of chocolate or vanilla.
Buy a cool Generation OatShake T-shirt, a true collectors item.
Influence the future of food industry by joining our Consumer Advisory Board.
Your name can also become part of our new book and documentary “Smooth: A Journey in Natural Foods” chronicling the joys, triumphs, trials, and tribulations of building a healthier beverage company.
Become a Smooth Casting Director and take part in the casting our Smooth Brand Ambassadors in Los Angeles.
Buy a Hollywood-style Portrait Session with Mika! A once-in-a-lifetime experience, or an unforgettable gift to someone special.
Join us at Winter Fancy Food Show in San Francisco to launch Smooth!

Mmmm!
We made it! Megan and I are so thankful for all of your generous contributions. We've been hard at work building the show and we can't wait to share it with you.
Although we've reached our goal please still consider making a contribution. We are hoping to raise some additional funds to do things like: hire a lighting designer, hire additional performers, pay our stage manager more than a pittance, buy materials for scenic elements, and countless other things that have come up in our rehearsal process.
We hope to see you at the show in September. Tickets are now available here.
Thank you!
M&M
A Dance Theater Duet.
Megan and Mason met in 2011 and started working together for the first time in 2012. They knew it was a match made in heaven when, at their first rehearsal, they spent 3 hours pretending they were Gremlins giving a mansion tour. This is Mason's first evening-length work in Philadelphia, and his first time self-producing. This is Megan's first time co-creating a piece. Megan thinks it's dance. Mason thinks it's theater. They both can't wait to share it with you. 
About MMMM.
Transforming into a variety of scientists, gurus, animals, plants, and minerals, Megan and Mason go out of their minds and into the unknown to investigate human consciousness. Mining the Mine of the Mind for Minderals is what happens when dance, theater, neuroscience, and spirituality collide in a TED talk gone wild format. Can you dig it?
MMMM draws from the work of scientists, philosophers, and spiritual teachers like:
Marco Iacoboni, Jill Bolte Taylor, Antonio DaMasio, V.S. Ramachandran, Daniel Dennet, Alva Noë, Eckhart Tolle, Chögyam Trungpa, Pema Chödrön, and many more.
It has been influenced by Megan and Mason's shared practice of improvisational dance, their unusual sense of humor, and obsession with shifting physical and mental states.
The performance will feature visual design by Ryan W. Kelly and sound design by Michael Kiley.
What we need.
We are asking for your help to raise $3500. The money would cover all of the costs of the production including the Philadelphia Fringe Festival fee, renting the Jolie Laide Gallery for rehearsals and performance, posters and cards, insurance, paying our stage manager, and collaborating artists.
Learn more.
Performances will take place as part of the 2012 Philadelphia Fringe Festival at the Jolie Laide Gallery (224 North Juniper Street, Philadelphia, PA 19107).
Show Dates and Times:
Wednesday, September 19 at 8pm
Thursday, September 20 at 8pm
Friday, September 21 at 7pm and 10pm
Saturday, September 22 at 7pm and 10pm
For tickets and more information go to: http://livearts-fringe.org/

HELP US STRETCH! If Pens Plus Pals can reach a total fo 150 backers, custom pencils will be added to the first stationery set for ALL levels of P+P supporters!
As any good tween of the mid-90’s, I remember reading my Teen Beat magazine and eagerly cutting out the mail-in advert for a pen pal. The anticipation of waiting to receive the identity of my pen pal was almost as excruciating as waiting to find out if Nickelodeon was going to take over my school (they never did). I'd spend hours crafting the perfect letters to my new friends from exotic places like Akron and Lubbock!
Who wouldn't want to be my friend?
Introducing: Pens Plus Pals
At its most basic level, Pens Plus Pals aims to provide that same thrill to its Pen-Members by matching pen pals across the world. P+P will tailor a match to suit your correspondence goals, whether you want conversation topics to focus on current events, new perspectives, mentorship, kid-friendly content, spirituality, romance, or let us play P+P "roulette" and see what pen pal fate awaits you!
Inclusions, please:
For our Yearly Pen Members, there are also great Pen Perks to receive along the way, including killer stationery sets and pencil case, P+P apparel, and more!
  Upon signing up for P+P, these packs will be (surprise) mailed to our Pen Members along with the reveal of the "Pen Name" of the pen pal with whom you've been matched and their address. From there, well, start writing - your exciting P+P experience begins! 
Themed stationery sent every quarter!
We will also provide you with quarterly gift packs filled with "surprise and delight" to keep your creative juices flowing.
Special delivery!
Is this for me?
If you're craving an excuse to unplug from our overexposed world of mass posts on Snap-Gram-Insta-Face-Tube, P+P is for you. Don't get me wrong, there’s a ton of value in these platforms but they shouldn’t be a replacement for or at the expense of writing traditions. End your reliance on the backspace button, spend 10 minutes on airplane mode, and let's challenge ourselves to compose thoughts and ideas on paper with the goal of creating authentic connection with fellow human.
The future of P+P
Not only will you take advantage of the great cathartic and health benefits of writing and cultivating a one-on-one relationship with your pen pal, but you'll join a lively community that is challenging modern and conventional wisdom about the place for letter-writing in the world. P+P should endeavor to become the #1 global movement and catalyst for letter exchange. 
With enough groundswell behind Pens Plus Pals, I'd also love to offer a Pen-It-Forward Program that allows Members to sponsor a Pen Pal in homeless shelters / nursing homes and also a P+P School Program for school exchanges, and many other fun products and inclusions in the near future!
What about Ts & Cs?
For anyone concerned about those Terms & Conditions, we got your back. The registration system will include a user verification process, the requirement to select a "Pen Name" to protect identities.
If, after those security measures, you'd still like an added layer of anonymity, the Yearly Penultimate Plan offers full anonymity. P+P will protect your identity and location by serving as the shipping go–between for you and your pen pal!
Before you leave...
Are you feeling left behind or increasingly disenchanted in the digitally-dominated world? Are you a parent looking for a fun and educational weekly activity to share with the kids? Do you need a gift for "the person who has everything"? Bottom line: you belong with Pens Plus Pals if you place an inherent value in writing and honor our three key values: legacy, authenticity, and community.
Pens Plus Pals: Look Good on Paper.

Ever dreamed of having underwear for everywhere? Underwear that’s perfect for exploring the world or exploring the great indoors?
Undies that lounge, gym, & swim.
Because what’s the difference?
Why do we need to buy three bra tops for a single day of activities?
Why is it ok to post a picture of yourself in your bikini but not your underwear?
We think underwear should empower you, not limit you…
So we created SOMI: 
The breathable underwear that moves with you...
Because we’re always moving! 
We’re jumping in the pool, or hitting the trail, or getting in a quick yoga session.
And we shouldn’t have to constantly change our undies to fit the occasion.
Or worse, have to skip out on activities because we don’t have a swimsuit, or a sports bra, or a change of underwear.
SOMI Men's Boxer
 SOMI is the three-in-one solution that’s made from a sustainable version of Silk Jersey fabric. It’s breathable, antibacterial, moisture-wicking, quick-drying, supportive, comfortable, and always ready for your next activity. And that’s the way underwear should be!
So you can lounge in comfort at home
  So you’re ready for anything.
  So your bedroom drawers aren’t so crammed.
  So you can jump in the pool without the hassle of changing.
  So you can cool off in that hidden waterhole on your hike.
  So you can be free to focus on what matters.
  So, seriously...what is the difference?
What sets a swimsuit apart from a set of undies?
And what makes SOMI a category apart?
Well, swimsuits are generally made of cheap materials. They aren’t concerned with comfort, they aren’t meant to be worn close to the skin for extended periods of time, and they tend to feature:
Awkward ties, twists, and bumps.
  Loud colors and prints that show through clothing.
  Round strings rather than flat elastic straps.
  Absurdly high price tags (especially for something you only wear a few times a year).
What about traditional underwear? It’s made from delicate, fragile lace that you have to wash carefully, and it’s much easier to tear. Or it’s a five-pack of cotton undies—generic, water-absorbent, and destined to show wear within a few washes.
In the eco-conscious category, you can forget style and sexiness. It’s utilitarian, rugged, and often oddly shapeless.
SOMI bridges this gap with stylish, comfortable, versatile classics made from an eco-friendly fabric that washes like a dream.
 We’ve always loved the idea of minimalism, but we wanted to offer our SOMI wearers the best of everything: The best workout underwear, the best swimwear, the best “I-just-want-to-be-comfortable-and-lounge-around-in-my-undies” wear. But how could we do that while still maintaining an eco-positive, minimalistic approach?
The answer was simple: Create one functional (yet fashionable) set of undies that does it all.
And make it durable enough to last for years to reduce your carbon footprint.
Wear SOMI for your next:
Adventure
SOMI packs small, so throwing a spare pair in your day pack is easy.
  You’ll ALWAY have your swimsuit on you, so if you need to cool off in that hidden waterhole it’s A-okay.
  You won’t need to find a changing area on the trail (save time and stay safe!)
  Stay clean and fresh for longer, even after a long day of kayaking or cycling!
  Workout
Unlike cotton underwear, which traps and logs sweat, SOMI underwear is moisture-wicking and quick drying.
  SOMI’s antibacterial properties are sweat activated to keep you fresh, even after a hard sweat.
  The Betty and The Deep Dive from our tops collection double as sports bras for low impact exercises like yoga, barre, and pilates.
  You can easily transition from lounging on your couch to your home workout.
  Swim
SOMI is UV and chlorine resistant.
  SOMI styles are designed with classic simple cuts that work for the beach, pool, and beyond.
  Save time and jump right in the pool!
  Lounge
Above all, SOMI is comfortable!
  No more wires, no more wedgies, no more sticky, sweaty material.
  Wear underneath your everyday clothing without worrying about panty lines.
  Did you know that fashion is a major contributor to pollution? In fact, 140 million pounds of clothes end up in landfills each year, and 20% of industrial water pollution is estimated to come from garment manufacturing.
We care about the world we live in, so designing SOMI to be eco-friendly and ethically made wasn’t a decision we had to think twice about.
What took a lot longer was coming up with an eco-conscious fabric that offered the water-resistance we needed, combined with the comfort we couldn’t live without.
We partnered with a supplier of some of the best athletic and swimwear brands in the world, and we worked with them to develop a new antibacterial fabric that would hold up even better in the gym and on the road—anywhere you’re likely to sweat.
The result was SustainLuxe: A material comparable to a sustainable version of Silk Jersey in its softness, flexibility, strength, and sheen—yet sustainably made and eco-friendly. And it's even constructed for maximum breathability so you stay comfortable no matter the activity. SustainLuxe is:
Best of all, SustainLuxe:
But we didn’t stop there, because we wanted SOMI to be ethically made as well as eco-friendly. To this end, we’ve taken careful measures to vet all our suppliers to ensure their workers are treated fairly.
SOMI wearers are practical, adventurous, and always ready to sweat—so we knew we had to make SOMI as resilient as they are.
It had to be durable, long-lasting, and ready to stand up to the wear and tear of a life well-lived.
It had to be easy to care for.
And above all, it had to be ready to go at a moment’s notice.
That’s why SOMI is:
Easy to hand wash (just wash in the sink with soap or shampoo, then roll into a towel and squeeze tightly).
  Resilient enough to throw directly into the laundry and dryer.
  Quick-drying, and tough enough to withstand heavy usage.
  All of our Kickstarter designs feature silky, breathable Sustainluxe fabric and are engineered to be supportive for low impact workouts like yoga and pilates. Our four-way stretch movement will keep you feeling comfortable day and night, and you’ll feel fresh for longer with antibacterial properties designed to last for up to 50 washes.
Our bra band and waistband elastic is sourced from a luxury supplier. Since we’re selling directly to you, we can afford to add this expensive detail: It’s thin enough to not add bulk, but thick enough to give you the support you need.
Our favorite part of this elastic is the hand feel. It feels as soft and silky as buttered kittens, and it doesn’t have that super shiny “I’m lingerie!” finish; instead, it’s a subtle sheen that lasts through grueling wash after wash.
To effectively manage resources, we are offering 3 designs at the start of our campaign: The Betty, The Maverick, and The Workout Buddy—all in black. As we hit our stretch goals for funding, more styles and colors will be available. You will pick which styles you want in a post-campaign survey.

We tested SOMI on 243 women, sampled over 100 fabrics, and examined 50 bra band elastics before bringing our venture to Kickstarter. Why? Because we wanted SOMI to be perfect in every way—and we knew the only way to achieve that was by paying attention to the little details, then getting real feedback from the people who matter.
Here’s what they had to say about their SOMI experiences:
With SOMI, we’re creating a new category…
It isn’t swimwear. It isn’t underwear. It isn’t yoga-wear…
It’s all three.
Here’s how SOMI compares to the status quo:
Because our SOMI bra tops are designed with super-stretchy double-lined fabric, we recommend choosing your size based on your band measurement rather than your cup size. If in doubt, size down!
Please note that some styles are only available in certain sizes, so make sure to look at the size availability when picking your preferred look.
It started with an email.
“Hey,” it said. “Can I wear this underwear in the water? Like a bikini?”
At this point, SOMI was just a vision and a website.
We thought about it. What was the difference between underwear and swimwear, really? Our test line was already made from quick-dry fabric with sporty accents.
“We don’t see why not,” we wrote back.
Two days later, she sent a photo wearing her SOMI effortlessly in the water.
Then we got another photo.
And another.
Different women smiling and wearing their underwear proudly for everything from home workouts to hikes.
And there was one hiker who did a week-long trip with only SOMI, wore it as a swimsuit, and washed it in the sink at night.
We realized we were onto something.
Fast-forward to today, and we’ve transformed our flagship line into something never seen before: A whole new category of designs intended to empower and embolden.
We’re more than just a team of dreamers, though. We know how to bring products to market, how to deliver on our promises, and how to execute on manufacturing and production.
So without further ado, meet our people:
 To support our goal of being eco-friendly and sustainable, we are being selective about what we produce and when. 
What we will definitely produce: 
The Betty Bra,
The Maverick bottom, 
The Workout Buddy (Men's Boxer Brief),
All in black color to start with.
What we will produce when we hit specific funding goals:
The Highflyer bottom ($50K),
The Boyshort bottom ($75K),
The Deep dive top ($100K),
The Versatile ($200K),
The Minimalist ($400K),
Additional colors for the entire line: $150K - Mocha, $250K - Navy/Lavender, and at $300K - A new color will be chosen by backers!
A team can dream, right? Here’s what we can add to our SOMI line if we achieve these fundraising landmarks:
This project is promoted by Jellop, the ad tech power behind the best Kickstarters with 1,100+ successful Kickstarter projects with over $460M raised between them.

The story 
We’ve all seen the disturbing images of the boats, rickety contraptions that hardly look watertight, full to the brim of men, women, and children fleeing war-torn countries. We’ve all seen the galvanizing images of the bodies washed up, floating in the sea, dredged onto the beach. This year alone more than 300,000 people have tried to make the dangerous Mediterranean crossing in pursuit of a better life; up to 2,600 are known to have died. When they arrive in Europe, they face an uncertain future, frequently remaining trapped on the borders as EU governments try to shift responsibility. The numbers keep mounting up. We are in the midst of the worst refugee crisis since World War Two. 
Yet the mainstream political and media environment habitually strips refugees of their humanity, casting them not as people worthy of help – not as people at all – but as a threat to “our way of life”, to our scant resources, a “swarm” seeking to overwhelm our borders. Images matter, but so do words. Over recent weeks we’ve seen a battle over terminology – “migrant crisis” versus “refugee crisis”. The overuse of the term “migrants”, splashed across the headlines of broadsheets and newscasts, is dehumanising, misleading and implies less responsibility for governments. The 1951 UN Convention Relating to the Status of Refugees defines a refugee as someone who has fled his or her own home country and cannot return because of a well-founded fear of persecution there. In contrast, a migrant is someone who freely chooses to move from one place to another for better socio-economic conditions. 
Our project 
In a bid to offer more insightful coverage of this crisis, Matthew Williams and I, Audrey Courty, would like to spend 3-4 weeks in Europe, travelling along the refugee trail from Turkey to Germany, stopping at key border crossings and refugee camps. We want to produce a short documentary (30-45 minutes) capturing the long, desperate journeys of persecuted people seeking asylum. At the same time, we plan to write stories and record videos that will be published on our website: http://ontherefugeetrail.com [it will go live by Sunday, September 20]. We’ve evaluated that to cover our travel expenses for this project, we need at least $2,500 AUD. Most media outlets nowadays do not have the time and resources to promote this kind of project. But as more refugees continue to travel to Europe, and EU governments remain bitterly divided over what to do, the more urgent we feel these stories are. Even $25 can go a long way in helping us shed a more compassionate light on the refugee crisis.
For more information, please contact Matthew Williams on Twitter @mjwill1991, Audrey Courty @audreycourty, or follow our progress @refugeetrail.

Adam and Eve Inverted
The Project
The project is two 72 x 46 inch oil paintings of a life sized nude male and female facing the Pacific Ocean. Instead of expressing Adam and Eve's legendary fear and guilt they each stand naturally facing open space. 
The Story
The vision of standing naked and free, and facing open space, light, sand, and sea. No religion, no wars, no stupid products, and no confinements to block our possibilities. This stance rocks my world. It's not that I am anti-business or anti-progress or anything like that, it's just that the spirit of facing the world without those distractions reminds me of our innocence, our humanity, and our hope for living in a special world. And it gives me unbearable pleasure to touch that in paint everyday. 
Rethinking Art History and Keeping It Fresh
It keeps things fresh to rethink art history and try new things, like finding ways to create unique color harmonies for the paintings. By drawing pastels on location I came up with interesting combinations of rusts, blues, aquas, and earth hues. Those pastel studies will play a major part in setting the color theory for the oil paintings and give them a nuance that is unrepeatable. 
Underway
The project is well underway. Alanna Burns and Javier Cervantes are the models. They have already posed for the graphite studies. The are both young artists themselves, sensitive to their surroundings, philosophical, creative, and caring. And as soon as I met them, inspiration to work with them hit home. 
Newberry, Woman Study, 2012, graphite on Rives BFK, 22 x 16 inches.
Newberry, Man Study, 2012, graphite on Rives BFK, 22 x 16 inches
The Background
A few weeks ago for a couple of days, on the vast California beach of San Onofre, I drew 30 pastels and 6 charcoal landscape backgrounds for this project. Salt, sand, marine layers, sun, currents, and wind influenced the feeling of my mark making. 
Newberry, Rust Blue 3, 2012, pastel on rust-orange paper, 19 x 25 inches
(You can view the 30 plus landscapes rewards here.)
What is Next To Do
Now that all the studies are done, what is left is to pull everything together: two monumental works (life-size figure); twist on art history; unique color combinations; and a theme of facing freedom.
The woman painting is already started and is in a monochromatic stage. The plan is to stretch the man's canvas (Belgium linen) and place it along side the woman. And continue to work them side by side. 
Where You Come In
Optimistically this will take me 3 months working 24/7. The Kickstarter goal of $6,000 is basically to pay for time. Practically all my projects go through to completion but usually take time because I balance finishing them with selling smaller works. This is where you come in. 
Offering smaller works, such as the works above, and selling them all at once makes it much easier to complete major works. It's like having a patron! Please consider a donation that you feel comfortable with, and you will be rewarded with an artwork(s) at a fair value. This will definitely contribute to inverting the legend of Adam and Eve and striking a stance for freedom! 
Michael Newberry

I am currently in the early stages of creating a new website aimed at documenting all the carp venues within the UK. Being a keen carp angler, i am constantly on the look out for a new venue to visit, a little known gem crying out for carp anglers to visit.
I want to create something a little different, something that will allow carp anglers to find new venues to visit but be able to obtain as much information about the venue prior to visit. 
To do this i have created www.getfishing.co.uk and i plan to visit each venue personally, i will speak to the venue owners and find as much information about the lakes as possible (what baits work well, rigs etc. I will also capture aerial photos and create a video promotion of each lake (see example above). This allows anglers to get a full picture of the lake, how it looks and what does best. This is something no other fishing venue directory offers, we don't just pick a picture and give basic information about the venue, we capture what carp anglers look for when visiting a new venue.
At this stage i'd like to point out that i am not doing this for any financial gain. I do not charge any of the venues added to the site nor will i be looking to charge visitors to the site. I am creating this purely for us carp anglers and to give a helping hand to the smaller venues looking for a bit  of help publicising their lakes.
All money raised will be used towards travel costs incurred whilst traveling the UK to document these venues. As mentioned above, i am funding this project myself with no plan of return, however i am struggling to finance the costs of travel, and this fund raising project will go along way to helping me document as many venues as possible.
Hopefully this fund raising project can be a success and allow me to get more done over the next 12 months, either way look out for the site, it will become the go to site for UK carp venues.
We only need 500 of the thousands of carp anglers in the UK to donate £5 to this project to get us up and running. Please help us.
Thank you

Aturdida entre espacios que no le pertenecen y una realidad que la abruma día con día, Martina se encuentra completamente invadida por la ausencia de ella misma, orillándose a buscar romper el ciclo para ocupar su propia vida.
Dazed between spaces that she can't seem to fully make sense of and a reality that holds nothing but a feeling of emptiness, Martina finds herself completely numb, lost in the lack of her own identity, trying to break free.
PLAY

¿Por qué Frontera?
Frontera es una película sobre reducirse para caber en un espacio que ni siquiera te permite respirar. Es sobre permitir que alguien, o algo, te invada tanto que de pronto en ti ya no queda más espacio ni para ti misma.
En nuestro cortometraje buscamos explorar los límites entre las personas, la frontera que existe entre lo racional y lo emocional. Queremos contar una historia sobre sentirse vulnerable y buscar fuerzas dentro de este estado.
Why Frontera?
Frontera is a film about making yourself smaller and smaller in order to fit in a space that does not have room for breathing. It’s about letting someone (or something) invade you so profoundly that, one day, you find yourself not even fitting in you.
In our short film, we explore the boundaries between people, the border between the rational and the emotional. We want to tell a story about feeling vulnerable and making that state a first step in the process of taking your own life back.
Martina (Diana Bovio)
Sinopsis / Synopsis
Martina, una joven llena de energía, queda emocionalmente drenada después de una desilusión amorosa que la hará cuestionarse quién es, en verdad, ella misma.
Martina is an energetic, young woman who is left emotionally drained after a break-up that makes her question who she truly is.
Detrás de nuestro corto / behind our short film
Creative and color experiments, director's notes, inspiration
Director's notes, ideas, inspiration
El equipo / Our Crew
Ana Fernanda Torres - guionista y directora
writer-director
Ana Fer, writer-director
No fue hasta tiempo después de haberse mudado a la CDMX se dio cuenta que siempre había querido contar historias y que las películas serían su forma preferida para hacerlo. Ana Fer ve la escritura y la dirección como dos partes del mismo proceso creativo que buscan crear universos donde quepan las historias honestas, complejas, libres y diversas (¡como la vida misma!) al igual que los personajes que habiten esos espacios.
Admira particularmente las películas que hacen sentir, por lo que ama el cine de Mia Hansen-Løve, Michelangelo Antonioni, Chantal Akerman y Eliza Hittman.
Además, ha tenido la oportunidad de formar parte del cuarto de escritoras de una serie universitaria, participar como moderadora en el Festival de Cine Kinoki y trabajar en la redacción de varias publicaciones como Vacant, DNA Magazine e Ibero 90.9, donde también es locutora del programa ‘El Cine y…’ desde el 2018.
It wasn't until years after moving to Mexico City that Ana Fer realized she had always wanted to tell stories and that movies would be her favorite way to do so. She sees writing and directing as two parts of a process that strives to create worlds where honest, complex, and diverse stories (just like life itself!) can exist.
She particularly admires films that make you feel, which is why she loves Mia Hansen-Løve, Michelangelo Antonioni, Chantal Akerman and Eliza Hittman’s work.
Ana Fer has also been a part of a TV show's writers' room, participated as a moderator at Kinoki Film Festival and written for several online and printed publications such as Vacant, DNA Magazine and Ibero 90.9, where she is also a radio presenter of 'El Cine y...' since 2018.
Camila Barbará - productora
producer
Camila, producer
Camila, co-productora de Frontera, es un ser de luz que viene a llenarnos el set de alegría y que, sin duda, es la “most likely to succeed.” Es productora de tres cortometrajes de titulación y ha trabajado en distintas producciones profesionales durante la carrera, además de ser First AD en su tiempo (no tan) libre. Es experta en bomberazos y en resolver la vida de todas nosotras.
Camila, Frontera's co-producer, is an amazing human that fills our sets with joy and who, without a doubt, is "most likely to succeed." She is currently producing three short films and has worked in professional productions during her college life, as well as constantly being First AD in her (not so) free time. She's an expert in last-minute jobs and, basically, in solving every one of our lives.
Sabina Suárez Valencia - productora
producer
Sabina, producer
Mejor conocida como Sabeibi, es co-productora de Frontera. Ella llega a este corto a traernos sus brillitos de colores y llenarnos de su orden y sabiduría. Sabina fue directora del Festival Internacional de Cine Universitario Kinoki durante la 15va edición y jurado en el Black Canvas Festival de Cine Contemporáneo. Actualmente trabaja en 9AM Cinematography y produce dos cortometrajes de titulación dentro de la Universidad Iberoamericana.
Better known as Sabeibi, she is Frontera's co-producer. She comes to this short film to bring us her colorful sparkles and fill us with her order and wisdom. Sabina was director of the Kinoki International Student Film Festival during the 15th edition and was a judge at the Black Canvas Contemporary Film Festival. She currently works at 9AM Cinematography and is producing two short films at Universidad Iberoamericana.
Renata Arzac - directora de fotografía
director of photography
Renata, cinematographer
Cinefotógrafa que vive y trabaja en la Ciudad de México. Asistió a la Universidad Iberoamericana, donde obtuvo una licenciatura en Ciencias de la Comunicación. Además, ha tomado varias clases de cinefotografía, certificadas por escuelas internacionales como EICTV Cuba.
Desde 2016 ha fotografiado más de 10 cortometrajes, tanto de ficción como documentales y dos videos musicales. Para ella, mirar nunca ha sido un acto pasivo.
En su trabajo, crea imágenes que piensan y sienten, deforman y transforman, que reinventan lugares y momentos. Para ella, el movimiento que realmente tiene lugar en las imágenes, no es el que el público percibe al mirar, sino el que se construye en su imaginación. Para encontrar la clave visual de cada proyecto, Renata nunca ha dejado de experimentar con películas, sensores, lentes, color y luz, en sincronía con directores que están intoxicados por las posibilidades de su arte.
Renata is a cinematographer living and working in Mexico City. She attended Universidad Iberoamericana, where she majored in Communication Sciences. In addition to this, she has taken several courses certified by international schools such as EICTV Cuba.
Since 2016, she has been the cinematographer for more than 10 short films, both fiction and documentary and two music videos. For her, looking has never been a passive act.
Throughout her film work, she creates images that think and feel by themselves, images that reinvent places and moments. For her, the movement is not what the public perceives while looking, but what's built in their imagination. In orderr to find the visual key to each project, Renata has never stopped experimenting with films, sensors, lenses, color and light, always in synchrony with directors who are intoxicated by the possibilities of their art.

Esteban has worked in multiple audiovisual mediums as a director, writer, editor, animator, illustrator, and production designer. Ivonne espera algún día poder abrazar a Pedro Almodóvar y a Harry Styles, además de proyectar a través del sonido todos los sentimientos que Frontera busca transmitir.
A lover of film, music, Harry Styles, and Shakira. Ivonne likes to tell stories and listen to them. She collaborated at Ibero 90.9, where she began to intertwine her passions for writing and music, also covering music events such as Corona Capital. She has participated in both student films and professional projects where she's been in charge of direct sound for movies, tv, and plays. Among her most recent projects is the play 'Plath,' that shows via zoom in October 2020 and the short film 'Ave en cautiverio.'
She hopes to be able to hug Pedro Almodóvar and Harry Styles one day, as well as to be able to convey through sound all the feelings that 'Frontera' transmits.
Ximena Bernús - editora
editor
Ximena, editor
Ha participado en varios cortometrajes desde el departamento de producción, además de que le encanta dirigir y escribir; su pasión es contar buenas historias a través de la edición y el montaje, en donde cree firmemente que es donde se empieza a construir una película.
Ximena has participated in several short films, in the production department. She also loves directing and writing but her true passion lies in being able to tell good stories through editing, which is where she firmly believes that a film really begins.
Reparto / Cast
Diana Bovio - Martina
Diana Bovio is Martina
Actriz, cantante y bailarina, Diana ha participado en obras de teatro, musicales y películas como ‘Hasta que la boda nos separe,’ ‘Solteras,’ ‘Cindy la regia.’ Más recientemente, también formó parte del elenco de la serie de Netflix ‘La Búsqueda.’ Gracias a la vida y a todo lo que se alineó, Diana y Ana Fer coincidieron para crear y contar juntas la historia de Martina en Frontera.
An actress, singer, and dancer, Diana has worked in plays, musicals, and films such as “Hasta que la Boda nos Separe,” “Solteras,” and “Cindy la Regia." Her latest work includes the Netflix series “The Search.” Thanks to life and everything fallling into place, Diana and Ana Fer were brought together to create and tell Martina’s story in Frontera.
¡Gracias por tu apoyo! / Thanks for your support!

We figured that part of the problem lies in the way we are taught at school. When you think of the way traditional learning works, you often picture something like this:
You go into a classroom and learn from the professor and the material he /she has already set up for you, which makes it difficult for students to draw a connection between the classroom lesson and the real world.
To establish a creative and stimulating environment where undergraduate students can build up their experience and skills using a project-based learning approach. To accomplish this we want to open up our first HackerSpace in Orange County, CA. A place full of resources (Arduinos, 3D printers, computers, tool, etc..) that students can use to creative some innovative and challenging to share with the world!
We want to help students build up their experience and skills and give them something exceptional to share with the world. Having a strong resume and High GPA are great, but having an innovative and challenging project that you can visually showcase or a great achievement you are particularly proud of makes an even greater impact. STEMbility can help you achieve just that, now talk about standing out from the crowd!
Donn Silberman, Founding Director at the Optics Institute of Southern California, speaks about the importance of project-based.
PLAY

Robert Castano, professor of Automation and Electronics at Orange Coast College, talks about how experiencing something for yourself is the best way to acquire knowledge. He also demonstrates, using a robot, how project-based learning can help students create a connection between a classroom lesson and the real world.
PLAY

Gain experience working on a project under real world conditions.
Get their awesome and innovative ideas completely funded.
Have the opportunity to showcase their abilities to the world. 
Practice their teamwork skills.
Learn project management and keeping documentation of their projects.
Practice their networking skills.
Increase their chances of finding a high paying job after graduation.
You will receive FREE Inspiring and innovative open source S.T.E.M. content.
If you are an employer or talent recruiter you will have a place to find potential candidates with real world experience. 
More students will be better qualified to join the work force after graduation and thousands of dollars won’t be wasted on worthless degrees or even jobless Americans.
We are a group of 4 undergraduate students from California that want to help other students have a better feature. We care about education and believe that it is important for students to use more of a hands on learning approach in order to acquire real knowledge. Over the past 3 months we have worked countless hours to further develop this idea and have reached out to professors and other authorities in the subject (project-based learning and S.T.E.M.) to make sure we are creating the most effective and exciting way for students to learn and stand out from the crowd. Now we need your help to make this project a reality. 
I'm a 22 years old Computer Science major at the University of California, Irvine. I have always been on a journey for the pursuit of knowledge, but I’m aware that regardless of the number of books I read, I will only learn by experiencing things for myself. Ever since I can remember I've been curious about science and technology and recently about art. My experiences and skills range from robotics and project management, to photography. I have been a leader, programmer and engineer contributing to several robotics projects over the past 3 years. What distinguishes me from others is that I can efficiently follow directions and work well in the solitude of my own space and still posses great emotional intelligence which allows me to interact well with others and be a team member.
I'm a student at Irvine Valley college majoring in Communications. I'm passionate about maintaining a healthy lifestyle, exploring new places, making connections with different people and learning through the process of it all. I'm participating in this project because I'm a strong supporter of hands-on learning, and believe that by assuming the role of Public Relations Officer, I can gain more experience in networking and communication.
My name is Tim Gutierrez and I am the director of photography for STEMbility. I’m passionate about music as well as singing. I’m also attending Orange Coast College as a psychology major. I’ve always wanted to be a part of something meaningful, and when Andres asked me if I wanted to help him out with his KickStarter Campaign I didn’t hesitate to say heck yes! I believe in him as well as what he is trying to achieve with his company.
I am a current UCI student majoring in mathematics. I am passionate about film and storytelling. I am participating in this project because I believe in hands on learning. By getting experience and trying it out, it makes learning fun and comes more naturally.
So here is the deal, we are not just trying to help undergraduate students build up their experience and skills to prepare them for the real world, we are trying to create a movement. We want to promote S.T.E.M. education and project-based learning among students all ages. We want YOU to join this movement. So take a picture of yourself working on a project or experiment (Groups photos are welcomed too) and upload it to Instagram or Twitter using the hashtag #readystemgo. We will go through all the photos weakly and feature you them our social media.

Welcome to my kickstarter project, Even Me!
I want to create twenty-four 4x4 ft paintings of the twenty-four orphans I've been teaching the past year in Tanzania.  
Instead of painting on canvas, I'm building wooden panels, each including a 4 inch box frame that will be covered with African fabric.  The paintings will have a similar composition depicting half the child's face, neck, and t-shirt line.  The difference in each painting will be evident through the child's expression and personality.   
The final exhibition will display all twenty-four paintings, comprising a 20 x 30 ft installation. 
Your funding toward this project will be used for materials.  
I need to purchase oil paint, gesso, paint brushes, turpentine, wooden panels, wooden frames, and African fabric. 
Any amount you contribute will be a big deal to me. And, as a token of my gratitude, you will receive my artwork in return.  Below is an example of the $25 reward, an African fabric heart patch, hand-embroidered with the project name.

My name is Omar and I have been a NYC photographer for about a decade now. I started when I was young and ever since I have fallen in love with it, shooting everything from portraits, fashion, life style, editorials, etc. what I capture with my lens is nearly endless. I have been using the same camera equipment for almost 8 years now, and although a photographers images are not based on the equipment he uses, but rather the skill and creativity put into them, my camera is starting to show its age. 
I would love to start shooting more NYC landscapes and personal projects that I come up with. Living in NYC, I love walking around and shooting its great sights and uncanny streets whenever I can. I feel this city always has something to offer, and if you have a little bit of patience and a quick trigger finger, you can capture some amazing moments. I'm looking to shoot more double exposures as well, and incorporate them with my portraits and landscapes in a way that would create some amazing work. 
In helping me fund my brand new camera equipment, I will personally shoot a NYC landscape for you to hang on your wall. The image above was shot by me 2 years ago, and it now hangs in my living room. With your backing, I will create a lovely unique piece of art for you to hang in your home. that will always be a conversation piece and look great in any room.
The rewards will be sent out by September, since I will need time to produce and print the unique work. Rest assured, I will work hard all through the spring / summer season and if the images become available sooner than expected, they will be shipped!. If you have a preference of location in NYC or want an image of a different location other than the NYC skyline: Brooklyn bridge? Flushing queens? Coney Island? Madison Avenue? LET ME KNOW!! I offer the NYC skyline as a starting point, but will cater to almost any request as long as its possible and I have access to the area / angle. I am a working father of two kids and want from my kids to study every day, but my kids want to play the whole day.
working father
Every time I asked my son if he did study today, he tels me: yes I finished my homework. But is this enough? Does homework let him understand everything he gets on school? Does it give him a high degrees? Or we should search for something else to help him be a successful student?
There are many websites on the Internet which give a good education, but most of them are boring for the children or too expensive!!!
As a parent I want my kids to get the best education they can ever have, but sometimes its too expensive and with unknown results.
I have already registered my children for an education website where they can learn by playing games, its too expensive, but very handy and I can pay for it.
But what about other parents? Can they pay for these games? and does they know how important they are to there children?
These questions guided me to an idea to help other parents for free, and with your help we can make the best gaming education web site, which can help children to enjoy learning while they are playing.
I believe that all children in the world deserve a good education because they are the future and when they get the right education we/they will get a comfortable future.
I am Haydar Alkadhimi, the head of a web development company who has helped a lot of other companies to make a successful web based business and ready to help our children to have the best education they deserve.
My idea is to make a gaming education web application to our, your and others children all over the world, with the help of local universities. This application will also be available in all languages and education methods.
EducationByGames.com
If you believe that this is an easy job, I am sorry to tell you that you are wrong, its a very difficult job and have many technical problems. per example:
We want our application to be an international education gaming website, this means that we will face some issues to deal with. One of these issues is:
Every country has its own education methods and language.
Per example the language in Iraq is Arabic, to write abi in arabic (which means father) you will need to write the following three letters from right to left and you will also need to connect these letters to each other.
And the language in The Netherlands is dutch, and when you write Aap in the netherlands (which mean monkey) you will need to write tow letters Aa (which is double A) and P, but you will need to write it from left to right (like most of the words languages) and as you can see the letters are separated.
To solve this issue, we have decoded to bind every profile to two properties country and school year. This will bind all games to these properties and will lead a fourth class student living in The Netherlands to other games than a fourth class student living in Iraq.
The other big issue is contacting universities, its too expensive and needs a lot of human resources per example by traveling to the countries of these universities. But this will be possible with your help by fonding this project.
Traveling to these countries is too expensive
What is it?
- An open source education gaming platform for all school years, languages and countries.
- Children can learn by playing, this is the best way to get the school lessens inside the children heads without any difficulty.
- Free registration for children, schools and parents
- Universities should participate by contacting them and going to them with the idea.
Who can use it?
- Children in elementary school (at the beginning)
- Parents of these children.
- Schools and class teachers of these children.
- Ministries of education in all the countries in the world.
How it works?
- Every country has its own education methods.
- We contact universities in these countries and ask them for help.
- Universities ask students to make education games as graduate projects.
Open source education platform
- PHP/HTML5 based website
- All games will be open source HTML5 based
- Contact universities to participate per example as a graduate project to there IT students. 
Supported platforms
Registration fees
- No registration fees applies to anyone.
- Anyone can help will be welcomed.
Restrictions
- No porn materials may be added (even education ones).
- No hate and violence material may be added (even if its an education materials in that country).

NOTE****
The following content is a demonstration video that depicts the drama, atmosphere and mood of the film we wish to produce. Our main character and some locations of the story are introduced. This is not the final work and is not an advertisement of the film.
次の動画は私たちが制作したい短編映画のドラマ、雰囲気、ムードを表現し、主人公といくつかのロケーションを紹介しているデモンストレーションムービーです。この動画は完成した作品ではありませんし、又、予告編でもありません。 
あらすじ
Due to the Fukushima earthquake and tsunami disaster on 03/11/2011, Yoko lost her husband and her eight year old son Yuta.  For three years she struggles with grief, and one night she hears Yuta’s whisper from a phone booth. She attempts to speak with him... a mysterious sign of life. Yoko wakes up in an unrecognized place, her pursuit begins.
人見洋子は、2011年3月11日、東日本大震災による津波で、夫と8歳の息子・人見裕太の命を奪われてしまい、以後3年間悲しみとの戦いを続けていた。ある晩、公衆電話からの通話で裕太の「囁く」声を耳にし、彼女にとっては摩訶不思議な体験であり、息子と会話をしようとしたが、自分の見知らぬ場所で目を覚まし、そこから彼女の追跡が始まることとなる。
Still image from the mood trailer that we shot.
なぜこのストーリー
To write the story of “Whisper”, I was inspired by an article about the "Wind phone booth" connected to nothing and nowhere. This phone booth is located outside the Japanese town of Otsuchi.
本作品「囁く」の物語は、岩手県大槌町にある、電話線がどこにも繋がっていない「風の電話」という電話ボックスについての記事にインスピレーションを受けています。
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Article by Spooky - Oddytycentral: “Ever since the tragic tsunami of 2011, which claimed nearly 20,000 human lives, thousands of grieving people have visited the booth to “call” their lost loved ones as a way of coping with their loss. The Wind Phone, as the now famous Otsuchi telephone booth is commonly known, was actually built a year before the 2011 tsunami that ravaged Japan’s Tōhoku coast. Otsuchi resident, Itaru Sasaki, had lost his cousin in 2010 and decided to build a phone booth in his hilltop garden from where he would call his dear relative as a way of dealing with grief. He would call his cousin’s phone number on an old, unconnected rotary phone, and his words would be “carried on the wind” as he spoke. Even though no one would talk back to him, it made Sasaki feel a deeper connection to his cousin.In the aftermath of the 2011 earthquake, Itaru Sasaki opened his Wind Phone booth to the public, allowing members of the community to mourn their losses in the same way he had.”
Itaru Sasaki  - “The telephone is not connected, but people feel like their lost loved ones are there listening on the other end of the line. I want people to resume their lives as soon as possible by expressing their feelings.”
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
The amazing and emotional story about the "Wind phone booth," inspired me to add some magic in my own script. Besides the grief and struggle in the protagonist's (Yoko's) daily life after her loss of her husband and son, she also experiences hope after she wakes up in an unknown world where she is guided by a mysterious red light.  
Nowadays, there's an abundance of short films and only a few of them are focusing on the feelings, emotions, the magic of making the viewer recognize themselves through the characters and story. These are the main key aspects that I want to focus in this film. 
「風の電話」の感動的な話から受けたインスピレーションは、私が書き始めていた脚本を更に魅力的にしてくれました。この映画の主人公（人見洋子）は、夫と息子を失くしてからの日々の深い悲しみと苦しみだけでなく、不思議な赤い光に導かれて全く見知らぬ場所で目覚めたあとに、希望というものも経験することになります。
近頃では多くの短編映画が作られていますが、感情や感覚、登場人物やストーリーを通して観客が自分自身を見つめさせてくれる映画が持つ魔法、といったことに焦点を当てた作品は数少ないです。この映画では特にそう言ったものを考えながら作りたいと思っています。
Still image from the mood trailer that we shot.

ロケーション
Another important aspect of this film is location. 70% of the locations will be exteriors, especially when she wakes up in the unknown world where a red light guides her.  A very important part in a good film is the right choice of the locations: how the atmosphere and colors of the setting is in relationship with the character and her psychological and spiritual state. This is the reason why location scouting is very important as we have some amazing locations in mind that are perfect for our film, but still have to scout for others.
本作品をつくる上でもう一つの重要なポイントは撮影場所です。この作品では、ロケーションの70%（特に主人公の女性が赤い光に導かれて見知らぬ場所で目覚めてから）が屋外になります。良質な映画にはずせないポイントの一つは最適なロケーション選びでしょう。撮影場所の雰囲気や色調と、主人公の女性のキャラクター性や彼女の精神的状態は、密接な関係にあります。だからこそ撮影場所選びはとても重要なのです。今回の映画にぴったり会う素晴らしいロケーション候補は既にいくつか考えてありますが、他の撮影場所も探さなくてはなりません。

制作費 - 100% か 0%
As we all know, a Kickstarter campaign gets funded only if it reaches its goal by the campaign deadline. We have 30 days to reach our goal and this will be only possible with your support and love for films. Anything from sharing this campaign to, funding, to becoming a co-producer is more than welcome! Despite the uncertain situation now in the world, we think nothing should stop us from moving forward to create and achieve our goals. We just need to adapt and never stop or look backwards. 
皆さんもご存知のとおり、このキックスターターは設けられた期日までに目標額に達しないと資金は得られません。期間は30日間です。皆さんのサポート、そして映画への愛なくして、この期間でクラウドファンディングを成功することはできません。このページのシェア、資金応援、どのようなことでも作品へのサポートになります。また、共同プロデューサー(Co-Producer)になってくださる方も歓迎いたします。今、不安が渦巻く世の中ではありますが、何かを創ること、そしてやりたいことを成し遂げるための歩みは、何にも止められるものではありません。現状を理解することは必要ですが、歩みを止めたり後ろを振り返るべきではないと私たちは思っています。

Blessid:  Fate Can Change Your Life Forever 
Rachel Kerbs (Splinter) stars as Sarah Duncliffe in Blessid
 STORY 
We all have free will to make our own choices in this life. But we are never really alone... 
Blessid is a poignant indie drama about a pregnant woman with a cursed past who forms a bond with a man who is immortal. At its core, Blessid is an anti-suicide film whose ultimate message is about self forgiveness. 
Sarah Duncliffe (played by Rachel Kerbs) battles suicidal thoughts and disturbing hallucinations of her deceased sister (a victim of a tragic childhood accident), an abusive ex-boyfriend who continues to stalk her, and the banal existence of an empty marriage. Weeks away from delivering a child that she feels undeserving to parent, Sarah finds her life taking a surprising turn when she accidentally meets her new neighbor who harbors an amazing life secret and shares a personal connection that will change her forever.
Gene Silvers (Edward Duncliffe) and Rachel Kerbs
CAST 
We have an amazing cast of SAG and non-union actors that you've probably seen but may not know by name. Yet. Our talented cast includes:
Rachel Kerbs as Sarah Duncliffe (Splinter)
Rick Montgomery Jr. as Jedediah Cross (Aimy in a Cage)
Gene Silvers as Edward Duncliffe (Law & Order)

Rachel Kerbs and Rick Montgomery Jr. prepare for a car ride

MUSIC

Sarah Blacker
Duke Levine
The Jinxes
WHY SHOULD YOU CONTRIBUTE?
Blessid was shot on the Red Epic and looks amazing. The direction, acting, cinematography, sound mix, music and color correction have all come together to create amazing production quality. Our film literally looks like a million dollar production.
Unlike many projects on Kickstarter, Blessid is an indie film that is complete and will be submitted to film festivals in the coming weeks. 
So why do we need your help? 
As writer/producer of Blessid, I have invested $120,000 of my own money into the film. I believe in it that much. I have also been fortunate to have some other small investors and contributions. But ...
We need more help. 
Now that our film is made, we need to get it out in front of the world. Funds you contribute will be used to help defray costs for film festival submissions, marketing, PR, and additional costs for meeting “Deliverables” requirements. There is no risk that Blessid will be made – it is already on DVD and BluRay screeners. The only risk is that it doesn’t get the marketing support it deserves. 
Your help – in any amount – is greatly appreciated! 
(L-R) Director Rob Fitz, Costume Designer Alanna Keenan, Writer/Producer Bob Heske and Production Manager Kurt Bergeron
