I am an aspiring art and enthusiastic fan of many sports.
Most fans are limited in how they are able to show pride in their teams, jerseys on game days and hats from time to time.
Hang Skyline Sports pictures in your living room, hallways or man caves as a classy and effective way to show pride for all of your favourite professional sports teams!
With the funds from this kickstarter project, I look to expand my market with promotions and opening an online store. It will also help me purchase supplies that in turn will allow me to create pieces for different markets and assist with printing costs.
Thank you for any and all help in funding my project!

Der Moment, wenn du nach einem flowigen Downhill auf deinen Hometrails mit deinen Freunden unten ankommst und dir denkst: GEIL! In Wien haben wir für dieses Gefühl ein ganz spezielles Wort: LEIWAND! Für uns gibt es nichts Schöneres als aus der Innenstadt in den Wienerwald und die Wiener Hausberge zu radeln, um gemeinsam mit Freunden Zeit am Trail zu verbringen. Dazu gehören natürlich Pausen mit Kracherl, Kaffee, Bier und natürlich Spritzwein! Wir sind Mountainbiker aus Wien und haben ein Ziel: Für Trail Mountainbiker mit hohen Qualitätsansprüchen europäische premium Sportswear zu fairen Preisen anbieten!  
Was macht LEiWAND einzigartig? Es ist die Kombination von drei Eigenschaften!  
100% Premium // Funktionalität & Qualitätsmaterialien & Design  
100% Europa // Faire Produkte Made in Europe  
100% Direktvertrieb // Faire Preise mit top Preis-/Leistungsverhältnis  
Unser Team besteht aus passionierten MountainbikerInnen. Wir haben einschlägige und langjährige Berufserfahrung in den Bereichen funktionelles Sportmodedesign, Grafik, Unternehmensführung, Marketing und Fotografie. Alle leben, arbeiten und biken in und rund um Wien!
LEiWAND – European Trail Wear hat eine klare Vision für ein nachhaltiges Wachstum! Für den Produktionsstart benötigen wir noch eine Sache: Deine Unterstützung!
Produktionsstart? Ja, unsere Produkte sind fertig entwickelt und getestet. Wir können sofort nach erfolgreicher Kampagne in die finale Produktion der ersten 600 Stück mit unserem Produktionspartner Kirpte Sportswear gehen. Deine Unterstützung fließt somit 1:1 in die Fertigung deiner Produkte! Wir bedanken uns schon jetzt herzlich für deine Unterstützung!

Für wen ist LEiWAND?  
Trail Mountainbiker! Auch bekannt unter All-Mountain- oder Enduro-Biker. Also jeder der sein Bike selbst bergauf tritt und sich dann auf Singletrails runterlässt. Die Abgrenzung sehen wir bei Cross-Country und Downhill, da wir uns bei der Produktentwicklung auf die Anforderungen von Trail Mountainbikern spezialisiert haben. LEiWAND bietet dir europäische premium Sportswear für Trail Mountainbiker zu fairen Preisen.
100% Premium: Funktionalität & Qualitätsmaterialien & Design 
Unter premium Produkten verstehen wir die Kombination von drei Eigenschaften: Erstens, ein funktionelles Design, welches dich beim Up- und Downhill optimal unterstützt. Zweitens, europäische Qualitätsmaterialien, welche den unterschiedlichen Anforderungen beim Trail Mountainbiken gerecht werden. Drittens, eine farbenfrohe, schlichte Designsprache die Freude bereitet.
100% Europa: Faire Produkte Made in Europe 
LEiWAND Produkte bestehen zu 100% aus Europa. Die Produktentwicklung findet in Wien statt. Die Hauptmaterialien kommen von italienischen Lieferanten, das Zubehör aus Europa. Gefertigt wird bei unserem Partner Kirpte in Litauen. Alle unsere Partner und Lieferanten haben sich auf Sporttextilien spezialisiert und haben langjährige Erfahrung in diesem Bereich. Diese findest du im Kapitel „Das LEiWAND Netzwerk“. Wir möchten damit faire soziale und ökologische Bedingungen unterstützen. Außerdem ist es uns wichtig, hiermit ein positives Statement für die europäische Sportbekleidungsindustrie über die gesamte Wertschöpfungskette zu setzen.
100% Direktvertrieb: Faire Preise mit top Preis-/Leistungsverhältnis
LEiWAND Produkte sollen für so viele Mountainbikern wie möglich erschwinglich sein. Beim Kauf unserer Produkte sollst du überzeugt sagen: „Leiwand, da passen Preis und Leistung!“ Daher haben wir uns für ein reines Direktvertriebsmodell entschieden. Unsere Produkte sind nach erfolgreicher Kampagne nur über unseren Online-Shop (www.leiwandwear.eu) zu beziehen. Hierdurch können wir einen Teil der Händlermarge einsparen und dir europäische Premiumprodukte zu fairen Preisen anbieten. Wir bitten dich daher uns bei Kickstarter zu unterstützen, um die Produktion unseres ersten Sortiments zu ermöglichen!

  Unser erstes Sortiment besteht aus der Grundausstattung für Trail Mountainbiker: Shirt, Longsleeve und Short. Die unterschiedlichen Bewegungsabläufe beim Trail Mountainbiken sind die Grundlage der Produktentwicklung. Hierbei kombinieren wir die Anforderungen des bewegungsintensiven Downhills auf Singletrails und dem schweißtreibenden Uphill mit Muskelkraft.
.
Unsere ersten Produkte sind für wärmere Temperaturen ab ca. 18 bis 20 Grad entwickelt. Die Größen und Schnitte sind Unisex, basierend auf Männergrößen. In den Produktbeschreibungen weiter unten findest du Detailinformationen. Unser erstes Sortiment ist produktionsreif und die ersten 600 Stück können nach erfolgreicher Kampagne innerhalb kürzester Zeit hergestellt und ausgeliefert werden. Infos hierzu findest du unter „Projektstatus: Produktionsbereit“.
.
  .
FUNKTIONALITÄT
Shirt und Longsleeve haben einen Bike spezifischen Schnitt mit verlängertem Rückenteil und genügend Bewegungsfreiheit im Schulterbereich. Die Produkte zeichnen sich durch lockere Paßform mit körperbetontem Schnitt aus. Zusätzlich achten wir bei LEiWAND auch auf funktionelle Details speziell für Biker. Für einen freien Blick durch Brille oder Goggles ist ein Brillenputztuch am Abschluß integriert. Das Longsleeve bietet genügend Platz und Flexibilität um Ellbogenschoner darunter zu tragen. 
MATERIAL
Das spezielle Shirt und Longsleeve Material ist aus Polyester und Elasthan. Es ist leicht, angenehm zu tragen, hoch atmungsaktiv und schnelltrocknend. Ideal für einen schweißtreibenden Uphill bei wärmeren Temperaturen. Der Elasthananteil im 4-Way-Stretch Material garantiert dir optimale Bewegungsfreiheit. Die hohen Abriebswerte des Materials bieten Widerstandskraft beim Tragen eines Rucksacks oder beugen Beschädigung durch Klettverschlüsse vor, genauso wie bei ungewollten Abstiegen vom Bike mit überschaubarer Krafteinwirkung ;)
DESIGN
Das Design ist modern, die Farben sind klar, mit speziellen Designakzenten in Kontrastfarben, die beim Tragen in der Stadt oder auf dem Trail richtig Freude bereiten. Die Farbvarianten pro Produkt reichen von einem optimistischen Orange, klaren und entspannten Blautönen bis zum dezenten, stylischen Schwarz. Die Produkte sind in vier Unisex Größen von Small bis X-Large erhältlich.
.
.
FUNKTIONALITÄT
Die Short hat eine legere Paßform und der Schnitt ist optimal auf die Anforderungen und Bewegungsabläufe des Trail Mountainbikens abgestimmt. Der Bund ist hinten höher geschnitten, bietet damit Schutz vor entblößtem Rücken beim bergauf Radeln. Die Schrittlänge ist vorne kürzer gehalten, damit du nicht an deinem Sattel hängen bleibst. Mit der Weitenverstellung am Bund, kannst du die Hose perfekt an deinen Körper anpassen. Der Kniebereich ist vorgeformt und bietet genügend Platz für Knieschoner. Auch der Hosenlänge und Beininnenweite haben wir bei der Schnittentwicklung besondere Beachtung geschenkt, speziell beim Tragen von Knieschonern ein Pluspunkt. Zwei offene Eingriffstaschen bieten dir bequem Platz um schnell etwas einzustecken. Zum sicheren Verstauen während der Fahrt, gibt es zwei verschließbare Zip-Taschen. Eine kleinere Zip-Tasche befindet sich an der linken Eingriffstasche und bietet Platz für Liftkarte, Bankkarte oder deinen Schlüssel. Am rechten Oberschenkel befindet sich eine Zip-Tasche für größeren Platzbedarf, mit extra Innentasche für dein Smartphone. Die Zip-Tasche ist so konzipiert, dass sie deine Kniefreiheit beim Fahren nicht beeinträchtigt.    
MATERIAL
Das Hosenmaterial ist für wärmere Temperaturen ausgelegt. Es ist sehr leicht, mit hohem Tragekomfort, atmungsaktiv und schnelltrocknend. Der 4-Way-Strech bietet hohe Flexibilität, die Short macht jede Bewegung mit. Zudem weist der Stoff eine hohe Widerstandskraft auf, auch über die Nahtführung erreichen wir ein optimales Verhältnis zwischen Dehnung und Stabilität. Dadurch unterstützt dich die Hose beim bewegungsintensiven Downhill am Trail, als auch bei Tragepassagen mit hohen Stufen und Ausfallschritten.
DESIGN
Das Design der Shorts ist clean und mit allen funktionellen Details ausgestattet. Die Short ist in zwei Farbvarianten, einem urbanen blau und einem stylischem schwarz, sowie in vier Größen von Small – XLarge erhältlich.
.
   Messpunkte:
Brust: Waagrecht an der höchsten Erhebung der Brust
Gürtellinie: Waagrecht an niedriger Taillenhöhe (Gürtellinie Jeans)
Hüfte: Locker und waagrecht an der breitesten Stelle
Mit deiner Unterstützung finanzieren wir 1:1 die finale Produktion der ersten 600 Stück unseres Sortiments. Die Produktentwicklung ist abgeschlossen. Wir werden die Produktion sofort nach Ende der Kampagne starten und deinen Reward zwei Monate nach Kampagnenende an dich schicken. Dies ist weit über dem Durchschnitt von normalen Kickstarter Projekten! Gemeinsam realisieren wir LEiWAND - European Trail Wear. Vielen Dank für deine Unterstützung!
   .
    Wir haben seit dem Frühjahr 2016 gemeinsam mit unseren Partnern und Lieferanten die Produktentwicklung und das Prototyping durchgeführt, beendet und selbst finanziert. Unsere Produkte sind produktionsfertig! Mit unserem Produktionspartner Kirpte Sportswear in Litauen haben wir eine Produktionskapazität für die ersten 600 Stück unseres Sortiments direkt nach Kampagnenende definiert und können zwei Monate nach der Kampagne an dich ausliefern! Du bekommst die Produkte daher überdurchschnittlich schnell nach Kampagnenende und noch rechtzeitig vor Saisonbeginn! Damit wir diesen Plan realisieren können, benötigen wir noch eine Sache … Deine finanzielle Unterstützung! Somit weißt du auch genau, wofür dein Geld eins zu eins verwendet wird! Nämlich für die sofortige Produktion deiner LEiWAND – European Trail Wear!

.

Uns ist es wichtig zu zeigen, dass hinter LEiWAND mehr als nur unser Team steht. Hiermit möchten wir dir unsere Partner und Lieferanten von Konzeption, Grafik, über Funktonsmaterialien und Produktion vorstellen. Volle Transparenz unserer Wertschöpfungskette ist uns wichtig und wir sind stolz darauf, dass unser Netzwerk zu hundert Prozent in Europa zuhause ist. Hervorheben möchten wir unseren Produktionspartner Kirpte Sportswear! Kirpte ist nicht nur eine hochqualitative Fabrikationsstätte für Sportbekleidung, sondern wichtiger Inputgeber für die Produktentwicklung. Hiermit möchten wir uns bei allen Partnern und Lieferanten herzlich bedanken!
  Unser Traum ist die Realisierung des Projekts LEiWAND – European Trail Wear! Hierfür haben wir aus Eigenmitteln die Produktentwicklung und das Prototyping finanziert. Nun möchten wir die LEiWAND Produkte auf den Markt bringen!
Hierfür brauchen wir deine finanzielle Unterstützung, damit die Produktion der ersten 600 Stück bezahlt werden kann. Durch den „Ready for production“ Projektfortschritt können wir dir eine überdurchschnittlich schnelle Auslieferung deines Rewards zwei Monate nach der Kampagne zusagen. Außerdem weißt du genau, wofür dein Geld verwendet wird, nämlich 1:1 für die finale Produktion!
Uns ist wichtig klarzustellen, dass LEiWAND – European Trail Wear kein One-Time-Event auf Kickstarter ist! Für uns ist Kickstarter die Chance unser Projekt zu starten und um ein langfristiges, eigenfinanziertes und nachhaltiges Wachstum zu ermöglichen. Wir haben konkrete Vorstellungen über weitere Produkte, die du zukünftig ausschließlich über unseren Online-Shop (www.leiwandwear.eu) erhältst. Im Folgekapitel „Ausblick in die Zukunft“ findest du eine Übersicht über unsere Ideen. Daher bitten wir um deine Unterstützung und bedanken uns herzlichst für dein Vertrauen!
.
Wir haben für LEiWAND – European Trail Wear klare Zukunftspläne. Unsere Produkte werden weiterhin für Trail Mountainbiker und für unterschiedliche Wetterbedingungen beim Biken auf den Trails entwickelt. Dabei folgen wir hohen Ansprüche um dir aus der Kombination von Funktionalität, Qualitätsmaterialen und einer schönen Designsprache premium Produkte anzubieten. Hierbei werden wir auch innovative Materialien und Stoffmischungen testen. Unsere Produkte werden wir weiterhin zu 100% in Europa fertigen und ausschließlich über Direktvertrieb anbieten. Hierdurch bieten wir dir europäische Produkte, mit fairen sozialen und ökologischen Bedingungen, zu günstigen Preisen und einem top Preis-/Leistungsverhältnis.
.
Bitte unterstütze uns bei der Realisierung unseres Projekts mit einem finanziellen Beitrag. Dies ist die Voraussetzung, damit LEiWAND – European Trail Wear umgesetzt wird. Bitte erzähle von LEiWAND deiner Familie, deinen Freunden und allen die sich für unser Projekt interessieren. Du kannst uns über diese Kanäle folgen:

    Auf Kickstarter kann man ein Projekt nur mit einem Reward unterstützen. Möchtest du uns öfters unterstützen, so benötigst du mehrere Accounts. Nach erfolgreicher Kampagne nutzen wir das spezialisiertes After-Campaign-Management Tool CrowdOx, indem wir die Abwicklung der Rewards durchführen. Wir möchten die Abwicklung der Rewards bis spätestens zum 15.01.2018 durchführen und den Produktionsplan an unseren Produktionspartner übermitteln. Bei CrowdOx hast du auch die Möglichkeit, weitere Produkte zu ordern.
.
.
.
.
.
.
The moment after a downhill with your friends on your hometrails and you think: AWESOME! In Vienna we have a special word for this feeling: LEIWAND! For us there is nothing better than biking from the city center of Vienna to the local mountains to enjoy time with our friends on our hometrails. Naturally with a Kracherl, coffee, beer and Spritzwein. We are mountain bikers from Vienna and we have an aim: Offer European premium sportswear at fair prices for trail mountain bikers who demand high quality.  

What makes LEiWAND special? It is the combination of three characteristics!

100% Premium // Functionality & Quality materials & Design  
100% Europe // Fair products Made in Europe  
100% Direct sales // Fair prices with a top price-/performance ratio 
Our team consists of passionate mountain bikers. We have deep and long working experience in the areas of functional sportswear design, graphics, management, marketing and photography. All of us live, work and bike in and around Vienna!  

LEiWAND – European Trail Wear has a clear vision for a sustainable development. For starting the production, we need just one more thing: Your support! Starting the production? Yes, our products are completely developed and tested. We can start with the production of the first 600 products immediately after the campaign with our production partner Kirpte Sportswear. Your financial support will be used 1:1 for the final production of your products! Thank you very much for your support!
.

For whom is LEiWAND made?  
Trail Mountainbiker! Also known as All-Mountain or Enduro-Biker. So everybody who pedals up his bike and rocks on singletrails to the bottom of the mountain. We define the “borderline” at Cross-Country and Downhill riding, as we focus our product development on trail mountainbiking. LEiWAND offers you European premium sportswear for trail mountain bikers at fair prices.

100% Premium: Functionality & Quality Materials & Design   
Premium means for us the combination of three characteristics. First, a functional design that supports you optimally at the up- and downhill. Second, European quality materials, which meet the different requirements of trail mountainbiking. Third, a colorful, discreet design that makes fun.  

100% Europe: Fair products Made in Europe  
LEiWAND products are 100% European. Product development comes from Vienna. The main materials come from Italy, accessories from all over Europe. The production lies with our partner Kirpte in Lithuania. All our partners and suppliers are specialized in sportswear and have long lasting experience in this area. You can find them in the chapter “The LEiWAND Network”. Thereby, we want to support fair social and ecological conditions and make a positive statement for the European sportswear industry throughout the entire supply chain.  

100% Direct sales: Fair prices with a top price-/performance ratio LEiWAND products should be affordable for as many mountain bikers as possible. After you buy our products you should state, „Great, price and performance match!“ Therefore, we use a purely direct sales model. After a successful campaign our products will be available only through our own online-shop (www.leiwandwear.eu). Thereby, we can partially save on the dealer margin and offer you European premium products at fair prices. Please support us on Kickstarter, so that we can start the production of our first product range.
.

  Our first collection offers the basic equipment of a trail mountain biker: Shirt, Longsleeve and Short. The different movements during trail mountain biking are the basis of product development. Hereby, we combine the requirements of the motion-intensive downhill on singletrails and the exhausting uphill by pedalling up the mountain. The two tops have four colour options each, the short has two colour options. All products are available in four sizes from Small to XLarge.



Our first products are made for warmer temperatures starting around 18 to 20 degrees. Sizes and cut are unisex, based on men’s sizes. In the product description below you find information in more detail. Our first collection is ready for production and the first 600 pieces will be produced immediately after the campaign and will be shipped to you within a very short period. For more information regarding the production plan see the chapter on “Project status: Ready for production”.
.
  .
FUNCTIONALITY
Shirt and Longsleeve have a bike specific cut with an extended back part and enough free moving space in the shoulder area. The products have a casual fit with a form-fitting cut. At LEiWAND we pay attention to functional details for trail bikers. For a clear view through your glasses, we added a glass wipe into the tops. The Longsleeve offers enough place and flexibility to wear elbow protections underneath.  

MATERIAL
The special Shirt and Longsleeve material is out of polyester and elastane. It is light, comfortable to wear, highly breathable and fast drying. Ideal for a sweaty uphill in warmer conditions. The elastane in the 4-Way-Stretch material guarantees optimal free moving space and flexibility. The high abrasion resistance offers to prevent damage from wearing a backpack or Velcro strips, also in case of unwanted descents off the bike with a manageable amount of force ;)  

DESIGN
The design is contemporary, the colours are clear with special design accents in contrast colours, so that wearing the tops on the trail and in the city is fun. The four colour variants of the products start from an optimistic orange, to clear and relaxed shades of blue and a discreet, stylish black. The products have four unisex sizes from Small to XLarge.  
.


FUNCTIONALITY
The shorts have a casual fit and are designed for the requirements and movements of trail mountain biking. The back waistband is higher and offers protection against a bare back during pedalling up the mountain. The front inseam is shorter, so that you do not catch the saddle during riding. With the waist adjustment, you can fit the short perfectly to your body. The knee is preformed and offers enough space for knee protectors. We also focused on the shorts length and inner width that is a plus for riding with knee protectors. Two open pockets offer you the possibility to insert something quickly. For a safe pocketing during your ride, there are two zip-pockets. A smaller one is next to the left open pocket and offers you place for cards or your keys. On the right thigh is the larger zip-pocket for more space demand, with an extra inner pocket for your smartphone. This zip-pocket is designed not to disturb your free movement at the knee area while riding.  

MATERIAL
The shorts’ material is for warmer temperatures. The fabric has a high wearing comfort, is light, breathable and fast drying. The 4-Way-Stretch of the material offers you high flexibility. The shorts make every move and offer high abrasion resistance. Through the seam guide, we enable an optimized ratio between flexibility and stability. Thereby, the shorts support you during the motion-intensive downhill on the trail and on carrying passages with high steps and sidesteps.  

DESIGN
The design of the shorts is clean and equipped with functional details. You can choose between two colours, an urban blue and a stylish black, and between four sizes from Small to XLarge. 
.

  .
Measurements:  
Chest: Horizontal at the highest point of the chest  
Belt line: Horizontal at lower waist 
Hip: Loose and horizontal at the broades point oft he hip
.

We want to develop a cycling community to share and promote an healthier way of life, friendship, respect for others and enjoy the nature.
We want to realize this by organizing biweekly group rides , monthly excursion in Belgium and annually international trips. We also provide technical support, training coaching and on the way assistance.
Our group rides never leave someone behind and the excuriosn are always merged with visits to museums or hysterical places.
We want to people excited and hungry of closing their laptops to join us on the road and feel free. This should be their way to remove all the stress and feel happy

Welcome to SCI-FI ART: SERIES DELTA! This is a Sci-Fi themed Art Pack of High-Resolution 300dpi PNG Items & Objects for Game Masters, Players, and Art Enthusiasts to use in RPG's, Maps, and Tabletop Gaming.
Why Sci-Fi? I chose to go with Sci-Fi for this art series because growing up I was a huge Cyberpunk 2020 player & fan, and the timing couldn't be better! I must admit, nostalgia definitely had an influence on my decision to go with a Sci-Fi theme ... know what I'm sayin' chombatta?
What Do You Get? Here are some more details about what you get:
200 High-Resolution Sci-Fi-Themed Digital Images
All images are 300dpi and will be in .PNG format
All images are in individual files (except for those in a pre-made scene)
All images have Transparent Backgrounds for Easy Use
All images are Organized into Folders for Easy Access
Images will be delivered via digital download (I'll send you a link)
Images will be a mix of views like top-down, side, front, and angled views
Both Personal & Commercial Use Licenses pledge levels are available
All Rewards & Stretch Goals will be 100% Delivered in December 2020
A little bit about me: I've been playing RPG's, CCG's and tabletop games since the early 90's. I got into digital art and graphic design several years ago and I've since discovered that creating art others enjoy using for gaming gives me great satisfaction and happiness.
Funds raised will go towards additional 3D Programs & Models. This is my third set in the Sci-Fi Series and I hope to be able to complete more sets in the future. 
Art Examples below are a sampling of the actual pieces you will get ... If you have a specific request to see more please let me know and I will add them here throughout the campaign ... ENJOY and THANK YOU for checking it out!


Thanks again for taking a look! If I can answer any questions or you'd like more details on something please let me know. ~ Phil

Our goal is to establish a brand built on inclusivity and body-positivity made for cosplayers who want to save time and money on body paint, and fashionistas of all sizes looking for more color options. We are LGBTQIA+ and POC owned and we are looking to provide for and feature members of our respective communities. We plan to startWe can't wait to be a positive staple in the cosplay and fashion communities! 
Arm Socks are a full coverage shirt-glove combo made of tights and are used as a substitute for body paint. They are often preferred by cosplayers and theater costumers for quick-change capabilities and for the fact that they look more realistic than a morph suit. Unlike gloves, they don't slide down, and they come with nails for a natural appearance.
Our Arm Socks are unlike any other, we have invisible zippers in our wrists! Perfect for eating and quickly answering your phone. Not to mention, we make Toe Socks to match, so open-toed shoes are no longer an issue when it comes to the illusion of body paint! We plan to custom-dye tights ranging in sizes XS - 8XL and provide colors that match fan-favorite characters and body-paints. Perfect for cosplay, drag, street-fashion, and more! Our initial range of colors will be Snow White, Sakura Pink, Alternia Grey, Lunar Blue, and Wisteria Purple. If we reach our stretch goal of $3500, we'll add Wasabi Green
This is your only opportunity to get one of our products before we launch our online store in late Fall! Help us out by picking a reward for your pledge!
A 3" Kickstarter Exclusive K Socks Sticker with a hand-written thank you note on the back. Featuring creators Koala and Kinetic, art by Danekez (who also did all our cute icons!)
A pair of custom dyed tights in any size from XXS-8X as well as a sticker thank you note. We'll send a Google Form via email to get details on your size and color preference!
Arm Socks with one zipper and nails as well as a sticker thank you note. We'll send a Google Form via email to get details on your size and color preference!
Maybe you're just here for toes! Get these with nails as well as a sticker thank you note. We'll send a Google Form via email to get details on your size and color preference!
A $20 Arm Sock discount applies when it comes with matching Toes! The best deal of them all and perfect for full body coverage! Both include nails, the arm socks have a zipper, and your package will also include a sticker thank you note. We'll send a Google Form via email to get details on your size and color preference!
Ordering Multiples
To pre-order multiple items, add the amount from that pledge to your base pledge and we will contact you later for those add-ons! For example, for a pair of arm socks and a plain pair of tights, pledge to the arm sock goal and add an extra $15! Or to add an extra zipper, add an extra $15 as well!
We made this Kickstarter to raise money for our shop launch, however if you'd like to help but are unable to contribute, feel free to share this page and let others know who would be interested! We are so excited to get up and running and we can use all the help we can get! Thank you so much for visiting this page!
-Koala and Kinetic

Your band has joined the biggest tour in HELL!
You've got to keep the crowds of demons and the damned entertained with the music spawned from Hell - METAL! Collect PICKS to overcome encounters as the PROMOTER (GM) guides you on your descent. Will your tour make it to the end or will the MARKS of the DEVIL destroy you?!
THROWING HORNS is a Lite RPG of devils, demons, and metal. You play a literal band of demons touring the best and worst venues in Hell. The Promoter (aka the GM) will guide you on the tour and throw encounters in your path which you can overcome in the most METAL ways possible. Use head-banging tunes, your demonic commanding presence, or just good ole fashioned violence to beat encounters and continue.
This is B&W zine style RPG. 26 pages of art and simple rules using a roll and keep system. You only need a few six sided dice and some friends! Easy to play but does require a bit of up front RPG knowledge. Play time is roughly an hour.

I wanted to use the artwork from my EP Strix on a vest top that I could wear at live shows, it's eye catching and shows my brand without having a name sprawled across it. I thought it'd be cool if maybe other people wanted them too, and to my surprise they did! After posting an image online of me wearing mine which was printed at a local printing shop as a one off, not great quality, I had lots of responses of people expressing an interest in wanting one of their own.
I never thought I would get to the point where people would want to buy MY shirts... that's crazy! So to say thanks I will repay you in high quality, super unique apparel !

Imagine 100 square blocks with 15 teams in that zone. 2 people in each vehicle, 1 driver, 1 navigator. Then you play hide and seek, just that simple.
 I am raising the funds for 3 parts.
 The first is the APP for the smart phones. This is a little complicated but not impossible.
 The second is for the web site so that the game can be monitored from a computer. 
 The third is for a new laptop to monitor the games.
 Each game will last about 2.5 hrs, there is a fee to participate. However the game runs on a point system so there are prizes for first, second and third place.
 There is nothing like it in the world so I can not give away any more info on the details.  I have talked to numerous people here in Lethbridge about this idea and about 80% say they like it and would try it, 10%-15% say the would not, and about 5%-10% think it is a foolish idea. With numbers like that any business can be successful.

The Current Sessions is a new contemporary dance series which showcases works-in-progress from emerging choreographers in their twenties.
The Current Sessions was conceived in July 2011 to bring like-minded contemporary choreographers together and present work that is in-the-moment and reflective of our current state of mind and process. To this end, all works are created and presented within a time period of six weeks. We are interested in producing detailed works that are fresh, raw, experimental and curious; we want to provide our audience with a glimpse of what dance is right now, and with what dance will be in its future state.
The founding choreographers of The Current Sessions are Genna Baroni, Allison Jones, Yarden Raz, Jonathan Windham, Yin Yue and Alexis Convento. We are all conservatory-trained graduates of schools including SUNY Purchase, Ailey/Fordham, NYU and UArts, and currently dance with companies such as Gallim Dance, Shannon Gillen & Guests and the Metropolitan Opera Ballet, among others. We all have the desire to develop our own voices as choreographers in a comfortable environment where spontaneity, openness and the instinctive nature of creation are valued.
This edition of The Current Sessions will include work from the "originals" Alexis Convento, Yin Yue, Jonathan Royse Windham, Allison Jones and Genna Baroni, as well as, a new slew of like-minded individuals such as: Jenna Otter, Jordan Isadore, Benny Royce Royon, and MADboots dance/Jonathan Campbell... how exciting!
Your help can lead us to SUCCESS for this edition of the Current Sessions, and for the many more to come!
Performance Details: Monday/Tuesday November 28th & 29th, 2011 at 8pm at the Wild Project, 195 East 3rd Street, New York, NY 10009; p. 212.228.1195.
Tickets: https://web.ovationtix.com/trs/pr/885825  or 212.352.3101
More Information: www.thecurrentsessions.com

When I was growing up, decorating the Christmas tree consisted of stringing popcorn and cranberries each year to be hung on the christmas tree. Along with these, were the intricately decorated ornaments, made by my grandmother and great-grandmother, that had been passed down to my mother. These ornaments had history and a special meaning to them. We still hang these ornaments, that are carefully packed away each year, and I share their history with my children. I want to bring back the special ornaments, hanging on the tree, and the tradition that comes with them.
I love to make ceramic and porcelian ornaments, where I pour the slip into the mold. Clean and hand paint each one and then fire them in a kiln, creating a finished piece of artwork. Each piece is slightly different from the other and can be personalized for the buyer.
I have been making ceramic items since I was 12 years old (35 yrs) and made porcelian dolls, later into my adult life. I wish to return to this artistic endeavor, now that I am on permanent disability. I would feel honored to create an item that is cherished by a family and passed down to future generations.
In order to be able to pursue this, I would require the materials and equipment. This includes a kiln, ceramic and porcelian slip and molds. Paints, brushes, pouring tables, drying rack, painting and finishing furniture. Glass pieces and firing stands as well as the miscellaneous equipment to complete these projects. I am asking for your backing on this endeavor and hope I will be able to provide people with cherished items.

Movie synopsis
English
The sister is a movie where you will find love, betrayal, revenge and a great focus on a virus that could kill the human race.
The film focuses on the personal life of FBI Special Agent Fernanda Urriaga. She is a young woman who entered the FBI to find the culprit of her parent’s death and find her lost sister.
When she was a baby, her parents, who were doctors of the CDC, died more than 20 years ago at the hands of the Russian Mafia when they discovered the cure for a lethal virus.
The cure was never given to hospitals or clinics, the Russian mafia stopped them in order to kill the population of the United States.
20 years ago the CDC was able to control and isolate the virus but now the life of the entire population is in the hands of the sisters.
Do not miss this movie and join us to discover the secrets of the Urriaga family.

La película se enfoca en la vida personal de La Agente Especial del FBI Fernanda Urriaga, ella es una Joven que entró al FBI para encontrar al culpable de la muerte de sus padres y encontrar a su hermana perdida.
Cuando ella era una bebé sus padres quienes eran doctores del CDC murieron hace más de 20 años por manos de la Mafia Rusa, al descubrir la cura de un virus letal.
La cura jamás fue entregada a los hospitales ni a las clínicas, la Mafia Rusa los detuvo para poder acabar con la población de los Estados Unidos.
Hace 20 años el CDC pudo controlar y aislar el virus pero ahora la vida de toda la población está en las manos de las hermanas.
No te pierdas esta película y acompáñanos a descubrir los secretos de la familia Urriaga.

Only in recent years has it been possible for independent filmmakers to distribute movies online and hope to reach a wide audience. Likewise online crowd-funding to make those films in the first place is also something new that is changing independent film-making entirely. We've also updated the working title from 'Hope is Our Sanity' to the simpler title of 'Ellie'.
This particular kickstarter is for the Irish indie feature film 'Ellie' which was just a logline in a word document several months ago but since then the script has been developed, drafted and re-drafted and re-drafted again. We also held auditions in December in which we cast the five main roles to five brilliant actors and we've also been putting together a talented crew to help bring this film to life! So what's different about this film and this filmmaking group?
We are a young multinational independent film group that will be offering feature films for low-prices in high quantity.
This is an Irish film that appeals in many ways to young adults of modern Ireland
10-15% of what is made from distribution of this movie in spring 2016 will be given to charity and we plan in the long-term to develop in to an intrinsically altruistic movie production company
Of course I'll be funding this film project as much as I possibly can myself but there's only so much that we can afford so far in terms of equipment, set design and the likes. There are many other costly expenses to factor in such as insurance and editing costs. With a successful kickstarter campaign we will be able to complete this film far more effectively and produce a better product for viewers to enjoy afterwards. Here's how funds would be distributed; 
Most of the funding would go towards equipment. We'd focus such funds on improving sound equipment, lighting & upgrading our tripod as well as maximizing filming efficiency by purchasing more SD cards to assure more memory. 
It's important to note that when you make a 'pledge' no money goes through until (and if) the kickstarter succeeds, hence the term pledge. Finally when the film is available for online distribution in Spring of next year, we will be selling it for quite a low price (of about €2 - €3) and we will also probably offer a rental choice that will be even less in cost to offer some variation & choice for each viewer.
*Disclaimer; Pie-chart distribution may be subject to variations if certain expenses become higher than expected. Also in regards to the promotion of media projects in exchange for funding listed under the 'pledge €10' section, any projects which incite discrimination or promotes violence will not be considered. Finally for sending rewards such as the clapperboard reward included in the €500 pledge, posting costs will be paid by us although travel expenses cannot be covered to come to the private screening or come on set as listed in some of the pledges.

ABOUT THE PROJECT
Last fall I was honored to be approached by Lynn Nachbar from The Edge Center for the Arts and invited to have a solo exhibition at The Edge gallery. 
The Edge Center for the Arts
The solo exhibition is an important step in any artist's professional development and artistic career. I'm excited to have this opportunity to reach a new audience and show an extensive selection of my work from the past four+ years in such a beautiful gallery. The size of the gallery and scope of the show, however, make the endeavor financially daunting.
I'll need 30-40 framed pieces to mount a satisfactory show in this space. I've already created the work. Now I need to pay to print and frame the majority of these pieces. 
This shows the layout and size of the gallery:
Gallery Layout & Dimensions
My $3,000 project goal will provide $100/piece for 30 pieces. This is a modest amount but will still be enormously helpful.
Making my stretch goal of $5,000 will allow me to produce additional pieces, travel costs to deliver the work and attend the opening reception, and pay the artist.
The following slideshow gives a better sense of the bodies of work and individual pieces I hope to include in the show. These are also the images available for reward selections. Once the project is funded, I'll send backers a link to access an online gallery for better viewing/selection.
To see more of my work or learn more about me, please visit my website: www.terrarathai.com or check out my photo blog: avantgarden365. The blog is where I got my start exploring photography. It's also the best place to see a diverse selection of my pictures and read a bit of my writing, too.  While the blog has been in hibernation of late, I'll be breathing new life into it in the near future. If you like what you see, please subscribe to receive future updates.
Thanks for taking the time to check out my project.

We're living the dream - for hula dancers, that is! We have been invited by our Hawaiian kumu (teacher) Lani Girl Kaleiki-Ahlo to be a part of the opening night performance at the 2014 Merrie Monarch Festival. Folks in the hula community consider this event the "Olympics" of hula. Even though we're not competing, just stepping on that stage to perform is enough to give us major butterflies! We've been practicing our dances, learning to chant in Hawaiian, making costumes, and convincing our spouses and families it really is a good idea!
Now we are looking for funding to help us on our way. The money we raise will pay for new costumes, live musicians, and fresh floral lei and hairpieces.

She&Her Productions: "Making Artistic Dreams Come True". This is a new theatre production company dedicated to inspiring and pushing the envelope. She&Her Productions bring artist of all mediums together producing in unusual artistic locations. Yes, there are many theater companies in Kansas City but we offer something different. We are a theater company that wants to provide added enticement and uniqueness to our patrons.
Our new home is the Crane Building located in the West Bottoms, which adds even more to the personality of our Theatre company. The space is amazing! However, not a traditional theatre.. yet! So we need your help by pledging a buck or two our way to help us renovate and rejuvenate this old building!
Each production we do will have some type of artist collaborations. All aspects of the arts will be defined, if not explored. We want to not only provide our patrons with an excellent theater show, but a cultivated evening of all the artistic medias. There will always be refreshments after each show free of charge which is an added bonus compared to sold items at intermission like other theaters in and around Kansas City.
Our big difference that we will bring to our patrons is the ticket prices. We want everyone in the community to be able to see great theater and become apart of the huge arts community that Kansas city has to offer, not only the people who can afford to pay top dollar for ticket prices. Our tickets are discounted for adults compared to other theater companies and even more of a discount for students.
We have an extremely exciting line up for the rest of the 2010 year! Plan on marking your calendars to see our Fall musical, October 15, 16, 18, 22, 23 and 24th. We will be ending 2010 with a holiday comedy by Jeff Goode; The Eight: Reindeer Monologues!
We are planing a HUGE New Years event at the new space with lots of entertainment and festivities!!!
All that being said, we would be extremely grateful for any cash donation to get our theater company up and running. Thank you for your time and hopefully you agree with our vision and hopes for the future of theatre in Kansas City.

If the dime store is a metaphor for the everyday, the ordinary, the well-known neighborhood, or the well-worn path, then Dime Store Red is the anti-routine and the rejection of following suit.  But the immersive exhibit is more tangible than it is conceptual, something best understood and seen at scale.  We are Dime Store Red. We are an immersive installation show. Think massive spaces, assembled structures built from the ground up, and space to meander. We are far from the boundaries of your conventional gallery walls. We want to bring the viewer into, around, and through art. Dime Store Red will offer an immersive experience, emphasized through smart, cohesive design, involving highly interactive installations. We want to invite people into a space where there is freedom to feel, think, and process.  We have a passion for redefining boundaries in how people interact within a curated space. We want to design, play, and then push past those boundaries using color, shape, space, and light. We are Dime Store Red. A vibrant residency pop-up experience that pushes past what is expected.  




Juliana “JULU” Lupacchino. Born and Raised in Savannah, Ga. Juliana earned her degree in Fibers from the Savannah College of Art and Design in 2017. She is now a full time freelance artist. Her passion within the arts lies in color, and the infinite ways colors react. Her brand JULU, cultivates the idea that JULU can be a verb, noun, or adjective. JULU is a word that celebrates color, design, and people. Her iconic JULU pattern has been covered items from public walls, stairwells, and shipping containers, to more utilitarian items such as upholstery furniture, roller blades, and pillows.  Anything can be JULU'ed, if the passion and excitement is there. 
William “WILLKES” Kesling. Born and Raised in LaPorte, Indiana. William earned his degree in Graphic design from the Savannah College of Art and Design in 2016. William is a dynamic digital and sound artist that forayed into visual arts first through his conceptual photography. William is passionate about collaborative projects, especially in the fields of music and film. He is passionate about design in a multitude of ways, ranging from digital design, to exploring work that can be tangible. 




For an audience, art is about fluid boundaries, interaction and perception, and even self-fulfillment. For the artist, it is dually an intensely personal statement and a study on something bigger than the self. Dime Store Red is an immersive installation experience that amplifies interpretations on both.
Four years in the making, Dime Store Red is the creative undertaking of Juliana “JULU” Lupacchino and William “WILLKES” Kesling, two emerging artists in Savannah, Georgia. Juliana and William met in school at SCAD and began dreaming and creating, culminating most recently in an early 2019 mixed media collaboration. JULU is known for painting beloved large scale lilting patterns, while WILLKES is a dynamic digital and sound artist that forayed into visual arts first through his conceptual photography. As the two assess their post-college life and trajectory, Dime Store Red is the groundswell culmination of their tandem creative energy and motivations for the road ahead.
With consumable art aplenty in Savannah, the artists wanted to bring a different experience about, something that would push boundaries: for viewership and interacting with a space, for interpreting next-scale art, for art accessibility for all, and for the inherent self-imposed creative limitations we all face down.
But it turns out that funding the collaborative planning, build-out, and dressing of four large, colorful, mixed-media, multi-dimensional spaces is its own unique challenge. The artists began with the intention of self-funding the show, which runs for 9 days from November 14 to 22. But as it has grown with their imagination and commitment to the unrestrained, so too have the costs. JULU and WILLKES are now gratefully leaning on the people to help crowdfund Dime Store Red and giving everyday people the chance to be part of something beyond.




The pop-up residency consists of sculpture, paint, mixed media, photography, multimedia, adorned ephemera, and a 1000 square foot pop-up installation that sits at the backside of a 22,000 square foot warehouse on Savannah’s westside—a corner of Savannah that doesn’t see many art installations. The warehouse is located directly behind Southbound Brewery, and is less than a five minute drive from the heart of downtown Savannah. The location itself plays a key role in the impact Dime Store Red hopes to infuse into Savannah.  Dime Store Red is the artists’ commitment to creating and sharing art in unrestrained ways.




Jules and Will here. Two artists that like to make things - really crazy things - things that are tangible, massive, and unexpected. We like to bounce ideas for hours, and we don't like to say no to what can be created.  Not only do we want to explore our creativity as much as possible, but we believe anyone can be creative, and we want to push that inside others. We want to build things, and inspire people to do the same. We are doing that through moonshot projects- like Dime Store Red. 
You could call us crazy. We feel like we are a little of that too. And that's 100% a win. 
But we are also passionate creative thinkers, who obsess over saying yes to what can be thought up and created. 



We celebrate dynamic design, adventurous color, and rebellious spirit through experience driven and thought provoking work. We aim to creatively express ourselves through large-scale tangible work. Our passion is to explore with audacity, play with risks, and explore and re-define boundaries. Our hope is that our work inspires, both through the feelings we stir, and the reactions that take place.








The installation will consist of sculpture, paint, mixed media, photography, multimedia, adorned ephemera, and a 1000 square foot pop-up installation that sits at the backside of a 22,000 square foot warehouse. Our attention to intention, is a driving force behind the entire experience of the show. Consider your first glance at the warehouse as the beginning of the experience.  The installation itself will be placed intentionally in the back of the warehouse. The viewer will walk through the warehouse and eventually reach the installation.  Once the viewer has entered the installation, they will be able to walk through three rooms. Each room revolving around it's own concept and design. We are submerging people into one experience after another.

SONS AND DAUGHTERS OF THE EARTH is the story of the rise and fall of Los Angeles based cult, The Sons and Daughters of The Earth, as told to a reporter by the cult’s last surviving member, Avonaco, from his hospital bed. It is a novella made up of fifteen tracks, which will be released as an audiobook with an original score.
Along with its digital release, SONS AND DAUGHTERS OF THE EARTH will be put out as a limited number of CDs that will include the full text of the book and original artwork, as well as being put on as a live multimedia performance with reading, music, and visuals on a west coast tour.
Once raised, the $2,000 will go toward paying musicians, recording/production costs, and a small portion of expenses for the west coast reading tour.
WEST COST TOUR: San Diego, Ca. / Los Angeles, Ca. / Monterey, Ca. / San Francisco, Ca. / Sacramento, Ca. / Eugene, Or. / Portland, Or. / Tacoma, Wa. / Seattle, Wa.

Keep checking back for updates. At each $500 mark an additional track of SONS AND DAUGHTERS OF THE EARTH will be added so you can watch as the story unfolds.
SONS & DAUGHTERS OF THE EARTH, Track 1. Full text as heard in video:
"Partially hidden away on a residential street in Echo Park in California, nestled behind another home at an unnamed ½ address on Lake Shore Ave., at the bottom of a steeply graded empty lot where coyotes graze at night, there is a house growing from the side of a giant avocado tree. And in this tree house there once lived the “cult”—though more accurately described as a family—known as The Sons and Daughters of The Earth. They were a mix-up of 100 different species at least, consisting of the basics, such as your dogs, your cats, your turtles, your squirrels, your birds, etc., along with the more exotic types, such as your lions, your sex panthers(they do exist), your monkeys, your koalas, a single wolf that was said to be domesticated, and they were all men and women too(save for that bastard wolf) who lived together as a family until just two weeks ago to the day when they met their bizarre and untimely deaths.
"The house is no longer occupied by anything representative of a family. Those who have heard rumors of the demise of The Sons and Daughters of The Earth and have ventured into the neighborhood to attempt a glance at the place where they once lived have failed terribly at this because they cannot get through. The property is sanctioned off by investigators who at this moment still haunt the grounds, looking through every nook and cranny of the home in search of some sort of tangible clue as to why, some sort of logical explanation for their extraordinary rise and sudden fall.
"There is only one surviving member of the cult, a small man with pale skin and olive-toned features who is widely associated with a lean bear cub. He has agreed to talk to me, giving me exclusive rights to the story of The Sons and Daughters of The Earth, under the sole condition that the names of all Sons and all Daughters be changed. He will be referred to here under the assumed name of “Avonaco.”
"From the hospital bed where Avonaco lays with his cheeks sunken in and bags under his eyes, bandages running the length of each forearm—spotted in places with drops of dried blood, the red seeming all the darker in contrast to the sterile bandages, his white cotton hospital gown, and the spectacularly white surroundings of the hospital itself—he recounts to me in full the story that will soon be paraphrased. I sit across from him in a wicker chair that looks as though it were out of a WWII mental ward, and I listen intently with one leg crossed over the other as my little recording device sits on the end table beside me.
"The hospital staff has been kind enough to allow me several extended visits to Avonaco in this fashion. I would like to take the time to thank them all now for their endless discretion and hospitality(excuse me), especially D., who provides countless cups of tea which she serves to us on a charming silver tray without saying so much as a single word while my interviews are in session.
"The windows are always pushed open in the hospital room. Outside there is always a warm breeze blowing eerily through palm leaves. Due to the mental state of the patient in question—whose glazed eyes give away that he is obviously still in shock—and the maddening sound of the rustling palm leaves, it is likely that his tale is woven with exaggerations, distortions, and perhaps even the occasional outright falsehood, creating something closer to a caricature of the cult, rather than a snapshot.
"It is not my responsibility to discover the actuality of any mentioned occurrences—leave that to the baffled investigators; it is only my responsibility to record the truth as it is told to me through poor, mangled Avonaco and as history will come to recognize it. No matter with what amount of certainty I have in the truthfulness of these occurrences I am to record, I share them with a clear conscience because they will always and forever—as everything is, regardless—be open to speculation."
Thank you everyone for your support.
Enjoy,
Benjamin Font

Illustrator Wil Brendel

The Epiphany Rover will be an innovative vehicle designed and manufactured with the intent of competing in the NASA Human Exploration Rover Challenge. The ambitions of this design will be to create a rover which will carry two riders and overcome the harsh terrain, and environment of an extraterrestrial environment. The Epiphany Rover is designed to be as light as possible due to the cost of transporting items off our planet. This will be accomplished by using carbon fiber throughout much of the structure and also in as many components as possible. The rover will consist of a three wheel design, a unique inboard suspension, and a drive train using internal gear hub systems. The wheels used on the rover will also be a unique design. They will be non-pneumatic, and consist of non-commercial specialized polymers to create a tread that will propel the Epiphany across NASA's course. The Epiphany’s wheels will be constructed from carbon fiber and will use clever engineering to allow for the wheels themselves to be modular.
     As part of the parameters for NASA's competition the rover itself will also need to fit into a 5 foot cubic box, which will require some creative ingenuity to design a method for the rover to fold into a storage configuration. The suspension will be completely independent and will be adaptable to the terrain through driver controls. This will allow for the Epiphany to succeed throughout a wide range of the terrain challenges presented by NASA. 
Overall the design of the Epiphany rover will allow for a faster, lighter, and more dependable vehicle to move two riders across a wide range of terrains no matter what planet it is tested on.

Out of the millions of people we currently have in our country, less than 1% of those individuals serve in the United States military. With that being said, our military is not a vastly large community. However, within this community, there is a melting pot of extraordinary individuals. Troop Life's mission is to bring these individuals even closer together by providing an outlet only they will understand. Serving our country is a difficult enough task, connecting with one another should not be! Troop Life will afford members a place to interact with people just like them. People who face the same challenges, experience the same triumphs, and share a similar bond through our band of brothers and sisters in arms. Too often times you find yourself with questions or comments that your civilian friends and family just can't relate to. When it's time to relocate every few years, service members face an immense amount of uncertainty, nervousness, and even anxiety. How amazing would it be to have an avenue to ease some of the angst that accompanies these very issues! This community will allow members to reach out and establish the much needed connections anywhere in the world. Have questions about the best schools in the area for your children? Ask Troop Life! Interested in what entertainment and leisure your new surrounding will have to offer? We can answer that too! Real people, with realistic views and opinions as it relates to military expectations. Like minded people with like minded dispositions. This is not however just a question and answer forum. Much like the more renown social media outlets, Troop Life will be a place to connect in every way available. Members will have the opportunity to create an in depth profile outlining their location, branch of service, duty position, interest and hobbies, photos and video posts, and much more! This will allow users to easily identify individuals who are in their area or an area they may be relocating to, and associate themselves with those of similar interest with just a few clicks. Just think of Troop Life as the medium designed exclusively for our nations armed forces!

Hello we are Lucia and Konstantina, we are independent choreographers and the founders and producers of the Kaleidoscopic Arts Platform.
Kaleidoscopic Arts Platform is a London-based performance event that celebrates and promotes contemporary dance works by female choreographers. We have so far produced three successful events in London where we have brought dance performance to unconventional spaces for dance, for example a former factory space and a typical East London pub. We have invested our own money and have won the Ideas Tap Innovators Fund for start up businesses in the arts.
We are thrilled to now introduce you to the 4th Kaleidoscopic Arts Platform as part of the Wandsworth Fringe Festival 2017. It will take place on the 19th of May, this time at Wilditch Community Centre, a typical community hall and we aim to make dance performance accessible to the local community of Wandsworth.
This time round, we will be showcasing work by Helen Cox, Jayne Port, Lucidez Dance and Feet Off The Ground Dance. We will also be exhibiting a photography exhibition curated and co-created by Elisabeth Schilling.
It is our mission to support emerging female choreographers in making and promoting their work as well as making it accessible to a diverse audience. We respond in this way to the issue that the current UK contemporary dance scene is dominated, not in quality and quantity, but in publicity and popularity, by male choreographers.
Taking place in spaces not usually intended for dance we bring contemporary dance closer to audiences who are new to dance. A post performance discussion enables the audience to gain an insight into the creative process and the artists to get valuable feedback on their works.
We have been awarded with £2,000 from Wandsworth Arts Council which cover part of the production costs. We now need your help to cover the remaining costs. Your money will allow us pay the artists a fair fee and most importantly it will enable us to tap into further funding so we can continue our work in the long term. The more money we can fundraise through this crowdfunder, the more we will be able to tap into and the better we can support choreographers!
Producing a live performance is very expensive, because it includes paying many hours of rehearsal space, collaborators, music, costumes, and fair fees for your dancers. It is very important to us to be able to pay our artists because non-paid work is a real issue in the dance industry. You can help us make this possible, by making a contribution to this project. To thank you for your contribution, we have have thought up some lovely rewards, which you can see below. Go on, have a read and take your pick!
Making a donation only takes a few minutes. And remember to share our campaign via email and social media! Thank you very, very much for supporting us!

The Flutter of an Eyelid  is a vicious, and often quite funny, satire of Southern California's bohemian community in the 1920s by Jewish-American novelist Myron Brinig (1896–1991). The original edition, published in 1933 and out of print since, was illustrated by Lynd Ward (1905–1985), widely regarded as the "father of the graphic novel." I received permission from Ward's estate to reproduce the 38 woodcut illustrations in this new edition. The original edition of the book is very rare and, as of this writing, the only copy available for sale online is going for $649.99.
Some of the novel's characters are loosely based on prominent residents of the Los Angeles neighborhood of Echo Park, an early center of film-making on the West Coast. These include the rare book dealer Jake Zeitlin (1902–1987), whose shop became a gathering place for local writers and artists, and who introduced Brinig to his circle of friends; and the charismatic evangelist and media celebrity Aimee Semple McPherson (1890–1944). 
Zeitlin, who was caricatured as a self-loathing Jewish antique dealer in the novel, considered the book an "insulting betrayal" and, after seeing an early set of galleys, threatened to sue. He succeeded in having some of its more offensive anti-Semitic passages removed prior to its publication. Jewish himself, Brinig was no anti-Semite; he and Zeitlin simply did not get along. One source reports that shortly after the book was released, it was pulled from stores because of further legal threats from McPherson and some of the other individuals who were too "thinly disguised" in the novel.
Left: The cover of the 1933 Farrar & Rinehart edition / Right: The cover of the 2020 Tough Poets Press edition
"Brinig's novel is the great modernist fantasy of Los Angeles . . . although it is essentially unread today."
— David L. Ulin, Los Angeles Times, March 14, 2011
"A most unusual book—one that is wholly mad in places, savage and caustic in other places, and here and there set off with a wild and moving beauty."
— Bruce Catton, Newspaper Enterprise Association, October 12, 1933
"No American author has done anything quite like it, and at first glance one scarcely knows quite what to make of it. . . . A brilliantly bizarre tale, a sort of literary nightmare, quite fascinating through its very strangeness."
— Galveston Daily News, October 8, 1933
"It is both realistic and romantic, poetic and prosaic, ironical and beautiful, satirical and naive—but always decadent."
— The (Raleigh) News & Observer, October 22, 1933
"The strangest novel to come out of the territory . . . a novel not set in Hollywood or dealing with the making of movies, but saturated with every fantasy and dream associated with the region."
— David Fine, Imagining Los Angeles: A City in Fiction, 2000
DESCRIPTION FROM THE ORIGINAL EDITION'S DUST JACKET
"Here a fine novelist turns the circus of California life inside out in a novel which is brilliant, incisive, distinguished—and perverse. His people are so exotic, so extraordinary, that at first they seem unreal—yet they can be recognized as the natural outgrowth of the abnormal conditions under which they live. A new Messiah walks on the waters for the news reels; nudists dance in the moonlight for the Mayor of the city; a woman with a fondness for murdering her men experiments on her latest lover with a delightful new poison; a man kills himself because he has had every other thrill; a Bostonian forgets Boston for a mad moment."
(Note: I'm not sure that whoever wrote this description actually read the book since the character who "has had every other thrill" does not kill himself.)
ABOUT THIS EDITION
Four of the 38 woodcut illustrations by Lynd Ward reproduced in this edition.
Format: Paperback
Pages: 302
Dimensions: 5.83" x 8.27" x 0.75"
Weight: 0.73 lbs.
ABOUT MYRON BRINIG
Myron Brinig was born in Minneapolis, Minnesota, on December 22, 1896, one of nine children of Romanian immigrants Moses and Rebecca (Labovitz) Brinig. When he was three, his family settled in Butte, Montana, then a booming copper-mining town, where his father opened a dry goods store. Brinig left Butte at the age of 17 to study at New York University and attended lectures on writing taught by the poet Joyce Kilmer. His education, however, was interrupted in 1917 by World War I. After two years in the Army, Brinig returned to New York City where he began his literary career writing short stories for magazines and reading novels for film studios in search of potential movie material.
Brinig's first novel, Madonna Without Child, was published in 1929 by Doubleday, Doran & Company. That same year, his editor John Farrar, along with brothers Stanley and Frederick Rinehart, formed Farrar & Rinehart, and published Brinig's second novel, Singermann, a semi-autobiographical novel of a Jewish immigrant peddler's family in the early 1900's American frontier. The novel is notable in that it is one of the earliest instances in American literature of a gay protagonist whose character is portrayed in a compassionate, non-stigmatizing manner.
Left: Myron Brinig, 1935 (photographer: Cady Wells) / Right: Myron Brinig, 1950s (photograpger unknown)
Earl Ganz, author of The Taos Truth Game, a fictionalized account of Brinig's involvement with the famous New Mexico art colony of the 1930s, wrote: “A homosexual himself, [Brinig] remained publicly closeted all of his life, a stance he thought necessary, not only for his writing career, but also for his place in American society.”

Brinig wrote 24 novels between 1929 and 1958. His most popular was Wide Open Town, originally published in 1931 and described by The New York Times as “a flamboyant epic of Butte in the heyday of copper mining and the lusty confluence of frontiersmen, saloons and brothels.” The rights to another novel, The Sisters (1937), were purchased by Warner Brothers and the subsequent film adaptation, starring Errol Flynn and Bette Davis, was released the following year. The Sadness in Lexington Avenue (1951) and The Street of Three Friends (1953), his last two novels published by Stanley Rinehart, were not well received by critics and sold poorly. The publisher dropped Brinig from his list. One final novel followed, The Looking Glass Heart, published in 1958 by Sagamore Press.

Brinig died on May 13, 1991, at the age of 94. By then, both he and his novels had faded into obscurity. In fact, none of his works were in print at the time of his death despite being compared early in his career to Thomas Wolfe and considered “among our best young writers.” (The Forum, April 1931)

ABOUT TOUGH POETS PRESS
Tough Poets Press, founded in 2015, is a one-person independent publisher of new and rediscovered offbeat and neglected literary fiction, poetry, and non-fiction. ABOUT BROOKLYN CIDER HOUSE
Two siblings and a friend quit their jobs to grow apples, make cider, and share their love of food, life, and drink. Their mission is to make really great cider with one simple ingredient: the apple. Help Brooklyn Cider House, Brooklyn's first farm cidery, with the final phase of the buildout of their 12,000 square foot cidery, restaurant, and bar.
Founders: Susan Yi, Peter Yi, and Lindsey Storm
Our cider rapture started in the Basque Country when Peter Yi, who was a wine buyer at the time, took a break from tasting wines to visit a sagardotegi. Delicious food, incredible ciders, and elated diners filled the cidery with pure magic. He was amazed by how well the natural cider paired with literally everything and how good he felt the next day. It was a thunderbolt moment and not long after his trip, Peter told his sister Susan, "We need to make a cider house in Brooklyn." He was dead serious and within weeks, Peter walked away from a business he built for 25 years and Susan quit teaching to study apples and hard cider.
Our First Trials in Peter's Garage (2014)
That was the spring of 2014. We didn't know a bushel from a bin of apples. What we did know was that we wanted to make a delicious, all-natural cider.
Lindsey Storm joined the founding team in 2015 and since then we have revitalized a Hudson Valley orchard, where we built a cidery, tasting room, farm store, and pavilion that serves wood-fired pizza and burgers. We've also planted 40 acres of baby trees of heirloom hard cider varieties, which should be in production in 4-5 years. 
Giving Love to Our Baby Cider Apple Trees!
BROOKLYN BUILDOUT
Presently, we have turned our energy to the final phase of the project, which is to open the doors to a full-scale cidery, restaurant, tasting room, and bar in Bushwick, Brooklyn. We will offer a farm-to-table menu perfectly paired with our ciders and made with timeless homespun methods to highlight simple, fresh ingredients. We will also spearhead and house cider events, educational workshops, tastings, and harvest celebrations. We don’t just want to be a successful place of business. We hope to make Brooklyn Cider House a place of innovation, creativity, history, and community, and one day, to be a hallmark of Bushwick and Brooklyn, recognized for capturing the spirit of Brooklyn with something local, something crafted, something smart, and wildly natural.
Architectural Drawing
  Brooklyn Cider House Brooklyn Location in Progress
  Brooklyn Cider House Brooklyn Location in Progress
  We started the Brooklyn buildout at the same time we purchased Twin Star Orchards, but our Brooklyn location faced a slew of permitting issues that have really slowed the project down and sapped our budget. The delays have forced us to make some cuts to our original plans for the Brooklyn venue. The barnwood finishes and original art, however, are two things we don't want to sacrifice.
We are thrilled to be working with a master carpenter who is installing beautiful barnwood beams and finishes throughout. We are also hoping to commission two talented artists, Dede and Pixel Pancho to custom design and install murals inside and outside our venue.
Reclaimed Barn Wood
  Dede Painting in Vienna Market

You may already know us for our ground-breaking and award-winning smart bicycle lights, all launched on Kickstarter. If you don’t know See.Sense, we’re an enthusiastic bunch of bike-riding designers and technologists dedicated to changing the world... for cycling... by doing things a bit differently.
With AIR, we’ve taken everything we’ve learned across everything we’ve done to create a clever little device to help you rest easy, knowing where your bike is anytime, anywhere. 
 It’s a combination of a few things. But let’s just say AIR is engineered the See.Sense way. It's designed to be the most effective bike tracking device available on the market.
After a quick set-up, AIR operates all on its own... quietly doing its job in the background while you carry on living your life. It knows what’s happening all around it, immediately letting you know if it’s been moved, if it’s been stolen (more about this later), if it’s been in a crash and even what the road conditions are like around it. Pretty smart, eh?
You know that ‘find my smartphone’ feature? Think of that but for your bike. We’ve brought all our experience in smart sensor engineering to locate your bike down to the nearest couple of metres. However, even the smartest sensor is only as good as the network coverage around it, so being the first bike tracking device to operate across the Narrowband Internet of Things LPWA Network means AIR will work where your smartphone does when in an NB-IoT territory. Don’t worry, any techies can get deeper into NB-IoT with a bit more scrolling.
With a battery charge required every three months or so and a quick set-up to iOS and Android apps, AIR is uniquely fit-and-forget.  It’s also a sleek and light device, weighing only around 80 grams, fitting unobtrusively to your bike.  But even more than that, it’s intelligent; it knows how close you are to your bike and switches into its defense modes accordingly to let you know what’s happening to your bike.
We’re not talking about the stuff you breathe... although we do think this device is pretty essential too. Locks and chains definitely have their place but they can’t do everything. In fact, sometimes, they simply can’t do enough. Let’s talk through the features that showcase the AIR advantage:
‘Fight Mode’ is AIR’s always-on self-defense setting, sounding its in-built alarm and letting everyone around it know if your bike’s being moved. You’ll also get an immediate SMS alert notification, allowing you to check your bike there-and-then. You can rest easy on that club ride coffee stop, or city centre breather, knowing that AIR’s guard is up.
AIR will understand if it’s being stolen, automatically switching to its ‘Flight’ setting and rapidly transmitting high-powered tracking signals and locating your bike to the nearest couple of metres. If the worst happens, you can quickly pass AIR’s GPS location to police, giving a better chance of recovery. Think of it as an electronic tag for your bike.
AIR can keep more than just your bike safe, it’ll also help keep you safe, detecting if you’ve been involved in a crash and automatically sending an SMS to your assigned contact with your precise location, should the worst happen. Help is always within reach with AIR; it’s security and safety in one little unit.
AIR’s battery lifetime is unique for a bike-tracking device as we’ve built it on new NB-IoT low power wide area network (LPWAN) technology. We promised a bit more for those with a techie appetite and we don’t want to disappoint anyone, so here goes... LPWA is specifically designed for connecting devices with low bandwidth requirements, using low power whilst providing wider and deeper network coverage. Many millions of devices will be connected via LPWA networks in the next few years and See.Sense is proud to be the first to apply its use to protect the most important thing to any cyclist... their bike.
LPWA will operate across multiple bands worldwide, powered by the Vodafone IoT network, so we’re manufacturing three different AIR models, each designed to work in the correct band for the appropriate network coverage of the territory. We’ve included a list of countries and bands below for reference:
Band 20 / Most of Europe: 
United Kingdom, Ireland, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Italy, Spain, Portugal, The Netherlands, Czech Republic, Malta, Turkey.
Band 8 / Australia, Africa & Asia:
South Africa, Australia, New Zealand.
Planned rollout of NB-IoT Networks from late 2020 include:
USA (late 2020), Russia, France, Switzerland, Denmark, Austria, Croatia, Poland, Slovakia, Norway.
We love the Kickstarter platform and the Kickstarter community because it allows us to really reward those who back us from the start. We offer a variety of pledges for AIR, each designed around the needs of our community, however, Kickstarter backers of all levels get two years’ free connection per device purchased. After 24 months, network connection will cost only around 3 pence per day for a year’s subscription. So you can put a price on reassurance, and with See.Sense, that price is low.
PLAY

AIR’s first defence in Fight Mode is its alarm, which packs quite a punch for such a small and discreet device - check out the short clip above to hear AIR’s sounder in action. In our (slightly OTT) way, we’ve tested a range of different tones, pitches, patterns, then engineered a bespoke alarm specifically for AIR to get as much attention as possible and help cancel your bike being taken.  Although the alarm will sound in Flight Mode, we’ve left it customisable so you can choose to turn it on/off or decide how long it should sound... it’s all up to you.
AIR is fixed to your bike quickly and securely using the security tools and bolts provided. AIR’s mounting kit is not only a tamper-resistant package but it’s a versatile one, with multiple mounting options available out of the box, allowing you to fix discreetly under the saddle or below the bottle cage. Fitting AIR in these locations means best-in-class connection to the network, accurately tracking your bike’s location and ensuring a battery life of months, not days.
Our R&D process involved consultation with antenna design specialists responsible for several generations of the market-leading smartphone.  This was crucial to locate the device in a way that could deliver the best-in-class network connection and battery life we knew was the missing link in effective bike tracking.  Once we had this design feedback, we then consulted with our customers and the findings were very clear... first-and-foremost, the tracker needed to locate their bike quickly every time, and if it could mount under a saddle (or under a bottle cage), that would be just fine. So we listened and we acted. As any existing customers know, this is the See.Sense way.
AIR therefore fixes to your bike quickly and securely using the security tools and bolts provided in a tamper-resistant and versatile package, with multiple mounting options available out of the box.
AIR can also make your experience of cycling better. The device is built on See.Sense advanced sensor technology and will monitor your environment as you ride, detecting issues such as poor road surface/route conditions. See.Sense then aggregates and de-personalises this data to work with city planners and advocacy groups to improve conditions for cycling for everyone. When we say AIR is smart, we really mean it.
See.Sense has already worked with cities including London, Manchester, Dublin and Antwerp to use these insights and we’re proud to be the Official Crowdsourced Data Insights supplier to British Cycling and Official Ride Insights supplier to Cycling Ireland.
We proudly manufacture in Northern Ireland, ensuring our products are made of the highest quality materials and components, and according to our exacting standards.
With six successful launches before AIR, we’ve built huge experience of manufacturing and distributing our products at scale. The diagram below indicates our expected timeline for AIR’s production.
 All Kickstarter purchases include 2 years’ free connection.
AIR will be shipped with both saddle rail and bottle cage mounts, a charging cable, a security torx key and optional See.Sense stickers to identify the device as a deterrent, should you wish to do so.
