For USA orders, we ship directly from our fulfilment centre in the United States. For UK & European orders, we ship from our fulfilment centre in the United Kingdom.
Please note you are responsible for any custom/import charges imposed at your border.
 See.Sense was founded six years ago and we are now a team of 14 that handles all the design and engineering that goes into our products. We want to have more people cycling more often.

BAMBOXERS 
Bamboxers is a Seattle-based project determined to get in your pants. We’ve been working hard to make amazingly soft bamboo boxer-briefs (not regular boxers... yet) a reality for dudes everywhere. And we’re almost there. 
The MOST comfortable boxer briefs you will ever own.
STRETCH GOAL #1 -- $35,000 -- BLACK ON BLACK
If we make it to $35,000 in funding, we'll hustle and bustle to develop and produce BLACK ON BLACK Bamboxers in time to ship for all Feb2106 deliverable product.  We got a bunch of requests for something like this from our current backers, so here we go! Excited to keep this thing going! 
WHAT PEOPLE ARE SAYING
"I'm a big fan of boxer-briefs that can double as something you can workout in or straight just chill at home." -Aaron, Ann Arbor, MI    
"When it comes to comfort, these briefs just slay the competition." -Drew, San Francisco, CA
"This pair of skivvies feels like a cross between the comfort of cotton and the performance of a sweat wicking synthetic fabric. Sweeeet."  -Hunter, Bellingham, WA
"People used to normal cotton boxer briefs will find these are a huge step up." -Lili, Seattle, WA                                                                      
Our product tester team included everyone from elite pro athletes, homebodies, PhDs, everyday ballers, international travelers, best friends, and all kinds of awesome in between. We had our testers run, skip, jump and philosophize while wearing product to make sure that our Bamboxer-briefs stood up to all the bragging we were doing. 
We gave our testers plenty of time to try things out. Underwear is meant to be lived in, not just looked at, right? After that, we listened to their feedback, made some small tweaks, and finalized our designs. And all in time for early-bird holiday shipping.
WHY BAMBOXERS ARE AWESOME
Soft, luscious fabric, made from bamboo fiber 
Plush waistband 
Won’t ride up 
The perfect pouch 
'Tagless' (we know, some people care a lot about this) 
Perfect for lounging... and SPORTS! 
PERKS
Along with our undying gratitude, we have some awesome perks available for our backers, which includes guaranteed shipment by the holidays for our early birds. This is your time to shine. Or, if you are looking for THE PERFECT GIFT for someone, here you go. We even drew some pictures to help you choose.
WHAT WE ARE OFFERING YOU AS 'THANK YOU' FOR YOUR SUPPORT
5 Different Sizes of boxer briefs
3 Awesome Colors (plus maybe 1 bonus color, if we hit our new goal!)
         WHO ARE WE, ANYWAY
We're a cool team with skivvies on our mind. 
Bamboxers is Zahlen, Xtehn, Vehro, Rohre, and Qxhna's brainchild. From conception to execution, the five siblings have been there every step of the way researching, product design, manufacturing, and everything in between.
Taylor and Sigrid are bringing all the other loose threads together: photo editing, copy writing, social media, and coming up with underwear-related puns for the Kickstarter campaign. 
Ningo, along with being the modeling talent, protects the office from the big, scary mailman. He's a good boy, yes he is. 
OUR PROCESS
Behind the Seams
Way back in 2008, we got the idea to redefine how people clothe themselves (from the bottom up, of course). On a mission to make awesomely soft and durable boxer-briefs, we went searching for the best fabric, the best process, and the best facilities.
Our quest brought us to China (that's where most of the worlds bamboo grows), where we spent 3 months researching bamboo fiber and how we could spin it into Bamboxer gold. We made sure to do our homework. While overseas, we studied every step of the sourcing and production process and evaluated the environmental impact of our manufacturing methods. 
Pre-boxers
We tried some really cutting edge stuff, but we knew that unless we had excellent quality, we would be making a compromise to our potential customers. Once we were happy with the material, we picked out a waistband that felt great, determined the best way to stitch everything together, came up with the washing label, landed on the best fabric dyeing methods for long term quality, selected the sturdiest thread, consumed unholy amounts of coffee, and reworked our designs to better suit your birthday suit. Phew. 
Our goal was to make the most comfortable boxer-briefs on the market. So we did. 
And now we're here. From Seattle, to China, back to Seattle, and now to you. Bamboxers goes the distance, and we're focused on what matters: underwear. Lots and lots of underwear.
WHAT WE'VE SPENT OUR TIME ON... SO FAR
2008: We couldn’t stop thinking about insanely comfortable boxer-briefs that would be a good balance of environmental sustainability and utmost longterm quality.  If you are going to buy them, we want them to last, because if you just throw them away after a year, that fills up landfills, an act we hope to minimize.
The idea floated around in our heads for a long while and we spent lots of time designing the best fabric and ensuring the best production partners.
2009: We found that our other clothing company was taking tons of our time, so instead of rush and push out Bamboxers.com, we took a short hiatus from the 'heaven in your pants' project. 
2013: We revitalized our quest for even better fabric than we had yet designed, mostly focused on increasing the quality and comfort of the raw material.
March 2015: Eureka!  We think we've got it!  The stars align with an awesome, high quality bamboo viscose blend.  We made our first prototypes and started putting them through rigorous testing. 
July 2015: We got awesome feedback from our team of top notch product testers from all over the world and from all walks of life. 
August 2015: We made some finishing touches. 
October 2015:  Lots of fun planning our launch and filming our own video! 
November 2015: Our Kickstarter campaign is launched, and we're trying to get these things in as many peoples hands as possible, because we know that once you have them, you will never wear another pair of boxer briefs!

LEVELnocturne is a late evening, site specific, dance experience that explores the goings on at night: from sleeping, to walking in the dark, to things that go bump in the night. It will take place in a theater venue but utilizing many of the non-auditorium spaces. We are raising money to set the scene and create the atmosphere for which LEVELnocturne can exist: from creating the lighting and costumes to employing the dancers and choreographers. With this money we will be able to turn normal hallways, breezeways, and a bar into a much more intimate, dark, and atmospherically appropriate space. This money will also allow us to bring the costume ideas to life and employ the highest caliber of artists to help us fully realize the concept behind LEVELnocturne. The involvement of all of these talented artists is crucial in making a completely cohesive evening of art from the original concept through to the final embodiment of LEVELnocturne. 
PLAY

PLAY

JUNTOS is collective of artists that uses outreach through dance to create community across borders...
Help our dancers connect with others in Costa Rica and Nicaragua! 
--TOTAL PROJECT COST: 19,520 ----- WHAT WE ASK FROM YOU: 9,500--
“The great thing about JUNTOS is that it takes this idea [that the understanding of different cultures is what will bring peace to the world] and connects it to concrete actions… Something inside me has really changed. I feel so inspired to do more because there is so much to be done." - Marisa Martin, Excerpt of letter written to the director after our 2010 Guatemalan exchange
WHO ARE WE?
JUNTOS (“together” in Spanish) was founded in 2008 by Joanna Poz-Molesky with other college students. We’re a collective of performing artists from various university dance conservatories in New York and California (Ailey/Fordham, Juilliard, LINES/Dominican, and SUNY Purchase) committed to social justice and community outreach through dance. We teach and perform in many local and international locations while focusing on communities that aren’t granted much exposure to art.

Over the past 4 years, we’ve had the opportunity to travel and share in central Mexico and Guatemala six times. We’ve also created multiple smaller projects in New York and the San Francisco Bay Area. We teach workshops and perform in various hospitals, retirement homes, orphanages, centers for HIV+ children, as well as for dancers with limited access to training and large public audiences. In total, we have worked with hundreds of children in workshops and have performed for thousands of people from diverse backgrounds. All our activities are free of cost.
WHAT DO WE HOPE TO BE DOING IN COSTA RICA AND NICARAGUA?
We would love to expand our project more and with your help (juntos!) we can do that!
We hope to offer 8 of our student dancers from New York City and the San Francisco Bay Area an opportunity to travel to Costa Rica and Nicaragua to collaborate with residents, engage in intercultural exchange, and connect with various diverse communities. With your help, we will: Teach movement workshops to local youth in rural communities and cities alike; Perform for communities unfamiliar with contemporary performing arts; Collaborate and exchange with local artists, workshop participants, audience members, and volunteers; Explore various traditional and contemporary expressions local to each country; Read more on our website (detailed description coming soon!)
WHY IS DANCE IMPORTANT?
create JOY; UNIFY body, mind, and spirit; NURTURE and promote creativity, confidence, and individuality; TRANSCEND languages, race, religion, cultures, and customs, enabling us as human beings to connect on the most essential level; OFFER a means of self-expression; STIMULATE both interdependence and collaboration
“We are humans. We have common feelings: joy, sadness, fear, love. It doesn’t take much to understand another’s story. Language holds limitations, but art breeds possibilities. If we dance for an audience and we use our spirits to do so, connection happens. We are here for each other. To share, to understand, to come together." -Marisa Martin, Excerpt from “Thoughts on Guatemala, Part II.” June 10, 2011
HOW ARE YOUR FUNDS HELPING?
Our total costs for the project are $19,520. We hope you can help with some of this! Covering participant costs is a big challenge, especially when travelling abroad. Individual support has always been key to allowing JUNTOS to continue to facilitate both local and global outreach projects! Your donation, made right here on Kickstarter, will take us one step closer to accomplishing our JUNTOS collective goals! You’re helping with..
Air & ground transportation: $12,100 – Funding our air transportation from the U.S. to Costa Rica and from Nicaragua to the U.S. is essential. We also need funding for our travels to towns, villages, and cities near San Jose, Costa Rica and Managua, Nicaragua.
Housing while abroad: $3,920 – After a fulfilling day of workshops and traveling, nothing would be nicer than a shower and a bed. That’s where you can help! We need to provide shelter 8 dancers + 4 staff members for 2 weeks!
Production and promotion: $3,500 -  (costumes, venue rentals, performance permits, promotional material, and resources for our participants abroad!) - We are a spending-savvy group that has learned to be flexible and resourceful with our past budgets, but we still need help with the logistics!
Even a small donation makes a big difference in our ability to achieve our goals. There are lots of rewards for donating, so check out the level that works for you. Thank you so much for your help!
Want to do more? You can also help by spreading the word - share this page on Twitter, Facebook, Tumblr, your blog, etc!
http://juntoscollective.org/
www.facebook.com/juntoscollective
www.twitter.com/juntoscollective

FEREF: UNSEEN
An intimate and unique look into the poster archive of one of the world’s leading movie marketing companies, featuring never seen before concept art for some of the world's biggest  films. 

Since 1968, Feref has helped to advertise some of the biggest and best-loved movies in the history of cinema and this book is a visual record of their most memorable work. It gives an in-depth insight into their archive, featuring pieces from over 3,500 films, acting as a love letter to the hard work and dedication of the artists that created stunning movie posters across 6 decades.
Each page will show treasures from across the collection in stunning detail, from source material and first concept sketches to work in progress illustrations and even alternative ideas that have never before seen the light of day. It will illustrate how an idea was transformed into an iconic image that needed to stop traffic and sell tickets.
The paintings, illustrations and alternative layouts will be as close as you can get to standing over their shoulder and watching as they paint the posters the world fell in love with. 
This isn’t just another collection of movie posters; this is a one-of-a-kind insight into the world of film advertising, featuring words and works of some of the greatest movie poster artists of all time. This beautiful book is for poster fans, for film fans and for anyone who appreciates art in all its forms. 
FEREF: UNSEEN - over 200 pieces of movie art / 200 pages / 32x25cm

Three-Step Plan is a role playing game where you start by picking your character's motivation and objective and build onto them from there.
Character creation in Three-Step Plan is an exciting, adrenaline-filled scramble, and by the end you'll have a fully fleshed out character built for adventure.
This game is meant to be played in one evening with little to no prep, so it's perfect to break out when your wizard bails on the party last minute.
Rendered Image
What makes this project unique?
The strongest and most unique elements to Three-Step plan are as follows:
- Since your character has a main objective, and a plan to complete that objective (the three steps), you start the game with a strong sense of purpose. Since each other player will have a character with equally strong motivations, the adventure will have a strong focus, and the characters will waste no time getting into trouble. 
- The characters, with some meddling from the GM, are dropped into the game with their objectives connected to the other players around the table. Even though everyone has their own objective, trying to complete these objectives at the same time is going to bring them together, often in exciting, explosive, and entertaining ways. 
- Character creation is a game. From the get-go, you are invested in your character, trying to get the equipment and traits you need before the other players scoop them up. Because of the dice, there will be some randomness to what is available, but at the same time, you have lots of control over what you choose for your character. 
Rendered Image
Reviews
"Compared to D&D, this game absolutely shines in its ability to set up one-shots."
- Alexander Grove: Playtester

"A rule-lite, no prep RPG that focuses on character creation as the most important element of the game. If this works as advertised, creating a character-centric RPG that lets you craft unique characters and spotlight them which might give plot-driven RPGs some competition. Going character-driven is a welcome direction for the gaming world."
- Egg Embry: enworld.org

"Let’s be honest, there are plenty of RPG systems out there already with some possibly older than yourself. Three-Step Plan is a rules-light system but heavy on content. The creator clearly understands that a true RPG system is not about hack-and-slash or amassing make-believe wealth but for players to roleplay their characters towards the achievement of their personal goals."
- Milo Alejo: tabletopunited.com

"All of this packed into a single game session! Everyone I've played Three-Step Plan with has wanted to play again. Dallas has done a great job with his concept and mechanics and put together a terrific game."
- Joe Tomkins: Playtester
Other note-worthy aspects to the game 
- This game can be played with no prep, and in one sitting. 
- It is rules lite, and highly focused on narrative and character development instead of rules. This allows the story to progress quickly, permitting the group to get through a full story with a beginning, a climax, and a conclusion.
- Every character has an objective that is secret from the other players (but not hidden from the GM). They may be admirable or nefarious, but that will only come out as the story unfolds. 
- Since the game relies on characters with strong motivation, it's easy for first time role players to get into their characters.
Rendered Image
What's in the book?
Here's a look into what I have packed into the book.
Humble Beginnings 
I started working on this project in 2018. I began creating it because I wanted something to create just for fun, just for the pleasure of creating. When my son was born, it gave me something to do while I was up late rocking him to sleep. It kept me sane as I took breaks from writing papers and presentations for my masters classes. It slowly took shape, and what I ended up with was more fun than I ever could have hoped. It took lots of re-working, re-writing, play-testing, and editing, but what I have here now is something I am proud to share with you.
Rendered Image
How we cut down on expenses (to pass the savings onto you)
I wrote the book on my own time and am friends with many talented people who believed in what I was creating and wanted to support me with their expertise. My sister filmed the videos on her cellphone and edited them on a free trial of Final Cut. I am friends with an English teacher who spent hours pouring over the material looking for (and finding) errors. I am blessed with many groups of gamers who were willing to play rough drafts of this game. Bernie the graphic designer agreed to design the book for a small cut of the profit. It was really a coming together of some amazing people who acted selflessly to make this project a reality.
Rendered Image
Three-Step Plan is a great game that has been worked on by a small group of talented people. It is in the final steps of the process and needs one more thing.  It needs people interested in the project to make it a reality.  It needs you. Please check out my videos below, and consider backing this project today. 

THE DICE SYSTEM:
This video outlines how I have taken various dice mechanics and tailored them into a quick and easy new system.
CHARACTER CREATION: 
 This video describes how to piece your character together. The process is a game in and of itself and requires no preparation ahead of time.
RUNNING THE GAME:  
With so much unknown, how does a game master prepare for a session of Three-Step Plan? Watch this video to see how the game relies on strong character motivation rather than game master prep.
Thank you for reviewing my project. 
Dallas Mix

Jon Schaffer is known as the founder, chief song writer, and guitar player of Iced Earth, the heavy metal band he founded in 1988. Not just resting on his laurels, Schaffer conceived 3 more bands that have also received serious acclaim, Demons & Wizards, Sons of Liberty, and Purgatory. 
Wicked Words & Epic Tales is a collection of his lyrics, and a variety of the artwork that they inspired. Schaffer is the author of numerous heavy metal anthems such as Watching Over Me, Melancholy (Holy Martyr), Dante’s Inferno, the Something Wicked trilogy, Damien, Travel in Stygian, A Question of Heaven, Gettysburg (1863), Raven Wing, Timeless Spirit, Spirit of the Times, and so many others. This volume is a celebration of his works over 30 years of songwriting.
Included in this deluxe hardback edition is a totally new concept in audio, on CD format, that Schaffer has dubbed “A Narrative Soundscape.” All of the output penned solely by Schaffer is represented in this fantastic visual display of a long and storied career.

OVERVIEW.
In JAN 2011, I will be crossing the South Atlantic Ocean on a 72-foot sail boat (for over 30 days) with 12 other people to study plastic pollution that has made it's way from land to the middle of the ocean. I am raising $5000 for my spot on the 5 Gyres research voyage. I plan to do this through Kickstarter (this online system) and a fundraiser event on DEC 3 in San Francisco (see below). Funding over $5000 will be applied towards flights. Any funds not used towards boat or travel (flights only) will be donated to 5 Gyres.
WHAT.
I have been invited to participate on a research expedition in JAN 2011, lead by the 5 Gyres Institute, to study plastic pollution in the South Atlantic Ocean. The 5 Gyres Institute is a non-profit organization dedicated to conducing research on plastic pollution and building public awareness around plastic pollution issues. The expedition begins in Cape Town, South Africa and travels to Montevideo, Uruguay, via Walvis Bay, Namibia and St. Helena Island. The purpose of the expedition is to bring together artists, scientists, ocean lovers, and activists, to conduct scientific research and increase public awareness on issues related to plastic pollution in our oceans. The expedition will contribute scientific information on the density of plastic pollution in the South Atlantic Ocean and increase public awareness about plastic pollution through various outlets (blogs, websites, news, photography, art).
I plan to write daily blog entries that document the scientific research, life on the vessel, each crew member's purpose and goals related to the voyage, the environment that we explore, and how marine life and the ocean are being impacted by plastic pollution. In addition to the daily blog entries, I plan to document my voyage through photographs by creating a photo essay project with photographs from each day of travel.
I am raising $5,000 for 5 Gyres to be on the January 2011 Research Expedition. The money will fund the research vessel (72' sail boat) and plastic pollution research and outreach projects. Each participant on the voyage is required to help raise funding for the expedition costs. I also hope to raise money for the cost of airfare to South Africa and return flight from Uruguay. Any funding not used towards travel costs will be donated to 5 Gyres. I am taking 7 weeks off work, 4 weeks unpaid, so I will be spending my own money too to make this opportunity happen.
WHY.
Plastic pollution has been found at the bottom of the food chain in plankton in many sections of our oceans but the extent of the plastic pollution is not well documented or studied. The bellies of fish and birds are full of plastic. Fish hormones may be changing due to chemicals found in plastic. And it is nearly impossible to go to a beach without finding a piece of plastic pollution.
Historically, plastic debris in the ocean was thought to be from the fishing and cruise ship industry, but researchers now believe that about 80% of plastic pollution comes from run-off (through storm drains and trash blowing into the ocean) and unregulated trash management (not all countries have the same kind of trash control as the USA). Before 1965, trash was composed of paper goods, food, and other material but since the plastic bottle and plastic packaging industries started booming, our trash has become more durable (plastic takes hundreds and hundreds of years to breakdown and never decomposes). The plastic pollution found in the ocean is mainly plastic bottle caps, plastic toys, plastic bottles, plastic wrappers, plastic bags, plastic pens, plastic food containers...this is the plastic material that we all use in our everyday lives and I am sure we can live without a lot of it.
WHAT YOU CAN DO.
Become aware of your plastic consumption and learn more about plastic pollution in our oceans. Donate to projects that focus on plastic pollution research and are dedicated to raising awareness on the issues related to plastic pollution, like THIS PROJECT.
Follow my BLOG: http://cboxplastic.blogspot.com/
Come to my FUNDRAISER EVENT (Photo Exhibit with Silent Auction) hosted by Surfrider San Francisco on Friday, DEC 3 at Space Gallery on Polk Street in San Francisco: http://cboxplastic.blogspot.com/2010/10/plastic-ocean-art-event-save-date.html
If you donate here (online) and come to my DEC 3 Fundraiser Event - I will give you 2 tickets for the RAFFLE as a thank you!
WHAT I WILL DO FOR YOU.
For everyone - I plan to keep my blog updated, as much as possible. If internet is not available while I am on the voyage, I will blog for weeks when I return. I will be writing a blog for EACH day while I am on the voyage.
For everyone who DONATES - I will bring you a photograph from my voyage. Photographs are very powerful and I hope to take some photographs that show the intensity of the plastic pollution.
For the top 10 donations - I will send you a photography book with a photograph from each day of my voyage.
FOR MORE INFORMATION.

Album 2015 er en realitet hvilket vi simpelthen ikke kan få hænderne ned over. TAK ALLE SAMMEN. Vi har stadig lidt tid tilbage som aktiv kampagne, folk bliver ved med at donere, og derfor vil vi gerne huske at sige at hver en krone går til bedre programmer og lækre ting. (Vi arbejder på at udvide konceptet - evt med et par live-optagelser - samt andre overraskelser ift selve programmerne. Det bliver muligt med ekstra cash.)
OG: Så vil vi gerne komme med et løfte (eller et "stretch goal" i Kickstarter-lingo): Hvis vi når 125.000,- så laver vi 11 programmer i stedet for 10! (Hvorfor ikke ved 120.000,- spørger du? Fordi vi også vil støtte The Lake Radio - der muliggør vores udsendelser og er et komplet con amore-projekt - med de første 5000,- vi går over budget. Lyt til deres mange fine ting her.)
--
Hvad er Album 2015?
Kender du det, når en dedikeret musikfan spiller en plade for dig fra ende til anden og råber entusiastisk op om hvorfor det, du hører, er intet mindre end ge-ni-alt? Det var sådan vi – i ungdomsværelser, studenterlejligheder, togkupeer – lærte mange af vores yndlingsplader at kende. Fordi vores bedste venner forklarede os om det bedste i verden: Deres yndlingsplader. Det var god gammeldags indføring af en believer, en rablende entusiast, et menneske fuld af kærlighed til musik.
Det er vi også. Og vi savner at formidle vores kærlighed til og indsigt i verdens bedste musik. Vi savner at give dig oplevelsen af at sidde med dine bedste venner og blive indført i musikhistoriens vigtigste plader – i højkvalitetslyd og med mange års erfaring som extra material. Vi vil være dine over-entusiastiske fan-venner.
Vi har gjort det før. For nogle år siden lavede vi en serie programmer ved navn ’Album’ på DR’s radiokanal P6Beat. I alt blev det til 30 programmer om ‘The Queen is Dead’ af The Smiths, ‘Thriller’ af Michael Jackson, ‘“Heroes”’ af David Bowie, ’Spirit of Eden’ af Talk Talk, ’Hounds of Love’ af Kate Bush, ‘Expensive Shit’ af Fela Kuti, ‘Blue’ af Joni Mitchell og mange flere af vores absolutte favoritter.
Men så sluttede programmet. Og lige siden har det kriblet sådan i os. Der er noget, der mangler. Der er så mange gode plader derude, der ikke er blevet udsat for vores bedrevidende, fabulerende, kropslige, nørdede og slubrende kærlighed. Vores liste er så lang! Og vi er blevet afhængige af det.
Det har vi på fornemmelsen at andre også er. ‘Album’ er blevet flittigt podcastet lige siden, og på de utallige mails og tweets virker det som om at det ikke kun er os, der fandt en eller anden mening i serien.
Vi kan ikke blive enige med DR om en videreførelse af serien, så nu søger vi andre jagtmarker. Vi har lavet et samarbejde med ‘The Lake’ – en allerede stærkt rost internet-radiostation startet af Efterklang, Kasper Vang og Jan Høgh Stricker – og sammen med dem vil vi gerne vække ‘Album’ fra de døde. Besøg The Lake her.
Denne gang i en mere publikumsinddragende version, hvor du kan være med til at vælge din yndlingsplade – ud fra vores liste – som emne for ‘Album’. Og hvor dine kommentarer kan blive en del af programmet.
Altså: En række 1,5-3 timer lange programmer. Én plade pr. program. Hver gang en dedikeret, researchet og frådende gennemgang af musikken, produktionen, betydningen, politikken, lyden, poesien, kropsbehåringen, indvirkningen på stjernerne, betydningen for samtiden, eftermælet – samt ikke mindst med kommentarer fra fans.
Når vi når vores mål garanterer vi 10 podcasts om 10 forskellige plader, udvalgt fra bruttolisten nedenfor.
Vi har brug for din hjælp for at få det til at ske. Og det skal ske.
Med kærlig hilsen,
Ralf Christensen og Kristian Leth
---
Nogle tanker om listen: 
10 plader skal vælges ud fra bruttolisten.
Vi har undgået plader med kunstnere vi allerede har lavet programmer om, på trods af at Bowie, Springsteen og Wonder fx alle har flere plader der er værdige.
For første gang har vi smidt nogle danske plader med. Og ja, det er noget andet at tale om danske plader, de betyder noget andet for os, og derfor skal vi ikke ud i nogle lange retfærdiggørelser eller sammenligninger med nogle af de tidsløse internationale klassikere, der også er på listen. Det er nok at sige at vi kun har skrevet forrygende værker på, og at disse danske pladers vægt ikke er til at underkende. Respekt.
Derudover er der en let blanding af Bangers og Mysterier. Disse kategorier er idiosynkratiske, dybt upålidelige og afhængige af værternes temperament. Men tanken er at vi skal have plads til BÅDE kanoniserede hovedværker OG obskure plader hvis betydning vi mener skal fremhæves i opposition til den herskende musik-mytologi. Her er vores indstilling at du selvfølgelig ikke behøver kende pladen for at nyde programmet, og vores håb er at vi netop kan åbne det pågældende værk på vidt gab, så du ender programmet som fan.
Til sidst skal det igen understreges at: VI har dømt disse plader som værdige til Album 2015. Mangler vi nogen? Ja. Er listen komplet? LANGT FRA! Vi har blinde punkter og kæpheste. Og så er vi helt vildt gode til det her. Sådan er det. (Men skriv gerne til os med din yndlingsplade, som vi har glemt!)

Real, quirky, and unique, the dancers of e r a Dance Collective take charge of their own realities through improvisation and input throughout the creative process. They, as creators and co-conspirators, work to generate a collaborative truth, a new reality to be experienced by the audience.
This year, we'd like to be able to share our work with peers, strangers, the people we love most, & you.
We'll be holding an open rehearsal on Saturday, April 6th at Gibney Dance Center in the Flatiron District (890 Broadway 5th Floor), an evening of contemporary dance works.  In return, we will not be charging for tickets; we would like to open our doors to anyone and everyone who would like to spend a Saturday evening with us.  We will also be applying to several shows throughout New York.  In the meantime, we ask for your assistance to help us fund:
-studio rentals & building overtime
-costumes
-application fees
-program printing costs
-photography & videography costs

I am an artist seeking funds to carry out my upcoming exhibition of paintings: Sacred/Wild
Silverback
What is Sacred/Wild?
Sacred/Wild is a series of large scale ink paintings on paper of wild animals in sacred, spiritual spaces. I will have an exhibition of these paintings in Paros, Greece in mid August of this year. Sacred/Wild has been a very interesting and exciting project to work on in that I am learning as I go about what I want to say about these pieces.  We have our cultural as well as personal ideas of wild animals, whether they are wolves, chimpanzees, leopards…and we have other ideas regarding certain spaces, especially religious and sacred spaces. By connecting the two different worlds together one acts as a bridge between the two ideas, and in that way each interpretation can be very different depending on the viewer. I also would like the images to feel real--as if these animals were actually there in these spaces. Ultimately I want the animals to appear natural in these environments which they would otherwise never be associated with.
Why ink?
I work with ink because it is such a versatile medium. It can be very dark and bold on one hand and light and subtle on the other.  Ink allows for very smooth transitions in tone which is very helpful when evoking light bouncing around a big Gothic cathedral.  Also, when working with ink one has to learn to let go and let the ink move freely across the paper.  The element of not being able to control the ink is something which I really enjoy, and leads to many beautiful marks I couldn't otherwise predict or plan.
Here are some images of the works:
Peacock
detail of Chimapanzees
Leopard
Why Kickstarter?
The Sacred/Wild exhibition will be my first show in three years.  I will be putting up this exhibition on my own in an independent space in Paros, Greece.  Because I will not be going through a gallery, the costs of setting up the exhibition itself will be carried solely by myself.  My goal is that through the Kickstarter platform this fundraising project will allow me to to have the best show I could possibly have.
Your pledges will go to:
Materials for making more and larger artwork to display
Rent to pay for the space itself over the course of August, 2012
Frames for the paintings as they are large scale works on paper
The printing of an exhibition catalog collecting all the images.
Promotion for the exhibition itself including postcards, flyers and posters
Rewards for your pledges:
In return for your pledges, there will be rewards based upon your contribution amount.  Rewards will include:
A mailed postcard print of one of my paintings
A handpainted postcard in ink with a personal message handwritten on the back like this:
A limited edition, signed, archival print of one of the images
A print of the first sketch that triggered the idea for the series:
Deer in a Temple
The full exhibition catalog featuring all of the images from the series Sacred/Wild
A painting on rice paper in squid ink like this:
Squid ( for more on this painting check out this blog post )
Original preparatory sketches for works in the series like these:
Preparatory Sketch for "Wolves"
Detail of Preparatory Sketch for "Leopard"
Preparatory Sketch for "Wild Horses"
A small, original ink and/or watercolor painting like these:
Aghios Constandinos
Sitting Nude
Reclining Nude
Sea after sunset
Street Lamp
A large, original ink and/or watercolor painting like these:
Blue Crab
Sea Foam
A personalized original watercolor or ink painting for you
How Kickstarter works:
Through Kickstarter individuals are able to make pledges of any size through the Amazon.com account.  Kickstarter is an all or nothing platform.  This means if there are enough pledges to reach the goal then the funding will be a go and your pledge will be sent on the day of the project deadline.  If there are not enough pledges then no money will be sent at all.  
For more about me:
I am an artist currently living in Paros, Greece where I paint and teach painting and drawing at the Aegean Center for the Fine Arts.
For more images please check out my  website: junpierre.net and my blog for recent work: junpierre.net/words
Please contact me with any questions you may have and feel free to share this with anyone who might be interested in the project.
Thank you for looking at my project and for your support!

¡Katharsis Teatro vuelve por Navidad! :)
El miércoles 23 de diciembre nos encantaría poder volver a subir a las tablas retomando esta fantástica comedia que ya representamos el curso pasado. El sitio es el Teatro Lagrada de Madrid (Calle De Ercilla, 20), y la cita a las 20:00.
¿Por qué necesitamos que nos ayudes a través de Crowdfunding?
El alquiler de la sala asciende a 250€. Somos un grupo de teatro universitario, ¡no tenemos ánimo de lucro pero sí muchas ganas de hacer teatro!, y nuestra única manera de financiar nuestros proyectos es a través de los donativos del público que recaudamos en las representaciones. Pero esta vez, necesitamos pediros los donativos antes de la función, a través de esta plataforma, para poder hacer frente al alquiler de la sala.
Además del alquiler, tenemos que poner a punto el resto del atrezzo e imprimir los programas; por eso, y teniendo en cuenta el pellizco que se queda la plataforma (el 5% de lo que nos donéis), hemos puesto el objetivo en 300€.
Por eso, si vas a venir a vernos el 23 de diciembre a las 20:00 al Teatro Lagrada y nos regalas un poco de ayuda, además de hacerte disfrutar con esta estupenda obra de teatro tendremos algún detalle para ti.
Y si no puedes venir a vernos, pero también quieres colaborar, también te estaremos enormemente agradecidos, y te podremos enviar a casa un pequeño obsequio de la obra como agradecimiento.

IMPORTANTE: si vas a venir a vernos, después de hacer la donación confirma tu asistencia mandando un correo a katharsismedicina@gmail.com .  
(Si no, no podremos saber qué donaciones corresponden a los que vienen a vernos, o a quienes sólo quieren colaborar y no vendrán a la representación).
¡Muchísimas gracias por tu ayuda!

Our Mission
Evoke Dance Company is a non-profit contemporary and hip-hop group that provides a dance haven to diverse artists and gives back to the community. 
The Dancers
What makes Evoke Dance Company so unique is the compilation of dancers. Each dancer comes from a very different dance background, culture, and perspective. While some dancers are college students, others are full-time working professionals in various industries such as finance, education, and marketing. Regardless, all members sacrifice time and energy out of their full-time schedules to make this company succeed.  
The Show
Evoke Dance Company will be performing at the Aratani Theater/ Japan America Theater in Los Angeles on Saturday, June 22, 2013. The show features choreography by famous industry artists, but the majority of the pieces are choreographed by Evoke dancers themselves. The show will also feature collaborative performances with other community dance groups. 
This season, our is titled "Therapy" because for us, dance is a form of therapy. It’s our way of expressing thoughts and emotions, bringing balance and purpose to our lives. This season, we’d like to take you on a journey through dance as a source of relief, as a healing power, and as an escape from ourselves. In this performance, you will catch a glimpse into our minds from our victories and triumphs to our losses and sorrows. We want to tell you our stories in a way that can only be told through dance; we want to show you that it is more than just physical movement, but also a way to heal, to grow, and to share. For us, dance is our communication, our empathy. For us, dance is therapy.

My name is Nora Belal. I work primarily in photography (norabelalphotography.com) but have always privately considered myself more of a sculptor. This exhibition, Icons and Monuments, is a chance to present some of my first large scale projects to the public. By large I mean a 20 foot high 16 foot long manila rope installation, A disintegrating wall of salt bricks, a flower staircase to nowhere and a 16 foot high all-encompassing  flower structure with salt, rope and scent components. I'm very interested in scent as art, and not in a yankee candle way, but in a  memory mapping fashion. 
The space I'm showing in is mind boggling, every time I look at photos I catch my breath because I can't believe I've been invited to take it over. SixTHreeFouR Studio is a true labor of love and is still making its name in Pittsburgh, by supporting me you will also be supporting a community oriented, experimental art territory powerhouse. 
  The only draw back is its in Pittsburgh and I'm in Boston. But, I've always welcomed the opportunity to change and explore, and a road trip with my pieces is just that. The gallery, SixTHreeFouR Studio, is a 20x40 ft. open air space covered in ivy. It features a wood stove, an additional event area, a garden and a birds nest made out of a trampoline (!??!!) 
The work in the gallery in this photo is unrelated to Icons and Monuments.
This space rejects the notion of an art exhibition being quiet contemplation and wine sipping and welcomes exploration, originative thought, and some serious party time the night of the opening, which is Friday August 1.  
Alas, with serious party time comes serious planning and material purchasing. Here is a quick breakdown of how your generosity will be put to use:
1136 mile round trip 10 ft truck rental including gas: $1710
2,500 feet of 1/2 inch manila rope: $4,325
salt, wood and other structural materials $500.00
As you can see, my goal is significantly lower than the actual cost. The $2,500 is the absolute minimum I need to make this project a reality, while $6,535 is what I need to fulfill the project exactly as I envision it in scale and scope. 
This exhibition is as much an exploration of concept as it is material and I'm grateful to have this opportunity and to be able to ask people like you to help me. Thank you so much for taking some time out to read about my project, Icons and Monuments. I + M has been a long time coming and to have the chance to produce and experiment with this work means so much to me as an artist and an individual.
Please check in at http://norabphotography.tumblr.com for snippets of the pieces in various states of completion over the course of the campaign, and to learn more about me.

Introducing TRISET: All Natural Training Drink Mix
We are a group of passionate individuals looking to simplify supplement use and change the landscape of supplement intake. As an athlete, you want to fuel your body the most effective and safe way possible to maximize your results. We believe that the supplements you take should be simply packaged and free of unnecessary additives.
          The idea for TRISET was born over 2 years ago when we discovered a void in the supplement space. We at TRISET are active working professionals and know that supplement use isn't always convenient but an important part of training. We wanted to create a product that encompassed every phase of our workout: before, during and after. We hate the inconvenience of hauling tubs of preworkout, BCAAs and protein in our cars and the mess that it caused so we decided to change the game.
 We also wanted to create a supplement that was actually good for you. We knew that the majority of supplements on the market had unnecessary fillers and ingredients that negated the positive effects they could have had if they had been formulated correctly. Having an actual physician (Dr. Porter) who specializes in supplements and training is a massive advantage to choosing TRISET over the competition.
Dr. Porter spent months perfecting the Triset formula, making sure that it was not only safe but helped athletes maximize results.
With your help, we can make TRISET a reality and change the way athletes train and recover.
  We are advocates of complete transparency when it comes to ingredients in our product.
Bogus "proprietary blends" and hidden ingredients are not what we're about. Below, you will find a list of every ingredient that will be in TRISET. What you see is what you get in every stick pack.
Preworkout - Apple Strawberry Blend Flavor
Triset Preworkout is only 10 calories per serving. An athlete will get more gain if they exercise in a fasting state. 
Beta Alanine and Creatine to maximize muscle performance 
The effectiveness of the B12 and Folate is increased with the addition of Betaine. 
Naturally sweetened with Stevia 
Intra- Strawberry Lemonade Flavor
BCAAS that actually work - BCAA's are essentially useless unless taken in a fasting state. It's tough to get great tasting BCAAAs, so Dr. Stuart suggest "why take them if they aren't going to work!"
 Post - Berries & Cream Flavor
Carb Conscience - "The most important health aspect that we can control is our blood sugar levels. Ideally, we exercise in a fasting state (or close to it) and replenish our carbohydrate stores post exercise. With Triset, we added the advised amount of carbs and protein to replenish effectively after a workout"-Dr. Porter 
 Joint Protection - Whether it be an elite athlete or a weekend warrior, you need to protect your joints. Triset post includeds MSM, Glucosamine and Chondrotin to help rebuild and protect those joints.
Get Rewarded For Spreading the Word About TRISET with Kickbooster
  Timeline
After some extensive research, we've selected an excellent manufacturer that is committed to delivering Triset before November 1st. With your help, we can get Triset into production and into your hands before this date!
This project has taken 2 years of work and development and we are beyond excited to get our product into production.

Neko Harbour: The Card Game is reimplemented from A Pleasant Journey to Neko, which is a dice strategy game released in 2018. Neko Harbour: The Card Game keeps the spirit of the game and tries to access more players with its simpler and faster game play. 
Designed and illustrated by Citie Lo, Neko Harbour: The Card Game is an engine building strategy card game available for 2-4 players. In order to see more penguins and thus win the game, players will build their preparation line and send their ships to attractions in just two periods game length.  
With numerous combinations of tableau building by cards, players create their own unique action procedure in the game. In the meantime, the competition between players on attractions brings a thrilling and exciting experience. 
We are The Wood Games. Neko Harbour: The Card Game is our 3rd game and 2nd Kickstarter project. This time we are happy to announce that Sylex (published Dreamscape) will be our distribution partner. Sylex will help to manage retailer copies and bring French version of the game to you. More languages are coming soon!

Recognized as the “king of all porcelain” in China, falangcai porcelain represents the country’s highest accomplishment in kiln-firing techniques.
According to historical records, by 1684 during Emperor Kangxi’s rule, Western copper cloisonné enamelware entered China from Guangzhou and other ports. European enamel craftsmen were invited to the imperial court to share their techniques, and from this basis, Chinese craftsmen then transferred the use of enamel onto porcelain, giving birth to falangcai porcelain in 1716. 
It was a precious secret kept in the imperial court, only a few deserving ministers were rewarded the gift. Elsewhere, it was hardly seen. As the craft was arduous, time consuming, and costly, the secret of falangcai porcelain was eventually lost by the end of Qianlong’s reign in1796 in the late Qing Dynasty. During the 100 year history of enamel use during the reigns of Kangxi, Yongzheng, and Qianlong, around 1,400 pieces were produced, and according to historical records, less than one third - around 400 pieces are preserved, mainly kept in the Palace Museum of Beijing and National Palace Museum in Taipei. At international auctions, these works repeatedly get high bidding offers, usually in hundreds of millions. Needless to say, they are extremely valuable. 
Falangcai golden pheasant vase (guyuexuan-type) from the Qianlong period, Sotheby’s Hong Kong, 2005, hammer price 115,480,000 HKD
  Falangcai Imperial Famille Rose “Swallows” Bowl from Qianlong period, Christie’s Hong Kong, 2006, hammer price 151,230,000 HKD.
THE ARTIST：
Sun Heyang, the first folk artist to replicate Chinese imperial falangcai porcelain.
Groping blindly and experimenting for 13 years, two generations of Sun’s family read several libraries worth of historical texts, trying thousands of kiln techniques while taking on financial and emotional strife, Sun finally succeeded in reviving the imperial falangcai porcelain technique that had been lost for more than two centuries. 
An Impossible Task: In 1999, Sun, a graduate in fashion design who had already made a name in the fashion world, was looking to try his hand at new endeavors. Persuaded by his father and uncle who are both porcelain artists living in Jingdezhen, he began to research the falangcai technique. 
For eight years, Sun and his father led a team of a dozen workers, invested their own funds in repeated attempts, tried and failed countless times and burned up their hard-earned savings soon. They failed to produce this special imperial porcelain, and on the day after the opening ceremony of 2008 Beijing Olympics, Sun’s father passed away. 
Sun spent a whole year to revive from the sadden reality and to restart the project, fueled by the desire to fulfill his dream and that of his deceased father.  
In 2013, Sun finally succeeded in producing a small bowl with the falangcai technique. He still recalls clearly his first reaction: “Father, your son has finally realized your dream.” Now every morning, he lights incense for his father, feeling as though the man is still by his side, guiding and protecting him through the biggest set backs and failures, always encouraging him to carry forward bravely. 
His father’s favorite phrase was: “You can fail for multiple times, but you have to learn from each failure and you must be steadfast in your work. In the art world you've chosen, not even an ounce of falsehood is allowed.” This pursuit of perfection encouraged Sun to move forward, seeing him through to the day when he could taste success.
From his first success of producing falangcai porcelain in 2013 until today, Sun’s team has not only revived the beauty of falangcai, they have also received high appraisal and recognition from the world of ceramics experts. The head of the National Museum of China’s center for appraisal of cultural relics, Yue Feng, says: “Zhenghegong has revived the imperial technique of falangcai, creating a contemporary artistic treasure. Today’s artworks are tomorrow’s cultural treasures.”
Falangcai "Celestial Vase" created by Sun was brought by Tiangong-2 to the outer space on Nov 25, 2016, the Mid-Autumn Day
THE HANDCRAFT & PRODUCTION：
Why each piece of falangcai porcelain is so valuable? The extremely difficult production results in very few completed works.
The production of falangcai porcelain includes 167 processes, from hand pulling clay and the gongbi painting method, to the application of color and repeated firings. To this day new, works continue to be made. Each step must be carried out flawlessly as even the smallest of imperfections can destroy any hope of completing a piece.
Why was the falangcai research process so difficult? The first reason is the rarity of the raw material. The second is the complexity of the decorative process. The third is the difficulty of the firing process. These factors severely limit the amount of falangcai porcelain that can be made. Completed works are extremely rare.
The raw clay used to produce falangcai porcelain must be extremely pure. From one ton of porcelain clay, only half a kilo is suitable for use. Similarly, only pure, natural precious stones can be used to make pigments for color. They cannot have pollutants, and must be high density and high luster. During the Qing Dynasty, the oil used for falangcai porcelain, called Dolmen oil, was imported from Persia and cannot be found today. Its origins are also impossible to trace. 
Sun’s team developed their own natural vegetable-based oil (Dolmen oil) used to mix the pigments of falangcai porcelain, and through countless attempts, they solved the dilemma of finding an adhesive that could bind the pigment to the ceramic surface.
The decorative patterning of falangcai porcelain are elaborate and similar to oil painting, using oil as one of the ingredients. With no foundation or clear glaze on the surface necessary, simply the thickness of the color itself creates variation of shades causing the decorative pattern to visibly protrude and giving it a sparkling luster. With a wide range of details in color, fine details can be magnified for appreciation.
The firing process of falangcai porcelain is also very difficult and differs from the firing process of blue and white ceramics—which can be completed in a single firing. Falangcai porcelain must be fired multiple times. The patterns must be redrawn and color reapplied, then sent back into the kiln all before a perfect piece can be completed. This makes the rate of completion extremely limited.
The firing process of falangcai porcelain is also rife with uncertainties. With variations in the weather’s humidity , the heat of the kiln and the time needed for firing may vary. 
Across the four seasons of the year, the temperature of the kiln, the time allotted for firing, and the object’s position inside in the kiln may very. If these aspects are not further researched, the risks are high.
Data from the tremendous number of successes and failures has been collected by Sun’s team, with thousands of entries for the different color combinations all forming a large database. With any given falangcai piece, the team can use their own color cards, compiled from summarizing the data, and compare them to the porcelain to gauge what temperature and what humidity resulted in the effect. These attributes have all been studied quite thoroughly.
How To Appreciate Falangcai?
According to The Book of Ceramics, There are  "four delights of falangcai porcelain":
"White grain, as white as snow—the first;
Thin as eggshell or the murmur of desire escaping a lover’s lips—the second;
Refinement exuded in even the smallest of details, light dances upon flower petals busting into a breadth of brilliant colors and the soft down of butterfly wings, while the neck is poised gracefully—the third.
Writing and motif in calligraphy and seal are as thin as the head of a fly—the fourth."
Introducing "Butterfly Lovers Cup – Falangcai Cup With Budding Flowers And Butterflies" & Why Kickstarter:
The design was inspired by the invaluable counterpart belongs to the collection of the Art Institute of Chicago from the Qianlong period. The Butterfly Lovers is one of China’s oldest myths of eternal love: two butterflies appear accompanied with entangled flowers, representing the continuous circle of life and gift passed down from generation to generation. 
Butterfly Lovers represents everlasting love, commitment and loyalty. The cup symbolizes the sincerest wish for love and eternity.
Packaging for the Butterfly Lovers cup follows the carpentry methods of the Qing Dynasty, using nanmu (evergreen) wood to make an opulent case constructed with mortise and tenon joints.
From the first time in 1716, when the Qing Dynasty succeeded in creating the first piece of falangcai porcelain, to present in 2016, the technique lives on to its 300th anniversary. in order to memorialize this special moment in time, we plan to create a limited edition of 300, with 100 released overseas, in order to give those interested in art, porcelain and collecting a chance to own a falangcai piece. These cups represent eternal sincerity and can be handed down from generation to generation.
Sun is leading a team of twenty in creating the cups. From choosing the clay and creating the form, to firing the white clay, painting, firing again and adding color, each cup takes around twenty days to complete. As the processes of decorating and forming the cups is quite complex, only three cups can be placed in the kiln at once, making the yield quite small, but the results are astounding, proven through the ingenuity of 13 years used to revive the falangcai technique lost for two centuries. These gifts can stand the test of time.
Art is boundless. Passion, creativity, commitment, and the persistent pursuit of true art  are shared trait of all human beings. We hope through this crowd funding, everyone can gain an opportunity to appreciate the very best porcelain art and possess something that represents love and an unremitting pursuit of artistic excellence.

Douglas Dunn’s Vain Combat and The Snake have been anonymously prowling the streets of New York City for a year and half. In Central Park, Lincoln Center, Times Square, Chelsea Market, Bryant Park, Union Square, Tompkins Square Park, The Highline, and many other Manhattan locations, the two dances have offered themselves up gratis at various times of day to passersby and to crowds that gather.
The Company is now invited to participate in La MaMa’s 50th Anniversary event on Sunday, October 16, 2011 (www.lamama.org). Both pieces will be on view, twenty-one dancers in all. Because we are "going public," we are asking for your support. Your donation will go directly to pay dancers' salaries. Seeing their prowess, you'll be glad you became part of our endeavor.

Douglas Dunn & Dancers thanks you in advance and looks forward to seeing you on East 4th Street between The Bowery and 2nd Avenue on Sunday, October 16th, 2 - 6 PM.

Hi, we are Komnata. One of the largest franchise networks of escape adventures in the world. Our flagship London branch, located in Covent Garden, has been welcoming guests since 2018.

Komnata rooms are designed to test your spirit, wit and problem solving skills.

To begin, thank you for simply checking out our project. There are so many worthwhile projects here, and we are honored that Kickstarter has approved our project to be included in this community.
Our Values
We are committed to supporting small-batch & family-run wineries. We understand that most of the time people want an easy, affordable bottle of wine to enjoy. We only ask though, regardless of whether or not we reach our goal, that you continue to support craft winemakers. It's as easy as making sure that each 5th bottle of wine you buy comes from a boutique winery or family-run vineyard.
The Short & Sweet (scroll down for 4 more videos!)
The California Wine Exchange is a start-up retail wine shop & tasting room opening near Burbank, California. And as our name suggests, we will specialize in craft & boutique wines from only the Golden State.
That said, helping us raise $5,000 will give us the best start possible by covering some big up-front expenses such as:
Permits & Licenses.
Materials and supplies to turn an empty retail space into a beautiful tasting room.
AND of course...Uncle Sam wants his cut too! We have to pay taxes on the money we raise here!
The photo below is just a possibility of how we would like the interior of our wine shop to appear...  
More About The California Wine Exchange
There are literally thousands and thousands of California wines from small-batch wineries, family-run vineyards, and green-oriented winemakers that you never see on the shelves at your grocery store. Sustainable-farmed vineyards mean their wine costs more, which means big distributors aren't interested. We're going to fix that. In addition, we are going to create an immersive wine tasting experience that will showcase some of these unique wine gems. And part of that experience is removing the stigma of high-falutin', hoity-toityness of wine, and create an environment where even beginner wine drinkers feel like they belong.
Do you like wine like Tyrion likes wine?
 We believe that California wine means to Californians as much as Huntington Beach, Yosemite, The Golden Gate Bridge, Hollywood, and Disneyland. And with over 5,000 winemakers in California alone, it's easy to see that there is a lot of California to love.
And we don't want to be simply four walls & a roof selling fermented grape juice, we want to bring the experience of a California vineyard tasting room to the people of our community. We're going to create an environment that transports our customers' imagination to California wine country. 
Wine itself is an experience in every bottle. Every bottle a story. Each night we will feature a themed tasting events to tell these stories, including, but not limited to: Latino winemakers, Central Coast wines, Women winemakers, Lake County, Pinot Noir & Sauvignon Blanc, Petaluma Gap wines, Black winemakers, Temecula and of course, Napa cabs!
In the following video, Mark goes more in depth about the mission and goals of the California Wine Exchange...  
What We Are Looking For & How You Can Be A Part
We're looking to raise a minimum of $50,000 from the Kickstarter community. As anyone in the wine business will tell you... "it ain't easy." And we don't expect it to be. It's long days and a lack of social life that we're in for. You have to have a passion for it. And that we do! Wine is one of those things that connect people in a special way, and opening our store is going to allow us to share our love of California wine with our community.
Permits & Licenses: All of the legal fees, local permits, and state licenses.
Materials & Supplies: As you can see from the photos and our video, we are NOT just going to be four walls and a roof with some wine inside. We want to craft a beautiful environment in which to sample wine! We are skilled enough to do quite a bit of our own labor & installation so the money we raise will mainly go towards raw materials.
Taxes: Many people may not be aware of this, but we have to pay taxes on the money that we raise here on Kickstarter.

More about Mark and his partner in wine, Joe (video)
In addition to bringing their passion for wine to this start-up, our two founders each bring unique qualities...
Mark Prior (video at bottom of page) is an avid wine aficionado and has traveled to wine-growing regions throughout California as well as destinations in France and Italy. He's so passionate about wine that he organizes the annual wine-tasting road trips for his circle of friends, and is regularly the "go-to" guy for wine recommendations. Mark currently pays the bills as a stagehand for concerts, special events and some television production. His professional background however features over 10 years of sales & marketing experience including direct to consumer sales and agency client management. He possesses a BBA degree in management from Georgia Southern University.
Joe Barton brings over 20 years of retail management experience to our venture. This includes positions as store general manager at companies such as Starbucks and Best Buy. Joe was also his graduating class' valedictorian at Platt College.

Started this adventure almsot at the beginning of covid. Being home more meant more coffee and we went on the search for light/blonde roast in Edmonton. As we tested different local brands (and some chain store bands) of coffee we quickly realized light roast wasn’t other roasters priority. Not being able to find a light roast we wanted to commit to we began learning how to roast our own beans, then we fell head over heels in the art and science of roasting coffee. Now we are at the point that we want to grow and provide light roast coffee to not just friends and family, the funds will be going straight into that goal. To reach that gaol we need to invest in a larger cofffee roaster and afterburner, bean cooler, other food safe containers and tools, and finally need to upgrade to a shop with more space.

Overview
My name is Angie Rucker, and I want to invite you to be a part of my photography project – “Hollow Bones.” As an artist, I construct scenes to create fictional narratives in the form of painterly, surreal photographs.
Hollow Bones examines the role of women in marriage and the theme of love and hate existing simultaneously. I view this project as a novella told in still photographs. The series portrays the various stages of an unhealthy relationship from the point of view of an unnamed woman living on an unnamed street in an old historic section of Columbus, Ohio. It is an attempt to visually portray incidents and emotions with a model and the use of heavily symbolic objects.  I tend to begin projects that are informed by experiences I have, or those close to me have, and then I look at how those experiences exist on a larger level and in different circumstances.
I won’t be able to begin this project without Kickstarter funds, therefore, I am unable to show any work in progress at this time. However, I did want to show some of my previous work so you can get an idea of the type of images I have created in the past. My work is continually changing and evolving, and this series will take me in an exciting new direction.
    The Plan
I will hire a model and rent this house
for a month, It's an intriguing old house in an historic district of Columbus, Ohio; with hardwood floors, some of which have been painted white,
and large windows, it provides the required light I need since I use only natural lighting for all my images. I plan to transform the rooms of this house into spaces to construct the staged scenes of a relationship’s journey,
as the model engages with various objects as visible metaphors, either organic or items that I create, while she physically changes, to create a heavily symbolic, sequenced, visual narrative.
Why I Chose this Project
I am curious about the reasons why relationships fail and what the stages of that failure might look like. How hate lives with love. How couples relate to one another, how love decays, and how that decay touches all those around them. 
I seek the fulfillment that comes from exploring and photographing human emotion and turning that into something physical. In addition, I feel a desire to take a seemingly cliché or dismal subject and display it in an entirely unique way. 
Finally, I am drawn to the natural shape of the female form. The line of a neck or the curve of a shoulder I feel are inherently beautiful and so I am compelled to infuse my work with femininity.
The Outcome
The final outcome will be a cohesive series of 12-15 digitally photographed, archival pigment prints that I plan to submit to galleries as I seek representation, and also to various organizations offering artist grants, in order to apply for funding for future projects to build my body of work. These prints will be predominantly monochromatic with hints of color creating a surreal quality, as if they were bits and pieces of a dream.
I will be working with a master printer here in Columbus who has printed my museum quality prints for previous shows. The final prints will be on archival quality, cotton rag paper printed with archival inks. 
The Value
So what might be the value in being part of a project like mine? Well, as many have written before me, to make Art. To create something beautiful out of something that might seem quite the opposite. To create something where once there was nothing. To create images that make people stop, think, and reflect. And, most importantly, to evoke emotion and provoke dialogue!
Please share this Kickstarter campaign with your community. Facebook, twitter and emails are a great way to let this project be experienced. With Kickstarter, its all or nothing. Thank you for being a part of " Hollow Bones" and supporting my project!
Qualifications
First – my work has been exhibited in multiple galleries and juried exhibitions across the United States (please see my full bio/profile for a list, or better yet, please visit www.angierucker.com where you can view more of my work and bio information) My awards include The Saville Gallery’s Annual Photographic Competition in Cumberland, MD where my image Someone New was chosen as First Place Winner by Juror Kenneth Garrett, Photographer for National Geographic Magazine, Bronze Award Winner of ArtForward’s Online Exhibition where my image Last Leaves of Autumn was chosen by Christa Dix, Director of Wall Space Gallery in Santa Barbara, CA, and The Director's Award for my image Sleeps with Butterflies 2 chosen for the "Flight" Exhibition at The Photoplace Gallery in Vermont.
Secondly - my passion to create this series and see it through.  I began as a self-portrait artist - often posing in 20 degree weather wearing very little, as in this image – this is all ice!
or covering myself with clay and volcanic ash while wearing nothing but ace bandages
or blindly running from angry bees that were attracted to the flowers I held, with my head entirely wrapped in cheese cloth
or getting the razor sharp porcupine needle necklace that I made tangled in my dress and around my neck strangling and stabbing me while I changed outfits in the middle of a field
all of which were shot without any assistance. (For more information about the series these photos are from, visit my website angierucker.com).
I am extremely excited about the potential of this project and i know that it will be a very meaningful culmination of thought, emotion, and energy. I am passionate about seeing it actually come to life and want so badly to see it through to the end. I so hope you will take this ride with me.  
Finally, if this project gets funded, I have pledged to contribute 5% of any profits I receive from it to other Kickstarter projects at KickingItForward.org  Thank you!

Our Program
At Now Next Dance we believe in transformational experiences. We also believe that the moving body informs humanity. Our mission is to cultivate leadership, wellness, and creativity in and through contemporary dance. We do this by helping tweens, college dancers, and professional dance artists create a life, emboldened by dance. 
Help us Bridge the Gap this Summer
After five years of running summer workshops that bring together middle school girls, college dance majors, and professional dance artists, we are expanding to provide a life-span approach to mentoring in and through dance. This summer we are offering 4 projects across the country, and we need your help to Bridge the Gap between our fall fundraising and tuition revenue--and our costs.
Help us offer four, meaningful projects this summer! We need to raise $5,000 through this crowd-funding campaign. Where will your dollars go?
-To pay our amazing faculty of dance artists and educators this summer. We have a gap between the money we raised last winter, our tuition revenues, and our costs. Why? Over half of our young dancers and college students are on partial scholarship this summer. This summer we are running programs in NC, TX, SC, and MO and we have dancers attending from all over the country.
-To conduct a series of summer strategy meetings with stakeholders, constituents, and allies, as we seek to refine and enrich our mission and programming.
-To fund travel expenses for our external researcher, an independent dance education scholar who will be studying our program and informing us on what we are doing well or where we are missing the mark, and she'll share her findings with the broader dance research community.

***Note: Orders will be fulfilled once our campaign is successfully funded. After we reach our goal, questionnaires will be sent out in order to gather your address, sizing, and any other requests.
 Where do you put your phone when you work out? 
We feel your pain. Our team has witnessed countless cell phones falling out of pockets, sliding out of waist bands and being crushed by weights. Do you hold your phone during a 5k race? Do you pocket dial people during workouts? Worst of all, who looks good in a fanny pack? The scenarios are endless! What if there was an answer to all of this? 
Introducing Pro Concept Gear (PCG) 
At Pro Concept Gear, we're committed to making workout gear that makes sense. Our team has created products that not only give you more flexibility and freedom while working out, but also give you less to worry about. Your phone is with you, without hassle or question.
 What is the Smart Pocket?
The Smart Pocket is the first of its kind; it is a cool, comfortable and convenient place for your phone. Our pocket is strategically located on our compression gear for durability, comfort and easy access to your device. 
  In today's world, staying connected is a must. PCG keeps your devices with you wherever you are. All PCG products have been rigorously tested by high level athletes participating in activities including running, biking, climbing, weight lifting, cross-fit, yoga and attempting extreme sports.
  At Pro Concept Gear, we believe that you should feel good and look good. PCG is a patent protected fusion of fashion, innovation and functionality.
Our apparel not only looks great, but it also protects you from harmful UV Rays. The moisture wicking technology built into the fabric allows you to cool off quicker and keep odors away.
Fitness and technology are rapidly evolving. Even with headphones transitioning to becoming completely wireless, we believe that people will want to stay connected as wearable technology continues to be adopted worldwide. 
  Your initial funding will help us make large quantity orders with our fabric and raw material suppliers. With the ability to make more inventory, we can deliver your PCG Apparel as quickly as possible.
We have a strong relationship with our manufacturer and are working together to match our increasing demand. Any profit from this Kickstarter will be invested into sustainably growing new distribution channels, brand/product development and to order inventory for fulfillment. With your help through Kickstarter, we will be able to produce and release more products in 2017. 
All orders will be shipped from our fulfillment warehouse in Orlando, FL. We evaluated dozens of companies for reputation, reliability, and experience before choosing this critical partner. For all purchases, standard shipping rates will apply.
For fitness enthusiasts outside of the US, shipping is priced accordingly. Because policies around customs and duties can vary by country, please check yours in advance to avoid any complications down the line.

Sebastián ha preparado casi todo para irse al extranjero, solo le falta despedirse de Pablo, su mejor amigo. Antes de partir, decide pasar un día entero con él para recordar los buenos tiempos y confesarle que se va. Este día juntos les hará entender a ambos que a pesar de la distancia y lo que pueda pasar, una amistad verdadera nunca termina. 
Mi nombre es Octavio Pacheco, soy el director y el guionista de este cortometraje. Esta historia habla sobre mis vivencias, mis maneras de ver el mundo, el valor de la amistad, el cariño que hay entre dos amigos y sobretodo sobre las despedidas, un tema muy difícil para mí. 
Quiero contar esta historia porque yo estuve en los zapatos de Sebastián, a mi me pasó lo mismo, recibí la oportunidad de irme a estudia al extranjero, sin embargo por el miedo y cobardía de dejar de ver a mis amigos, decidí quedarme.
Mi cortometraje busca hacer reflexionar al espectador sobre disfrutar cada momento que pasa con sus seres queridos, ya que muchas veces no valoramos el tiempo que pasamos con ellos y nos lamentamos de eso cuando ya no están cerca de nosotros.
