Kefir is a traditional fermented beverage with numerous health benefits: but to get the best of it, it has to be fresh – and for this do-it-yourself preparation is the best. Those of you who already know kefir will probably agree that this is a very refreshing, tasty and also healthy beverage.
HOW WE GOT FROM KEFIR TO KEFIRKO  
When a few people who have to keep their minds busy all the time - whether it is making music, design, branding, writing or preparing food - meet, you can be sure something new is bound to emerge. One day we came across kefir, liked its taste and noticed its beneficial effects. As we advocate the DIY principle, we started making kefir at home. Soon we realized that the procedure tends to be quite messy and complicated: jars, sieves, measuring cups, spoons, cloths, lids...milk, kefir grains...no metal, food-safe plastic...just enough of everything for another DIY intervention. This is why we started thinking about a solution that would minimize the number of utensils needed, keep our kitchens tidy, be handy and nice to look at. It took us some time, and since we do not like cheap, half-way solutions, but functional and sustainable products, we finally ended up with the KEFIRKO prototype.  
We tested it and we believe that it can make the lives of kefir-makers a lot easier.
We firmly believe that you, too, will enjoy preparing and consuming your own kefir thanks to KEFIRKO.  
KEFIRKO EXPLAINED
Kefir making requires specific preparation. KEFIRKO is a specifically designed glass jar with two different purpose-specific lids which enables easier kefir-making at home. Put the kefir grains in the liquid of your choice and allow the content to ferment for 24 hours. After that, the grains should be separated from the freshly‑made kefir. KEFIRKO enables optimal fermentation conditions and simplifies the procedure of separating the grains from the kefir at the same time.

KEFIRKO is designed so that every element has a functional purpose, and thus the preparation of kefir is made as simple as possible. Also, the materials used do not react with the contents so the kefir can preserve its unique taste and freshness.
 
MILK AND WATER KEFIR
Both milk and water kefir require kefir grains. For water kefir crystal grains are used, but the basic production principle remains the same.
DELICIOUS KEFIR DISHES
Either fresh or as an ingredient in smoothies, shakes, icecreams, breadspreads, salads, cakes, cookies, pies, puddings, pancakes… Your favourite meal can easily be even more delicious with kefir.
WHY MAKE KEFIR AT HOME
Making kefir by yourself gives you the opportunity to enjoy all the richness and health benefits of the beverage. Since no preservatives are added, you have better control over the quality of your kefir. Compared to the kefir you can buy in stores, the homemade beverage contains a much higher degree of kefir-specific active substances which are important for your health.
WHY DRINKING KEFIR IS GOOD FOR YOU  

Several studies have confirmed the medicinal properties of kefir: it is rich in vitamin B, contains folic acid, easily digested proteins, good bacteria helping your digestion, antimicrobial strains of lactobacilli, etc. Besides its numerous benefits to the gastrointestinal system, other positive effects of kefir have also been accounted for: preventing and treating cancer, lowering the blood pressure, healing the skin after severe burns, and helping people with allergies (and, yes, it can be also consumed by the lactose intolerant).
   
WHERE TO OBTAIN THE GRAINS
Kefir grains are constantly growing and multiplying, and it is common practice to share your extras with others. To help you with sharing we set up the KEFIRHOOD portal, based on the sharing is caring principle, where you can share your extras or obtain fresh grains. You can also share or obtain kefir grains through various social networks where people connect for this purpose.
HOW SENSITIVE ARE KEFIR GRAINS
Kefir grains are living organisms which – just like you – need food to live. But don’t worry. Even the more mobile among you can preserve the grains. During shorter or longer periods of absence, the grains can be stored in a cold place, which will slow down their activity.
MULTIFUNCTIONAL FORM
While your kefir grains are having a rest, your KEFIRKO is waiting for new adventures. You may try growing your own sprouts or experiment and find other yet unknown ways to use it.
STRETCH GOAL #1
If we reach the stretch goal of $40,000, we will add a squeezer for free to each KEFIRKO pack. Now you will be able to squeeze fresh juice directly into your water kefir.
STRETCH GOAL #2
If we reach the stretch goal of $55,000, we will offer you a new reward: the KEFIRKO kit. You can use the large glasses to store your kefir in the refrigerator for secondary fermentation, and in the small one you can store your kefir grains. The glasses can be nested one into another, and finally in the KEFIRKO jar, like Russian dolls. You will also be getting a kitchen cloth.
DETAILS
Unscrew the lid just a tiny bit and the fruit flies will not be able to get inside the jar. V-shaped slots designed to keep the grains of all sizes in.
  KEFIRKO IN COLOURS

While the whiteness of freshly made kefir associates with health and inner peace, an active lifestyle is full of dynamics and vivid colours. This goes hand in hand with the preparation of your own kefir: just pick the KEFIRKO in the colour you like most – so that other members of your household will know that this KEFIRKO is yours and yours only.


We are very proud to announce that the KEFIRKO project was supported by:
 
TIMELINE

  FURTHER DEVELOPMENT OF THE KEFIRKO PRODUCT
The product is designed to allow further upgrades with low-priced accessories that will make the production of other healthy, homemade foods (fresh cheese and whey, butter, buttermilk, etc.) possible.

HELP US OUT

Our aim is to support kefir makers all over the world and also to promote a healthier lifestyle through do-it-yourself food production. Your support would help us in producing the molds needed to manufacture the final product, and in a continued development of the kefirhood.com portal.

EVE BY NATASHA MARSON
Hi. I am Natasha Marson , visual artist, landscape painter, living in Spain. My life is dedicated to Art in any kind of form of creation. My very special passion is Nature and I put in my art work all passion, feelings, sense of beauty and harmony , positive energy and creativity from the heart . I do believe that everyone likes nature, our beautiful Earth.
I have studied in art collage and then in Photo collage, working as a photographer in Moscow. Later, in 1999 I have moved in Spain, looking for inspiration.
I found it!
The first visit to local Salt Lake with pink color surrounded by white salt , looking like ice, amazed me . It was surreal  , I felt like was moved  to other dimension of peace and serenity. Indescribable !    Microclimate created the largest salt lakes in Europe in Spain in the town of La Mata, has been declared one of the healthiest in Europe, according to the World Health Organization.
I have started working on serial “Enclosed Space” and it is took me 5 years to collect material ,then another 2-3 years to create art work and  make my first art exhibition and another one and more… (see bio)
Today I am ready to present my new Art Project “VIOLET PEACE”, which included creation of 10 stunning  landscape  paintings of amazing Salt Lake,
Paintings will be in different sizes,from 100 x 100 cm up to 100 x 140 cm with the following opening of Art Exhibition in the local gallery.All proceeds from the campaign go to the cost of materials, producing paintings, special pro-scan to create top quality reproductions for my backers and putting on an Art Exhibition in the Art Gallery, which includes inauguration party night, recorded on video and 2,5 weeks of displaying art works.
Join me on this exciting journey and you will see all steps of creative process.
I promise, you will not be disappointed !
But I really need your support. With your help ones dream comes true!
You will receive beautifully created rewards according your bid, certificate of authenticity and also - extra surprise gifts!  
I am looking forward to work for you, my supporters and dear friends!

The Painting Process
The painting process takes time, means, lots of hours of work.
Several very fine layers of paint will be built up over the canvas day by day.
All paintings will be  produced on the highest quality 100% cotton canvas, using high quality oil paints and mediums.
All paintings will be hand signed .Prints will be signed and numbered, before they are carefully packed into rugged mailing tubes along with a certificate and shipped to you..
Cotton Canvas is flexible and suitable for stretching around a wooden frame in case
you decide framed art work make in your local print shop.
The sizes of art work do not include some extra borders, normally 3-5cm each side.
 Risks and challenges
My challenge here is dealing with the bigger size of canvas. Until now I did not
use canvas size more than 90 x90 cm. But I have necessary skills to work it out !
Another challenge is to deal with professional laboratory, meaning: talk through every step of work and be in charge of whole process to get from them what I want - the best possible result !
 Communication with my backers

Hi Everyone!
I'm so honored and delighted to be presented by On the Boards in Northwest New Works. June 9 and 10 @ 8pm on the Mainstage!
The Project
Falling Short is a duet between Shane Donohue and myself. 
I am a trans man and Shane is cis. Together we stand our manhood up against society's rubric for measuring masculinity. Successes and failures abound. Desire and heartbreak wind in and out of our bodies. We're entangled. So similar and so different. 
Being a child of the 90s, I've been looking at those men that I wanted to be, 90s heartthrobs, recalling those daydreams about what it would feel like to live inside their large hard bodies with soft floppy hair. How would it feel for clothes to touch their skin? How would it feel to flex their muscles? How would it feel to be touched while inside their body? Witness our exploration.
Your Support
I've set a goal of $3,500. 
Paying Shane and myself $10/hr for rehearsals. Dancing is a valuable way to spend our time. Valuable to our community and to ourselves. I'd like to value our work by paying us!
Paying our Lighting Designer, Kent Cubbage. He's a masterful artist and deserves to be fairly compensated. 
Paying our photographer. Dillon Webster took our promo shots! He did such an incredible job!! Let's pay him for his work!
Props. We have very fun surprise props that need to be purchased!!
Costumes. Don't worry, we'll only be wearing underwear. Calivin's ;)
Elby Brosch is a trans masculine dancer and choreographer. He began dancing at age 10 because his mom wanted him to do ballet. Dance quickly became a safe haven, a way to connect to a body that felt hard to understand. As gender became confusing, movement became clear. He gained control and intimacy with his body, and learned to process emotion and trauma through movement. Dance has become a vital part of his existence. Now, he choreographs to build connections and understandings from a marginalized view point to the greater community. He distills the trans experience down to what makes us human, and then he offers that to his audiences. Empathy heals wounds and builds connections. He has presented his work at Velocity in a co-produced show, This That & The Other, and Velocity produced shows, Fall Kick Off and Next Fest Northwest. His work has also been presented in Seattle International Dance Festival and Mo-Wave.
Shane Donohue is a Seattle based dance artist currently working with zoe|juniper, Kim Lusk, Alyssa Casey’s Squatch Tanztheater, and Elby Brosch. His performative philosophy derives from an interest in movement and creative practices as they provide him an opportunity to gain new insight on his perception of the world. While studying Dance and Psychology at University of Wisconsin-Stevens Point, he received the Incoming Freshman Scholarship in Dance, the Bukolt Family Scholarship, the Chancellor’s Leadership Award, and the Outstanding Graduating Senior Award. Shane is currently a Creative Resident at Velocity Dance Center.

This June I will be an artist in residence at Studio Kura in Fukuoka, Japan. During the residency I will resume my series of Nocturne drawings that began last summer in Wassaic, NY.
 I am seeking benefactors to assist with funding during this residency in exchange for one of the drawings I will produce while in Japan. Part of my time spent at Studio Kura will be dedicated to production, but I am also looking to liaise with local artists for education in traditional Japanese drawing techniques and paper-making. 
With additional resources (thanks to you!) I will be able to better expand on my Nocturne series. These drawings are each roughly 16” x 20” and are drawn with sumi ink on rice paper, but during the residency I intend on experimenting with other kinds of pigmentation and paper surfaces. The drawings are made at night and drawn “blind”, meaning I don’t look at the drawing while making it. The process is about observation of not only environmental phenomena, but also one of mediation between internal and external psychological space.
In exchange for your kind support of $50, you will receive one of the Nocturnes, signed and dated. For $200 you will receive a framed Nocturne of your choosing. The end of my residency will culminate in an exhibition of one hundred of these drawings in Studio Kura’s gallery. The exhibition title, One Hundred Views of Nothing refers to Hiroshige and Hokusai’s famous  ukiyo-e depictions of Edo and Mount Fuji. Those who lend support prior to the exhibition (date to be announced) will be listed as such in the gallery signage. 
For more information on Studio Kura, please refer to their website: http://studiokura.info/en/ 
For more information about Andrew Prayzner, please refer to: http://www.andrewprayzner.com

Friends, Romans, Facebookers, lend me your ideas!
 I will paint 30 paintings in 30 days. The subject will be decided by you! Your inspiration is my motivation.You pitch the ideas and I'll choose one to paint each day. Then I'll post the new painting for you to see the results. It's as simple as that. 
So, challenge me to paint something I've never done before!
Why am I doing this?
I'd like to offer you a rare opportunity to collaborate in the genesis of a work of art, for me to expand my creative horizons, and for us to make original oil paintings available on the average person's budget. That's our goal!
If we can get 20 donations at the $150 level by December 15th, I'll be able to start shipping the 8"x10" paintings domestically, so they should arrive in time for Christmas.
Otherwise, they will be ready to ship at the end of the project.
Then, I will choose the best pieces to expand upon on 12"x16" canvases.

Who gets which painting? This will be a lot to juggle, so to be fair it has to be first come, first serve.
 What's the money for?
I'm going out on a limb, using money out of my own pocket to run this project for it's duration because I believe in it that much. If we don't meet the monetary goal, I'll be in quite a predicament!!! What I'm asking is to be reimbursed for my time and expenditure. 
I believe in people, so I believe that you'll help me to be generous to you and many others!
I really can't do it without you, so tell your friends!

Hello there! We are a film crew from the European Film College in Ebeltoft, Denmark, and we are currently in the process of making one of the biggest films of our year, and it's a non budget. That's why we need your help.  
What are we doing? 
We're raising money for an 8.5 min long short film, which is about a young woman who is afraid of death and tries to escape growing older and ‘decaying’ by taking care of her skin so much that it becomes an obsession. 
We follow the psychological struggles of this woman, Amy, and how she isolates herself and her fear from the world. Eventually her obsession drives her into madness. The story is about the human nature and how sometimes the talent human beings have, realizing that we exist, can work completely against us. It also critiques the beauty standards of the modern society and how young people are pressured into believing that beauty can determine who you are.
What does the money go to? 
The film will be shot in Copenhagen, so the money will mainly be spent on transportation of equipment, actors and our beloved crew. Furthermore the style and tone in the film are very important, and we will use the money on set design, props, costumes, extra lenses so we can achieve the style with extreme close-ups that we want. 
Who are we?
We are an international crew consisting of people from 6 different countries, and we are all students at the European Film College. So without further ado, here we are: 
Mimi van Rinsum - Writer & Director
Josefine Edstrand - Producer
Vivianne Werkhoven - Actress
Sine Juhl - Camera Operator
Toni Vucic - Light Director
Elettra Arnell - Sound and Editor
Daniela Ferreira - Sound Assistant
Klea Suitso - Light Assistant
Zita Leemans - Music
Laura Hesseldahl - Co-producer
Hrund Ölmudottir - Co-producer

Project
By preparing two separate exhibition in the museums of Cleves - the Museum Kurhaus Kleve and the Museum B.C. Koekkoek-House - an insight into the important and fascinating Wörner collection will be given. The collection covers over 500 years of art history, it comprises artworks from the late Medieval times up until modernity, as well as contemporary works from the 20th century.
The collection was given to the two museums after Rose Wörner passed away in 2015. The museums see it as their duty to acknowledge and present the huge legacy which has been given to them. 
Private collection
The  collection is until now mostly unknown. It is made up of over 5000 works of art: Paintings, prints, sculptures, and arts and crafts. 
The most important areas of the collection are: Medieval miniatures and incunabulums, asian art, old master drawings from the Baroque and Rococo, engravings of birds and plants, engravings of historic gardens and Rhine landscapes, Art nouveau vases, classical modern sculptures (Emil Nolde, Käthe Kollwitz, Renee Sintenis, Gerhard Marcks, Ewald Mataré, e.a.), modern and contemporary paintings and prints (Heinz Mack, Hann Trier, Otto Piene, Günther Uecker, Bernhard Schultze, Arnulf Rainer, e.a.)
The Wörner collection is an inheritance which was given to the city of Cleves and its citizens by the two generous collectors. It is the duty of the two museums to present it to the world. We strongly believe that the artworks assembled in the collection are of great value for the whole society and that they will help us to understand our cultural identity.
The Collectors
Rose and Gustav Wörter were famous garden and landscape architects. They were known for their very unique style of perfection in their profession, but art was their real passion in life. They acquired a huge knowledge and understanding, an amazing love and dedication for art. They loved to open their drawers filled with countless of works on paper and presented their artworks to anyone who came into their house to pay them a visit. Their love for art is present in every single piece of the collection.
Exhibition & Publication
Special theme rooms will bring back the atmosphere of Rose and Gustav Wörner's home and will give an insight to the visitors of the exhibition, what it was like to visit them at their house. There was this rule at the collector's home, that all works needed to be looked at in an order, one piece after the other. This way of showing the artworks inspired us to present them in small separate rooms, one might think of the French "Salon" of the 18th and 19th century.
In addition to that there will be a catalogue of the exhibition, which intends to present and describe the unbelievable bandwidth of this amazing collection.
Target group
The exhibition reaches out to people of all ages. There will be workshops and many other very interesting projects for kids and teenagers, with the aim to develop an understanding of the significance and importance of the collection. For adults and college students several different lectures will take place which will elaborate on the most important areas of the collection, like for e.g. the medieval miniatures or the master drawings from the Baroque. Furthermore there will be guided exhibition tours as well as exhibition tours exclusively guided by the curators. All activities will contribute to the understanding of the exhibition and its exhibits, its organization and realization, all in all to the understanding of the whole project in its entirety.

Why are we here? A 2017 Dragon Calendar!
    The calendar is comprised of all 12 months, with one of my favorite dragon paintings for each month and a separate all new unreleased cover image. 10 of the months are completed, with 2 more and the cover left to finish. The drawings of the last 3 images are completed, along with the color palettes. I have chosen to create these 3 new paintings so the calendar will have fresh, never seen before work and so backers can see the process as it happens. I will be updating all the backers with these new paintings as I move through the process of finishing them throughout the month this project is running. Each dragon has been painted in my signature style using watercolor, with each page of the calendar being designed by myself. Rarely will you get the chance to own a calendar that is completely created by the artist. Here is the only place to get a calendar where the artwork is not only created by me, but the calendar is also designed by myself from the ground up. 
     Calendars are printed by the same small press that printed the 2015 Dragon Calendar, their quality is stunning! Each image is bright and lush, every page will be full color with the artwork extending over both pages of every month. The numbers will be easy to read, and the day squares amply sized for writing notes and special dates. The Dragon Calendar will be 8.5 inches x 11 inches when closed and fold out to a full poster size of 11 inches x 17 inches when hanging. The pages are printed on 80# text paper, with full UV High Gloss Finish and a heavy 100# cover. Each Dragon Calendar is stapled in the middle and will have a prepunched hole, ready to hang! I’m excited to be working with the same small print press, they came out beautifully and will again!
Why Dragons? 
     They are one of the few truly universal icons and images of man kind. Every culture as far back as we can study have believed in Dragons. They had different meanings to different peoples, but always they are there. Some created the universe and our world, some created the lakes, rivers and oceans that surround us, and others the mountains and landscapes we call home. Yet still others sought to destroy, and became Gods of chaos or even death. Religion, philosophy, myth and even history all carry shadows of the Dragon. In our days the dragon still has a firm grip on our waking and sleeping minds. Through the written word, movies, games and advertisements Dragons still fly though our imaginations and sing in our hearts. And now, you can experience and enjoy them in this calendar.

Each year, The Brown Daily Herald's Commencement Magazine serves as a guide to the weekend for graduates, families and alums. The magazine provides news and analysis as we reflect on our four years and look forward to those to come. It profiles speakers and honorary degree recipients, details the weekend's events and — perhaps most importantly — provides a keepsake of your time at Brown.
Help us upgrade the magazine from dull newsprint to high-quality glossy pages, and celebrate the Class of 2012 in style.
Thank You!

A new gate has opened into The North Woods, a location set in a world of ancient magic and dark history, where Travelers and Dwellers fight for survival. 
Lost in the North Woods is the first Art Series expansion to Gatefall, and features amazing characters and sculpts by Alexei Konev. The series pays tribute to elements of Slavic lore while showcasing the unique character concepts that are a hallmark of Alexei's beautiful work.
 This expansion features three new fighters from this world: Volhv, Zimorodok, and The Drowned Warrior. Each fighter brings new abilities to the worlds of Gatefall, and this team is a lot of fun to play.
I knew when I made this game that I wanted to work with artists to give them a place to show their work in a fun and unique way. I am very honored to have Alexei, Gatefall's original artist, be the first of those artists to take us to their own world.
Lost in the North Woods requires Gatefall: Chapter One to play. Chapter one can be added to your pledge in this campaign. You can check out the original campaign for Chapter One here! 
Gatefall: Chapter One.
HUGE FIGURES
These figures are nearly triple the size of standard tabletop miniatures. This scale is reminiscent of the scale used for toy figures (100mm scale), and provides the same level of emotional connection to the design. That connection is elevated by the amount of detail and personality in each figure. 

THE PERFECT CANVAS FOR PAINTERS
Gatefall's scale provides painters with sculpts that are a pleasure to paint. Huge surfaces combined with sharp intricate details and realism provide you with endless opportunities for creative expression and execution.

SUPERB CASTS
Eastar has been manufacturing miniatures for years, and their dedication to excellence shows in their work. These are solid figures with minimal mold lines cast in durable gray PVC plastic. Details are shatter resistant and sturdy. The same factory manufactured Gatefall: Chapter One, and here is what Chapter One's backers had to say:
Chapter One has a 9.1 rating on Board Game Geek!

Volhv
In the Western Swamp there is death and decay, but also life. Volhv knows of all these things, the call of the solitary beasts, the rot of necrosis and that which feeds upon it, the movement and dance of the eternal stars and pale moon. Volhv can whisper to the dead, waking them from their slumber. He can tend to the living, knitting skin and bone together that was sundered in battle.


Zimorodok
The Southern Forests are a majestic natural cathedral of cyclopean trees, beautiful and unearthly sights and smells, and the enticing songs of birds that are too alluring and perfect for human ears. Travellers should heed the advice of the common folk and avoid listening to this music, lest they follow it to their death. Zimorodok's pot is filled with the flesh of such unfortunates, and her clothes are made from their skins and adorned with their bones.

The Drowned Warrior
In rare ages the sea is filled with spite and woe and wages war upon the land, waves claiming the earth and devouring the people and creatures living above the water. The Drowned Warrior was once a mortal man, but the kelpies and water maidens took his heart, chained it in iron and replaced it with an urchin. Now he is the rage of the sea, bringing horror and death to land dwellers for his cold wives far below the waves.


(Lost in the North Woods box design subject to change.)
I have an atypical approact to stretch goals. You can read all about my thoughts on them here in this update.

But the basic idea is: I constantly evaluate the performance of the campaign, then try to add as much as I can. Sometimes I can add things for free (shown as "$0" above), and sometimes the campaign's success allows us to produce something new that is too expensive to produce to add for free, so it is added as an add-on right in the campaign. This is a new option, as Kickstarter just launched the beta of in-campaign add-ons.

Some campaigns charge for a "Kickstarter Version" or a "Deluxe Version" that they then add things to, but I would rather have you choose what you actually want and don't want.
You can read about how to access the add-ons page in the FAQ.

 Paid add-ons now available in this campaign:

What's in the box?
Lost in the North Woods includes three new figures, standard Gatefall character boards for each figure, three health markers, six swamp zombie tokens, four drowned tokens, four grabbed tokens, and one new game board. Token configuration is subject to change.The cards, gate, dice, and an opposing team from Chapter One are needed to play.
How do you use it with Gatefall: Chapter One?
Simply replace one of the teams in Chapter One with the North Woods team, and you're all set!  You can also use the triangle gates (available as an add-on in the pledge manager) to play a 3-player game using all three teams of fighters.
FUTURE EXPANSIONS
There are a LOT of expansions coming. Want to drown a triceritops with The Drowned Warrior? You got it. Want to send some swamp zombies to take down a space ship? That's coming too. Want to see how a samurai does against a mech? Just wait. 
I'll post all about the future of this game in updates during the campaign!

We have created a short trailer of films that have already been realised to give you an idea of the vibe and vision for Regulars. 
The Story
After flirty encounters over americanos and banana bread, Lilly agrees to go on a date with Titus - a regular at the cafe she works at. Despite a promising start, things quickly take an unexpected turn. It seems that some things are better left as a fantasy, and some people's fantasies are other people's nightmares.
Look Book image
Project
The whole team of Regulars would be extremely grateful for your generosity towards this project. We are raising funds for the shoot and post-production, aiming big and applying for lots of film festivals.  Covid has been a big knockback for our industry and especially the indie film scene. 
Look Book image
We are very excited to have such a fantastic cast and crew behind it. Lauren Mackenzie will be directing this project. We are very excited to have her on board as she previously has won awards for her work. She has such an incredible vision and natural artistic eye and will really capture the complexity of these characters Titus and Lilly played by Tom Glynn-Carney and Tegen Short

This piece was first performed in December 2018 as a one women show and has further developed this into a short film. I have been working on adapting this and am now so overwhelmed that the ball is finally rolling we are finally producing it!  As a young woman in this industry, I am determined to make and produce female stories providing opportunities for people to showcase their work. 
Tegen Short
I am excited to be able to work with such fantastic people on a script that really includes all elements of cinema. With a gripping unpredictable plot, complex characters and beautiful cinematography. Please help us make our dream a reality and start up the small film business in London once again! We are aiming to film from the 4th-7th of February 2021!

Hello! We are Joelle Geisler and J.Haley. Both artists from Austin, TX, we join forces and imaginations to create the line of original animal paintings we call "Fierce and Furry".
And now we're gearing up for a much broader collaboration, and need YOUR help! This March, we we will be accompanying members of a wonderful local non-profit organization, Project Schoolhouse, to a remote mountainside village in rural Nicaragua. While they oversee construction of a new school building, we will be working with the children of this community. We will have supplies and lesson plans, but more than anything we want to celebrate the imagination with kids who otherwise might not have the time, space, and encouragement to create art.
Two years ago, Joelle worked with the children of another village, which planted the seed for this project. She brought supplies, lesson ideas, and a Spanish dictionary, and helped initiate a temporary art program in the community's school.
Over the course of a week, the kids gained confidence in their creations. The work that the children produced bore some strong similarities to that of kids here in Austin. They drew their homes, their friends, their families, their animals. They might have drawn chickens and cows instead of cats and dogs, but they still depicted the things they see around them.
The week ended with an outdoor art show at the construction site of the new school. Paintings, drawings, and collages were hung on the side of the old school house, and along the surrounding fence.
This year, some things will remain the same. We will still bring art supplies and lesson ideas, and encourage the kids to try new materials, including some that they see every day. Who knew that taking a machete to banana leaves could create perfect palettes?
This year, we want to continue the experience after we leave Nicaragua. Our feature project will be a collaboration between Austin and Nicaraguan youth. Words provided by Austin children will be paired with Nicaraguan students' pictures, and vice versa. These pages will be printed and bound, and two communities that may never meet in person, will meet via their creation.
What we look forward to most is sending copies of this book back to Nicaragua, to a rural farming community that has few picture books to begin with. We can only imagine their delight when they receive copies of something that THEY created, and when they find their own names, words, and pictures paired with the same from would-be peers in Austin. These are communities with no electricity, and therefore no refrigerators on which they can hang their sons' and daughters' latest crayon drawings. We think and hope that these books and their contents will become heirlooms, a source of pride for the children and their families.
We have a generous sponsor for our art supplies (thank you!). We are donating our time and most travel expenses. So, we are looking for some assistance with our plane tickets, the cost of printing and framing photos for display, and of course, the production of the picture book. The more backers, the more copies we can print. Any money made beyond our goal will further the promotion and display of this book and the kids' visions. Whether you give $1 or $100, every bit helps, and we are so grateful to you all for spreading the word and helping to make this happen.

Say hello to your new favorite tank, the re-engineered bra top designed for smaller-busted women -- a sophisticated and versatile basic that's anything but basic. You can wear it at home lounging, at work, during a night on the town, or at a yoga class in between.  As a comfortable work-from-home piece, it doesn't get any better.
Years in the making, we’ve broken the boundaries between the latest advances in activewear technology, precision intimates manufacturing and high-quality everyday wear. The Free Reign seamless Everyday Tank with integrated, buttery soft, custom-molded cups designed for A and B sizes provides just the right amount of coverage, support and shape to take women everywhere their day takes them. Best of all, no bra needed.
We've completed prototyping, wear testing and pilot production. With your help, Free Reign can fund our first run of the Everyday Tank Top in two colors and six sizes.

You no longer need to choose between bras too thin they show your headlights, push-ups that are overly padded or sports bras that flatten. You can say goodbye to uncomfortable underwire, sagging bra straps and frustrating removable cups that make you crazy.
To get our product just right, we worked with skilled designers who have years of experience developing innovations in bras, sports bras, and seamless apparel at major intimates and activewear brands. We went through dozens of prototypes and fit tests until we developed PERFECT modern everyday essentials for smaller-busted woman – light in support, comfortable to wear all day, and shape that doesn’t conform to any standard of beauty but their own. So great, it feels like a second skin against the body.
You’ll fall in love with the clean look and unconstrained feel of the all-in-one tank.
We've taken the iconic go-to tank and everyday bra and given you the best of both worlds, the bra and tank in one. Our design features lightly padded molded cups engineered to contour to the unique shape of smaller busts. With just the right amount of support and construction, you'll barely feel like you're wearing a bra.
The Free Reign Everyday Tank Top is the perfect go-to tank for work and play. We all gravitate to a tank as part of our daily uniform, and this modern essential will pair across your existing wardrobe. Worn alone, or with your favorite leather jacket, power suit, or denim shorts, it makes dressing easy.
In a world of endless consumption, we're making a wardrobe staple designed for versatility and longevity, so you need less and can do more with what you already have.
We're mindful of the environment and have chosen TENCEL™ yarns because they are made from tree pulp, a renewable resource from forests that are certified as sustainably managed by the Forest Stewardship Council (FSC). Ancient, endangered, and high-conservation value forests are off limits. Not all our materials, especially our molded foam cups, are as green as we want them to be. Free Reign is closely tracking materials science and will continue to push boundaries to lighten our product footprint.
We met when we were seven years old -- before we ever knew the purpose of a bra – and have been best friends ever since. Across the decades, we tumbled around as tomboys, confided through love and career choices, and served as each other’s wedding witnesses. We also grumbled a ton about how hard it is to find a good bra.
All we asked for was a comfortable bra with a little support and coverage. What we got was push-ups, padding and underwire to be someone we were not. As smaller-busted women, the difference between what we needed and what the market offered was wider than the Continental Divide.
Feeling completely misunderstood and underserved inspired us to create Free Reign – a line of ultra-comfortable wardrobe essentials that celebrate active lifestyles and natural beauty.
We aren’t just offering a variation on the theme – the way other brands design for the middle of the market and expect it to work for everybody. We design our apparel for the A and B cup woman. We know our customer. We are her.

Kerf Boxes
So, what is a kerf box?  A kerf is a slit made by a tool that is typically the width of the tool's cutting edge.  In this case, the kerf is the width of a laser beam.  By making a series of short alternating kerfs, you can create a living hinge in thin flexible materials like wood.  Each of our kerf boxes use this method to create a single piece that is both the top and bottom on the box.  Our boxes open and close much like a bound book.  We also use a sliding latch that snaps open and closed, so no fear that the box will accidentally open during travel.  
Kerf Box Styles
 We are currently offering out kerf boxes in four different styles and sizes.
Four different kerf box styles
The Spell Box - This box has an integrated spell tracker on the top of the lid and enough storage in the box to hold two small dice bags with sets of nine 12mm spell dice.  The box will ship with one set of dice (your choice) and a small dice bag to hold them.  Exterior size (108mm x 87mm x 27mm) and interior Size (94mm x 72mm x 15mm). A little interior space will be lost to the natural curve of the box hinge and the sliding box latch.  If you are a Pathfinder player, check out the add-on section for a 10-dice version. 
The Dice Box - This box is big enough to hold several sets of loose dice, a bag with a single set of 12 dice, or the optional 12 dice foam insert.   This box will ship with a 3" - 4" dice bag by default. Exterior size (108mm x 87mm x 32mm) and interior Size (94mm x 72mm x 25mm).  A little interior space will be lost to the natural curve of the box hinge and the sliding box latch.
The Mini Dice Box - This box is sized to hold a 12 dice set of loose dice, a bag with a single set of 7 dice, or the optional 7 dice foam insert.   This box will ship with a 3" - 4" dice bag by default. Exterior size (108mm x 62mm x 32mm) and interior Size (94mm x 48mm x 25mm).  A little interior space will be lost to the natural curve of the box hinge and the sliding box latch.
The Character Box - This box is 35mm deep and should hold your 25/28/30mm minis perfectly or use it to carry your larger 30mm D20s.  This box has an optional foam insert and will ship with a 3"-4" dice bag by default. Exterior size (88mm x 67mm x 42mm) and interior Size (75mm x 52mm x 35mm).  A little interior space will be lost to the natural curve of the box hinge and the sliding box latch. 
Natural Hardwood Veneered Boxes
At launch, there will be 5 natural hardwood veneers to choose from.  Theses are solid MDF core with a beautiful natural hardwood veneer on both sides. 
Alder Kerf Boxes
Black Walnut Kerf Boxes
Cherry Kerf Boxes
Mahogany Kerf Boxes
Maple Kerf Boxes
UV Printed Boxes
UV printing is a form of digital printing that uses Ultra Violet light to immediately cure the ink as it is being printing.  This allows for beautiful and vibrant colors on substrates such as wood.  Our UV Printed boxes use a Baltic Birch Plywood and graphics are printed directly on the wood prior to being cut.  We will start with 6 graphic options for the UV printed kerf boxes.  The prints look best on the Spell and Dice Boxes, but can also be used for the Mini and Character Boxes.
UV Printed Kerf Boxes
 UV Graphics Options
 Below are the available options for your UV Printed boxes.  If you choose a UV Printed box, you will select your graphic during the Reward Survey after the campaign has completed.
UV Graphics Options
Stained Boxes
Looking for a natural wood finish but in a specific shade or color?  Then a stained finish may be what you are looking for.   These are colored stains on top of Baltic Birch Plywood.   Current stain options include:  Ebony, Espresso, Dark Grey, and Bright Purple.  These look great in any of the kerf box styles.  
Stained Kerf Boxes

Pricing
There are four box styles (Spell, Dice, Mini Dice, and Character) and three base materials (Hardwood Veneers, UV Printed, and Stained) to choose from.   To make pricing easy, all the woods/prints/stains in a base material are all the same price.  The chart below lists the price for each of the style/material combination.
Example Pledge 1:   You want just a Cherry Spell Box.  You Pledge $36.  Shipping will automatically be added.
Example Pledge 2:  You want a UV printed Spell Box ($32) and Veneer Mini Dice Box ($30).   You pledge $62.  Shipping will automatically be added.
Example Pledge 3: You want a Black Walnut Spell Box ($36), Dice Boc ($32), and Character Box ($30).  You also want a foam insert ($4) and an extra set of spell dice ($5).  You Pledge $36 + $32 + $30 + $4 + $5 = $107.  Shipping will automatically be added.
If you have any concerns about how to calculate your reward cost, please message us.
Dice Options for the Spell Boxes
Each Spell Box comes with one set of dice, so you can start using it immediately.  During the Reward Survey, you will be given the option to select from the dice below.  Don't forget that you can also Add-on additional sets of dice if you want.
Spell Box Dice Sets
Add-Ons
Foam Inserts
Each of the kerf boxes will come with a black velvet dice bag by default.  You can also add a laser cut foam insert for the Dice and Character Boxes.  These inserts are $4 each.
Foam Inserts
Foam Inserts
Additional Dice Sets 
Having trouble picking a dice set for the Spell Box?  Add on additional nine dice sets from the available dice styles for $5 a set.  The Spell Box will hold 2 full sets in their bag.

Pathfinder Spell Box Upgrade
Do you want a 10-dice Pathfinder Spell Box instead of a 9-dice DND5e one?  Just increase your pledge by $3 per Spell Box and I'll upgrade the box and include a 10-dice set of your choice.

pas de deux bridal is a unique line of ballet-inspired separates and gowns, which will debut during October's International Bridal Week in NYC. The collection will include several dresses along with a healthy mix of tops, skirts and coverlets, offering limitless style options!
Our concept has been extensively researched in order to hit the right notes and offer a complete collection for the bride-to-be. The line will include all of her apparel needs for the engagement, rehearsal dinner, ceremony, reception and every occasion in between. A rare value for customers, the bridal offerings are designed to be treasured and worn before, during and even long after the "I do's" are exchanged! 
The crowdfunding success will provide our project with all of the necessary start-up costs typical in the apparel industry. With the Goal amount we will grade our original patterns to offer a range of sizes for all the pieces that will be produced for stores and customers. Additionally the capital raised will secure all of our materials necessary for production.
Your help is most appreciated and a few examples of where your support will be seen are:
$5 = 5 skirt zippers
$25 = 20 covered buttons in our Chantilly lace
$50 = 1 yard of our beaded French lace trim, as seen on the Zaragoza top
$75 = 10 yards of our crinkle silk chiffon, enough for the chiffon layers of 1 Gitan skirt
$100 = 6.5 yards of our Chantilly lace, used throughout the collection
$250 = 1 day of ballet studio rental for our lookbook photo shoot
$500 = 20 yards of our sequin fabric, enough for the sequin layer of 2 Lucienne gowns
Stretch Goals
An additional $25,000.00 will provide for our launch event in NYC during International Bridal Week where we will present our collection, sponsored by noted bridal website Lover.ly, with full press coverage from 300 of the most noted bloggers, influencers, publications and celebrated authorities in both the bridal and fashion industries. Important industry insiders will attend and provide priceless publicity for our brand. The Stretch Goals will also cover the replication of our Fall 2015 collection for a set of traveling trunk show samples which our sales team will use to present the line to stores across the country and internationally.
Stretch Stretch Goals
With an additional $20,000.00 our Stretch, Stretch Goals achievement would enable us to design, source and produce our next season, the Spring 2016 collection, and continue to present during International Bridal Week in NYC. We also are in the earliest development phase of creating an app to launch during the spring market. The initial primary use will be business-to-business, integrating our philosophy to be licensed and used by bridal retailers globally. The app is designed to allow all bridal designers to upload their designs in order for customers to visually customize any wedding dress in a bridal retailer setting. Our next app, to be used specifically for our collection, will involve the mixing and matching of the separates as well as the addition of new items from our expanding categories (IE: Fragrance, Maids, Mothers’ Of, etc…) to maximize sales, and will offer the bride a full pas de deux bridal wedding experience. Our Stretch, Stretch Goals will provide valuable funding for these projects! Thank you in advance!

Take a Painting is an interactive painting installation designed to make painting more accessible to a broad audience.  Viewers are invited to "help themselves to a painting," and are invited to make their own paintings on paper that will be embedded into the installation.
So, not only does the viewer get to select and keep a one-of-a-kind painting, they will get to make paintings that will be on display for the rest of the exhibition (or until someone selects it!).
This Kickstarter is seeking funds for materials for exhibitions at the Sykes Gallery at Millersville University in Millersville, PA in October 2016 and at the Alternative Gallery in Allentown, PA in January 2017.
Take a Painting on display at Eckhaus in Kuztown, PA, 2014.

fuck poetry, right? yeah this is fuck poetry.
i mean, fag poetry.
it’s something. 
the world of poetics is fraught with...losers tbh. loser straight white dudes publishing other loser straight white dudes writing poems about bluebirds or some other loser shit. also loser straight white women who write about horses. we are not horse girl poet allies here.
but in the world of fuck poetry, there’s this community. a world. frothy and tight and also very loose and ready. real and imagined and iridescent and covered in mud and motor oil and strawberry lube. this is the fuck poetry. the liminal space between your hand and zipper. does that space still exist? 
buy my book and find out. (we fuck poets are, most regrettably, filthy capitalists.)

PonyBabe is an ethical fashion label, dedicated to providing women with comfortable, multi-use styles.  We use only eco-friendly textiles and are manufacturing in Brooklyn NY, USA.
Our first collection is the 24 Hour Outfit: A wrap, racerback tank top, cardigan, and pants... all meant to be mixed, matched, and worn on repeat. 
We're raising money to fund our first production run and launch PonyBabe with a strong start. In exchange for your pledge, you'll receive the styles shown here at below-retail value.  Your investment contributes directly to the growth of a more sustainable fashion industry!
                  Each piece in the collection has been designed with function in mind, and finished with details that ensure a beautiful presentation.
The pants are gathered with 36 delicate pleats (18 in front, 18 in back.)  This luxurious detail guarantees that they can be dressed up or down.  The waistband in sturdy elastic, allowing you to adjust a higher or lower fit as preferred.  In addition, the ankle cuffs keep your pant legs from dragging, and also make yoga class a tangle-free experience.
The Racerback Tank Top is finished with a stitched binding, which helps to prevent the neck and armholes from stretching out. The racer silhouette means that you won't be pulling your straps up all day. This one stays put as a base layer or as a workout top.
The cardigan has an ample shawl panel that can be styled in so many different ways: Loose and open, tied in front or back, or draped across the neck. It doubles as an on-the go nursing cover, and styles perfectly as an evening cover-up or coffee-run top layer.
The wrap has a stitched edge, and is surprisingly warm considering its lightweight feel. It can be worn as a shawl, a scarf, a nursing cover, a head wrap... the possibilities are endless! It's perfect for staying comfortable on a long flight, or wrapping up as the sun sets after a day at the beach.
PonyBabe's styles are designed to fit on the relaxed side.  The XS/S/M/L sizing range allows you to size up or down depending on the amount of ease you prefer. The models in the photos below are all wearing a size S.  Take a look and see how the same size looks on different bodies:
      Use the following size guide for reference.  If you're not sure which size to choose, email rachel@ponybabe.com.
 *You will choose your sizes and colors by survey after the campaign is complete.
PonyBabe is a woman-owned, American made label. A commitment to ethics, sustainability, and transparency is the heart of our brand. This motivates us to share the details of our supply chain.
The first collection is made of a super soft blend of  55% organic cotton and 45% bamboo, two fibers that have a reduced environmental impact, when compared to conventional, mass-market options. We source the fabric from Kendor Textiles, a company that is committed to the growth of sustainable practices.  Elastic for the pants is USA-made and sourced from Trim Lab, a New York City-based supplier that caters to small fashion labels.
The fabric is machine washable and can be machine dried as well. When possible, we recommend line drying, or laying flat to dry... Save your clothes and save the Earth!
Special note: this fabric has a slubby knit texture and is slightly sheer. If you are concerned about your undergarments showing through, go for the darker colors (black or stormy blue.)
The 24 Hour Outfit is being manufactured in Brooklyn, New York, USA. We've partnered with Dynotex, a leading production facility for better-market knitwear. They are supportive of independent designers, and have been a fixture in the New York City fashion industry for over 16 years.
We're using recycled, biodegradable, and environmentally friendly products for everything from clothing labels and hangtags, to mailers and shipping stickers. At every step of the process, we are looking for ways to create less waste and we encourage our customers to re-purpose packing materials.
PonyBabe recognizes that the price tag of ethical fashion can often be a reason for customers to feel that they have no choice but to opt out. We want to lower the barrier to entry, and to make better, fairer options available to more people. With this in mind, all PonyBabe email newsletter subscribers will receive exclusive access to steeply discounted pre-sales when new styles are ready for market.  
October-November 2016: Kickstarter campaign in progress.
End of November 2016: Size/color surveys complete, fabric and trim ordered, production order placed.
Mid-January 2017: Production begins.
February 2017: Quality checks in progress.
Mid-March 2017: Final quality checks, production complete, clothing begins to ship.
May 2017: All orders fulfilled, PonyBabe's Kickstarter is officially complete... now visit ponybabe.com to shop the collection!
PonyBabe is just getting started, and needs your help! Please spread the word by sharing this campaign. (Share buttons are at the top of the page, right below the video.)  Support the growth of American-made ethical fashion! 
Want to learn more? Visit PonyBabe: Website | Instagram | Pinterest
PonyBabe has had so much help along the way.  Big thanks to the Gordon family, the Fernbach family, Aaron Limoges Photography, Jen Ng (art direction), Sam Richards Video Production, Emily Anderson (model), Rachel Swyer (model), Sunny Hitt (model), Shannon Lohr and Factory45, The BF+DA, Lisa and Peter, Iris Garcia, Marble & Milkweed, Rekh & Datta, Faelyn, Susan and Beverly, Blandine, and all the sweet, generous friends who have cheered on PonyBabe along the way.  Thank you.

For the past 11 months Sarah Council Dance Projects (SCDP) has been hard at work on our newest project: Deep Water, an evening of dance that focuses on women found on the margins of society; exploring ideas that relate to poverty, exploitation, gender and survival. 
Deep Water includes the expansion of two current SCDP works, Shadowlands and Staring at Stones.
Shadowlands, a work for five women, seeks to expose the world of human trafficking and modern day slavery, drawing inspiration from stories of trafficking survivors. Staring at Stones takes a look at my southern roots by exploring the culture of the Appalachian Mountains through the words of several female poets from the region, traditional ballads, stories from my Great Grandma Lena and recorded memories from native, Lou Crites. 
Deep Water will be presented by Gowanus art + production on Oct. 24th at The Green Building in Brooklyn. Next, we will be taking it down south to Kentucky where it will be presented by the Glema Mahr Center for the Arts. Deep Water includes performances by Liz Beres, Melissa Brading, Sarah Brown, Sarah Pope and Aya Wilson and features the original music of Greg Heffernan, Bruno Augusto and Kentucky based Carla Gover and Anna Roberts Gevalt 
With our premiere performance less than 8 weeks away, we are in the last stages of creation. This cast, of fantastically talented and generous dance artists, has worked tirelessly with me to bring this project into being. 
And that’s where I need your help…Please help me compensate these 5 artists for all their investment of time and passion to make Deep Water happen! 
Our goal is to raise $1,550 to be used to pay performer stipends for our performance of Deep Water on Oct. 24th at the Green Building. Please consider giving to this effort, no amount is too small, and please come and see what we've been up to. We would love to share Deep Water with you! 
THANK YOU in advance for making dance happen!! 
With gratitude, 
 Sarah Council
Artistic Director
www.sarahcouncildance.com

About SCDP:
Sarah Council is a choreographer based in Astoria Queens and the artistic director of Sarah Council Dance Projects (SCDP).

In 2007 she founded SCDP as a platform to create emotionally and physically honest dance performance works. These dances explore and reflect life's poignant moments – from the beautiful to the tragic, the curious to the absurd. Drawn from a collection of personal experiences, research and observations, Council's choreography flows between clarity and abandon. Aesthetically interested in the specific, her work uses articulate movement and authentic expression to construct images that provoke thought, conjure memory and capture imaginations. 
The creation of Deep Water has been made possible in part by the Queens Council on the Arts with public funds from the New York City Department of Cultural Affairs in partnership with the City Council. Additional funding for the creation of Deep Water also been made possible by the Puffin Foundation.

Dance is a tricky beast in the digital age. 
There is inspiration everywhere you look, and the dance world is inundated with artists doing brilliant things all across the board. I think, however, that the full potential of the digital media has yet to be tapped. 
That's not to say there isn't PLENTY of dance on YouTube, Vimeo, Facebook, and all the rest. There's performance videos, rehearsal footage, behind the scenes bits, clips from the classroom, and yes even the occasional bootleg video shot from the balcony on an iPhone (but shh... we won't tell). But there is a serious lack of concert dance being created and cultivated SPECIFICALLY for the handheld screen. 
That's where we step in.
READY - a Dance Film
READY will be a foray into the combination of concert dance and digital media. 
While dance is, in many ways, more accessible than ever before, it is rarely tailored specifically for, let's say the screen of an iPhone or a laptop. There is a LOT lost in translation when viewing a taped performance that originally took place on a stage. So what if we cut out the middle man? 
I am very interested in the concept of developing concert choreographic works that are created, performed, and distributed with the acute intention of being watched digitally. That's not to say that this isn't already happening- it certainly is. There are some truly great dance innovators who, like me, want to create a highly creative and artistic experience for digital audiences around the world. The more art there is, and the more accessible that art is, the better. Right? Right! 
READY will utilize and contribute to this burgeoning type of accessibility to concert dance. We want there to be MORE dance, MORE access, MORE support for creative endeavors; I truly believe that projects like READY can help sustain the visibility and appreciation of concert dance.
The film would provide a viewing experience that is free of charge and available at the audience's convenience. No 8pm curtain times or expensive tickets for seats as high up as the chandeliers. You should have fine art at the ready (pun!) in the kitchen, at the office, on the crosstown bus, at your sister's wedding... Doesn't matter! The point is, it's up to you!
So... Who Are We?
A key component of this film will be the involvement of high-caliber collaborators across various disciplines.
Samuel Asher Kunzman (hey, that's me!) will choreograph READY. I'm a dancer and choreographer based in NYC who has presented work at major festivals and venues throughout New York as well as received commissions from notable institutions including The Ailey School and the New Jersey Dance Theatre Ensemble. My last major endeavor was in August of 2014, in which I conceived, created, and premiered "4 Stories," an evening of 4 brand new works that I choreographed over the course of 3 weeks. It might interest you to know that "4 Stories" was largely a success due to the support of-- Kickstarter! So this isn't my first time at bat... But enough about me!
Sarah Daley will be dancing in READY. Sarah is currently in her 5th season with the world-renowned Alvin Ailey American Dance Theatre. She has been noted for her "smooth movement and subtle intelligence" (Dance Magazine 2014: On the Rise), and has danced leading roles in a vast array of the ballets in Ailey's repertoire. She's a captivating performer, shockingly versatile, and a self-described explorer. Her unique presence and beauty alone are sure to make READY a must-watch.
Nel Shelby Productions will be the videography team behind READY. The Emmy-nominated team at NSP is one of the top names in dance videography. A company fueled by devotion to dance, every member of their team has training in movement and understands the fundamentals and components that bring a choreographer's vision to life. Having filmed more than 700 dance events and performances, they are uniquely qualified to bring READY to its most professional and polished culmination.
Christopher Duggan will be photographing READY, both the performance and behind the scenes moments to really preserve the day. With 10+ years of experience as a dance photographer in NYC and at Jacob's Pillow Dance Festival, Christopher has mastered the art of photographing fleeting, meaningful moments that happen in the blink-of-an-eye. 
Mark Gieringer will design the costumes for READY. Mark is an experienced and creative designer. He is also a dancer with Ballet Hispánico, so he knows all about what a costume needs to capture movement and make a dancer feel comfortable yet glamorous.
Where Will Your Donations Go?
As I mentioned earlier, this film will be distributed and available FREE of charge, so READY will not be for profit at all.
That being said, a LOT of hard work goes into a gorgeous and meaningful final product. As the choreographer and creator of this project, I will not personally be receiving any money. But it is incredibly important to me that all the collaborators on this project are paid for their talent, time, and efforts.
80% of all funds raised will go towards paying Ms. Daley, Mr. Gieringer, Mr. Duggan, and the team at Nel Shelby Productions (Director, camera people, editors in post-production) for their collaborative contributions to helping me realize my vision.
Keep in mind that the artists will not just be paid for their time the day of the shoot. There is extensive work to be done leading up to and after the filming. I'm sure you'll agree with me that they deserve sufficient compensation!
The Remainder of the budget will be allocated for
Permits & Licenses to ensure that we are able to film in the locations of our choosing and to acquire the rights to the music to which READY will be performed.
Studio Rentals because we need a place to rehearse and create the film before we actually film it!
We'll be rehearsing and filming in mid-May with plans to have the final video released in July!
THANK YOU
Thank you for taking the time to read this. Your consideration means The World to us, and this would truly not be possible without your generosity and support of the arts.

Glowstix
One day I was looking through my closet and noticed that I didn't really have so many long sleeve shirts. I had short sleeve t-shirts that I wore with a sweatshirt, but not really so many long-sleeve tees.
So I headed to the interweb to buy some more long sleeve shirts but not one store had what I was looking for. I was looking for a long sleeve t-shirt with a cool graphic across the chest. But what I found was that most long sleeve shirts were either boring old solid colors with no design or graphic, or they had an outlandish graphic that sprawled across the entire shirt. I wanted a happy medium, and I couldn't find one.
I couldn't believe what I was seeing, why doesn't one store have what I am looking for?
So one night I was hanging out by my artistic friend Andrea's place and looking at her photos that she took for her photography class, and the words just came out: "I want to put your photos on long sleeve shirts." And just like that, Aedran was started.
We picked out some photos, researched shirt-printers, and pretty soon we had our first apparel line.
Now as much as we hate to say it, the old adage holds true, and in order to make money, you have to spend money, and so we are looking to you-people of Kickstarter- to help us provide young men with a long sleeve shirt that isn't just a skin-coverer, but rather a fashion statement.
We are looking to build our brand through intense branding and marketing to the college market. The money we raise from this will go towards building our website, photoshoots, and paying for the setup costs of selling on location at different colleges.
We hope to one day become a large brand so that we can hire those who have a passion for art but struggle finding a good job.

THE PROBLEM
“Science allows us to see what our eyes cannot.” -Neil deGrasse Tyson
But it doesn't always seem that way, especially when we flip through pages upon pages of technical jargon and hard-to-decipher figures in scientific journals. As a result, science is too often perceived as either too difficult to understand or too boring to care about. 
OUR SOLUTION
We want to illuminate what science has the power to show us. We want to peel back the layers of jargon that separate the public from science and uncover the universal truths that are essential to humanity. We want to present science the way it’s supposed to be shown: exciting, cutting-edge, and accessible. We want the International Collegiate Science Journal (ICSJ). 
WHAT IS THE ICSJ?
The International Collegiate Science Journal is a revolutionary publication with a mission to translate science from obscure to captivating. We will write exciting articles explaining why our brain forgets names of people we just met, why it rains diamonds on Saturn, how you can travel to the Caribbean in a second through virtual reality, how we may be able to live for 200 years in the near future, and other interesting topics that you will want to read. Through an online and print magazine, we will create an environment where anyone can uncover science and discover all that it can do. This is not just a journal. This is ICSJ. Visit our FB page here!
WHO ARE WE?
We are a group of undergraduate college students representing nine successful and established undergraduate science journals at some of the world’s top universities. We come from diverse majors and backgrounds, and all share a common passion for making science accessible to the public.
JOIN IN!
Help us get this project started! We need funds to launch our website, print the publication, and pay for shipping fees. We will spend $500 on our website, and $3,000 on the initial printing and shipping fees. 
But we don't want to stop there! If we get additional funding, we will host a science communication conference and launch event for our magazine to bring university undergraduates together. We want to invite a panel of science communicators, hold science workshops, and invite a keynote speaker like Neil deGrasse Tyson or Bill Nye.

WHAT IS THE MAGIC ZOMBIE! GLASS?
It's a mystical drinking vessel that'll turn your regular tiki cocktail into a potent voodoo potion.   Its dark powers will cause the dead to appear whenever a cold beverage is poured into it!   
The glass is inspired by Donn Beach, the father of tiki culture and inventor of the Zombie cocktail.  However, Donn didn't serve his Zombie in a tiki mug - instead he presented his so-called "mender of broken dreams" in a tall, chimney-style glass.
The Magic ZOMBIE! Glass is an authentic replica of Donn's original glassware, and features artwork by Nik Poliwko with colors by Sveta Shubina.  The glass also includes Donn's 1934 Zombie recipe (courtesy of Jeff "Beachbum" Berry, Sippin'  Safari).  
WHO'S THE MAGIC ZOMBIE! GLASS FOR?
Whether you're a tikiphile, horror hound, lowbrow art collector, or just an aspiring weekend witch doctor, this glass is for everyone!
Of course, please make sure you're of age to imbibe one of Donn's "rhum rhapsodies" or dabble in the art of "necromixology." 
ADDITIONAL TIKI-TASTIC REWARDS!
Custom ZOMBIE! Swizzle Sticks:    
 4-piece ZOMBIE! Coaster Set:    
 Exclusive ZOMBIE! 16'' x 12'' Art Print by Nik Poliwko and Sveta Shubina: 
* Reward add-ons are only available for backers who have pledged $20 or more.
SPECIAL THANKS
This project would not have been possible without the hard work of several individuals: Nik Poliwko, Sveta Shubina, Matt Durston, Alan De Herrera, Greg Cahill, Kayci Nosal, and Death Valley Beach Club for providing our theme music "Donn of the Dead."
Also, thanks to the fine folks at False Idol in San Diego.  They make a killer Zombie.

Adam has lived alone for 15 years after the Great Apocalypse. Nuclear war consumed the globe and human kind wiped itself out. Adam survived and now sick and dying he lives all by himself wondering about great many things. He writes, keeps a daily journal, tries to keep track of time, to keep his mind occupied as he is constantly fighting despair, depression, insanity. As he is attacked one night in the woods by other survivors he and Eve help each other overcome these brutes only to attack and almost mortally wound each other. Their journey together thus begins. Adam had a wife and two girls before the Apocalypse and couldn´t bring himself to kill Eve although she almost killed him. Something in him stops him. He brings her back to his small cottage by the lake and makes sure she survives not knowing why himself. With time, the two interact. They learn about each other and the World togehter. They cry and laugh together and they despair and fight each other again. One night as he was hunting for food Adam is attacked by wildlife in the forest. He is wounded and on the brink of death as Eve sees her chance to kill Adam and claim the cottage for herself. Something stops her, something she hasn´t felt for a long time. She manages to save his life and the two grow closer, contemplating on life, what it has been, what it is and if it ever may be again. The movie is the journey of revelations, conclusions and truths we have forgotten today. The movie is a story of humanity told through two simple manifestations of Life. This film is about us, a lesson, a prayer so that we may not end up in that very place in a near future. So that our children actually have a future to look forward to.

Several women in my family were victims of domestic violence and spousal abuse. I witnessed this atrocity all my life, but now at sixty-two years of age, I want to tell my story. It is a meek attempt to speak for them-- many years after the fact, but is a personal mission.
I have the great honor of featuring AMBER DAWN FOX as the female lead Katie, TIM ROSS as the male lead, Jarrod, and BRENDA MOSS-CLIFTON as female support of Katie's mother.
I am not asking for your help, I am begging. The trailer to the film project "The Egg Shell Minuet"  has already cast an incredible support team of extremely talented professional actors and crew members, and I am only seeking the funds to help for lodging and food for them.
Won't you please help us with this worthy cause for ALL women?
My professional background can be seen here: https://www.linkedin.com/in/michaelelder2.
I can also be reached at my home/office in North Carolina at 910-297-3020
Thank you for your interest, your support, and your generous donation!
Michael V. Elder

WHY NOW?
Hi I'm Robin B, a licensed curl specialist. In my salon, I often hear stories about hair. This much you may expect in a salon, but the stories go deeper than the hair itself, deeper than any style or look. My clients often tell me how meaningful their hair is to them, what it represents in their view of themselves and how it connects to their whole identities.
A major cornerstone of every culture, hair is never just hair – as Nia, the main character in my book God Created Me Coily, is starting to realize.
My book follows Nia, a smart and curious young girl, as she asks BIG questions about her hair – like, why is my hair coily and curly?
THE PROBLEM
Many children of color, grow up their entire lives feeling "UGLY" in the United States. 
They look in the Mirror and they HATE who they SEE
They lack self-confidence and self-worth
 They Struggle for Years in their Careers and with their Families (I see it everyday in my Salon) 
So I posed the question of why? Why is it that our children feel UGLY because their "hair isn't straight" and Skin is not White? This is a SERIOUS PROBLEM in the United States. When I looked deeper, this is what I found.  See the statistics below:
According to Lee and Low Books  “In the last 24 years, only 13% of Children’s Books contain multiracial content, even though 37% of the US population are People of Color.” There are more "Animal and White" Characters in Books than any other race in 2018.  Often because our children don't see themselves being represented in toys and books they often think they are not worthy enough to be represented. In the future this  leads to self-doubt and lack of confidence that follows them well into adulthood in regards to their identity.   Clearly, the Industry has failed us, lets not allow  for the industry to fail our children. 

Leading Psychologists have mentioned often :"Kids that hate themselves will grow up to hate others." 
 (YOU deserve to be REPRESENTED in the Industry)
 THE SOLUTION
I have written this book in response to the self-acceptance challenges I know many young girls face as they go through their childhoods. As well, I have written it in response to the distinct lack of Black characters in children's books and the distinct lack of Black dolls with hi-texture hair in the toy market. Our Story with Representation Matters in 2020.

The message of my book is clear and straightforward: embrace yourself, your authentic self, and discover your own creativity and uniqueness. By combining story and representation we create a world where your child learns and feels empowered by their identity” Passionate about beauty, tech and entrepreneurship, I am the founder of Coil Beauty. I want the God Created Me Coily Book Series + Doll Experience to motivate your girls to pursue their grandest dreams.
Long-term, I would also like to launch my own line of diverse dolls through Coil Beauty, but to get to that point, I need to be able to hit my minimum order goals on the first edition of the "Nia" Collection Dolls. This is the priority of the crowdfunding campaign, pushing funding over the edge so that I can cover those costs.
 THE GOAL 
I am looking to raise $10,000 to cover the costs of publishing, manufacturing, marketing and distributing God Made Me Coily and hitting 300 presales of the first edition of the "Nia" Collection Dolls, planning an expansion of doll line next. As long as I can reach this goal, I will be able to launch my book and doll series in a timely manner.
STRETCH GOALS
PLEDGES
Contribute now and claim your copy of God Made Me Coily Collection Rewards! 
 BENEFITS AND FEATURES
 (You have the option to donate your Doll + Book to a little girl in Need)
It's A Movement! "Girls Create Book Club"
 (Readers become Leaders! We will released 1-3 more books in the "God Created Me Coily Series" this year and send directly to your child)

 HELP US AND SHARE NOW
In addition to making a monetary contribution to this campaign, you can show your support for me and God Made Me Coily Collection by sharing a link to the campaign on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, and any other social media platforms you use. The more people are aware of this doll and book prior to the launch, the further I can spread my message of self-love and self-acceptance.

There’s something special happening in Mobile. People are building things again. Good things. Using local resources and an inventive spirit, there’s more innovation in technology and entrepreneurship happening in Mobile than ever before. And the results are impressive.  
At Serda Brewing, we believe in this renaissance. Whether it's building airplanes, littoral combat ships, stainless steel, fiber optics, bike lanes, entrepreneurial incubators, restaurants, or even a brewery, there’s a sense of pride that comes from building something great. We want to share Serda Brewing with you, and we want you to play a role in helping us build it. By becoming a Serda Founder, you’re embarking on this journey with us, and together we are going to build something truly special.  
Over the past 48 months, we’ve been working feverishly to raise capital to get the brewery off the ground. We’ve ordered a beautiful, fully-custom, 3 vessel, 30 barrel brew house. But we want to do more than start a brewery. Nestled in the heart of Downtown Mobile, we want to build a first class taproom experience, a space to make your own while enjoying the artistry and craftsmanship that defines Serda beer. 
So what will we do with the money?  
Mobile was "Born to Celebrate" and we have a big vision to create the taproom that continues our tradition of celebration. A place to celebrate Mardi Gras, closing that deal, pulling off that huge event, making it through Monday, he or she saying yes, it's a boy or girl, that friend is back in town, that promotion and even funding your own project. We want to be a part of your celebration! 
Private Events Space - Want to host a company event off-site, Fantasy Football draft, Christmas party, wedding shower or neighborhood movie night? We’ll have the perfect space for you
Fiber Optic internet – Never wait on a web page again with our fiber optic internet connection provided by Southern Light! Feel free to use our speeds to change the world.  
TV and Audio - For that big game or that final episode we will have the big screen TV's and sound to make it come to life.
Large Outdoor Seating Area (Beer Garden) - Ample seating for your gatherings, all shaded by large triangular, sail cloths or warmed by our fire pits. Enjoy the fresh air and large oak trees, or take a stroll through our brew house and observe the brewing operations!
Food Truck Alley - Adjacent to the Beer Garden and accessible from the Beer Garden, we will have 1-3 food trucks on site to satisfy your hunger. Enjoy a snack while relaxing under our Italian lights, surrounded by large planters with local vegetation.

Share our project like it’s the cutest cat or most picture-worthy food you’ve ever seen. Tell anyone and everyone you know, or we might not get any of the money.
