   About Serda Brewing
Serda Brewing is a craft beer microbrewery being constructed in downtown Mobile, Alabama to serve the Greater Mobile and regional Gulf Coast markets. Located at 600 Government Blvd., the over 12,000 square foot facility will incorporate production and packaging facilities as well as a pub-style hospitality venue for tours and retail bar sales of the brewery's products. The beers offered will reflect traditional German beer styles as evolved by modern American craft brewer boldness and innovation.
The core brand beers will be traditional German styles that have had an American craft beer face lift: richer in flavor, bolder in strength, more complex in character, a reflection of the past with modern craft brewing innovation. There is a notable void in the industry craft beer menu as most new breweries have focused on West Coast style micro-brews and a smattering of English style ales. Serda Brewing will bring about more choices of what consumers are looking for in a market crowded with a limited style selection. Our flagship beer will be our Hook, Line & Lager - light straw to golden color and crystal clear. Hops are very prevalent with a spicy bitterness and a spicy floral flavor and aroma. Smooth and crisp with a clean malty palate. Lagers are more difficult to make and take longer, but they're worth the extra effort.  
Our Beers
Hook Line & Lager - Pilsner   Our flagship Pilsner, brilliant and zesty with ample hop bite. Malted rye and noble hops deliver a spicy refreshing zing. A perfect beer for any occasion, especially thirsty occasions.  
Profile notes: Pale golden with thinning white head, black pepper sharp hop aroma with faint toasted grain and sulfur yeast lingering in the back, crisp slight malt sweetness behind noble hop forward balance, bitter hop is perceived as dryness that does not linger in the aftertaste. Very fresh German noble hops and yeast at the forefront, malt sweetness is present but subdued.  Rye malt adds a layer of complexity and a slight oily/creamy texture that helps lighten the hop bite.
Clear Prop - Porter    Our flagship dark beer brewed in the Baltic Porter style.  A heavier but balanced offering to please stout and porter drinkers with a variation of style seldom introduced into American beer markets.  Layers of subtle roast and caramel honey-prune flavors weighed out with a mellow bitter smoky and herbal hops. 
Profile Notes:  Dark unfiltered opaque brown with a off-white frothy head. Heavy leaning with layers of malt complexity.  Some smoked perception lingers in the background from the hops even though this is not a smoked beer.  As forward the malt flavors are, the beer does not finish as thick as you would think, the higher alcohol thins the body out to a more moderate mouth feel.  You can drink several of these, but you will feel the effects.
Mobile Bay - IPA    Brewed with several new German hop varieties and traditional alt-bier yeast using American craft brewing techniques to drop a hop bomb of unique citrus aromas balanced with the smooth malt base of German barley. 
Profile Notes: Upon first look, the beer pours slightly clouded from unfiltered hop oils and has a tight frothy sticky head. IPA nose is very upfront and packs a fresh citrus/mandarin orange/apple-pear punch.   Moderate body from a strong pale ale fermented drier than most American versions. Won't leave you with heavy thick finish, but a lingering sweet hop burn.
Tidewater - Vienna  A smooth malty amber mainstay with clean moderate hop bitterness in balance with toasty sweetness.  Floral and spicy in both malt and hop aroma, but easy drinking and satisfyingly complex. 
Profile Notes:  Pouring a reddish amber with a tight creamy white head, the sparkling carbonation releases refreshing floral and spicy aromas from both the toasted malts and noble hops.  Once settled in in the mug, the carbonation subsides to a smooth and slightly sweet quaff with a hint of caramel and a kiss of herbal hops.  Moderate body with  short lingering flavor makes this brew a perfect companion to any type of meal.
The Team  
Like all good teams, each member brings something unique and positive to the group. A good team works together, discusses differences, and always has the team's betterment in mind. 
John Serda is our President and CEO. He is the owner of Serda's Coffee Co., a popular coffee shop in downtown Mobile and has recently opened his second location on the eastern shore of Mobile Bay with a third location on its way. John understands the customer experience and brings operation and management skills to the team.
Matt Serda, John's brother, is our Chief Financial Officer. Matt has an Accounting and Finance degree. He is also in charge of company finances for his father's local business. Matt has been instrumental in working with city officials on permitting and licensing, working with our bankers, general contractor, and architect. 
Tim Mahoney functions as our Corporate Secretary. Perhaps, more importantly, he is the designated "task master". Bringing over 27 years of corporate experience to Serda, Tim is an adept Project Manager. He keeps the schedules, the action items, agendas, and basically keeps us all on track! Tim is a retired Naval Officer (O-5) and between his active duty and reserve time, spent 20 years in the U.S. Navy. He also has one of the largest beer can collections in the Southeast United States....he knows beer.
Donna Lambert is our Marketing, Merchandising, and Event Coordinator. She's the one who will book the Tap Room for your special event! She does much more than that however. As we march toward opening day, we are keeping her busy designing everything from beer labels to T-shirts! Her experience in the digital marketing world is invaluable since she is also responsible for our website and all social media content.                                                                                      
John Serda - President
 Our Director of Brewing - Todd Hicks
Twenty plus years of professional craft brewing experience in brewpubs and microbreweries
Director of Brewing Operations, Serda Brewing Company Twenty plus years of professional craft brewing experience in brewpubs and microbreweries
Originally from the greater New Orleans area, Todd moved from Destrehan, LA to Mobile in 1982, starting 6th grade at St. Dominic Catholic School. He then went to McGill-Toolen Catholic High School, graduating in 1988. After high school, Todd attended the University of South Alabama from 1988-1992.
Todd first became interested in the fickle art of fermentation during his teenage years. Ironically, his initial inspiration was his family’s winemaking hobby. After Todd won a Best Specialty Wine award for a potion made from Prickly Pear Cactus fruit, his Mom shut out her main competition by buying her son a “True Brew” beer rig for his 18th birthday. Already having a taste for great imported beers, Todd knew, with practice, that he could brew beer himself. By the time he got to the University of South Alabama, he was experimenting with every type of unique brew he could concoct.
Todd Hicks is a familiar face in the craft beer community's cast of professional brewers and beer advocates. He joined Mobile's Port City Brewery, located on Dauphin St., in 1993 and was instrumental in the opening of Alabama's first brewpub since Prohibition. Todd started as an Assistant Brewer in training under Brewmaster Bradley Fournier and was quickly promoted to Head Brewer. He also brewed occasionally at the company's other location, Magic City Brewery, in Birmingham, AL. Over the years of beers to follow, his devotion to brew the best and most unique craft beers possible has never strayed. This determination (and subsequent reputation) has led to numerous head brewer and consulting positions for Todd all over the southeastern US. Todd’s specialization within the trade is troubleshooting and upgrading equipment, reviewing procedures to increase efficiency, and hands-on training of brewery staff. Not to mention, he is adept at producing a variety of great tasting, unique beer styles!
While still working occasionally for Mobile’s Port City Brewery, Todd moved to the Florida Panhandle and began brewing along the Emerald Coast. He started brewing with Steve Fried at McGuire's Irish Pub in Pensacola and then was key in the 1996 startup of McGuire's of Destin. In 1997, Todd left McGuire's to brew at the Santa Rosa Bay Brewery in Fort Walton Beach, and later that year also took over brewing for Sharktooth Brewery, which later became Nigel Manley's Microbrewery across the island in Destin. After Mobile’s Port City Brewery closed in 2001, Todd began consulting, training new brewers at Hal & Mal’s Brewery in Jackson, MS, and providing brewing services to The Cannon Brewpub in Columbus, GA. He knew, however, that with the closure of Port City, a prime location and a lot of brewing equipment became available back in Mobile.
Starting in early 2002, Todd developed a plan to purchase and reopen the former Port City Brewery under a new banner, Mr. Jim's Cannon Brewpub. The name was in memory of the deceased co-founder of The Cannon Brewpub in Columbus. 2003 was a year of extensive renovation with Todd as Project Manager. “Mobile’s” Cannon Brewpub opened in early 2004 with Todd as Brewery Manager. On the refurbished 15-barrel brewing system, he brewed a few of the original Cannon brands with revised recipes and a few revamped brands from Mobile's beer past.
Unfortunately, the absentee owners from Columbus had legal issues back in Georgia and in early 2006 had to eventually sell their entire operation. Mobile’s location was not exempt, and Mr. Jim’s Cannon Brewpub closed as a result. In mid-2006, Hurricane Brewing purchased the equipment, leased the property, and began plans to open at the same location on Dauphin Street. Todd was hired as Head Brewer and was responsible for developing fresh recipes for the new operators. Hurricane Brewing opened in late 2006 after six months of renovations. Todd’s brewing goal was to keep the focus on the beer itself and increase the number of beer styles available by adding new keg space and upgrading the draft beer system. He created a variety of contemporary English/Irish beer styles that have been widely reproduced in the wake of the craft brewing revolution. Sadly, Hurricane Brewing also only lasted about two years due to a myriad of internal issues. The building owners decided to turn upper stories into offices and lease out the bar area to a Mexican-themed restaurant, which is where Montego’s is located today.
Back in 2003, Todd joined the grass roots movement of “Free the Hops” as a founding member. He volunteered to organize the Mobile Free the Hops Chapter and lead the local beer community in support of shattering the embargo against craft beer in Alabama. This work continues today with his involvement in the Alabama Brewers Guild, where he was also a founding member and briefly a Board of Directors member.
By word of mouth, and through introduction at the WYES International Beer Festival in New Orleans, Todd was approached by two business partners about consulting on a brewery business plan in 2010. After about a year of planning, a site was selected in Baton Rouge, and construction began with a tight budget, a used 30-barrel brewing system, and a few new fermenters. Todd spent a couple of years consulting in various stages of recipe development, construction, training of brewers, and equipment expansions. Their business and facility is growing every year and shows no signs of slowing down. This brewery is known as Tin Roof and continues to be very successful to this day.
Currently, Todd and four investment partners (who are also all McGill-Toolen graduates!) are opening Serda Brewing Company, a 30-barrel brewhouse and packaging microbrewery with a tap room style pub in Mobile, Alabama. The downtown location, at 600 Government Street, is directly adjacent to Lower Dauphin Street and connects directly with the LoDa Entertainment District and the many popular restaurant and bar venues nearby. It is also directly on the Mardi Gras parade route! Serda Brewing will have ample outdoor patio seating (shaded by large sail cloths) and an outdoor food truck court. The tap room will feature one of Mobile’s largest bars, nearly 40 feet in length and crescent shaped that will span the width of the tap room. On site, secure parking will be plentiful. Serda will both keg and bottle its year-round beers for distribution. Seasonal and specialty test beers will be available only in the taproom in the near future. A July 2017 opening is being targeted.

The Human Canvas Project
Now on TWITTER and FACEBOOK
Subject Kira
I set out with the Human Canvas Project with the intention of giving my friends unique portraits that showed their beauty in a way that would communicate their tremendous impact on my life. I wanted complete strangers who had never met them to see their images and understand who they were and what they really are. It has since turned into a fascinating study of body image, and our relationships with each other, our bodies and our identities.
Subject Tom
Many of us remain insecure in who we are, but that is something I'm hoping to change with this project. Body painting is often traditionally used to cover up the body, or to "enhance" a models appeal. With this project I wanted to take a more artistic approach. I want to show who these people are by painting their identities on their skin and I wanted to do it in a way that made them proud and made them feel beautiful about themselves. There's a celebration of who we are as people and how we are seen in the eyes of others.
Subject Chad
What began as solitary appointments has expanded and has grown to include relationships. So far I've painted friends, strangers, people I worked with, people I acted with, sisters, brothers, couples and best friends... but I'm hoping to expand and be able to capture a much wider range of relationships. 
Subject Georgia
The project has also begun to extend into film as well, such as the music video for "Petty Victories" entitled Concrete and Rosy Cheeks.
As someone who has struggled with body issues myself, I've also begun to turn the paint brush on myself to craft images relating to pain, joy and remorse. I feel that by exploring these complicated emotions in a tangible way it has often helped me to sort through overwhelming times.
The project now carries a new mandate. I want to be able to paint more people. More relationships. I'd love to paint every gender, orientation, race and age. We are a diverse people after all and the more I try to diversify the richer this collection will become.
The money I raise from this Kickstarter will be going to three things:
#1 - I am hoping to raise enough money to expand my collection of paints and brushes in an attempt to find something that will be safer to use on the human body without sacrificing the rich and bright colours of the paint.
#2 - I am hoping to craft a 40-60 page hard cover coffee table book that will not only document the creation of the canvases, but will also capture the impressions I had of the experience, both immediate and lasting , as well as  highlights from every persons journal entry to offer a comprehensive account of both of our emotional headspaces.
#3 - I don't want to keep this project a secret and have decided to produce a gallery show which will take place in Toronto later this year. The show would feature roughly 20-30 of my best pictures blown up to a gallery size, would include copies of my book for people to purchase and would also include a live model demonstration of the procedure.
Subject Mark
Ideally I'd love to take this new expressive form of body painting around to schools and universities to teach the techniques I'm discovering to other artists.  I would love to see this project grow into something bigger and better and hope that you will help me to achieve that. 
I would love to have your help with this endeavor! Please feel free to contact me with any potential questions you have on the process, the project or to be a canvas. Don't hesitate to contact me!
Subject Chris

In the follow up to his best-selling book, The Retrospections of Sherlock Holmes, Thaddeus Tuffentsamer once again delves into the battered tin dispatch box to retrieve more delightful canonical adventures in Further Reminiscences of Sherlock Holmes.
Four new Holmes’ adventures including the novella, the Giant Rat of Sumatra. Plus another fan favorite, Joseph Bell adventure.
The Adventure of the Tiger’s blood
Holmes’ new client, Mr. Blanchard has just inherited his late uncle’s manor. As he is settling in, he is becoming more and more unsettled. His staff is quiet, too quiet when it comes to his uncle’s death. The only comment made in regard to it is the fact that the tiger cub should not have died. Seeing that something is amiss, he retains Holmes to find out what the real issues are.
The Adventure from the chair
Holmes receives a request from Mr. Nelson who is in turmoil. He has received a strange visitor from ‘the future’ who tells him that he must act quickly or the life of someone he loves will be lost. Not knowing what to believe, he asks Holmes for help. (This story is penned by Holmes himself as Watson was gone for the day, and Holmes solves it, ‘from the chair’)
The Adventure of the African Crown Jewel
The African government learns that their long lost Crown Jewel is set to go on display at the museum. Mycroft, failing to diplomatically retrieve it from the museum, hires Holmes to gather a crew and steal it, (in order to serve the Queen and save diplomatic ties, of course.)
The Adventure of the Giant Rat of Sumatra
Set six weeks after Watson meets Holmes and begins sharing rooms with him, a threat hits London. A plague that is only striking a certain demographic. A demographic that has the financial means to support a growing criminal organization. A giant rat is set loose to attack them and make demands. But what does the giant rat of Sumatra have to do with Holmes, Watson, Moriarty, and the Island of Dr. Moreau? It is an adventure that the world is finally ready to hear. (This story is a novella, taking up more than a third of the overall book.)
The Adventures of Joseph Bell: The critical art critic
Sherrington Hope, private consulting detective and his loyal chronicler, Ormond Secker have become the new consulting duo in London, but when a curator is murdered and they begin to bumble their way through the process, Inspector LaRue asks Bell and Doyle to once again assist Scotland Yard in finding out who the killer is.
The author is also an artist, whose works have been in museum displays. He has included twelve new illustrations throughout the book, incorporating them into each of the stories, in the spirit of the original The Strand illustrated adventures. 
Due to Covid-19 delivery times will be impacted.  The company doing the printing of the book has been impacted and rather than 1 week to print and ship to me, it is now taking about 5 weeks.  That is why I pushed out the delivery to December of this year.
To offer my readers a thank you for your patience with this, each physical copy, paperback, and hardcover will be signed.  There is no special reward for a signed copy with this campaign.   
New Stretch goal added 8-22-2020.  We were fully funded in 2 days.  We are currently at $600.00.  If we double that, we will include a hand made bookmark with each physical copy of the book, and a PDF copy with the electronic version of the book. 

One of the illustrations from the book
Illustration from the 'Joseph Bell' story

Coal Comforts will be the first of its kind, a pop-up art "bakery" in which the familiar treats on offer will not be what they appear-- they'll be made of ash from burned coal.
(almost) good enough to eat!
 This is about climate change. Coal power has never been "clean" and continuing to mine and burn it causes irreparable harm to frontline communities and accelerates climate change. The current administration wants to prop up this outmoded industry without regard to the known consequences. As we have seen, nostalgia is a powerful tool––it can make what is familiar seem wholesome and innocuous, as "American as apple pie." But like the sweet treats we might find in an old-fashioned bakery, a little dirty energy might look like a harmless enough indulgence, but our global consumption patterns will be our undoing. Put simply, we can't have our cake and eat it too.
I need your help to build a mobile bakery counter that I can take out onto the streets. If funded, it will make its debut appearance during the annual Gowanus Open Studios weekend. Gowanus, home of a federal Superfund site, is itself a cautionary tale about environmental degradation and about the last place you'd expect to find a pop-up bakery. But that weekend people from all over the city descend on the neighborhood to see what's happening there and visit artists' studios.
Cart drawing
It is my goal to use the bakery as a conversation starter, and help each person I meet identify an action that they can take to help transition away from dirty energy. The bakery will be fully stocked with faux "desserts" for sale, and I'll be splitting the proceeds from sales that weekend with the Citizens' Climate Lobby.
I believe art can change people's perceptions and encourage them to think differently about the future and their role in creating it. With your help I can bring Coal Comforts into being, in Gowanus and beyond.
 The rewards:
  Coal Cookie
   Mini Cheesecake
  Coal Cupcake
  Art Tart
  Bundt Cake (plus bonus dessert!)
  Birthday Cake (plus 3 bonus desserts and tour!)

During the last twelve months I have spent my free time working on a new group of fine art acrylic paintings. These will be exhibited from mid-March through mid-April in the 2011 Alumni Invitational Exhibition at Mississippi University for Women. MUW has $300 available to help defray expenses. I need additional funding to cover framing for the acrylic paintings and to assist with shipping costs.
FUNDING WILL GO TOWARDS:
Framing for the ten new acrylic paintings on canvas and funds toward crating and shipping the pieces round trip from San Francisco, CA to Columbus, MS.
Any funding beyond this will go toward expenses related to photographing and documenting the paintings.
SYNOPSIS AND PROCESS:
These paintings are an exciting new direction for me, an outcome of my breast cancer diagnosis in 2009, when I looked for a way to turn the experience into something positive. At that time I asked the question, "If my cancer could talk, what would it tell me?" The answer was that I needed to find time for painting, and my Praesentia Series was born.
These recent paintings are representations of structures that symbolize passages: turning points in life when a person is forced to look within when facing a difficult challenge. I use value and contrast to draw the viewer from the darkness and toward the light. The light represents hope and renewal. For subject matter, I've used photos I've taken of the watchtowers at the Great Wall in China as well as passageways at Fort McHenry in Baltimore and Fort Point in San Francisco.
The word "praesentia" means "presence" in Latin. To me it represents one of the ways I got through the cancer experience: by practicing "being in the moment" rather than focusing on the past or the future. This said, my paintings are not about cancer but about the human experience. They are like snapshots in time. 
The exhibition at MUW feels pivotal as it will be the first public exhibit of this series. After this show I hope to exhibit the Praesentia pieces on the West Coast, regularly adding new paintings to the group. I would really, REALLY appreciate your help in getting these paintings displayed! 
About Mississippi University for Women: Founded in 1884 as the first public college for women in the United States, MUW is a tradition-rich university that has also educated men for more than 20 years. U.S.News & World Report has consistently ranked MUW among the top Southern public master's universities. MUW also has been prominently ranked in other leading publications such as Kiplinger's Personal Finance and Consumer's Digest magazines. http://web2.muw.edu/

Thank you for spending time on our page!
The film, titled Among Sorrow and Song, follows Mark, a lonely man in his early thirties whose job is delivering HIV medication to various people throughout Los Angeles. The short film focuses on one day in his life as he delivers the medication to various clients who are all experiencing differing crisis’s. The inspiration for this film came from my many years of volunteering with non-profits serving those with HIV/AIDS. The more years I spent doing this work the more I heard. Stories of sadness, joy, and everything in-between. I would like to shed light on these people in all their struggles and joys through the short narrative of Among Sorrow and Song. 
However to do this I need your help! As always filmmaking is not a cheap art form and raising funds for short films can be difficult.
Your financial contribution will go towards renting equipment, location permits, and securing the most talented crew we can find to have a beautiful final project to screen at film festivals. Any amount helps contribute to the film. In the past my films have only been possible because of generous donations from you and other thoughtful friends and supporters. Thank you for your time and thought! Many thanks and much love,

Failure to Fail Trilogy synopsis. 
After several life lessons, from several jobs and people, Sophia, a Romanian gypsy, finds love on a porn video-chat website. Bill, is an I.T. director for corporate America and a hacker. He brings Sophia to US, just to prove to his Mormon family that he is not gay. He starts raping and torturing Sophia, but she learns to survive. When the abuse shift to their two daughters, Sophia is trying to get out of the marriage and finds love at the park. Mason, a 35 year-old retired military , that helps her gather evidence against Bill, by playing double agent and beating Bill with his own weapons: technology. After Bill finds out about the affair, he breaks into Mason's house and he gets shot and killed. The nightmare didn't stop, since after more than a year, Sophia gets accused of second degree murder, when she wasn't even at the scene. Bill's Mormon, powerful family, makes a goal from destroying Sophia and take her kids after losing a grandparent’s trial. Now Sophia is facing a 10 years sentence if she is found guilty, or she will uncover major corruption at a high level in the state of AZ. Since evidence lacks into trying to pin everything on Sophia, the state and the enemy family drops the case and brings new charges against Sophia and Mason , based on absolutely nothing new, of first degree murder - conspiracy to commit murder , which is punishable by death. Since the entire case is based on family ideas , Sophia and Mason gets released from jail and now they are waiting for a trial for a case that is based on fabricated stories from Bill's family.
Failure to Fail Vol. 1 synopsis . 
“Failure to fail”, vol. 1, is the first part out of three, that follows a real-life story, which is almost to raw, to be thought as true. Sophia, a Romanian girl, has a series of unfortunate events, that leads her on a path of surviving, even if she doesn’t follow the moral rules all the time. Her journey to growing up, doesn’t change who she is, but changes the circumstances of her story, when she meets Bill Poulden, an I.T. employee for corporate America. Sophia, thinks she finds love, in a loveless place, a video-chat website, with adult content. Bill, discovers Sophia’s naïve side and trusting personality, that makes her the perfect target, for his “kind” of happiness. Sophia agrees to become his fiancé, move to America and live a perfect love story, that Bill promised to offer. Just when she thinks her misfortune ended, Bill shows his real, broken personality and intentions. Sophia gets stuck into Bill’s life, habits and mind-rape strategies, followed by a big decision to make for her future, that seems more complicated than she though...

RAISE THE RHYTHM (RTR) is a one of a kind charity event that combines music, fashion and dance in one evening. In its first two years of production, RTR sold out each show and raised over $15,000 for Canadian charities. RTR has featured many up-and-coming artists including So You Think You Can Dance Canada winner Jordan Clark, Conteur Dance Company, Coca-Cola’s Covers finalist Andres Sierra as well as fashion designers Whitney Linen and Arnaldo Santos.
At RTR, our mission is to influence others to use their passions and bring awareness to what really matters in the world. This year, RTR plans to raise more money and bring more Canadian talents to its stage.
This year, RTR will be taking place on Wednesday, October 1, 2014 at The Danforth Music Hall in support of the Panov Program.
 RTR 2014 will be raising money and awareness for The Panov Program - Precision Chemotherapy for Sarcoma Cancer Research at Mt. Sinai Hospital, Toronto. Sarcoma accounts for more than 15% of all Children’s Cancers. Sarcoma attacks the body’s tissues causing tumours within muscles, bones, nerves, fat and blood vessels. One of the most recognized names in Canadian history, Terry Fox, suffered from Sarcoma, taking first his leg and then his life.
Precision Chemotherapy is designed to greatly improve a cancer patient’s odds. A novel process, Precision Chemotherapy aims to increase a patient’s chance of survival by growing human tumours in mice and testing them with targeted chemotherapies. This innovative technology helps oncologists identify the best treatment options available for each genetically unique individual.
This year, RTR plans to raise $20,000 for The Panov Program.
The show will feature some of the top local up-and-coming dancers, musicians and designers. RTR 2014 artists include:

The Dragon Code: Fantasy is a completely new universe to The Dragon Code classic, which is a strategic board game for adults and children. Our goal is reach funding to be able to create this magnificent universe. The story describes 2 opposite powers, forces that fight over the power to rule the world. These powers take the shape of a white and a black dragon, created by board pieces. The objective of the game is to attack and slay the opponent's dragon. The game requires at least two players. 
What we have so far:
The Dragon Code classic currently enables the basic game board, where players can play and challenge each other, level up and hold player profiles. You can access The Dragon Code classic for free here: thedragoncode.com On the 10th of October 2014, we released an Alpha version of the game and we have been working ever since to improve the game and add new features. The 15th of April 2015 is the launch date for the completed classic game supporting the basic game features:
Player matches
Levels
Chat system
Point system and tournaments
Time-based move (the player can continue thegame in up to 24 hours of being idle)
Support
Website with the player profiles and forum
Android and iOS apps downloadable from Google Play and iTunes
Facebook app
The game is free to play and can be accessed at http://thedragoncode.com
The Dragon Code: Fantasy
The Dragon Code fantasy is an extension of The Dragon Code classic, which unlocks the full story and characters. By building this extension, we would like to bring players the ultimate fantasy and bring to life an unforgettable adventure that revolves around The Dragon Code game. We’ll build amazing new features!
The story
“The origins
The Dragon Code, the magic and power of dragons concentrated in one code, was created by the first dragon to maintain the balance of the world. After he created the code, the Dragon King carved it on a sacred tablet to keep it safe from the corrosion of time. The world evolved and humans evolved together with the dragons. However, in time, quarrels raged out. Some were overtaken by their ambition to rule the world. They struggled for power and greed took over the hearts of many. These were dark ages. The dragons held the power to the balance or destruction of the world. The humans had no choice but to side with the dragons and live together. Ambitions unfolded Humans, a frail, yet cunning race, have always lived under the domination of dragons. The fearful and gigantic winged demons held the power of life and death. They held the key to the gateway to either balance or chaos. However, humans were not to be taken lightly. Equipped with a swift mind and many talents, they were a race that even the almighty dragons were wary of. And among the humans, there would be a diversity in characters, just like the dragons'. While the strong tried to maintain peace and protect values like honor and compassion, there were many who would do anything for power and possessions. Ambition took over the hearts of the weak. Those who had the most influence attracted others, finally leaving two leading powers inside the world of dragons: Shiro – the white dragon clan and Kuro - the black dragon clan.
 And so the world got stained in two colors: the white and the black, the yin and the yang, the tranquil and the furious. The dragons split into two clans, fighting for world domination. The white clan to protect the world and keep its sanctity, the dark clan to fulfill its ambition of gaining power and rule of the world. Caught in the middle of the dragons' raffle, humans started joining sides with the faction that supported their beliefs the most. Those who wanted to become the knights of justice and sanctity, the masters of balance and meditation joined the Shiro clan which took a protective stance. Those taken over by lust and thirst for power, joined the Kuro clan taking an assertive approach towards total domination. Growing up where they could, treated roughly by the conditions of the land, men and women alike learned different fighting styles. From vagabonds to martial artists, each of them was forced to build survival skills.
The fall of bones and wings
 The future was yet to unfold. Due to the opposite forces growing in power, the sacred tablet was broken into pieces and the dragon code lost. The world emerged into chaos and, as it was slowly crumbling away. The peace had to be first restored to the world, either that or domination. By the word of the Dragon King, there had to be only one force taking over the world or the balance of yin and yang had to be preserved. Due to the dragons' fury and refusal for cooperation, there was no hope for a yin/yang balance. And so the battles for world domination started. Across the world, sacred locations were appointed for dragon battles. And so the fall of bones and wings started. As they fought, many got turned to dust and many tried to hide. But there was no place to hide. As the world went into collapse, they all had to join in the battle of the ages. Now it is your turn to make a difference, stranger. The earth is crumbling away with screams of terror in the air. The fields are burning and sounds of metal clashing on metal echo in the distance. It is the time. The battle calls. Which path will you walk on? Which side will you join your destiny with? Which clan will succeed? Which clan will come to dominate the new world? Who will be king in the new world?”
Characters  
The Dragon Code: Fantasy will turn the classic game into a role-play experience, with 4 different characters, skills that can overturn the state of the game, achievements to collect and items to boost your gameplay.
“Mankind had no choice but to survive in the dark times of the dragons. As their villages perished, one by one, most fled and some perished into the wilderness. However, there were some who used any means necessary to survive the rough conditions of the land.”  
 Gameplay
1. Characters  
Characters will only be available with the launching of The Dragon Code: Fantasy. In the beginning of the game, the player will be asked to choose one of the 4 characters, input a username and pledge allegiance to a dragon faction.
 The player will be able to create up to 4 characters/ account, with the option of removing them.
 2. Game factions
 In The Dragon Code: Fantasy, the player will be asked to pledge their allegiance to one of the ruling powers in the game: the Shiro clan, which is the white dragon clan or the Kuro clan - the black dragon clan. These correspond to two opposite forces, represented by the color of the white and black pieces. In the classic game, these roles are shifted randomly according to the order in which players join a game. In the Fantasy extension, once a character is created and the player chooses a side, they will be a member of that faction permanently for that character.
 The Dragon Code board is composed of 10 x 7 spaces, on which the pieces of the players can move vertically, horizontally and diagonally. The game starts with 5 pieces of each color belonging to the 2 players. Once a piece is conquered, the piece shifts color and the number of pieces in the player’s dragon increases, while the opponent’s decreases.
4. Elemental bonuses
 According to the chosen faction, the player will obtain some elemental attributes that will later affect the course of the game, precisely, the effect and duration of the special skills.
5. Skills and energy  
There are five different special skills, one for each element:
 Blazing wind (fire) - Scorch: burn one of the opponent's pieces
 Moving sand (earth) - Stun: disables one of the opponent's pieces for one round; the opponent cannot move that piece
 Dancing river (water) - Double move: provides an extra move
 Iron blossom (metal) - Immortality: makes one piece immortalized in one round; the piece can be jumped over, but not conquered; it does not become part of the opposite dragon's body.
 Nature spirit (Wood) - Regeneration: revives a burned piece
 Using special move requires energy. This energy can either be collected on the field or purchased before the game starts. Unless there has been purchased energy before the game starts, then players start with 0 energy. Acquisition of the energy will be happen gradually, per turn. Each special move can only be used once during a match.
6. Boosters
Energy items: The player will have the option to buy energy containers which will replenish their Energy sphere. They will come in different sizes and will be available from the Item Mall
 Double experience scroll: A scroll that doubles the player’s gain of experience for a period of 24 hours. It is a consumable item and it will be available for purchase in the Item mall
 Currency: The items inside the game will be purchased with coins or gold.  
Gold: Can be purchased online through by major credit cards and mobile pay  
Coins: They will be obtained by in-game achievements and points As a general rule, Gold can buy and amount of Coins, but it cannot be bought with Coins.  
Player inventory: All the items you purchase or obtain will be available for claim and storage in your personal inventory  
The cart: is the Item mall icon. By accessing this icon, you will be directed to the item mall
 7. Achievements system
The game has an achievement system based on points, which every player can obtain through several types of contribution: gameplay, shares, invites, challenges and, of course, by being a backer here on Kickstarter. Platforms Android, iOS, PC, tablet What’s in it for you?
A bunch of exciting rewards that will give you a good start into the game and shoot you up at the top of the Achievements board.
Limited edition items
Collector’s items: DVDs, posters, the original game board, OST and unique titles
Stretch goals
 Upon reaching our stretch goal we are going to release even more amazing features that complete the story. Story unlock of each of the characters: By raising in level and achievements, you will be able to unlock unique moments in the life of the character you play. The game will become more exciting as you are guided to the next chapter. Each chapter will come with a unique title for your character, which cannot be obtained in any other way.  
About the creators 
 "Creative Outlaws is a small but hard working Danish digital game development company, founded by redWEB (http://www.redweb.dk) and Thomas K. Simonsen, an enthusiastic board game developer in April 2014. On October 10th 2014, we published an Alpha version of The Dragon Code classic, a free-to-play online strategy game. We have been working ever since to improve the game and add new features.
The Dragon Code team

Hello everybody! My name is Ian, aka Cometkins Art, and I'm an independent illustrator based out of Colorado. I was blown away by the amazing response to the first print run of these decks of cards, and I knew I had to come back to Kickstarter to get your support again!
I've grown to love Dungeons and Dragons since I started playing my home campaign over four years ago, and the Deck of Many Things has become the most tantalizing item, thus the idea sparked to make my own. I endeavored to create a version that appealed to my aesthetic needs, and hopefully to others! It was two years in the making, and it's finally here.
100% of my Artist Alley merchandise before the first print Kickstarter was self-funded. However, when it came time to do the math for these decks of cards, it became clear that I wouldn't ever be able to print and sell these at a reasonable price without help from crowdfunding. Once again that is the case here, and I have returned to ask for your assistance in bringing in a new stock of these amazing cards.
I first began creating the deck by making the Moon card, and it set the tone for how the rest of the Deck would end up. The final card I did was Throne; I saved it for last because I knew I'd need to learn more about how I wanted to paint these before I could get it to look how I imagined, and I'm very satisfied. I challenged myself a lot with the art in the deck, made many revisions and tweaks, and it finally came together.
Each card has been illustrated to demonstrate both the name of the card as well as hint at the effect it has as best as possible. You'll notice the Moon card has three stars for up to three wishes, or that the Jester card represents the wealth of EXP you gain through gold coins. Each of the 22 cards is vibrant and colorful and is sure to impress your players when they pull from the deck! This time around, you'll also notice some small improvements to the graphic design, such as better text wrapping on the banners with the card titles.
The base funding covers the print of all 22 cards, the custom art tuck box (slightly improved from its previous design), as well as the brand new card back with silver holographic constellations! This is something I had wanted for the original Deck, but was previously unable to find a printer able to do so. Now you get the Deck in all its intended glory! The gold edging will be gone in favor of something a little more noticeably flashy and mysterious.
Also included from the start in the base funding will be the guide booklet! It was a free upgrade in a stretch goal in our previous campaign, but it's just too valuable to not include right away this time! Never pull out your clunky DMG again!
There are options to order two and three decks as bundles if you and your friends would like to save on shipping for international orders, and there are 24-deck bundles for friendly local game stores that would like to carry the Deck on their shelves!
Top Row: Talons, Throne, Knight, Idiot, Flames. Bottom Row: Moon, The Fates, Fool, Euryale.
Top Row: Star, Donjon, Gem, Key, Skull, Fool. Bottom Row: Ruin, Rogue, Comet, The Void, Balance, Sun, Vizier.
Front side of guide booklet.
Back half of guide booklet.
Featuring the constellations of Pegasus, Draco, Scorpius, and Cygnus in silver holographic foil.
Improved card box design as well!
As all of the artwork for the deck and add-ons is complete at this time, it should mean that this will be a fairly quick campaign! Crowdfunding will go on for 30 days, and then once funds reach me I'll be able to order everything in swift fashion. I estimate roughly a month of time to order and print all the rewards, and then a month or so to organize and ship everything out to you all; this should hopefully account for minor delays because of weather, surprise holidays, quarantine related postal delays, as well as any necessary social isolation that's required at this time. I would like to have all decks and rewards out to everybody by October, November at the latest, but everybody will be notified ASAP should that change.
I have set the base goal at $3500. This will account for the decks and their included booklets, as well as shipping costs and add-on rewards for backers.
Below is a chart showing the rough breakdown of all the costs; the majority of the money is for the decks and add-on rewards, with the second biggest portion being for shipping costs (the curse of us all), and then finally Kickstarter and bank fees.
While the main product I'm offering is of course the Deck of Many Things, it never hurts to have some fun extras! There's not many so that shipping times don't get bogged down too much with waiting for products to arrive, but requests for more will be taken into account!
Set of 3 Holographic Buttons (+$5)
Flames, Skull, The Fates. Digital mockup.
Want a cool extra that won't break the bank? Then these buttons are for you! A set of 3 1.5 inch buttons with a cool holographic star finish! The artwork you see here is what will be present on the final buttons, based on their popularity in the previous campaign.
Drawstring Bag (+$10)
5.5in x 6.5in/13.5cm x 16.5cm. Deck fits perfectly inside. Holds up to 15 standard 7pc polyhedral dice sets.
One of the most popular rewards from last campaign is our matching drawstring bag, and it's back again! It's said in the DM's Guide that the Deck of Many Things is found in a drawstring bag, and it felt appropriate to include for those that want it. Store your cards inside for added mystery, or use as a traditional dice bag for all your dice goblin needs.
While our base funding definitely covers for a lot, there's always room for some other fun upgrades and add-ons! All of our stretch goals are laid out here, and include free backer rewards and deck upgrades. 
Unlocked!
This was one of the MOST requested stretch goals of the previous campaign, but I felt that the previous company I worked with just couldn't give me the results I wanted and that my backers deserved. The new company I'm working with is able to give the amazing, shiny foiling that I desire, and of course it has to be the first upgrade! At $4000 raised, ALL backer decks will be upgraded to have gold foiling on their deckbox! It will be that extra bit of shine that helps it stand out.
Digital mockup featuring new box artwork and foil simulation.
Unlocked!
In our previous campaign, backers got rewarded with free stickers for their awesome efforts, and that will remain true in this campaign! At $5000 raised, all backers will receive three holographic stickers! These designs will be voted on by all of you at the end of the campaign, so start thinking of your favorite artwork now!
Designs not final; to be voted on by backers.
 Unlocked! 
Left to right: Skull, The Fates, Moon.
At $5500 raised, an acrylic keychain add-on reward will be unlocked for all backers! They will come in three designs featuring some of the most popular artwork from the previous campaign, and you'll have a choice to back from just the one, or for a set of all three! They will cost $10 for a single keychain, and $25 for the set of three. They'll feature a sturdy gold-colored keyring and flashy gold edging, harkening back to the long lost gold edges of the last print run!
Unlocked!
At $6500 raised, all backers will receive a set of three free bookmarks! In the previous campaign, bookmarks were a surprise bonus for everybody, but this time you'll be getting a set of three, with artwork voted on by you! Perfect for keeping track of your most used spots in your books.
Bookmark bonus from previous campaign; final designs to be voted on by backers.
Unlocked!
We've heard you, so now it's an option! At $10000 raised, all backer decks will have their cardstock upgraded to premium black core! Pretty much all TCGs on the market use 280 GSM blue core cardstock and what the deck uses by default, which is a very fine, long lasting print stock that stands up to shuffling and use over time, but we can go further! Casino grade playing cards will often use 330 GSM black core cardstock, which allows them to take to more shuffling for longer, and makes them much more durable in general. It's a very expensive, high quality material, and if we can reach this goal, it will mean that much more longevity for your cards, even if you never sleeve them up! It's a rather lofty goal, but will add that extra premium feel, so let's go!
 Unlocked!
Something that backers absolutely loved about the last campaign was the gold gilt edges on their cards for that extra bit of shine and mystery. Well, turns out my new printer is able to do that very thing after all! At $15000 raised, all backer decks will be upgraded to have gold gilt edges! This was something I was originally sad to lose, but now nobody has to fret, they'll be back!

The Untold Stories of Valhalla is going to be a historical depiction of some of the most heroic acts in combat carried out by Reconnaissance Marines, Marine Raiders, and Marine Snipers over the last 15 years in the global war on terrorism. Each chapter will be a story of heroism and loss, details from those who were there at the time and who live today in memory of those who made the ultimate sacrifice. 100% of the proceeds of this book will go back to the families of those lost and the organizations and causes they support.
This book will be something to share with future generations of Americans to better understand the sacrifices their fellow Americans have made for the country. 
Please help us by pre ordering an electronic or hardback copy of "The Untold Stories of Valhalla".

25 years of experience working with erotic models.
Amazing stories from the life of an Art Nude photo artist.
Lovely Girls - Nude Models
- Who are they on set and behind the scenes?

Hello!) I am Kate.
Me and group of my friends want to create a documentary about the work of the mystic photographer Alexandr Furdui.
It won't be just a documentary.
It will be a mystical interview with the Author and Characters of his Adult Fantasy Book!

We decided to create this film for the double anniversary:
- 55 years of life and 25 years of photographer and decorator Alexandr Furdui.
Alexandr writes and illustrates a Fantasy Book.
This is a mystical Dystopia about the terrible future of Mankind.
Terrible, but very beautiful!
After all, the main heroines of the book are beautiful warlike girls - the Amazons.

The presentation of the mystical book was the only and first time Alexandr spoke in front of a video camera.
Just for a few minutes ...
In this film, we will do a long interview for the first time.
The author will tell in details about his Fantasy Dystopia.
And YES - you will be able to ask your questions too!
Alexandr Furdui - Photo artist and decorator, working in the Art Nude Fantasy style.
A documentary movie about the photographer and his mystical work.
+ PDF album of the best works with mystical predictions.
We are preparing this film in the mystical documentary interview style with a photographer and his beautiful models.
A documentary film about the photographer and his mystical work.

It is gonna be a film with a mystical documentary interview of Alexandr and his beautiful models.
Some of you are already saw these amazing calendars.
Below you see lovely model who posed for this calendar.
The calendar girl tries a new image of the blonde.
It's not usual for her, but she really likes it!
This will be a unique interview!

The author will talk about his work for the first time!
You will be the first to hear the story of the photographer.
And you can ask your questions to Alexandr!
Yes, you can get into this movie too!
Interesting? We just started:)
___________________________________________
Alexandr works a lot and doesn't tell anything about himself.
Some interesting facts about Alexandr Furdui

 Just see what he knows and can do:
- Love for the visual arts was born in early childhood - Alexandr grew up in the art workshop of his father.
- The author makes costumes, accessories and decorations for photo shoots himself. Also he illustrates his book on his own.
- Alexandr writes a Mystical Adult Tale in verse and prose.
- Higher medical education allows Alexandr combine scientific knowledge and mysticism.
Yes, the path of Alexandr’s life is full of mysticism. He is given visions of his personal fate and the fate of humanity. With terrifying accuracy - personal visions and prophetic dreams comes true!
At 55 years old, Alexandr can already look back and know exactly what prophecies have already become a reality!
In this film we will combine the real biography of a photo artist and fiction from his photographs.
Yes! We will ORGANIZE A MEETING OF THE AUTHOR WITH HIS FANTASY WORLD CHARACTERS!
First, Alexandr will tell you the story of his life full of mystical events.
He will talk about his difficult creative path. After all, he was faced with a choice - to give up a successful career in the medical business for the sake of his beloved creativity ...

Instead of a career, Alexandr took the difficult path of a creative person.
And his path is really very thorny.
Let's just say that due to several crises there were lots of job losses.
The magazine Penthouse (Kyiv - Ukraine) – where photographer is used to work, was closed.
The first large studio in which Alexander worked was closed also.
Then, because of the war in Ukraine, the second large studio was destroyed ...
But the author didn’t give up!
Each time Alexandr started anew - he created new decorations and continued to work! To follow his dream!
Look at the freshest decorations for 2020 - here we will shoot an interview with the photographer.
As was said before, the first part of the interview will be the biography of the Author of Photo Pictures.
______
Then we will plunge into the Fantasy  World ... We assure you - it will be very interesting!
This film will be full of documentary mystical interview with a photo artist and his beautiful models.
So get ready - the film will be full of unique philosophical discourses of Life and Death.
Without complexes and taboos, we will talk about the most exciting issues - how this world works and why do we live here!?
This film, despite the complex subject matter, will not be boring!
After all, beautiful warrior girls will interfere the dialogues!
You will meet real Amazons!
You know, people talks that Creative People, Artists and Poets, predict the future ...
Let's see what Fantastic version of the Future is predicted by the Alexandr Furdui work...
Alexandr creates a new philosophy based on the synthesis of modern scientific knowledge and ancient magic.
To not this worldview be boring - the characters of Fantasy Tale itself will tell you about it.
Yes, Alexandr creates his own Fantasy Universe.
In this Universe is no place for Lies, Hypocrisy and stupid Complexes generated by pseudo-morality.
The main values in the new world are Beauty and Sincerity, Honesty and readiness for self-sacrifice.
The beauty of nature and the naked female body adorn the New World. Don’t you want to admire this beauty forever!?
The combination of Beauty and Honesty makes this World harmonious.
Honesty to others and to your inner "I" - will not give a chance to Lies and Hypocrisy take over the new world.
_____________________________________________________________________________
You will get a real feeling of being on set with these exclusive mystical events that we prepared for You!
 
We offer a unique trip! The creative journey to Fantasy Universe full of gorgeously charming models! 
We are so grateful for every small donation towards the creation of this film!

Mori is the vision of local Adelaide illustrator and visual artist Jess Lewis. 
This is brand is her love child, born from her deep passion for her specialised illustration practice and creative drive. 
This Kickstarter campaign has been organized to get the Mori brand's first shirt design off the ground, if it is successful it will allow more designs to be produced for Etsy and market stores.

Stretch Goal 1 - $1000, 20 x Rad Skull Shirts
Rad Skull
 20 pledges will allow for the minimum orders of the Rad Skull Shirt to be produced and the profits will allow for an extra design to be released. The more pledges over 20, the brighter the future of Mori as a sole trading business will look. The profits from Rad Skull orders will go towards more designs to be released and sold, and any marketing that needs to be produced and printed.

Stretch Goal 2 - $2,150, 43 x Rad Skull Shirts 
Hopeless Case
43 Rad Skull Shirts sold will allow me to add another design to this Kickstarter. The shirt design is called Hopeless Case and features another illustration from this series. This option will be added once the required amount of Rad Skull shirts have been sold. 

Stretch Goal 3 - Duzza For Your Bruzza design 
Details will be added once the above stretch goal is met. 
Mori aims to support illustrators and visual artists that fall under the same aesthetic and philosophies. This brand has the opportunity to grow into something supportive.

All products that are of produced by Mori are of high quality and made using local businesses.  
Shirts screen printed by hand at RTD - http://www.rtdscreenprinting.com/
Stickers produced by artist DHKart - www.facebook.com/DHKart

I also want to thank the cool cats who were more than generous with their time, helping me to create the video above. Their details are below for any work you should require from them.

Flim and editing by Chelsea Pearl - chelzea_pearl@yahoo.com.au
Sound production by Anders Bogdanowicz - anders.bogdan@gmail.com

This project is about a dream. One that began over fifteen years ago, and it is still ongoing. Life has taken us on many tangents in those fifteen years, and in all honesty, getting this project off the ground was a long shot all along. No self respecting funding source would consider financing this. But with the advent of social investing we see a great opportunity to find out if what we have envisioned can if fact be made real. Up until now we have invested almost $1.5 million in the initial, exploratory phase of this project. Our initial desk-top plasma device produced some very early but encouraging results. We are now looking to expand this work to its next phase. 
Our goal, in short, is to re-imagine the way we access space with this: 
Prototype inside and out
We are seeking to create new technology, one that is sure to be the subject of much controversy. A new direction that is not based on our currently accepted and widely used space delivery systems we call rocketry.
 
We are seeking to take a quantum leap forward, a giant leap for mankind if you will, by daring to think way outside the proverbial box. Our goal in nothing less than to develop a space access system based on the control of a universally available reactant - gravity. 
Upper faceplate covering science bay
Gravity control would mean access to space on an unprecedented scale at a tiny fraction of today's cost. With gravity control the stuff of science fiction would become reality. If this technology is possible, development will take time. Upon success a whole new paradigm would open in our space faring endeavor. We would truly open a new frontier, one that holds many secrets, rewards and adventure. 
With the control of gravity we could access space on a scale comparable to air travel today. Flights could depart hourly, bringing about whole new industries like space mining, space tourism, and planetary exploration.

"This can't be done" is what we usually hear. We are of the mind set that anything is possible when people put their mind to it. Twenty years ago who would have imagined that Apple would revolutionize the world with the iPhone and iPad, Or that we would have TV screens so thin they can be bent. Or that private enterprise would have more rockets available to access space than NASA itself does. 
Can gravity be controlled for flight? 
No one knows. But we sure want to find out. The potential benefits are immense. Some people ask "Why?" others ask "Why not?". We belong in the latter group. So we are asking "Why not?" Why not work on this, there is nothing to lose, and much to gain. 
In the initial phase of the project we are looking to demonstrate, under laboratory constitutions, that gravity can be interacted with (other than an apple falling on our heads), controlled, artificially created. Once we have successfully establish this, the next step will be to build a technology demonstrator prototype, as illustrated here. Please keep in mind that all images displayed are for illustration purposes only and are only engineering drawings. The shape of the craft is a direct result of technological needs, namely spin-symmetric structures. Any resemblance to real or imagined phenomena is just a coincidence. 
This is a cross section of our proposed craft. 

In the center of it is the propulsion system, a toroid shaped plasma chamber, the envisioned engine of change. A plasma based device capable of generating a field that can interact with gravity. We won't post lengthy and elaborate theoretical text on how this system may function. If we can build a working prototype the science of it will be debated in endless papers and meetings, both in support and in contradiction. For this Kickstarter project we are interested in conveying the dream, not the science. The dream of "What if?" this can in  fact be built.

The possibility that our vision can be engineered and in the not to distant future people can be visiting space on a daily basis. Lots of people. For a lot of time.

Our proposed flight demonstrator craft is composed of three sections:

- the upper payload bay
- the main body 
 - and the lower payload bay. 
The upper payload bay will house mission specific scientific instruments. There are 4 functional sections, each capable of holding one specific instrument cluster. These can range from equipment to collect data on initial flights, to better understand flight dynamics, to telescopes and interstellar matter collection bays for later missions. It is really up to our imagination to come up with an infinite combination of devices to carry. 
These are a few illustrations of such devices.
Telescope and Spectrometer
Payload bay with energy storage ring
Three scientific palettes from upper payload bay

The main body houses the propulsion system, power generation and storage system. flight control hardware, communications system, and the landing legs, among other support systems. 
Upper faceplate
All electrical components, including main propulsion, are powered by the plasma based power generation unit.
Power generation
The lower payload bay is designed to house an autonomous rover for unmanned exploration. But this lower bay can also be configured for scientific cargo, same as the upper payload bay. 
Power storage units
We can also envision it carrying cargo to be deliver to the space station or anywhere on Earth, when timely delivery is of the essence. Again, the potential uses of this craft are unlimited. In fact we would welcome suggestions posted in the comments section. 
Landing leg
This project is a "What if" scenario study therefore the social engineering available to us should be explored. We have also have completed some preliminary illustrations of our planned autonomous folding rover: 
Rover
We can't stress it enough, that this project is, at best, speculative. We do believe the only way it can cross the first hurdle, disbelief, is if it is implemented. Implementation costs money. The sheer benefit of the technology begs for investigation, but in reality, it is near impossible to get it funded. Unless we as people at large, decide to dream a little and crowd fund it. We believe this technology can be successfully engineered. Our participation rewards give people who support us a limited number of tangible items they can enjoy, especially if development is successful. We would ask everyone who contributes to allow their names to be posted on our website (to be launched after funding is successful.) The names of those who help make this happen should be known. 
Support hardware
Upon successful funding we propose to commence activities in two steps: 
- build a laboratory scale test version of the propulsion system to demonstrate gravity interaction, control
- build the prototype illustrated throughout to conduct actual test flights 
The first phase we would like to complete by the end of 2016. The second phase by the end of 2017. 
There are still many questions to be resolved, like how to control the flight's trajectory without any aerodynamic surfaces or jets, how to power the craft while in flight, and how to navigate from point A to point B. But before we can answer these questions, first we need to learn if the most important element of the system. the propulsion matrix capable of interacting with gravity, can in fact be built. 
This is the focus of this Kickstarter fund raising. 
Main body equipment racks
So why don't you all come along as we imagine a future where space access will be as common place as in the best science fiction novels of today. 
Observation telescope

I'm so proud to introduce my third full length Sherlock Holmes novel: The Adventure of the Beer Barons. Here's what's in store...
The Adventure of the Beer Barons
When a beer barrel containing the body of a man is delivered to the door of 221b Baker Street, an intoxicating new adventure begins for Sherlock Holmes. Together with his faithful companion, Dr John Watson, Holmes travels north to Burton-upon-Trent to investigate the poisoning of a regiment in India from a contaminated batch of pale ale.
The incident threatens the reputation of the mighty brewer, Houghton's, which supplies beer to half the world. But Holmes is not the only detective working the case. Miss Gertie Cresswell, owner of a first-class mind and a yellow umbrella, has a few ideas of her own. With militant suffragettes, folding bicycles, and the footprints of what appears to be a three-legged man, the unlikely trio face their most fiendish mystery yet. The game is on!
Sherlock Holmes and The Beer Barons is the latest Sherlock Holmes novel from Chris James. Chris's first novel, Sherlock Holmes and The Ruby Elephants was a huge hit with fans and went on to be translated and released in Italian. His second novel Sherlock Holmes and The Jeweller of Florence was an even bigger hit. Alongside his novels, Chris has contributed stories and poems to a host of anthologies - including the MX Book of New Sherlock Holmes Stories.
Rewards
We have paperbacks, PDFs, signed paperbacks and an exclusive, unseen Sherlock Holmes novella I've written, called The Adventure of the Mechanical Elephant. There are also some Early Bird rewards with limited numbers so you'll need to be quick to grab those.
We've also added a stretch target - when we are past 70 backers, my publisher will plant ten extra trees at Happy Life Children's Home in Kenya as part of their #bookstotrees campaign - here's a short video from the founders of Happy Life on the Books To Trees Project.
The Adventure of the Ruby Elephants

Ghost/Grove is one of my first forays into the professional art world- and the first requiring me to travel.
After taking the plunge and going back to school to work toward my MFA, I created a proposal for True/False as a professional practice exercise.  It was a huge surprise to be accepted!  Then the reality of creating and transporting the project and myself half way across the country to participate set in.  As a student, I do not have much cash.
I don't need much! My project itself is made of many recycled, re-purposed, and found objects.  Major expenses include the telecine film-to-video transfer, airfare, and lodging.
I will be traveling to Missouri from Portland twice: first in January 2016 to begin the project, collect needed supplies, meet my volunteer team, and other preliminary steps.  Then I will return a few days before the festival begins for the final set-up, installation, and of course the festival itself.

I want to shoot and put together some of the very best pictures from the Mississippi gulf coast as a comemorative look at the south 12 years after katrina. I want to show the beauty of the gulf coast and how far it has come in the last decade. The people and places of south Mississippi are stronger than ever and I want to highlight that.

Read what Maxim Magazine says about The Cubed Travel Jacket™
   Clothing Arts Featured in:
The Cubed Travel Jacket™ is a 4-season jacket combining distinctive style, innovative pocketing and an eVent® DVStorm™ membrane, the most technically advanced waterproof/breathable fabric in existence.
The Cubed Travel Jacket™ is the one jacket you will never want to leave home without. It's the culmination of years of development and offers more pockets and features than any other waterproof shell available on the market today.
  Reinventing the Waterproof Shell: It Begins with Pockets
A great waterproof shell is your best friend on the road, whether you’re in the city or the mountains. If you've traveled in one, you know what we're talking about.
However, waterproof shells were born in the outdoor industry, which means they’ve been traditionally designed for extreme weather protection during specific outdoor activities like mountaineering. So shells are made with the pockets placed to stay out of the way of a harness and shoulders wide enough for swinging ice axes. This is great if you’re dangling hundreds of feet above a glacier, but impractical for daily life.
So we chose the most practical and beautiful pockets in the jacket world: Twin Napoleons. But with a twist...
Our twin Napoleon INT/EXT PKTS™ (Interior/Exterior accessible pockets) allow you to access essential items without undoing the main zipper. Something we wished we had when attempting to retrieve a wallet or phone from our jackets during rainstorms…
Twin Napoleon INT/EXT PKTS™
We designed the pocketing on the Cubed Travel Jacket™ to accommodate everyday life, while retaining the advancements of technical waterproof materials. With 8 pockets total, you’ll have all the carryability you need to go anywhere.
The laterally zipping lower-right pocket accommodates the removable hood.
Cutting-Edge Waterproof/Breathable Jacket Tech… For Everyday Life
We independently tested every leading Waterproof/Breathable membrane on the market today and concluded the eVent® DVStorm™ membrane lead with perfect waterproofness and awe-inspiring breathability. 
Waterproof/Breathable technology has come a long way since your 90s windbreaker. Our fabric withstood a 20000 mm/24HR water-column test (water accelerated to twice the velocity of a hurricane), while being air permeable (so you don't sweat buckets while climbing a flight of steps), with an incredible 20000 G/M2/24HR breathability rating.
Far less toxic than most DWRs (Durable Water Repellants), and used by environmentally minded companies like Patagonia, the short-chain C6 DWR is our repellant of choice, protecting you and the environment.
Water does not get in, sweat-vapor gets out: advanced science keeping you dry and comfortable.
The jacket is fully taped-seamed, which means every exterior stitch is backed by a line of waterproof tape to form a total seal.
Tape seaming is a highly technical process only a few garment manufacturers in the world, and their highly skilled craftspeople, are capable of producing.
We have years of experience designing articulated patterns to facilitate complete freedom of movement, without the bulk you'll find in other technical shells. Go ahead and stretch, it feels great.
Minimalist Design
Styled as an urban travel jacket, you can go anywhere with it and feel right at home. We chose a highly durable face fabric with a natural feel, which isn’t shiny or noisy like the plastic-feeling face fabrics found on most waterproof shells.
You won’t find a single stitch down the front of the jacket (besides those securing the Napoleon Pockets), a feat achieved by an innovative manufacturing technique where the internal pockets are sewn directly into the taped seams.
We designed the collar so it’s not too high or low, but just right, with ample room to accommodate a scarf.
The perfect height for a jacket's collar.
We've worn a lot of jackets over the years. Some we've loved, others not so much. The Cubed Travel Jacket™ is the culmination of our experiences pushing the boundaries of what a waterproof shell can do for your everyday life. 
Subtle accents and a discreet logo make the jacket appropriate and distinguished whether you're enjoying a bourbon or Spring skiing.
  We relate, because we've wanted The Cubed Travel Jacket™ for years! Choose a reward from above, and as soon as the campaign ends we'll send out a survey asking for your choice in size and color and take it from there. For your support, we're offering the jacket on Kickstarter discounted over 25% off retail.
The Cubed Travel Jacket™ comes in three colors.
Black...
 Slate...
 And Mountain Blue...
Thanks for spending a moment with our jacket. It will change the way you think about going outside. Please share this page with your friends and anyone who appreciates the finer things in life. 
For the Love of Details
Send us into the world!
Guarantee & Exchanges
We guarantee the lifetime of The Cubed Travel Jacket™ from all defects in construction and materials. 
If your jacket does not fit, send it in, and after we've finished fulfilling the rest of the rewards we'll exchange it for you.  
The future of jackets is here.

The creation of these 100 paintings on the same theme is a real artistic journey, the concept of this project aims in the best case to open a door in the world of art.
Each painting is sold the sum of 1000 francs. In a utopian hope to be able to admire my artist's rating as well as the value that takes each of the paintings at the same time. This system thus makes it possible to answer both the interests of the purchasers and mine, by creating a stimulating and favorable artistic and economic context. The approach is also, in a way, an experience reflecting the current system of artistic speculation. And everyone could benefit directly.
Finally, why kisckstarter? I use this crowdfunding platform, allowing me to bypass the traditional hermetic spaces

texte français

La création de ces 100 tableaux sur le même thème est un véritable périple artistique, le concept de ce projet a pour but dans le meilleur des cas de m'ouvrir une porte dans le monde de l'art. 
Chaque tableau est vendu la somme de 1000 francs.  Dans un espoir utopique de pouvoir admirer ma cote d'artiste ainsi que la valeur que prend en même temps chacune des toiles. Ce système permet donc de répondre tant aux intérêts des acquéreurs que du mien, en créant un contexte artistique et économique stimulant et favorable. La démarche est également, en quelque sorte, une expérience reflétant le système actuel de la spéculation artistique. Et tous pourraient en bénéficier directement.

Enfin, pourquoi kisckstarter ? J'utilise cette plateforme de crowdfunding, me permettant de contourner les espaces traditionnels hermétiques.
